Reviews.Title: “Nice facility, expensive Internet”
Reviews.Author: SAdragons
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a conference. The meeting rooms and the convenience of the arena are great. Rooms are a nice size and it was relatively quiet (for a casino). The cost for wi-fi is outrageous ($12.99 per 24 hrs), and there is even a fee to use the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed due to conference hotel; would return by choice.”
Reviews.Author: HyannisSteve
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel is distant from the heart of the strip... But that also contributes to it's benefits. You can take a shuttle ($8/day) to/from Treasure Island, Aria and Excalibur locations; it takes a while, but saves you on the $30 cab ride. I found the dealers to be friendly, the table minimum to be reasonable without resorting to altered rules, and the fellow gamers to be friendly. The rooms are clean, and well-enough appointed... After all, the hotel is only six years old. Considering the price paid for services rendered, this is a welcome value, south of the Strip. And to think... The liquor store in the gift shop had our favorite table wine for 25% less than NH State liquor stores! And, even the Steak & Shake alternative inside had good food at good prices. The only complaint... The table game stools were uncomfortable. No problem, it just encouraged me to get up and leave the Casino sooner! If you don't need to be in the heart of the action, then consider South Point. Part of it's "charm" is that it's not in the center of the chaos.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the strip but worth it, quality of a 4-stars but at a much cheaper price...”
Reviews.Author: Kyragirl
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind taking a shuttle to go to the strip, this is the place for you...Don't forget to take The Club Card and ask for your free booklet of coupons...If you could have a flight between 6:00 and 21:45 either departure/arrival, the hotel shuttle will pick you up for free during that time. We had to pay $35 cab ride because we came in around midnight and it is off-the-strip. The hotel offers a lot to do, the food is good, breakfast is really cheap between midnight and 6:00 but very good. We will be going back next time we are in Las Vegas...

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed expectations”
Reviews.Author: RandiRA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent an afternoon and night at the South Point Hotel, prior to an early flight from the Las Vegas airport the following morning. We chose it for proximity to LAS and price. It was intended to be just a place to sleep, with easy access to the airport the following morning, but ended up being a pleasant mini-getaway with unexpected amenities. Upon arrival all of the staff, beginning with valet parking to bell desk and registration were very friendly and efficient. We were surprised at the large size of both the bedroom/sitting area and bathroom. It was nicely appointed and very clean. This was a standard room at their lowest rate of $50. We had a late lunch in their Mexican restaurant, Baja Miguel's. The price was $10 ea. that included a large plate entree (mine was chicken taco, relleno, rice & beans) chips, salsa, bean dip, guacamole and a margarita. It was all very good and the service was excellent. We wandered into the equestrian center where a show horse exhibition was taking place. That was fun to watch as was browsing the booths of beautiful western gear for both horses and humans. We also enjoyed the plaques and memorabilia of rodeo champions and the "bigger than life" bronze statue of Benny Binion on horseback. We then went to a movie in their multi-theater complex and watched the bowlers in the bowling complex. Later in the evening we had a light dinner in the Coronado Cafe. The menu offered a variety of choices, both North American and Asian. The service was lovely and the prices were very reasonable. The bed and bedding was comfortable, the flat screen TV good, the wake-up service prompt and check-out simple. When we returned from our New Orleans visit, 9 days later, a South Point "Thank-you for staying with us" email was waiting with an offering for a future stay of $50 for the first night and 2nd. night free. We live 3 hours north of Las Vegas so will definitely take advantage of it. The property offers a wide variety of activities and events with something for everyone, including families. It was all a good experience for a small price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel away from Strip”
Reviews.Author: N2tiques4me
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on March 18, 2012 and were completely surprised by this jewel of a property! We met my brother and his wife there to finish planning a trip to Ireland. The rooms very very spacious, the price was right and the staff very accommodating. We dined at their Italian restaurant which was superb and had lunch at their seafood restaurant. There were plenty of gaming options as well. We will definitely go back for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, just off the main Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: HJBW
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at The South Point for 10 days, this hotel is a couple of miles from the main Vegas Strip but this isn't an inconvenience as there is a shuttle bus directly from the hotel every hour, the shuttle stops at three main hotels on the strip; Excalibur, Aria and Treasure Island. Tickets for the shuttle cost$8.00 and Re valid for the whole day so you can travel as many times as you like, the last bus back from the strip is at 1.00 am. The rooms at the hotel Re spacious and have. Very comfortable bed and large bathroom with shower, bath and hair dryer. The buffet meals are very reasonable and there is a huge choice of food on offer every day, all of it delicious from the Chinese, Italian and BBQ. We went to ann in house show on the Saturday night thawing was very entertaining, there is also a bowling alley and cinema at the hotel. All of the staff were very helpful and there is free wi if access in the lobby. Overall a great hotel and a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “New to South Point Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TulipL0ver
Reviews.Content: Although I have driven past the South Point Hotel many times on my way to the Strip, I have never had a reason to stay. From the freeway, the hotel looks very lovely lit up at night, and it has always signaled that we are approaching Las Vegas. However, in January my daughter was scheduled to participate in an athletic event held at the hotel, so I booked a one-night stay for a very reasonable (by Las Vegas standards) rate. The hotel is conveniently located off the 15 with plenty of free parking either out in front or in the parking garage. Check-in went quickly, but as mentioned by previous reviewers, it was a bit of a hike to schlep all of the suitcases, extra coats, gym bag and competition clothes through the casino to the hotel elevators. The room was large, clean, and pleasantly decorated. I liked the fact that the toilet/bath was separated by a door from the sinks/vanity area. Unfortunately, there was no mini-fridge or microwave which is always a plus for those travelers who are spending more time in Vegas. The various restaurants looked appealing, but my daughter wanted to eat at the Garden Buffet. I took a few minutes to join the player's club (me, the non-gambler!), which allowed us to eat for half price at the buffet. There were many choices, and we had fun sampling the different world cuisines. Because my daughter needed to get a good night's sleep, we didn't try to drive up to the Strip. For those athletes who had already competed and didn't need to get to bed early, there was a bowling alley and a movie theater located within the hotel itself. Because there is no automatic resort fee, the next morning I had to go to the front desk to sign up to use the fitness room. While it's great that you are not charged for amenities you don't use, the fitness room fee combined with the wi-fi fee is about equivalent to the resort fee charged at other hotels. The fitness room itself was large and empty with towels and water available. For breakfast I went to Seattle's Best in the lobby for Chai lattes and bagels to take back to the room. Many of the other athlete's parents must have had the same idea since the line was very, very long. All in all I was pleasantly surprised by my stay at the South Point hotel. There were only a few negatives. In my particular room, the blackout blinds did not completely cover the edges of the window so the outside light seeped inside making it difficult for me to sleep. If I had remembered to pack my eye mask this wouldn't have been a problem. Also I found the pillow to be extremely stiff. I'm sure if I had called down to housekeeping they would have sent up another pillow, but I just didn't want to be bothered. Finally, as someone else has mentioned, the smoke in the casino is pervasive. But this is Las Vegas and to be expected unless you go to a non-smoking hotel. Usually I just try to avoid second-hand smoke, but unfortunately at one point we were trapped in the slow-moving line to get into the buffet while a man smoked nearby. Still, I would return to the South Point Hotel, especially if my daughter competes there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: loelou
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay a short distance from the strip, my husband and I were travelling around the USA and found this hotel had everything

Reviews.Title: “Relatively Excellent”
Reviews.Author: brentp999
Reviews.Content: If you don't need or want to stay on the strip South Point Hotel is an excellent choice. The registration process was pretty quick, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The casino is spacious, and there are a wide variety of restaurants. The buffet is priced below average, but the food is somewhat above average. But the best thing about South Point are the very large well appointed rooms. The rooms are as nice as anything on the strip and much nicer than other off strip hotels. For the price South Point Hotel is an incredible value.

Reviews.Title: “a good value break”
Reviews.Author: ccaves
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a couple of weeks at this hotel, and I must say that the hotel and the staff rate as good as any of the famous hotels on the Strip. The atmosphere is very american, with lots of families enjoying the various activities they have. A multi screen movie house: a gigantic bowling facility; a horse show facility, several restaraunts, from a steak and shake, to a couple of fine dining places. A fantastic pool. The hotel lies about 5 miles south of the main part of the strip, but a bus goes into town regularly, but most importantly, the prices are very competitive. This is our third visit to this hotel, and we hope it wont be the last.

Reviews.Title: “Here again for the umteenth time”
Reviews.Author: smokeyj
Reviews.Content: Still the best deal in vegas if you have a vehicle. Rooms well appointed and huge, casino bright and open, free wifi in the lobby and best of all NO RESORT FEE! Disappointed with the room assigned - no view except of the hotel HVAC system although who is here for the view. We always enjoy seeing the hotel lit up at nite when we are coming back - my friend calls it the golden palace. Primarily prime rib closed Monday and Tuesday but did get our fix on the Sunday nite of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite Vegas hotels but still can improve”
Reviews.Author: Stymie
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th time staying at South Point casino. My wife and I enjoy the spacious gambling area. I especially like the sportsbook area with the many seats to watch my favorite sports. Our favorite restaurant is Don Vittos which the staff there treat us well. We're not a big fan of the strip anymore so South Point allows us to pretty much to stay at one casino for our whole stay. Cons - The inside of the elevators doors are always full of dust you could write your name. I told the staff about this before with no change. If you need to send out or receive a fed ex or ups letter or package you get charged $15. This is b.s. Now we just drive 2 miles to a fed ex store to pick up and send our boxes for no extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Calm......for Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: roscoetheotter
Reviews.Content: We ended a month long vacation here for 3 nights prior to flying home. We have stayed many times in Vegas and did not want to be in the thick of it,this as an excellent choice,nice rooms although no fridge or microwave! The eating choices were really good,the buffet was good,the cafe does excellent Chinese food, Steak & Shake great for burgers and shakes,there was also a deli,a steakhouse and an Italian restaurant as well.Joining the players club gives you discounts off the buffets which all adds up. The only negative was the cost of Wifi in the rooms I think it was $12.99 a day and that was only for one device,we had two as I was travelling with my husband..........I think that is way too expensive. The location was good for getting on and off the strip with the car and valet parking was very quick. All in all I would stay here again but would look elsewhere for a cheaper Internet deal first!

Reviews.Title: “A 3-Star Hotel Masquerading as a 4-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gareth G
Reviews.Content: Be ready to be nickel and dimed to death! They advertise "No Resort Fee" but charge and exorbitant rate for internet, use of fitness center. The check-in staff were curt and not customer-friendly. Our 1st room was dirty and the TV remote was so old that the numbers on the buttons were worn off. We were then moved to another room, which was satisfactory in most respects however, there was no clock radio and the wireless keyboard for in-room check-out did not function. The breakfast buffet was excellent - good value and quality service.

Reviews.Title: “South Point first timer.”
Reviews.Author: Eddy191
Reviews.Content: While I did not stay at the South Point hotel, I visited the casino for the first time in March 2012. If the rooms are as nice as the casino floor is, then I can imagine they are nice and clean, as well as spacious. For a place that advertises itself as a locals property, you would think you were on the Strip in a fancy resort. The place is beautiful, and very clean. I did not have any problems with it being too smokey. The ceilings are high, the isles wide, and the place feels very open. You can tell that the employees care about the property, because I didn't notice one thing that seemed to need attention. All machines were operable, and clean. The bars were spotless, and the service excellent. They have craft brews on tap, complimentary for video poker players! I also had the impression, that the video poker and slot machines were actually "looser" here. It may have been a lucky streak, but I have heard from other players, that this was a "loose" property, and my experience did bear that out. On my next visit to Las Vegas, I will definately be interested at making the South Point my home base! I highly recommend this casino for your gambling action. Clean, friendly, big but not enormous, easy to navigate and maybe a little more lucky than Strip properties. Don't miss out on the Graveyard Shift specials at the Cafe either! Great food at even better prices. The wait staff will also impress you with fast and courteous service. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “OMG The Smoke! 2nd Hand Smoke was Brutal!”
Reviews.Author: logger93
Reviews.Content: I know in Las Vegas people are allowed to smoke in casinos but the South Point Resort was unbearable due to customers smoke. You could not access anywhere without going through the lung cancer filled casino. From your room (which was ok for the price) you would have to pass the casino to get to the parking garage, restaurants, arena, valet, shuttle, movie theater, etc. I guess their ventilation system is incapable of handling the very best the Marlboro men and women patrons could exhale. My 15 year old son said he was "repulsed" from the hotel. We were there for a function but would not go back. If you want to save a few bucks, be isolated from the rest of Vegas, pay $13 a day for Internet, pay to use the gym, pay to use the shuttle, etc then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “We do not recommend this hotel for non-smokers.”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelers34
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four consecutive nights recently. We were both very disappointed as the lobby/casino area was extremely smoky. We thought that the employees were unfriendly and inefficient. This hotel is located far from anywhere else, but since we had a car it was not a problem for us. South Point Garden Buffet located inside the hotel was also a disappointment for us as we found the food to be just average and quite boring. We tried both dinner and lunch there. Their coffee shop, Seattle’s best, was terrible. We had the worst coffee we have ever experienced! The steak & eggs at the Coronado restaurant located inside the hotel were very good. It is a great value at $4.95. The rooms were large and clean and the bed was comfortable. The rooms were not smoky. This hotel has a very nice bowling alley upstairs which we enjoyed. We do not plan on returning here. We do not recommend this hotel for non-smokers.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Blast!”
Reviews.Author: Anthony F
Reviews.Content: Traveled here to reconnect with college friends, and had a excellent time! Great buffet, clean environment. The only drawback was the distance from the Strip, but if you're looking for somewhere to have fun and meet up with friends, South Point is the way to go!

Reviews.Title: “A place worth its value”
Reviews.Author: ycart0616
Reviews.Content: The main reason attracted us to stay at the South Point is the price. Since it is a bit far away from the other hotels on the Strip (about 7 miles to Mandalay Bay), it has a very reasonable price and there is NO resort fee. (However, you do need to pay a fee if you want to use the gym). The room is very spacious and there are many choices of restaurants on site. The casino waitresses dress something like leotards! It is quite nice at night as it is not as crowded and crazy like the other hotels on the Strip. But you do feel a bit isolated. We have a rental car but there is a shuttle from the hotel to main Strip area ($8 per day). There is a huge parking lot in front of the hotel so you may be lucky to just part the car there instead of driving to garage (well, we were not there in the summer, so parking outside is nice and close).

Reviews.Title: “great place for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: rene h
Reviews.Content: I personally can say that, my family and I love this place, they have great food, bowling alley, movie theater, and arcade. It feels more at home to me rooms are kept well. I'm overly excited to go to Vegas THIS summer for our family vacation. LOVE IT

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the $”
Reviews.Author: SamandTaylor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The South Point for the 2nd time in 3 years - as it was the least $ for a late-made reservation for a Friday/Sat night during March Madness ($120/night) NO resort fee - thank you. The rooms are showing their age, but clean and show no sign of the dreaded bed bugs (seem to be all the rage these days). The bathroom needed a good re-grouting, couch had wear-marks on the arms, etc. However, the rooms are huge (bigger than Aria which we had just checked out of), had a divided bath, have a couch as well as a table/chairs, and have coffee makers. We had to ask for extra towels (only 2 provided), and there were only 2 pillows on the bed. There are outlets near the bed for electronics. Bed was not very comfortable. This property is off strip, so if you are playing 'tourist' you will want your own transportation to get to other sites. Cabs would be pricey, and I do not know about shuttles. They have a good convention/horse-arena trade, and staying on site for your whole 'business' trip is perfectly reasonable (food prices, sundry shops, etc). We had to leave one day early, they did not complain about our early check out. Valet was fine, but no call-down service,

Reviews.Title: “Everything is great........except -”
Reviews.Author: twostick
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my recent stay at the South Point. It was my 15th visit. As usual, my room was spacious and clean. However, I had a concern and asked (twice) that the manager reach out to me about it. I'm still waiting. But I'll be back. At these prices this ain't the RITZ and I am asking a lot for a busy exec to place a phone call to me.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of pickpockets”
Reviews.Author: stevecwood
Reviews.Content: Was there for the Mtn. West basketball tournament. Two of our group were victims of pickpockets. Hard to believe they can operate in an environment brimming with security cameras, but they do. Security was helpful and told us it was "rare".

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for us”
Reviews.Author: maresa02
Reviews.Content: South Point was suggested to us by a relative who goes to Vegas often and has stayed at many places up and down the strip and downtown. This room was spacious, quiet, clean and a great value. There are things to see and do in the hotel besides gambling. For example, we took in a movie one afternoon in their multiplex. We found the coffee shop offered the best food. Go to the buffet only with a coupon for the best value. Try the Mexican place upstairs for lunch---some days they have a free Margarita with lunch (though their free Margaritas are made without much alcohol!). You can't walk to much else ---- the strip is too far away. But South Point is worth giving a try.

Reviews.Title: “South Point continues to be a nice place”
Reviews.Author: Illinoistraveler54
Reviews.Content: I made another visit to SP. I had made my reservation through my host Courtney. Then a while later I received a mailer with free play and resort credits good for meals etc. So I called back and she made sure it would be good. I arrived early and checked my bags. A room would have been ready but it was not a king n-s. Which the check-in girl new was not my preference. So I came back a couple of hours later and received a nice city view king room on the 23rd floor. I like the king room always get a nice couch and a coffee table that makes a nice foot rest. Always funny I can get to the 23rd floor as fast I get to the 4th at Silverton. The one thing I never get and not a big deal. I have had HD TV since 05. And my current TV is similar to theirs. But such a waste to not have it in HD. I guess a cost factor. As many know the diff is big. I enjoyed a nice corned beef sandwich as usual from the Del-Mar Deli. Always good. I did get a nice comp to have the prime rib special at the coffee shop. It was cooked correctly. A good deal. And I always enjoy the graveyard breakfast specials since I am always up early. Had a decent gaming experience. Even saw 2 movies a nice little break. The drink service was great usually were back before I was ready. So I cannot think of any negatives. I am reminded staying here of how nice the Rio was before Harrah's took it over. So I will be back in November.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay, still great.”
Reviews.Author: travelingenigma
Reviews.Content: Convenience to take shuttle to Strip, clean rooms, good food in most restaurants and good service, shuttle offered to and from airport during not extremely late hours. Many amenities, which one can take advantage of, you, do need a car if you want to go to a lot of places other then the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant room, good value”
Reviews.Author: 4 Joyful Travel
Reviews.Content: The room was large, well-lit, and had good temperature control. It had comfortable chairs and a large flatscreen TV. We had no view but looked out on a concrete wall. The safe was positioned over the luggage/clothing area and was a hazard to one's head. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The toilet/shower room was separate from the sink area, where there was lots of counter space. The shower was not powerful, but we had plenty of hot water. When we checked in we got two coupons for half off at the buffet. We ate dinner and breakfast at the buffet, which is pretty good for the price but not to be compared to the quality of expensive buffets such as Mandalay Bay or Paris. We had good service at the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Canuckdude_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Southpoint for 4 nights in mid Febtuary because this was where my conference was located. It's a $25 taxi to get to the strip or an $8 unreliable and inconvenient shuttle. There really is nothing special about this hotel. In it's defence it's reasonably clean.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!!!! Secret of Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: chevelleskick
Reviews.Content: Well kept newer Hotel. Casino was clean and rooms large, clean, and comfortable too. Would stay again. Make sure to get club card for buffet half price with paid room. Breakfast was good other than the sausage stay away from it. Bleh.... We had a great experience here. Plus no resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KC2833
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to the hotel. I came as part of a convention. It was a great place for a convention as you could come here and never have to leave. The convention space was big and nice. The food in the convention was the best food I have ever had at a convention. I enjoyed the convention area being up and away from the casino so you felt like you were getting away from it. The rooms were awesome. I was by myself and I had a huge room. I especially enjoyed the couch. I like to read at night and hate trying to sit up and read in bed. It had a big bathroom. Also the shower was seperated from the sink area and I can see how that would be helpful if you had more than one person getting ready at a time. The air conditioning unit was quiet. To quite for me as I sleep with a fan at home and it was to quiet in my hotel room! I used the shuttle to and from the airport and had no trouble with this. I had to wait just a little when I got in for the shuttle but worth not having to pay for a cab for me. I did not use the shuttle down to the strip as I am not a person that would enjoy the strip,but others did and said it was easy. One of the best things in the hotel was the gift shop. If you want to get much cheaper alcohol then that is the place to go. They had my favorite bottle of wine for 12 dollars which is much cheaper than I could get it at home. So enjoyed that in my room. Great selections of wine, beer and other alcohol. Everyone here seemed to be friendly to me. I ate at the Del Mar Deli when I got there. It was a little slow, but the food was reasonable and good. Didn't expect to find places in Vegas with reasonable food. Also, ate breakfast one morning at Coranoado Cafe. It was ok, not the best food ever but definately not the worst. I really enjoyed a dinner at Don Vito's. The gnocchi was awesome and neat atmosphere. I was disapointed that the mexican place was not open on Mondays and Tuesdays as that is when I was there. But had other choices. I did get room service one night and the food was awlful. So I would stick to the restaurants. I am not really a gambler so did not go to the casino much. It was smoky, but less than the other casinos I have been in. I did not like the smoke smell but could stand it. Once you got past the casino in the hotel part I never did smell smoke though. As said before, if you want to the stip experience not the place to go. But a good place for conventions as reasonable for attendents and you can go to the strip if you want. Also great for people like me that would want a relaxing vacation with a little bit of Vegas, but not to much on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “All in One Destination”
Reviews.Author: tripleplay423
Reviews.Content: My wife attended a seminar here and it is a all inclusive hotel/casino destination. It is about 6-7 miles away from the strip to the South and is about a $20 taxi ride to the airport. The shuttle to the airport is only available during the day but if you are leaving early or late, you will have to catch a cab.There is no reason to leave the premises unless you are siteseeing. If you like to casino hop, you will need wheels or a taxi (chich can be expensive). There are restaurants, meeting ballrooms, & lots of guest rooms.The rooms on the 21st floor were very quiet. Staff was friendly and helpful. A good place for a convention, but not convienient for activities other than what is going on at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean place nice spacious rooms for 50 bucks NICE”
Reviews.Author: montecrloman
Reviews.Content: My hotel experience was great...the food was okie nothing special.....I lost in casino but thats just me ....great place to stay very clean

Reviews.Title: “South Point Still My Favourite in LV”
Reviews.Author: SarahDaisy
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth stay at South Point over the past few years and this is my third review of it. The main reason I'm writing pretty much the same thing as before is so that people know that it is still as good as it was before. We really feel like we are coming home when we arrive at South Point and look forward to going back! If you are looking for a mad, hangover type of vegas, then SP is probably not for you. If are looking for a holiday in Vegas where you can go in and sample the madness of the strip for some of the time and be able to relax and take in all the rest that Vegas has to offer for the rest of the time, then SP is probably for you. This time we stayed in the Junior 1 bedroom suite again, and at a price that is still significantly lower than any of the other good options in Vegas on the strip. What we love about South Point is the following: a. Friendly, professional, quirky and down to earth staff everywhere. From reception all the way across, South Point staff are lovely and have never let us down. b. Huge big comfortable rooms that are quiet, bright or dark as you prefer. Well appointed bathrooms, clean and well kept. c. Huge big casino with all my favourite slot machines! And no hustle... d. Fantastic choice of restaurants and places to eat. We had been vaguely interested in the Steak and Shake, and this is a brilliant addition. The burgers were excellent. Really excellent. Service is slightly more quirky there... but still very good. Don Vitos Italian - brilliant food. I still haven't found a better fettucine alfredo! Oyster Bar - clam linguine. Yum. Coronado Cafe breakfasts, excellent. Buffet breakfasts and brunches absolutely brilliant as well and incredibly good value. If you have a club card you get even better prices. e. Bowling alley and cinema if you have people who don't want to gamble. f. Pool area not full of intimidating bodies... nice and relaxed New this time - the free wifi in the lobby area. Excellent. Vastly improved shuttle service to the strip - $8 a day for as many round trips as you need. Great. I would not stay at South Point if I wanted to pose and meet "beautiful people" - they generally seem to be really nice and down to earth human beings. Lots of cowboys! I would not stay at South Point if I wanted to holler and yell and get manky drunk and dance on the poker table. I would not stay at South Point if I had small kids with me as people like me who like to smoke can smoke pretty much everywhere. And there is a lot of drinking and gambling going on, and cocktail waitresses that might evoke a few questions from young adults. Again, if I could change one thing about South Point it would be to have it be a little closer to Europe so that I could go more often. Thanks again, and look forward to going back in December.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Chawalit S
Reviews.Content: December of 2011 I had book a trip through Expedia and selected The South Point Hotel, Casino, and Spa because I wanted to get the most bang for my buck and with it being near the New Year, most of the other Hotel/Casinos were really expensive. I arrived late and had a friend pick me up from the airport to take me to the hotel but was able to utilize the free airport shuttle for my return (Reservations required or you are on a "Space Available" status). I arrived around midnight and was checked in promptly by a very nice young lady who offered me a couple of coupon books, generated a duplicate Players Card for me since I forgot to bring mine from home,as well as offered to print my boarding pass for my return trip home.She also let me know of the Strip Shuttle ($8 all day pass) since she knew that I had not rented a vehicle, and let me know of its pick up location and times. I used this service almost everyday that I was there and believe me $8 was well spent. I came and went a fews times during the day and the shuttle drops you off and picks you up at multiple points along the strip. The service to and from the Strip locations were quick and efficient as well as on time. Prior to my arrival I had called the Hotel and had requested 2 beds since my friends would be staying with me for part of my stay. The standard for all hotels booked through a third party is "All requests cannot be guaranteed", but the South Point had no problems accomodating my needs. When I arrived to the room, I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room itself as well as the size of its large bathroom (Separate toilet/shower and sink areas), which makes things a lot easier when multiple persons are trying to get ready at the same time. The rooms were nicely appointed, nice big floor to ceiling windows, and a 42 inch flat panel TV, among other amenities. During this trip I did not utilize any other services besides eating at the buffet and cafe. The buffet is good but not great...I have definitely eaten at worse but it's not the Bellagio nor Wynn buffets but their prices were reasonable (Cheap if you use the 50% off coupon in the coupon book), and the Coronado Cafe, which is open 24 hrs has great food at dirt cheap prices but the catch is that those prices are from 12am-6am and there can be a wait as expected for the quality of food as well as the price. I had the 7oz NY steak and Eggs (Approximately$4) a couple of mornings while I was there. So, after staying there back at the end of December of last year, I received a mailer for several nights stay for free as a Hotel promotion, and since I had a wonderful time there previously, I reserved a room from Feb.28-Mar.3. As part of the promotion I also was given $40 in free slot play and $40 resort credit for use at almost all of the venues within the resort. There is not a Resort Fee but if you want to use the Spa or Fitness Center the cost is $15 per day, but with the promotion it was free as well. The pool and jacuzzi are free, and man, the jacuzzi is nice. The only way I can explain it is that it is 8 jacuzzis fit into the style of a lazy river. I used the jacuzzi everyday that I was there this time and I even layed out next to the pool. I think the locals thought is was a little chilly out but 60-65 degree weather is magnificent to me since I am from Seattle. I was a happy camper! The pool was supposedly heated to 77 degrees but I doubted that, as I quickly did the two feet in and two feet out quickly dance. I also saw a show there (The Dennis Bono Show), I don't know if there is any relationship to Sonny Bono but I never asked. The show is free to Player Club Card holders (Free to join) but you have to obtain a ticket at the Box Office prior to your admittance. I guess I somehow didn't understand this but when I walked into the door and I didn't have my ticket, I was a little embarassed but a very nice older gentleman that worked the door and "Pat", at least I think that's what her name was, scanned an extra ticket and allowed me in. I sat in a booth next to a lovely older local couple (Mid 70's if I had to guess) and they treated me as if I was their new best frind. The show is a variety show that is broadcasted via radio each week. I was pleasantly surprised, lots of good singing...I left impressed. So, needless to say I would recommend the South Point! It has alot to offer, from multiple eating establishments, large movie theatre, bowling alley, Spa, Fitness Center, Pool/Jacuzzi, arcade, etc., and I can't forget to mention that next to the Sports Book from 11am-5pm, they have a Hot Dog Stand that serves hot dogs for 75 cents and they even dress it for you. It definitely is a nice establishment and the rooms are huge (500 square feet), and thats just a standard room not the suites. you can't get that much space in Las Vegas very often. The higher the room level, the better the view. My room (2039) had a nice view of the valley and mountains and I got to watch the sun come over the mountains every morning, that's a treat for someone from Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel grows on you!”
Reviews.Author: justinedvm
Reviews.Content: I wasn't too pleased to have 3 business trips out to Vegas. I was even more unhappy to hear that I was going to be far away from the lights and fun of the strip. This hotel is about 5-8 miles away, but... STILL lots of fun! This hotel is huge, but has a small town, homey feel to it. It's got kind of a Western theme going on (since a lot of rodeos and horse events happen at the attached arena). That said, it's cheap, with hotel rooms ranging from $40-100 bucks/night, and offers all the similar amenities. The PROS? Free wifi in the lobby Decent food Awesome spa - I had Salena for my facial and LOVED it! Incredible steam room and well manicured/attended-to spa ($10/day) Nice pool and hot tube Nice fitness room - plenty of treadmills, but at a steep price ($15/day?) Cheap shuttle ($8, roundtrip) to the strip - picks you up and drops you off at 4 main locations The CONS Off the strip so you feel like you're in the middle of nowhere Overall, I was pleasantly surprised how good this place was. It's where the locals go to gamble, away from the strip. If they had free wifi to all the rooms and a free shuttle to the strip, it'd be better, but their prices are really, really reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “best bargain with excellent service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: LucyLu60003
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything. I wanted to find a good hotel for the price in Vegas. Our room was facing the mountains, had 2 queen beds and was one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed in. It has a bowling alley, movie theater, bingo hall, equestrian arena, many 1 cent slots, and quite a few restaurants to choose from. The buffet has a good variety and at breakfast cook to order omelets. It has a Steak and Shake, Oyster bar, Evening cuisine at the Silverado which is elegant yet casual dress. It has Seattle's best coffee bar, Ice cream place, a deli and more restaurants that I did not get to try. It has a indoor spa for services and a workout area but I found the extra fee for the use was a little steep for the short amount of time I would be using it. If you wish to go to the strip they have a shuttle that takes you and picks you up at designated stops for a fee. lt so it has free airport pickup and drop off but make sure you reserve your space on it days in advance. I was very impressed with the place and would recommend it if you don't mind staying off strip. I will return there next time I go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal H
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything for the family! Everyone will be satisfied! This hotel has the feel and looks of any 5 star hotel on the strip. Speaking of the strip the have a shuttle that will take you there if you don't have your own car. Really wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Off Strip, but still lots of Vegas fun”
Reviews.Author: HiloYoshi
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed off-strip when visting Vegas so was doubtful about staying at South Point. However, what I found was a resort that was affordable, comfortable, with lots of amenities that provided a Vegas experience without the high price. South Point has a variety of entertainment (bowling alley, movie theatres, shows, etc.), gaming, restaurants, and a nice pool area. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful during my stay and everything was clean. The room I booked was spacious, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was clean. The room could easily accomodate a couple of people without them tripping over each other. While it was a little inconvenient to be off the Strip for some things (we had tickets for a show one night and did general exploration on another), it was actually nice to get away from the drunken craziness that can abound on a weekend in Vegas. If you're looking for an affordable Vegas vacation, I would check-out South Point.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great value! great buffet-great price”
Reviews.Author: dinee1
Reviews.Content: After staying at Treasure Island and Mandalay Bay, I didn't expect much, but I was sick of paying resort fees and sick of the strip. So we thought we'd take a chance (at $49 a night) with So. Point. This is our new hotel! It's somewhat family friendly, has a huge bowling alley, movie theatres, and a wonderful buffet, at only $18 a plate on weekdays, it put the other hotels' buffets to shame! It had the most delicious prime rib, shrimp, real mashed potatoes, and desserts. The rooms were very clean and spacious. Very pleased and glad I read the reviews. Loved the price....

Reviews.Title: “Alway top of the line.”
Reviews.Author: jwh2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all for anyone not wanting the noise and hassles of the strip hotels. Great restraunts, bowling alley, events in big arena. The check in is always pleasant and the staff is great. Recommend it to anyone wanting quiet comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Room was gross”
Reviews.Author: greenespace100
Reviews.Content: Delta put me up here for free because of a canceled flight. It's not a great place- the room smelled of sanitizer, the buffet was a little scary, and the location didn't seem close to anything. I don't know what the price was, but there's certainly better in LV for the money. I do understand that some rooms are much better than others, so maybe just got a crappy room, but I wouldn't go back. Can I offer the hotel a little advice- check the buffet for food that's been sitting for a long time. With all the incredible buffets in Vegas, you can do better. Seriously. You can also make sure the rooms don't smell like cheap sanitizer and have a sign asking needle users to call for a safe disposal system.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia P
Reviews.Content: The South Point is everything you'd want in Vegas. A nice hotel with big rooms, flat screen TV's, comfortable beds. The casino is great. The buffet is excellent and half what you'd pay at a strip hotel. If you don't care about being on the strip, want a hotel with good rooms, great food and prices, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “South Point has so much to offer!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the South Point to celebrate our anniversary recently. We were so pleased to find so many things to do.There was a horse show in progress that we enjoyed, bowling & pool/spa available, and we also attended a movie- it was a real treat. We were there on a 3 day weekend though, numerous conferences / events were in progress. Lines for the restaurants were crazy long & there were kids everywhere- even in gambling areas! We did have a great time & were greatly impressed with our room & staff. I'd definitely recommend the South Point to family & friends!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: thelegoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night after visiting the Death Valley during the Presidents' Day weekend. We had booked rooms at Mandalay Bay and Monte Carlo but decided to cancel those because we thought it was just too expense for an one night stay (MB was over $300 and MC was $160 a night). Someone at work told me about South Point because she always stays there when she goes to Vegas for bowling tournaments. Long story short - after checking the rating/comments/pictures on the internet about the place, we decided to give it a try for about $75 a night. We were very impressed when checked into the room, the place is very spacious and so was the bathroom, plenty of counter space. The whole place is very clean and looks very elegant. Yes, it is not as upscale as hotels like Mandalay Bay, but for the price that we paid, it is very nice. The hotel is located just right off the I15 freeway, so it is very easy to get there. We didn't care about going to the strip so the location is actually perfect for us. For those who wants actions on the strip, this hotel might not be convenient for you location-wise. We ate breakfast at its Coronado Cafe downstairs, food is pretty good and price is reasonable, just that the service was pretty slow. We didn't have the chance (I wished we did) to check out the bowling lanes and the pool there, but I have heard that they are nice too. I would definitely recommend this place and would stay there again when we visit Vegas next time.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value with large room far from Strip”
Reviews.Author: vardon
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for a large conference. I was impressed by the shear enormity of the interior space in this hotel, its conference rooms, casino floor, movie theater, restaurants horse arena, etc. The hotel room I was given was by far the largest hotel room I have stayed in at this price point. I have stayed in larger rooms but at 2-3 xs more $$. The room was very comfortable and the views from the upper floors are great too. I found the desk with internet connection useful. (fee $13 /day) Outside has a beautiful pool area and not just your regular boring rectangular pool, but a contoured attractive pool area. The place is so large that one can be tempted not to leave. There is not really anything worth walking to around the hotel as it is by itself at the end of some suburbs. The strip is 15-20 minutes away which sounds close but the shuttle service ($8 for all day rides) was difficult to use. We waited for the shuttle only to find there were not enough seats and we had wasted our time. We ended up taking a taxi instead. (~$25-30 with tip) At the South Point, most of the restaurants and bars are mingled among or on the sides of the casino floor. A coupon book for hotel guests lowers the cost of meals or offers free drinks or desserts with your dinner purchaase. Another reviewer enjoyed the Garden Buffet and I have to second that opinion. Everything was great except the Chinese dishes some of which were inedible. But with so much unhealthy food in Vegas, it was nice to have many healthy choices available. I had a large salad and spread peel and eat shrimp over the top, then had a delicious cut of prime rib and lots of fresh fruit for dessert. I also ate at their mexican restaurant. The free margarita was dreadful and the steak dish was poorly spiced with undercooked onions, dry rice and cheese poured over the top. Yuck! They did provide free tortilla chips with 3 dipping options including guacamole The buffet food for the conference was impressively good considering the volume of people they were serving. We had a great Salmon meal with Brocolini for lunch one day. This hotel appears to be frequented by a lot of locals due to its ease of access. A Wenesday night song and dance show De Ja Vu was full of local regulars in their 60 and 70s filling the dance floor and having a good time. Overall, this hotel seems more relaxed than the strip and offers a lot under one roof. There are definately good food choices and the overall value is great. Of course, this is still Vegas and gambling is the center of the facility. And so the idea that this is a family-friendly hotel is ridiculous to me.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path Casino”
Reviews.Author: Zhiv
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay here and I liked some things: spacious rooms, simplicity, clean without smells, quick elevators, busy casino floor, you could tell they are trying to reinvent themselves... there is a guns show and horse cutting show and a movie theater with the latest attractions. Food is decent and plentiful at reasonable prices. Parking is also ample and near the action. Conference hall accomodated a large crowd and the conference breakfast and lunch were excellent. Negatives: something's gotta be done about the horse smells in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Could be a better option for Vegas !”
Reviews.Author: 2009Benjamin
Reviews.Content: The South Point is a great option if you're going to Vegas and don't mind being off the Strip. A rental car will get you to the Strip which is 8 miles away, but you'll find all you need at the South Point and at better prices. Rooms are about $100 per night. Join the Club and get a buffet dinner for $8. And if you're into gaming, there's a $1 minimum at the roulette table compared to $10 minimum at the Excalibur. Staff were all friendly and helpful, unusual for such a huge hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great off the strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: salesmaven
Reviews.Content: My hotel room was spacious and clean. The bathroom was larger than most. The in-room coffee is unusual for Vegas hotels. $12.99 a day for wi-fi. But, no resort fee and free parking in the large multi-level parking structure very close to the casino. The South Point always has several things going on. During our stay there was a gun show, a drummer's clinic and a cutting horse competition. The large equestrian center is host to many events during the year. Unfortunately, during the 2-day cutting horse event, the entire casino had a strong smell of horse manure. Slots pay moderately....better than most strip casinos. If you eat at the Garden Buffer, be sure to use the coupons in the book they give you upon check-in. 50% off makes the buffet bearable.....we ate breakfast there and the made-to-order omelette station provided a great option to the steam table breakfast items. The Coronado Cafe has much better food and some of the best hash browns I've eaten lately. The Steak and Shakes diner is inexpensive but I found the cheeseburger disappointing. The meat patty was smaller than that at McDonald's.

Reviews.Title: “Too many negatives...”
Reviews.Author: germatt2
Reviews.Content: Positives (this will be quick): rooms are large and clean with nice views. Negatives: 1. Almost 9 miles from anything worth doing when in Las Vegas (must do a taxi or the hotel shuttle (which fills up quickly) to get to the Strip). 2. Crawling with locals and low-class types -- I saw more mullets in one location than I once previously thought possible. 3. Cigarette smoke throughout the casino is overwhelming. I tried to enjoy a few slots and ended up 'cashing-out' and calling it a night. 4. Worth repeating -- a sketchy low-class crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Best ROI Out There”
Reviews.Author: e3paperman
Reviews.Content: I've been a guest at this hotel for years, back when it was known as South Coast hotel and casino. No place is going to be perfect for everyone, but let's face it, the price point is very impressive. If I was to rank 'impressive' I would say the rooms take first place. They're spacious, fairly modern, and clean. If the low volume of available TV channels concerns you, maybe you're misssing the point of being in Vegas.....you can watch your 400+ channels at home! The casino floor has a 'local feel' but that can serve you well with the lower limit tables. One can bet $25 dollars at a $10 table but not the other way around. So if the shoe goes cold, you can dial back you betting and ride the wave until betting winner skies emerge. Having eaten at the buffet for breakfast, lunch, and dinner (not all in the same day), probably the best 'bang for your buck' is the breakfast. Just remember to bring your Club card to save a couple of bucks (and use that for tipping based on good service). I give this review 5 stars because I believe this place gives you an excellent value for your money. What you do with all the money you save by staying here probably will end up also staying in Vegas, but win or lose, that's the cost of entertainment. -Paperman

Reviews.Title: “Spacious....Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Carrie4742
Reviews.Content: We just spend 2 nights at the South Point Hotel and loved it. Very fresh, clean, spacious, and relaxing which is pretty hard to find in Las Vegas. The rooms are very large, with large 2 room bathrooms (or at least ours was...and we were in a regular room) with great lighting and beautiful tile. The rooms even had reading lights above the bed, something you never see in Las Vegas. Every employee was genuinely friendly, not plastic smiles. It's an easy on/off from the freeway with ample parking close to the front entrance. The casino is well spaced out giving it an airy feeling. Great variety of restaurants too and the food was terrific. We're looking forward to staying at the South Point again soon and will recommend it again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, pretty convenient to strip”
Reviews.Author: Ariktravel
Reviews.Content: I am just finishing a 3 night stay at this hotel. Great spot for families since there is an on site bowling alley, movie theater and arcade. The food at the Garden Buffet was actually pretty good quality. I do not eat buffet food and did eat from this restaurant. The rooms are pretty big and spacious. Bathroom had sink separate from toilet/bathtub. Casino was nice to play in. A little on the smokey side though. It is probably about 5-8 minutes down to the Mandalay Bay. They offer a strip shuttle and airport shuttle from this hotel. I know the strip shuttle is $8 per day payable on the bus. Not sure about the airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GreyhoundGirlie
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel after debating staying on the strip. Excellent choice...there was plenty to keep occupied with, lots of great food, and although I don't gamble, it sure sounded like patrons that did were winning more than the people who were gambling further north on the Strip. As a runner, it was nice to be able to leave the hotel and venture to surrounding areas and not feel unsafe....and you could run from the hotel, into residential areas, and back into shopping and schools....and if you got turned around, all you had to do was look in the direction of the hotel, and it was almost like a giant mirage in the middle of the desert!! The staff was friendly and helpful, and the rooms were clean and spacious. I am definitely looking forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: ArcheryFamily-NJ Posted by a Wyndham Hotel Group traveler
Reviews.Content: We participate in a sporting event every year that has been at the Riviera for a number of years. It moved to South Point this year. A lot of people were disappointed that it was not on the strip. There is a shuttle for $8 cash round trip (the same day), which we did use a couple times, but after the mad house it was trying to walk on the strip at night, I would gladly have just stayed at the hotel. There is a bowling alley and movie theater and other activities that I didn't even take advantage of, but will next year. I would probably only go to the strip if I had tickets to a show. South Point is also close to lots of outlet shopping. Car rentals being reasonable, I would probably rent a car while there instead of using the shuttle so I could explore some of the area right around the hotel and head to the strip hotels via the highway if I wanted to go there. The rooms were very nice - spacious, clean and comfortable. Everyone I encountered from the front desk staff to the housekeeping staff was very nice. As we often don't get out a lot during the competition, it was an added benefit that South Point offered more and better restaurants. The food was better and there was a good selection and the price was definitely better than places on the strip. Did not get to the higher end restaurants, but heard they were all good. Enjoyed Coronado Cafe, the buffet, Steak and Shake and the deli. All were good and fairly reasonably priced. Looking forward to returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “Everything in one perfect package!”
Reviews.Author: Lvjennyo
Reviews.Content: Rooms clean and up to date, staff all incredibly friendly and helpful, lots to do, spa is amazing, fun, fun, fun!

Reviews.Title: “Bring a Gas Mask”
Reviews.Author: jasonchr
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at SouthPoint, from February 9-12, 2012. The rooms are perfectly adequate, though less than nice. The pool area is void of much in the way of shade or grass. The food is expensive and not very good, on par with amusement parks. The Steak-N-Shake had a 20 minute line just for takeout. The beds were ok, though the pillows were overstuffed, which I found uncomfortable. The phones in the room did not work. Wifi is not included, and they charge $14/day PER COMPUTER. Though it's free from the lobby. I could forgive all of the above. What I can't forgive is the air quality inside the hotel was awful. I'm having a hard time understanding why someone would spend the hundreds of millions of dollars to build a place like SouthPoint, only to poison the guests by not ventillating the facility properly. I understand that gambling and cigarettes go together. But, I fail to understand why the hotel and event center would tolerate such lousy air circulation. It was exceptionally poor in the common areas, especially near the event center. So, unless you have a really good reason to stay at SouthPoint, spend the extra few dollars and stay at a nicer place, or just bring a gas mask.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay away from the crush of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Dsmittys
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a significant distance from the main part of the Strip ( about 2 miles), so if you are looking to Casino Hop without a car, this place isn't for you. That being said, the Casino is nice, not smoky, with a decent selection of games. The buffet is fairly standard, but is a good deal most nights (Friday Seafood buffet is a little overpriced for what you get). The Prime Rib Room is excellent. Rooms are comfortable. King rooms have a loveseat as well if you just want to sit and relax. Bathrooms are nicely appointed, but the Shower/tub combo is a bit shallow if you are looking for a good soak. They have a shuttle available to go to the airport and strip, but a car is really necessary to see the rest of Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Too long a walk from registration to the elevators!”
Reviews.Author: tracey m
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice property and has one flaw. The registration desk and the elevators to the rooms are quite a long distance walk. For those with disabilities it was a disadvantage for them, as the elevators are too far away from the registration desk. For those who have one bag and not need of bell service, it is quite a hike to reach the elevator banks, yet alone those with disabilites. Other then that, it's a very nice hotel. The rooms are quite large, the beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are larger then your usual hotel. The staff is very nice and helpful. They have a very nice movie theater upstairs along with a nice bowling alley to get away from the casino. The ice cream parlor is a great place for a late night sundae!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Denise B
Reviews.Content: This hotel, with its beautiful pool, great buffet and lovely room was a delight to stay at. The pool and jacuzzi is large and open later in the evening. Most of the hotel pools in Vegas close early to get you into their casinos. The garden buffet has a nice variety. The chef will make you an omelet for breakfast or an Italian pasta dish for lunch/dinner to your liking. There are several other reasonably priced restaurants such as Steak 'n Shake and Coronado Cafe. During the day there is an inexpensive hot dog stand by the sports bar in the casino. The rooms are comfortable with a flat screen TV and sitting area. The hotel doesn't charge a resort fee. However, there is a charge to use the fitness center. The hotel is located on the strip south of the airport. Since we had a car this was not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “A very Good night”
Reviews.Author: Seacruise
Reviews.Content: I have been here many times but never stayed here. I stayed here Feb. 01 2012 We had been given two rates when we booked and chose the lesser rate. The slightly higher rate included a coupon book with coupons for 50% off in the Buffet. We we arrived and checked in we were given the coupon book anyways. Great customer service. I had left Club card at home and was promptly given another one at check-in. The room was much larger than other rooms on the strip. It was clean and very quite. Nice to have no "resort" fee. I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: lycheewaves
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very far from the strip, so if you're ok with that, then I'd recommend it for the value rooms. We got such cheap rooms and for the price the room is very spacious, clean, decor is good and decent facilities.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Happybikers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the South Point for two nights in January 2012. We have stayed at this hotel before, but this time it was exceptional. We were greeted by a friendly hotel clerk, and check in was fast and easy. We were assigned a smoking room, as requested, on a high floor. The room was very, very clean. The furniture and carpet were in excellent condition. The mattress was perfect-felt like it was new. Bathroom was also in excellent condition and very clean. The maid service was also very attentive. The casino was fun and we did play bingo. We ate at the buffet and the mexican place. Both were good and the service was friendly and efficient. Cocktail service on the casino floor was fast and friendly. We will be returning at the end on February and hope everything will as good as this time. We had a great time-thank you South Point!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Claire M
Reviews.Content: The South Point Hotel has a lot to offer for all ages and interests, they have a lot of on site amenities like a movie theater, bowling lanes, games arcade and an indoor equestrian arena (check with the hotel before booking about upcoming events as it was closed when we stayed there) and a convention centre. I stayed here with my Finace back in August 2011 for 4 days on a weekend, the rates were ok, pretty standard for a hotel of its size (stayed for 3 nights) It was our first trip to Vegas and the rooms we're very spacious, comfortable and clean. On a future visit I'll be staying on the main strip and just to be aware the cab fare (to get to main strip) was roughly $25-30 but they do have a shuttle bus which takes guests to and from the strip for a small charge ( roughly $7-cant remember the exact price but it wasnt more than $10). This hotel is a great place to stay if you don't want to stay on the strip itself and I thought was a fantastic place for families due to the other facilities besides the casino. The only negative thing I have to say is the Hotel location, which is described as 5 miles south of the centre strip, I thought closer to 10 miles (cab fare reflected this) and I felt this could have been made more clearer as distance to main strip (walking/driving) was a question I asked before making the reservation but other than that the Hotel was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “All in One Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arbyboy
Reviews.Content: Although my last trip was primarily for business, I do stay here occasionally for personal trips too. South Point offers a very reasonable room rate for what you get. The rooms are very spacious and extremely clean. The reason I titled this ‘All in One’ is because you literally don’t have to go anywhere else unless you just want to see the strip. South Point offers all the different variations of casino games, plus the size of the casino is gigantic. It has a movie complex, fantastic pool area, spa and gym, bowling lanes, plus live entertainment. Perhaps the best feature is the variety of restaurants. The steak house is one of the best in Vegas! A couple tips, take advantage of the free shuttle to and from the airport. All you have to do is register beforehand with the hotel. Also, if you want to walk the strip, South Point offers free shuttle service to and from the strip. Have fun and good luck!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT OPTION FOR STAYING AWAY FROM THE STRIP”
Reviews.Author: PATHRCO7
Reviews.Content: A bunch of us stayed here for a week in early January while working a trade show @ Mandalay Bay. Because CES show was in town, hotel rooms were at a premium, especially Mandalay Bay, so we opted for the South Point because the rates were extremely affordable compared to the hotels on The Strip. WOW! What a great choice!! The place is really great in terms of pricing, size & cleanliness of the rooms, restaurants/bars and parking. Several in our group had vehicles so going back & forth to the show @ Mandalay wasn't a problem. If you don't have a vehicle I'm guessing the taxi rides could be costly going to/from The Strip. The buffet, cafe and bars are a true value compared to the nearby Strip hotels. Rooms are big, clean and a bargain, too. Front desk personnel even accommodated us for early check-in @ 11:00 in the morning upon our arrival. That's rare in Las Vegas, believe me and we really appreciated that. We fully agree with a bunch of earlier reviews.....For some reason, the casino area seems more smoke laden than other casinos in Las Vegas. I'm guessing that they don't have a top rate ventilation system. But, once you get past that, the rooms don't have the smoky atmosphere. We'll certainly be back next year and we've contacted the trade show organizer to see if they can move their show from Mandalay Bay down to the South Point. May not be possible but nevertheless, we'll be back to South Point.

Reviews.Title: “A real surprise”
Reviews.Author: Mat R
Reviews.Content: Living in Vegas for so long I never really considered the local's type hotels much but when my wife and I had family in town staying at our place, we decided to take off for a night and stay at the South Point. It was truly a big surprise. First off, we got a spectacular rate ($40 for a king standard) which was cheaper than even the crummy motels in Henderson. So long as you can hold your breath through the smoke laden casino downstairs, once you get to the room you will be surprised. We had a great view but the best part was that the room was HUGE - like 360SF+ big - very well appointed, nice decor, super comfy bed, and very clean bathroom. If you have a car and can get yourself off the main strip or you need a big place for a small family - definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel if you don't want to be on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Linnepin_99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel since I needed to be in this area. Was not impressed with the Front Desk staff at check in, she made it very clear that since I didn't book directly with the hotel but through a third party I shouldn't expect what I had reserved. I had booked a king size bed but got 2 queens, again I was told this was because I booked through a third party and they don't honor the request that was made for a king even though it stated as such on my conformation. The room was even more roomier since there was a couch and table missing, phone next to the bed was not plugged in and there were no glasses in the bathroom. I have worked in Resorts in Las Vegas and to me this looked like a room that was off the market and was put back in just for me. When I went back to the desk the next morning (was to tired after a 16 hour flight the night before) I again was not treated very friendly. I asked for a king a second time and was told with a very uninterested face that the only king that was left was smoking. When I told her I didn't mind she put the room on hold for me with a big sigh. The girl that actually gave me the key to it in the afternoon was very pleasant and to my surprise it wasn't even a smoking room. This room was fine, checked by Housekeeping the way it should be. There is free wifi in the lobby but in the room it will cost you $12.99 for 24 hours. There is a coffee machine in the room and sometimes you get double the amount of coffee, there are tea bags as well. Rooms are very quiet and the bed is great. So maybe if they train some of their Front Desk staff in customer service they would get a better review next time.

Reviews.Title: “fun place!”
Reviews.Author: oldseptblues
Reviews.Content: I love South Point for a number of reasons. It's very clean, and there are lots of things to do there if you don't want to gamble. Bowling, Movie theatre, tons of restaurants. They also have really great cheap drinks at the bars!

Reviews.Title: “When you don't want to be on the strip, this is a great choice.”
Reviews.Author: DillonPayton
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice now as we are passing through Las Vegas. South Point is now a high point in our trip each year. We love the convenient online booking, quick and efficient check-in, security patrolled free parking, and the variety of dining options. We request a tower room and enjoy the excellent mattress, large room and double bathroom area. Rooms are extremely quiet and the flat screen TV is a plus. Real glasses and a coffee pot and hair dryer are all pluses. No free wi-fi but we have our own so not an issue. We enjoy and take advantage of the fun book discounts and always take advantage of the gift shop liquor options on our way upstairs. Primarily Prime Rib is our favorite restaurant and find the staff and seating to be extremely pleasant. We love that this quality hotel is not on the strip and find it so enjoyable we recommend it regularly to the point that two sets of friends are staying here during their travel this next two weeks. Finally, a great option for a relaxing stop while traveling in the region.

Reviews.Title: “Good stop over”
Reviews.Author: RoadtripperColorado
Reviews.Content: I stopped here for one night just passing through. It is a fairly new property with ample free parking. The room was exceptionally large with a big flat screen TV and a very large and nice bathroom area. It would probably be called a mini suite by other strip properties. The location is good for passing through, it is a very easy on/off to I-15 and is away from the crowds of the strip. Although it is technically on the south end of the strip, it is not walking distance to any other properties, good for passing through, bad if you want experience other properties easily.Had an excellent dinner at the Italian restaurant on site and even won a few bucks at the craps table, although they only allow double odds, bad for serious gambling. Would stay here again if only passing through, usually stay closer to the other strip properties if I'm staying for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Janesays_11
Reviews.Content: I love the rooms, they are comfy and smell good. Bathrooms is roomy and is actually 2 rooms with the toilet/shower separate. $30 cab ride to strip, so be prepared. Buffet is terrible, with brown wilted lettuce, the same at Coronado Cafe. Deli & coffee shop were good. Great for families, pool area very nice has bowling and movie theatre. Internet and fitness center are surcharged.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be nice ...”
Reviews.Author: seawoof0417
Reviews.Content: ... but isn't anymore. Yes, we got our room for approximately $40 per night last summer, but noticed big changes since our first visit several years ago. The rooms need refurnishing badly, as it appeared the carpet had not been cleaned or replaced in years. Also, the bed was "itchy." Make of that what you will - I was afraid to check the mattresses for bed bugs. The casino itself was filthy during the weekdays. Glasses weren't picked up, there was trash on the floors and ashtrays were brimming with cigarette butts. Although I gambled pretty much continuously for the first two days, I was never approached by a cocktail waitress. If I wanted anything to drink, I had to stop my play and go to the bar. I used self-checkout and asked for a copy of my receipt to be sent to my e-mail. It never came. What did come was a survey asking me how my stay was. I requested a copy of my receipt again, and asked to be contacted by management. I never received a call - or the requested receipt. We spent the next two days at the M Resort, which was a far better experience. I will never stay or gamble at the South Point again.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: FlyguyAustin
Reviews.Content: If you are willing to be two miles from the Strip, the Southpoint Hotel/Casino is a good deal. Large, quiet rooms with two comfortable beds and non-smoking floors are available. Big bathroom with granite counters, tub/shower combination, and average set of amenities. Large flat-screen TV with full range of channels, and there is no “resort fee” now charged by so many of the other Las Vegas Casinos. In-room internet is expensive, no newspaper, and no fantasy pools or attractions, are the only possible downside. The casino is friendly and has low minimums on the tables. Access to the first strip hotel is about 8 minutes by car via the freeway, and there was an all-day pass on the shuttle to the strip for $8. If you want a nice room at about 25% of the cost of a strip hotel, and do not mind being away from the action, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: ferrywings
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel for one night, just to get us in position for an early morning flight the next day. I thought it would be easy to get a cheap price for a room in Vegas, but apparently not during a huge Electronics convention! I came across the South Point for a great price and thought, "why not"? I was very pleasantly surprised by this huge, clean oasis at the far end of Las Vegas Blvd. Plenty of free parking, a huge casino, great variety of restaurants, extremely clean both outside and in, including spacious rooms. And it was easy access to the car rental return at the airport. The only downgrade is that other than the check-in person, there was not a friendly staff person to be found. It's a long way from the strip action, but there is a (pay) shuttle. Might stay again if I don't care about being on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious, inexpensive, but far from strip”
Reviews.Author: Getawayguy20
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at South Point during the Consumers Electronics Show in Vegas, mainly because it was much less expensive than staying on the strip. We were impressed with how clean it was, easy to park and walk in, and how easy it is to get to from the car rental building. The rooms were more spacious than what you'd likely get from a regular room on the strip, plus there were lots of food options. No Starbucks in the casino, but there was a Seattle's Best. Overall the age of the people there were a little older, and it was just a little quieter (not a bad thing for Vegas!). There is a shuttle to the strip, but we took a cab all the way to the convention centre (about $30 US). Would be cheaper to the main part of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dottie0328
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really a great value! It was away from the hustle of the strip but close enough to take the shuttle if you wanted to venture out.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place for the price!”
Reviews.Author: chuckles79
Reviews.Content: You don't have to go anywhere else when you stay here! They have movie theaters, bowling lanes, a spa, food and their own casino. The casino is quite huge and not as expensive to play the slots as they are at the casinos on Las Vegas Blvd. South Point is about 15 minutes by highway outside of the craziness of Las Vegas. It is amazing just to drive up to because of its size. We stayed a week at our timeshare and an extra day here at South Point on Novemer 6, 2011 and couldn't believe how nice it was for the price that we paid. It was only $59 for the big room with the extra large window for the view. I will stay there anytime I have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Freakin Bad Even Though It Was Free”
Reviews.Author: OahuHawaii
Reviews.Content: The only reaon we stayed here one night is because our Air Tran flight from Vegas to our hometown area was cancelled overnight. The airline put us up at this dump. It is a rather new place, and nice size. Casino was okay, but not that many good games. Heavy smoke. Different people for sure. Room was very large and was clean. Bathroom was rather dark, shower in tub, etc. Had a view of the pool area. The pool area was another matter. There was some kind of cowboy/wrangler event in Vegas. The pool was small with a large CEMENT area around it. Again, different people for sure. Men had their swim trunks on with there freakin cowboy boots and hats. The girls, well, they looked pretty hard. MANY people who were sneaking their own drinks/beers in to save $$. And, these were NOT kids. Pool service was LONG....drink was not even cool by the time it arrived. We would never stay at a place like this. D-. I cannot recommend it you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Visit”
Reviews.Author: JohnSocal
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the South Point 2 times. Our last visit was for 4 nights. We are frequent visitors to Las Vegas having stayed at several of the strip hotels and also 3 different timeshares. We are pretty serious slot players so the casino is very important for us. The rooms at the South Point are quite large at 500 sq; ft. Though not as luxurious as some of the strip hotels we have stayed at, the rooms are clean and quite nice. I do recommend staying in a mid to upper floor room. The check-in and check out was quick. We were comped for all our room and all food charges. South Point's comping is quite generous. The restaurants are very good with a wide variety to choose from. South Point has a wide variety of slot machines and are definitely much looser than any on the strip. We came out ahead after 4 days of serious playing. It is located quite far south of the strip which is not a problem for us as we have stayed many many times right on the strip. Our main interest is a good gaming experience, good restaurants, good service, and nice accommodations. The South Point meets all of those. They also have a nice swimming pool, movie theater, bowling alley, etc. If you don't need to be right on the strip then the South Point is a very good choice. Make sure that you join the Player's Club. Is is free and you will get some free play and a discount book.

Reviews.Title: “Convention”
Reviews.Author: DaveNSC
Reviews.Content: First time in Las Vegas, not a gambler so no interest there but there was plenty to do besides with the movie theatres and other shows ( Horse jumping competition). Rooms were fine. Only downer was a cigarette smell in the main lobby. They try hard to get it but it is just there if you know what I mean. Prices were reasonable at the restaurants. Did not like the charge for wifi in the rooms - it is free in the lobby, just used my phone for emails.

Reviews.Title: “Always great for the money”
Reviews.Author: Michael1016
