Reviews.Content: This hotel I think is underated. Maybe it is not on the strip but it is not that far out. The staff are trained and courteous. Excellent to get to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: taffken
Reviews.Content: I was a little put off by the location, It is just south of L.V airport but that also an advantage if your coming in or leaving L.V. Hotel rooms, pool, food all of a good standard. I would use again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “No resort fees!”
Reviews.Author: myopinionz
Reviews.Content: This is a great property that is on the Vegas strip but is a few miles South of the Mandalay Bay. My check in was very quick and friendly. I arrived late Friday afternoon and I stood in line approx. 2 minutes and within another 2 minutes I was given my room key. This is such a change from the average Vegas hotel. Upon walking into the hotel/casino, you are not smacked in the face with the smell of cigarettes, you are welcomed to a bright, large, gaming facility. The room that I had overlooked a roof, like they all seem too, but beyond that I had a view of the Vegas skyline. The room offered a sitting area with couch & table along with a desk with all of the necessities for your laptop. I was a bit disappointed by the very small size of the tub, but other than that, it was great. The walls seem to be a little thin since I could hear my "neighbors' arrive around 3 AM. The buffet offered prime rib, shrimp & crab for a great deal of only $20.00 IF you signed up for their card. Also, upon checking in you are given a coupon booklet that has a coupon for 50% off the buffet. You can't beat $10.00 for this! All in all this is a fabulous deal and I would recommend staying there if you are not into the party feel that Vegas is known for.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: P M
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel. The rooms are very large—we got a king size bed, and there was ample space for two other seating areas. Bathroom is also very large and has a sink area separated from the toilet and shower. Our room was clean, with pretty furnishings and linens. On the downside, internet in your room will set you back $12.95/day (standard for most of the LV hotels), and if you want free internet you can sit in the smoke-filled lobby. Also, they only gave us 2 large towels and 2 small towels, which was a bit chintzy. The room doesn’t come w/ a microwave or fridge, just fyi. As a tip, there’s a nice Whole Foods Market just 2min down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great value.”
Reviews.Author: Fraulein1020
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times. My parents visit Vegas often and they have had several extended stays here and always enjoy it. Great value, good service. There is a Steak & Shake, a bowling alley, and movie theaters. If you have a car it is very conveniently located to the strip. Great entertainment with the Spazmatics on Saturday nights is a fun dance-worthy outing.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Smurf52
Reviews.Content: I had to stay an extra night in Vegas and wanted something cheap and nice. My cab driver recommended South Point. Although it is off the strip, they provide a shuttle service to various spots on the strip for $8 a day. (Beats a $30 cab ride) Huge room for the price and just as nice as anything on the strip. I thought the bed was fine. If you eat at the Oyster Bar, definitely try the clams with the white wine appetizer. Delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Good place away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: nuggetboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed a 7 night stay over the Christmas holidays at South Point. It was our third stay at the hotel. The hotel is a considerable distance from the strip and any other casino. There are no outside restaurants within walking distance so I would not recommend the place unless you have a car. The rooms at SP are over sized. The property is only 5 years old and everything is still in very good condition. Each room comes with a large flat screen TV, a safe and a coffee maker. The bathrooms are large with an outside sink/dressing area from the shower/toilet room. Some reviewers noted a smokey smell on a no smoking floor. I did not have that experience other than one day when a person was walking down the hall smoking. As noted in other reviews, you must walk through the casino to get to the rooms. Parking is also a good distance from the rooms. If you have trouble getting around, this may not be a good choice for you. The place has several good restaurants. The buffet is only average. I would suggest the Mexican or Steakhouse. The cafe also serves great Chinese food. For quicker meals they have a deli that serves huge sandwiches (the pastrami is excellent) and a Steak and Shake burger place (always crowded). There seafood place was also always crowded with lots of people eating the chowder. I meant to try some but never did. The pool is fair sized but simple. They do have a large outside hot tub similar to the one at the Orleans (circular with a little island in the middle). You can get to the pool and the spa without walking through the casino. We do love the spa here. If you are staying, you can get a three day pass for only $45. I real bargain in my book. The spa has a sauna, steam room, waterfall massage, cooling pool and hot tub. The facility is clean and well equipped. Upon arrival they provide you with water sandals, and a locker. In the locker is a nice robe to wear in the facility. I did find it interesting that most of the younger men wore bathing suits while engaging in activities while most of the over 55 crowd went naked. I thought it would be the other way around. After you have relaxed you can go into the lounge area where they have fruit juice, coffee, etc. with a large screen TV and several over stuffed loungers. Very nice place to hang out and watch a game. I would highly recommend trying out the spa during your stay. We love to stay at SP because it has everything we need. It has a huge on-site bingo parlor, a bowling alley, a huge movie complex and an active poker room. The slot machines are pretty loose and they are very good with comps at they tables. I played BJ for about an hour and half on Christmas Eve and they comped our Christmas dinner at the cafe. I was betting $5-10 at a $5 table and actually came out ahead. We hope to return to SP on our next trip. One last thing, they do not charge a resort fee and even though they don't seem to advertize it anywhere, they have free wireless service at the Seattle's Best cafe and the check in area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Business and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: LadyDi_and_Cowman
Reviews.Content: We stayed for business since we were doing a Holiday Craft Show. It was very convenient for us, and easy to park, leave our car, etc. The rooms are very nice - big screen tv, little couch, king size bed, safe and nice bathrooms. We were very pleased for the price. The Casino was fun after work, and good drink prices at all the bars. We ate twice at the Oyster bar...Great deal on Yummy Crab Legs! It is a bit far from the Strip but they do have shuttle service, if you need....however we didn't leave the hotel. We would definately stay at the South Point again.

Reviews.Title: “"Not impressed"”
Reviews.Author: sojourner999
Reviews.Content: We found the South Point via TripAdvisor when a previous hotel we had arranged was not available. I looked it up using the TripAdvisor app for my Android phone. The price seemed competitive and the reviews were good. Overall, the hotel room was extremely clean and large. We had two queens and were easily able to accommodate our family of 5. I have just a few bigger complaints. For one, the bellman's service was very poor. It took us more than 30 minutes to have the bags brought from the car to the room. We came in late and were tired and it is difficult when the kids were so tired. Secondly, they were inconsistent in information. The woman at the desk told us that they would not put a cot in for one of our children but when we asked again from the room they did so. One reviewer mentioned the smoking and I agree that there was a lot of smoking between the front door and the elevators to the rooms. You HAVE To go through the casino to get to those elevators. Ideally, I guess it would be better not to have to subject the kids to that but no choice in this case. There is a buffett for morning breakfast but on weekends it's 15 dollars for the brunch. We got two 1/2-off coupons but there was no discount for kids, so it would have been a lot of money for breakfast. So we chose to have coffee and a pastry at the coffee place at the entrance to the hotel/casino. Overall, it was just an average experience. It seemed to me that if I had paid about $100.00 for the room I would have been more satisfied that I got my money's worth. If you have to be here, it's ok, seems safe, very clean place. But it's not a "value" and I wouldn't choose ahead of time to stay here as a place to save money for a trip or to get a "Vegas experience". Also, they are at least a 15 minute drive from the "Strip". Keep that in mind when you are planning your stay. Oh - one other thing. If you use Google's voice command to find the hotel, the software has an address that is incorrect and Google Navigation will direct you to some place about 15 miles away from the hotel. I had to call the hotel and get the proper address to enter into my Android phone to navigate to it properly. The people at the hotel also seemed young and had a bit of a hard time giving directions! (I think everyone is getting used to GPS!). So be sure you have the proper address of the hotel/casino when you are navigating there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lonnie C
Reviews.Content: Ventlation could have been better (somewhat smoky, as others have noted and we visited during a horse show - throughout the common areas you could kind of smell horse). However, our room was spacious and updated, the staff was pleasant, and the room was clean. We did not eat at the buffet, but dined for several meals at the lobby restaurant which was good, reasonably priced, and with good service. There is a western/horse theme to the restaurant and an impressive arena attached to the hotel. We did not gamble so cannot rate the casino aspect. We rented a car and could always find parking in the ramp. We found it close enough to the strip for our intent which was mainly sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to brag about”
Reviews.Author: skymouse
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on very good reviews on Trip Advisor But in my opinion South Point does not stand out Newer hotel but lacks character Very long walk , not very convenient parking Beds are too stiff , pillows the same Buffet food very average , almost bland in relation to price You add 7 more bucks and you can have gorgeous breakfast buffet in Bellagio or Paris On our way back we decided stay at Tuscany Inn and Suites which was hell of lot better choice This hotel is quite away from main drag Summing up mid level experience

Reviews.Title: “Return Trip - Enjoyed our 5 days”
Reviews.Author: ramonabare
Reviews.Content: We returned for a five day visit. We are aware this casino is off the strip and this is the reason we stay here. We rented a car from Fox Rental which is a mile from Southpoint and we enjoyed our time, bowling, movies, slots and the coupon book offers. It feels like we are on a cruise ship.. We had one nite with noisy party next door, we called the front desk.. Security was there within five minutes..We enjoy the tower with a vies of the mountains...Already planning a return trip...Plan ahead this is not a casino on the strip ...more to enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great value for an off-strip casino hotel”
Reviews.Author: lesilek48
Reviews.Content: My husband's family all live in the Las Vegas area so we have stayed at numerous hotels both on the strip and off. We were really looking to stay at a casino property close to Henderson. My DH had stay at South Point last year but it was my first encounter. I was able to negotiate a very good deal on a one bedroom suite as we had recieved some great deals on some of the newer properties on the strip and asked the reseveration manager if they would match (which they did). I really liked the fact that South Point offered many decent restaurant choices at much lower prices than many of the strip properties. From check in to check out we experienced very friendly and helpful staff. The only negative was the valet staff and opertation. It was under staffed by very indifferent employees and was rather disorganized. It was the only area that we felt fell short of an upscale strip casino/hotel. The one bedroom suite was spotless and provided plenty of room for the two of us. Very nice bathroom with both a large soaking tub and beautiful granite shower. Casino had lots of choices of penny slots and lower minimum black jack tables. We are not big gamblers but enjoy spending a little time on the slots and found them to be a bit "looser" as with many of the casinos that are frequented by locals. I have a real problem with cigarette smoke and did not find it a problem in any part of the hotel or casino. We really enjoyed the Don Vito's Italian restaurant and ended up eating there twice. Also enjoyed the Mexican restuarant. Coronado Cafe and buffet were adaquate, nothing special. Much preferred the buffet at the M Hotel but it was considerably more expensive. Over all an enjoyable stay and we will return. I still recommend a strip property for people's first time in Vegas as there is something to be said for being in the thick of things, but for folks that wants a more laid back experience and save a bit a money than I would not hesitate to recommend the South Point.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Hotel&Over Rated!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kim L
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a low-mid level travels( NOT a 4 star hotel), it's clean&spacious but awful smell of smoke as soon as you walk in and you can't avoid it because you have to walk a long length of the casino to get to the elevator. If you have kids, PLEASE DON'T STAY HERE...It's also quite away from the strip, there is shuttle bus but there is a catch, it's $8/person round trip to strip( plus waiting time to be pick up at a certain time& certain area/hotel) and $12.99/day for internet. If you add $8+$12.99 to the hotel price, it would be wiser to stay at the hotel on the strip that much better and more convenient. The worst food I ever had( we tried two restaurants), doesn't worth the $$$ we spent. If you want to stay here, a car is a must for your own convenient after all you're on vacation... It was one and done for us!!! better quality for the price on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KatieHU
Reviews.Content: We spent a few nights there in September. The hotel is away from the strip but there is a shuttle bus in every hour which takes you there. The hotel is huge, you can find lots of entertainment with a casino of course. Check-in&out was quick. We got a coupon leaflet with discounts at restaurants, bars, shops, cinemas there. The room was very big, beds so comfortable (the most comfortable we have ever slept on) with awsome pillows, beautiful mountain view. The bathroom is well equipped and super clean. The Mexican restaurant in the hotel was gorgeous. Malls, shopping outlets, car rental are nearby. The whole city was very well maintained and clean. We made trips to Hoover-Dam, Zion National Park and Grand Canyon from here.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: CARIBBEAN757
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Southpoint and been there to see a show and stayed elsewhere. It is a nice venue for the price. It is conveniently located and has the standard amenities. They have a shuttle to the strip and airport which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Customer Service & Cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: TrafficJamCeejay
Reviews.Content: This was a huge surprise. It's a massive hotel with movie theatres and an equestrian center. Great for families, reunions & any occasion. I'm always ready to pay big bucks for a great experience and I was surprised that I didn't have to. The rate was $35 a night for a 500 sq. ft. room with a breathtaking mountain view. Great drinks at the pool & the deli will blow you away. Go or it.

Reviews.Title: “it's ok”
Reviews.Author: Jordan Y
Reviews.Content: stayed here a few times, it's alright, nothing grand or spectacular as i would've expected (judging by exterior). pros: double door bathroom privacy, room pretty spacious & economical. cons: two measly flat pillows on beds (what's the deal with that? i could've sworn there were more pillows before), weak flusing toilet, no trash can near toilet (what's the deal with that?), and bad experience one time with casino manager (i think he was)- slot machine robbed us of points but casino manager wouldn't do anything to help us out.

Reviews.Title: “South Point Hotel Reunion September 29 - October 4”
Reviews.Author: smudgersdad286
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Las Vegas, but the first time at South Point. This was arranged through the Arellano University College of Nursing and Alumni Association of America Foundation CA. My wife and I stayed with relatives in San Marcus, we hired a vehicle and drove up to the South Point 29 September. The staff working in valet parking on arrival with the car advised me the procedures collecting the car and returning the car for parking. All staff we met were very professional and polite, The room was amazing large, clean just perfect for us. The food was absolutely fabulous , we hope to visit again next year and again when the next reunion is held there. Stewart & Leila England

Reviews.Title: “I Like South Point”
Reviews.Author: mtripguy
Reviews.Content: Rooms were $35 on their website.....stayed Sunday, Monday, and Tuesday......big rooms, very clean, and overall great stay.....a good place to go and relax without the crowds of the strip.....good food choices, bowling alley, and movie theatre......this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Cowboy Central at its Best”
Reviews.Author: Glee N
Reviews.Content: The South Point is by far the best hotel, casino, and eating establishment in all of Las Vegas. The rooms are very clean, the entire staff is VERY guest friendly, and they offer so many amenities. During the Wrangler NFR, it is the ONLY place to visit !!

Reviews.Title: “It all depends on what you want--and make sure you get a sale rate”
Reviews.Author: RichOrman
Reviews.Content: Before booking at the South Point, do your best to make sure that you get a sale rate on their website. They seem to put up a sale rate every month or so, and the sale is for five or so days. There is usually a 30% to 40% reduction, so it is worth trying to get the sale rate. If you book at a higher rate and you see a later sale, all you have to do is call up their reservations line and they will give you the lower rate. Regarding the hotel, either you need to plan on staying there pretty much exclusively or you need a car. All of my trips to the South point have been for a specific event and I have essentially stayed there for the entire time, and I have been very satisfied. The rooms are very modern and comfortable, and everything is very clean. The prices for the rooms and everything else at the SP are very reasonable, even at the casino store, which is pretty amazing. Usually Vegas casinos use the casino store as rip-off central, but at the SP they take a different philosophy and actually give you better prices on a lot of stuff than you would find at home. If found the liquor prices to be especially reasonable--cheaper than most liquor stores in the Denver metro area. If you want to spend lots of time on the strip or elsewhere, you pretty much will need a car.

Reviews.Title: “Hope to return to South Point!”
Reviews.Author: occasionaltraveler66
Reviews.Content: My first thought as I pulled in...this place is HUGE! Not that size = quality for a hotel, but. This place felt more like an all around convention center/destination resort instead of a Vegas casino hotel. I've been up and down the strip and old downtown. South Point has a definite edge in class compared to many other places in Vegas. Check-in folks were very pleasant and accommodating. They said to come back down and they'd print off our boarding passes for our flights, and we did. The rooms were big and very nice. Even the bathroom was big, with two rooms. We were on the 7th floor. Someone said to book above 6 and you'll have a view, but we still had wall. The whole color scheme of the place is yellow, gold, bronze and red, in case it matters to you. The room was quiet, the bed was comfortable. South Point has a movie theatre, a bingo room and a 64 lane bowling alley on the second floor. We went bowling after my man did well on video poker! That's the time to walk away. :) The bowling alley was in great condition and we had fun. There were some locals bowling the next lane and they were friendly. The casino wasn't as loud or smoky as others, it was roomy too. There were plenty of bar and restaurant options, and upon check-in, they gave us some very useful coupons. We were there on a Sunday night, about the only night of the week they have no live show available, so that was a little bummer. We were only there one night. You walk down one long hallway to get to the rooms. The other long hallway leads to the equestrian center. I accidentally turned down that hallway once. Imagine my surprise that as I was walking by their open Coronado Cafe I was smelling horse manure. If you live on a horse farm, that might not bother you. But we decided not to eat at the Coronado Cafe based on that. Later we saw some spots of manure on the carpet coming from the equestrian center that someone had obviously stepped in and was tracking around. Generally, South Point was very clean. Service was fine. The whole buffet/club member thing was annoying. They advertised two prices for their buffet, one club member, one non. That would imply you don't have to be a club member to eat at the buffet, right? Wrong. At the register we were told we needed to go someplace else and get our club card before we could eat there. That took awhile, and I was not happy about being cornered into joining their club. I had no intention to gamble, so had no reason to join their club. Now I'm on another list, and spam from Vegas is likely in my future. I guess we'll see how much they spam me. Right now, I'd like to go back, but that could change.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: hotela2z
Reviews.Content: Of course you can find fancier hotels in Vegas, but even if you are a millionaire and don't want to throw away your money, this is a excellent option. A good hotel for an excellent price. The bedroom are OK and bigger than average. The food prices are fantastic. You can have a breakfast buffet for seven dollars (like the good old days in Vegas). It is very convenient the movie complex inside the hotel. If staying in the core of the strip is a matter to you, this is not your hotel. It's far from the strip, but if have a car this is not a problem at all; the hotel is very close to the freeway and getting there is a matter of minutes. The only thing I didn't like is the mattress cover they use in the beds. I think is something to avoid wetness and stains, but it is very uncomfortably. For two nights I did not sleep very well until I found out what was disturbing me. So I recommend when you get here ask the maid to take it out. I hope someday they will offer free internet in the bedrooms but while they don't, there is free internet in the lobby (if you have your own computer). The spa facilities are very nice with sauna, steam, jacuzzi, a "massaging" water cascade and nice chairs were you can rest or take a nap (many hotel in vegas don't have a resting area where you can lie down). And a confortable lounge too. So, maybe you are not in the "world of luxury", but for sure you are going to be in a hotel that has everything with very reasonable prices. And they don't charge for that infamous resort fee like most hotels here in Vegas. So,from now on, this is my "new home" in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Can not believe how they treated my friend?”
Reviews.Author: Severina111273
Reviews.Content: We went to a Christmas Party the other night, the heat in the room did not work right it was very cold in the suite and we tried watching tv while talking and it kept freezing up. When my friend the host complained about it, they sent him an email accusing him of essentially being a liar, how can he being lying with more then 12 witnesses. The hotel directors response was horrible and she should probably get into trouble for such a rude email. My friend who comes to Vegas frequently and has always stayed at South Point told me he will never stay there again. Most unfortunate in this economy in Las Vegas not to put your customer first.

Reviews.Title: “NFR Vegas”
Reviews.Author: debiallmon
Reviews.Content: South Point is a bit out there away from a lot of things but it does have the advantage of the roping arena and after the rodeo events. A good place to call home after the rodeo and a good place to visit with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Too many operational issue quickly becoming a below average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Hadleyhodgkin
Reviews.Content: After my last stay resulted in me cancelling because of their poor customer service I chose to give South Point another chance. Weird night at South Point, the heater in my room stopped working and it was freezing,my internet logged me off twice. I called room service and the phone hung up twice while placing my order, and now my TV is on freeze frame, plays for a few minutes and then freezes up. They are sending an engineer up to check it out, I hope they are recording these instances so they dont think its me. The engineer checked it and said the system has been freezing up at late night and he would call cox cable. Again very prompt and friendly but I am beginning to feel like it was unwise for me to stay here. Day Two the heater is still not working right I have to turn it up to 82 to get any heat or it turns the air conditioner on, the internet is still intermittent but the maid did a great job cleaning. After being loyal and faithful since this place opened I think this will be my last stay here. The service was decent but when you are on vacation you just don't want to deal with all the broken operational issues.

Reviews.Title: “What Las Vegas used to be....”
Reviews.Author: jimmylikes2eatmore
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a $500 a night hotel to tell all your friends you stayed there, this isn't the place. However, if you want SOLID value, clean & comfortable surroundings, awesome yet oh-so-reasonably-priced food...this is your place. Years ago, before Las Vegas went all high-end, catering to the non-gambling nightclub set, you could come to this town & stay without breaking the bank, including the food bill. Perhaps the gaming supported the food operation more back then? Anyhow, the old "value oriented" Las Vegas is exactly what Southpoint is today. You always leave here feeling you got a great bang for your buck. If you're a gambler, there aren't many better options in town than the spacious casino offered here, with some of the best slots, tables, poker, and video poker found in Las Vegas..period. Some of the "high limits" machines were a little dissapointing (I play a lot of video poker), but for the average visitor, you won't find a better bet. All the restaurants offer their own personality, and all are a great value for the $$. Even the buffet (and I do NOT do buffets often) is pretty darned good. On Monday's they feature NY Strip steak on the buffet (and countless other items)....for about $15 - INCLUDING your coke, tea, etc....Stay at the hotel, and there's a 50% off coupon....couple that with your players card and you get a great steak buffet for about $7....crazy good! They have a great steakhouse - Vito's is awesome for Italian, and the Mexican restaurant is a winner as well - try the fajitas - good stuff! Oh - the Coronado Cafe - can't forget it - great 24 hour Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner - with some incredible "late night" specials (about $3 for NY Strip & Eggs.....mmmm!) If you play much, comps are not hard to come by - they treat you really well here. Point in fact my last 2 trips I never left the property all 4-5 days....that says alot with all the casinos & things available in Las Vegas.... Keep in mind I've been to town 100+ times, so I've seen all the places....but I've definitely settled on Southpoint as being "the one". There is a shuttle to the strip - available for just $8 as well, if decide to travel out a bit....the strip is a couple miles north on the same road as Southpoint. Southpoint Management take note: Please don't change a thing....well, ok, maybe some down pillows - but nothing else! Did I mention the killer 1/2# burger at the deli?... had one every day! (time to hit the treadmill!

Reviews.Title: “Question high ratings”
Reviews.Author: Ron O
Reviews.Content: My non-smoking room had been smoked in by prior guests and the floor was seriously smoky--hard to make it to the elevator. Staff was un-pleasant and un-helpful. Access to anywhere off-site was expensive due to distance--cab fare ran about $60 round-trip to closest destinations (something to think about when you think you are saving money to stay here). Restaurants were average--non that you would go back to in a city you lived in (unless you lived in a mostly franchise area-heaven forbid). Beds not up to snuff compared to most of today's hotels and the two pillows were large, hard foam. Old style bath tub with shower and curtain. You would only give a high rating if you were used to staying in fairly cheap hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for NFR fans”
Reviews.Author: LoyalPacker
Reviews.Content: A little far off the strip - but worth it. Great amenities, comfortable beds, rooms are quiet, valet is quick and lots of restaurant choices. Hotel operated free shuttle to/from airport and offered $8 shuttle to the strip all day long. We were there for National Finals Rodeo and staff was very accomodating to all the committee needs. Banquets were handled beautifully and staff was friendly. Only disappointment was that they charge $15 per person per day to use work out facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Greg S
Reviews.Content: My fiancee' and I spent 4 days/nights at South Point in early November 2011 for a relative's wedding. Had an absolute BLAST!! We had one of the basic rooms on the 23rd floor which was clean and well appointed with a decent view of the mountains. Honestly we didn't plan to spend much time IN the room so we didn't upgrade. Plenty to do just at this hotel. Plenty of choices for food also from inexpensive up to fine dining. Loved having a Steak n' Shake in the casino. Ate there at least 4 times!! The Coronado Cafe had pretty good food for really cheap but you paid as much for a soda or cup of coffee as you did for most meals. I ordered a ham sandwich and a slice of cheese cake at the DelMar Deli (also in the casino). There was probably the better part of a pound of ham on the sandwich and the cheese cake was the best I'd had in a long time. This eatery was a little pricy compaired to Steak n' Shake but worth the money. I'm not too much of a gambler but I was able to spend quite a few hours at the $1 dollar roulette tables with out hurting my wallet too badly. Checked out the Indian National Finals Rodeo in the hotel's equestrian center. Pretty sweet setup. Caught a few frames of the Pro Bowler's tour at their bowling alley. Also a pretty sweet setup. Listened to an 80's band for a while at their in house club. Quality entertainment...sounded AWESOME! Didn't have time to hit the pool, movie theater or much else at this MONSTEROUS facility as we hit the strip pretty hard each day/night but there is enough to keep you busy for several days JUST at this hotel. Aside from, IMHO some really lousy and uncomfortable bed pillows, my ONLY real complaint was the distance from the strip. You either had to wait and pay to take a shuttle from the hotel, have a rental car or pay the rediculous Vegas cab fees... like $3 and something for the first 1/13th mile and a fair amount of change for each 1/13th mile after that. How the heck do you measure a 13th of a mile anyway?? It probably costs $5 bucks just to get out of the parking lot. I heard someone say it was twenty some dollars for a one way cab to the strip. Of the three transportation choices, it's probably cheapest AND most convienant to just get an inexpensive rental car. They do have a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel which is nice but I'll be getting a car at the airport next time. If you don't need Ceasar's Palace's luxury and you're looking for a good time, a great value for your $$$ and you don't mind NOT being able to just walk out of your hotel and be on the strip,... and you bring your own pillow... South Point is hard to beat!! I can't wait to come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: BADUGIS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at south point for the first time....A little far from the strip but besides that, everything was great...The valet and check in was real easy and friendly..The room was really nice...Nothing crazy, but lots of room...Big Bingo hall, cheap limits on the table games, good sports book....a very nice hotel overall, specially for the price...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel way at the end”
Reviews.Author: jujubiee
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Southpont a few times and decided to try it for a couple nights for a recent trip. Now the last 2 times the hotel was overun with kids. When sports tournaments are in town it seems all the kid teams stay here or something. This time was fine and very quiet. The buffet has gone downhill some. The room is nice and large. Great Flat screen. Nice bathroom. The beds are very comfortable. The casino is huge and plenty of variety of machines. This hotel is very family oriented and has a great movie theatre. Of course the drawback is where the hotel is situated at the very end. However we find that once we check in we rarely need to go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Restaurants, Rooms and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: onegadfly101
Reviews.Content: South Point is located on Las Vegas Blvd, a few miles from Mandalay Bay. The rooms are clean and modern with large flat screen TVs.( I had a problem with my shower and it was fixed in twenty minutes from the call.) I love everything about this hotel, from the Casino, to the Restaurants. It has a very nice buffet and coffee shop. The latter serves Chinese food at all hours as well as American Entrees. It is not as glitzy as the larger strip hotels, but has amenties such as movie theaters, bowling, and a Rodeo venue.

Reviews.Title: “Always a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hula324
Reviews.Content: This past November 2011, my mother helped me celebrate my birthday in Las Vegas, it has become an annual event, to celebrate my birthday in Las Vegas, and this year, I had two free nights at South Point Hotel, Casino and Spa. As always, the room was clean and neat. When we arrived and had dinner, my mom enjoys a real good steak, we had dinner had Primarily Prime Rib on the second floor of the casino. Our dinner was fantastic. She had a prime rib and I had the two medallions. There were two draw backs, the air condition was on in the room and it was difficult to reset the temperature, we had to leave and come back and secondly, the tub was slow to drain and when I turned the shower on, the faucet in the tub also ran. I received a wonderful gift of having a massage in the spa, Costa del Sur, it was wonderful. The spa was clean and had great amenities. I, especially liked the pineapple shower. Each shower had their own scented shampoo, conditioner and body wash. It's not often I have a male masseuse, and Brian was great! I gauge my massage experience if I fall asleep and I was able to do that this time.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the hectic strip”
Reviews.Author: Sigirl33
Reviews.Content: While I like the strip, sometiems you just want to get away from it. This is a nice alternative. It's about 15minutes away from the strip if you jump back on the 15 and head North. I like the South Point for the built-in movie theatre, bowling alley, sports room, plenty of tables and easy layout. We spent Thanksgiving here and ate at the Silverado restaurant and it was amazing. Good place for a simple weekend with family.

Reviews.Title: “Food poisoning in buffet - terrible casino response.”
Reviews.Author: citysightseeing2010
Reviews.Content: Both of my kids got food poisoning from the buffet. Both were up all night. I asked for some crackers in the morning and was told to make a security report. The front desk was no more helpful. Restaurant manager was rude and showed zero remorse.

Reviews.Title: “A sad Thanksgiving Day.”
Reviews.Author: shorty0089
Reviews.Content: The room and staff were excellent like always, only this time the buffet personnel refused to honor our coupons. We stay at South Point several times a year and save our coupon books for this trip, last year we had a great time with our family at the Garden Buffet, and, they honored our coupons last year. This year after waiting in line for 40 mins. got to the register only to be told they would not honor the coupon. This information was not posted anyplace and it is not written on the coupons which I still have. There are no blackout dates stated anywhere on the booklet. Instead of paying 17.00 each for lunch, we had .75 cent hotdogs from the little casino stand. If I knew ahead of time, I would have rescheduled my trip for another day and stayed home and cooked for the family.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: hhbartman
Reviews.Content: Clearly, you get what you pay for and we were able to secure a large, clean room mid week via hot wire for $40 per night. Yes, you are indeed "off the strip" but the shuttle is pretty efficient and is a pretty good deal at $8 for the entire day and not every time you ride it. The other thing that many reviewers complained about is the $13 per day internet fee. Cmon folks, $40 for a nice room and youre b*****n about that? Simply take your laptop down to the lobby!. The on site store had extremly fair prices for beer, booze, sundries and there is a convenience store a couple blocks away where you can buy a cheap styrofoam cooler should you want to keep drinks cold (no fridges in room). Food is cheap at buffets and plentiful, and cafeteria quality.Best deal in town is the after 12pm specials for like $4....... 2 eggs hash browns, toast, ham........ good qualits and fast. Casino not too smokey, pool looked nice as did fitness center. All and all would certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great room.”
Reviews.Author: gallo1978
Reviews.Content: Nice place, good location. Room new and clean. Flat screen tv...I think at least 50". Food less than average, eat somewhere else. The only problem I had, while staying, was next door neighbor. Some retarded lady screamed all night about social justice(???). Have no idea what happened to her.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keyself
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. It is about 10 minutes from the strip which is why we liked it. The staff was nice and helpful and we only got to eat at Baja Miguel's restaurant which was very good. The rooms were huge and the bed was comfortable. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “everything is there”
Reviews.Author: rpolito2004
Reviews.Content: i was there sept 2010 and july 2010 very hot but dry heat but all the hotels are air conditioned also we rent a car every time we go to vegas don vitos resturant excellent, coronados cafe very good also, not crazy about the buffett. rooms in the hotel big 500 sq feet flat panel tv's and comfortable beds highly recomend this hotel. plenty off table games and slots. they have a movie theatre, bowling alley, and billiard room. nice pool and jacuzzi. nice pool and jacuzzi

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to have a convention”
Reviews.Author: wduren
Reviews.Content: I attended a convention for 5 days in October. The room was on the fourth floor and had a view of the casino wall. The view was horrid, but the room was quite nice and comfortable. Usually there is always a tobacco smoke smell in casino hotels. I didn't have any hint of smoke in this smoke free room. The price of 55$ per night made the room about the best deal in Vegas. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The food that the hotel provided for the convention was excellent. Access to the freeways and the strip was easy. The only down point is it is a few miles from the Strip. However, if you want to be away from the crowds, this hotel fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: LisaLS
Reviews.Content: Everything is dirt cheap here. Its quite a ways from the strip, but it does have restaurants and all sorts of entertainment wrapped into one. You do miss out on the glitz and nightlife of Vegas while you are here, but it is a great place to stay if you are wanting to relax and go shopping at the outlets because traffic and parking is much better out here. Gambling is cheap and it is better ventilated than most casinos. Our room was clean and comfortable, pretty much what i was looking for in a short weekend trip away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel but Definitely Not the Right Fit For Me”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler1983
Reviews.Content: The South Point Hotel, Casino and Spa is a perfect hotel for one who would like to find an off-strip, cowboy themed property. Personally, since this is not exactly the type of hotel I would pick, my score is based on my personal preferences. I stayed at this hotel in November of 2011 as part of a convention. Pros 1. Really, large rooms and bathrooms. 2. Relatively new hotel (though by the look of it, this hotel needs to total renovation). 3. Great front desk staff (but the meeting sales staff left a lot to be desired). 4. Inexpensive room service (though the delivery time leaves a lot to be desired). 5. Off strip (if this is what you're looking for) 6. Equestrian Center (if this is a necessity for you) 7. Good meeting space (most on a single level) Cons: 1. This has to be the smokiest hotel I have ever been to in my entire LIFE. While most casino hotels allow smoking on the casino floor, the smell of the smoked traveled well beyond the casino space. My non-smoking room was on the 22nd floor and still, the smell of the smoke traveled through the vents into my room. My nose and throat were literally burning from the smoke. This issue alone will assure that I won't voluntarily stay at this hotel again. 2. While I am not a big TV watcher, this hotel has extremely, extremely limited TV options. The food at several of the restaurants I tried was lousy and not cheap. 3. Security. I am a seasoned traveler who does a great deal of traveling alone. For some reason, I was extremely unfcomrtable in regards to my safety at this hotel. While most Las Vegas casino properties have a million plain clothing and uniformed security officers patrolling the hotel non-stop, I didn't have the impression that this hotel had the same. One night, I got to the 22nd floor where my room was located and there was a rather grungy looking man asleep in a chair in the hall near my room. Three hours later, he was still there. Also, a lot of the hotels I have stayed in either have security near the elevators to whom you must show your room key or require use of the room key in the elevators to access the sleeping room floors. This hotel had a sign that one needed to show their room key to the security officer but there was no security officer in site over the 6 days I stayed at the hotel. 4. Bedding. All of the beds in this place have a plastic cover on them. In all of my travels, I have never encountered a matress with a plastic cover on it in a hotel room. It made sleeping uncomfortable, hot and noisy. The mattress it self was very uncomfortable in my upgraded room. I could feel the springs and so I didn't sleep very much over the 6 nights I was there. 5. Restaurants. This hotel leaves a lot to be desired in regards to restaurants. They have the standard Las Vegas Buffet, a couple of steak houses, and other sorts of restaurants (i.e. an Oyster Bar?!) but in terms of quick service take-out establishments, your options are Steak N Shake and an extremely overpriced coffee shop. Given that the area surrounding the hotel is somewhat desolate, this lack of options for a quick meal was very disappointing. 6. Service. The front desk staff was nice and attentive. The bell desk staff was a little snarky. The business center guy was great. My biggest issue was with the sales staff. There is a gentleman (who will remain anonymous) in the sales office who was a complete jerk and unhelpful. For the amount of money my event poured into this hotel (no less than $60,000), I would have expected a little more attention, kindness and willingness to cooperate. This is hands down one of the worst convention service staffs that I have ever worked with in my career. Overall, I will give this hotel an average rating. It is not a horrible hotel but it just wasn't my cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Nice escape from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Kathy M
Reviews.Content: After having spent several nights on the Strip and an overnight trip to the Grand Canyon, we wanted something a little bit quieter for our last couple nights in Vegas Got a terrific rate for Sunday-Tues stay via a popular website (no bidding), and the clerk gave us a beautiful spacious king suite room on the 20th floor with a magnificent view of the city and strip. This is a huge facility - it's a long walk from the parking garage to registration through the casino to registration, and only one set of elevators for the hotel, so if you're averse to walking, this isn't the place for you. But the noise and smoke level are less than other places we visited, and while we didn't take advantage, they have a bowling alley, movie theatre and bingo on site, along with the spa, of course. We had dinner at the Coronado Cafe, which was just average. Broke even on the slots, but we don't play much, so don't expect to win much either. It's a convenient trip to the airport and easy access to freeways to other parts of town. This was our first trip to Vegas - South Point will probably be on our list of places to stay if we choose to make a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel & Casino are great!”
Reviews.Author: rhatfield
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Point on Nov. 9th for only one night, but wish it had been more. Even though this hotel is rather far south on the Strip, it is worth traveling to. We had friends who were staying at the time share (Grandview) next door, so it was convenient for us. We had not problem at check-in. Got there early but were able to check in right away & get into our room. The room was quite large with a nice big flat-screen TV on the wall. We had 2 queens and still plenty of space in the room. The bathroom was also quite large with a separate room for the potty and tub, which is a personal preference for me & you don't find it too often. The casino is also quite nice. Easy to find your way around. Not so huge that you get lost all the time. The buffet was very good & quite reasonable. The cafe menu was quite good AND the food was good. There is also a Steak & Shake inside for quick, smaller meals. All in all a great place to stay and play.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, lousy service Coronado Cafe, Wi-Fi not included in room”
Reviews.Author: IslandLubber
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Point while attending the Indian Finals Rodeo. The rooms are spacious and neat and we loved the toilet/shower being separate from the bathroom vanity. The buffet had excellent food. The Coronado Cafe? Different story. Long waits to be seated, to get your order taken, and to get your food. My steak was ordered med-well. It arrived half well-done, half medium rare. Previously, we loved the margaritas at Baja Miguels. This trip, the drinks were very watered down. Also, it felt like they keep the garage elevators about 90 degrees below the outside temperature. One major problem was the SMELL from the Horse Arena. We could smell it from the Gaming/Restaurant area and the dust did bother our respiratory systems. Even though they charge a RESORT FEE, wi-fi is NOT INCLUDED in the rooms (additional charge for that service). Wi-fi is available in the lobby free.

Reviews.Title: “Smokey, Low Class, and Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: J B
Reviews.Content: South Point Hotel should be a nice place to stay, gamble (if you do), and relax a little bit but unfortunately it's not. First of all, this hotel is one of the smokiest 'newer' hotels I have ever been in. Not as bad as the El Cortez but it is certainly going down that path. If you have any sensitivities to smoke at all I recommend you do not step foot in this place. I stayed on the 16th floor and I could smell smoke all the way into my room. It burned my eyes and nose. The customer service is certainly lacking at best. Check in was efficient but the clerk was detached and bored looking - as was everyone else. The second night I returned home from work around 6 PM and wanted to turn on the TV. I'm by no means a big Television watcher but enjoy zoning out for 30 minutes or so by watching the news after a long, stressful day at work before I do some reading. Unfortunately, the television would not turn on. I called the front desk and was put on hold for about 3 minutes. When they finally answered the front desk agent was curt and said they would send an engineer up and immediately hung up the phone. Seriously? 30 minutes later no one had arrived and I wanted to go down to get some dinner but had to wait for the engineer. I called again, was put on hold for a few minutes again, and was told the same detached answer as before and was immediately hung up on. 45 minutes later... no one, 60 minutes later I finally call again and was finally listened to for more than 5 seconds. Well, 5 minutes later an engineer came up. He looked at the TV and went back downstairs to flip a breaker...This solved the problem but over 1.5 hours had passed. The food at several of the restaurants I tried was lousy and not cheap. Another thing is the people that this place tends to attract. They are some of the sloppiest, grossest looking people I have seen to date. I mean, is this pretty standard for las vegas? Shaved heads, tatoos, pants down to your knees, cigarette dangling out of their mouth. These people are unbelievable. I won't even make eye contact with anyone from this place. All of the beds in this place have a plastic cover on them. From looking at the crowd that frequents this place I would expect they often have to deal with soiled sheets and mattresses. GROSS! Between the extreme smoke in this place, the crappy service, and the extremely sleazy and depressing crowd I have no reason to ever go back to this place. Count me out!

Reviews.Title: “A Different Journey in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: billaggie
Reviews.Content: If you've been to Vegas again and again, the strip begins to wear you down. South Point is an excellent little oasis just a mile or so past the beloved "Welcome to Las Vegas" sign. South Point is its own little city. Bowling alleys, movie theatres, a bingo hall... plus a large and friendly casino. The Friday night seafood buffet equals any in Vegas and is under twenty dollars (if you get a club card) twenty-two if not. The Prime Rib restaurant has the best Prime Rib on the Strip, inches thick and under thirty bucks. The race book is Caesar's like. The rooms are very good (the one weird knock is that there is plastic under the bedsheet---still a minor tic). Great room service options!---But finally, after having been to Vegas annually over two decades, I found that there was everything I needed for gambling, food, and entertainment. If you still crave the 'bright lights, big city' glitz...probably not the place for you. But if you're just coming for the essence of a great vegas vacation...you want to check this place out!

Reviews.Title: “VERY UNpleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: bcgirl62
Reviews.Content: Our first error was choosing this hotel. We had a different hotel booked much closer to The Strip but it was much more expensive and we thought "it's just one night and the reviews look pretty good, so we may as well save some money and stay at the South Point". The reservation was prepaid with an online booking agency so getting a refund when were there wasn't possible. BIG MISTAKE! The first room assigned to us after a lengthy line-up at registration was on the 4th floor. When we opened the curtains we found a view of a cement wall - I guess the parking garage - approximately 30 feet away. We called down and were offered a "view room" for $10 additional, or a "strip view room" for $20 additional. We opted for the view room and waited 15 minutes for the bell boy to bring us our new keys and show us to our new room. The room we now had on the 21st floor did have a much nicer view facing the pool and riding ring. It still had the same shabby, dated look of the room on the 4th floor, but "it's just one night". We had a hard time seeing any qualities in our room that would merit a 4-star rating however with it's worn and filthy carpets and cheap linens. My husband left to go get our luggage while I waited up in our room. We have traveled extensively, staying in anything from 3 star to 5 star accommodations. But we have NEVER stayed in a hotel where it was abundantly obvious the bathroom had not been cleaned. There was feces in the toilet, which was completely disgusting. I called and asked for housekeeping to come and clean the bathroom ASAP and also asked for 3 extra pillows to be sent up. Ten minutes later, someone delivered 2 pillows and promised to come back with a third (he never did), but still no housekeeping. In the meantime, my husband had returned with all of our luggage and we wanted to put some things in the safe and leave, so we could take in some of the sights on The Strip. The safe door was closed and he was unable to open it. Another call was placed to have a maintenance man come and fix this. We waited 15 minutes and a maintenance man did come but he was unable to open the safe, telling us that someone would have to come and physically break the door off the safe. This would be another delay - at least 15 minutes for someone to come, and another 15-30 minutes to repair the door. We had electronics with us we did not want exposed to the rain (which they would be if they were carried in our backpack), so we decided to go downstairs and have our boarding passes printed while we were waiting. That took 20 minutes and when we returned to our room, the safe was still not repaired. We waited another 10 minutes and had just decided to take everything with us when there was a knock on the door, a different maintenance man this time. He rolled his eyes when we told him the first man had told us the door needed to be removed. He produced some sort of electronic device which had our safe door open and functioning within a couple of minutes. So, we locked up our electronics and left to spend 5 hours on the strip thinking all would be well when we returned. When we returned, it was obvious the toilet still had not been cleaned. My husband had flushed the feces away, but there were still urine marks on the rim. This time I called and spoke to a manager and told her all the things that had happened during our brief stay. She promised to get someone from housekeeping up right away, and offered us a $25 food credit and agreed to remove the $10 "upgrade" cost. The housekeeper came and cleaned our bathroom and finished around 10:30 p.m. We decided to order room service for breakfast to use our food credit. But, we could not fin a hotel information binder anywhere in the room. Yet another call brought us a binder 15 minutes later. We placed the order and finally got some sleep. Breakfast arrived perfectly punctually at 9 a.m. Unfortunately, all of the food was barely warm. We had order a $16 entree to share and added a cup of tea and a glass of orange juice. It turned out the tea was $5 and the OJ another $6 (for one glass). Add a mandatory $4 gratuity, a $2 service charge and tax and our bill became $34. Again disappointed but to worn out to complain again. We paid our bill and simply left, never to return again. Our mistake was choosing this hotel, thinking it could meet the needs of someone simply wanting a modern and clean well-appointed room. We're not gamblers or drinkers or equestrians, so our time in the hotel was actually spent in our room. And it fell very short of what we had expected.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great amenities”
Reviews.Author: Bernie1903
Reviews.Content: We loved out stay at South Point. Clean and nice, the rooms were comfortable and roomy. Wonderful pool, great restaurants. We didn't even bother with the LV strip.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk”
Reviews.Author: Elaine M
Reviews.Content: I stopped at S.Point for a bit of gambling and asked at the front desk if I could find an internet service to print out my boarding pass for the next day and the clerk said she would do it for me. How nice was that? Never had it happen before, not even in hotels where I was staying. (And there is always a fee).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: bobbyb09
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's about 5-6 miles south of the main Strip, but they have nice size rooms, comfy beds, and great people manning the tables in the casino. This has been our choice for Vegas for the last five years and with fair comps, I see no reason to change. The Silverado Steakhouse, Primarily Prime Rib, Don Vito's, and Baja Miguels restaurants are all excellent and reasonably priced. It helps to have a car if you want to venture to other places but there is not much need to go anywhere else to eat. And don't miss the 75 cent hot dogs at the cart by the sports book.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Comfy as I remembered”
Reviews.Author: Tara360
Reviews.Content: We just returned from South Point in Las Vegas. We stayed on a Saturday night and ended up paying $100 for the night. The room was large and clean, but the bed and pillows were not that comfortable. I found the mattress to be a little hard. We had stayed here a couple of years ago and I thought it was more comfortable then. The Steak and Shake restaurant in the the lobby was fantastic. Great burgers and amazing shakes!

Reviews.Title: “Your choice”
Reviews.Author: dee b
Reviews.Content: I was not happy paying for internet $13 day. Everything is very expensive and you are long way and I mean a long way from the strip. I wish I had known that I would have pick a hotel much closer. But overall It was nice would I stay again, O'coarse not.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: sagafemina
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected because of its proximity to a much more expensive one even further south of the strip having a health conference, and for its price and reasonably good reviews. It was possibly the most unpleasant experience I can remember in Las Vegas. Of course it may be normal by LV standards, but there was so much smoke in the lobby, casino and entryways that the air was blue. There were matches and cigarette butts on the carpet in the guest room areas, and everything had a dingy brown-grey appearance. The rooms were large but furniture sparse and uncomfortable. Beds so-so but pillows horribly cheap and lumpy. Room appeared clean, but glasses were just turned over and not replaced or washed for the length of stay (6 days). The "view room" had a view of the (closed) pool and a crack showing the southernmost strip, but had a series of large floodlights shining directly in the room window. Internet was $13/day per computer, although there was free internet in the lobby---if you didn't mind being asphyxiated. Got the impression that a lot of locals frequent the place and that they all must smoke. Horsey set too, sorry there was no mention of what was going on in the arena. Overall quite a depressing (and unhealthy) experience. Ultimate lesson I suppose is you get what you pay for. Cheap, yes, good, no!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Jef N
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for great rooms. I have stayed at South Point once with friends and once for work. Both times the rooms were great and very clean. Plenty of work space if you are traveling on business. The restaurants are great. Try the Cioppino at Big Sur Oyster Bar and bring a friend to help you eat it. The happy hours at the bars are dirt cheap. We were getting doubles of Glenlivet for $4 a piece. The only reason I did not give them a perfect rating is that they charge $15 / day for the gym. It seems like that should be included with your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Casino”
Reviews.Author: Jason M
Reviews.Content: I went to the South Point for the Fetish and Fantasy Ball. The customer service was horrible in all aspects. they were hosting cowboys from the PBR Finals and it was clear they were only concerned with them, and not the masses of people coming for the ball. On top of that I met several people who ended up with counterfeit tickets which the casino offered no help for. Apparently South Point event tickets are easily forged that there was a ton of them going around and they didn't really seem to care. On top of that the rooms were overpriced in my opinion. For being on the edge of town and having prices equal or higher than strip casino hotels is ridiculous. South Point isn't a high class place that warrants the high prices. There are plenty of better places to spend money in my opinion, and if South Point doesn't want to give me good service for my cash then i will take it somewhere that will appreciate my business.

Reviews.Title: “My budget place to stay in vegas”
Reviews.Author: mgatty
Reviews.Content: Without feeling like I'm being cheap. Not aria, but better than many (most) strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii721
Reviews.Content: South Point is a very comfortable casino to stay at. Large casino, great restaurants and staff is very friendly. The pool area is very large with many chairs to accomodate all guests. Also a nice hot tub. Rooms are very large. Gaming area in center of casino was large and crowded my 2 nights there. One of the better valet parkings I have used in a Vegas hotel. Has a shuttle to the strip but costs 8.00 for the day, taxi would be more $$$. I have stayed here twice and rooms are always very very afforadable. Definately my favorite place to stay off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas South Point Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: sparky464
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many LasVegas hotels over the past thirty years, but my stay at the SouthPoint hotel and casino was the most enjoyable. Very clean guest rooms, restaurants, and casino areas. Room prices very reasonable. Restaurant and Buffet prices somewhat on the high side, but the food/service was good. Bed was excellent,,,,best 3 nights of sleep I've had away from home. Only one complaint: Guest room television channel selection availability was poor. They need to expand and update the available channels to view. No regular ESPN or SPEED CHANNEL was unacceptable, plus more local LV channels need to be added.

Reviews.Title: “Things Afoot at South Point!!”
Reviews.Author: westcoastd
Reviews.Content: Well, I came back after 4 years, and arrived early via the Free Shuttle from the Airport. I found that the Hotel/Casino was VERY busy, and I asked about checking in early, which was around 11 a.m. I was told that my room was not ready, I had reserved a King with a Strip View, I was offered a 7th Floor 2 Queen room for which I declined. I then waited for about an hour, and contacted the Front Desk again, I was told my reserved room was still not ready, however they offered me a 2 Queen 18th Floor room (Room 1879). I accepted the room, and my stay began. I was there for 5 days 4 Nights (October 27-31), however on the night of the 29th (Saturday) a large party was held, which was called The Fetish and Fantasy Ball. This party started at 9:30 p.m. and went on til 4 a.m., yes you have that time correct. As I have already noted that I was on the 18th Floor, I could feel the bass from the music all the way into my room. I got very little sleep that night, and had some business to conduct on Sunday a.m. I was in the elevator with some other guests on my way out on the morning after, who were clearly upset about the noise (and on a higher floor than I), and I told them to let the Management know of their frustration. I also paid the Management a visit when I returned from my business that afternoon. I had a conversation with Venessa/Manager??, and informed her of my frustration with the noise issue, she was clearly concerned about the event in a way like I was telling her not to have it here, but I wanted her to know that paying guest who are calling this their place of residence was extremely important as well. I was given a rate reduction for that night, and offered a late checkout. I dont know how many guests were affected during this, but it's something that everyone who plans on staying here should know. As far as the other benefits for staying here, the Ticket book is nice, as well as the Buffet, and there are plenty of resturants to choose from, but some of those close kinda early, or at least for Vegas kinda early. Good Luck!!.

Reviews.Title: “By and Far the Best Value in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: CowboyAgent
Reviews.Content: By and far the South Point Hotel in Las Vegas is the best value on the strip. Although it is located on South Las Vegas Blvd. a ways off the beaten path of the most active part of the strip, the hotel makes it up in affordability, friendliness, cleanliness great assortment of restaurants, some of the largest guest rooms in Las Vegas and an outstanding pool and spa. I am involved in Professional Bull Riders (PBR) and visit the South Point many times each year on both cowboy business and other conferences. This hotel never disappoints. It has a true western/equestrian/bull riding feel, but if those are not your interests the hotel can still fulfill all of your needs. The Equestrian Center on the grounds of the hotel seats over 5,000 and has more then 2,000 stalls - all underground! The restaurants range from an upper end steak house right down to a Steak and Shake. It’s pretty amazing that all the restaurants are fairly priced for a city where most food stops are pretty expensive. The buffet is one of the better ones in Las Vegas. The casino is large, spacious and has a nice clientele. The hotel is neither too big nor too small and has a very homey feeling. I recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay no where else in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for the money... bar none”
Reviews.Author: SportsReporter
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here on three different occasions and have never been disappointed. There's something about walking down the hall and housekeepers asking you if you're enjoying your stay that appeals to me. My pet peeves when staying in a hotel are cleanliness and how fast housekeeping responds to requests for extra pillows or blankets. South Point gets an A+ in those categories. Pillows were brought to my room within 10 minutes of the phone call. I've stayed at the Belligio and love it there...it's probably my favorite hotel besides the Mandalay Bay. But I can't always stay there due to business per diems if I'm there on a weekend. South Point gets my third choice every time and I would actually pay double for what they charge per night. I recommended this place when my husband was there on business. He hemmed and hawed because he's spoiled by the Hyatts, Venetians and Hiltons. He came back raving, saying it was a great stay and he too, will be back to stay there. Don't be scared that it's slightly south of the Strip... you're a couple of exits away from the heart of the Strip off the I-15. It's maybe a 6-minute drive to the Strip. Easy on, easy off I-15 access, tons of parking and a hopping casino. Cocktail service in the casino is fairly good--if you're sitting at a slot machine, you won't get ignored like some other casino waitresses have a habit of doing. Another bonus point is their valet service. If you've been to Vegas and had valet parking, you know the deal. It's an excruciating long wait--I once waited 30 mins at the MGM. Not so at this hotel. I've never waited longer than 10 minutes, and that's probably because unlike the MGM, where cars are parked on multi-level structures adjacant to the casino, the cars at South Point are all in the lot (I assume). EXCELLENT valet service and you can call down from your room so that your car is waiting for you when you get to the car lobby. Also, unlike other Vegas Hotels, getting to the registration desk isn't a 15 minute walk (Hello, Mirage and Wynn Hotels?) It's right inside the lobby doors and getting to your room doesn't require a map and a compass to even find the elevators. The rooms are Eurpean boutique style and very large. Bathrooms are large. Flatscreen TVs and all the modern technology you need to conduct business. Don Vito's restaurant was very good and reasonable. The Big Sur Oyster Bar was FABULOUS. We sat at the bar and the chef action was fantastic. I would not recommend the Garden Buffet-- the food didn't look very fresh and many of the items listed on the buffet menu were not available. We also ate at the Coronado Cafe and the fare was typical high-end Vegas coffee shop but they had a pretty extensive Chinese Food menu and from what I could see, that was the speciality of the restaurant. I had a Ribeye steak special that was cooked to perfection for under 15 bucks (including potato, salad and bread).

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GailK1013
Reviews.Content: Was just there in October. Although a bit off the beaten path this hotel has a great pool area, terrific service, and the food was prepared well and in abundance. Lots of new machines for slot players and the tables were plentiful for cards and craps. Room was very spacious and clean. The hotel has a shuttle service to take you to the strip at a fair price. Great trip and I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A great destination property”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgentReview
Reviews.Content: great value and perfect for all. Rooms are decently furnished and large. Great assortment of table games and the latest slot. Bowling alleys and full movie theaters add to the experience. Food for all budgets including fast food as well as one of the most expensive "Michaels" Coffee shop has GREAT specials midnight to 6 am. Gift shops has a full liquor store at area rates!! no resort mark up! The Deli is simply AMAZING and the best in vegas!!!!!! I stay here whenever i can. Great sports book.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: SCNancylee
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice, and clean and spacious. The hotel has excellent restaurants, great gambling with friendly dealers. There are movie theaters as well so you really never have to leave if you don't want to. Great value. My only complaint is that the rooms are too hot.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Sbitb2005
Reviews.Content: South point is really nice!!! It has a bowling alley movie theater tons of slot machines restaurants and much more. The rooms are very nice, big and clean. The only issue I had was the customer service. Everyone for the most point was rude and difficult to work with. Above that my stay was pleasant and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Disfan1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Point for the PBR world finals. The hotel was wonderful. It is south of the strip, but we rented a car and found it very easy to get around. Pros: great rooms, large and clean; friendly staff; wonderful rates; movie theater Cons: casino was very smoky compared to ones on the strip; not enough places to eat that are open before 5:00 pm; long lines at breakfast eateries

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NorthglennBill
Reviews.Content: We travel to Las Vegas once or twice every year and South Point Hotel is our favorite place to stay. It is away from the main part of the strip so it is easy to get in and out of. The room prices are reasonable and the rooms are larger than average. The whole atomsphere of this hotel is a lot mellower that the big strip hotels on the strip. The South Point isn't as glitzy as the other strip hotels so if that is what you are looking for, stay elsewhere. If you are looking for a nice, comfortable place to stay where you can relax, have good food, and have fun, we recommend the South Point.

Reviews.Title: “What A Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: loveladyc
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel from Priceline for $40.00 a night and wow- the rooms were huge, they gave us a booklet for free breakfast buffet,free wine, free cocktail and more. Buffet was really good and though they had a lot of choices- most everything we had was good. The breakfast buffet was free and so that was really a deal. There is a casino but this hotel is south of the airport area so not close to the strip, We were rally just looking for a room to stay before flying out the next day- WHAT A DEAL!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value, if it was more I would give overall just 3 stars.”
Reviews.Author: Stormcab2
Reviews.Content: We paid £40/$59.99 for 1 night at this hotel, so it must get 4 stars overall. There is no free internet - it costs $12.99 for 24h! but if you're desperate to avoid this, you can go down to reception where there is free access. You get a voucher for a free breakfast, so if you are with your partner like me, you have to pay. It's a buffet, & if you sign up (quick & free) for their club card, you get about 30% off all food. The queue for the breakfast was a shocker - it took about 20 minutes to get to the front & be seated. There were lots of empty tables, but staff couldn't clean then quick enough. We stayed in 8 hotels in Nevada, Arizona, Utah, New Mexico, & this was the only one where we have to walk through a casino where people can smoke. This means you will get to your room & leave smelling of smoke. The bonus was hitting the $5 Blackjack table & walking away with.... $61, so we got a free stay haha, along with smelling like an ashtray.

Reviews.Title: “South Point is our home away from home!!”
Reviews.Author: vanbusboyandwife
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 10 night stay at the South Point hotel, and are always impressed with the rooms, pool, facilities, and staff. We have stayed at the South Point at least 6 times in the last 7 years. The first thing we did after booking our trip on Priceline was to call the hotel and ask if they could upgrade us from a standard "no view" lower view that we paid for to a view room higher up. They did that easily for us after a little sweet talking on my part. Once we arrived, we got a room with two queen beds facing east looking over the parking lot on the 21st floor. What I forgot to ask for was a king bed instead of two queens, so later when I did, they said they couldn't do it for a few days. After 3 days there, we transfered to a king bed room with a FANTASTIC view looking west over the pool. The nice thing about being on the west side is that you don't get the sun blaring into your room in the morning when you open the curtains. The front desk staff couldn't have been more helpful. Also of note, almost everyday we visited the Seattle's Best Coffee bar in the casino and had arguably the best Americano coffees in town...a must have. Say hi to Rob there...he always greeted us with a smile, and even remembered my name! The other item to mention is the gift shop and liquor store in the hotel. They have the cheapest prices in town, even Costco can't beat their prices. We are never disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I Expected!”
Reviews.Author: preciouspinkxxx
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel and will stay here again! I was SO tired and I really wanted to check in early. The front desk was wonderful and found me a room right away! It was clean, comfy and had a terrific view of the desert. The only bad thing was that my ring went missing from the room. I was very upset but I really couldn't say if it was stolen or if Housekeeping might have swept it off the nightstand. Security came right away and took a report but it was never found... Fun Casino* Decent Buffet* Great incentive coupons at check in* Clean Pool* Great Drink Deals* Comfy Bed* Fluffy Pillows* $1 bowling after midnight! The Pina Coladas at the Pool Bar Rock!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: redstarlost
Reviews.Content: This was a great, reasonably priced place to stay in Vegas. The only problem is that it isn't on the strip so you have to drive or take a shuttle/cab. This isn't that bad unless you plan on partying down on the strip. It was a great place though to have a home base. It has a movie theater, bowling alley, dining, drinks and casino. The pool is nice too. Great place to just relax if you are not the person there to party.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms and Offerings”
Reviews.Author: Dugster29
Reviews.Content: The rooms were large (king, couch, table for two, work area, 42" flat screen, large bathroom). Several quality restaraunts. Movies, bowling, sportsbook, bars everywhere. The pool area is great. A great place to stay at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “So surprised but for the good!”
Reviews.Author: pukasch
Reviews.Content: This hotel way exceeded our expectations! it was super clean and the room was very large. The buffet was excellent and you could actually play on the slots without having to keep putting $ in over and over again. This hotel was recommended to us and will most definitely recommend it as well. You bet we stay here again. although it was off the strip it is a hop skip and jump to the main strip by car via the freeway! It was a steal of a deal! Worth the stay! Oh and love the security near the hotel elevators must show key to go up!

Reviews.Title: “Super holiday”
Reviews.Author: Scandinavian54
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little far away south from the Strip, need a car to move around Vegas. But the hotel is great. We liked the pool area, very calm and relaxing with excellent service. We liked just about everything in this hotel, rooms, service, staff, atmosphere etc. Definitely will stay there again when in Vegas. Quality buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip but very inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: TrishGo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent if you want a cheap place to stay that's clean, kid-friendly and has everything a good casino offers (sports betting, buffet, slots, tables). It is off the strip (taxi to the strip is about $25+), but if you don't want to deal with crowds, this may be the perfect casino for you.
