I stayed here labor day weekend with my family and only paid $80 a night for two queen beds and no resort fee! Can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: “Abysmal Housekeeping detracts from an otherwise sub-par experience”
Reviews.Author: bugzboy
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip and stayed at this hotel for a convention at the property. The convention facilities were excellent. However, on a more personal note, my wife had to ask for coffee every day. I could understand the first day, but we stayed 7 days and had to ask for coffee each day! Same thing with towels. They only gave us 2, and we had to ask for an extra towel everyday. The smoke seemed to be everywhere - even though our room was non-smoking. I understand the casino is smoking, but some of the strip hotels didn't seem to be as smokey. Don Vito's was excellent, as was the buffet. If you're looking for Vegas, this isn't it.

Reviews.Title: “South Point Heaven”
Reviews.Author: sgtmal
Reviews.Content: Nice place all the way. Large rooms, nice buffet, and various restaurants, first run movies in on site theater, bowling alley, and yes the casino. A little far from the main strip but still on las vegas blvd. A straight shot. Travel center downstairs for the attractions in vegas. Customer srevice is superb. This place is nice especially for the price 54.00 a night during the week... only a few years old , I think built in 2008.

Reviews.Title: “love this place!”
Reviews.Author: jammex88
Reviews.Content: Great rates, customer service, and just about everything you could want under one roof. Much easier to get in and out of South Point than other hotels further up on the strip. Very comfy and quiet rooms! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are really Big! Far from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Mageeclan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was close to our relatives. It's a nice clean hotel and casino. The Casino was big enough to relax and gamble in without getting bored. Didn't win at all though. The rooms are big and had a nice flat screen t.v. , had a safe and large bathroom, with toilet and shower separate. There was no fridge and the beds were a little hard. It was an average room for a decent price. If you have kids there is a movie theater, bowling alley and arcade. Probably won't stay there again, just because it is far from both downtown and the strip.

Reviews.Title: “This is a three star hotel at best!”
Reviews.Author: G W
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire and they list it as a "4 Star". When you compare this to other 4 Star Vegas hotels (MGM for example), it can't hold a candle to them. I'm not sure who is giving this a 5 out of 5 rating but these are definitely people that have not stayed at other Vegas hotels (or South Point employees). While I'll admit that the hotel was clean, the rooms are looking a bit tired and are very much like a B.W. or an H.I. hotel with a casino. As well, the beds are very uncomfortable because they use some sort of matress pad that gets all bunched up. Beyond being clean, there is nothing special about this place at all. I paid $100 a night on Hotwire because the weekend I stayed was very busy in Vegas but if you pay over $60 or $65 a night you'll definitely be disappointed. Once again Hotwire has overrated a hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas stop off if travelling with children”
Reviews.Author: Mini_Zilla
Reviews.Content: The South Point is a great value hotel with amenities that make it ideal if travelling with children. Other reviewers have pointed out the superb value that the large and fairly luxurious rooms offer and even on a Saturday night we got a great deal for our room. The resort has a cinema, bowling alley, a shallow pool and a great choice of restaurants making it ideal for those travelling with kids. Staff were polite and helpful. This isn't quite a 5 star hotel, I've taken a point off as there were no adjoining rooms. Also for the very long walk from the car park to the front desk. To be fair though most of the Vegas hotels seem to have this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: glad25
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at South Point, and we were not disappointed. I booked the hotel online at an excellent price. As our flight arrived in the early evening, we stayed one night enroute to our condo in Lake Havasu City, Arizona. We found the rooms to be spacious and clean. We ate supper and breakfast at the buffet, and it was superb. We are not gamblers so we cannot comment on that portion. Some folks may find the hotel a little far from the action, but otherwise it is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “South Point, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Johnnyblackjack
Reviews.Content: Dollar for Dollar this is the best hotel I've ever stayed at in Vegas, and I've stayed at a lot of hotels in Vegas! I paid $65 a night (no so called "resort fee") for a large, clean modern room. Staff was helpful and polite, service was quick and efficient and the casino was bright and relatively smoke free. What more could you ask for at a Vegas hotel? Oh, I guess food and entertainment. Well there are a variety of restaurants from the inexpensive Steak and Shake hamburger joint to the expensive steak house. I liked the main floor layout. All of the restaurants are immediately accessed from the casino floor; no need to walk for miles like you have to in some strip expensive hotels. The buffet was cheap and although it cannot be compared to the more expensive buffets on the strip, it was certainly adequate. There is entertainment for the family with a multiple screen movie theatre and a bowling alley. The shows are directed at the more senior guests, with mainly stars from the 70s and some of them in their 70s. While I was there Tony Orlando (no Dawn) was the main attraction, next week it was Sha Na Na and the following week Juice Newton. A couple of weeks ago Connie Stevens was there. Wow, I haven't heard about her for 40 years! So I guess you can say entertainment wise, they had something for everyone. The casino was large with lots of slots and table games. They always had $5 double deck blackjack with good rules. You'll never see that on the strip! The swimming pool had some shade trees and looked nice. It is a ways from the strip and downtown so it might be best to have a car. So there you have it. I highly recommend it and will stay here in the future when I have to pay for a room (I'm usually comped for rooms).

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value Hotel If You Know What You're Getting Into”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasResortFees
Reviews.Content: We've visited South Point on numerous occasions. The large rooms are always well maintained and parking is readily available. The best way to describe South Point is that it's simliar to an upscale Fremont Street Experience. There is plenty of on-site gaming, tables start at $5 - $10, dining and entertainment options are cheap and the hotel has a laid back vibe. As with Fremont, you'll miss the bright lights on the LV Strip. We usually stay here for one or two nights upon arrival from the airport. A rental car is a must for this high quality value hotel that does not charge a resort fee. Recommended as long as you know what you're getting into.

Reviews.Title: “TOP CLASS ALL THE WAY - YOU CAN'T GO WRONG STAYING HERE!”
Reviews.Author: adelaide c
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short stay at the Southpoint hotel and casino. My partner and I had previously visited this establishment for gaming while staying at other Vegas hotels. On this Vegas visit we decided to stay here and it's a truly fabulous place. Everthing about Southpoint is excellent. I can't understand anyone giving this place negative reviews at all! The room we stayed in was roomy and spotless, great large flatscreen TV, ace king bed, superb bathroom and shower. Pool area is large with plenty of sun beds. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful, answering any and all questions we asked of them. All the restaurants we tried and especially the buffets were of a high standard and were very good value. The weekend brunch is a great deal. The casino is bright and light and not too smokey compared with some other off strip places we have stayed at. All gaming is good, plenty of interesting slots, video poker and table games to keep you gambling away. We hope to return to the Southpoint in the very near future and in the meantime can highly recommend it to anyone intending on visiting Las Vegas. Last point; It's probaby a good idea to have a rental car while staying here as it's a short drive to the main strip and other places of interest. Very near the airport (about a 10 minute drive). Keep up the good work Michael and Co.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay BUT”
Reviews.Author: bthebert
Reviews.Content: the south point was a great place to stay, it's only about 6 miles down las vegas blvd which is right in front of the hotel down to the strip. when you check in they will sign you up for the player's club that saves you the hassle of waiting in another line. the discount book offers a free buffet and other offers. we ate at the prime rib restaraunt good food and value. all of the staff were very welcoming, BUT if you stay there request a room on the 9th floor or above.our room was on the 7th floor eastside of the building it ahd a great view THE BLOCK WALL OF THE PARKING BUILDING we were able to see some sky , lower floors probably couldn't

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ZeniasGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the South Point Hotel on numerous occasions over the last 7-8 years. We have family in Vegas, so we visit at least once a year. We choose the South Point because it is in a less frenetic part of Las Vegas Blvd, known as "the strip" in the section that is jam-packed with hotels and casinos. You cannot walk from South Point to the central part of the strip - it's about a 15-minute drive, primarily due to the heavy traffic. The South Point is an easy hotel to get in and out of (you don't have to walk through miles of casino to get to the parking lot), the rooms are large, with very comfortable beds, bathrooms are spacious with luxury toiletries -- always clean. Very nice pool area and it has a spa. And of course, it's got a casino! It is not necessarily the least expensive hotel in Vegas, but it's a good bargain. While you will want to try other places to eat, the South Point has several restaurants that are good, including a seafood bar and a huge breakfast buffet. One downside - they do charge a daily fee for internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and good variety of slots”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette F
Reviews.Content: Lots of variety of slots, hotel room was spacious and had a few unusual items in it. Breakfast buffet was included, lots of variety.Drink persons were always available.

Reviews.Title: “It's nice if you're OK with not being on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: koniption
Reviews.Content: Registration was smooth. We got out with only one extra charge for a day of Internet. Free shuttle to the airport. Shuttle to the strip is convenient and only runs $8. Room was spacious and clean. Only complaints were a dead wireless keyboard (which hampered self check-out and a weak remote (had to be within 5 ft). You're about 20 minutes from the strip by car. Keep that in mind - it's not within walking distance. This hotel/casino tends to draw an older crowd. On the other hand, it's a bit quieter than the others. The HVAC system is not effective at removing smoke. I've been to others where you can't smell the smoke. Calistoga Steak House Loved the lamb. The oysters weren't fresh. Great deal on Clos Du Bois Merlot. Rib-eye tasted and looked like a roast. Crab legs were OK. Filet mignon was tasty. Lobster bisque was yummy but maybe a bit too salty. Service was mostly attentive with a couple gaps. Pool Liquor service is spotty, indifferent. Drinks are reasonably priced. Pool is nice for hanging out or wading but you wont be doing laps. Unusually shaped jacuzzi with warmish water. Plenty of lounge chairs on this visit. Pool closes fairly early - 10pm. Costa Del Sur Awesome. Adrian does the best neck massage. The waterfall shower is crazy powerful. There are dedicated men's and women's areas but I especially like the couples area. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: love2travelPei
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th trip to Vegas and our first at South Point. I would highly recommend it to anyone who doesn't need to be on the Strip. It has seems to have been designed for the "older" group 40-70 and the family group with children. If you are looking for the night life of the Strip I would say stay closer. Having access to a car will help. For the first time at a hotel I didn't feel like they were trying to rip us off at the restaurants or the gift shops, everything was reasonably priced. The buffets were very good value. Wonderful pool and restaurants, with the movie theatres and bingo an extra bonus. We will be back to stay!

Reviews.Title: “4 night stay october 2011”
Reviews.Author: Harold G
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference, which was at the Wynn. Wanted to stay off-strip. Cost me a fraction of what it would have cost to stay at the Wynn, even when adding in the rental car to get to and from the South Point to the Wynn. Nice pool. Clean rooms. Comfortable beds. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Would definitely stay here again. My only complaint is having to walk through the smoky casino to get to the room elevators. The $13/day internet is a bit steep, but we didn't use it, we used our wifi tethered smartphone instead.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely value for the money!!”
Reviews.Author: Canuckscout
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Veags some 60 times. We have stayed at many hotels. I am amazed that people can criticize the internet cost of $13 when they are paying 35$ for the room. Leave the computer at home or use the business center. The other thing people complain about is the $8 shuttle. I rent a car and rarely pay more than $15 per day!! We have stayed at the South point at least a dozen times. It has both good and bad points. The good is the pool stays open until 10 PM. AWESOME!!!! The rooms are large and reasonably comfortable, cleen and well appointed. The ameneties are great. Bowling, theatres, arcade, spa, etc.. The hot dog lady by the sports bar ($.75). Now the not so good. It is smokey (casino). The food is definitely not as good as years ago. The buffet is mediocre but they give you a coupon. The coronado cafe seems to serve recycled food for breakfat. The Steak and shake is AWFUL!!. The best deal is the hot dog lady by the sports betting during the afternoon. All in all I like the South Point. I recommend it to my friends and we are bringing our grandsons next july.

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly Service and Free Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: Bobremy
Reviews.Content: No resort fee, free Wi-Fi throughout hotel, great restaurants and lots for everyone to do at a great price what more could you want.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: docsla
Reviews.Content: Was in Las Vegas for week, then side trips to other areas which created a need for a one night hotel room. I was looking for a 4-5 star hotel before next day flight when I used Priceline. I bid on any location 4 star and above which is how I booked the South Point Hotel. It was tacky, not what you think when booking Las Vegas four star hotels. Location was not bad for airport but upon checking into the room, not a single person to help with bags and you have to walk a long distance to get to the room elevators, then show your key to two security guards to get on the elevator. What is that all about? The room was large but two worn out towels with two hard hand towels made me wonder again about this hotel. The bed was not good but they did have a topper on the mattress that helped. I paid more for this room than the going room rate for this hotel which I thought crazy but they class this hotel as a five star hotel. So buyer beware on Priceline bidding. The hotel did give a coupon book for free buffet which included free Bloody Marys, but on my plane ride the breakfast was with me for 5 hours and not in a good way. If you want a large room far away from everything and hardly any linens book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: swtpeahb
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at SouthPoint. We went for a friends wedding and this is one of two hotels she wanted to stay at. We got there about 12:30 fri afternoon. I was hoping we would be able to check in early, but if not we could kill some time. The valet area was jam packed when we pulled in. Surprisingly we walk straight up to the counter to check in. Tiffany(easy for me to remember) helped us. She was very efficient and friendly. There were going to be 4 or 5 more rooms with our party. Being the first in our group to arrive. I was asked to try and get all the room on the same floor. Not only was Tiffany able to check us in right away, she quickly looked up the other guest and made arrangements for us to all be on the same floor. Once we got to our room I was surprised at how spacious it was. The rooms are large and clean. Don't get me wrong I still wiped a few things off with my Clorox wipes.But the room was comfortable. I do have 2 minor complaints. One complaint I have about the decor is that when I was taking pictures of us in the room. Because of the lighting there is an orangeish tint to the pictures. Oh well. My second complaint is there is no free wifi in the rooms. $13 to have internet for a 24 hour period. This is definitely a hotel we will come back to. We did not use the shuttle to go to the strip, will next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the money...But could U turn the temperature down a notch in my room?”
Reviews.Author: olawsonii
Reviews.Content: My stay was over the Columbus Day weekend; Oct 8-11. We booked four rooms through Expedia for a 4-day, three night pre-paid stay for a golf outing. Check-in was smooth, efficient and pleasant. I was totally registered in five minutes. They didn't have the exact room we booked but compensated with a pool view. Since I don't spend much time in the room, any view was fine. The rooms are spacious with large flat-screen TVs, dresser for clothes, good size closet with a wall safe. Bathrooms were comfortable with dual basins and nice fixtures. Floors were tile. Everything in the bathroom was clean. The only downside was I like a cool room for sleeping and no matter what temperature I set, it stayed at about 77 degrees. Great for ski lodges, not so much in the desert. Eating experiences were mostly elsewhere but we did eat at the buffet several times because of the coupons they gave us at registration. Although I shouldn't have to say it, READING IS FUNDAMENTAL so make sure you read the fine print on most of the coupons they give you to avoid having to call in an air strike only to have to say "my bad" later on. If you want any decent service from the Bell Desk, you better tip well, otherwise they barely notice you after their first encounter. If you do not handle smoke well, there are very few options for you in Vegas; I highly recommend wearing a mask, the smoke really did a number on me and aggravated my bronchial asthma. Where I come from, wearing a mask just doesn't sit right with the fellows but if I had been by myself or with a different peer group (say Geeks are us), I would definitely wear one. As I did not stay to gamble, the casino being located smack dab in the middle was a bit of a nuisance to me having to traverse so many folks; some smoking like Smokin' Joe's BBQ shack. All in all, a great time, great service and great food at the buffet. Free wi-fi in the lobby only.

Reviews.Title: “First Time Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelinf00l
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 9 -10 miles from the strip. They offer a shuttle to the strip for $8 dollars per day per person. They have ample parking both covered and open. Casino is adequate and smoky. Hotel staff at checkin was pleasant. Arrived early, about 1:00 but rooms were available. The room was quite spacious, comfortable and clean. Bathroom good size and vanity/sink separate from toilet/bath. There are several restaurants in the casino and good sized gift shop. Bowling alley was huge as were the theaters. Downsides were the food for breakfast at the Garden Buffet was not very good. And the $13 per day for internet was ridiculous. We did not use the pool but the view of it was nice and seemed to be quite popular with the guests. I would stay here again, room rates were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Surfin1212
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night this week. Walking through the casino is very smoky, and the carpets in the halls were stained and reeked. The room was very dirty. The carpets again stained and reeked. The nightstands had sticky rings from drinks. The bathroom dirty...The place gave me the creeps. Will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany Z
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at SouthPoint. We went for a friends wedding and this is one of two hotels she wanted to stay at. We got there about 12:30 fri afternoon. I was hoping we would be able to check in early, but if not we could kill some time. The valet area was jam packed when we pulled in. Surprisingly we walk straight up to the counter to check in. Tiffany(easy for me to remember) helped us. She was very efficient and friendly. There were going to be 4 or 5 more rooms with our party. Being the first in our group to arrive. I was asked to try and get all the room on the same floor. Not only was Tiffany able to check us in right away, she quickly looked up the other guest and made arrangements for us to all be on the same floor. Once we got to our room I was surprised at how spacious it was. The rooms are large and clean. Don't get me wrong I still wiped a few things off with my Clorox wipes.But the room was comfortable. I do have 2 minor complaints. One complaint I have about the decor is that when I was taking pictures of us in the room. Because of the lighting there is an orangeish tint to the pictures. Oh well. My second complaint is there is no free wifi in the rooms. $13 to have internet for a 24 hour period. This is definitely a hotel we will come back to. We did not use the shuttle to go to the strip, will next time.

Reviews.Title: “Where grumpy people are employed”
Reviews.Author: MrFoster
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days, and have no idea how anyone could rate this place greater than 3 dots. The Good: Nice spacious rooms, very clean, big comfy bed, good workspace in room, very little noise filters in the rooms. The veal marsala at Vitos is excellent, and the wine prices are very reasonable. The Bad: Except for the housekeeping staff, these are the most unfriendly hotel employees I have ever encountered, From the shuttle driver to the bellboys to the front desk clerk to the blackjack dealers; I have never encountered so many unfriendly and grumpy people in my life. The drapes do not fit tight enough to block all of the outdoor floodlights shining on the building, The Ugly: The coronado cafe breakfast is awful; the eggs, potatoes, and steak all smelled and tasted like old stale grease. The breakfast buffet was free with coupon - and not worth the price! The Mediocre: The Sterling restaurant has decent, but not great prime rib. The Surprise: The prices in the gift shop are VERY reasonable, especially the wine beer and liquor. Most hotels really gouge you for general merchandise, but South Point keeps the prices about the same as you find at a large chain store. The Ridiculous: $12.95 per day for internet access; This is a service that costs the hotel virtually $ZERO. This is the biggest rip-off I have ever seen!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience for my family passing through Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cjatlanta2
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on the room, great coupons for food and drink, and went bowling in the resort which was fun. We had our own rental minivan so we could go to the strip when we wanted. We saved a lot of money here, had a great time and a wonderful room. We did a long scenic loop from LA to the Grand Canyon to Las Vegas back to LA... and then we flew off to China for 12 days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility, extra fees are ridiculous”
Reviews.Author: DerFotograf
Reviews.Content: This is a very new hotel which is south of the Las Vegas strip area. Great facility and the Garden Buffet was great. I booked the trip through Hotwire and upon arrival discovered that wi-fi and access to the gym both required an additional daily fee. I think any hotel that charges extra (daily) for wi-fi should re-think the value that they are delivering to their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Management, Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: BrooklyniteLA
Reviews.Content: First off the hotel is huge inside, lots of restaurants, Seattle Coffee chain inside the hotel, Cinemark movie theater (I think 16 theaters), Bowling Alley, Equestrian (we missed the show it was $15 for a competition so ask when you get there), lots of slot machines (including the one with cherry at any position that's rare), $3 Craps we spent 5 hours at with 2 other couples (craps you lose little at a time so $100 will get you hours of excitement), $1 roulette!!, its all great, they even have hot dog carts when football games are playing and Monday night pigskin football event where you sign up for chance to win $250 every quarter of the game, covered parking with very little walking to the hotel, great views of the strip and vast desert and mountains which is gorgeous to me, reflective mirror glasses which give you privacy on the inside and amazing colors on your skin when you are at the pool and want to take pictures, it also warms you up when you are at the pool as it doubles the suns strength. So that's all the hotel except the room. They also gave us a coupon book with free drinks, free buffet and free gift from the souvenir shop (these were all the free stuff) and lots of other free with purchase coupons like popcorn, desert etc that required a purchase. We used lots of our coupons plus we got comp'd buffet because we gambled a lot so we barely paid for food. Our breakfast was at the Seattle Best Coffee which is just like starbucks and its convenient to have inside the hotel (with regular pricing! for comparison the Starbucks at MGM properties, Monte Carlo and Luxor were I shopped are twice as expensive as LA for instance regular medium size coffee is $380 vs $1.95 here in LA) The service and people at the register (specifically Holly) were fantastic and very helpful. The people at the buffet (which is really inexpensive by the way with the player card). The SPA area is gorgeous, we didnt use it because we thought $25 is a bit high but next time we will get a service like manicure and use the SPA for free. SPA is $45/ 3 days. There is a couples area also that is separate admission than the regular SPA fee. Gym is $15/day. I think they will lower the cost to the SPA and Gym because none of us in our group used it and when we got a free tour of the place (to see what it looked like) it was empty. It has a nice lounge area for men to watch sports and read, very quite and relaxing to fall asleep in. I guess in the cold months where you cant use the pool its more popular. Now about the room and hallways. The elevator area is nice, the hallways are fresh looking with new carpet (the building is new, that's why) and the rooms are really nice and modern. Everything feels fresh and new. The beds are comfortable but the top sheet as someone else also pointed out feels like its un-breathable material so we just put it on the ground when we slept. Also we didn't know how to use the AC so we ended up having the AC on ON instead of Auto so the fan ran all night and I woke up with dried eyes and dry throat. Overall rooms are very nice and definitely fit the 4 star category in American standards (and 7 star in European standards). We just stayed at Monte Carlo and I think that was 3.5 Star but claimed 4 star. The bathroom is really nice, the shower is stone all the way up and the bathroom/shower being separate is a real convenience. The hotel is well insulated so you barely hear the other rooms, heck I couldn't even talk to my wife from the bathroom, she couldn't hear me. The only problem is the distance from the strip which didn't bother us because we had a car and it was about 10min ride and parking is free everywhere on the strip casinos anyway so one night we went to the strip and the other day we spent the whole day inside the hotel because there was enough to do inside. There is a Mexican restaurant also that has great lunch specials for $8.95 includes chips guacamole and salsa, margarita (or soda), soup, and two items like burritos or tacos. We had lunch there and loved the foot. Lunch special was 11-3pm

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: DonnLlouM
Reviews.Content: This was our sixth trip to Las Vegas. Having stayed at a different hotel each time I can say, without reserve, that South Point is the nicest we have stayed at. The rooms are huge and, even without paying extra for the "view room" we had a beautiful view of the mountains outside of Las Vegas. The room was unbelievably reasonably priced, and not nearly as far from the Strip as one might believe. The beds were firm and comfortable. The bath is large with a separate dressing area and fabulous toiletries that smell great. Just a short drive and you're in the middle of all of the action. All of the staff that we encountered - from the valets to the maids to the waitress at the Steak'n'Shake - were pleasant, helpful and always smiling...a wonderful plus in any hotel, but seriously lacking in Las Vegas. The food in the restaurants is wonderful. The surroundings are beautiful. From Monday to Thursday the casino floor isn't overly smoky. There is absolutely nothing to complain about. Oh...play the Star Wars slots - you can win BIG!

Reviews.Title: “PREFECT "HIDDEN GEM"”
Reviews.Author: rollingstone66
Reviews.Content: Absolutely undeniably best value (family-oriented) hotel in Vegas! I like that its away from d glitz n madness of d Strip but (when U want it) d Strip is still just 5 minutes away via I-15. D room was huge. Spotless. Two queen beds. Huge bathroom. 5 star quality for 2 star price!!! Walk to d car-park was reasonable. Buffet was fantastic value (6 cooking stations) for d price, but even better, I got it free with coupon book given at check-in! Dont miss d (new Vegas institution) Steak & Shake! If low on fuel, get d 75 cent Vienna all-beef hot dog!!! Midnight steak special was another must-try!!! Service at reception was great. Too busy eating, didnt have time for d 64-lane bowling center or d 16-screen cinema! No complaints whasoever. Cant recommend South Point highly enough! Cant wait to go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas, South Point & The Spazmatics!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AAMeraz
Reviews.Content: My cousin had stayed at this hotel many times. She mainly stayed here to see the band “The Spazmatics”, an 80’s band. We gathered our family and friends and off we went to Vegas! We were all very surprise with the appearance of this hotel, room and amenities. The rooms are 500 square feet with plush beds, granite countertops, and awesome views of the pool. The staff were really friendly and were always attentive. The outside pool and hot tub was very luxurious; we felt like we were at a spa. The resort is off the strip, however they have shuttles that take you there and back. The band “The Spazmatics” were definitely a great band with awesome music. They were very entertaining. We will definitely staying at South Point again and look forward to seeing “The Spazmatics”! We’re already planning our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, good price too!”
Reviews.Author: happytravels29
Reviews.Content: While touring the west with the family this year, we had a quick stay over in Vegas, and had booked this hotel blindly though one on the online hotel services. When we drove up and saw this impressive structure we were amazed. We had a wonderful stay here. The staff from the valet and door-people to the restaurant waiters were all very professional and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas or Bust”
Reviews.Author: dancer62va
Reviews.Content: We (my brother and I) have stayed here a couple of times now. Very Large and just off the I-15 interstate and close to the Airport. On the Strip and very quiet and pleasing to the eye. We enjoy everything about this hotel from the spacious rooms- to the great food - to the people who work there. Very good times and specials can be found if you ask or join theie email club.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for the price!!”
Reviews.Author: Triper14
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Vegas and don't want to pay for pricey rooms on the strip, stay here! Our room at Southpoint was huge and so clean! The bed was also really comfy! The only drawback to this hotel is how far away it is from the strip. We had a rental car and it was about a 15 to 20 minute drive depending on traffic and parking was a nightmare unless you did valet at one of the hotels on the strip. If you are looking to save some money on your trip to vegas, but still stay at an amazing hotel then this is the place! Like I said, it's far removed from the main strip. If you are looking for somewhere cheap but closer to the main areas, check out Tahiti Village.

Reviews.Title: “Southpoint's The Best”
Reviews.Author: Rick_Janet
Reviews.Content: Southpoint has been our choice of hotel for our stays in Vegas for the past 4 years. The staff are friendly & courteous. The rooms are clean & quiet. The pool & hot tub are great. Unlike most casino's the gaming floor is very bright. As in previous reviews, a car is needed as taxis could be pretty pricey if you want to visit the strip - I believe a taxi from Planet Hollywood was $30 without tip. There is a restaurant for every taste at this hotel from buffet to gourmet.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming...a true treat!”
Reviews.Author: jlm256
Reviews.Content: We stopped for one night on our way to California and were delighted with our stay at the South Point. The check-in was quick and we were given a 23rd floor room with a strip view without even asking. The friendly agent at the front desk gave our 2 year old daughter some bead necklaces that made her day. I felt that the hotel was very welcoming to families. The coupon book was nice, it gave us a discount on our meal The room was large and very clean. The lighting was very relaxing and the bathroom huge. Our crib, extra pillows and towels were delivered quickly. The pool was probably our favorite part. It wasn't crowded and also wasn't overpowered by loud music. This place is a really great value. The location is definitely way off the strip, but it suited our purposes perfectly. It was great to avoid the traffic of the rest of Vegas and just hop off and on the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: JEM605
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the South Point for a seminar and found it a great value for the money. My room was very nice, clean and had a great view. All of the staff was friendly and accommodating. It was very laid back compared to the strip. After four days at the seminar, I was ready to move to the strip as it got a little boring but overall if you're visiting Las Vegas and want to avoid all the crowds, the South Point is a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “a truly wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Lilly F
Reviews.Content: My husband ,my 8 year old son and I stayed here last year and came back last week again.This time we stayed in a one bedroom suite for 4 nights.I believe there are different ones but our was HUGE and the main bathroom was amazing!!The furniture and decoration is tasteful and everything is spotless.Great swimming pool,hot tub and pool area as well as a selection of good restaurants in the hotel . We had a perfect stay at South Point and can surly say that this is the Las Vegas hotel we'd love to go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pdee333
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed staying here. Compared to the nasty, filty Flamingo, this was heaven. Everyone we encountered was obviously proud to work there. The room was large and clean. and excellent value. All rooms have 36" LED TV's. I don't like paying for WiFi , but all the vegas hotels charge.. so what can you do? The food is excellent. I love the coffee shop and it is open 24 hours. The pool was heated and heavenly. Love, love, love the hot tub. It was a great experience and this will be my new favorite hotel in Vegas. ( please never make me stay at the Flamingo again . what a dump )

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Julia R
Reviews.Content: So much better than the itty bitty rooms I've stayed at on the Strip. The rooms were huge and the hotel had everything there (cinema, bowling, yummy places to eat). Great prices, great cleaning service, friendly atmosphere. Con: you can't turn off the A.C.

Reviews.Title: “What a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: wind_n_water_01
Reviews.Content: We stayed there twice foe one night, before and after a wild and rough week of camping in the canyons of Utah. For about $70, we got a 500 sq ft room with a bed that could sleep 5, a marble bathroom, and very good service. Can you ask for more? Sure, there are some annoyances, it's a long way through casino before you reach the elevators, the pool was crowded, and not so clean, the wi-fi access was ridiculously expensive - but still, would come back there any time (if they keep their price low)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: MWV2011
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Las Vegas now every year for 7 years now and I had never heard of South Point. My girlfriend had made the reservations for last week due to a Haea national confrence there. I was very surprised to see the resort was so large. Great restaurants and gaming there, I actually made over 400.00 on penny slots there, and I never play the slots, always craps and blackjack! The staff was great, check in and check out an ease!! I loved the pool area spending five afternoons out there.

Reviews.Title: “South Point Stay”
Reviews.Author: lynnc54
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recomment this Hotel/Casino. We only stayed one night, but used the Casino for a whole week. The staff are all very nice. The hotel and casino are kept clean. The food at Del Mar was great. The Buffets were also very good, I highly recommend eating the buffet on prime rib night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at great price..”
Reviews.Author: plymouthargyle
Reviews.Content: Hotel very easy to find as it is the first hotel coming into vegas...huge parking garage and smooth check-in..huge very clean room..lcd telly but, very few channels..great pool with huge towels and plenty of them...very cheap buffet breakfast during week ( rises in price at weekend)....awesome cinema with cheap prices early in day (when heat outside the hottest)..this place has everything at a great price and you can get the club discount card even if you dont gamble!! only grumble is the smoking in the hotel..with most places in europe being smoke free this hotel was like stepping back to the bad old days..some parts of the buffet area was swathed in smoke from nearby gamblers... we will be back next year for sure!! barbara who worked at the towel issue point was a star a credit to the south point!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: NancyJ3
Reviews.Content: We cannot rate the service any higher - 5+++++ stars. We called for various things, pillow, towels, hangers at different times and got them all promptly with no tip expected. Amazing! We booked directly at the hotel website. Also we were upgraded to a high floor with no upcharge. After the first night when we found out the city view was better, we asked about moving. At first the person at the desk said it would be a $10 upcharge for that side, then gave it to us for nothing -- right across the hall. Very convenient to move. We couldn't be happier with all of that. The casino decor was bland/ordinary to us because we are design people. The rooms were nicely maintained, roomy, good maid service, good bedding - they're not the Encore, but for $54 per night for 5 nights an outstanding value. (We have stayed at many strip hotels including Encore, Aria, MGM Grand, etc.) We enjoyed the pool and thought it was nice. Very pretty hot tub area with beautiful vegetation. Food at cafe and buffet was adequate and reasonably priced. Food at Oyster Bar was delicious. Didn't eat anywhere else. Horse arena was outstanding. We aren't even horsey people, but went in to watch a free national competition for a while. Really impressive riders. Hotel is 6 miles south from strip, but doesn't matter to us because we always rent a car - which we recommend, since taxis are expensive, parking is free at all casinos and we like to go to different shows and casinos. Makes for a much easier trip. After you pay for a few taxis, you can get a rental for the same price and get the freedom. (Car was $165/week). This is not a casino hotel for young people that want a night club scene where they're staying. Stay there for a deal and go somewhere else to party!

Reviews.Title: “Served It's Purpose Very Well”
Reviews.Author: bdr2835
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights prior to a roadtrip. Here are the good and bad points; Good -The room was probably the best that we have had in Vegas. Spacious and clean with a good shower. - The restaurants that we tried were all good and good value with a wide range of options. - There is a free shuttle to and from the airport (but remember to book it). -The pool area is fine and was quiet when we were there. - The onsite bowling alley and cinema are a great way to spend time away from the bustle of the casino and Vegas in general. Bad -Although it isn't that far from the Strip it was further than we thought. A shuttle is provided and there are plenty of taxis but nothing really beats beeing able to walk straight out on to the Strip from your own hotel. All in all this was a great place but we would only stay again as an airport overnight as it doesn't really convey the "Vegas" experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fun family trip”
Reviews.Author: Malialyssa
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Friday afternoon and had no problems. It was quick and easy at the front desk and I liked the convenience of getting the players card at the same time...also, LOVED the coupons we got as well (very convenient for families trying to save some money!). We were able to use the coupons for FREE lunch buffet (tip: you can only use this coupon Monday thru Friday only). The room we stayed in was nice and clean. We had two beds which was perfect for us family of four (with a 5 and 3 year old kids). The pool was good for the kids since it was no deeper than 4 1/2 feet. I liked how you can put the pool chairs in the water; however, found several broken chairs so if you go to the pool, try to go early to get a good chair. One minor complaint about the pool is the lack of waitresses. Otherwise, it is fine for the family. One thing we loved about this hotel was that there were things to keep our kids busy. From the 24 hour bowling to the movie theatre, it was a nice experience for me since I don't usually gamble. The only thing that would make this the perfect place would be if the hotel invested in making carnival type games so that we wouldn't have to go to Circus Circus for that. Lastly, I want to mention that we really appreciate the comped lunches/dinners that my husband got for gambling. He said that this hotel was more liberal when it came to handing out comps. We definitely had a great time there and will come back again. See you soon South Point!

Reviews.Title: “Best of All Vegas Hotels”
Reviews.Author: RedRider1912
Reviews.Content: This hotel/casino is on the south part of the city and is the best property in the city. We have always been comfortable there. The rooms are large and we've also never been denied a king bed like happens in so many other hotels where they say you "can request it but it is not guaranteed". The hotel is new and so every facility within it is clean and modern. You can go to a movie, bowl, watch a lounge show or select from a variety of restaurants, too. We ate in the Oyster Bar and although a bit pricey, it was absolutely delicious! Wej even got an email after our last stay whereby we were offered a free room the next time we visited and we didn't even gamble!!

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip, but great value!”
Reviews.Author: GregKovacs23
Reviews.Content: It's about a 10 min drive from the strip. But it's a great value for the money! The rooms were nice; slightly above average. The entire hotel is pretty new so that's nice. The beds were average, not particularly good or bad. The guys at the craps table were more than willing to help my wife and I learn to play and it was fun. Overall, I was very happy with our decision to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, south of The Strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: ATLTravel15
Reviews.Content: Good (not great) casino, very good restaurants at reasonable prices and good hotel room. Only a several minutes drive from The Strip. Would've been nice if a mini-fridge was offered free of charge, as is standard at many non-Vegas hotels. However, considering the cost, this was a very good value. If you're looking for more flash and to be closer to the action, there are probably more opulent (and expensive) hotels on The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “South Strip Hotel Away From Everything That Is Vegas”
Reviews.Author: barizzo
Reviews.Content: Nice looking place that is about 5 miles south of the Strip. If you want to do ANYTHING on the Strip, you have to drive or get a cab. That adds up and reduces any savings you might have seen from staying at this out of the way place. If you're allergic to smoke, this casino is NOT well ventilated. The buffet does offer a good value, compared to most Vegas buffets, but it does not open until 7 am. The cornbread was especially good. The worst part of the stay here was the sour attitude of the poker room manager and his floor manager. They let an attractive young lady take my turn to play after she had been more than 20 minutes late to claim her spot. Any any classy poker room in town, that young lady would have had to relist and I would have been allowed to play my turn. I'll never go back to this place because of the disparate treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: beachlover2141
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at South Point and it was great. The rooms are really nice and super large. We were on the 23rd floor and the view was nice. The casino and lobby are nice. We ate at a mexican restaurant that was fantastic and got free margaritas. Of course they had little alcohol in them, but they were free. We also ate at Primarily Prime Rib and it was good as well. The shuttle to and from the airport was a lifesaver, but be sure and call ahead and make reservations for it. The only bad thing I can think of is that it is kind of out of the way. We took a shuttle to the strip one day and that was not too bad, $8 per person for all day. We then took a taxi to Fremont street one night at it cost us $40 one way. If you just want to go to a nice casino, with good restaurants and lots to do and stay in a really nice room that is reasonably priced, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Love South Point”
Reviews.Author: PamS18
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here multiple times. Each one was fantastic. The rooms are large and very clean and the bathroom is also large (plenty of countertop space and a separate room for the toilet and bathtub). The casino is huge and very bright, not dark like some. We love eating at the Oyster Bar, Miguels and Steak n Shake (the only place my husband wiil eat a hamburger). When we stay we usually stay 2-3 nights and can easily find plenty to keep us busy. I love to play the slots and would much rather play here than on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Noodle411
Reviews.Content: Aug. 2011 -- We stayed one night at the South Point Hotel only because we'd be staying at the timeshare next door (The Grandview) the rest of the week. My husband and I LOVE the South Point -- besides the casino, they have a bowling alley, movie theater, swimming pool, and spa. The location was ideal for us because it was right next door to The Grandview, away from the crowd and noise of the strip. We also discovered another close-by casino called The M Hotel & Casino. The deluxe room we booked was beautiful, clean, and romantic feeling. Best part, it was only $80. On previous trips, we used the movie theater (we saw one of the Resident Evil movies in XD -great sound and picture) and the spa (I Love the Spa!). My favorite thing about the spa was the "hydro room," which has a sauna, steam room, jacuzzi, small swimming pool, and my favorite, the Cascading Waterfall -- just stick your sore shoulder under that super strong water pressure just before your deep tissue massage and you're all set. My husband has used the barber shop a couple of times for a haircut -- old school barbers, they even trim your eyebrows with a small comb and a small pair of scissors. So many choices for eating establishments, including an occasional hot-dog stand, which may have a looooong line, but for 75cent hot-dogs, can't beat it. Our new favorite eating place is the Steak n Shake. Also on this recent trip, we ate a few times at our favorite 24hr Coronado Cafe (love the midnight to 6am breakfast deals). We also fell in love with seafood selection at the Garden Buffet, which includes Mimosas on weekend brunch days. My advice: Sign up for the comp card (you'll automatically get it if you stay at the hotel) and there may be a lot of coupons in it for you like they gave us -- free bottle of wine, free coffee, free buffet meal, etc. http://www.southpointcasino.com

Reviews.Title: “Super Comfy!”
Reviews.Author: Sassybratt
Reviews.Content: I booked a standard two queen bed room. Upon arrival we were told they did not have any standard rooms available and we were being upgraded (no extra charge of course). They upgraded us to a one bedroom suite....only problem was there was one kind size bed. Housekeeping at the hotel seems to do a great job, every inch of the place was very clean. The room was nice and all the furniture was Thomasville. I would skip their breakfast buffet. The price was reasonable but food was not very good. Location isn't too far from the strip and the casino area was fairly large. Really convenient to get to....freeway has an exit that drops you at the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Great except for one glitch”
Reviews.Author: 1__JL__1
Reviews.Content: We were put in a handicap-accessible room even though we requested a regular room. The room configuration was horrible, with no counter space in the bathroom. The shower ended up flooding the entire place. It took them several hours to relocate us, and we lost an entire day in Vegas. The new room was great - I wish that was the only room I knew! Note - there's no refrigerator in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Secret Gem of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: michelledancy1974
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great hotel that is hidden away off the strip. The rooms were great. Great customer service staff. Didn't know what to expect with being used to staying on the strips. Great price and Great room. Hotel has movie theater and bowling alley on site and we tried them both.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, away from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: prubin9
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel with nice roomy accommodations. It's about a ten or fifteen minute drive to the strip, so beware. It's off by itself and there's nothing else around. Great restaurant in the lobby--Don Vito's.

Reviews.Title: “A valid alternative to The Strip”
Reviews.Author: CarloLivorno
Reviews.Content: First of all I've to say that if You want to avoid the Strip hustle and bustle this is a valid alternative. We (as a family of four) were at 8th floor in a large double queens room, always perfectly cleaned from the housekeeping service with a view not so beautiful but anyway acceptable. The location is 4/5 miles off The Strip, but it's easy to get there (The Strip, I mean)....and you need to go because, ok The South Point 's got plenty of fun resources, but after a great game at the bowling court, and a movie in the great Theatre inside ( and a dive in the....too small swimming pool...but the spa is ok) you need to go. We also tried the Buffet Restaurant and it's ok, great value. Steak 'n' shake it's ok too, but far from the standard quality of the others Restaurant of the same chain. We tried it in many places around US and...this is far away from original (I had a 'Frisco Melt' and.......it seemed another kind of sandwich...but anyway Shakes are ok). Another plus is the vicinity to Premium Outlet, very convenient for huge shopping bargains. Last plus of this Hotel is 'The Club' card with its very convenient vouchers. To get it it costs only to queue for a couple of minutes and that's it (it's free).

Reviews.Title: “Equestrian Facilities Great, Rooms Great, Casino Smokey”
Reviews.Author: karenosh
Reviews.Content: I went Celebration 2011, the Andalusian Horse Championships, Everything that had to do with the convention was fantastic, I was really impressed. Also my room was huge especially for the price but the Casino was smokey and there was no quiet corner, super noisy. The staff in the restaurants were well trained and the food was so so. The free breakfast coupons helped a lot.

Reviews.Title: “NO MAJOR COMPLAINTS”
Reviews.Author: I-HATE-DISHONESTY
Reviews.Content: This hotel was OK. The rooms were great. Amenities were complete. Housekeeping was good. Breakfast buffet was cheap $5.99) and big and reasonable quality (not fantastic). Pool was excellent. Location was a short 6 minute to the strip, 10 minutes to the COnvention centre. Valet service was excellent. Only if internet access was cheaper or better yet...included. They charged me $5 to hand me the UPS box of business cards. So... you do pay for every service. But still it was not outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “"ANOTHER GREAT STAY" AT SOUTH POINT !!!”
Reviews.Author: FLORIDATRAVELLOR
Reviews.Content: Once again, my husband, Jack and I took a trip to Vegas and we stayed at South Point. The room, as always, is so comfortable and pleasant - there is a coffee maker, hair dryer, clothes iron, etc = all the amenities that you would expect to find in a hotel room. I needed a fridge and almost immediately got one placed in our room. I always play the 100 Hand Poker Slot Machine and won some of the monies back that I left the last time = I was very happy ! We ate at the buffet, which has a tremendous variety of foods from all around the world and, all delicious ! For women who 'need' to go shopping, there's a Marshalls, Ross, grocery stores, etc, just down the street and so conveniently located from the hotel. Otherwise, if you would stay where all the other cluster of the hotels are about 3 miles north on the 'Strip", you have to fight conjestion, traffic and drive a greater distance to go shopping. So, once again, "Another great stay" at South Point Hotel, Casino and Spa !

Reviews.Title: “great value for overnight stay passing through vegas”
Reviews.Author: kniegge5
Reviews.Content: I don't gamble much but joined their players club and was given a great coupon book full of discounts at buffet and free bottle of wine with buffet purchase. Pool & Hot Tub were excellent as well. Rooms were clean and very large.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Here Many Times”
Reviews.Author: eeghost
Reviews.Content: Considering I have stayed here on at least 10 occasions, I thought I should finally review the joint. I have been coming to Vegas since I was a kid and living a mere 3 1/2 hours away, I have been hundreds of times. I've stayed in at least half the hotels in and around Vegas. While South Point is at the end of the strip, I find it convenient. Since I have experienced the strip on numerous occasions, I don't feel the need to be in the middle of the chaos. South Point is really reasonable with large rooms, a flat screen TV and great hotel amenities. The rooms are not high end, but comfortable. It's very easy to get around. The pool area is really nice with a great giant whirlpool and plenty of seating. The spa is one of my favorites and I have been to many. It's never crowded and has a steam room, dry sauna, whirlpool, a tepid pool and this high powered water tub that shoots a large volume of water onto your neck and shoulders. They have different scented themed showers with toiletries. I just wish I could get my husband to go to the co-ed section. It looks like fun. The buffett has great food and is pretty inexpensive. There's a large store inside that sells a good selection of wines, beers and liquor for as cheap as you're going to get. There's a really good steak house next to the italian restaurant. Good lobster bisque and table side salad service. My son loves the bowling, movies and arcade. They give you a good coupon book upon arrival for free drinks, buffet, popcorn and bowling. I just found this place to be a good value without it feeling like you're staying in a dump. If you're not looking for super luxury, this is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Great when our timeshare is unavailable”
Reviews.Author: Rikayah P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here because our timeshare was not available for a last minute weekend trip. I read the other tripadvisor reviews and was optimistic. This hotel does not disappoint!!! The price was great (especially for a weekend). The room was large and clean. Service was excellent. The hotel had a variety of restaurants, (make reservations though). And, the front desk didn't even charge us for the fridge (we needed it for my 2 year old's milk)!!! The children's pool was also great (only 2 feet deep). Would definitely recommend & would stay here again if my timeshare is unavailable.

Reviews.Title: “No Refrigerator”
Reviews.Author: World Passport
Reviews.Content: The room is quite spacious and clean. Bed is comfortable. A/C is quite. There is a coffee maker in the room. Unfortunately, there's no refrigerator. Separate vanity from shower/toilet area. The casino is quite big too. A lot of poker machine slots. If you join their player club, they will give you coupons for free desserts in their few restaurants. One coupon is even good for a free breakfast or lunch buffet. Just like most buffet food, they are not that good. Food in their cafe is better.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review on South Point Casino / The Truth !!”
Reviews.Author: Larry N
Reviews.Content: Just spent 6 nights at this 4 star hotel .. My overall rating was very good . The Goods ... The gaming at South Point was excellent .. Great variety of games .. Cornado cafe was ok but service at times was suspect as far as the servers . Food ... Breakfast was good .. Dinners fair .. The Room was not really 4 star quality in my honest opinion .. The Shower Spray was very light which is a turnoff to the wife and I . The Picture on the 42" plasma TV was terrible !! The AC was very fair .. When we checked in they offered us a view of the mountains for an extra $10 a day in which we agreed to take advantage of but in all honesty when I'm staying in your Casino for six nights that should have been a no cost upgrade instead the $10 a night extra expense ..

Reviews.Title: “Only place for me in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Rog62
Reviews.Content: Love the South Point. This is the third time I’ve stayed here in three years. I always stay for two or three nights at the end of my holiday in the Southwest. I picked the South Point as I got fed up with paying over-inflated prices to stay in an average on-Strip casino room. The rooms here are big, clean and cheap. Yes, it is quite a trip to the Strip, but if you’ve got a car or want to use their free shuttle bus service – what’s the problems? If you want a guide to taxi costs, last year we went to see the Jersey Boys (wow – superb) at the Bellagio and it cost us $25 there and $27 back (ex. tip). The restaurants at the South Point have always been good, with Don Vito’s Italian being exceptionally good. Unfortunately, I made the mistake this year of eating one night at the Steak ‘n Shake. I ordered a cheese and bacon burger and got a cheese burger. The burger itself was much smaller than I thought it would be and very thin. The friers were tiny, very crisp and just warm – as was the burger. Finished burger in about 5 min and was so glad to escape.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, decent restaurants, ok casino, but...”
Reviews.Author: ReflectionsByErika
Reviews.Content: After staying in a few on-strip and off-strip hotels, both extravagant and basic, I would say that South Point falls somewhere in between. The rooms are nice, clean and simply stated. The staff was polite and accommodating. The restaurants and casino were average. But... There's just something the South Point is missing. It seems not only disconnected with the rest of the Vegas vibe, but it also felt very bland and uninteresting. There's no excitement there, nothing seems to grab your attention to stay there. Because of that, we spent all of our time elsewhere and only slept there. Other hotel/casinos we've stayed at have kept us there all day with their events and fun atmospheres making it nice at the end of the day just to go up to your room and relax before heading out. It was kind of a let down after being so excited to go to Vegas, only to get there and have it not be what I expected. In a word, it's just 'meh'.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel 15 minutes from the strip”
Reviews.Author: james c
Reviews.Content: This casino and hotel only has one problem it's location, other than that I would recomend to anyone. I lked the hotel room it was quiet with a comfortable bed, a large bathroom and it had easy access to the pool and casino. The hotel as a number of dining choices from geat burger place, an ecellent deli, an ok buffet, also a mexican and steak restaurant i

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: BoltzMan
Reviews.Content: With so many superior qualities, it's hard not to write a glowing review of South Point Casino and Hotel. It's so close to being a "5" that it makes you wonder why they don't go the last few yards to win. This is a quality operation: The large rooms, filled (but not overly so) with quality furniture, flat screen TVs, large bathrooms, and all the basic amenities (including wall safes, high-speed Internet/WiFi - but see below - and inroom coffee that tasted good) make it a pleasure to enter the room. A large bed, with quality double-sheeting, nice pillows and decorative drape was inviting, and even more so when extra pillows arrived within 10 minutes of a phone call. Housekeeping was excellent; this was on of the cleanest and best maintained hotel rooms I've ever seen. The rest of the hotel and casino are inviting, too: Three pools (one a massive, but attractive, hot tub and another for kids) were delightful, with a good snack bar, plenty of lounges to relax on, and friendly staff. The casino was nearly smoke free, and restaurants were excellent, particularly the Steakhouse, with one of the best filet mignons I can remember. Bowling and a 24-theater movie facilty (with open captioning for hearing impaired!!!) and a large equestrian center made this a good all-around family resort. Every member of the staff smiles, and is welcoming and helpful. That made it a friendly and warm place to be, something that is rare in Vegas. What's not to love? A few things that should be easily changed: First, the main pool either is filled with salt water or isn't treated; it tastes like the ocean, which is hundreds of miles away. That's a major problem, and one that should be quickly fixed. Another is the annoying fee ($13 a day) for internet service; while it's a disincentive to stay in your room and surf the 'net, instead of going downstairs to gamble - and help the place make money - it's also a serious irritant in this day of laptops, tablets and smartphones. Better they should modestly raise the very-reasonable room rate and provide WiFi at a free or nominal price. If you're not looking for hip clubs or resort shopping - both of which you can get to in 10 minutes with the hotel shuttle to the Strip - this place is almost perfect, and certainly perfectble. One hopes that Management will finish the job.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Value and excellent service but the food sucked!”
Reviews.Author: v h
Reviews.Content: The pictures of this hotel really does not give it justice........this hotel is massive...i mean MASSIVEEEE...please bring comfy shoes. The front desk was great, they even gave me a free frig for my medicine due to my health issues. Loved my hotel room, it was pretty and clean. Had fun playing slots and black jack.....even got my breakfast comp...even though I return the food b/c it tasted so bad. Honestly, my only complaint about this hotel was the food options....to be fair...I only ate at the Baja and Coranda (sp?)....because the food was soooo bad at both...I didnt try any other options. This hotel, if they get the food right........would be one I would return to again and again. This hotel has the opportunity to be a location you dont have to leave. They have bowling, a movie theater and tons other stuff. If it wasnt for the bad food.....and my desire to see Gladys Knight.....I would have never left the hotel. I have read that some believe this hotel is far from the strip...actually its down the street...maybe 6 to 7 blocks...nothing I would walk....but it seems like only 3 when your driving. This year the strip was SO crowed.......made me thankful i had a car this time. Also a heads up for those new to vegas...the strip has a parking lot that only cost $5 to park and their is a discount ticket place right door from the lot that I was able to get concert tickets at a fraction of the cost. The parking lot is near the Hard Rock Cafe....NOT the Hard Rock hotel. The discount ticket place is to the right of the lot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Partyoffivefromsocal
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 3 nights for a basketball tournament. In a nutshell, the only thing that I was not satisfied with was that there were no refrigerators or microwaves in the hotel room. Having 3 kids and staying for 3 nights, I felt this was necessary but I was not prepared and didn't find this out until the day before we got there. Besides that, the rooms were spacious, the pool was very very nice (that was the highlight), the dining was good and there was a good selection, and the hotel was clean. I would stay here again only if they put refrigerators and microwaves in the rooms. It was quite a hassle having to bring a cooler and put ice in it every day. But if you're okay with that, and you want to be away from the strip, then I would recommend it. It's very family-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday with Family”
Reviews.Author: Bellaindira
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this trip and hotel. It was nice and clean, everyone one nice and curteous. Alot of things to do for the whole family, they have a show in the evening for adults, and theres a theatre, a bowling alley and the pool for the kids. I LOVED the fact that we are able to use the hot tub all through out the night, unlike some hotels on the strip where the pool area is closed at a certain time. They do have a disclaimer in the door stating you are swimming at your own risk because theres no life guard on duty. Not only did I enjoy the buffet and the great steak and egg special at 3am but I love the gaming, I played a couple of hours on a table and won money to pay for the whole trip!. I will always come to this hotel, cleaner than some hotels on the strip. The only bad part is that it is about 10 minutes away from he strip driving distance, andthat you have to pay for the shuttle they have to take you to the strip. But other than that it was great! And the prices are not that bad either

Reviews.Title: “good buy for your money”
Reviews.Author: advising
Reviews.Content: The rooms at south point las vegas, are huge and comfortable. Affordable with flat screen tv, separate room with shower. Very spacious hotel

Reviews.Title: “Decent value but poor attitude of management and horrible margaritas”
Reviews.Author: barizzo
Reviews.Content: Rooms are decent, certainly a cut above Motel 6 but it's obvious they try hard to be more than they are, which is an out of the way alternative to Strip hotels with a heavy emphasis on locals. One word of caution: If you book a room that says "no view," believe them - no view means a view of a big yellow wall, and if you're lucky, an occasional dump truck or two. Get 6th floor or higher and you'll be fine. The casino is VERY smoky. For whatever reason, this property has never figured out the secret to eliminating 98% of the smoke like upscale resorts such as Aria, the Wynn, etc. have done. I wanted to play some poker here because it is known for being frequented by very bad local players but I was highly offended by the poker room management so much so that I checked out of the property one day early. They have a very sourpuss attitude. The managers are from "back east" as we like to say which means that they are very gruff and think nothing of it. In my situation, the manager on duty allowed a very pretty younger woman to play ahead of me although my name clearly was at the top of the wait list (I had already waited 35 minutes). This was inexcusable and never would happen at Aria, the Wynn, etc. The poker room itself is pretty much deserted most of the time. There were only 3 tables playing at 4pm on a weekday afternoon. Who knows, maybe I'm not the only person they've offended? In any event, if you can get a higher level room for $50 or less, then it is a decent value. The resort fee is only $6 but doesn't get you much. They give you coupons you can use on the property including one free breakfast or lunch at the buffet, which is average, at best. But they do have a seafood bar that is pretty cool with awesome crab legs. The tex-mex restaurant upstairs was disappointing. The free margarita at dinner was the worst margarita I have had in my life, period. I could only take 2 sips then sent it back. The rice was dry and sticky - indicative of a Taco Bell approach to cooking that really should have no place at any Las Vegas resort. At least the beans were good but the enchiladas were so-so. Other than the poker room management, staff was friendly and helpful. Overall, I would rate this as a slightly below average place to stay, like a 2.5 stars, but it is more family friendly than most other places, except for the smoke!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: captmorgnsgrl
Reviews.Content: We had been wanting to stay here since it opened so we decided to stay for a night here before checking in to our other hotel. I really liked this place, it is open, clean and they keep the drinks coming while your gambling. The room accomodations were excellent. The room was clean and had internet available in the room for an additional charge. They had plenty of towel and provided and in room safe, iron, hair dryer and toiletries. They had a coffee maker in the room with enough coffee for two. I also bring extra creamer and suger as there are never enough. But I think if you needed more you could call thedesl and it would be provided. Several dinning options that are well worth the money. The garden buffet was really nice and worth the value.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: mudd_stuffin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on an extended long weekend (Sat-Tues) for $40-$70 per night. Moneywise, the best part is that there is no resort fee at this hotel although high speed internet is $12.99 per 24 hour period. Overall, the place was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Waaay ouuut theeere!”
Reviews.Author: lisbat
Reviews.Content: South Point itself is fine, nothing great, just fine. It is waaay off the strip, so if you want a little p&q (relitively, but who goes to Vegas for that!) it's good. The shuttle driver did drop me off at the Convention Center, not a regular stop, so big tip for him! :o) The rooms are large and QUIET, not too run down, again for Vegas. We won our cab faire back on the penny slots, so good there. Food was fine, no complaints. All in all a good value for the money, but probably won't stay there again. Too much "shuttle time" for me & smoky.

Reviews.Title: “Value!”
Reviews.Author: End412
Reviews.Content: This was about my thirtieth trip to Vegas and before this trip, I always stayed on the strip. Now that my son and daughter-in-law live out there, they recommended South Point. They often play Bingo, poker and the slots there as it is closer to their home. for about a third of what I usually pay, South Point was great. On a par with a Hilton or Doubletree. Small pool area and the outdoor restaurant wasn't open but otherwise just great.

Reviews.Title: “great place to be”
Reviews.Author: Tanja1968
Reviews.Content: great hotel. we stayed for 3 nights, the room was quite large, everything was clean and tidy. check in prozess was quick. the hotel is a bit off the strip but a shuttle bus is going to and from the strip every hour. if you like to go to the strip but want to go home to a bit quiteness this hotel is perfect. food is great and gym, spa and pool facilities are spectacular. would definetly go back there

Reviews.Title: “Great Buffet and Pool”
Reviews.Author: FastEddie9999
Reviews.Content: The kids loved the pool. The breakfast buffet was great, about $6 if a "club" member. The rooms were large and had a good size bathroom. A great stay for a very reasonalble price on weekdays.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise…surprise”
Reviews.Author: AcolyteNS
Reviews.Content: Had initial reservations staying off the strip, but not anymore! Stayed here with the kiddos during their Spring Break on our way to the Hoover Dam and Lake Mead so location and exposure to the undesirables at the main strip was a much welcome benefit. Parking, check-in was a breeze and got an awesome pool view on the top floors and room was big and very comfy. Nice amenities – played bowling, used the pool and Jacuzzi but did not get a chance to watch movies. Ate at Shake n’ Steak and got astounding burgers and shakes. Also ate at the Grand Buffet for breakfast and it was average. This may be our “official” hotel/casino at LV. Can’t beat the pros and price! Oh yeah, almost forgot – Hoover Dam and Lake Mead were awesome!!! Perfect weather and the kids had so much fun feeding the Carp in Lake Mead…

Reviews.Title: “IT'S ALL HERE”
Reviews.Author: rebeldiva
Reviews.Content: From fantastic coffee...food and great rooms which are clean it is all at South Point. My girlfriends and I stayed here last January..boy, did we have fun. Bowling alley, movie theatre, and a variety of restaurants. The buffett is fantastic for lunch..and the coffee shope divine at all hours. My bjsband and I have stayed here as well. We had so much fun, we even joined a poker tournament, Fun, fun, fun.

Reviews.Title: “My son had an accident - no help from the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christina R
Reviews.Content: We had a very bad experience at this hotel - which ruined the rest of our USA vacation. We were given a handicap room (eventhough we were not handicapped). As the is not a thresfold under the door in a handicap room, the hotel as mounted a metal bar instead - in order to close the open space between the door and the floor. My son - age 7 - went to answer the door, when someone else in our familiy was knocking it. My son was barefoot, and the door/metal bar went all the way on top of his foot. As the bar was bend it worked almost like a knife. Therefore my son got a 5 cm wound - open to the bone. Security came within 5 minutes (great) and removed the metal bar to avoid further accidents. We went to the hospital and Jacob got 5 large stitches and were told to sit still and stay at home for 7 days. Not very easy when you're on a vacation on the other side of the planet. Next morning we spent until lunchtime having the hotel giving us a wheelchair, so we very not totally stuck in our room. Very bad service. I went home to Denmark two days later, and the rest of our familiy went on to Death Valley, Segoia and San Francisco. Now South Point says it is not their fault??? All communication with their security manager has been very difficult and I am ANGRY with the poor service. They didn't even send the boy a box of candy, a game for his Nintendo or just SOMETHING? Very lousy service which I did not expect. It ruined the rest of our vacation and gave my son a large scar for the rest of his life.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Vegas Hotel and we always stay there”
Reviews.Author: lvqween
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the BEST! The location is great, right at the beginning of the strip and freeway close. If you don't want to valet your car there is a self-park lot that is close to the entrance. The food venues are the greatest, especially the cafe! There is a multiplex movie theater if you want to take a break from the casino and see the latest release. The bell desk also has a list of area tourist locations, such as the Valley of Fire, which have directions and approx. mileage. If you book a package that includes a coupon book there are some free-bees, discounts, and 2 for 1 coupons. If not, you can earn some for a future visit. The only suggestion I can offer to the management is to keep the pool open longer. We were unhappy to find out it closed at 8 when it was still light outside and hot. Also there were a lot of kids earlier in the day. The beautiful rooms we had made up for it though. The room was spacious and beds comfortable. And the icing on the cake was that there were NO RESORT FEES! I hope they keep this policy!! We had out of town guests that insisted on staying further in on the strip,the month prior to this, and surprise resort fees were added to our cost upon arrival. We LOVE THE SOUTHPOINT HOTEL and will always stay there.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: rjcro
Reviews.Content: Spent a lovely week-end. The resort is off the strip but had everything you needed. nice restaurants and the casino was not over crowded. They also have great happy hour specials and a cheap but good graveyard breakfast. The hotel was clean and the rooms were spacious. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Love this slightly off the strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jsilver3
Reviews.Content: Great prices, great rooms, you really never have to leave the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the strip, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Jfoo323
Reviews.Content: While this hotel doesn't have the pizazz or opulence of the hotels on the strip, this is a nice hotel. It's not far from the strip, and since we had a car, this was not a problem. I believe there is a shuttle that would take you to/from the strip but not sure of the cost. This hotel has everything you would need and then some.
