Good variety to the restaurants, there is a bowling alley and movie theatre, and tons of parking. The pool is gorgeous! Rooms were very quiet and big with comfy beds. Bathroom area was great with a separated toilet / shower area. We were travelling with kids so we appreciated being away from the noise of the strip. Downside is you had to pay for Internet, $12 per day PER DEVICE which is crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location I would return”
Reviews.Author: homer17402
Reviews.Content: Check in and out was quick and easy. I felt the room was very clean, but I did kill two bed bugs. I checked the beds closely and did not see any others. The front desk responded appropriately. The pool is very nice. It is a large casino hotel. Parking is not very convenient but free. There is no resort fee. Internet is 12 bucks a day.

Reviews.Title: “Off Strip Treasure”
Reviews.Author: Cowpiggymoo
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at South Point for 3 nights and we LOVED it!!! The Hotel is off the Strip, but not far from the Strip. The Hotel offers so much more than just the Casino. The restaurants were not too pricey and the variety of restaurants gave really good options/choices. There is a Movie theater, bowling alley and Equestrian center. The Hotel is also close to the South Premium Outlet Mall and Town Square. We would definitely stay at South Point again on our next visit to Vegas! VIVA LAS VEGAS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Very Impressive”
Reviews.Author: MagnaFox
Reviews.Content: Rooms were spacious and clean, some distance from the Strip, but that's not always a bad thing. Liked best - everything size, pool hotel. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Don't tell anyone about this place...”
Reviews.Author: R77556
Reviews.Content: because it may become too popular. We had visited South Point on prior trips to Las Vegas and, after reading the other reviews on Trip Advisor, decided to spend a few nights here. We spent three nights here and two nights at the Golden Nugget which is reviewed separately. In short, our stay was wonderful. South Point is a clean, cheery and very friendly place with a good vibe. From check in to housekeeping, the staff was very friendly. It's considered a "locals" casino so the emphasis is on friendly service as opposed to the "wow factor" that you would find on the Strip. This can work especially well if you are more interested in great value instead of volcanoes, pirate ships and Venetian canals. Our room was on the 22nd (of 25) floor overlooking the mountains and a bit of the pool. At $20 extra, we didn't opt for a Strip view. The room was large, bright, and well decorated with newer furniture. The bathroom had a separate tub/toilet area. Bed & linens were above average and the flat screen TV was nice. Elevators were quick. The casino is huge, well lit and uncrowded. It is ringed with restaurants ranging from a deli & Steak and Shake to an upscale Steakhouse. On the 2nd floor you'll find a Bingo Hall, bowling alley & multiplex cinema. Certainly plenty to do here. In my opinion, the high points of South point are: a friendly place, clean, comfortable room, good water pressure in the shower (a must for any hotel), a surprisingly inexpensive gift shop (beer was available for less than it cost at home) The two drawbacks to staing here are the location (get a rental car) and the casino can get a bit smokey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price. A Total Destination.”
Reviews.Author: jwey
Reviews.Content: South Point is located at the very South Point (hence the name) of the Strip, Don't consider this hotel if you plan to walk around the Strip. It's at least two miles south of the next hotel. With this being said, it has comfortable accomodations and appears to be quite "kid friendly" with a large pool, bowling alley and movie theater located on the property. It has a poker room which I found to be a little too friendly with the locals, not particularly welcome to outsiders.When I was there they played 2/4 limit holdem and 1/2 no limit. They could not seem to keep a 3/6 game going. It could have just been the day. Mid week in August. When you check in they give you a value book good for a vairiety of things...not just gambling. You can get free WiFi if you bring your laptop down to the lobby. The Fitness Center costs extra. The price was similar to what you pay in North Las Vegas. Overall, I'd say this was a good place to stay and gave us a jump in the morning as we headed back to Southern California. We totally missed the work traffic. We'll stay again and I'll give the poker room another chance.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best kept secrets of LV!!”
Reviews.Author: JannieBoo
Reviews.Content: Love,Love,Love this hotel. Third time staying here, staff is awesome. Great deals with the coupon books~free bottle of wine!!, free meals,popcorn w/movies... I like the fact that its away from all the hustle and bustle of the strip. Quieter too!! Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Last Minute Stay Turned into a Jewel”
Reviews.Author: Wenderful2011
Reviews.Content: We were on our way home from Vegas when we hit severe traffic and decided to stay one more night. We came up on South Point and decided to take a chance. Right off the bat, they were able to accommodate our family of 4 for a $52 dollar rate. Not having high expectations, when we entered our room, it was absolutely beautiful and very roomy compared to more expensive hotels on the strip. Floor to ceiling windows, plasma tv, large bathroom, very comfortable beds...wow! This place also has everything a family with teens needs - has a movie theater and bowling on site....gorgeous pool area. The staff was very friendly. The slot areas were nicely spread out with many of our favorites and a variety of coin choices. I wished we had stayed here for our entire trip and will be coming back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, well run, spacious, but smoky & too far from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Bregita19
Reviews.Content: I used the 72-hour special to book our rooms for $35/night (Sun-Wed). Friday & Sat nights were like $60. Sounds like a fabulous deal in Vegas, but they said the Rio and I think Bally's are that cheap also. We exited door #9 from McCarran and grabbed the first Sedan driver (if they're standing outside their cars, they're available, and you don't have to pay for the wait time while you get luggage and such, which you would have to pay for if you reserved ahead of time). The chauffeur was very kind (spoke ENGLISH), and we paid a little extra to drive us near the strip for a few minutes before delivering us to South Point. Being Friday night, the Strip is basically a parking lot for several blocks, so he wound in and around and we got our first taste of Vegas. I was very pleased. Then we headed south for the 10-15 minute drive down Las Vegas Blvd to South Point, where there is nothing more to look at than an IHOP and outlet mall. We were instantly impressed with the size and glamour of the hotel itself. However, walking in, we hit a wall of smoky haze (again, Friday night) and had to detour around a rennovation area to find the front desk. I had called the week before with questions about the airport shuttle, daily shuttle to the Strip, etc., and my answer was "they'll give you all that when you check in." They did not give us anything more than our room key. It wasn't a deal-breaker, but it would have been much more helpful if they had at least offered the schedules or a Las Vegas guidebook or something. The room was huge and clean and in great condition. (For those who have traveled with kids, I could have fit a playpen and 3 sleeping bags on the floor next to the King bed, and STILL had room to get to the bathroom in the middle of the night!) Each morning the shuttle to the Strip leaves every hour, more or less on the hour, and the drivers are friendly enough. Note: The shuttle is run by Ritz Transportation. They are a separate company, and you have to pay cash! Not truly a "South Point" shuttle! (This is not a review of Ritz, but if you stay at South Point and want to see the rest (or any) of Vegas, you need to know that.) The pool area is clean and gorgeous, though the smoothed-stone sidewalks get VERY hot, enough to burn feet. Beach towels are available just as you walk out, after you pass the doorman who checks for room keys before you go out. We only swam twice, and each time the water was chilly when we first got in, and took a minute to get used to. The pool is salt water, not chlorine, which also takes some getting used to. The main pool has a max depth of about 4.5 feet, plus there's a kid pool which is 2 feet or so. Then there's a large lagoon of a hot tub, which is an odd idea when it's always more than 90 degrees outside. Maybe it's more popular in the winter. We did not try the restaurants, though the Primarily Prime Rib was rated very highly here on TA and is inside the hotel itself. We DID go see a movie in the theater (HarryPotter 7.2) and it was clean, well-run, good sound, etc. Everything we expected of a modern movie theater. Better concessions than our local theater. The bowling alley is huge and not terribly smoky - big open space for it - and the snack stand just between the movie theater and bowling alley (beside the arcade) has YUMMY chicken strips. Just saying. Room service was spectacular, maid service was impeccable, but the bell desk was rude and NOT helpful. I'm not sure what their purpose is, but we got a lot more help from the valets and OTHER hotels' concierges. Don't call them for help, call the front desk. We watched several movies in the room (X-Men First Class, Midnight in Paris, and Thor) while they are still in theaters. They were digital movies, so you can rewind, pause, etc., or exit and save it til the morning! Movies are kept until noon the next day. So my husband finished watching X-Men after I fell asleep, but I finished it while he showered the next morning. I've never seen that before and it was fabulous. The technology, not just the movie. We did try the Garden Buffet and it was not spectacular, but we got full and it was a Vegas experience. The Round Table Buffet at Excalibur was MUCH better. Speaking of Excalibur - beware the body snatchers: very pleasant people in suits that approach and ask if you're in town for a couple days and offer to "set you up with some free tickets." They offer show tickets and end up sending you to the Grandview (next door to South Point!) for a tour and Timeshare sales pitch. They said 2-3 hours but we were there for 4. Blech. Lie to them or just run the other way. I WILL say that we got $25 tickets to Tournament of Kings at Excalibur, which was awesome, as well as $150 in vouchers for dining at MGM, Luxor and Excalibur. Not sure it was worth 4 hours of our first day in Las Vegas. Oh well. Have fun, and good luck!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet room”
Reviews.Author: gracecl88
Reviews.Content: We went on a weekday to get the great rates. Room was on the 11th floor, it was clean and quiet. We received 2 coupon books upon check in, and in it, you get a free breakfast or lunch buffet. We opted for the lunch buffet, and it was very good. We were supposed to get a king bed and a sofa, but the bed looks more like a queen size than a king, so it wasn't that comfortable, but other than that, room was spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Casino”
Reviews.Author: ghthird
Reviews.Content: If I were only going to visit a casino, this would have to be the only place I would have to visit. As it was, I had other agenda, so I did visit other casinos all over the city. It's not too far from the downtown Las Vegas area, so I would have to say the location was quite convenient. Restaurants were very good, & the atmosphere was very good as well. I can recommend this casino.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, a little tired”
Reviews.Author: traveler212121
Reviews.Content: Bought strictly on price and got what i paid for. Its a very big place and has a lot to do. A little far from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great value, enough to do.”
Reviews.Author: Foxboy
Reviews.Content: South Point has to be one of the best values in Vegas. Very large comfortable rooms that are easily accessable from any place in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Almost loved it”
Reviews.Author: Catswans
Reviews.Content: Check in was very fast, room was spacious, elvators were very slow. We had to stand in line to use them. Parking garage was too far away to get to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Crowded, Smokey, Noisy”
Reviews.Author: mysources
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at South Point and it was like the Indianapolis 500 but with families. We visited the property when it first opened by Coast Casinos and it was great. Felt private, quiet, alot of locals. But now the new management must be doing promotions up the yin yang and are willing to sacrifice a more pleasant experience for as much business as they can get. Greed plain and simple. The hotel was very noisy. We were kept awake all night with kids running up and down the halls, doors opening and slamming shut at 3 in the morning. Many different cultures staying including an Asian contingent with 10 kids to a family. If you like a smokey, noisy hotel - this is your ticket. If not - find a smaller establishment.

Reviews.Title: “nice option in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: flyhigh832
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, a good option for Vegas. Not in the strip, but that can be a good thing. Rooms were clean and large. Bathroom was spacious, more so than the average hotel bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot to stay for stop through Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cajhawk84
Reviews.Content: Traveling from Park CIty, UT back to San Diego stayed here on the way home. Great value, large rooms, and activities like bowling and movie theatre make it good for families. A bit far from the other end of the strip it isn't ideal for nightlife, but has enough activities to keep you busy.

Reviews.Title: “Far, far away”
Reviews.Author: ecotravellor
Reviews.Content: The Southpoint Casino is very removed from the strip and anything else you may want, with the exception of the big box store malls. Food was edible but nothing great like the other casinos. You must walk through the smokey casino each time you go in and out of the hotel unless you are willing to tresspass on the employee entrance/exit and put up with security reprimanding you for using it. The bed was really uncomfortable. The maid hated us for some reason, even though we did tip her-at first. Our bathroom was never fully cleaned, we foudn the supplies in there unused. She came into the room while my wife was sleeping and stood there until asked to leave, She short-sheeted the bed the next day. Finally our laptop screen was broken while we were out of the room and the hotel refused to accept responsibility. We told the conference organizers that we would not be returning unless they found another venue. It seemed to be a common "suggestion".

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: vmarin01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the SouthPoint Hotel Casino and I must say it was a great family hotel! We booked a suite which had 2 separate rooms (1 for the kids and 1 for us). Both bathrooms had a large soaking tub and separate shower, a kitchenette, living room, several tvs... The hotel also has a bowling alley and movie theater which is very great if you have kids...or not! Yes, the hotel is not on the strip, or a glamourous hotel by any means..but you are at the strip in a matter of a few minutes. You can get a shuttle there or drive-no problemo whatsoever. Personally I would rather spend less on the hotel and more on the shows, restaurants, casinos, etc... This was my third stay at SouthPoint and I plan on staying there whenever we have a family getaway to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “My default Vegas location”
Reviews.Author: JB1983
Reviews.Content: The location of the South Point can be a pro or a con, depending on what you are looking for in your Vegas trip. If you looking to be in the midst of the excitement (chaos) of the strip, this probably isn't your ideal hotel. But, if your Vegas goals include gambling, drinking & relaxing poolside without the major crowds of more centrally located hotels, you'd probably be very happy at the South Point. My husband and I have stayed at the South Point twice and plan to stay again whenever our next trip comes up. The rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable. The staff is super friendly. The prices are more reasonable than the other Vegas hotels where we've stayed. We haven't eaten at all the restaurants at the hotel but the Cafe is good and food at the oyster bar is tasty. The buffet is just so-so (but at least it isn't overpriced!). We've always liked the bars and the barstaff. Though we've the best of intentions to try onsite bowling or see a movie at the onsite theater, we never seem to escape the casino long enough to make it happen. We have made time to lay out by the pool; the area is mellow, though I wish they would restrict hot tub access to adults only. When we do get out of the South Point for an excursion to the strip, the distance isn't bad whether driving, hailing a taxi or taking South Point's shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price, we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: munk67
Reviews.Content: Loved the layout of the casino floor and the ease at which you can get around. Check-in was quick and the elevators are a straight shot from the front doors. We found the valet to be very quick. In a one week stay, I think we waited more than 5 minutes for our car just once. The rooms are over 500 sq ft and have flat screen tvs and a safe big enough for laptops. The Coronado Cafe is open 24 hours and has a large menu with good service. We did order room service one morning and found the prices to be comparable with other Vegas properties. My wife had an 80 minute swedish massage and loved it. She said the spa area is very nice and plans to spend more time there on our next visit. We like to play video poker and there are plenty of machines to choose from throughout the casino. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Wished we had tried it sooner!!”
Reviews.Author: B.C.Heather
Reviews.Content: SouthPoint Casino is a really great place that works hard to get your business. Its only about 10 minutes south up the strip. Airport and car rental 5 minutes away. Great room rates especially Sun - Thru and some good freebies upon check in. We had been staying on the strip and had to check out early. We arrived at SouthPoint expecting to wait until the check in time before we would get our room. We were pleasanty surprized at 9:30 am when we were all checked in. A coupon book at check in had free drinks at the casino bars, free buffet, 1 free bottle of wine with buffet or restaurant purchase. Free coffee at Seattles Best, free margaritas. Bowling coupons and show discounts. Discounted buffet prices with players card. Also free and discounted live shows in there theater. Shows most afternoons and evenings some with dancing. Full movie theatre and bowling alley. Also large arena with events many free to watch. Cutting Horse event while we were there that was really interesting to watch. Seems to have lots of locals and is very busy in the weekends. Lots of familes with kids due I'm sure to the great pool area and bowling and theatre. Lots of outdoor parking and easy to access. We gambled on the strip and never did very well. Sister plays the slots and was winning all the time at Southpoint. Seems like others as well. Good point system with players card. Staff and food all really good. Ate at the buffet , deli and burger & shake cafe all very good and reasonably priced. Before 12:00 each day you can get a bloody mary, mimosa for $1.00 or baileys coffe for $2.00. You don't really have to rent a car if you stay here as they have a good shuttle service to and from the airport. A daily shuttle goes on the hour to the strip and has 3 stops, Excalibur, City Centre or Treasure Island. It costs $8.00 per day for as many times as you want to use it. Return times evey hour as well. Good value if you want to go to the strip and not have to worry about a car rental or taxi. We are frequent visitors to Las Vegas and will definatley return to the Southpoint.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: SweetMagnolia1
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th trip to The South Point for a Cutting event and I am always blown away with the facilities. Amazing value -- even for Vegas and the equine facilities set it apart from any other facility in the United States. They are constantly cleaning to ensure each guest (individual & equine) have a pristine environment during their stay. The owners make it a point to make you feel so welcome and they "get" a hotel should be kid friendly for that part of their market segment. Love this family and love this facility!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous trip!!”
Reviews.Author: shorty0089
Reviews.Content: Came for some rest and relaxation, we weren't disappointed in the least! Played BINGO, the best in town until 2am and then went to the Coronado Cafe for a late nite dinner. How can you go wrong with steak and eggs with all the trimmings for $3.99. The Coronado Cafe has daily specials from midnight to 6 a.m. The kids played midnight bowling for $1.00 a game and they have a big pool. The room was comfortable, clean and cool! It was over 100 outside but never had to go anywhere they have all you need here. They even gave us a late checkout at no extra charge. We will be going again real soon, we miss it already!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: neilandkt_partridge
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay off the strip this is a good choice and the shuttle bus (not free) means there are good links to the main sights. Rooms are large and comfortable but there was a odd smell in our room and the bathroom was not cleaned particularly well. Overall though very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jeng6109
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four days and attended a class reunion. The rooms were nice and everyone was helpful. Banquet room was very nice and the "banquet" dinner was very tasty. Would stay here again. Shuttle to and from the airport was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind the location”
Reviews.Author: Cethis
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my second stay at the South Point. The staff was very friendly. I know there have berm some complaints, but they got the memo when I was there. They have a shuttle to the strip, and it worked for my gf and I. Others might want to consider a car if you stay here. If you want the mega resort experience, this won't be the place for you. If you want a nice place to stay, I can recommend the South Point.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific casino hotel south of town - NICE area of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Outlanders
Reviews.Content: South Point is a new-ish hotel complex- huge equestrian event center-free shows that were great. Casino was crowded and fun. Complex itself attractive, free parking, tip valet, fast bellman. Many restaurants with great coupons that applied to bill or desserts etc that we got at checkin. Staff was great-checkin staff got our boarding passes, with pleasure, upgraded, etc. Food at Don Vitos was wonderful Italian fare-really enjoyed the meal. Room was lovely, great view of the city, large, flat screen-paif internet tho :(--really? Coffee pot in room, no fride Really close to outlets and shopping

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation at South Point (Vegas baby!)”
Reviews.Author: semperfihomes
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days here during my sons BMX tournament. I have to commend South Point for accommodating so many people. There must've been 2500 racers and their families. I ate at 3 of their restaurants during my stay and my fav was a little Asian place in the Casino area, I forget the name..Oyster Bar maybe, but order the Grilled Lobster and Cheese sandwich! This was good and there was no waiting. The arena where they built an indoor MX track was amazing..and air conditioned. Bell service and Valet were on it too. The room was not so great. There was an unpleasant odor in our room and no exhaust fan in the bathroom. After a good shower, the room felt like a sauna. On a good note, we had closed circuit TV in our room to keep track of the 3 days of BMX racing in the Arena. This way we didn't have to sit at the arena on standby for 12 hours waiting for our turn to race. A real plus when you have 2 kids, wife and your father in law with you, and two of them secretly just want to escape to the casino for some gambling. Speaking of gambling, I played a penny machine for 3 hours on the same 20 bucks and won enough at Racebook, betting Ryan Newman (Sprint Cup Race) to cover our trip. I also have to say that I was amazed that when we went bowling at midnite at South Point's allnite bowling alley, the place was packed. I guess nobody sleeps in Vegas. Or maybe because its 110 degrees during the day, they only come out at night. My kids loved it. They loved the arcade, the bowling alley, and they seemed preoccupied with the gift shop too. Oh, lest not forget the Movie Theatre with I cant remember how many screens. This place is huge. If you're taking family to Vegas, South Point is kid friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: FES
Reviews.Content: This property has it's pluses and minuses. At the time I was there property seemed to cater to families. There were a lot of small children around, but well-behaved and never a problem at night. It's location is in a suburban area well away from the Strip. Plusses: The rooms are clean and large. The property is well maintained. The pool is large and very nice. Minuses: Wireless is $13/day and the fitness center is $15/day. There is free wireless in the area of the front desk. The clientele is heavily tilted to the tank-tops-and-tattoos set. Housekeeping never really made the beds. They just pulled the covers up, leaving the sheets beneath untucked and in a mess. It's a nusiance to get to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “very nice rooms! will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Brittstick
Reviews.Content: very clean! the rooms were spacey and the bathrooms were big! I cant waqit to come back. the people were nice and the restaraunts were delicious! the casino was the main part of the trip and it was great! The only let down was that the casino smet strongly of smoke and our shower drained slowly also the window veiw was of another wall! but besides those miner details the stay was great and its a must stay on my agenda!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the money, but the beds could be better”
Reviews.Author: TechGuy1970
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the South Point for four nights while on vacation in Vegas. Overall, this is a great place to stay. The rooms are quite spacious, and the hotel has a lot to offer. We enjoyed the buffet, the cafe, and the Steak and Shake while we were there. The pool was great, and overall the air was clean and not too smoky. The worst part of staying there, in my opinion, were the beds. Ours felt like the mattress had zero padding and needed to be replaced. I would have liked it if there were refrigerators in the room, as we brought our own bottled water, and we didn't use the hotel wireless because of the outrageous fees. If you have kids, the bowling alley, arcade and movie theater are a huge bonus. We found it impossible to get food after midnight there with kids, however, which was a bummer one night that we were there. We like the location because it is close to I-15 which means you can be on the strip in about 10 minutes if you want, or an hour if you drive Las Vegas Blvd. We paid about $40 a night and it was easily the cheapest part of our trip. I would stay at the South Point again when returning to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: roni055
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel off the strip and came across this hotel. Without a reservation we booked Monday thru Thursday for $50.00 a nite the room was big, clean, and the views were fantastic. Would come again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: ryamagishi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at South Point Hotel and Casino approximately 5 times since it's grand opening. The hotel and casino is quite nice, although similar to some casinos in Las Vegas the casino portion of the hotel is a bit smokey. The rooms are clean and quiet since the hotel portion is located in the back and removed from the casino. I really enjoyed their lunch and dinner buffet. The lunch buffet takes place from 11:00 am to 3:00 pm at a very low cost of $7.95. The dinner buffet is $12.95 on most nights and is a little more costly on steak and seafood nights. Their menu consists of basic food from American, Mexican, Chinese and Italian. The menu does not consist of extremely high quality food, however, in my opinion it is still of good and there are many choices to pick from. The only draw back with South Point, the hotel is located very far south on Las Vegas Blvd. better known as the strip. If you plan to stay there, it is best to have a car. However, South Point is noted for bingo tournaments, it's 24 hour bowling alley, movie theaters and its horse shows. Overall, a nice place to stay even if you don't gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: FoodSnob1
Reviews.Content: We always stay at South Point when in Vegas. Very family friendly. Not the best buffet. We always eat elsewhere. Cold pool. Huge rooms. Will continue to go back. Actually .... Will be there tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - nice, clean & lots to do”
Reviews.Author: travelbug4life
Reviews.Content: It's not on the strip, but that's ok. The rooms are fairly big, nice bathrooms w/ toilet & shower in a separate room. no fan to get rid of the steam, etc :-( The view from our rooms (861 & 849) were of no interest, but that's ok, we were just there to sleep. They had a huge high school basketball tourney going on & I thought it was good that in each room they had a list of hotel rules (no bouncing basketballs on the floor, under 18 curfew at 10pm, etc) They have a movie theater, bowling alley & a Steak 'n Shake restaurant (with take out)...plus a lot more, but those were the highlights for our family. Check in was quick, no problems getting a crib, checkout via the TV was super easy. I'd stay here again for sure (unless I wanted to be on the strip). Oh, and the rates were super reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice hotel but away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: nickster99
Reviews.Content: *This review has been submitted by a 35 year old Australian male* Great hotel. Big room. Good price. Nothing to complain about there. It's about a 10 min drive from the strip so if you're planning on going there you'd need a rental car or take a taxi, or the hotel shuttle bus (it costs $8 unlimited per day I think). If you are driving into the strip every hotel has FREE parking - don't get suckered into taking the valet parking (unless you want to of course). The in-room wifi was $12 per day. $20 gets you wi-fi and access to the gym each day (there's NO free gym here). You get a great coupon book in your room too (including 2 vouchers for the lunch buffet). I was here for a skeptics conference and didn't do any gambling surprise surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovethatvegas
Reviews.Content: What a surprise this beautiful hotel was. The large rooms were so clean, the bathroom was huge, and the bed was extremely comfortable. When I got up at 6:00AM Seattle's Best coffee was open and it was very pleasant to stroll through the casino when it was almost empty. I was never overwhelmed by the smell of smoke so they must have a great ventilation system. I tried the buffet which was good and Primarily Prime Rib which was out of this world. The service through the property from front desk staff, housekeeping, restaurtant employees was exceptional. Everyone went out of their way to be helpful and courteous. I can't wait to go back and stay at South Point. It has anything and everything you need to have a wonderful, relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Internet Connection”
Reviews.Author: mikeinsd0415
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good, but be aware that the internet is $12-13 per day per device. It seems a bit archaic in this day and age; just be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms and Easy Off the 15”
Reviews.Author: halobb
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from South Point, after a weekend with a sporting group. I usually coordinate my own groups, but the rates to stay on site where the bowling center was situated was just too good to pass up. First the positives: Coming from LA, this is the first major hotel on the 15. You're not even close to the "strip" but it's only a few minutes up the freeway to get there. You'll be near the South Las Vegas Outlet Mall, and fast food places, gas stations, etc, without the Strip traffic. Rooms are huge. Two queen beds, a working desk, a table and chairs, closets with doors, and a great private bathroom set up. Hot water and great pressure at all hours of the day and night. We were on the Strip side, on the 21st floor, so we had views of planes taking off and landing. The beds were amazingly comfortable and our room was as frigid as we needed it to be the entire weekend. The onsite Seattle's Best had some of the friendliest baristas I've seen. When one found out we were bringing cocoas back up to a couple of our little bowlers, he sent up a few extra chocolate sticks with the drinks. The Del Mar deli was a great option for breakfast sandwiches. A little disappointed with the buffet--both the short breakfast hours and the Saturday "brunch" had us eating away from the hotel more than we wanted to. The kids were introduced to Steak and Shake--the closest one we've seen outside the Midwest. It's got great hours, and it's got a line at all hours, but order "to go" and you'll have a great experience. Primarily Prime Rib had chicken (I'm not a red meat eater) and Turkey Chili and Manhattan Clam Chowder--and all were fantastic. The downside--allow a 15-minute walk from the rooms to the parking garage. This is a real pain when bringing luggage to and fro, or if you forget something from the car. We opted for the parking garage to shield the car from the heat, but the other parking lots were no closer. The hotel was packed with a basketball tournament, so the elevators were full, and the pool area was way too crowded. But there is an in-house bowling center, a movie theatre and an arcade for the kids. $1 bowling after midnite Monday through Thursday. We'd love to see another event in this hotel--it's the most convenient thing in the world to be able to send the kids downstairs without ever leaving the property.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place further away from hustle and bustle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: yipster930
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious, clean, and very nicely decorated. The pool area is also very nice. We ate at the breakfast buffet and it truely was a buffet. It's within driving distance of the strip and is much more family friendly than hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, away from main strip”
Reviews.Author: Melbournetraveller84
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in May 11. Location is well south of main strip but if you are happy with that this hotel must be on your list for value and comfort. Big outlet mall is nearby, and interstate freeway is easily accessible. Very good midweek room rate; enormous, clean and comfortable room as reviewed in T/A, and buffets/restaurants were very good value, good quality, although (presumably in common with all casinos) they are co-located with the unavoidable gambling activities. Didnt try the hotel shuttle to the strip - drove in which took about 30mins in traffic, 15 mins otherwise. However the hotel is very big, and reception and overall service is a bit impersonal. However once you have worked out the hotel 'systems', everything works very smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas On a Budget”
Reviews.Author: arniepalmerfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a week day at South Point Hotel for $55.00, including room tax. There is no resort fee, as almost all other hotels in Las Vegas charge. They avoid having to add this charge by letting you select the extras you need and want to pay for. As an example, it is $13.00/day for internet access, or you can get the business package which gives you access to the fitness center and in-room internet for $20.00/day. South Point is 8-1/2 miles from the strip, shuttle service is offered at $8.00 for an all-day pass. There are frequent pick-ups both at the hotel and at the strip. The rooms are large and clean. The bath has a large area for toiletries and I liked the safety bar over the tub to assist getting in and out for the shower. Their pool is very nice with bar service, but no restaurant, only a snack bar. The snack bar was closed the day we were there to we had lunch at the Coronado Café. Our server, Alexander, was top notch. I had the calf’s liver, with bacon and onion. I haven’t seen that on a menu in a really long while and enjoyed the preparation of the cooks at the Café. My husband had the grilled ham and cheese sandwich and said it was very good. There are several restaurants in the hotel, but not all are open early in the week. We had reservations for dinner at Michael’s, but when we arrived they refused us service. My husband was dressed in well-tailored Bermuda shorts and a dressy silk shirt, but his attire didn’t meet their dress code. He probably would have been served if he had been wearing overalls. We then went to dine at Don Vito’s. I have reviewed this restaurant in a separate review.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Vegas hotel!”
Reviews.Author: traveln4
Reviews.Content: We have been frequent guests of the Southpoint since its opening. Once we stayed there we never went anywhere else, there was no need. The rooms are spacious and clean and convenient for my son who is in a wheelchair. The restaurants are great, buffet would be better with fried chicken, hahaha and they have something for everyone. The bowling alley has $1.00 bowling after midnight with great pizza at the snackbar. The movie theatre is wonderful and the workers are extra friendly. They even give a coupon book with free popcorn, buffets, souvenirs, bottles of wine and discounted coffee. The real treasure to this hotel is the bingo room! The workers are energetic, and it is an hour of nonstop fun. The hot cocoa is delicious! This is the best Vegas hotel for families and people who want to be a short distance from the hustle and bustle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for family with kids”
Reviews.Author: Margut09
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 days at this hotel due to youth bowling tournament and was great. Good food at Garden Buffet, Del Mar Deli and Steak and Shake. We paid around around $600 and worth it. The girls that made the housekeepint at room made a good job. This place is very good for kids, it has too many things to keep them busy and happy. Theater, Arena ( BMX competition), bowling alley, Games room, a great pool. My only complaint is that smell very strong to cigarrette at the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Place”
Reviews.Author: livegood77
Reviews.Content: Althought is a liitle far from the strip, this hotel has everything you need to have a good time in Vegas with your family. Is quiet and rooms are very nice. Like I said the strip is about 10 minutes away, so if you go with friends to enjoy crazy Vegas this place is too far for you. Taxis are available at all times, the ride was about $25.00 each way to the strip, with that extra money you can book a hotel at the strip. Over all was pleasent.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasantly unique Hotel/Casino”
Reviews.Author: drbobgold
Reviews.Content: We probably visit Vegas as frequently as annually, and have stayed at a wide variety of hotels, on the strip, off the strip and in nearby Henderson. From the moment I walked into the airy and brightly lit gaming area to register (you can't get to the registration desk or to your room in any Vegas hotel without passing through gaming) I sensed a much more pleasant and less pressured an environment. Thereafter, I found the room to be large, with an extra sofa, the tv to be modern, and the water very hot. The dealers made playing a pleasure, and all of the food was good, especially the fine dining at Michaels (incredibly expensive if you are not a high roller being comped). I was at a meeting with over 1,650 attendees, and I was impressed with how well the food and beverage department handled our breakfast buffets, and particularly our lunch breaks. At checkout, I did have a concern about my room charges that neither the desk clerk or her supervisor were willing to correct, but a brief email to the manager (who was not yet in for the day) was answered promptly that afternoon and the matter was resolved completely to my satisfaction. I think that it is important to note, in a review such as this, not the negative aspects of a problem, but the fact that management promptly and courteously resolved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for a Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: jcbackfist
Reviews.Content: Southpoint Hotel and Casino is a hidden Gem on the Strip in Las Vegas, NV. The hotel really is on the South Strip past the Airport. They have their own shuttle service. to the airport and back and to North Strip. NICE. The pool and hot tub are open late till 1000 PM. They have 9 resturants now, one is a buffet. Great prices most of the year. Big convention center and arena for many horse shows and BMX racing. They had 5 major events happening at once and only the elevators were kinda full Friday. Casino floor just was expanded to almost double the size. With 2300 rooms it is hard to believe they sold out Friday of our stay. Rooms are big and bathrooms also. Flat screen tv's on the wall. Plenty of parking in a 5 or 6 story parking garage and front lot. Movie theaters, bowling alley, hot dog cart even. They just opened a lounge with a live act. NICE. Try it you'll like it. Spa is big and fitness center is big and has good equipment.

Reviews.Title: “My Only Choice For Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: sunflowerSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It is quite in the rooms, clean, has a nice pool, not a million 20's running around drunk and I love the movie and bowling upstairs. It is a bit more mellow than a hotel on Strip. If you are looking for a getaway hotel, yet still want to enjoy Vegas and all it has to offer, this is the hotel for you! By the way, Staff is fantastic!!!!! We LOVE this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: socalfam4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with my husband and two kids. We had never stayed here before but since we had the kids we thought it would be a more family friendly resort. Price was great, room was spacious and pool was great for the kids. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants but did order a pizza from Del Mar Deli in the resort for a very reasonable price. There is a shuttle that goes to the strip for $8/person and is good for all day. Arcade was awesome for the kids and is right next to the huge bowling alley. All in all, great place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy busy but still a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Eve G
Reviews.Content: Stayed this week and would have to say, check before booking to make sure there is no Junior Bowling Open during your stay. Booked the night because the hotel offered activities for my 12 year old without having to go down to the strip. Unfortunately, no lanes available either day of our stay. The place was crazy busy with the juniors and their families but was still enjoyable. Steak and Shake is a wonderful, inexpensive addition to the dining choices.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, take the free shuttle to the strip and have extra $$ to spend!”
Reviews.Author: greatexpectations076
Reviews.Content: I have a family member who has lived in Las Vegas for 7 years. Over this period of time my family has stayed numerous Hotel/Casinos on and off the strip. During our most recent visit we stayed at South Point Hotel, south of the Strip on Las Vegas Blvd - just off the 15. The hotel offers shuttle service to and from the strip and it is a short ride. Wow! We took advantage of a reduced room rate of $42/night - yes, you read that correctly! We had a large, clean room on the 24th floor with 2 queen beds and a view of the pool. The bathroom is also large with a separate room for the toilet and shower. Dedicated elevators for this tower (floors 15-25) made it a quick ride up from the Casino level. The casino floor has high ceilings and is bright - really a feeling of natural light illuminating everything. The air was clean and smelled fresh - no clouds of cigarette smoke hovering over the tables. Check-in was quick and the reservation clerk was very friendly and helpful, giving us an overview of the hotel in general as well as restaurant recommendations. In fact, this was the friendliest and most user-friendly hotel we have encountered in Vegas. Every employee we encountered had a smile on their face and was quick to ask if we needed anything. There are several restaurants on the premise ranging from a walk-through deli with fabulous take-away desserts, a coffee bar with lightning speed service, 2 steak houses, a Mexican restaurant, Italian Restaurant, a buffet with expansive breakfast choices, a cafe, and a 5-star restaurant offering Continental Cuisine. There is absolutely something for everyone in your group, from children to adults. We ate at the Italian restaurant one evening and received helpful tips on wine and entrees from our servers. Due to an evening engagement, the waiter also asked the kitchen to expedite our food orders. Valet service (we had a car) was also quick, efficient and friendly. Though we didn't use the pool, we could see it from our room. It was lovely - very large and appeared fun for kids through adults. This is a great hotel for singles, couples, and families. Stay here, take the shuttle to the strip and have extra $$ to spend - or keep in your pocket!

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean spacious rooms, lots of 1 and 5 cent slots!!!”
Reviews.Author: donald_daisy1433
Reviews.Content: We extendend our stay for a day before coming home and decided to stay here, rate was ok for a holiday weekend and no min stay was required. Rooms were well done, spacious and comfortable. Wish they provided free internet... didn't want to pay 12.95 for less than a 24 hour stay. Wish they had more kid friendly restaurants that were less high end and more cost concious. Too many fancy restaurants. Pool area was nice, didn't like that you can't take your towel to the room. Did however like that it was open till 10pm.

Reviews.Title: “DREADFUL HOUSEKEEPING, DIRTY ROOMS.”
Reviews.Author: ethnice
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the SouthPoint, it is a beautiful hotel and the rooms are lovely looking. Unfortunately the housekeeping is so bad, skid row has cleaner rooms. There were four of us, two adults and two grandchildren. We had shampoo for the first day, never had shampoo again until I went to get some yesterday. NO backup toilet paper, that's what the kleenex is for. In the 5 days, vaccumed only once. Bath not washed once in the 5 days. I complained to the day manager, Tiffany, I think was her name. Too bad the hotel did not pay for training for this arrogant, indifferent female. She told me that they only replaced shampoo when bottles empty, did that apply to the toilet paper...Friends arranged for a gift certificate for my husbands birthday dinner at Michaels, I wonder where the $200.00 dollars is as we never received and so never ate at Michaels. Poor, poor service, too bad as it is a lovely looking place, but such a let down. Never to return.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a drive, but so worth not being on the strip.!!”
Reviews.Author: XVEGASGIRL
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights due to hubby in a bowling tourney. Had no expectations, but was pleased beyond when I opened our 24th floor pool side room. It was HUGE, clean, was portioned, and so worth the great deal we received with the bowling tourney. The housekeepers were great, always there if you needed anything. The free buffet was of course good, free is always good, but lots of breakfast offerings. Only 2 draw backs...... Smoke was in the casino heavy, and it is a drive being so South, but having been on the strip before, nice to have a quiet place...with a wonderful King bed to curl up on...!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: lormae
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location for three nights in June. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Las Vegas. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. I slept very well after spending a day climbing canyon walls in Zion Nat Park. The restaurants had good food and reasonable prices. Most of the staff were happy to assist customers but, there were several who were either not very friendly or didn't seem to want to be there. The pool area was nice. There were plenty of loungers and the gentleman working the snack bar was very friendly. I didn't use most of the amenities offered by the hotel so I can't comment on those. If I decide to return to the Las Vegas, I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Janeika
Reviews.Content: South Point is a very nice hotel for the money. The room was very nice, spacious, and clean. Although the hotel was not on the main strip, shuttle was provided to get you to and from the strip for a flat $8.00 fee for the entire day. The shuttle runs from 8:05a till 1:40a, which gives you plenty of time to tour the strip. The food in the hotel was great!There was even a .75 cent hot dog stand on the casino floor; the best hot dogs. The pool area was very clean. The casino was packed every night. Even though it's a four star hotel, it offers accomadations that some five star hotels do not. South Point has everything you'll need inside. You don't ever have to leave the hotel. I would definitely stay at South Point again. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: mikeh1759
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 4 hotels this visit and this is by far the best value, can't fault at all and it is the only hotel we stayed at that has really hot water(for shaving)in the bathroom.PS. You can get on free internet at tghe coffee shop

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Reasonably Priced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MZMCKENZ
Reviews.Content: As most of the reviews have stated this is an awesome hotel to stay. Great facility with plenty to do. Friendly staff and great service. It is off the main strip however it's close to a great shopping center. Shuttle service runs every hour and was not pricey at all to go to the strip area($8 cash-good for all day). This hotel also gave coupon books which I took advantage of the free souvenir, discount coffee , free bottle of wine at buffet and the free popcorn at the super nice movie theater. I also booked this hotel during President's day and got an unbelievable great rate!!

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay Just As Good As The First”
Reviews.Author: Gemelli
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 2006 and again July 1, 2, 3, of 2011. The rooms are still nice and inexpensive compared to those right on the strip. An improvement this time over the last is that the shuttle to the strip is now on a schedule. It's eight dollars a person and you can go back an forth to the strip as many times as you want per day. The casino is a little smoky. Food at Don Vito's was very good. Drink service at the pool was very good as well. Housekeeping did a great job meeting our requests for more coffee, pillows, and towels.

Reviews.Title: “"Had a great. We will be back"”
Reviews.Author: macfamily04
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. This is our second time to stay here. This a great Hotel for a family. Of course you can not beat the price. We paid $297.00 for three weekend nights and it was 4th of July weekend. It was very easy to get to the strip. The pool was great. They have a great kids waiting pool that is a big hit for all kids and kids at heart. The room was very clean and very good maid service. We ate at several restaurants. We loved the prime rib place very good and very reasonable. We also liked the Steak and Shake.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: HamiltonTexas
Reviews.Content: We've been to Vegas many times and have stayed many places. This is a large operation and covers a large area but there are shortcuts! Check in was a breeze and we requested a room close to the elevator. Got that plus they put us on the 2nd floor overlooking the pool. The room was clean and cool. It was a king bed and very comfy. The bathroom had a separate room for the tub and pot. The sink area was raised and it was large! It held all our toiletries and still had room. The room had it's own stat to control the temp. It also had a room safe tucked away in the closet. Hangers were provided. For $42 it was a steal. South Point is maybe the last large hotel on the strip but this far out it's called LV Blvd. The freeway is very close. They run a 'fee service' shuttle to the strip and also a free shuttle to the airport. There are many eating options plus the bingo, bowling and movies. Our cousins stayed at the Planet Hollywood and commented at how nice our hotel room was compared to theirs. Even the gambling area was better. The pool was large and offered some shade and plenty of towels. The gym asked $15 fee & don't know if that was for the duration or one day. There's a salon and barber shop plus other shops. Really the very only drawback is the location. The city bus runs right at the door and of course the dreaded taxis are available. My opinion is we'd stay here again without thinking much about it. Downtown has become a zoo and the strip is sooo crowded. I like South Point!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Californiapuglover
Reviews.Content: Nice for the price. The shower did not work properly. The casino was very well ventilated; important when you are a non-smoker. The pool area was spacious and the cocktail wait staff was attentive but the pool itself was VERY dirty. There was a layer of scum floating on the surface of the pool!

Reviews.Title: “South Point is a Terrific Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Saturngrl1
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3-night stay at the South Point. I booked my reservations based upon the wonderful reviews on Trip Advisor. Wow, how accurate these reviews are! The hotel is easy to get to from the airport. Early check-in was a breeze after being in line for only 5 minutes. My room had a pool view and was clean and spacious. For the most part, the halls were quiet at night, even though the Electric Daisy Carnival was that weekend. My delight began with Jeri, the waitress at Big Sur Oyster Bar. When I remarked the heavenly shrimp scampi would be awesome paired with an Austrailian Sauvignon Blanc, she instantly brought me a Kim Crawford SB--perfect pairing! It was also great fun to pig out at Baja Miguel's after church on Sunday. All the food there is fresh, tasty and had wonderful presentation. The horse show that weekend was awesome and the arena, bowling and bingo facilities were quite impressive. I can see why locals want to host their events there. I was also blessed to experience the spa there---wonderful staff and it was treat to chat with locals who also frequent that spa! Smoky casino? Not in the day, but it does get smoky at night. Then again, is there ANY casino in Vegas that isn't smoky at night? I was very impressed with South Point and look forward to my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “i loved it and I'm going back soon”
Reviews.Author: money0184
Reviews.Content: The room was excellent, the casino was great, i enjoyed the food, and had fun by the pool.I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to go back.”
Reviews.Author: LoveUSA_UK
Reviews.Content: Off the strip but great if you have a car and really good even if you don't. Stayed for 3 nights during the week and could easily have stayed for more. Extremely good value for money and a winner with no resort fees. Nice pool and facilities to relax and take in a bit of sun, good choice of restaurants and very comfortable rooms. Can't fault it and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & friendly people”
Reviews.Author: Yasichiura
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights and I felt very comfortable at South Point. People are friendly, especially valet parking person, James, night shift guy, was so kind and helpful. He made my impression perfect on staying at South Point.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as in the past”
Reviews.Author: My_kids_Mom6
Reviews.Content: I feel like I remember this hotel being nicer in the past than it was this time. The good part was the consistently good buffet restaurant. The rooms were clean and updated. The pool is nice...but closes if there is high wind. However, there were more people, more noise and more smoke than I remember in the past. The down side was that we called in advance to see if we could get an early check in, and we were told probably yes and to check at 10am, but when we arrived at 9 am after a red-eye flight from Honolulu the early morning staff could not get us a room...and so nine of us sat on the front couches for hours. The staff changed shifts, and when the next staff came in they were surprised to hear we couldn't get a room and were very helpful to get us into a room about 1pm to catch a nap. What a difference between the two sets of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel but not a good place to make $$$.”
Reviews.Author: sirgeneral
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good place to stay if your on a budget but not a good place to make $$$! The rooms is good enough for a family of four. The rooms don't have a mini-frig to put beverages. I guess they want you to go down stairs and have a drink while you play the machines. If you stay here, make sure you book the room package. It comes with access to the fitness facilities, some buffets, drinks, and more. The dining is great but the casino sucks! Don't think your going to make any money here. The machines are tight and the tables are cold! I guess due to the economy and the cheap rooms, the hotel got to make money some how. On the bright side, this place is pretty good if you have kids. They have a bowling alley, movie theather, pool hall, and a arcade place (not as great like Circus Circus). My two kids enjoyed it very much (especially they watch the movie "Kung Fu Panda 2"). The last thing I want to say is about the staff. The valet and bellman was quick. The front desk and dining waitress was not bad. But the casino waitressess was slow! Overall, this hotel is a good place to stay (if you have a vehicle because it's far from the other hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation: Vegas Style”
Reviews.Author: hennssy
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort. Definitely worth it's 4-star rating. Nicely designed & clean pool, but only 4 1/2 foot depth. Casino not too smoky. Lot's to do: Many restaurants to choose from, large casino, pool, hot tub, bowling alley, movie theater. Short drive to strip, airport, outlets, outdoor shopping mall. Very family-friendly. Large guest rooms. Lots of free parking. Great overall experience. Would highly recommend & would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: avocadolady
Reviews.Content: This place is not where the action is on the strip, but it's a good value, and they offer shuttle service. The rooms are large, clean, and comfortable, with coffee makers, something that not's always found in L.V rooms. There is a large pool, plus many of the other amenities one finds in L.V. hotels, The staff was friendly and efficient. The only restaurant I tried was Steak and Shake, another good value, a clean, well-lighted plac e.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JerryLV
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the SP several times in the past and as this time, we have always been happy with our stay. As many people have stated, the rooms are clean, large and well appointed. Not the Wynn, but not at the Wynn prices either. Lets face it....how much time do you spend in your room when you are in Las Vegas? Of course you want it clean and comfortable and the SP does not disappoint. We checked in on a Friday before noon and was given our room and an upgrade right away....despite check-in being at 3:00pm. The check in fella was courteous and efficient and got us going right away. Oh...and by the way...we checked in and never left until we were heading back to L.A. Easy off the freeway and easy on to head back home. If you want to be in the middle of Vegas and able to hotel hop...this may not be for you, but we have been to LV many times and just wanted to enjoy all that the South Point had to offer. We had dinner at Don Vitos and it was one of the best Italian meals I have ever had. Great food and great service. The movie theater has a lot to offer also. Nice pool area and a casino with all the games you could want. Played in the poker room and found it very hospitable. Not real lucky though...my fault...not theirs. I did hit a Royal Flush on a poker machine so that made my weekend a success. Here are the negatives: the casino tends to smell of smoke the more crowded it gets...especially in the evening. Not great for us non smokers. Most of the food places were good but I would pass on the Garden Buffet. I have eaten there a couple of times and I'm not impressed. Try the Coronado Cafe or one of the other places. No shortage of food at South Point. All in all I would say its a good place to stay if you want to avoid the hustle and bustle of the Strip or Downtown but still want to feel like you are in a nice hotel and casino.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and super friendly”
Reviews.Author: wcircleauto
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort if you want to be away from the strip and have everything in one place. Pamela (I believe that was her name) was super friendly at check-in and got our group on the same floor with good views. Every dealer was very friendly and helpful and made the games fun. $5 blackjack and $1 roulette helps your gambling budget go a long way and their was no shortage of cocktail waitresses making their rounds at the tables. I didn't notice the smoke but my other colleagues who stayed in the casino much later into the night complained of smoke. The room was very nice and beds very comfortable but the nicest thing it was very quiet. It may be just a tad overrated as a 4 star resort but close. The bathrooms are nice and good showers. A 42 inch flat panel is nice but a little short on channels but maybe just not the channels I wanted to watch. (It was US Open weekend and I was looking for the Golf Channel no big deal) One of the things that impressed me is we sat at the Seafood cafe bar and someone in the group asked for some green olives for their drink and it wasn't available at that restaurant. But 2 minutes later Norma our waitress had gone out of her way to find some for us, that was unexpected since we had told her it wasn't a big deal. The food and service was great. We had a rental car so getting around wasn't a big deal but you are isolated without a car and it seems popular with the local crowd which isn't a bad thing. It's a great place unless you want to be in the middle of the strip and walk everywhere. Their is a great walking/jogging trail around the resort if you are crazy like me and like to go for a morning run even on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: CBE&LME
Reviews.Content: Nice large room. Quiet throughout, even the air conditioner. Double sheeted comfy Serta bed. Pillows were a bit hard. Great room/check-in/casino service. Prompt elevators with security. Nice 42 inch flat TV. Easy to use pool w/lots of area to relax. Buffet was OK.........tequila bar was fun. Very professional and prompt shuttle service to the strip for $8 one-way and to and from the airport for free. Fun gaming and convenient 24 hr. store. Over all good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Marc2042
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Vegas every year since 2005. While we have stayed many times at the MGM Signature Suites, South Point Hotel provides excellent value and service for your money. In fact, the first time we stayed at South Point in 2007 we were extremely impressed. We recently returned, by choice, in May 2011. They have a good mix of restaurants, a good pool, a good gym and excellent friendly service. You are away from the "buzz" and that is why you select this resort. If you have a need for the strip, take a cab or the shutlle. The overall rating for this hotel is excellent for us. The location may, for some, not be as suitable which is the location rating chosen. We have no issue with the location ourselves. If I look to find something negative, I am hard pressed to find anything to comment on. This casino is for the couple / family that wants to relax while being able to enjoy the amenities (theaters, bowling, gym, casino) all at an affordable price. We were very impressed with the restaurants we used. We found the cleanliness standards to be more than acceptable and always leave a gratuity for the women who attend to the care of our rooms. We have no hesitation recommending this resort. In fact, we are going back this August. For the men, make sure you use the salon for a professional shave. What an experience! Ottawa, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are GREAT...Customer Service is Impersonal”
Reviews.Author: WhamBam85
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great. Large. Clean. Well decorated. Nice view of the parking lot/back of the building. hahaha. -_- The TV was a little far from the bed. But the beds were really comfortable. There were not enough plugs close to the bed. I like to charge my phone at night, and my cord barely reached from the wall to my bed. However, all in all, 4 star room. The casino was...a casino. They have pretty good food for a fantastic price at night. Their customer service was very impersonal. I'm sure they have to deal with a lot of guests, but still a friendly "Hello. How are you?" at check in would be nice. When I asked them where I could mail something, they looked at me like I was stupid and pointed down near the door. Yeah, obvious place, but I don't work there and the slot was a tiny hole in the wall. I was not impressed with their guest services at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeeBee53
Reviews.Content: For our second stay at South Point, we booked a two bedroomed suite for 12 nights and when we arrived, were upgraded to the most fantastic 2 bedroom luxury suite. So much room - more square feet than our house at home. Although bing treated like royalty by the maid was a bit embarassing!! Fabulous start to our holiday. We can't recommend this hotel enough. Pool area gret for the children. Food choice excellent. For amenities and value, South Point is our NUMBER ONE in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “One night with Kids- Great stay”
Reviews.Author: cladano
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night with our two little kids on our way to California. We don't regret our choice at all. For the most part everything was great. Hotel, bowling, movie theater were nice, and the pool was great (especially the heated kiddie pool- great for the cool morning). Some little things that I found annoying but not that big of a deal were: Smoking section right next to the theater and bowling alley entrance on the second floor, room service was expensive (two pancake breakfasts and a bagel cost us almost $50- and they don't tell you that gratuity is already included), and it was farther away from the strip than I had thought. Overall it was a great stay and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Please do not share the secret.....”
Reviews.Author: Trident743
Reviews.Content: If the center strip is not a priority then this is a gem to enjoy....decent food...wonderful room for the money and friendly service...This is not for the snobby etheral people whom I don't want around anyway...just a fun, clean place to relax and enjoy...A special thanks to Barbara at the front dest for wishing my wife a special birthday and Dave at the pool bar for tasting the lemon drop martini (with a straw) twice to be sure it was balanced just right.....Oh yeah, they have a strip shuttle for $8 for an all day pass....can't drive it for that anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury A Few Miles From The Strip”
Reviews.Author: Travelsavvy888
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a number of hotels in Vegas and South Point is one of our favorites. You get most of the features of other Vegas casino/hotels, but South Point offers a number of benefits. Here are some Pros and Cons. PROS: * 4 Star rooms at 2 Star prices. * Very spacious rooms with huge bathrooms. * Comfortable beds. * No resort fees. * Valuable coupon book given to you at check-in (includes good freebies like a free drink and a free buffet). * Consistently clean. * Newer property. * Decent buffet with good choices. * Has a movie theater and bowling alley, so there are things to do here other than just gamble. CONS: * It's a few miles south of the Strip (you'll need a car or a paid shuttle service). * Toll-free calls are not free. * Staff attitudes vary from very customer-focused to 'don't care' (important for long-term customer retention). This is a solid choice if you are in Vegas and don't need to stay on the Strip. It is a hidden gem for travelers who want class but at a good price. It's a more casual hotel than some of the fancy ones in it's class but recommended overall.

Reviews.Title: “Isolated, but a good bargain”
Reviews.Author: 1000Mike
Reviews.Content: Pretty far from the strip, but they have shuttle services to both the airport and the strip. Rooms and amenities are typical of the big hotels on the strip, but I found the buffet and Coronado Cafe to be less expensive by far than most on the strip. In addition to the typical free drinks and gambling matches, the coupon books had a free breakfast buffet during the week, and for my 5 night stay, they gave me two coupon books. To keep people at the hotel, they have nine restaurants, plus a deli, a Starbucks and an ice cream shop, ranging in price from very expensive (Michael's) to very reasonable. Also includes a bowling alley and most of the shops and services you will see at the other big hotels. I found the staff to be a little more friendly than most hotels in Vegas. The Internet was pretty fast, but $12.95 per 24 hours, but that's unfortunately typical in Vegas. And they didn't have free boarding pass printing. The only other negative was the shuttle driver back to the airport. He had a wheelchair passenger that took up some of the seats and was causing him to run just a little behind. So he told a couple of the last passengers to arrive with reservations that there was no more room because of the wheelchair. But when we left, less than 5 minutes late, there were still three empty seats left in the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Good Food”
Reviews.Author: TravelLightDot
Reviews.Content: We had a flight that scheduled to arrive in Las Vegas at 10:30 PM and had to leave LV in the morning for Lake Powell so we wanted a clean, inexpensive hotel. South Point exceeded our expectations. Our flight was delayed so we ended up arriving at South Point around 3 AM. Check-in was easy and we each got a coupon book that included a free drink, a free breakfast or lunch buffet and many other goodies. Our room was clean, spacious, and beautiful...all for $40. We slept in, missed the breakfast buffet, but had the lunch buffet. It had shrimp, roast beef, and all sorts of other delicious food. We could have had a bottle of wine for $6. The liquor store had very reasonable prices and a nice selection so we bought wine and liquor for our trip. Checkout was easy. The only down side, which is true of most Las Vegas casinos, is that people smoke. And, since it is 6 miles or so south of the strip, it would not be good if you wanted to be on the strip. When we returned to Las Vegas we stayed at the Aria but returned to the South Point for our last dinner in LV at their Rib Room. The roast beef was delicious and the best we had in LV, including the buffet at the Aria. I am hanging on to my coupon book to use next time we go to LV.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience”
Reviews.Author: 9pretzels
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at South Point. The staff is friendly and rooms very clean. We had an eight floor room that looked out over the pool and hillside, very pleasant. There is a swimming pool which we didn't use but seems popular. We liked the location of South Point, off the strip and so parking and driving to and from the hotel is easier. My one complaint is I think their beds aren't very comfortable, harder than I'd like.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business trips”
Reviews.Author: Otaview
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel when on business trips to conventions. It is a 10 minute drive from the south end of the strip, and is quite isolated way out there in open land, so you either need to rent a car or pay for taxis, however when on business renting a car is a really good option to get to and from the convention center anyway. Self-parking is free. The best thing about this hotel is that the rooms are often way cheaper than the mainstream hotels, and the rooms are superb - big, clean, and safe. I am not a casino-goer but it's certainly a huge casino that seems very popular and busy. The buffet restaurant is great for all-you-can-eat.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Acefljo
Reviews.Content: Besides the smoking, I really enjoyed my stay. The staff was very attentive from the front door to the housekeeper. There was easy access to transportation such as the city bus, cab or eight dollars a day for 24 hour shuttle to the las Vegas strip; in addition, there was free airport shuttle. I do not believe this hotel was built last year, but if they continue to provide excellent service; they will be in business for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: “great customer focus”
Reviews.Author: JimEd45
Reviews.Content: Hotel room is a whopping 500 square feet. Great variety of reasonably priced restaurants. Reasonable selection of gambling options , race and sports book, bowling, bingo, movie theaters. Nice pool. easy access to major roadways. The hotel is clean and the workers are friendly and courteous. My week cost me $386.00 total! My wife and I have stayed here multiple times since it opened and have never been disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: MissoulaTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here often and it is consistently good. Stays generally come with coupon book for discounts and freebies such as a lunch buffet. Buffets seemed to have improved from passed years. Breakfast buffet is $5.99, make sure you grab a Bloody Mary on your way to your seat. This has to be one of the best deals in Las Vegas. Rooms are well appointed with nice flat screen televisions, great bedding, nice shower heads and wall safes. Slots are not to tight. Casino is a little smokey but that's on par with most of the casinos in Vegas. Pool area is very nice. Circular jacuzzi around a waterfall & palm tree is a nice touch. My only gripe is the $14.99 per day internet charge which seems a bit excessive for today.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it !!”
Reviews.Author: pcgatormom
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel away from the hustle, crowds and traffic on the strip. Close to good shopping and Great view of the strip and mountains. Nice casino playing area. Good pool and great big hot tub. Ate all breakfast meals at the cafe and dinner meals at the mexican, italian and steak place at hotel. Good food and good prices. did not eat at Michael's (It is very expensive) Had the crab legs at the seafood place and fried shrimp. mmmm good. valet parking great and maid service was good. very friendly staff all around.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!!!”
Reviews.Author: TinyBaby07
Reviews.Content: The hotel was dynomite; rooms were comfortable and clean. Buffet was excellent. I even won a little money. First time ever while in vegas. I usually leave there broke, but I actually left with a little money this time which made my trip even better!!!! Will definitely stay there again and recommend it to my friends and family. Thanks SOUTHPOINT!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, self-contained Hotel/Casino!”
Reviews.Author: ArchieHOP
Reviews.Content: Once a year my bowling league goes to South Point at the end of the league. Last September was my first visit and I'm looking forward to this September's trip. There are many things to like her and there is one small point that prevents me from rating this at five stars. Good points: The location is great, convenient to both the Strip and the airport. If you are driving in from SoCal it's before you get to Las Vegas proper therefore missing the congestion. The rooms are very comfortable and spacious. The hotel has many attractions, including the on-site bowling lanes, the equestrian center, movie theaters, and of course the casino. The gambling is very fair and the slot club is pretty generous. There are a great variety of dining options, including Mexican, Italian, two Steak restaurants, Buffet, cafe, and a new "Steak & Shake" location. Bad point. The rooms are very inconvenient t. From the parking structure you have to walk all the way through the casino to get to the desk to check in. After check-in you have to walk all the way through the casino and down a long hall to get to the elevators. If you have an issue with walking long distances at one time, such as needing a knee replacement like my wife, then this will be a problem. It's just wasn't planned very well. Overall a great vacation spot and full service hotel/casino/spa. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “We love the South Point”
Reviews.Author: ute4lyf
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the South Point on a couple of trips and love it. The rooms at this hotel are very spacious and give plenty of room for our family of four. This has become our normal stop on our trips to California. The staff is always pleasant and helpful, and the rooms are always clean. The location of this hotel is great as it is on the south end of the strip and has very easy freeway access and is a short drive, or shuttle bus to the main strip. The price is very reasonable for the rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, Bad and Ugly”
Reviews.Author: AlmostFamousRocker
Reviews.Content: The GOOD: I arrived early but I was allowed to check -in. A gentleman was checking in next to me with the same problem. I asked for a higher room..they gave me 2nd floor. The BAD: I heard the young lady tell the gentleman that she had from12 to 24 available. The UGLY: The young woman (Sarah) at the desk, who is the night supervisor was so rude and obnoxious. She would not stop argiung and just had to be "right". Horribly rude to a guest. When I mentioned that there was no need for rudeness, she pulled out the computer asked my name and typed in something..I am sure it was not good.. The GOOD: The SPA is one of the best in Las Vegas.
