The BAD: they don't warn you that if you cancel, you are charged anyway and the prices are VERY EXPENSIVE! The UGLY: they MAKE YOU PAY GRATUITY! The 25 min facial is NOT worth the 65.00. Outrageous since that would be my choice to pay gratuity. The GOOD: The hotel room was clean, no bed spread, just a drape across the bed, a spacious bathroom, but very hard matress, The BAD: Internet is 13.00 for 24 hours. The Ugly. They had crab dinner for 21. dollars and it was horrible food terrible service. The other cafe was just as bad but the salad was good. It took 40 minutes to get a salad and soup! They nickel and dime you any time they can and when you don't even know it..The slots were tight just like the rest of Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A much needed break”
Reviews.Author: BartBLexington
Reviews.Content: Location is off the main strip, but more than close enough (maybe less than 5 minutes away). It's a 4 star hotel with lots of bells and whistles. They have a movie theater, bowling alley, and variety of restuarants.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: vbalmom
Reviews.Content: We thought we would try a newer hotel for a less expensive hotel than the main strip. Well we got exactly what our money paid for, bad service. The ironic thing is we have been here since Thursday and even have to stay here because we already paid for the night. Not only is the food and service below par we had no available parking tonight and we are hotel guests!! When I tried to complain to the front desk they just looked at me with blank stares. They did nothing to make me feel like they were going to do something to make the rest of our stay a little bit better or want our money anytime in the future. I would think twice about staying here when there appears to be better places elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Please Don't Share This Secret......”
Reviews.Author: Trident743
Reviews.Content: If the Center Strip is not a priority this is a gem of a hotel/casino. The room, customer service and relaxation of this property is wonderful...This was for my wifes birthday...which I had mentioned when making the reservation....and guess what...when we checked in Barbara at the hotel front desk took the time to wish my wife a "happy birthday"...and David at the pool bar made a perfect lemon drop martini for her,,,even tasted it twice (with a straw) to ensure the proper balance. Everone was friendly and helpfull...They even printed my bording pass for me and had it ready at checkout....i can't say enough. But please stay away from this place as we would like to keep it for our own...It is easy to drive to although they have a "strip shuttle for $8 for an all day pass....way worth it....and a free airport shuttle...Thanks South Point.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: ksmith1300
Reviews.Content: Combine all the reviews and that defines South Point. Pros: Low price, new rooms (we stayed on 22nd floor), clean, pool OK, coupon book with free-bees and discounts. Cons: Far from center of strip, OK if you have car. $40 taxi, kinda smoky casino, food so-so, not much excitement in casino, had bad experience with staff over a coupon, only one employee out of five( not the supervisor) did the right thing. Never get any drinks in casino, almost no waitresses around (we stayed four days). I'd stay here again as the price is good, but only if I had a car.

Reviews.Title: “Consistanly good value”
Reviews.Author: CanardUk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the South Point several times since it was the South Coast and it is still good value.It is some way from the strip and a car is really required. On this trip I used the Buffet twice and it was really good quality and compared well against the big names on the strip. I think this place is well managed and as long as they don't get any fancy ideas about changing things it will remain a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Good the Bad and the So So...”
Reviews.Author: redevils
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at South Side after reading some of the reviews here and for trying to stay on a budget. Which going to Vegas I guess the budget part went out the window rather quickly. We actually had a great deal on the room over memorial day weekend, 5 days 4 nights, for just under $290. We thought that was great! We missed the shuttle from the airport so we decided to take a taxi, that was about $30, so not terrible. The check in was nice and painless, they already had everything very much set and gave me a free room upgrade. We thought that was really nice, specially after paying what we paid for the original room. The room was nice and clean, with freshly made bed, really clean and tidy bathroom, which was nice and big. It had a nice couch and flat screen TV. The entrance from the moment you go into the casino until you get to the elevators to take you to the rooms was quite smoky. It didn't bother me as much as it did my wife, she really couldn't stand it. I don't blame the casino as much as the people there. I guess it's big with locals to go and play there being that it's off the strip and rather cheap playing tables. So you get more of a local crowd. They had $5 blackjack tables which was nice. the dealers weren't very friendly and more serious than the other casinos we visited. It is a little further from the strip than I thought it be. So after the first day of taking a taxi, due to missing the shuttle when we were ready to go, costing us about $30 each way. We asked the concierge regarding renting a car and they have some hook up with a local car rental that is actually at the airport, so it worked out great. It was relativity cheap, $30 a day, and with free valet parking in all the major Hotels. It was a deal, room for 5 days with car rental $435. We didn't try the pool or theater, we basically made it our base and did everything else elsewhere. So, clean rooms, albeit a little antiquated. Smoky Casino floor, not their fault is legal to smoke indoors. Nice freshly made beds every day. A little far from the strip.. Would we stay again? If we are on a budget, yes!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, well-kept rooms/property with great price/performance”
Reviews.Author: CL5309
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 1st time in June. We typically stay on the strip but decided to give this place a try for one night based on positive reviews on trip advisor. We were pleasantly surprised by what we found. Pros: - Very clean property (rooms, restaurants, casino) that appeared to be relatively new and was well kept, though by no means attempting to be a luxury property. - Staff was friendly and helpful. We arrived early in the day and had no problem checking into room early. - Inexpensive rooms/ restaurants and low (mostly $5) casino table minimums - Free airport shuttle Potential cons - Location is far off strip. In fairness, I'm sure this is how they keep the prices down. The hotel has a lot of choices for food and entertainment besides gambling so if you had a car or didn't mind staying put, this isn't an issue. - There were a lot of families with children here which could be a pro or con depending on what you're looking for. They have movie theater, bowling and nice pools that kids could use so if you're looking for place where you could turn teenagers loose to entertain themselves this appeared to be a good place. - Only complaint I have (and it is nitpicky) is the lack of feather pillows in the rooms. The ones that were there were very hard and overstuffed. - While lots of choices for food, we ate at the buffet and couple of the restaurants and found the food good, but not great (think Denny's).

Reviews.Title: “Great priced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vivnoaln
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at this hotel. We had a big gorgeous room with 2 queen size beds with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the pool area, very nice. It was clean and the beds were very comfortable. The pool area was resort awesome. We paid $66 per night on hotwire for this hotel in April. It was a bargain. We had a short drive into the Las Vegas Strip. We would stay here again. Good family hotel. Good childrens pool and big hot tub. The only downside to the stay was our car in Valet parking, when we needed it to go into the strip that evening, we had to wait 30 minutes to get our car because it was very busy. I would ike to see the Casino offer more cheaper priced family restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for Mother, daughter and aunt to celebrate 21st Bday”
Reviews.Author: 1Panda
Reviews.Content: In 2007, my sister and I brought her son to South Point to celebrate his 21st birthday. The hotel and casino still looks brand new and spotless. Being away from the Strip, I felt safer since we left our spouses at home. Checked in with Chelsea and what a pleasure! She smiled, laughed easily and listened to my requests then worked to locate the room, floor and even suggested the pool view which my niece loved. Due to severe allergies, bedding was a concern but Chelsea 's hotel knowledge enabled her to give me correct information without a delay. I checked in a day early and didn't want to eat by myself in a restaurant so I ordered "TO GO" at the new Steak and Shake. Without a digital number display, we all had to listen for our order numbers to be yelled (no microphone) but as the restaurant filled it was impossible to hear. We had to keep checking on numbers and clustering around the cashier. The hamburger was delicious, I enjoyed it in my beautiful, quiet room. The A/C wasn't cool but within 30 minutes after calling housekeeping the filter was replaced and the room cooled down. The next morning I had some time to kill before picking up my sister and niece at the airport but I couldn't find the penny slot machines. I asked a guard near the cashier's cage and he took me to some slots and explained how to change the coin play amount. Wow! I had no idea! Maria from Housekeeping kept our large room immaculate and had no problem with our request to change the linen daily (they prefer every 3rd day) and leave us plenty of towels. I love the luxury of clean linen and towels each day in a hotel. The towels were big and fluffy but we didn't use any of the toiletries due to allergies. I don't remember the coffee pot in 2007 but it was very convenient. The bathroom is large and the early morning I returned home, I rolled my suitcase into the bathroom to finish packing so I wouldn't wake my sister or niece. We ate breakfast in the Coronado Cafe each morning. The wait staff and their assistants anticipated our needs so we never had to ask for any refills or condiments. Do avoid the early morning counter service if possible. You won't save any time and service is not good. We invited some friends over for a delicious lunch in the Garden Buffet. We were able to use our complimentary coupons and only paid for our guests. I loved the Chinese and my niece enjoyed the Mexican food. After returning from dinner we played the 9:30pm Bingo. The second night we each rented the electronic units, so much easier. The complimentary beverages at the bar was a nice touch. My sister and niece enjoyed a wonderful and relaxing massage in the Spa on their last day. The warm oil they rubbed on did wonders to their dry skin and for the first time in a week, they felt like they had some moisture in their skin. They were pleased they weren't pressured to purchase any spa products. Thank you South Point for the comfortable beds, huge room, wonderful employees and having everything we need under one roof.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great for memorial day weekends”
Reviews.Author: jak3man1500
Reviews.Content: My stay at the south point was terrific. Check in was easy, the pool was wonderful, the food was good, overall i would reccomend this hotel in vegas. try other hotels like the mandalay bay, sunset station, or the orleans if you don't like the south point.

Reviews.Title: “Here now, not for us, Vegas on the cheap.”
Reviews.Author: huladolz
Reviews.Content: Too far from the strip, basic casino hotel, huge so it's a zoo, bowling alley & movie theatre good but every thing else is below fair. Wish we could check out but would lose $ with holiday weekend. The towels still smells like smoke even in non smoking rooms - gross. If you really want a nice non-smoking hotel, this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “Far off from the strip, not nice staff, don't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: kittykat44197
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by their street name. Way off of nowhere near Las Vegas strip. Even if you are not there to have Las Vegas fun, they are totally overpriced. Worse yet, they said one thing to book the room then gave me another. Worst out there, including their foods.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Sweetlu4
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this place. It's a little out of the way but the rooms were nice. It's a great value for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “COULDN'T ASK FOR A BETTER EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: LoveJaniece2011
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived to Southpoint we couldn't believe the size of the place and how clean it was outside and inside. The hotel provides a free shuttle to and from the airport which was a plus and they also have a shuttle that will take you to the Las Vegas strip for 8 dollars for the whole day!! The hotel not only had tons of gaming, but upstairs, there is a huge bowling alley and theater that we didnt even know existed til after day 3 of being at the hotel!!! The people were super friendly the food was pretty good as well. They give you coupons for a free buffet and percentages off different food items and such. Had a great swimming area and all in all I give this Hotel 5 stars out of 5 stars!!! Great place to be for the people interested in a nice time in Vegas without being surrounded by drunken idiots!!! Hotel is AWESOME!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, out of the way”
Reviews.Author: TravelwithBrown
Reviews.Content: Big points for being cheap (booked through hot wire), further from the strip than I thought. Nice room with large, though plain, bathroom. Ate at the burger place which was also cheap. The casino is okay, a bit depressing,but clean and no frills. Free self parking is good, but free wifi would be a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel a Little Out of the Way”
Reviews.Author: TerMar1981
Reviews.Content: The South Point turned out to be much more than I expected. The room was much larger and nicer than I thought it was going to be for the price paid. Very clean in every way with very comfortable beds. It is several miles off the strip but they do have a shuttle that will take you to the strip if needed. We found it very easy to get around driving our car to the nearby strip and taking the monorail system from one end to the other. Good food here too and a very nice casino.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: doggiedaddie
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed at the SP. I had the best time in Vegas in 15yrs. My room was great, gambling was great and it was easy to get back to the airport. I will be back again. I'm not just saying this because I won money, three major jackpots by me and two by my wife on the penny slots! The room was clean, the staff was nice and being a 50 plus customer I didn't mind being a little farther from the strip with the drunken 20 somethings! I had three days of fun and relaxation. Everything you want under one roof, Bank of America down the street and shopping too! They even printed out our Jet Blue itinerarys for $1.00!

Reviews.Title: “Go to South Point!”
Reviews.Author: mayzeeo10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived to South Point from McCarren Airport, which is only 6 miles away and were warmly greeted by the front desk staff who were prompt and courteous. The room was very clean, and a very large size compared to other rooms in the area. I was very impressed by the size of the bathroom as well, easily two people can use it at once. The bathroom was spotlessly clean as well. The bed, Ah the bed! Details were made to provide a bed that has a very comfortable mattress, pillows and bedding. It felt like home. We ate at the Oyster Bar and at the Buffet while we were there. Both restaurants were clean, and the food was good. The fish and chips served at the oyster bar were made with real filets of fish, not the bread-laden stuff served often in other places. The buffet had a nice assortment of items,and there is a buy-one-get-one coupon in the booklets available to hotel guests at the front desk. The hotel location is a little out of the way from most of the main strip activities, but everything you need is right there on the property. We did not use the shuttle service, but there is one available. If you are looking for a very nice place to stay without breaking the bank South Point is it!

Reviews.Title: “We luv Southpoint”
Reviews.Author: Breadhead1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 days attending the Interop Conference (Mandalay Bay) and The Money Show (Caesars). This was the second time we've stayed here and really enjoyed it - again. The rooms are good sized and comfortable. We were on the 18th floor overlooking the pool with a great view of the mountains. We always rent a car so we can visit locals casinos and tourist locales like Red Rock Canyon, Hoover Dam, etc. The night time view from the parking garage is priceless. Food- we got a free lunch buffet in the coupon book and the food quality and selection has really improved. We had the $6.95 breakfast buffet every morning. Can't beat the 75 cent Vienna hot dog from the cart near the Sports Book. There is a new Steak n' Shake, a coffee shop, an ice cream place, a sandwich place and then some nicer restaurants including a Mexican restaurant, a steak place, Primarily Prime Rib and the famous Michaels. There are also 4 -5 bars scattered throughout the casino - 2 of which you can grab a table to sit and talk with friends and watch the action. Gambling - lots of machines and low limit table games. We didn't have much luck this trip though. There is a movie theater and equestrian center and a small theater for concerts although nothing was going on while we were there. Pool - there is a large main pool, a kiddie pool and a large hot tub and plenty of lounge chairs. There is a snack shop/bar in the area. Staff was friendly and helpful. In 15+ years we have stayed at many hotels but this is by far our favorite for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great dining and $5 table games”
Reviews.Author: Badger_rob
Reviews.Content: A good friend of mine and I were able to head out to Vegas on May 6th for a long weekend of golf, gambling, and enjoying the dining at the Southpoint. First of all, yes, I did notice the smoke when I got into the Southpoint, but I have low grade asthma and have been prone to getting sinus infections if I am around too much smoke. Neither issue cropped up and we spent a lot of time in the casino. You get that in Vegas since they have smoking. I dealt with it. The rooms at the Southpoint are larger than some of the other mid level price hotels that I have stayed at in Vegas (Harrah's, Ballys, Flamingo, etc). The beds were comfortable and the pillows on my bed were actually better than a lot of hotels. The bathroom was very clean and spacious as well. The gambling was good. You can always find a $5 table game, be it blackjack, roulette, craps, etc. I like the higher ceilings in the place and did not mind that color scheme. Now, the dining was another thing entirely. Our first night we hit Don Vito's and had the Seafood Diavolo which was excellent. Probably the best shellfish meal that I have had in twenty years. The stuffed mushrooms were very good, the grilled shrimp appetizer was fine and too much food. Dessert was a piece of chocolate cake, which was very good. Two drinks each and the bill was only $86 before tip. Sat night we ate at Baja Miguel's which was decent. I cannot say it was off the charts, but serviceable. They were nice enough to throw fajita chicken in a chimichanga instead of the shredded chicken on the menu. Chips, salsa, and guac were complimentary with dinner as well. Our last night, we ate at the Steakhouse and had surf and turf and the lump crab appetizer. Let me say that the amount of lump crab in that cocktail glass would make any other restaurant look cheap on their volume of crab. I could never find the bottom of the glass, but did. I will not waste shellfish. The ribeye steaks were great, no need to say more. You get a potato and a large, I mean large salad with your meal. The lobster was not needed and not very sweet, but heck, I never order surf and turf. I am going back with my wife and friends at the end of the month and Don Vito's will definitely be a dinner choice one of our nights in Las Vegas. Golf, we played at Paiute, the wolf course. I have not played at Paiute in about ten years. It is a very nice track and we got an early afternoon tee time for $50 on golf now. You can't beat the layout and the overall course conditions for that price. On Sunday we went down to play the Primm desert course. A nice track and complex just into California. Paid $49 for that round. If I had to choose, Paiute is the place to play between the two. I would recommend the Southpoint all in all, and you can get a comp. My friend and I played a lot and we just asked and the staff was gracious to give us a dinner comp. At Bill Salon and Gambling Hall (the old Barbary Coast), we played on a crap table for over almost four hours, my friend, at times had over five hundred bucks on the table and we barely got credit for anything. But, they are owned by the Harrah and the big guys don't comp diddly. For that reason alone, I will make the trip back to Southpoint.

Reviews.Title: “Houskeeping problems”
Reviews.Author: karenpiglet
Reviews.Content: We really liked the hotel, great restaurants, nice pool, a Seattle Coffee (yum). We arrived on Monday May 2. Friday May 6 I called housekeeping to say our bars of soap had yet to be changed & asked if that's normal. She said we replace them "When they get too small to use". They were finally replaced on Saturday. As I mentioned to her "It kind of makes the hotel look cheap". I've *never* stayed anywhere for that amount of time & not had soap replaced. We also had problems getting the room cleaned. On Thurs.,Fri.,Sat. when we left the room we told the chambermaid nearby that it was free to be cleaned. On Sat. this happened at 9:10 a.m. We picked up friends who were also in Vegas, had lunch at our hotel & brought them up to see the room at 1 p.m. Surprise...it hadn't been cleaned yet again. There were no staff anywhere in the hallway. For the 3rd day we called down to ask to have it cleaned. This sounds like a little thing, but it got rather annoying. I don't feel I should have to hunt down someone to clean my room. I'd probably stay there again, but if I went through the same thing, I wouldn't be back. Otherwise we really liked the hotel. We always rent a car, so distance isn't a problem & it's so close to get onto the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and gamble. Excellent Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: rtfulk
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say that I am a gambler and I do not like the strip. I feel you get so much more for your money from the local places. South Point is huge, the rooms are very spacious and always clean. They have flat screen tvs, large bathrooms, safe in the room, comfty beds. The pool area is very impressive. There is also a spa, hair salon, barber shop, travel agent, bowling alley, movie theaters, bingo hall (the best in Vegas) There are several restaurants and my favorite is the Primary Prime Rib, great food and can't beat the price. Big Sur Oyster bar is also one of my favorites. They have just opened Steak and Shake, there is also a deli, ice cream shop, coffee shop, Mexican, Italian and cafe open 24 hours. The sports book is one of the best in Vegas. The casino is huge and has all your favorite games. For the rates they offer, you can not find a better place. There are not on the strip but they do offer transportation to the strip for a fee. There is a nice fitness center which is $15 a day cheaper for a week. They are very close to shopping, there is an outlet mall just down the street and an open air mall not far away. The staff is very friendly and always helpful. We got in at 9:30 in the morning and did not expect to be able to check in, we had reserved a king size bed, the front desk agent called and had them clean a room for us and we were checked in and in our room by 10am. You would never get that on the strip. On our last night, we went to the front desk and asked if there was an internet kiosk we could use to print our boarding passes and she asked which airline we were flying and printed them right up for us at no charge. I love this place and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay, but nothing to write home about..”
Reviews.Author: qnookie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our Moms to Las Vegas but had a hard time finding a hotel to stay on a Saturday night that wasn't less than $175! We saw the reviews on South Point and decided to give it a whirl since it was priced at about $100 for Saturday night. We had a rental car so didn't mind that it was several miles from the Strip. We also figured we would be jet-lagged and didn't want to stay out too late on Saturday night, so it was a great option for us. We booked through Hotels.com, and when we arrived at the hotel, the front-desk check-in staff was less than friendly. They weren't rude, per se, but definitely not friendly and no smiles or welcome words. We actually had to do this twice since our Moms arrived on a different flight later in the day. The second time we did this, with a different employee, we had the same experience. Walking through the casino my eyes watered because of the smoke. I've been to all the big casinos on the Strip and have never had that problem before. Perhaps it is that the ventilation system is not as good, but it was by far the smokiest casino I've ever been to, with the exception of those found on cruise ships. The room was clean and neat, but not modern or updated. The bedding felt cheap and thin--reminded me of bedding from my college days. The casino staff was very friendly, and when we were playing the slots, we did receive free drinks. The housekeeping staff was also very helpful when we didn't understand how to use the coffeemaker. We were only there for one night and would only recommend this hotel if you want something basic and reasonably priced. We did not use any of the on-site restaurants or amenities, but they looked to be more family oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Wind Down”
Reviews.Author: LivandMarc
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one night stay at South Point. We were in LV 5/6 - 5/10, and spent the first 3 nights in a casino, center strip, with the last night at SP. We've been to LV several times over the course of 5 years - stayed on the strip and off the strip in a variety of hotels and condos. This time, we went to LV for the Supercross finals, so the men wanted to stay on the strip. DH and I stayed an extra day for a little R&R on our own and decided to give South Point a try. Checkin: We checked out of our strip casino at 11:00 and headed straight to SP via taxi. We arrived at approximately 11:30am and headed to the check in desk hoping we would be able to check in. We were greeted by a very friendly young lady who promptly checked us in. After some friendly chit chat about the difference between on and off strip properties we were handed our keys to our room. She asked if we knew how to get to the elevators, we did not, so she gave us quick directions and we were off. Room: We stayed in Room 1027. A beautiful room, large in size. Our view was of the roof of another building, but we still had a somewhat mountainous view. The room was very clean, we couldn't find anything wrong with it from that perspective. The bed was comfortable...we managed an afternoon nap and a great nights sleep. Amenities: The pool was very nice and clean. I worry about whether or not there would be enough chairs if the hotel was booked to capacity. We used the bowling alley and the movie theater. Bowling alley was a fun addition - bowled three games and had a really good time. We also enjoyed snacks from the conession stand at the movie theater and found the theater itself to be very clean and good in size. Movies were current and plenty of show times. The spa area and the work out facilites were also immaculate. It was very frustrating the cost of everything at the hotel. The cost to use the spa and the fitness center was several dollars more than what I paid on the strip. There was also no discount to hotel guests for bowling or the movie theater. (Though we did have a coupon for free bowling - for every game we bought we got another free.) I feel as a hotel guest, there should be some sort of discount for using those facilities. Casino: The variety of slot machines was great - very comparable to machines on the strip and better selection than our strip hotel the first few days. However, table games were a let down. There was not a lot of variety in table games, neither of my two favorites were available. However, there was a good variety in minimum bet - a welcome change from staying on the strip. Even at its busiest, the casino still offered $5.00 minimums at certain tables. Food: Staying only one day left little opportunity for trying all of the restaurants, but we did have the buffet for lunch. There was a lot of variety on the buffet - but the food itself wasn't very good. Though we didn't use it - they offered both strip and airport shuttles. The price on the strip shuttle was very reasonable. We had a very early flight out, so we were unable to use the airport shuttle as the first departure was at 6am. If you want a lot of action, noise and chaos - this is not the place for you. However, it's a great way to add a few extra days to the end or beginning of a trip. The property was very nice, clean and housed a lot of amenities. Overall, I would stay at South Point again.

Reviews.Title: “No View”
Reviews.Author: IreneCCalgary
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful but what a joke when I opened the curtains. We had a view of a wall. No daylight could enter the room. We had to call for an extra bath towel. We waited 45 minutes and called again. After 15 more minutes the towel arrived. Then went to have a drink of water - no water glasses in the room. Called again. They said they were very busy. Perhaps if they stock the room before people check in, they wouldn't be so busy. When we checked out, I questioned our view. The girl said that we had a low rate room. We had booked the golf package there was no mention that is was a low rate room. Being that we were golfing, it would be nice if you could look out your window to see what kind of day is was. If this is your first visit to Vegas - this is not the hotel for you. This hotel is way south of the airport, far from all the theam hotels.

Reviews.Title: “OK- disappointed”
Reviews.Author: nadacaca
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days for a mother/daughter trip at the South Point based on reviews that it was clean and friendly. We had a car, so the fact that it was quite a few miles from the strip did not bother us. Check in at 7:pm not too bad except that the desk man was a stiff, unfriendly sort. Obviously tired of dealing with the public. We requested a refrigerator and he asked if it was for medications and I said yes, he kind of rolled his eyes. The fridge had not shown up by 10:00 so I called the front desk and they told me that there had not been one ordered. They sent one up pretty promptly after that. The room itself was not so clean. There was some kind of Pink and Blue crap on the ceiling and a few globs on the wall and even a goober looking thing on one of the bed drapes. It looked like some party remnants from a shower of sorts. Beds were ok but the mattress protectors did not fit well and kept wadding up underneath the sheets making it feeling lumpy. The casino, which you must go through to get to your rooms is smokey and not well ventilated. There was an evening when they opened the front lobby doors to clear the air which helped if you were near the front. Overall, it was OK. NOT 4 stars worthy. Maybe 2-comparable to Super 8 with a casino.

Reviews.Title: “Think Walmart - Great Value, Average Service, Trashy Scene”
Reviews.Author: Jupitersmoon
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed at the South Point at least once a year since it originally opened as the South Coast (Station) back in 2004. If you watch the sales, the rates cannot be beat ($35 to $60). The rooms are very spacious and always decently clean. With the addition of the new tower there are over 1200 rooms. It’s a massive property that clearly operates on a volume based principle. They have a bowling alley, arcade, movie theater, equestrian/rodeo center, and about a half dozen very boring restaurants. The spa is nice, but caters mostly to locals, which negates any “resort” experience in my opinion. But the prices, again, cannot be beat! The service is nothing special. In fact, most employees have that “I can’t believe I have to work today” vibe. They remind me of Walmart employees – Unhappy but need a job… any job. Don’t hold your breath for any of the usual pleasantries unless they’re expecting a tip. But honestly, when you account for the kind of people they have to deal with, I really can’t blame them… This is not a place for hipsters. There are business travelers like myself, who are just there for a decent and cheap bed. Then there are the families with out of control screaming kids…and cranky sloooooow old people…and plenty ( and I do mean plenty) of hillbillies. Now if you’re the sort with a groovy pair of cowboy boots, a truly disturbing pair of daisy dukes, four kids by four different fathers, an alcoholic mother and gambling addicted stepfather – then this is your scene! Otherwise, drive up to the Town Square just past the 215 for any dinning/shopping/socializing. Oh, and DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS YOU HAVE A CAR! Also, because the valet service is so slow, I suggest parking in the self parking garage first, walking down to registration, then back to your car for your luggage, and then to your room. This will save you from hauling your stuff all over the busy casino maze and/or waiting endlessly for your luggage/car. And yes, this is one of the smokiest casinos in all of Vegas. It’s so bad that you can taste it in the food! But I’m a sensitive non-smoker… The pool is right next to the freeway and gets lots of dust clouds flying over. Plus there are way too many kids running around for it to be relaxing. Overall, South Point is a pretty good hotel. I will certainly stay here again. The price is right, and it’s a perfect reminder for why I’ve happily chosen not to have children.

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip, no frills, good Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenniferRose8
Reviews.Content: I typically stay with family when visiting Las Vegas, so chose the South Point for convenience to their house, not necessarily for the "vegas vacation". It is definitely not a Strip hotel, however I was very impressed by the rooms. Large rooms, up to date, clean, very comfortable. I had a mountain view, there was construction going on at the back of the hotel but I never heard a sound. The casino is average; it is afterall more for locals and a bit blase by comparison to the M or Green Valley, but overall comfortable, probably good for business travelers or those looking to save some money. Decent restaraunts; no top chefs here, but good food available. They just opened a Steak-N-Shake for those of you from back east! Good for kids (I have none), but movie theater & bowling alley, both nice.

Reviews.Title: “South Point Hotel is on point for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: malie1018
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Las Vegas as a stop over for two nights before contiuing on to Hawaii. I was very pleased at this Hotel having my seventy- seven year old mother and seventy -five year old Aunt this hotel was a great find. They could easily get around this hotel and not get lost it was very clean and offered alot in the way of activities for them. The movie theater is great playing the latest movies. We also watched an equestrian show along with bowling in their 64 lane bowling alley. The food was really great and if you are able to stay up past 11:00 pm you can eat at the Coronedo cafe with deals such as; bacon or sausage, eggs, hash browns and toast for $1.95 and steak and egg with hash browns and toast for $3.95 trust me these meals and more are worth staying up for. I would recommend this hotel as a good find, although it is not real close to the hustle and bustle of the strip but if you need to go to the strip they have a shuttle that will take you there and pick you up for $8.00. I did not see the need to go to the strip because this hotel had everything you would need. With its affordability and comfort and pleasant staff this was a great layover for me. I stayed here on my way back from Hawaii to break the trip up because it is a 10 or 11 hour flight if you don't. This hotel bathrooms all throughout the casino was exceptionally clean which made staying here even better. It isn't as smokey as most casino's and security even makes you feel safer with there presence throughout the day and night. I will stay at this hotel again and will recommend it to all my friends and family. One complaint at the open bars in the casino they provide bottom shelf white wine, I asked, I do hope they step that up a notch.

Reviews.Title: “Not My Cup Of Tea”
Reviews.Author: Krisanc19
Reviews.Content: Pros: I stayed at the hotel because my family was showing horses. The hotel is great for people who don't want to try and navigate downtown Las Vegas. Overall the staff was pretty friendly. My Grandfather had a medical emergency while at the hotel and the staff did what they could until help arrived. This hotel meets a need for those who are showing horses, in bowling tournaments or have family's. Negatives: -My disabled Mother and I were supposed to take the hotel shuttle to the airport. The shuttle driver said he never received my reservation and could only take one handicapped passenger at a time. He was quite rude. We ended up taking a taxi. -The first handicapped room I was given had one bed (we requested two). However, the bed was broken. I went to sit on it and the other end of the bed raised three feet in the air. We got switched, but it took over an hour. -At the cafe, a member of my party got a staple in their pancakes. The waitress would not give us that meal for free. -The casino floor needs more air circulation, it smells like cigarette smoke. -I don't go to Vegas to be surrounded by kids and this hotel had a lot of kids running around. That would be ok if the children were supervised, but I felt security should have been more strict with kids running around the casino. -I knew the hotel was not near the strip, but there wasn't anywhere within walking distance to do some shopping. -The doors are very heavy and virtually impossible for a handicapped person to work alone. -You have to pay for wireless internet. What a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not at the price”
Reviews.Author: somedey
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, clean. Not being Vegas savvy found it very difficult to find the parking. No registration parking area unless you used valet parking. Everything is a long walk. For the price we paid, no coffee maker, no fridge, no hair dryer and smelled like cigarette smoke even though it was a "non-smoking room" Took two calls to get housekeeping to spray air freshener. That was the hotels answer to the smell. Room Temperature system is probably the best I have ever used. I don't believe I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the area, good hotel, extra charges for everything”
Reviews.Author: sspc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the opposite end of the strip. It's in a residential neighborhood and it's a welcomed change from the bustling strip. It's huge like the rest but there is very little traffic AND there is the South Point Shopping Center nearby. All the shops including a Whole Foods. The hotel is good, my only real complaint is that the lobby is virtually non-existant. It's all casino with a welcome registration area. The elevators and across the casino so you have to walk through the smoke to get to your room. Not a very good floor plan at all. If you are a non smoker, you have to cover your noise as you by through. My room is very nice, high floor with a nice seating area, flat screen, etc. Don't care for all the extra charges. $15 for internet per day, $15 to use the gym, $15 to use the sauna or hot tub, $2 to print a boarding pass. It can drive you crazy. On the plus side, they give you a coupon booklet with a free well drink, a free lunch at the buffet and a free souvenir at the gift shop. Doesn't quite make up for all the extra charges, but it's something. The food is expensive, but there is a nice Thai Food restaurant in walking distance from here that's pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Casino”
Reviews.Author: lasvegasview
Reviews.Content: Our family visited here for a quick "staycation" and had a blast. My youngest loved the kiddie pool, and it is by far the best we have experienced, with a really cool lighted fountain in the center. The bigger pools and the ornate hot tub were great fun as well. The beds were very comfortable and the buffet was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Equestrian event in Las Vegas...”
Reviews.Author: O0hlala
Reviews.Content: Went to a horse show in Vegas that was at the South Point Hotel! Nice hotel that offers equestrians a great place to stay in Vegas. They can host a number of equestrian events (or rodeo's) at the hotel and it makes it very convenient if you are attending the show. It's not on the strip.... about 15 minutes away (which is fine with me!) For the most part the hotel is lovely. Clean and pretty affordable. My biggest complaint about the room would be the beds..which seamed lumpy and were uncomfortable. Just my opinion. The maid service was also not the best I have seen. Although the room was clean she didn't empty the garbage can the whole three days that we were there. Not a biggie but would have been nice. :) The casino itself is very large with just about any game you want, tables or machines. The restaurants we tried at the hotel (they have about 5 or 6 restaurants/deli's at the hotel) were far from excellent. Probably the worst mexican food I have EVER eaten. Ick! Although they did have a wonderful Deli there with great little breakfast plates. Over all it was a pretty good experience and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and great food”
Reviews.Author: marcdesi
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed it very much. The deli and cafe had really good food. The room was clean. Its a few miles from the main strip and if thats ok with you, then this is the place to stay. We enjoyed the pool as well.

Reviews.Title: “South Point ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: jpeters1953
Reviews.Content: I find it quite disturbing that people will base their reviews on slow room service or a grumpy maid. South Point Hotel is CLEAN and AFFORDABLE and FUN! That is all that matters. I couldn't care less if the front desk clerk didn't smile upon my arrival. I didn't either. I don't care if the maid didn't fall to my feet when I greeted her. All I care about is cleanliness, affordability, location, comfortable beds, water pressure, TV reception, and a few other amenities. Don't believe the people that get on this site just to gripe about a hair they found on the sink. Good job South Point!

Reviews.Title: “off-the-strip solid contender for value, yet a full-service hotel/casino”
Reviews.Author: dakotakidz
Reviews.Content: Didn't know this place existed, and when a large conference took up the last nights of our stay at our other hotel, we looked for another place to stay. All the rates on/near the strip were well over $100 a nite, so we looked elsewhere. THis place is south of the airport a good 3-4 miles, but it's huge! The same type of place as the Las Vegas Hilton or Luxor, etc, just without the strip around it. They had 9 restaurants, and while I only ate at the fast-food lcoation and the buffet, I've had much worse. The buffet wasn't as great as some other Vegas buffets, but it was acceptable, and very reasonable ($5.95 breakfast!). Rooms are standard and clean; beds were a bit firm, but not a huge deal. Costs were only $70-$80/night, and many times you get what we did, and get a coupon book that included free lunch buffets and some other deals. We enjoyed it, and the tables there had lower limits much of the time than some of the big name casinos. Easy to get to to/from the airport, but you need transportation, or you'll pay $8/shuttle trip to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mandy1402
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to Vegas and my first to the Southpoint. Having previously stayed on the busier part of the strip I decided to book at this hotel as knew it was quite new and had seen very good reviews for it. I'm glad I did as it is a really lovely hotel, and we were upgraded free of charge to a lovely large, modern 24th floor room with a nice view of the mountains and also given a free fridge. Buffet was one of the best I have had. As we had a hire car the location at the bottom of the Strip was fine and we slept like logs - the beds were fabulous. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal with some pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: meaganf
Reviews.Content: I have to say this hotel is further off the strip then they said, 2 miles.. this isn't no 2 miles. We had a great stay here, rooms were very affordable and very nice. Rooms were silent, the only thing you could hear is if your neighbour slammed the door behind them other then that no noise at all. Beds were very comfortable, the steak house in the hotel is AMAZING! alot of the restaurants close early so if you come in late and are hungry.. good luck finding anything. as for the shuttles... they leave every hour which is sort of inconvenient i would think every half hour would be better. Theres always a line outside for the shuttle to the strip, and its unorganized, no sign saying"line up here" so everyone makes there own line which could become a problem as the buses aren't large enough for the whole line to get on which means you would have to wait another hour. Talk about slowing down your day.. Depending on traffic you could take a taxi but it may be between 30 and 50 dollars.. no thanks.. I would stay here again if we were on a budget but would rather stay closer on the main strip so everything is more in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money but some wierd quirks”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl12
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because a hobby show was there and decided to stay there also rather than endure the craziness of LV proper. Got the weekend package special which has 3 prices based on whether you get the low, mid, or high level floor. We got the mid at about $100pp for 2 nights since the lower price was sold out. Includes 4 cocktails and 2 meals at the buffet and access to the fitness center. Here's the good: Covered parking, fast elevators, very large clean room, flat panel TV, tons of penny slots, there's also bingo, bowling, and a movie theater, cocktail servers came by very often for players, sports book area is really nice, food at the buffet was surprising good. Check out is at 12 which gives you a little more time. Here's the bad: The ventilation system is awful - I'm used to smelling some smoke in a casino but in this one I felt like I was smoking along with everyone else. The wireless access is about $13/day, Here are the quirks:There are only about 10 non-casino stations on the TV and none are cable except CNN (I think) and definitely no HBO. You get your coupons for the meals when you check in. You can check in after 3pm. However, the buffet is closed at that time until dinner. On Saturday and Sunday, they only have brunch and you can't use the vouchers for that meal (only specifically breakfast, lunch, and dinner so brunch was not included. I called to verify and found that is the policy). So effectively, you can only use them for dinner on Friday or Saturday night. I'm not ever sure if you can use if for Friday night since that is the seafood night and the price is higher. Seems kind of weird that the package is specifically for the weekend and you can't use the vouchers for most of the weekend. They should give out vouchers that say they are good for brunch and dinner when getting the weekend package.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls, poor guest relations and smoky casino”
Reviews.Author: Earth_Pal
Reviews.Content: pros... movie theatres, free and plentiful parking, easy access to I-15, close to seminars and fast elevators cons... thin walls, smoky casino that makes it impossible to eat at restaurants or use "free internet", noisy water pipes, no frig/mw, limited tv channels, long walk to parking garage, front door let hall light into room that no night light needed Was here for a week attending early morning starting seminars and trade show. I debated about staying elsewhere but decided it would be good to stay in the conference hotel. Nearly checked out after being woken up at 2:30am by the woman next door screaming into her cell phone. This went on before and after I called security to please come up to tell her to quiet down. Did Security or Hotel Management do a follow up with me regarding this, no. On two other occasions, I felt like I was part of a "threesome". The pipes carrying water for the room above me could be heard in the bedroom part of my room. To obtain some white noise, I would have to run the AC at a low temperature thus making it very cold in the room. Needless to say, I do not consider this to have met my request for a quiet room and it impacted my ability to learn which is what I was there to do. In hindsight, I should have checked out early since the SP doesn't understand how important a quiet room is to someone who is in classes all day. If you have no problems with smoke or noise then stay here. I know that I will not again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Pleasant, Minimal Amenities"”
Reviews.Author: AnnonSheena
Reviews.Content: Traveling with my 12-year-old son during his Spring break. Chose South Point due to positive reviews. It was indeed a very large, inexpensive, surprisingly classy room in the "mid-price, no view" category, working out to about $45 a night--I got lucky and happened to book during a shoulder week: Prices were higher the weeks before and after. Cleanliness: Overall the hotel felt and looked clean--the lobby floor is picked up, the elevator area is pleasant and shiny, the pool area isn't a towel dump, and the corridor carpets are in good repair. Of course there is the inescapable smoke of the casino--which is everywhere in Las Vegas, and took me by surprise, coming as we do from the Nanny State next door. The casino ventilation in South Point is better than some, but not as good as others, such as Caesar's Palace--but one might say, Caesar's Palace had better be the best. A final note: I wish they kept the glass entry doors cleaner. Service The reason I put a three is because when I requested more hangers, it took a full day, and then what I received was a tangle of wire hangers, not the nice wooden ones. Our housekeeper was solemn and didn't greet us in the hallway. I'm silly that way: I like to be greeted by the housekeeping staff. I just put it down to personal unhappiness. She did a nice job with the room, no complaints there, and I gave her $10 as a show of goodwill when I left. Lastly, the guy who checked us in was helpful, but seemed like an old con on work release rather than the bright agent of welcome I tend to prefer. My question: "Can you find us a very quiet room?" seemed to arouse suspicion in him and he eyed me unpleasantly, looking for motive. But I did get a "very quiet room" at the end of the hall on the 11th floor. Location This I loved, four miles south of the Strip. You can take the resort's daily $8 RT shuttle bus or drive yourself. I drove into the Strip each day and self-parked at one of the big hotels. I was relieved to be far, far away from the churning bodies, shouts, and neon of the Strip, troglodytes snapping prostitute calling cards at every corner, all of which took on the feel of an undulating nightmare animal by the end of our third day. Remember, we're laid-back mom-and-son San Diegans. (Then why choose Las Vegas? you may ask. Believe it or not, it was because the weather report said the Grand Canyon would be "rained out" and I had never been to Vegas. "I thought it would be fun.") Value I guess when you take the low price of the room, and add a $5.95 breakfast buffet each day, a cheap lunch somewhere, etc., it's good value. I had an idea that Vegas was a great value for everyone. The lesson I learned is that it's not, at least for sober, retiring people: You have to be a Vegas guy. The value is when you drink and smoke and gamble and get comped for shows and meals and earn points with your little frequent-guest card in the video slots. That is, when you like to do Vegas stuff. I'm not him (or her). I'm a mom who wanted a thrifty escape for her boy, and by the time it was over I wished we were in a small, decent room in a Hampton Inn somewhere, with a nice smoke-free lobby, free coffee in the lobby, a complimentary breakfast buffet, even at $40 more per day for the room. Room / Sleep Quality For such a well-appointed room--handsome drapes, lovely linens, firm mattress--there was no mini-fridge or microwave, and the channel selection was meager. But it is a 42" wall-mounted TV, and nice to watch an in-room movie on for $12. I saw a teeny mini-fridge being removed from another guest room, so I guess it can be requested. Maybe this is typical in Las Vegas, or typical in general for resort rooms (to drive the guests into the establishment for their food and relaxation?) but a small disappointment for someone who likes to put a little food and milk aside and channel surf with her kid while on vacation. Overall Impression Traveling with a child, I did very much appreciate the brightness, even cheeriness of the South Point casino floor: When we walked through some of the dark casinos of the Strip to get to parking, I felt like a bat might suddenly fly at me screaming, and I sensed evil everywhere. The bottom line is: If you're savvy about Las Vegas, know your way around, and know how to work the system, South Point is a very good choice for families with children. Large, clean, comfortable rooms, good thermostat, nice pool and Jacuzzi, bowling lanes and movie theater. But poor channel selection and nowhere to put leftovers.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service ever”
Reviews.Author: pesker
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Las Vegas during one of the busiest weekends of the month so in order to save money we decided to stay at South Point instead of on the strip. We picked our car up from the valet to go to dinner and the back window wouldn't roll up so we went back to the hotel to find out what happened. They called down security and he was the only friendly person we talked to that night. Next, the head of security came to talk to us and I have never experienced that kind of rudeness at a hotel before (even at a motel 6!!). He basically called my boyfriend a liar and said, "let's get to the point, what do you want?." All we wanted was to know what happened to the car and we wanted a ride to dinner since our car wasn't fit to drive to the strip. He said he reviewed the surveillance tapes and our window was half down when we arrive (this is false and the part where he was basically calling us liars). At this point we decided to file a claim. The head security took our information inside to photocopy and when he came back, his attitude had completely changed. They had re reviewed the tapes and our window was in fact all the way when we arrived and as the driver drove down the ramp, it drop. Ok, fine, can we get a ride to dinner now? Security is not authorized to make this kind of decision and we need to speak with the front desk manager. Ok, great, so now the claim? We were told that basically nothing would happen so filing a claim is a waste of time. We're not sure if they just told us this to CYA or what but either way, we decided not to file a claim. After an hour of standing in the cold, we went in to speak with the front desk manager to ask for a ride to dinner. Before I could even talk she said "we don't know what happened so we can't be shuttling you guys around everywhere." umm, ok? Also, she said she is not authorized to make that decision and there was no one in the hotel that could. On St. Patricks day and the beginning of March madness, there is no one managing the hotel. Ok. Overall we were very disappointed in the overall employees of the hotel and the lack of customer service. Our car was not some POS, its a 2 year old 5 series BMW and most people I know would have been extremely upset to have it return from the valet with a broken window. We weren't as concerned with the repairs because the car is a lease and repairs are covered but we did expect to treated with some sort of respect. I will definitely never return to this hotel. Also, the non smoking room smelled like it had been smoked in.

Reviews.Title: “Barely adequate place to stay”
Reviews.Author: evvybuns
Reviews.Content: I was in Las Vegas as an exhibitor at a trade show and therefore not the typical Vegas customer. I have no interest in the Vegas "experience." I don't gamble or smoke. The sheer scale of South Point is mind-boggling. The walking distances are annoying. The casino is huge and loud. The people-watching is hilarious, though. Those glazed-over eyes. . . . The room was clean and spacious, as was the bathroom. Our view to the west was neat. However, the in-room safe was broken. I suspect a low battery. We did call housekeeping but the safe was never fixed. The $12.99 internet charge per laptop per day is idiocy. Hell, the most humble motel in Utah offers free internet these days. I'm sure a hotel employee will chime in and tout the free internet in the hotel business center. Not good enough. I'm not going to haul my laptop and credit card imprints through the obnoxious casino in order to hook into the free internet downstairs and process credit card sales. Won't happen. The tub floor was really slick and dangerous. The shower head was a joke. If we had not temporarily substituted a cheap plastic shower head during our stay, I would still be trying to rinse shampoo out of my hair. Also, the bath tub didn't drain well. Standing in soapy water--yuck. If this place epitomizes glamour to you, you are more easily pleased than I am.

Reviews.Title: “Love being away from the strip....”
Reviews.Author: LaCoqui222
Reviews.Content: We don't come to Vegas to gamble so the further away from the strip for us, the better! We've stayed at South Point three times and have never been disappointed! Check-in was fast and front desk staff are very helpful. It will run you about $25.00 to the airport, but they do offer shuttles for about $8.00 to the Fashion Mall on the strip. Driving on the freeway, you can get to the strip in about 12-15 minutes. If your not a good big city driver and have a vehicle, stay on Las Vegas Blvd. and you will eventually run into South Point. Will take you a little longer, but if you're not in a hurry, the scenic view is quite interesting. I love that the rooms are far from the action and they have plenty of other things to do. Rooms are very large and have nice views of the city. Very clean and nice comfy beds. They also have a variety of restaurants to choose from, so if you'd like to be just a little away from the hustle and bustle of the strip, this is the place to find a room. Also, room prices vary during certain seasons, so check the rates. We just missed March Madness, so we got the rooms at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “This is a gem ....off the Vegas Srip”
Reviews.Author: Globebugs
Reviews.Content: I could easily rate his hotel 5 stars but had a service problem in one of the hotel's franchise restaurants...more on that later. We enjoyed our one night here and wished it could have been more. The rate if you watch online can be exceptional for the room you get. The weekend price goes up of course but we planned around that. There were plenty of locals here and that is always a good sign for the budget conscious. Plenty of free parking and could get close to the hotel. Check in/out a breeze and excellent reception staff. We paid a little extra for a mid level floor and got a higher floor with a great view to the Strip in the distance. The room itself was palatial in size, clean and neat as a pin. The bathroom was a great size and the amenities were plentiful. Beds were so comfy and noise was nothing for a casino hotel. The style and colours of the room were beautiful and would rate better than some on the Strip. The only drawback for some is the distance to the Strip without a vehicle. There were plenty of choices for dining. We had the buffet for breakfast at a great price. It was closed for dinner when we were there. They have a deli, a Seattle's Best coffee but both closed rather early for a casino. That's how we ended up eating at the Steak and Shake Restaurant I guess we didn't order enough .... just off a flight and not too hungry. That shouldn’t mean poor service. We waited 30 mins for just a couple of side salads and got fed up. So in the end we walked away just trying to pay for the drinks we had. Of course they tried to say the salads had been delivered.... news to us! End of story…. embarrassing check problem. This is not associated with the hotel directly but did spoil a great stay here and a 5 star rating. We will be back for sure next time in Las Vegas. If you like the buzz of the Strip this hotel is not for you but if like a great room and price with all kinds of facilities with no resort fees, try the South Point.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Quiet Sleep”
Reviews.Author: lynz001
Reviews.Content: Two families stayed 5 nights for our March Break with 17 and 14 year olds had 2 rooms with 2 queen beds. We got the lowest room type. We were so busy we were only in room to sleep and change so view did not matter to us. The room was very quiet except the heavy doors but never heard any noise during the night we were on 3rd floor. The room was clean and large and beds were comfortable. Liked the bathroom with separate area for shower and toilet so another person can get ready at the mirror and sink. Wished they had a microwave and fridge but was not a problem. We ate at garden buffet for breakfast most morings as the price was great and plenty of choices for everyone with home made eggs. Also got free luch buffet coupon. Also ate at Prime Rib and was very good and also the cafe and deli and coffee from Seattle place. We found the food to be very good and plentiful. Coupon book nice with free drinks and bufett and discounts we used most of them. The casino was very nice with brightness and easy to navigate. We did not gamble much but was easy to get to elevators to room. The pool was not ready however they had use of one next door which was very nice but did not use as we were to busy seeing the sights. We rented cars and went to hoover dam and the dessert. Valet was was great as well as self parking. The price of the room was unbeatable. We enjoyed our stay and recomment to other families if you rent a car. Also has bowling and theatre but never had time to use.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY OFF THE STRIP”
Reviews.Author: broexa
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this hotel for a reunion trip. The hotel room was clean and meet all expectations. The casino had a variety of games and the bingo room was awesome. We had a mix up and had our rooms on separate floors upon arrival, but the staff was able to move a room to just a few doors down from the other. The brunch buffet was not that great except the mimosa, but the deli had a good breakfast. The hotel shuttle to the airport worked out well, but you do need to make reservations in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Always my first Choice in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: shoeboxdriver
Reviews.Content: I love South Point. We found it a few years back. It is my go to place in Vegas. It is always clean. The beds are comfortable. The pillows stink, they are to soft, but I can deal with that. The buffet is always good. Nothing fancy, but good! The rooms are quiet. Plenty of space. Employees are friendly. Valet to check in all rate A plus for me! Great rates. We usually do the super saver rates because we know what Vegas looks like and do not need a view from our window. This time we saw a wall and a rooftop next to us and if I looked hard to the left I could see the parking garage. For 42 dollars, great view for me. I could see if it was sunny or not!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: GogetterVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for one night from March 27-28. Although it is a little far from the main action of the South Strip, it was an incredible value for us. Clean, spacious and modern-style room. Nice facilities, too. Loved the pool/ho tub area. Garden Buffet is not bad, sieher.

Reviews.Title: “Negative surprises”
Reviews.Author: Joeclt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is out of the way and you best have a rental car if you stay there. The customer service is substandard. My first impression was pulling up to the hotel and being ignored by the staff to unload my luggage and use of a bell hop. I had to leave the car parked out front in plain sight of two guys who ignored me. Next, the check in was pleasant but no offers of assistance. I took my luggage up to the room, came back to park the car while two of their "welcoming committee guys watched an never spoke to me. If you were told you have high speed internet, be advised it's $12.95 per day. If you like to use a fitness center, be advised you need a $15.95 "pass" per day. The pool is mostly off limits. What's next, a fee to clean the room? The restaurants are average at best but I haven't tried the two upscale ones available. I would not stay here again. The room rates are not that great to account for the lack of service.

Reviews.Title: “Still our first choice”
Reviews.Author: UncleLenny
Reviews.Content: This place has been "discovered" as it has been at full capacity the last three visits we have made in the last six months. And while the hotel is showing some signs of wear and tear, it is still a good value. We have looked over other hotels and casinos in Vegas and have concluded that South Point is still our first choice when we want a few days away. We always fill in a comment card and get the emails on special deals they offer. While I notice the towels are thinner, the amenities in the room are different, the rugs and wallpaper are showing their age, these are things that we notice, but do not deter us from moving to another hotel. South Point has been our first choice since it opened.

Reviews.Title: “What a complete mess.....just cheap everthing "except there phone service"”
Reviews.Author: mary1949
Reviews.Content: well it was straight out of the door after the first night......we had done 4 nights at the Platinum Hotel in Vagas and decided to stay a few more nights but the Platinum was full so we had to move on...well this hotel made us move on to another city..... oh and i made a 5 min call to a overseas number and they charged me $39.50. l asked if that was the phone company charges the stated NO its hotel charges. teach me to forget me phone charger........we ate italian in the hotel which can only be discribed as OMG...it was swill.......PLEASE GO BACK INTO VAGAS!!!!!...this was just cheap and nasty.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mahalo65078
Reviews.Content: This was the third straight year that we do "Madness in Vegas." College Basketball and Las Vegas just go together. South Point has a huge Sportsbook, great TVs and great bars and bartenders. We will be back for "Madness" again next year. The hotel is wonderful. Large, comfortable rooms. The restaurants were what we expected with reasonable prices and good food. The pool is now open however it's to cold this time of year to enjoy being outside.

Reviews.Title: “An easy way to vacation when you are a Las Vegas local”
Reviews.Author: Marlea298
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Sometimes you just want to get away and relax yet, you can't be too far or don't have the money to travel. Just pack a small bag and go down the street to your own little vacation with relaxing pool and spa. Great movie theatre and unique eateries.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing property that is a hidden gem in the oasis.”
Reviews.Author: MisterC_78
Reviews.Content: After experiencing a horrid one night stay at a property on the strip, my friends and I booked a four night stay for the remainder of our Vegas trip at South Point (SP). We arrived at SP around noon Sunday. The lady at the front desk said that it wasn't a problem checking in early as rooms were already available. When I arrived to my room everything was 100% clean and spotless. The bathrooms looked stellar and the bedding area was in order. No discrepancies whatsoever. Every room at SP is equipped with a 42" plasma television. After showering and eating a nice meal at their buffet, we played some games on the casino floor and actually won some money. We than took a shuttle that transported us from the property to the Las Vegas strip at an affordable 24 hour rate. The shuttle service to and from the strip is what really made this stay a positive one as cab fares in the Las Vegas region can be ridiculously expensive. Yes, SP is located a good five miles from the L.V. strip, but the generous shuttle service rate which is good for 24 hours compensates the distance between SP and the strip. We enjoyed the numerous services that SP had to offer while on property. SP is one of those hotels that I consider a hidden gem due to its location off the strip. Personally, I would avoid booking a stay on any on strip properties as the majority of them are over hyped while incurring hidden fees. At SP, there are no hidden fees. Overall, SP is the way to go if you're on a budget but still want to experience the treatment of a luxurious five star mega resort that is found on the L.V. strip. The difference between a privately owned hotel compare to a corporation run property is amazing. Avoid corporate hotels which are found mostly on the strip. Looking forward to staying at SP in the near future. While I was on property during my four night stay,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tedsmith68
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my experience at this hotel. The rooms were just fantastic. They are so large and the Serta beds provide excellent sleep quality. It is incredible the value you receive in your room for the price paid. Again, the rooms are huge. They also have a lot of light and a large television. The HVAC system is also great because it maintains a comfortable temperature and is quiet. The bathroom is also huge and the shower is very nice. The shampoo provided is also very nice. Additionally, the coffee is also great. While the price of the rooms is quite cheap, if you choose to stay at the hotel for your food, the price will quickly be made up. We ate at the buffet for dinner and it was $56 for four people. The selection and quality of the food was really not fantastic. The hotel does have a Seattle's Best Coffee which is nice, however, I would recommend saving some money and eating at the restaurants that are just down the street on Las Vegas Blvd. The casino here is pretty cool. It is large and there are always tons of people on the floor. The sports book area is also very cool and is very dynamic during big sporting events. Security at the casino is tight though and it is somewhat of a tense environment and it feels like somebody is always looking over your shoulder. Parking at this hotel is a bit of a pain. While it is free, it can be hard to find a parking spot and you will likely have to park a far distance from the door. Overall, it is was a very fun and enjoyable experience staying at this hotel. The room was simply fantastic. However, if you want better parking options and want to be able to come and go easier, I would recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AuntieM64
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I stayed in an establishment that I didn't park outside my room. The hotel was a bit intimidating at first, but everyone that I met was concerned only with my welfare and comfort. The valet staff was outstanding, as was the bellmen, front desk, and housekeeping staff. Everyone was more than courteous when I had a question. There is a large casino at the hotel, and several restaurants, but it is located south of McCarran Airport, which gives it a quiet dignity you don't find in the "Strip" hotels further north. The room was spacious, the bathroom wonderful, and everything was exceedingly clean. The beds have Serta mattresses, so are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location if you have a car - pool area is closed!!”
Reviews.Author: travelingwurd
Reviews.Content: We like staying at South Point because the value is good. The rooms are always clean although the beds are not comfortable. Room and bathroom is large. Fairly quiet unless there is an event - then be prepared for a crowd. Very disappointed that the pool area was closed - and they did not tell us when we reserved our room. Internet connection is not free, although it should be!

Reviews.Title: “Bottom Line...If You Have A Car, This Place Is Friggin' Awesome. If Not, DO NOT Stay There.”
Reviews.Author: BigMountainTraveler
Reviews.Content: I am going to attempt a fairly decent review based on a recent one week stay at South Point. But I am gonna tell you now, if you have to take a taxi (35 bucks and up) to get to the strip, or use their shuttle ($8 per person & time consuming), do yourself a favor. STOP reading reviews of this place and just find somewhere else to stay. South Point's remote location from the strip should be a deal killer if you don't have a car, and I wouldn't dare stay there if I didn't have my own transportation. Trust me on this. If you can afford to pay that kind of money for a taxi, you can afford to stay on the strip in a higher dollar hotel. If you are still with me, here we go. Spent 6 nights (Sun-Fri) while in town for a conference at the LV Convention Center. I didn't have a choice on hotels because my colleague blindly picked SP based on the cheap room price, so we had no idea what we were getting ourselves into. We had a company car, so we weren't horribly worried about transportation issues. I booked my room about a week in advance direct by phone at the hotel. The girl who I dealt with must have been new, because she put me on hold several times to get answers to some relatively simple questions. But overall, she booked me a room and it wasn't too painful. They charge a one day deposit up front to hold the room. Once you arrive, they tack on a hundred dollar incidental charge to your credit card, which they say is returned. I have not yet confirmed this, as I haven't got my CC bill at the time of this review. My six day stay wound up averaging about $58 a night, and the total bill (no incidentals) came out to be about $385-ish after taxes. Not bad at all. Check in was pretty easy and non eventful. You have two choices for parking. One, on the ground level parking lot outside the east or north sides of the hotel, or in the 7 floor large parking garage on the northwest side. They are more or less about the same distance walk to the rooms, which I would say is not horribly long. Certainly less than some of the major strip hotels. Plan on a 5-10 minute walk to your car from your room. You have to pass through the casino area no matter how you come in to get to your room. I hate this, but that seems to be the norm in most of the big outfits. We chose to park in the parking garage on the top floor, as we could see our car from our rooms on the 20th floor. The garage was plenty big, and was empty enough where we always got a good parking spot. That was not the case with the ground floor parking, which was largely full most of the time. Also, coming in from the garage bypasses all the crazy traffic jammed up activity at the main entrance (taxis, bell hops, valet, etc.). Using the parking garage is much less dramatic coming and going versus using the main entrance, which can be a madhouse at times. I attached 5 photos of my room, which was a "Deluxe King Non Smoking", the cheapest room in the hotel. You will see it is clean, modern enough, and spacious. Zero complaints about the room, other than they don't have refrigerators, which sucks, and they charge 13 bucks a day for internet, which likely would have been a deal killer for me, but again, I didn't have a choice. I think the girl told me I could have a refrigerator for an extra 15 bucks a day, but that was gouging in my opinion. Even Super 8's have refrigerators and microwaves these days, so this is pathetic. There is certainly ample room in the rooms for them. I brought a small cooler and just put ice in it every day. They do have an ice machine near the elevators. Fortunately, the prices of food at SP are low (I will go into that in a minute), so it wasn't too major of an inconvenience. I understand these hotels charge for internet access because they don't want you in your rooms surfing the net.....they want you in the casinos. But just about everyone needs to check their email once or twice a day, and the internet charge is ridiculous. They supposedly have free wi-fi in the lobby by the check in desk. I did see a couple of people with laptops in this very small area, which is surrounded by casino areas. I fortunately borrowed an air card for my laptop, so I didn't need to try to utilize the lobby wi-fi. But again, I would likely not stay there based on the lack of free wi-fi alone if it was up to me. The rooms had their own climate controls, which was great. They had a good quality collection of soap/shampoos, and a single cup coffee maker. There is a Seattle's Best coffee shop at the main entrance, and surprisingly, their prices are not higher than a regular coffee shop. Their "normal" prices were a pleasant surprise. I would not have been pleased about the single cup coffee maker if the coffee shop prices were high, but this made it more tolerable. The furniture/TV/accessories in the rooms were of good quality. The large flat screen TV had a minimal lineup of channels. Again, I'm sure they don't want you in your room watching TV all day. I get this, but don't like it. The bed was comfortable, but a tad bit firm. Not too bad though. The pillows were comfortable. The maids consistently did a good job cleaning my room each day. Hint: lock your room with the bar across the door each morning, or put out a "Do not disturb" sign outside the door if you don't get up early.
