If not, the maids do a "room check" fairly early and knock and enter. They don't wait for you to answer the door, they knock and immediately enter. I am not sure what this room check accomplishes, as it's not when they actually clean the room. The only thing it accomplished with me was to wake me up a couple of times. A minor negative was the bathroom lighting was inadequate for shaving. The bathroom sink area should be better lit. The shower was excellent. A large head and seemingly clean. We didn't really take advantage of any of the recreational opportunities other than the casino, but we did take a look at the bingo hall and bowling alley. They both looked cool if you are into that. We never checked out the equestrian center, as it didn't have anything going on at the time we were there. The casinos seem to be more or less clean, and with a fair choice of games. I am not much of a gambler though, so I am not well versed in this area. I did wind up leaving about 25 bucks ahead, which is probably just lucky. As far as smoke is concerned, I would say overall it wasn't too bad. At times if you are in a spot where a bunch of people are smoking, you're gonna be smoky, but overall, I don't think it was as bad as I have experienced in other casinos. The waitresses were decent on bringing drinks most of the time. There were a couple who seemed to be a tad bit slow, but it wasn't so bad that it made me mad. There was a pretty good security presence in the hotel. They seemed to have a lot of guards and they made their rounds enough to where you felt like they had a good grip on things. There were also plenty of slot attendants moving about. I felt the security presence overall was above average. Most nights, the security makes you show your room key at the elevators, presumably to prevent large parties from going on in the rooms. I appreciated this. No need to have riff raff or thieves moving about freely on the upper floors as well. Another issue that was a HUGE plus in my mind was it seemed the prices overall for a lot of things at SP were cheaper than what you would pay at strip hotels. For example, the Steak and Shake diner had cheap prices. A cheeseburger combo was less than 5 bucks. A quality chicken salad (for a fast food type place) less than 6 bucks. And something that totally amazed me was the gift shop sold six packs of cold beer cheaper than any place I have ever seen anywhere. For example, a six pack of Dos Equis was $4.99, and a six pack of Henieken was $5.19. That is incredible. Cheaper than you can find on the street pretty much anywhere. I am guessing the cheap prices are to draw people away from the strip or to keep them in the facility to spend their money. You can certainly spend the day at SP and spend significantly less than you would at a big hotel on the strip. The prices alone make SP very desirable in my opinion. I know this is Vegas, but I hate to get gouged as much as the next guy. To review, I would highly recommend SP if you have your own transportation. Even then, count on 15-30 minutes to get to the strip, depending on traffic. It took us upwards of 45 minutes to get to the convention center each morning to get to our conference. Plan your driving accordingly if you have deadlines. If you have a car and the internet charge doesn't bother you, I say go for it. You will not be dissapointed. Hope this helps a bit. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location, too far from the strip!”
Reviews.Author: gunner1995
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 6 miles from the strip, although the hotel has a shuttle bus its still 8 bucks a day return! and will waste two hours a day of your time! so better to pay a little bit more AND STAY BY THE STRIP! The restaurants are ok nothing special! The swimming pool has been under reconstruction since january! The casino looks like it needs updating and smokey!

Reviews.Title: “good for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: Waretoonext
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very reasonably priced. Our King bed room was large although it had a distince odor of cleaning fluid that never really goes away. Food in cafe was adequate and if you like slot machines they are in abundance especially those geared toward the average joe. Lots of penny, nickel and quarters. Video poker which are in less supply in the nicer hotels. Located at the far end of strip as you enter town, Very close to a new outdoor mall called Town Square. A few miles before Mandalay Bay. Easy access to freeways and strip. But certainly not within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: efoster81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Las Vegas to attend the NASCAR race and do some sight seeing. We were so pleased with our stay here that we are already planning another visit. Our room was on the 21st floor and was very spacious and clean. With this hotel being off the strip (7 miles) it was very quiet and family friendly. There were no rowdy and loud guests in the halls, which we were pleasantly surprised. We ate at three of the restaurants at the hotel (the buffet, the seafood bar and the prime rib restaurant) and all had wonderful food for a very affordable price. We utilized the shuttle to and from the strip, at $8 per person for an all-day pass. The only down side was that it took one hour to return from the strip with all of the stops if you board the shuttle at the furthest stop on the strip. Even then, I thought the shuttle service was better than navigating the strip in our rental car. We also had a couples massage and used the couples spa area, which is so relaxing. The staff was very polite and helpful, with the exception of the box office staff. We utilized the bowling alley and was pleased with the pricing as well. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Reid_Swanson
Reviews.Content: Having done the Strip countless times, South Point was reserved on a whim. A massive structure a few miles south of the madness, this place is truly a diamond in the rough. The Casino floor was one huge room, which I usually dislike, but it's done very well. Plenty of gaming for all types daring enough to try. Huge OTB and Sports as well, which i wasn't brave enough for. I loved the atmosphere and lighting throughout. You can get booze relatively cheap at the gift shop and make your own drinks instead of screwing around with the bar(s), guilty. They gave you a coupon book highlighting the "dime a dozen" perks and freebies on check in. Didn' t do the theater but the lobby was cool and they let me go through to get a bag of popcorn for the Wife so she had something eat while watching James Franco and Anne Hathaway butcher the Oscars. Given this is an affordable local, it does bring in a mix of people and there was an "altercation" between an individual and staff in the cafe`. Not saying, but i'm saying. All in all, it was a magnificant establishment and would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place with Great Value”
Reviews.Author: swimmer1016063
Reviews.Content: We came to South Point Hotel as a large group of us and we felt that the prices were great and the rooms were nice. The hotel was close to restaurants and other amenities. The staff were very friendly. The beds were very soft and comfortable. We would recommend South Point to others for sure.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE, THE BEST FOOD, RELAXING SPA”
Reviews.Author: bettyhoyde
Reviews.Content: Room was a great size and the price was great. The food was top quality with the cheapest prices that i have ever seen from midnight to 6 am. the spa is worth its weight in gold. Staff were very helpful and the Bingo was the best in town. Keep up the great work South Point!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, away from Strip”
Reviews.Author: DannyRoman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within easy access to the highway that leads to downtown. I was very pleased to avoid the heavy traffic from the Strip. The hotel was very comfortable. The rooms and the bathrooms were big. All the floor had new rug. The beds were very comfortable. As most of the hotels in Vegas, the parking lot is far away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yarnam
Reviews.Content: I am a regular Las Vegas traveler and this time I took my new fiancée. This was our first stay at the South Point as we were looking for a new hotel experience that neither of us had stayed at before. We chose the South Point due to their western events and excellent value. We are both cowboy/cowgirl types so it fit our lifestyle and the arena has numerous western events. There was one scheduled while we were there but was unfortunately cancelled. This was a little disappointing but understandable given these economic times. Was a little annoyed that the events people did not respond to an email sent to them about 2 weeks before arrival however. If you are familiar with the Orleans hotel it is roughly the same idea but newer and cleaner and a better choice in my opinion. Location – Yes it is off the strip so a car/rental is probably best if staying here. They do have a reasonable priced shuttle though we did not use it as we had a car. To those complaining that the shuttle isn’t free, oh well it is a $20 - $30 cab ride and the shuttle is $8 so it’s a pretty good deal in my opinion. Valet – Courteous, prompt, and professional. No complaints here. People the Valet services in Vegas are some of the best value there is. For a simple tip you get to drop and pick up your car at the front door, it's a no brainer when the Nevada winds are blowing and that sun is beating down. Save the sunburn, use the valet, you’ll spend the tip money on water if you try to save it. Bellhop – Courteous, prompt, and professional. No complaints here either. Again folks use the bellhop, it is a tip service and why on gods green earth do you people want to drag your 3 bags each through the casino and onto the elevator (that I am inevitable on) when for a few bucks it is all handled for you. Just tell the Valet (which you should now be using after my previous lecture) that you would like a bellhop and one will come running, literally at this hotel. Check in – Smooth and much quicker than most of the strip hotels. No surprises like those stupid resort fees. Internet is not free however just like most if not all Vegas hotels. I really think it is time for the Vegas hotels to look into this silly extra cost. The infrastructure involved is not really that expensive anymore and it can be integrated into the main hotel computer system making it entirely wireless. I bet the first hotel to drop this silly price gouge makes up for it in month one with extra customers if they advertise it right. That said I am used to this internet issue and at least there wasn’t a stupid resort fee (read “surprise mark up”), I really hate those. Casino – Very spacious and open. Loved the design and really it has to be one of the most spacious casinos in Vegas. I have read several comments about it being smoky. I have no idea where these people are staying in Vegas other than the South Point but this has to be one of the most smoke free casinos I have ever encountered in Vegas. If you dislike smoke then this casino is a good choice. Didn’t win any money but this is Vegas folks and to tell the truth I found the machines to be fairly good as we didn’t lose very much. Drink service was average to good and at times excellent. Tip the girls people and you will find a dramatic improvement in your service speed, don’t be cheap, the drinks are free, excellent service isn’t. Drinks are also VERY reasonable priced if you are not gambling. We picked up a couple beers on every pass through the casino at the bar on the way to our room and it was cold and convenient. Room – Very spacious and clean. Beautiful television with normal Vegas channel offerings. Music channels were nice to have, mainly left it on the country station for background music while we were in our room. Someone commented that there were no “Do not disturb” signs. Not necessary, just double lock your room door and no maid will bother you. Someway it signals them that you want privacy just like the instructions on the door say it will. Bathroom was beautiful though I found the tub to be of the useless tiny variety. Shower was good though so no real problem here. Just don’t have any misconceptions that you and your partner are going to jump in the tub together, it’s not going to happen unless you’re both the size of a ferret. We had a king deluxe room and the sitting area was very nice. View was excellent also and I didn’t pay extra for it. The room was one of the largest I've ever had in Vegas and we could have run laps for exercise if we wanted, however the fiancée didn’t want to run laps but I did chase her around the room a little bit when time permitted. Shoe Shine – The courteous gentleman saved a pair of cowboy boots I thought I might have lost. For a few dollars my boots were looking good for a night on the town. Pool – closed while we were there (which I was warned about when making my reservation). We could see it from our room and it did look very nice. They are doing some renovations down there so it looks like it will be even better when it reopens. Food – Only ate at the Coronado Café but loved it. The late night deals are unbelievable. I had steak and eggs and I believe it was $4, fiancée had biscuits and gravy for $2. Really I have no idea how they do it but they do and it was good food. Service was excellent and they try to shove all the drunks in the very back so they don’t annoy you too much. Gift Shop – Very well stocked and staffed, has all those little things you need or nice things for gifts for the folks back home. Best t-shirt seen in there was a child’s t-shirt that said “I’m what happened in Vegas” Got one of those for the grandson who is a Vegas baby. Checkout – Used the electronic checkout through the TV. Went smooth and with an efficient bellhop service we were out the door and headed home in no time. A few comments however. I do not understand how a western oriented resort does not have a country bar in it, this is just odd in my opinion. If you feel the need to party country style however Stoney’s Rockin Country Bar is just a few blocks away and it is one heck of a place, look it up. The Las Vegas Outlet Center is very close and a trip to the Boot Barn right down the road is a must for any cowboy/cowgirl. Our overall impressions were very good. As I said I am a Vegas regular and I enjoyed my first South Point experience. In fact I enjoyed it so much this is where we will be staying for our honeymoon. Watch for my next review of one of the more upscale rooms in April, hopefully with a larger bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was very clean, large, good value hege rooms.”
Reviews.Author: longshot3725
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I have stayed here and I found the hotel to be very easy to get in and out of with lots of self parking very colse to the hotel. The casino was big and not over crowded. The rooms were very big and had a large 42 inch flat screen TV on the wall. The rooms were quiet and clean. The only negative thing I have to say about the rooms is the sheets were "short Sheeted" at the foot of the bed every day. The bed pad they use has a plastic cover on it and it is noisey and it wrinkles easily making for an uncomfortable nights sleep. This hotel is about four miles south of all the other hotels on the "strip".

Reviews.Title: “overall, nice place, but VERY smoke-filled”
Reviews.Author: tinytike
Reviews.Content: Is 10 minutes total off the Strip via I-15, but location has the advantage of being quiet, easy to find parking, close to shopping and fast food. Restaurants are okay, but nothing to write home about. Rooms are okay--adequate size, nothing fancy but very nice. Best part was being able to sleep early at night or late in the morning and not be awakened by noisy, drunken guests. Was there for conference as well as leisure and those facilities were great. Major complaints: ventilation in public areas is terrible--clothes smelled like smoke the whole time; fitness center is way too expensive--per person rather than per room charge; no free refrigerator (available at $15/day); front desk staff could be more helpful/polite. Overall, good value. Would stay there again, but next time might try the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: SnappyG
Reviews.Content: The South Point exceeded our expectations from the minute we arrived. The staff - everyone from valet to check-in - was friendly and helpful. The next thing that caught our attention was the clean air in the casino; not a heavy smoke laden room. We also appreciated the spaciousness and decor of the lobby/casino. Our room was huge, clean and quiet - all very important factors for our comfort. The bed was comfortable and the thermostat in the room let us set it at the point *we* liked (as opposed to other places where the temperature is set by management). We enjoyed that there was so much to see & do within one place - not just a casino and hotel. "A city unto itself" - bowling, lots of restaurants, spa, an equestrian center, a 16-theater cinema, great workout room. We also appreciated that the hotel is located a straight shot south on Las Vegas Blvd. - or we could take the interstate - a short trip to the strip either way. However, we ended up spending most of our time at the South Point (the slots actually PAY here!). I ***loved*** the bath products. On the down-side, there were bright flood lights shining into our room all night. The South Point **GLOWS** for miles around as the lights shine off the gold exterior walls - which is beautiful to look at from the outside; however, it's a challenge for those of us who like to sleep in a completely dark room at night. The curtains were lined and light-blocking but the light still creeps in around the edges. The other thing I'd mention is that I wish they would have put a refrigerator and microwave in the room - there's certainly room for them (the room was huge). We will definitely be recommending the South Pointe to all our friends - and we will stay again the next time we come to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CBVDive
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for a long weekend in February. We were stranded at the airport for 7 hours before our flight was cancelled. The airline gave us a vouchure for a "cheap" hotel room through their Stranded Customer Service program. So we got 3 rooms for $50 each. I am thinking we are going to be put up at a dive but at this point I didn't care. After sitting on the floor in airport for 7 hours, anything has to be an improvement. So we arrived at the hotel and were amazed at how nice it was. The check in was quick and they got us right into our rooms. I do have to say that the front desk clerk was a little short and unfriendly to us. We were traveling in a group of 11 and reserved 3 rooms. On the phone the rep only gave me one confirmation number and didn't tell us we needed 3 vouchures for 3 rooms. So she rudely told us, if you are getting 3 rooms we need 3 vouchure and 3 confirmation numbers. My fuse was already short from being stuck at the airport all day so I basically let her know that it was not my problem that the lady on the phone didn't do her job and we were in no mood to deal with her attitude. So she got us checked in after a few members our party happened to have a few of these vouchures in their pockets as they were handing them out to everyone on the flight. But the rooms were beautiful and big. Very clean. They had a bowling alley, movie theature, huge arcade and indoor swimming pool. If you are going to Vegas and taking kids or teens, this would be a great place. They had tons of video poker. The restuarant had a special at midnight. $3.45 for NY steak, hash browns, 2 eggs and toast. $15 for 4 of us to eat a steak breakfast. Can't beat that. The slots seemed to pay off quite well and a lot of us won. The casino is huge and well layed out. It is a classy place. It was a nice change from the Strip and all the people handing out "girls to your room in 30 minutes" flyers and half naked girls cage dancing all over. Even though it is out a ways from the strip, they have a shuttle for $7 for the day that will take you to and from the hotel to the strip. I will definately consider staying there when we go back. Especially if I take my kids. I wish we would have had more time to explore the hotel and use more of their ammenities. They had a good variety of food options too.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money but if the beds are covered in stiff (anti-bedbug ?) mattress covers, feels like you're sleeping on plastic.”
Reviews.Author: eastave
Reviews.Content: Pros: clean, serviceable rooms/decor; large rooms with nice baths; wonderful spa facilities/personnel; movie theater; bowling alley; decent "coffee shop" Cons: smoky lobby full of depressive, unhealthy looking patrons; no more than 4 decent in-room dining options; inflexible front desk upgrade policies; hard, wrinkled mattress cover just under a thin sheet, negating the acceptable comfort of the mattress

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Excellent Room!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyjsanders
Reviews.Content: I was so happy to stay at South Point Hotel. While in the room I literally forgot I was staying in a casino. The room was so clean, comfortable and quiet! The layout of the casino made it very easy to find the different restaurants, etc. The coffee shop was very good. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay at the South Point again!

Reviews.Title: “One Stop Shop”
Reviews.Author: Off_the_Market
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the South Point....the Casino and Sports Book was all brand new. The clubs are ok but there is a shuttle out front to the strip that leaves every hour. The resort has a huge 21 (or so) screen movie theater, the biggest bingo hall and the buffet was great. The only downside was the smoke......OMG. There is a non- smoking section but you can smell the smoke in the casino. The resort is about 15 min from the airport and 10 min from the strip. The rooms are clean and large the front desk has plenty of goodies just ask. If you are into rodeos this is the spot.......Very Nice Spa also...I would give the resort a 7 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “much quieter than most Vegas properties yet all the benefits”
Reviews.Author: skiutah
Reviews.Content: This casino is large and has all the amenities. As a business person it was much quieter and i liked that. I was actually able to sleep well at night and not be woken up by drunken young people running down the hallways coming back from da clubs on the strip. Much quieter yet nice restaurants and stuff, i would recommend for business travelers and families with kids. When i go to Vegas for leisure however i stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities, rooms need upgrading”
Reviews.Author: Rhumdog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the South Point specifically to be there to watch the Super Bowl in their excellent sportsbook. This was our first time staying overnight there. We booked a "mini suite" with a separate bedroom and living area and found the accommodations greatly in need of being refurbished. The rooms were devoid anything up-to-date except the two flat screen TVs. Considering what we paid, the suite was not what we expected and realized we could have gotten a much more for the price on the Strip. This is especially true now that even the better hotels are offering great prices to fill their rooms. South point really needs to update the rooms if they want to remain competitive; especially since the location way south of the main Strip is not convenient if one doesn't have a car. However; we must say that the South Point is outstanding when it comes to the food in the restaurants, the casino and the facilities other than the rooms. Even the room service menu is reasonably priced, which is a rarity at the better hotels on the Strip. We especially liked Dom Vito's Italian Restaurant. Great food, great prices. Overall, I do recommend the South Point if you're not fussy about the "old fashioned" rooms. I am looking forward to the day that South point announces a refurbishment. I will then happily be there again.

Reviews.Title: “Off Strip in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MisterWombat
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well to the south of the Las Vegas Strip so you need a rental car unless you want to pay $50 per trip for a taxi. Not much nearby. Hotel does have a shuttle to the strip but it is infrequent. Casino is very smoky and smoke intrudes into the restaurants and ground floor meeting rooms. Room itself was OK although bed was too soft and no refrigerator and no free wi-fi. Bad glare from outside neon at night and bright sun in the morning if you do not get the drapes just right. Free parking but it fills up fast whenever there's an event.

Reviews.Title: “clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: phoenixdeb
Reviews.Content: as others have said, waaaaay off strip but thats not a problem if you have your own car as the hotel is right on the strip and right off the freeway, easy to get anywhere you want to go in vegas, and parking is a plenty in the garage or in the lots surrounding all sides of the casino. check in was fast, we arrived early and had no problem getting a room, service was always with a smile everywhere we went around the place. buffet is good and cheap(!!!), "primarily prime" restaurant was lucious and fairly priced for all the yummy food you get. the place is huge, lots to do so that you would never have to leave the place if you didnt want to. rooms were clean and very large...everything worked well, no problems. wasnt very impressed with the bed, not as comfy as other places we have stayed, but all in all, it was a very enjoyable experience and we will definately visit again, especially when rates are so low. i would highly recommend south point.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I was hoping for!”
Reviews.Author: TheHemmesFamily
Reviews.Content: The South Point was just what I was looking for on our first trip to Vegas. It was off the strip so it was quiet yet had it all. The Casino was bright and clean. The resturants had really good food. While we didn't get to try the bowling alley or movie theater they were available. The shuttle service to the strip was great and only cost $8 for the entire day. Having a free airport shuttle was also a great perk. My only negative about the hotel was having to pay for internet. That seemed wrong to me since most good hotels will offer it for free to their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mkathy
Reviews.Content: We've been going to Vegas for 30+ years. We have stayed at hotels up and down the strip, Ceasars, Sands, Monte Carlo, Star Dust, MGM, you get the idea. The South Point has became one of our favorties. True, it is a little ways from the strip, but for us that isn't a problem. The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are spacious and clean, the resturants have great food and at a great value. We prefer the small casinos, the last time we stayed at Ceasars it took me three days to be able to find the elevator to our room without asking directions. We have stayed at the South Point three times during the last two years and have reservations for a trip this spring. If you are looking for value and comfort, don't hesitate to stay at South Poing.

Reviews.Title: “If Vegas Isn't Your Thing You Won't Think it is Great, Only Average”
Reviews.Author: fierydragon
Reviews.Content: If you think Vegas is really tacky, the buzz and whirr of slot machines drive you nuts, and you can't stand the smell of smoke, then you are like me. I suppose I'm a well-traveled, "sophisticated" urbanite would really only go to Vegas for work. I don't require luxury, but I do know what a 4-star hotel experience is and this isn't it. Or maybe I should say, there's a 4-star, and then there is a Vegas 4-star.... This hotel is simply Vegas condensed into one building. The overall style is "tacky corporate" - a mash-up of colors and patterns to give the illusion of upscale design. Ventilation in the Lobby/casino should be better. Charging for use of the gym (not only spa) is lame. Had a good massage. Service was quite pleasant and I don't have any complaints there. We asked for a sewing kit and one was delivered within 20 minutes. The rooms are actually quite large and quiet, so it is nice to be able to leave the din behind. If the price is right, it gets the job done as a place to stay that will give you a taste of Vegas with some of the comforts that you want from a decent hotel. It just won't do it with any style. If you really want a sophisticated experience for Las Vegas, you need to consider the Aria, or the Trump (which has no casino).

Reviews.Title: “Good price- far from strip- SPA is the BEST but Oyster Bar is TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: LemurDroid
Reviews.Content: This hotel was cheap- but it is farther from the strip than you think. Also, the cab from the airport to the hotel cost us $36 despite them telling us it's a $15 trip. They have a free shuttle but we were tired and didn't want to wait an hour. The clientele is older than most of Vegas and a lot of families with small children- though it's just as smokey. You can hear right through the walls of your room, but this was only an issue on Friday night. The Oyster bar is terrible. They only have one type of oyster and they are pre-shucked- so dried out and tasteless. The crablegs were also pre-cracked, very, very dry- VERY- and tasteless. Way over-priced. The Prime Rib place was decent- the Italian place was ok. hotdogs were the best part for 75 cents- though the lady at the cart seemed very bitter. the bartenders- every one we went to- were not friendly, nor attentive. Bingo was fun and the ladies there were very nice and helpful. the shuttle to the strip is nice to have but they stop at other hotels to pick people up- fyi. the bed sheets were uncomfortable and made us sweat as if made of some non-breatheable material. The SPA was the best I've ever been to for couples. The couples area was so nice and private and our massages were really good and well priced. I recommend getting a treatment together and then hanging out in the couple's area. you can order food there and make a day of it. It's nice because if you get a treatment- you get into that area, too- whereas just going into that area is $75 with no treatment. The pool was not open.

Reviews.Title: “BEST place to stay in Las Vegas - bar none!”
Reviews.Author: TravSD
Reviews.Content: My first visit to this hotel back in July was an incredible experience, complete with each and every customer/employee interaction being full of charm, friendliness, and a genuine delivery of customer service. Was it a fluke? Not at all! I returned to the South Point last Saturday and had a carbon-copy experience. I arrived early, about 8am, and the valet RAN to my car to open the door and welcomed me to the hotel. When he saw I had luggage, he asked if he could help or to call a bellman. I declined since I only had the one bag, and went to the front desk. I was cheerfully greeted by the desk agent, and when I asked if I could check in early, she said "absolutely" (so much for so many other hotels who insist on the "3pm check-in time" even if they have clean rooms, they make you wait anyway). The room was spotless, had a very fresh smell, and I didn't find a single thing wrong with it (although I must admit I'm still perplexed how a multi-million dollar resort with beautiful flat screen HDTVs in each room does not carry a single HD channel......took a little of the shine off what seems to be a flawless property). Food and beverage staff were friendly and very courteous, the casino staff - even the supervisors, all had smiles and welcomed you to their table. Sitting at a video poker machine, a cocktail server came over and asked me if I wanted a drink (as opposed to the other places where someone speeds past you muttering "cocktails", and you take your chances at getting their attention). EVERYONE was friendly, and it's the kind of place you don't mind spending your money, as you feel very welcome. Super family friendly - I saw many families about, and since the little ones can't go into the casino, the bowling center and multi-screen cinema upstairs is a delightful distraction. The pool was closed - not sure if it was because it was January and not that warm, or if they were remodeling, so that was a little disappointing, but in no way a deal breaker. You've heard about that word-of-mouth thing about when someone has a terrible experience they tell all their friends? Well I do the same thing when I find a place that gets it and understands how to take care of customers. I tell everyone I can about the South Point and how they need to stay there! Enjoy the experience, you will NOT regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Relax”
Reviews.Author: Starbuck777
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the South Point Hotel. Excellent rates, make sure you get a players card when you gamble there to get best rates, give them your e-mail address and you can get deals and info via the internet., Rooms were excellent with a flat screen TV on the wall, bedding was very comfortable. Noise in room was non-existent. Buffet was reasonably priced and had the same food as the big priced buffets on the strip. Breakfast had omellette station plus all the goodies that go along with it. They have a great sports and horse racing .area. Individual TVs for the horse players, several tracks to bet. Excellent Mexican Restaurant. Shuttle service from and to airport, you must make reservation to take advantage of this service. It is about 7 miles from the airport on Las Vegas Blvd, if you want to visit the strip you can take the bus or rent a car or use another shuttle service that is available to the strip for $8.00.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: lmcjipo
Reviews.Content: I picked South Point Hotel Casino and Spa for a recent 1 week vacation stay in Las Vegas. I had stayed there for 1 night before and I had a good idea of what to expect. The hotel is very nice. The room that I got for this stay was 505 so that is the room that I will describe. Previously I had a different room with a view overlooking the outdoor parking area. This time in room 505, I had absolutely no view. The view I had was of an exterior wall. I believe that I had one of the inner rooms. If you want a view, you might not get one with this hotel but that didn't bother me. I found the room to be very spacious for the price that I paid and it was very clean. Room 505 was a non-smoking room in a non-smoking floor but a few times I could smell smoke in the corridors when I left my room or when I was going back to my room. I've stayed in different Las Vegas hotels each year (MGM Grand, Golden Nugget, Monte Carlo, Stratosphere, and the Hilton) and I would say that the smell of smoke from the corridor.at this hotel was the most noticeable on a non-smoking floor. There were 3 conventions going on during my stay with the biggest convention being CES which was near the Venetian (on the Strip) so hotel prices jumped up dramatically for those 3 nights but I still found it reasonable. This hotel was hosting a motorcycle convention during my stay and I found that sometimes there were loud motorcycle noises when I tried to turn in early after an exhausting day of sightseeing. Another thing that I noticed when I turned in early is that I think that this hotel is somewhat close to a train station or train tracks since I remember hearing the train whistle a few times. I'm mentioning this but it was not bad. This hotel had a wide flat screen television attached to the wall with a variety of channels. I found that they had some 2 or 3 ethnic channels as well... the common Spanish but they also had a Mandarin Chinese channel which I found unusual for a hotel in the US. There were not a lot of Mandarin Chinese people that I could see staying at the hotel. For me, I could understand a bit of Mandarin so it was a somewhat pleasant surprise (although I watched mainly the US/American channels while I rested at my hotelroom). My hotelroom had 3 phones. I believe that previously when I stayed at this hotel last year (in a different room with a view), I also had 3 phones. There is 1 phone near the night stand by the beds, 1 phone near the table where you might sit to use your laptop, and 1 phone in the washroom/toilet. I didn't use the phone since I had my cellphone but I believe that all calls including local calls carry a charge. I ate at 2 of the restaurants at this hotel during my stay. I had a lunch buffet which was included in my stay (the tipping is of course not included) at Garden Bufft. I found the buffet to be quite good. The regular price for the lunch buffet is $9.99. I had dinner one night at Primarily Prime Rib. I found that the prime rib that I ordered was good. It wasn't the best that I've had but it wasn't bad. I would classify the service in both these restaurants to be very good to excellent. In terms of the Player's Club (Gambling and needed to use some of your coupons at the hotel), they did not have any promotion for getting a player's club unlike in some casinos on the Strip where they would give you credit for slot play with your stay or with the application of the card. I didn't spend much time gambling at this hotel. The coupon book that the hotel gave me showed expired dates. I checked in during the first week of January 2011 and the expiry dates on all the coupons were December 31, 2010. The person who checked me in did not automatically tell me that they were still good. I had to call or pass by hotel check-in later and ask them if they gave me the wrong book. The person who checked me in should have automatically told me when he checked me in that the coupons were still good and they were using it because the new books did not come in yet. They probably expect some customers to think that the coupons expired and not use them and/or not mention this. The hotel has a large parking area. You can park outside or you can park in a tier parking (they also have valet parking). I parked both outside as well as in the tier parking. The parking is not too far from the casino/hotel exit. The tier parking has an elevator which is connected to the hotel so you don't have to go outside (in case of rain) to get to your car in the tier parking. I was a bit disappointed with the housekeeping service during my 1 week stay. The lady who cleaned my room seemed to be more interested in her tip than replacing some of the items sometimes. I had used the ice cooler bag and threw it away after the first night and she didn't automatically replace it... nor did she replace one of my coffee cups. I left a note near the tip money and she didn't do what I requested. Also, when I placed 4 of the towels that I wanted replaced in the bathtub and left to do my sightseeing, when I returned to my room, she replaced it with only 3 towels. I was wondering whether I would be charged for the missing towel but the following day, she placed the correct number of towels for the room (she replaced the towel that she didn't put the previously day). The hotel has an indoor safe. I found it to be quite large and accommodated my laptop as well as a lot of my electronic accessories (camera, chargers, etc.), identification (passport and Nexus card), and money. I would say that this hotel is a great value if you don't mind not staying on the Strip. You will need a car (or be prepared to spend around $20 for transportation to/from the Strip). I had a rental car so it wasn't an issue for me. One last thing to mention is that the hotel charges ~$20 for internet for a 24 hour period for 1 device only... so let's say you and your guest each have a laptop and a mobile phone, if you want to use your laptop, that's one charge and if your guest wants to use their laptop, that's another charge on your room if both of you connect within the same 24 hour period. If you want to use your mobile smartphone for WiFi, that's another charge. This is the standard price that I see at the Las Vegas hotels that I've stayed at. Personally, I find the price to be quite expensive when I'm not in the hotelroom surfing all day/evening. I'm in my hotelroom for ~10 hours per day with 8 of those hours being asleep... so it is like paying $10/hour for internet. I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NO FRILLS, BUT SOLID HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: fivedonahues
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times. I love playing BINGO and this hotel has one of the best. Admittedly I split my stay between here and a few choice 5 star hotel we enjoy, because I do like "frills" and I get that at a 5 star hotel for a few nights. Although I love the suite and the decor at the 5 star hotels, the SOUTHPOINT restaurants beat those restaurants hands down! I've taken a cab from a few 5 star hotels to eat at SOUTHPOINT. The Silverado Steakhouse.....the food, ambiance, and services matches and in some cases BEAT most of the high priced steakhouses on the strip. I have eaten at Silverado at least 15 times and have NEVER sent a plate back to the kitchen (never had to). The food is great and for the first time ever I can honestly say..... "this restaurant is priced below its value." The SOUTHPOINT rooms are very large and nice. Their buffett is good, not "over the top", but good. Their "coffee shop" (what I call it, but its a large casual restaurant) is very good, they serve chinese & american cuisine. We tell our friends and family that we go to Vegas for good chinese food (that I can't seem to find where I live) and its at.. SOUTHPOINT.

Reviews.Title: “good, but could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: Stymie
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife for 4 night mid week stay. The restaurants were above average especially Don Vito's. The casino has some pockets of smoke clouds that wasn't too cool, but the rest of the casino was not bad. The sportsbook has a nice lounge area where you can be surrounded by tv's to watch your sports action. The pay back on the slot machines were awful. Do not stay on the first 7 floors because you will be woken up by the construction going on in the pool area. Staying on the 10th floor we were still bothered by cables being lowered from the roof banging into our window.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to visit but I wouldn't want to sleep there.”
Reviews.Author: Doool
Reviews.Content: Casino floor set up very nicely and is spacious. For non-smokers the smoke can get pretty heavy when the casino is busy. Some type of better circulation system is needed. The restaurants we went to were good, and the service terrific. The first night we stayed here (it was a 4 night stay) the bed was short sheeted (Another review listed the same comment), the circuit breakers popped in the bathroom every day, and the bathtub was clogged up. They fixed the sheets & bathtub situations the next day, but over the course of our stay the cleaning service was sub par. The rodeo was there the day we got there and had to wait for 30 minutes to get car out of valet parking. The worst part was the bed...hard as a rock. Neither of us slept well, and my wife complained of hip and back pain the entire time we were there. Heard other comments from people that stayed there to the same affect. For this alone we would not stay here again, the other items are annoying, but not deal breakers.

Reviews.Title: “Way down south on the strip”
Reviews.Author: thedude_888
Reviews.Content: I like this place. It's a Gaughan casino, old Vegas family with a tendency to get it right. Pro's - From parking spot to hotel room is manageable- about 5 minutes. - Movie complex here rocks. First rate and top shelf Vegas quality attraction - Rooms are nice sized, no claustrophobia here. - Bowling - Bingo Con's - Too far from the strip - Coffee shop slightly overpriced, should be cheaper- but I did like it. - Internet wasn't free. GET WITH THE PROGRAM & STOP CHARGING FOR INTERNET.. 12.95/day is ridiculous. Make it free or tack on 10 bucks for the stay. Back in the last decade paying for internet was acceptable... it's a new decade & everybody under 50 is on the internet. Everybody under 30 is addicted to it. Charging for internet can be a dealbreaker. I recommend this hotel if you are driving- especially if you are coming in from Cali. If you are relying on taxis & public transit, skip this and go somewhere on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “first experience at vegas”
Reviews.Author: cajohnson5
Reviews.Content: have used trip advisor rthis entire trip and not been disappointed once. This was last stop. Never having been to vegas previously, I don't know how to compare to other hotels here. But when I return, i'm looking to stay at South Point. Excellent value, cleanliness, location south of strip, quality of service and accommodations make it a must stay in our book. Thanks, The Johnsons in 981

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a fair price”
Reviews.Author: photojunkie25
Reviews.Content: I won a Priceline bid for four nights at the hotel during the consumer electronics show, a very busy time in Las Vegas with limited rooms available. It is a short easy 10 minute drive from the airport and was billed as "south strip vicinity". It is about a 10 minute drive from the very end of the south strip which to me ends at Mandalay Bay. We had a car but the hotel has a shuttle with several stops on the strip and I think it goes about every 30 minutes with a reasonable $8.00 a day unlimited pass. Check in was easy and fast after parking in the garage which is free. There is also ample free parking in the front of the hotel which is outside. We didn't use the valet. The room was large and very clean with a big bathroom and comfortable beds. The casino was big and busy with any table game and slot machine that you would want, frequent free drinks and friendly people working there. The sports book area was huge. Friday nights offer any drink at the bar for $2.00. I had a huge delicious margarita. We received a free buffet coupon for each of us when we checked in and had lunch there. I'm usually not a fan of buffets but this was really good with fresh ingredients in small quantities and lots of selection.. The Asian grill part of the buffet was my favorite and you could pick out your own meat, veggies and sauce and they made it for you. We also had brunch there on Sunday with unlimited mimosas and champagne. They even gave us a free bottle of wine to take up to our room which was in the coupon book. I thought it would be inconvenient being away from the strip but it was really fine. We had two nights of shows on the strip that we went too and it was so much harder to navigate the parking and driving that we were glad to get back to our hotel. It must have been a 30 minute walk from the Cesears Palace parking lot to the restaurant there! Negatives were Internet at South Point is about $12 a day and a hefty fee to use the fitness center. I do see that on the room specials online now that they are throwing in the fitness center benefit. The swimming pool was closed but it was winter and was cold when we were there. Also our drapes did not close all of the way so it was a little bright in the morning. We also asked for an extra luggage rack since we had two suitcases and housekeeping said they could not do that.

Reviews.Title: “Great again!!!”
Reviews.Author: hazelson
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend Christmas in Vegas - because we could lol. We wanted to return to Southpoint as it was wonderful the first time and hopefully would not dissappoint. Our week was great. Check in was very fast - we asked for a room close to the elevator because I had knee problems - exactly what we got! On the ninteenth floor with an outlook to the south. The room was perfect - roomy, well appointed and extremely clean and quiet. We ate at the buffet several times - including Christmas dinner. The staff were super, especially our hostess who taught us to say "Merry Christmas" in German. The dinner included a glass of champagne and a bottle of wine (which we were allowed to take back to our room).....all for $14.95. Great turkey, stuffing, gravy etc. plus many other stations. Nothing fancy just good food for a great price. We rented a car as we usually do so we could go out and see the lights and sights. We have been to Vegas many, many times but always find something new and different to do. We won some and lost some but came home with money - what more can a person ask for? When we go back next time it will be Southpoint once again.

Reviews.Title: “Once Again Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: rouletteman
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th time staying at the SP hotel and casino. This time we sprang for the 2 room suite....WOW! What a value! Room was huge. Bathroom was awesome. Complimentary soft drinks, juice and water in the fridge. Restaurants are always good. Especially the weekend brunch. The corned beef hash is a cure for almost any hangover : ) Hotel and gaming staff were friendly and helpful. Could of had another roulette table open on Sunday with the big crowd. The 4 tables that were open were packed. But the low table minimums here are sweet compared to the ridiculous $25 and $50 mins of the main strip area. The spa is also very nice and relaxing. Reasonable rates as well. Those who complain about internet fees can whine all they want...who wants to go to Vegas to hang out on Facebook anyway? Bowling alley and movies are a bonus here and the new Steak and Shake is a great addition. Keep it up South Point...we'll be back in the future!

Reviews.Title: “$12.95/day per laptop!! No Free internet in room, No iHome radio!!!”
Reviews.Author: gypsydogg
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel south strip, it's nice and the rooms were large, but they missed the mark big time with internet service. Most nice Casino's have free wifi in Vegas. I stayed here because it was $10/night cheaper than Tropicana and it was a lil closer to where I needed to be, but I would have gladly stayed at the Tropicana had I known there was no free internet. I would have had to pay $24/day cuz we had two laptops vs free at tropicana for only $10 more. Then they have a crappy cheap alarm clock radio and no trashcan in the shower room!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: Gibarca
Reviews.Content: It's out of the way. It's not on the strip. Yep - and that's great. It's quiet at night. The restaurant is affordable and so is the gambling. I've stayed on the strip and downtown and I would return to the middle of nowhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay -- Spa is Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mistmtn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southpoint for 9 days at the end of December 2010 through the New Year. It was fantastic. Rooms were very large and clean, as observed by other reviewers. We agree that the smoke in the Casino is an issue and would encourage the hotel to establish a non-smoking walking area from front doors/registration to the hotel room elevators. Of special note is the Spa which has fantastic packages, including 3 and 5 day spa use deals that we thoroughly enjoyed. The sauna, jacuzzi and pool in the ladies lounge area were great. We also recommend spending some time in the relaxation room. They bring you heated/weighted neck wraps! All this for $45.00 (3 days) and $79 for 5 days. The pass also includes use of the gym. As for food at the hotel, we enjoyed the Silverado the best, the Cafe and Primarily Prime Rib tie for 2nd, the Buffet 4th. Not noted by other travelers, but worth point out is the Southpoints central location to just about everything you could want. Yes, Walmart is just down the road, along with a mega Whole Foods just up the Strip. The travel up 15 to the strip, freemont experience, and airport were simple and quick. Given the hotel's ease of access to 15, it was as convenient as any hotel on the strip, perhaps even more so. Friends traveling with us utilized the shuttle service to the stip without issue, too. Staff at the front desk and bell desk were very fast. efficient, and helpful to us. All around, this is a great place to stay. Finally, we noted that the outdoor pool was not open and heated, though when we had called to make our reservation we were told it would be. The website is unclear on this point and I would suggest having a clear and concise policy of dates/times when the pool will be open and when it will be heated.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all! However, distance from strip was an issue.”
Reviews.Author: WoodyChitown
Reviews.Content: We came to Vegas, as we do every year for CES. Thinking we would grab a prime strip room at a good price, as we did last year, we made no hotel reservations until the last minute. Not the best idea as CES attendance was up 20,000 over last year. We stayed at the South Point and it was a very nice self contained resort, Since we like to get around to the different hotels at night, it was not ideal for us. With the said, the rooms were large and clean, the restaurants were good, and the casino was as good as any. This is primarily a locals place so you probably won't see the Vegas eye candy and glitz you see at other places. However, if you want a quiet time, go see a movie, or do a little bowling, it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Excellent Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: tbags33
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to save some money as it is about 8 miles from the main Las Vegas Strip. But with every main hotel downtown offering free parking, it's no big deal to rent a car and just drive to a place and get out and walk. Very convenient to I-15 and its already located on Las Vegas Blvd....just on the south end. The restaurant choices is what keeps us coming back and the fact that the rooms are super clean, very comfortable, and great in size. The place has a more relaxed atmosphere, well cleaned throughout, many amenities (including bowling, bingo, a theater, salon, spa, gym, etc.), safe environment, and did I mention the fabulous restaurants? :) By far the Coronado Cafe (best bang for your buck with a wide variety to choose from), the Silverado Steakhouse (no better steak anywhere), and Don Vitos for the Italian cuisine (the Linguine and Clams and the Gnocchi...yumm). I know just about every hotel/casino has a coffee place, but I am just thrilled that South Point has one that stays open until 10pm-11pm. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Ample parking is great. Be prepared to do a lot of walking though...this place is huge. The only downsides that I can think of are these: 1) Wish there were more shops (especially for tolietries and picking up something special as gifts...there is only one and not that impressive at that), 2) the wifi/cellular signal in the rooms suck...always losing signal (we use sprint aircard for wifi as they charge a fee), 3) no matter WHAT you request as far as the rooms go...you NEVER seem to get it (I think if it shows it AVAILABLE ONLINE, that is what you should get...PERIOD! Especially when booked well in advance), and lastly, the Garden Buffet is not that great. When something is suppose to be hot, it was cold, and when it was suppose to be cold it was lukewarm. The food was so-so...PALED in comparison to the Bellagio's buffet (WOW). Anyways, I would definitely recommend this place to anyone traveling here. We have already booked to go back in March and this will be our 4th time there.

Reviews.Title: “Balance Price With Location”
Reviews.Author: peloza
Reviews.Content: The rate for the room was amazing value realtive to the cost of the Strip hotels. I stayed here one night after my Strip hotel rate went up from $140 to $275. The stay here was $70 and it was easily twice as good as the room that was going to cost me $275. So the value is certainly there. The trick is the location. Everyone knows it's far from the strip, but it is REALLY FAR. Having said that, there is a shuttle service that goes every hour or so and it's $8 bucks round trip. If I were to come back to Vegas I'd stay here and maybe go down tot he strip once or twice for the experience and the crowds or maybe a couple of shows. Other than that, if you want to gamble, everything you need is here. The nickel and dime thing is alive and well here. Paid internet seems standard in Vegas, but the free high wifi in the lobby is something I didn't see anywhere else. The big one for me was the $15 charge to use the fitnes center. Really? That was the most shocking example of nickel and dime I've ever seen. Still, not enough to put me off the hotel overall. But just be warned, if you want come to Vegas for the stereotypical party weekend, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nickeled and dimed to death!”
Reviews.Author: mobybich
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel and were very excited to get a four star rated hotel at such a reasonable price. First of all, it is quite a drive from the strip, so if you are planning to spend a great deal of time on the strip, do not stay here. The taxi fair would eat you alive! Next, I am a little uncertain as to why this hotel is rated four stars. It was not nasty, but not great. Just average, and maybe a low three star, at best. We were charged a one hundred dollar deposit to our debit card upon check in. Nothing in our booking process prepared us for that expense. Next, while they boast of high speed internet available in your room, they don't boast of the $13 a day it will cost you. Also, they charge for the business center, so don't think you are going to get anything free there. They said you could get free internet in the reception area of registration. I tried, the server was down, imagine that? The only positive thing I can say, is the little restaurant in the casino was good when we went there. We will not stay here again. There are numerous hotels in Las Vegas that offer internet and business center services for free. Be warned, if you must use the internet at all in this place, you will pay dearly.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot off the strip”
Reviews.Author: cottydoo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel off the strip wasn't too crowded and had its own movie theater and bowling alley. Great to stay here for a night or two to get away from the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in South Point”
Reviews.Author: Eveleigh
Reviews.Content: Had heard many good things about this hotel so we booked it for Christmas. The room looked old and dated even thouth the hotel is not that old. Wallpaper was peeling off the walls in places, the trim on the corners of the walls was falling off in two places but worst off all was the cleanliness. When we arrived the curtains were closed, we opened them to find sticky hand prints all over the windows. The door looked as if cola had been sprayed over the back of it and it had run down the door. The walls were dirty and looked as if they hadn't been cleaned. The carpets were clean except the edges, it appeared as though the vacuum could only clean up to about 1/2 and inch from the walls so there was about 1/2 of dust and dirt around the perimeter where the vacuum couldn't clean. Also the room staff didn't know how to make a bed. I hoped into bed the first night and the bed was short-sheeted by about a foot. I then checked the other bed and it was the same. Next night left the curtains opened so the windows could be seen and the bed uncovered so the sheets could be seen; we returned to the room to find the dirty windows behind closed curtains and the beds made the same: short-sheeted. Were were disappointed after hearing good things. We canceled part of our reservation and left early. Even the price $54 I felt it was a bad deal. We stayed at the Luxor the week before for $38 and it was clean and in better shape. We go to Las Vegas 2 X a year, every year, and with so many choices in Las Vegas I would even consider going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Large clean rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ToddNugent
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great for the value. It is located far from the strip but not a problem if you have a car. I would think that most people here drove from CA or are locals here for the horse shows. The best part of the hotel room are the beds. The mattress is so comfortable, we didn't have backaches like some other places and the pillows are nice & soft. The maids even line both sides of the bedcover with sheets. Bathrooms are modern and clean. The check-in staff, housekeepers, bag boys were all very nice and helpful. Parking is a little inconvenient - located far from the hotel elevators but that's just the way it is with all these casino hotels. For the price paid, we definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay.”
Reviews.Author: jrleeper
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed for two nights during New Year's. Even though there are not other casinos around, it's self sufficient and has everything that you and your family would need. We had a room with a city view and was not disappointed. Though it was New Year's, it still was not as crowded as if this casino were on the strip. You could walk around without feeling packed like a "sardine" and could still get a table. Our room was very nice & clean; staff was courteous, friendly and helpful. The only small glitch we had was leaving the strip after seeing the Terry Fator show. As we waited with others looking for the shuttle back to South Point by Forever 21, we got word that the shuttle stop had moved down the street, closer to the Trump Hotel. By the time we got there, the shuttle was full. The employee in the passenger seat said that there was a pick-up at/near Sonny's Saloon on Industrial. Instead of rushing over there, we ended up splitting a cab with another couple. Other than that, it was a great trip. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced Off Strip Casino”
Reviews.Author: BeachBum92130
Reviews.Content: Our family made a stop over night here on a long drive. The rooms were big and clean and fairly priced for Vegas. I realize Vegas is the last safe harbor for The Smoker but we were still surprised how smoke filled the casino was, if there's room for improvement it would be to change to a non-smoking facility.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Mega Resort”
Reviews.Author: southguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night after flying from Long Beach, CA. It's a relatively new hotel south of McCarran Airport. Nice spacious and affordable rooms. You have also an in-room safety box for your convenience. Free inside or outside parking. Good breakfast. Very clean and comfortable resort with all possible amenities. Besides the SPA, you have a 16 screen Century Theatre and a 64 lane bowling. An Equestrian Arena is also located on the premises. If the Las Vegas Strip is your priority, this hotel is not within a walking distance. Otherwise this place offers great value for what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL, GOOD RESTAURANTS, EXCELLENT VALUE, OUT OF THE WAY”
Reviews.Author: Ken/Canada
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 day stay at this hotel. We were impressed with the overall quality of the hotel. Our cost averaged 44.00/night for a large room on the 16th floor. Also impressed that when we had a couple of small problems with the room that service people were dealing with the problems within ten minutes of our call. Buffet's were very good especially the breakfast buffet for 6.95. The Mexican restaurant far exceeded our expectations with excellent food at reasonable prices. Only problem was the distance from town. Be prepared to pay approximately 30.00 per cab trip every time you want to go just about anywhere. There is a shuttle available for 16.00 per person in advance to the strip but they only stop in three spots and it only runs once per hour. Hotel really needs to reduce the cost and double the times and drop places. Over five days our taxi costs added up to about 120.00 "extra" dollars which really jumps the overall room prices up. Also we missed their airport shuttle by about five minutes so we had to cab it to the hotel from the airport as well. Mentioning this to the hotel front desk staff got no more than a shrug and a "well he said he was there on time. Not happy especially given that we reserved the shuttle in advance. Still in all, very little else to complain about. Good "meat and potatoes" stay.

Reviews.Title: “Was skeptical at first, that soon changed!”
Reviews.Author: rvoice100
Reviews.Content: We had our flight home cancelled due to snow at heathrow, British airways said they would put us up at the southpoint. Knowing it was off the strip we were dreading it. As soon as the free shuttle got us there our worries went, the room was spotless, nice colours, very comfy bed, sofa, desk, flat plasma tv. The casino seemed so different to the strip ones ..... We were actually winning! The gambling rules were so much better! The drink service was super fast too! We were given vouchers by BA for food, the restuarants are spot on with great service. Our favourite was silverado steakhouse, I had the filet mignon and it knocked my meal at stripsteak out of the park! We went to the cinema one evening too to while away a few hours, good fun. After being skeptical at first, the southpoint has just made 2 new regular guests, we enjoyed getting away from the strip after 5 days there and if you want to there is a shuttle to the strip $8. Thanks south point you really exceeded our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay !”
Reviews.Author: greenmd
Reviews.Content: We found the South Point a few years back on one of our many getaways to Las Vegas from the cold winter of Canada. We spend anywhere from 2 to 5 weeks in the Vegas area at least once a year. We LOVE the Southpoint! The rooms are very clean and pleasantly decorated, the king beds VERY COMFORTABLE, the staff is very nice and friendly (just like us Canadians!!) and the casino has provided us with many hours of great entertainment. The restaurants are all super. The pool area is nothing short of wonderful in the warmer months. Honestly, 'though we have tried a number of other hotels, we just find the Southpoint so very easy to get in and out of with great parking, and in all other aspects it makes us smile, so it is the place we have decided to call "home" on our journeys to 'Vegas. We don't go on vacations to Vegas from Canada, to sit in a hotel room, we go to have FUN, feel safe, and stay in clean and comfortable surroundings. The South Point is all of that! It's the South Point for us, all the way!!!

Reviews.Title: “Think of South Point as Orleans South”
Reviews.Author: kabbagehead
Reviews.Content: First, I want to start this review with a direct request to whomever kindly responds to the reviews on this website, which I think is admirable. Here it is: Is it too much to ask for real cream with my coffee in the Garden Buffet? I mean, the Bloody Marys are a great idea for people who need at vodka drink at 7:00 a.m., but the rest of us, I think, would really appreciate REAL cream, not the non-dairy crap that is offered. I was very disappointed in that considering the caliber of your hotel. Now, moving on... I stayed at South Point for three days in the week before Christmas, lured by excellent reviews and a relatively good price. I want to make special mention of the friendliness of the staff: Everyone, from the bar to the buffet (who was literally unable to bring me real cream...oops...) to the check-in desk to the dealers were friendly. I only stay at hotels where the place has a reputation of being good to its employees, and South Point has an excellent reputation. This place is a lot like The Orleans: A very big place, kind of an oasis unto itself with nice rooms, full gaming, movie theaters, restaurants, bowling...I mean, it has everything but a trampoline and airport. And like The Orleans, this place is off the beaten path, about six miles south of Mandalay Bay on Las Vegas Boulevard. But no one should hold the location against them: If you can't live with it, stay elsewhere. it's also worth mentioning that by staying here on the South end, you are that much closer to Henderson, which also has excellent gaming and shopping. Alas, you are twice as far from old Downtown (I hate The Strip, and avoid it like the plague), which has excellent gambling. The rooms remind me most of ones I stayed at in Golden Nugget, with the same color scheme if I recall, though a little bigger. Nice big bathrooms and good beds. Very quiet on the 14th floor where I was. That's impressive since the main casino level is always humming with people. A light bulb in my bathroom was out. A phone call to the front desk remedied that in five minutes. The literature I had read before staying said there was a free shuttle from the casino to various spot - airport, the Strip - but the sign at the hotel said it was $8. Either the literature was wrong or SP "updated" their policy. On the other hand, there is not ridiculous "Resort Fee" like many other hotels have, which is just a way to jack up rates. In the end, South Point is a good bet. It is clear that it is trying to cut costs and boost revenue, but that in not surprising in a city that has seen a severe downturn tourist dollars thanks to a terrible economy; I just wish I could get real dairy creamer with my coffee...

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Ismael2004
Reviews.Content: This has been my second visit to the South Point this year and it'll be not my last. For me it is the perfect mixture of gambling (nice poker room), fine restaurants, fantastic movie theater, comfortable rooms and really reasonable prices. Of course it is not on the Strip. But it is a great getaway after a weekend at the clubs and in the zone.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever been”
Reviews.Author: Filipisko
Reviews.Content: It is really the best hotel I have ever been. I have been there two times. Typical hotel room is clean, roomy and very nice. Once they gave us deluxe luxury room for 95dollars, fantastic. This deluxe room was bigger than our home and shower seems to be at least for ten people at once :-) Very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Everything in one place away!”
Reviews.Author: jammex88
Reviews.Content: Casino, bowling, movies, restaurants, hotel, all under one roof. Right off the interstate, easy in and out. They often give coupons for free buffets, discounts on movies, bowling. Room rates are VERY reasonable for the quality of the rooms. Starbucks, Outlet Mall, and other restaurants about 1 mile north of the hotel on Las Vegas Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: leanneos
Reviews.Content: the hotel is out of the main strip of Las Vegas but great place to stay. Rooms are spacious and clean and so much to do. The Garden Buffet is fantastic with somethiong for everyone tastes. Highly recommend. Leanne

Reviews.Title: “Love South Point but some changes are in order.”
Reviews.Author: Pippy8
Reviews.Content: Back Home (as we like to refer to SP) and had a wonderful time. Unfortunately, time and the economy have changed some things that need to be changed back to the way they used to be. No doubt hotels save lots of $ by downgrading there soaps/shampoos/etc. but they should realize that those items are comfort items. We felt the items now used detract from the quality/comfort experience (in other words, forgettable). Again, the room was quiet and good sized. The casino seemed much more smokey than ever before especially during the rodeo nat'l finals. We ate in the Italian Restaurant and for the first time had mediocre to not good service and the food was just OK not as in prior years. We ordered the same meals from the menu as last year so could easily compare. The bar service near the restaurant was OK but slow in comparison to past years. Not enough help. We will still return to South point with enthusiasm but hope the economy is kinder to its choices and service. Ideal location to the airport car rental/shuttle and a favorite of many locals who are very kind to us visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Easygoer_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and everything was great. Room was nice and spacious, super comfortable bed, everythng nice and clean, big flat screen wall mounted TV, great food in all the restaurants and great facilities. 64 lanes bowling, cinema, spa and huge casino. Casino has high ceilings and feels clean and fresh. Coctail waitresses are really efficient and very fit. ok it's a long way off the the strip but regaular shuttle is only $8 return. I will be staying here again without doubt. Well done to all the staff and managment. Great job!!

Reviews.Title: “good value, casino/hotel starting to show its age”
Reviews.Author: bran99
Reviews.Content: the hotel carpet is starting to come up, the casino is not the best, for a locals place its nice, but we wont come back here as part of our vacation

Reviews.Title: “our family always wants to stay here when we have a reunion”
Reviews.Author: lesfonts
Reviews.Content: We come here 2 or 3 times a year and meet up with family in the Spring. We love the friendly staff, especially in the poker room. We are headed there next week (in November) to stay for six days and always look forward to it. We have stayed in fancier rooms but at South Point they are kept clean and comfortable. Lots to do here: if you tire of gambling there's a huge theater, bowling alley, bingo parlor (all huge). The restaurants are great and if you use a player's card you can earn points toward dinners. It's south of the big hotels on the strip but they run a shuttle bus to and from. And you can't beat the price!

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelmingly Under-whelming”
Reviews.Author: MichaelonLI
Reviews.Content: I like trying new hotels and Southpoint has been on my list for a few years. I was traveling with Mom and was looking for a place for one night before heading out on a road trip. Seemed like the perfect opportunity to try South Point. At the time I was looking to make my reservation they were advertising an upcoming sale in a few days. I checked the rates for the date I needed; itwas $45 for the night. That was good price, but let me wait and see what the sale brings. Lo and behold the sale came and the rate was $45, although they claimed the rate was normally $70. I can understand if a hotel wants to limit the days they offer discount rooms. But it annoys me when they tell you they are running a sale on rooms they artificially inflate. My room was $45 before the sale, during the sale, and after the sale. I decided to "splurge" and spend an extra $10 not to be on a low level room looking at AC units. I Arrived about 5:00 and there was no line at check in. The man who checked me in was proficient in what he did, but not a single word of welcome or any kind of friendliness. I actually received a room on the 22 floor which is more than I bargained for. I requested a room close to the elevator and was given one only four doors away. I was pleased with the room assignment even though it was a less than enthusiastic beginning. There are many positive things to say about the room. It is very spacious, it must be over 400 square feet. The bathroom was also very roomy, although some may complain about there being only one sink. The bed was very comfortable. The room was very bright; there were many lamps and cieling lights that were helpful. (I only appreciated this later in the trip when most of our other rooms were so dark.) The room was also very clean. No complaints; I paid $55 for the room and I got a room worth $55. But then there were a few parts that just seemed to miss the mark. The most glaring shortfall were the towels. I normally don't notice the quality of towels. But these were the roughest, worn, and uncomfortable things I have encountered in a long time. They were woefully inferior to the quality of the bedding. Also I was surprised the room was as worn and beat as it was. Nothing overwhelming, but the carpeting clearly had high miles on it. In general, the furniture was scratched and scruffed up. But my biggest disappoinment was the overall decor of the room was, how shall I say; dull. The room lacked character; it was not modern or sleek, it was not classic. If ever you see one of those TV shows where decorators come in to jazz up a boring house, this was definately "the before" scene. I know its unfair to complain about decor, but it seems like a little imagination and a splash or two of color could really make these spacious rooms inviting and exciting. In a similar fashion, I also found the casino to be dull. It's hard to describe why but it just did not have a fun or upbeat energy for me. I planned on going to the spa, but after taking a quick tour I did not think the facilites justifed the $25 fee to use it. I had a decent stay and I have no regrets having given it a try. If I had to stay here again I would. But I am hard pressed to think of a reason to go out of my way to travel so far south to stay here again. I wanted to be "wowed" by this place, but I left with a yawn instead.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL AND SPA”
Reviews.Author: California Sun
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised! Hotel is located about 13 miles from the strip on the south end of Vegas. Hotel is around 4 years old so it is still very clean and nice. I always like to comment if bed was comfy (That’s a huge deal to me) and it met my expectations. This is an awesome hotel to have fun in. Bowling alley (68 lanes I think) Movie theater, spa, equestrian and events center…I may have left something out. You can have a $6.99 buffet breakfast with mimosa or bloody Mary included in price. I found all the restaurants in this hotel reasonably priced. Down the freeway about 15 miles is a superb Designer Outlet mall with some of the biggest names (Neiman Marcus). I thought we may hit the strip but there was no need to, we had everything and more in this reasonable price hotel. $46 a night and this was NOT a price line purchase, this is everyday! WHAT A DEAL!

Reviews.Title: “Twice is Nice(r)”
Reviews.Author: Madamvee
Reviews.Content: Stay @ the hotel in April 2010 on a return trip from Hawaii. I thought nothing cause top that. South Point proved me wrong on both accounts. This stay was better than the first. I actually Ate, drank (@ several of the restaurants on the property) went to the theater and bowling. I enjoyed my 2 day pass I purchased to ride the RTS. This public transit was awesome ( p/u and d/o in the hotels parking lot). The hotel staff was most efficient with the exception of the $8 shuttle(van) that took you downtown. No order, first come last to get a seat; was dropped off literally in the street. Chose RTS instead. Airport shuttle was friendly and on time. Thanks to South Point staff for delightful stay again . . . . . Until next time.

Reviews.Title: “Been here multiple times - Will not return - and I'm writing this FROM the property”
Reviews.Author: flafilmmaker
Reviews.Content: I work for a large entertainment company that frequents Las Vegas for trade shows and multiple conventions. Over the last few years; I've had the privilege of visiting Sin City for work - and every time they've booked me here.
