Make no mistake - despite being a small company - these guys are fairly high rollers - and on average - they usually drop close to $100K in wagers in this hotel (if not more). I took my girlfriend here twice now; and she loved our last stay. I'm not a high roller by any means. I'm a simple guy. I've probably run at LEAST 20,000 points (dollars) through their machines - in the last 10+ stays - which isn't bad (I've had some luck). However - here's where the fun ends. My girlfriend and I were married this Halloween - on the strip. After staying in our suite at Treasure Island - she wanted to head back to South Point to relax (spa, etc.) from the hustle-bustle. Well - this has been a nightmare. First; the half-dead receptionist sends us to the wrong room type from what we'd booked 6 months before - and, to top it off - it was DIRTY (I mean - food and crap left behind - big time - like housekeeping thought the party they were tidying up after the guest was staying - not leaving). I then called the front desk - who told me that they'd hold the right room for us - and to give them a few hours (on their behalf - we arrived a few hours before check-in time - so no love lost). However; when we showed back up to the front desk - they acted as if they'd never heard of our issue - then said they needed to know who exactly we spoke with - and when (????). I wasn't taking notes when I called for the room. However; they eventually (rudely) fixed the issue and found the exact person. Sorry - I expected there to be notes on our account. Next; we booked a special on July 4th that gave us $10 in free slot play for our stay. We didn't have it on our player's club card - so we visited the members' area. Apparently - the ad was a scam - and we had to use the $10 before October 31st - even though our reservation was for November 3rd (WTF?). They wouldn't even give us a number to call. They just kept saying "contact our promotions department" (and yes - I carried a print-out of everything). Okay. I can handle all that. However; when gaming - the bartenders are now slow to bring you drinks (if at all). Before - I had no problem blowing $50 or $100 in a machine - if I'm in a good mood and drinks are coming regularly. Heck - even if we wanted to PAY for them - no one seems to want to wait on us here. Then there's the pool. A sign proudly reads "OPEN FROM 8AM to 10PM" (it's 80 degrees out). However, when we walked outside - we were confronted with 70+ people who were complaining the pool bar was closed. So - my (new) wife and I walked to the front desk for everyone to ask when it opened. Instead of getting a time, we received this response - "Well - you shouldn't be out there any way. It's closed for season". Then I apologized (like I had done something wrong) - and explained the sign stating it was open. Then she said "That's because so many of you are out there they decided to let you use it" (as if we were breaking some sort of unheard of rules). Sick of the poor, rude service, we smiled and left the desk area. Of course, in cheapo fashion - the pool was not heated. So - despite the hot weather - it was freezing. Real inviting. God - I miss the Golden Nugget. Stayed there last year this exact time of year - and swam every day. FINALLY - there's the "Business Center". Lovely. Everyone was complaining. Yes - they ship UPS - but only offer a metric scale (another WTF)? They actually acted as if we should know the exact weight of the boxes we just purchased (at $8 a piece) and packaged there. WHO IS A UPS/FED EX ship center that can't weight the item? They warned us of a $15 charge for incorrect weight. Just terrible. GET a scale. My God. They're $10. Even if it's not to the ounce - you won't be guessing - like the girl who worked there and just shook our package around and said "feels like 20 pounds". Bottom line - I always thought this was a special hotel. Something for the local gamers from the area that is hidden from the strip BS. However - we were wrong. My wife was going to visit the spa - but is now taking her business elsewhere. I understand Vegas is a busy town with lots of tourists - but; when folks have stayed with you more than 3+ times a year for the last few years - at least PRETEND they matter. This place sucks (only good food is The Oyster Bar and Deli - avoid ALL ELSE - aside from Micheal's - but it's $100 a head). Yes. We wanted to stay off the strip - but should have stayed at The Orleans or Silverton. You've been warned. Oh - and to the management - PLEASE - do not respond with a "we're so sorry...we hope it doesn't detract you from staying here on future stays response". However, if you do - that's just further proof you don't read the guests' issues.

Reviews.Title: “Still a nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: iluvvegas
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at SP several times ... sometimes for just a few days, but this last visit was for a week. We consistently get a nice room at good value. I don't like that they now charge different rates for view rooms on upper floors. It's not like you have great views at SP anyway. I guess it's their way to get more $$ for the room but still being able to say they don't charge a resort fee. I was on floors 7 and 10 and the hallway carpet had been replaced on both of those floors. The unsafe wrinkles of the old carpets were gone. I don't know if all floors have been replaced yet, but at least it appears they are working to correct this problem. Our room was spacious and clean, and the firm bed was extremely comfortable. The AC worked great and housekeeping did a great job as well. I love that the rooms are mostly soundproof. We didn't really hear any noise at all, except for a few doors slamming in the hallway. We ate at the deli several mornings, had the breakfast buffet once, and had dinner at Baja Miguels once. All the food was very good and reasonably priced. We would definitely consider staying at SP again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great stay, great holiday!”
Reviews.Author: RobMarr
Reviews.Content: As my title stays, it was great value for the money and we had a great stay. If you want something slightly away from the busy strip, but not to far, this is the one for you. There are shuttle buses to and from the airport and the strip, for either free or next to nothing. On a sour point we had the safe in our room broken into, but strangely nothing taken. We requested a room change and they were happy to help. All in all even with the the safe saga, we wouldnt hesitate at staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Smokey. Dirty.”
Reviews.Author: littleamen
Reviews.Content: Whoever said this is the nicest hotel they've stayed in must not get out very often. I stay in hotels 4-5 nights a week for work and most Hampton Inn and Holiday Inn Expresses are nicer than this place. First, they allow smoking in the casino, so it reeks. Second, the carpets in the hallways of the hotels are stained and starting to come up, so there's actually waves in the floor where the carpet is beginning to buckle. The restaurants where I ate were mediocre at best...and really not that cheap. The water cooler in our meeting room had some type of dirty, rusty, chunky residue in it. My room did seem to be relatively clean, though they are very stingy with pillows and towels. Now, let's talk about cost. Before I ever checked in, they charged $25 to my credit card, then upon check-in they charged $100 for a deposit. They charge $12.50/day for internet and it costs $15/day if you would like to use the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Most Awesome Hotel I Ever Stayed At ! ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: pepsilluver
Reviews.Content: The people were extremely nice and very helpful. The food was good to excellent. Found none that we did not like. The casino was great! But even more so. . .our rooms were awesome. The safes in the room wee super roomy, easy to use. The bathrooms were huge. The maid was very good and helpful. We had a fridge brought to the room, I am a diabetic, because I was, I got the fridge in my room for free, where as my sis and her hubby paid $10 for theirs. We were there for 4 or 5 days and it was just so awesome and relaxing. Many restaraunts. Great gift shop, people very helpful. Every chance we get we will come back to stay. I did a lot of research to pick this hotel, and it really paid off. Yes it is off the beaten path of the main drag. I am thrilled it is, The main drag is nice. . . but always toooooo busy. Thank you Southpoint for the best vacation hotel ever. Hey when I went to book for 1 more night, the girl at the front desk remembered me and my sis by name and took care of it all in a matter of seconds. Thazt is what I call service!

Reviews.Title: “Fri 10/8 Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: tamster34
Reviews.Content: We checked in about noon. They gave us a coupon book that included a free Mon-Fri lunch buffet, free drink & free souvenir ( small key chain). We ate the buffet twice (2nd time comped) & it had a good variety. The room was large with a comfortable bed & pillows. Large floor to ceiling windows with a view towards the strip. We never heard any noise from the hall or our neighbors. We would have liked the AC to get a little cooler. There were always plenty of seats at the $5 blackjack tables. I liked that the glasses for comped drinks weren't the the tiny ones you get elsewhere. Good selection of video poker & slots. It's about 6-7 miles from the Strip so you would need a car if planning to go. We stayed & gambled all day the Southpoint & were very happy. Would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “You won't need an Alarm Clock here”
Reviews.Author: redhand
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to South Point and was by far the most disappointing and will therefore be our last. Male person at reception desk merely asked for photo ID and credit card and robot like checked us in without even a hint of welcome. Similarly on check out the female receptionist went through the motions coldly and formally and we were on our way without even a goodbye. Our main gripe however is that at exactly 0730 hours we were awakened by the noise of reversing vehicles and machinery outside our room (359). Clearly some construction or repair work is ongoing at the hotel and it would be good manners for management to advise prospective guests of this before they accept a reservation. Thankfully we were only staying one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation for our family. Can't wait to come back.”
Reviews.Author: serranofj
Reviews.Content: We normaly stay next door and walk over. This is our first time staying at SP. We all enjoyed ourselves, even our 10 and 12 year old boys. I wish they would open the pool bar during th weekdays. Also, they don't play music by the pool too often. It's relaxing when they do. Other than that our stay was perfect. I recommend requesting a room clse to.the elevator. Ours was at the end and got to be a hike after a while.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and casino on the outskirts of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: HeidiDW
Reviews.Content: If you do not want to stay in the hype of it all in Las Vegas, this hotel offers the perfect solution. It is a beautiful hotel which is very easy to find as it is right next to the Freeway coming into Las Vegas. If you want to travel into Las Vegas, the hotel offers a Shuttle Service to the Strip at the cost of $8 per person for a return journey, which is the cheapest way to travel. A taxi cost $30.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable and pleasant place to stay near to but away from the bustle of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: drfumblefinger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort because our friends were staying there and we wanted to spend a few days visiting with them. We had no expectations and were very pleasantly surprised. The main down side is that, while on the strip, it is far from the major resorts so you will need to take a cab (or pay for a shuttle ride) to get there. But its distance from the heart of Vegas is also one of its pluses as you are somewhat removed from the noise and bustle of the strip. The hotel runs a free shuttle service to and from the airport, an appreciated service. The restaurants we ate at in the hotel were quite good (especially the deli), the rooms very spacious and comfortable, and we had two great nights of sleep here. The hotel houses a great multitheater movie complex, and a huge bowling lane. I'd stay here again but would have a car rental next time to give me a greater degree of freedom when visiting the city..

Reviews.Title: “I loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: doggiedaddie
Reviews.Content: South Point exceded my expectations. The room was quiet, well furnished with heavy wood doors and nice wood furnishings. The toilet has a separate door for privacy wich is a plus. The huge 42" flat screen was great for football! The room was quiet, the bed comfortable. I had a view of the pool and mountains. The room is 500 sq.ft. with plenty room for a few guest and they still have the old Las Vegas fun book! The rooms even have post cards pens and writing paper and the drinking glasses are made of glass not those stupid plastic cups! Other hotels need to take notice. I will be back again next time I come!

Reviews.Title: “South Point - Like Coming Home”
Reviews.Author: SarahDaisy
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth time to stay at the South Point in Las Vegas. We really do love it there! I think all the other reviewers say pretty much everything. Top 3 Good Points 1. Very reasonably priced rooms which are huge, with great bathrooms. We stayed in a junior suite this time (birthday treat for me!) and it's fantastic - huge big bathtub, walk in shower and separate toilet; bedroom, living room. Lovely. Well worth it. 2. Much more friendly and relaxed place to stay than hotel on the strip. The staff are lovely, they really do look after you well. There are plenty of places to eat and drink on site, and a huge casino. The Italian and the steak house are as good as any you'd get anywhere - we love Don Vitos - best fettucine alfredo in the world! 3. Bowling alley, cinema, pool, spa, shop and casino (did I mention the casino?) Loads of things to do. Bottom 3 points: 1. Far from strip - you have to drive or take a taxi or shuttle to the strip. There's a small shuttle that costs $8 each way per person every second hour. Plenty of taxis, typically about $25 with tip, or the local bus to the station and transfer to the strip bus or other bus. Or your own car, of course. 2. Internet Access - $13 per day per device per room is really a bit steep. I understand they are probably locked into a contract with the providers, but it's time to push this one... 3. It's so far away from Ireland! I wish they could move it - and the weather and the strip - a lot closer so I could go more often! This time a group of friends and family came with us, and most stayed at SP also on our recommendation. They all agreed on the same good and not so as us.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay away from strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I liked the place specially the swimming pool. The hotel is somehow away from the strip but this makes it unique away from the crowdiness. The room was great except for there was no minibar in it. Otherwise everything was just great.

Reviews.Title: “great casino at a great price”
Reviews.Author: badgers4ever
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the south point casino in Vegas for the 3rd time. Keeps getting better every time I stay there. Quick check in . Clean rooms. And the best feature was the unheard price for my stay. The only bad thing I can note would be the distance from the strip. If you have a car rental, it's not to bad, but it still is at least a five mile trip to get on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it- would go back in a las vegas minute!”
Reviews.Author: starkles99
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel immensely. Other than the location, which required a car, it was everything we were looking for!

Reviews.Title: “terrible service. be prepared not to complain”
Reviews.Author: syjames
Reviews.Content: When i first got there they stuck me in a room without a view and they didnt even have my reservation correct. I PAID FOR A ROOM WITH A VIEW AS WELL AS A KING SIZE BED AND THEY DID NOT CARE!!! then they said if i want the room with the view i needed to pay extra (even though i already did!!) BY THE WAY THE VIEW IS LAME. NOT EVEN WORTH VIEWING. i reserved a king bed and all they had was 2 queens. their linens are hard (possibly 100 thread count). Also the casino smells like horse crap. i had the worst time ever. not a good idea to bring your family here as cocktail waitresses walk around in a bra and a thong in a fishnet body stocking. i trusted this place to house all of the guests from my brothers wedding. we reserved several rooms at this hotel and they messed up each and every reservation. most ordered the packages that came with free cocktails and free buffet dinners and only 2 of the 30 people recieved them. also they paid for the higher priced packages with rooms with a view and most of them ended up with a wall view. when hotel staff was contacted about the mistakes they acted as if they didn't care and there is nothing they can do about it despite the fact we had printed out confirmations verifying our purchase. Also when my grandmother came to check in to her room which she had reserved she was informed that she could only stay 1 night instead of the 2 nights she was reserved for because they were sold out the next evening. i could not believe this!!!!! no doubt you see how horrible this is, i am BEYOND ANGRY!!!! Also the carpets in the hallway are a hazard and no doubt if that problem is not fixed they will get sued. GREAT PLACE IF YOU WANT TO FIND A PLACE EASY TO SUE!! JUST TRIP ON ALL OF THERE RINKLY CARPET WHICH HAS BEEN FOUND ON EVERY FLOOR MY GUESTS HAD ROOMS ON.My mother and my grandmother stayed on the floor that had the worst wrinkling. I can't believe nothing was offered to solve these issues either, what a horrible experience and i hope that one day all of the staff responsible, go to another establishment and deal with what i had to deal with there. oh and by the way dont even think about complaining about this place because management doesnt care and this is an independently owned place so there is no one to call who would actually give a rat's a** stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Showy,Fun, Efficient”
Reviews.Author: flyer1223
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the South Point Hotel in Las Vegas Nevada. It was efficient,food was good at the Garden Buffet Our room on the 23 floor was comfortable,restful,and quiet. I had a restful and comfortable experience. It is not really,really close to the strip but it was not critical in our case.

Reviews.Title: “Great internet rate - great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: gyshwysh
Reviews.Content: I got an internet special rate of $45 for a one night stay athe the end of September. It was great!! Huge room and affordable buffet for both breakfast and dinner. This night was the final night of a 10 day National Park tour. I'm not a gambler but passed some time at night playing the penny slots for fun. There is a shuttle that takes you down to "The Strip" for $8 but I chose to stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: palmtree74
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly suprised by SP. The only downside for me was the smokey casino. It really go to me a couple of times. The rooms were better than the pictures we had seen. The check in was easy and fast. There is very good ammenities between the pool, bowling, theatre, and restaurantes. We ate at the mexican restaurante (sorry cant remember the name) which was very good and the portions were good and reasonable prices. We also ate at the Coronado which has such a variety of food it can be hard to decide what you want. And with the number of people they had, their customer service was excellent, along with the food of course.We went bowling once and wish we could have went again. And was also able to go to the theatre. Both werer very nice and convenient. It is farther from the strip, but we took the bus to the strip which was cheaper than a taxi, and was not bad. Plus there is the shuttle to the Shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place hate the carpet”
Reviews.Author: vkqueen
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort several times over the past years. We love the room, restaurants, casino, friendly employees etc. I don't know what has happened to the carpeting on the room hallways and by the elevators, but this stretched carpet really needs to be fixed. Both my spouse and I have had joint replacements and we are more than slightly aware of the danger that this carpet situation poses to the both of us. We would hate to have to switch to another property over such a minor detail, but it's a big deal to us. Come on South Point maintenance, you're fabulous, do your thing !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice price, way off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: KingHuskey
Reviews.Content: First, the South Point is way off the strip so make sure you have a car if you plan on seeing any of the other Vegas attractions. You could cab it or catch their shuttle but you'll find yourself spending some cheese on the taxis. We rented a car and got a great deal from Priceline so it was cheaper than taxis. The hotel looks great and I really liked the color scheme, very cool. The casino inside was nice and they had $1 roulette and $5 blackjack which is somewhat of a rarity when you get to the nicer hotels on the strip. When we checked in, around 5:45 PM on a Friday, it was a very quick and painless process. The clerk was very nice and noted that she upgraded us to a room facing the pool, nice touch. The room itself was big but decor wise wasn't anything fancy, right along the Holiday Inn Express or Hampton Inn line. We had a king size bed, firm but got the job done. The pillows weren't that great they felt like they had little chopped up bits of foam. The toilet paper wasn't soft so be prepared :) Overall it was a decent hotel. Next time we'll stay closer to the strip or even opt for a national chain rather than one with a casino.

Reviews.Title: “Big changes, not for the better”
Reviews.Author: Mort69
Reviews.Content: We understand the need to find economies in poor market conditions. It goes with the economic recovery. But drastic cuts can not only mean a difference to the bottom line now, an experience like ours influences future travel decisions as well. We have stayed at this hotel several times a year for the past 5 years, and have recommended friends as well. Inconsistent housekeeping - towels and drinking glasses daily? Not here. A call for a box of Kleenex was not dealt with. Floors not cleaned, poor quality toiletries (when provided). Hallway carpets wrinkled and not stretched are a potential trip hazard for the able bodied and a minefield for the disabled. 22 minute wait simply for the cashier in the buffet, which was half empty. A second cashier arrived when we got to the front of the line. Quality of food and choices are poorer than past visits. Buffet ran out of clean plates for about 5 minutes which released a tidal wave of eaters when restocked. No towels at the pool for 1/2 hour on Sunday. One lifeguard on duty instead of the normal 3. Is this wise? No Server to be seen. Pool area very dirty with used towels, dirty dishes, glasses, etc. Problem with dinner reservation (wrong date-their fault or ours, doesn't matter). A quality establishment would have seated us to "fix" the situation. The restaurant was 1/3 full anyway. No, were were turned away and told to come back in 45 minutes. We found another restaurant close by that was wonderful! Many deteriorations in physical plant, staff, quality of foods and services may have saved a few dollars now, however we may never return or suggest to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place would go again”
Reviews.Author: BelMere
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the beginning and 4 nights at the end of our trip. Very low prices (60-70) except Saturday. On the 15th floor first and 25th the last stay with nice views of the mountains and overlooking the pool. Rooms were quite large, towels were frayed, and carpet made my bare feet black. So they need to do some updating and steam cleaning. Bath was spotless. Airport shuttle and strip shuttle worked without a hitch with a reservation. Staff very welcoming and helpful. Enjoyed the movie theater, swimming pool, restaurants, and dabbled in casino. Silverado, Don vitos, and prime rib restaurants are great. Baja offered free margarita with large portions of good mildly spicy standards. We were shocked they did not serve drinks in the garden buffet which had lots of variety of just okay choices. Coronado was good for breakfast but we liked Seattle best for coffee and pastry. Bowling leagues clogged the ally so although we tried twice, we did not bowl. Lots of middle age folks enjoying the 1, 2, 5, 25, and 50 cent slots. The Monday football was packed and looked like a good deal but we could not find a seat. I really wish the cocktail waitresses wore skirts over their thong bustiers. They were the skimpiest cocktail outfits we saw after we walked through all the major casinos on the main strip. Recommend it and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: morralkan
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight at the South Point and returned home today. The rooms were very clean and large, well-decorated, and comfortable. For the price, it could not be beat. As with all Vegas hotels, I think, if you are a smoker, you will notice some smoke in the casino area and while walking to and from the elevators, but the smoke was not overwhelming while I was there. (Of course, it might have been worse if the gaming area had been more crowded.) I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Las Vegas, for the money !”
Reviews.Author: Metallica269
Reviews.Content: Just had a great stay at South Point this past weekend for my 10 year wedding anniversary. South Point is a very large Hotel/Casino roughly 6 miles south of the strip. Very helpful/friendly staff, very clean casino/rooms/pool. My wife is allergic to cigarette smoke and didn't have a problem at all in casino, very well ventilated. I enjoyed the brightness of the casino/room and the bright colors in the decorations. All the restaurants are wonderful ! The pool area is awesome with a very large main pool, a smaller kiddy pool, and a very large jacuzzi. Basically what i'm saying is between the casino/rooms/restaurants/pool/bowling alley/movie theatre/friendly staff/and loose slots, you can't beat South Point for the money ! Don't tell them this, they could be charging 4 times as much and it would still be a great deal ! I will definitely be going back to South Point while in Vegas !

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cherie1950
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Point on 9/15 & 16 and then again on 9/27/10 at the end of our trip. We had a beautiful room and the food in the buffet was excellent. We would definitely stay there again if we're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: tnuhlj
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the South Point a couple of times over the last year and have always enjoyed the place. Rooms are large, quiet and clean. Restaurants offer up good food at reasonable prices and staff are friendly and helpful. Only downside I see is the location. If you don't have a car then you are dependent on shuttle or cabs to get to the strip if that's your thing. Can't really beat this place for the price especially with the online room deals available.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: MrsTippen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on my brother's recommendation. This is the ONLY place him and his family stay when they come to Vegas. I'll describe the 2 cons to this place...and believe me there are ONLY 2!! 1) Would be the price of the internet. Seriously...$14!!!! And that's for ONE day! To say I was shocked at this was a understatement!! And 2) the proximity to the Strip. It is FAR!!! Don't look at a map and think that it's not. GET A CAR!!! Ok..now for the pros (and there are MANY!!!) We ate at a few of the restaurants that are in the hotel (Coronado Cafe, Garden Buffet & Baja Miguel's) We ate quite a few times at the Coronado. Go after midnight and you'll get CRAZY prices for breakfast. Try $1.99 for eggs, toast, sausage. YUMM!! We only ate at the Buffet once (Friday night is seafood night!!) and while it was ok..I wouldn't eat there again. And Baja was very disappointing!! I got two beef items off of the lunch menu and could only eat one. The rooms are large and very spacious. Oh..another thing I'd complain about are the pillows and the bed itself. The pillows are NOT what you see in the pics on the website. They are flat!! And they say that the mattresses are pillowtops. I think they were when they first opened..but not anymore. We had a hard time sleeping as the beds were THAT hard!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet for such a big place”
Reviews.Author: hetden
Reviews.Content: That is for the rooms, we didn't hear any of the other guests and that's great, especially while there are so many people at the casino and we were a little afraid that the hotel wouldn't be soundproof but as said it is. And we didn't mind it is about 7 miles from the Strip. We didn't have breakfast or dinner at the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Free Airport Shuttle at this SuperPowered Resort!”
Reviews.Author: RedCarnationReady
Reviews.Content: Needed a nice place to stay the night before my flight. Facilities are brand new and Hotel Front Desk Staff is very nice! The free Airport Shuttle is why I chose this property, I'm not crazy about Casino Hotels but this one offered me all I could want and more...SUPER CLEAN! This place is HUGE too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice amenities and proximity to strip”
Reviews.Author: rockmama12052
Reviews.Content: Let me say up front that I did not stay at this resort, however, I was in Henderson for a week staying with my husband in a nearby hotel for his business trip and i spent some time at this resort. My resort did not have a shuttle to the strip, but they would shuttle me to Southpoint, and I would purchase their shuttle to the strip. ($8 RT) which I found very reasonable compared to taxi trips! While I was there I checked out the resort...they have a lovely pool, so many things onsite to keep you occupied if you happen to not be there for gambling. Their shuttle service makes this a great choice to stay away from the craziness of the strip, but close enough if you want to go explore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But I'll Pass”
Reviews.Author: Astutefox
Reviews.Content: Online, South Point seemed like a great deal. But in reality, the hotel is not very convenient. It is too far away from the Las Vegas Strip-- about 7 miles. In order to get to the strip we would need to either drive or pay $8 per person each way for a shuttle. In addition, internet service costs $14 per day. When I factored in the cost of the shuttle (time and monetary) , South Point became less appealing. As far as the hotel is concerned, we didn't stay long enough to experience it. The room was spacious and clean. However, like the hotel, the room decor was dated... nothing special. Bottom line: If you want to be near the strip (at least within walking distance), skip South Point.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury on budget ($45pn) self contained mini-city south of LV strip”
Reviews.Author: Ek_NZ
Reviews.Content: Quite unbelievable hotel/casino complex in terms of scale (at least for New Zealanders). We got a promotional per night room of $45US including tax and were pleasantly shocked by what we got in terms of hotel/room class. Definitely beat most 4-star hotels in NZ (and some self-rated 5-star places too). Free/affordable wireless internet would have been great - its $13US per 24 hours which is really steep by today's standards where you tend to expect free wifi. The Buffet offered excellent value and quality breakfast and lunch (which you get a free voucher for SO LONG AS YOU GET THE CLUB CARD, which I forgot to). I enjoyed the limited gambling that I did - only one grumpy looking croupier I guess thinking that a cheap kiwi isn't going to tip - as the croupiers were friendly and helpful for newbies. Had other family with us for the stay. They enjoyed it too. We played 10-pin and I'm sure the lanes were the best I've ever bowled on. All in all I'd have to say 8.5 out of 10! Oh and fantastic rooms for sleeping in - beds ultra comfy, quiet air con - perfect to relax away from the Strip. A warning, pretty much everything else is charged for - e.g. fitness centre

Reviews.Title: “South Point is LV's Best Kept Secret!”
Reviews.Author: Fellowtraveler4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at South Point Hotel, Casino and Spa from Sept 13-17, 2010. We had stayed here once before when it was still part of the Coast Casino group, and known as "South Coast". We liked it for the comfortable beds, spacious rooms, and all the amenities available: bowling, bingo, movie theatres, fine restaurants, etc. The stay this time was just as enjoyable. We are primarily slot players, with occasional bingo. The machines here have a large variety of new themes, plenty of different coin denominations, and a very clean atmosphere; although smoking is allowed here as in most LV casinos, the air is changed frequently. We liked the Bingo experience in their 600-seat hall. The "pros" include a quiet place away from the busy Strip, with everything available at hand. Also, it's close to the airport. The only "Con" is the fact that this is the most southern casino on Las Vegas Blvd, quite a distance from the other casinos. If you like to casino hop, take some of the money you saved booking a room here, and use it to rent a small car. SP has shuttle available but it goes to the airport or to the Fashion Mall, and you will pay for it. We got a compact car from Payless for $107 for the week and were very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: “Free Airport Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: Jayr09
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because it has its own free airport shuttle. We were not planning on visiting any other casinos while in Las Vegas so it was perfect for us. They were also running a great special on the rooms. The casino is huge and is away from the strip. The rooms are luxurious! They have a bowling alley and theatre, so there is something for the kids too. Would have liked free internet from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but far away from anything else”
Reviews.Author: jofromab
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel. Mostly Seniors. Didn't try the buffet but it looked like all buffets. Main restuarant OK nothing great. Cost for bus to strip is pretty high $8. Bingo people were very helpful. Nice pool area. Good if you don't want to be right were the action is.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: johnfogerty
Reviews.Content: South Point Hotel,Casino and Spa, Las Vegas is an excellent hotel and casino and well worth considering if you'd like to stay off the strip. Me and my husband have been to Vegas quite a few times and have stayed in MGM Grand, Excalibur, Circus Circus etc, but thought we'd stay off the strip for a change. Now what I'd say is: a car is a must -even though there is a shuttle bus service, a car would be more practical. South Point is about 10 minutes drive from the airport and the strip,and is easy enough to find. We booked in without any waiting-it was about 8:00pm when we got there. When we got to our room we were slightly disappointed with the view from our window. We were looking out on to the parking garage roof. As we were staying for 14 nights we asked for a better view and we were told that as we had booked through Expedia these were the rooms allocated to them. We could however pay for an upgrade, but we didn't as it was quite expensive. Our room was on the 7th floor. The room itself was a generous size with a lovely king sized bed which was very comfortable. Everything was very clean, and uncluttered. One of the restaurants we went quite a few times was the Coranardo, where the service was very good and so were the meals. From 12 midnight to 6:00am they did specials so you could have steak and eggs for about $5. Because it was a busy restaurant there were times when we had to queue, but the staff worked very hard to get you a table as soon as possible. House keeping was really good,they kept the room to a high standard which we really appreciated. We only used the pool once in the 14 days as it tended to be very crowded. We went to the cinema but not to the Spa. We used the business centre to access our e-mails but found that quite expensive. Overall, it was a really nice change to stay at South Point, everyone went out of their way to make us feel comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for great price”
Reviews.Author: ChrisGabriel
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for a couple like us.. who look for value for money. Rooms are spacious.. and very clean.. take a higher floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap eating and cheap stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGirl69x
Reviews.Content: My first experience of the Las Vegas hotel and casino. The restaurants on site are great value compared to many of the other hotels. Distance from the strip might be a problem if you wanted to be in the middle of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value -- A Bit South of "The Strip"”
Reviews.Author: corvairmaven
Reviews.Content: Great room! Spacious, clean, flat screen.... at a great price. Coupon book on check-in featuring free buffet lunch, free drinks ('yes' not unusual in a casino) and some other discounts. Easy to get to.... I'd stay there again, without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Vacationrounder
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Souh Point many times since they opened in 06. Affordable rooms with all the ammenitys of some of the pricier hotels. The rooms feature a nice size room and bath complete with plasma TV. The carpeting was starting to show it's age. Very nice not too crowded pool area. They have one of the nicest hot tubs in all of Vegas. Included for the rediculously low price of $35 was a free lunch buffet, free drinks and several other coupons. Although they offer shuttles you probably will need a car as South Point is about 15 minutes from the strip. The best value in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and new poker room”
Reviews.Author: TRB33
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed four nights, August 22-26, 2010. We like everything about this place. It has all the features we need to enjoy our frequent trips to Vegas; clean, large, modern rooms with comfortable beds, rainfall type shower heads and instant hot water, full casino, good but not expensive food and customer pleasing staff. The casino has good pay schedules on many of its video poker machines and the poker room has been expanded as an important part of the newly enlarged casino. My wife loves the spa. The enitre structure is medium sized so you don't have to walk long distances. We enjoy being away from the congestion of the strip. If I was forced to recommend improvements I would ask for fluffier towels and more channels on the TVs.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel out of our whole West Coast road trip!”
Reviews.Author: anjelita13
Reviews.Content: We paid $50 for 2 queens in Aug/2010, RIGHT after we left they ran a deal for $35 rooms. Our room was HUGE, and SPOTLESS! Beds were very comphy, we had a flat screen tv, great channels, a desk, a table, great view of the pool. The bathroom was also spotless and had two areas, one where the vanity area is and a separate room that could be closed for the toilet and shower (huge, clean shower). I can't really comment on the staff (we arrived late and stayed only one night), or the pool/hot tub area/movie theater, etc.) But we definitely decided this is where we will be staying next time we go to Vegas. We did get to hit the arcade, which my 9 yr old son loved. Great place if you're going to Vegas with kids. Great prices too. They also have free valet. Only downside was having to pay $13 for internet. It is kinda far from the strip, not a big deal for us, but might be for some.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: okiest
Reviews.Content: If you have a rental car check out this hotel. It is on the strip 4.5 miles south of the LV sign. Access to the main part of the strip is very handy with I-15 running on the west side of the property. We went with the bargain room on the lower floors. It had no view, except for a 30 foot wall on the other side of the walkway, but the room itself was really nice. The room had lots of room, a very comfortable bed and a really nice bath area. The pool area was very nice with a large whirlpool area and separate kiddy pool. It also was open from 8am to 10 pm.

Reviews.Title: “one of our favorites”
Reviews.Author: achristie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here and will probably stay again. If you have a car, you can't beat this hotel for value. Rooms are huge, flat screen tv's, nice pool, good food in restaurants (mexican restaurant is excellent with a great lunch deal that includes a margurita), a decent buffet, good slot selection, very nice movie theater, bowling - it's one of our favorite places to stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Always good stay”
Reviews.Author: lovetovacation04
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at South Point the last three trips to Vegas. The room is always clean, beds comfortable and the good food, but excellent in the mexican resturant. We like the location out of the crowd of the strip and the spa is great.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, clean and spacious.”
Reviews.Author: tahiti_ldy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the same day we arrived. In reality Vegas has gotten expensive, especially with all the ridiculous resort fees for amenities that should be standard and apart of the price. Even Circus Circus was trying to charge $100/night on the weekend we went. So since we had stayed at South Point the year before and were satisfied we stayed again. Room was clean, spacious and perfect for our needs. The downside is that the pool is no longer open 24 hrs, it closes at 10pm. And the latest they'll let you check out is 12:30pm. On the upside I like that it's a straight shot from registration to the the room elevators, it's not overly smokey and there are plenty of non-casino things to do like movies and bowling. It is perfect for families and those don't a one-night stop in Vegas and don't care about the Strip. It is a bit of a drive from the Strip but if you have a car it's no big deal since there is plenty of free parking on the Strip as well. I would like to mention that the beds are not the most comfortable. But for reference I like pillowtop mattresses. So of course it's a matter of preference. Also as a girl that did many vegas trips with friends during college, their rooms are HUGE at South Point. You can get a room with 2 queen beds for as little as $40/night. And while they won't do roll away beds in those room, you could pack a ton of people with sleeping bags in there and split the cost of the room. Seriously. Wish it had been around when I was in college. We could barely fit 10 people into a deluxe Luxor room!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Mid-Week Affordable Vacation Spot!”
Reviews.Author: LGMom
Reviews.Content: We (Single Mom & 12 year old son) just spent 4 nights here and had a blast! The location - off The Strip - was perfect for relaxing and enjoying our time together. Close enough to The Strip to visit all the attractions (NYNY roller coaster, Shark Reef @ Mandalay Bay, M&M Store, etc.) without having to deal with the crowds and noise 24/7. What we liked: plenty of self-parking in the garage, beautiful room with two fantastic queen beds, large bathroom with separate sink/vanity area (both with doors to separate from living area), 5th floor view of the pool, large plasma flat screen TV, gorgeous pool area with lots of seating and friendly lifeguards, on-site arcade/bowling alley/theater, lots of food choices (Garden Buffet was excellent!) What we didn't like: having to walk through the smoky casino to get to and from garage/registration/elevators, lack of air conditioning near elevators going from casino to garage, no comfy seating area (couch, lounge chair) in room, very expensive "per day" cost for wireless internet service, limited channel access for TV (one channel for kids but 10+ for horse races?) Overall, we did love this hotel and will be going back. Beautifully decorated, very clean, nice people, great pool - definitely a great deal for the money!!

Reviews.Title: “underrated hotel, great sportsbook”
Reviews.Author: mazeandblue
Reviews.Content: I visited the southpoint a few times on my trip to Vegas on Aug 9-13. I didn't stay there. The gaming area is large and roomy. The sportsbook is one of the largest I have seen in town. In the sports book they sell hotdogs for 75cents. They have the sportsbook and the horse racing area in two separate rooms. This is a really nice place with a great sports book.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to airport”
Reviews.Author: MTfamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before flying out of Vegas after a California driving trip. Room size was even bigger than expected. That is just what we needed to spread out our things and re-pack for the flight home. We slept well and could not hear any noise from other rooms even on a Saturday night. Not sure I would pick this hotel if wanting to experience the nightlife of Las Vegas Blvd since it is at the far south however that was not our intent this trip. Staying here made it easy to get to the rental car return area.

Reviews.Title: “Still Great; Still Among Best Hotel Values in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: KittyChan
Reviews.Content: Southpoint (SP) is the only hotel for which I'm writing an update review (so far). I've stayed at SP several times since 2008, and I've come away impressed with the hotel's quality and outstanding value each time. The hotel has grown a couple of wings since it first opened -- understandably so, as it must be doing well. What I like about SP is that the hotel has not been spoiled at all by its success, and it is meticulously maintained. Value: If anything, I paid a bit less overall for my last few stays than for those prior to 2009. Expedia and other travel sites offer great deals at SP, usually a bit better than what the hotel's website offers. I think the hotel's regular rooms are a great value at the regular $70/night rate, but I've always found them available -- at least for weekday stays -- between $30 and $40/night. For this price, you get a very comfortable and well appointed room that's about 500 sq. feet, with a 42" flat-screen TV and, yes, my favorite hotel bath amenities in Vegas: Bath & Body Works Coconut and Lime. Location: Many TA reviews complain about SP's south-of-the-Strip location, but one would think they'd have considered the location before booking. I actually like the SP's location, especially since the opening of a new interchange on I-15 2 minutes' drivee from the hotel. SP is only a few minutes' drive south of the Strip (it's actually on Las Vegas Blvd., which is the Strip extended), and it's much easier to access and park at the SP. Both the garage and surface parking are plentiful and convenient. Food: Some reviews complain about SP's food options. Except for Michael's, which is reputed to be one of the finest (old-school) restaurants in Vegas, SP's restaurants are nothing special but provide plenty of affordable dining options. The main buffet restaurant is pretty good -- especially if you get coupons for free meals, as is usually the case with the coupon booklet SP gives you upon check-in. I'm a bit surprised that SP has slowly slipped down from the top 10 to no. 20 in TA's Vegas hotel rankings, but competition in Vegas is fierce. For my money, it remains the best hotel value in the city. I'll be trying a couple of new (for me) 5-stars on the Strip later this summer -- Vdara and the Encore -- but SP will remain my regular go-to Vegas hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hot Hotel for a cool price!”
Reviews.Author: MrDolby
Reviews.Content: Excellent Off Strip Hotel & Casino & Resort! Rooms are clean and large with a 42 Inch Plasma TV's that looks great! On the negatives, the Casino isn't the friendliest in town, with the Slots tight, and a morning Pit person who took my Players Card, returned & just flung it me as she was more intent on focusing on one of her own Black Jack Dealers. Players remember these things! The Hotel has almost everything you need and more. Without a Car there is nothing nearby, so keep that in mind. And if you earn 100 Points you could get this weeks free gift that can slice a finger off. I have never seen anything like it. I'm sure if Michael Gaughan the Owner of this Property took time to look at this 3 piece board set, & Cleaver being distributed to guests, he would be astonished. This Razor sharp Cleaver is not sealed in any plastic, simply tied onto a piece of cardboard, & 100% raised & exposed! They hand you a somewhat heavy wooden Carving board set rapped loosely in crepe paper & then this Razor Sharp Cleaver separately & without a bag too. You would think that a guests security & safety would be South Point's # 1 priority. This gift item is beyond dangerous, and the marketing manager should be held accountable for the way these items are being distributed! Date of stay 08/11/10

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing and rather depressing”
Reviews.Author: welshbelle
Reviews.Content: We have stayed on 2 previous occasions at the Venetian which is very good but pricey. On this occasion we were only going to have an overnight stop over between flights and decided based entirely on the TA reviews to try this hotel. How very disappointed we were. To me the hotel is exactly how I imagine a fairly down market Vegas hotel to be. Yes it is 4 star but this ranking can only be based on the range of the facilities offered and not their quality. To begin with the hotel is a long way from the strip (out taxi from the airport cost $34). The casino ( which as usual you have to go through to get to the room elevators) is very smokey and looks rather sad. The carpets in the corridor to our room had seen better days many years ago - they were worn grubby and badly puckered. The room whilst large and quite clean was very tired in appearance and the bed was awful. We wanted supper and having seen the Mexican restaurant mentioned in several reviews decided to give it a try. One look at the virtual fast food establishment made us change our minds pretty quickly and instead we went to the Silverado Steak house. This is obviously intended to be a cut above the other food outlets ( apart from Michael's). The service there was good and efficient but the food was mediocre at best and definately not worth the money. We had fun at the bowling alley but the pool area in the morning was ordinary at best and there were large numbers of families with young children . There were very long queues for breakfast and none of the options were particularly appealing anyway. Despite asking the concierge to order a taxi van to carry our family of 5 back to the airport after waiting for 50 mins one still hadn't turned up and we were obliged to take 2 at additional cost. The taxi driver told me that 5 seaters wouldn't bother going all the way to the South Point to pick up a fare beacause it was out of the way. We did not have that problem on the strip. Admittedly the hotel room was very cheap but do not be fooled but the 4 star ranking into thinking that you will be staying at an establishment that is only a little way down from a 5 star place. There is a world of difference both in the quality of the facilities and the overall ambience. Personally if I were to go to Vegas again then I would definately chose to stay closer to the strip and pay more to stay in some where that was a little special. I am sure that there are much better 4 star hotels around.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE; GREAT LOCATION for families”
Reviews.Author: KSScubaDiver
Reviews.Content: The South Point Hotel is a great location for families. The hotel rooms are WONDERFUL and there is alot to do as well as a full service casino -- something for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Prices”
Reviews.Author: mswguitar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Vegas to work on our rental property and we decided to stay at the South Point. I found the rates to be very reasonable and the hotel had pretty much everything you need right there. We didn't get a change to enjoy it all but it has a movie theater, bowling alley, and several restaurants. There are a lot of different restaurants with pretty much any style cuisine you could want. The AC unit in our room made an annoying ticking noise that made it hard to sleep so we notified the front desk after the first night and they moved us into a new room for the remainder of our stay. They also discounted all of the nights we stayed there so we basically ended up getting the last night free. The rooms are nice and very roomy with a 42" flat screen TV. We are going back to Las Vegas soon for a quick trip and we will be staying at the South Point again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury in the outskirts of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Antstro
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in the middle of the summer heat and loved it. This hotel has it all: big and clean rooms, an impressive 15$ breakfast/lunch buffet (read: early dinner) in the weekend, a restaurant for every day of the week, nice pool area with a shallow pool for children, a huge bubble pool for the ones who like it hot, as well as a normal pool for the rest of us, a huge bowling hall, an arcade hall and a 16 screen cinema complex! So even if you are not in Vegas to gamble you could actually have a great vacation just staying at the hotel. The gambling and bingo halls would probably satisfy the gamblers too. We used the hotel as a base and drove the 15-20 minutes into the heart of the Strip were you would go to se the shows and the insane amusement park for grown ups and children alike called Las Vegas. We liked the free parking and that it is only a 5 min. drive to Food4Less, and disliked paying 13$ for internet (per unit per day) and 10$ for changing rooms. If you want to use the spa area and the training room, which we didn´t, you have to pay 25$ extra. But for the budget minded these extra expenses are avoidable and a hotel like this for just over 50$ per night through the weekend, is just incredible. This is syden and danskebåten in a complete package which is Norwegian for sun, cheap alcohol, young people partying and old people sipping drinks, listening to out dated artists and playing slot machines. But yet it is possible to have a fairly quiet vacation in this impressive resort.

Reviews.Title: “Never go here”
Reviews.Author: UALDEN
Reviews.Content: Unless you want to be treated like a criminal. We went to the pool one morning and no towels, eventually a kid showed up with a cart of them at 10:30 am so I went over to get towels for me, the wife and kids. I was told I was only allowed one. I explained that my family is by the pool and he didn't believe me and started grabbing the towels? So I asked if he wanted to walk over to them with me so he could verify "my story". To my suprise he said yes. After everything checked out (lol) then I had to return with him to sign the faded dingy towels out? I asked for the manager and explained to her that maybe this isn't how you want to treat people and she told me "its your perogative to go somewhere else" From now on, I will- Its a dump

Reviews.Title: “Very good value.”
Reviews.Author: SFVicki59
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good a value if you just want to lay out at the pool, gamble and stay away from the very large crowds. The pool and jaguzzi are never over crowded and you can always find a lounge chair. There is an abundance of gaming tables and slots and I never had to wait for a seat at the tables. My room was very clean and the staff friendly. If you are traveling with a family they have things to do in-house such as the movies, bowling or even hit the arcades. I always rent a car when I am in Las Vegas, but there is a shuttle to the other casinos and I believe the near by outlet mall. They have a very good buffet which was included in my on-line reservation. The finer dining restaurants were not open during my stay. Over all I enjoyed this south end strip hotel and did recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Dare others to beat the value of South Point”
Reviews.Author: Idreamof
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at South Point Casino in mid-July. Checkin was quick and efficient. After having read some of the other reviews, we asked for a room higher than than the 2nd or 3rd floor and not facing a wall. We were told a room “with a view” would be extra each night. We decided to forget the view, as we were not planning on sitting in the room looking out the window much while on vacation. We were given a room on the 22nd floor overlooking the pool and a great southern view spanning Las Vegas Blvd to past I-15. The room was spacious, with a sofa, table and chairs, desk area, flat screen TV, along with a king bed, which was just like Goldilocks bed –not too hard, not too soft, but just right! Pillows are not feather, which is fine by me, as I am allergic to feathers and hate to be a pain for housekeeping to ask for non-feather pillows. The A/C was fully adjustable and was VERY quiet when the fan was on low or automatic. There are not one, but 3 telephones in the room, with one being in the bathroom next to ‘the throne’. Lighting was plentiful, with eco-friendly CFL bulbs (the hallways used CFL or LED lighting). The closet contained the iron and ironing board, along with an in-room safe, which is great to leave your winnings. ?;- ) The bathroom was not one, but two rooms – the toilet and bath/shower were in a separate room off the room with the sink and vanity. This is good since the coffee maker (also has tea) was on the spacious vanity, as was the hair dryer. Plenty of toiletries were left by housekeeping each day. The bath had a great rainfall shower head and there was plenty of water pressure, even on the 22nd floor! There was also a nice metal grab bar in the shower with a rough grip spot so if your hand was slick with soap, you won't slip. The rooms are very quiet – we saw a family with elementary school-age kids next door, but only heard them in the morning if they bumped into the wall. Security in the hotel was very good, with key check in the evenings before you get to the elevators. The swimming pool and hot tub were good. With the extremely high temps while we were there, along with a high school basketball tournament in town, we decided to use the pool immediately upon getting up in the morning. The hot tub, which is designed like a lazy river, was great. However the pool was a little cold, since the sun only hits it in the afternoon. Received coupon books upon checkin, which contained some good deals, including a free lunch buffet at the Garden Buffet on the 1st floor, which they also accept for breakfast. If you are looking for a fancy buffet, this is not the place to go. However, if you want good food at a very reasonable price (breakfast was only $6.99 with a Bloody Mary or Mimosa included), this is the place to go. We ate there once for dinner the night we checked in and twice for breakfast and were very pleased each time. Parking was plentiful, with some outside spots and a HUGE 7 floor parking garage which was great to help keep the car from baking when it was 110 degrees. The front desk people were very helpful – when I asked about using the points on my Player card toward my bill, they explained how to do that, along with pointing me to the Business Center when I had some items I wanted to ship home. Checkout was just as efficient. The only ‘down side’ to the whole trip was the long walk from the parking garage to the hotel room elevators, especially with luggage. But then there is valet parking and bell service, if you desire. I’ve never stayed at any of the ‘Strip’ hotels further north on Las Vegas Blvd. but I can’t imagine them giving me more value for my money than what South Point provides for a vacation visit.

Reviews.Title: “Of all the hotels we could have chosen in Vegas, this was Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Driver39
Reviews.Content: Having absolutely no idea of what Las Vegas would actually be like in "Real" Life! This hotel was a great find! It is at the southernmost point(hence it's name!)of Las Vegas Boulevard with a regular Shuttle to the Main part of the Strip. We had everything we could possibly want in that hotel, great , cheap and lovely rooms, a fabulous selection of Dining,for all tastes. An exciting atmosphere with superb staff, A Cinema, a Bowling Alley, a lovely swimming pool and an Equestrian area that frequently holds Rodeos and other Cowboy Entertainment. All Fabulous Will Deffinately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good room housekeeping staff”
Reviews.Author: romanticnights
Reviews.Content: My husband was entered in the world series of roping finals held at south Pointe last december. My son, his wife and 1 1/2 year old son was with us. My grandson had some kind of virus most of the time we were in vegas. Lots of dirty sheets and towels because of that but the housekeeping staff was so good to us. They didn't seem to mind the extra work keeping clean linens and things for them. So kudos to them for that. Overall, we had a nice time in spite of that. Would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: herctech
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel I was a little worried about how big the room would be considering the price we paid. I was not dissapointed at all as the rooms were a fair size. The hotel is a bit of a drive from the strip but that could also be considered beneficial. The rooms were very clean and smelled fine (I really dislike smelly hotels). We ate at the Big Sur Oyster bar and were very pleased with the crab leg special, the Oysters Rockerfeller and the wine we had. I can't say I have any complaints about this resort.

Reviews.Title: “WORSE hotel EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: shawna01
Reviews.Content: Worse hotel ever. This hotel has no regard towards patrons. Upon arrival the housekeeping manager let herself into our room with her key to check I'd we were "ok". Afterwards we placed a " do not disturb" sign outside only to have her return leaving with my jewelry that has yet to be compensated. The front desk was very nonchalant and careless about the missing valuables as I was told there were no comptent managers on duty on the weekends. Will never ever waste my money here again and I strongly advise anyone to never stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not OK with me”
Reviews.Author: Willx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this facility July 19-22, 2010 - thought it to be very nice and I liked the location because I wanted to visit the area around LV (Hoover Dam) and didn't want the congestion of the Strip or downtown areas. The room was great - quiet, and very comfortable. My only gripe is the exorbitant wifi fee: $12.00 PER HOUR or $20 PER DAY (nearly half the room rate) for the business center. I refused to pay that amount, and since I had a rental car, was able to find wifi within easy distance from the hotel. The amenities listed include internet access, but not the exorbitant charge - a nominal fee, say $5.00 per day would be fine with me, but $12.00 PER HOUR is just too much. I rely on wifi while traveling, so this alone would keep me from staying here again. That said, if all one needs is a nice room, this facility would be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Better than staying on the strip”
Reviews.Author: marcuswilson
Reviews.Content: We needed a base whilst in Vegas and South Point didn't dissapoint. Excellent value for money. The bedrooms, as they always are in the states were huge, and this was considering we were a family of four - 2 adults and 2 children. The casino/food outlets didn't dissapoint. The Garden Buffet is great value - both for breakfast and evening meal. Make sure you use your voucher booklet. The pool area perfect for both adults and young kids. Oh, and houw could I forget the 10 screen cinema. We watvhed 2 films during our stay, very luxurious. Only 5 minutes from the Strip, we even cnaclled our stay at the Monte Carlo becasue we wanted a Vegas hotel without the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “for the price, it was ok”
Reviews.Author: Mountain_travel
Reviews.Content: We pass through Vegas often and stayed at the South Point in March. It is fairly new and was pretty cheap. It is way out of town, but we were just passing through over night. It was a kinda wierd, like it had all the parts to be a destination casino but it is just not very nice. Surprising how run down it felt for how new it was. I guess the sign in the room that encouraged needle users to be responsible and contact the front desk for proper needle disposal kinda sums it up. I have never seen such a sign.....

Reviews.Title: “FINALLY - A TERRIFIC VALUE IN LAS VEGAS!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravSD
Reviews.Content: OK, first the negatives (no one is perfect, after all).......you have to walk through the casino to get to the guestroom elevators, and although this casino seems to do better than most at scrubbing the air, you still get the smoke smell - it's not awful, but it's there nonetheless and an irritant. Also, my room was missing a part that operated my coffee maker, and at 4:30am, that was frustrating - but I'm sure just an oversight by the housekeeping staff. HDTV did not offer HD channels. The rest I have to say about this hotel is nothing short of wonderful - with a HUGE amount of kudo's going to the service staff and their genuine customer service attitude. Whoever is hiring and training this team certainly understands what customer service is all about - with only one or two minor exceptions during my 24-hour stay, I was met with smiles, "hello", and a genuine feeling of "we're glad you're here". The valet service in front of the hotel was about the friendliest I have ever experienced. The room was great with all the amenities you would want (although the 42" HDTV didn't receive HD channels - I'm sure it's a cable company or satellite thing, but why would you invest $500million in a hotel and not have HD?????). Sound-proofing was good, the room had a comfortable sitting area and the bathroom was a good size (with a separate room for the toilet & shower.....a good touch for multiple family members staying in the same room). The pool area was a good size, and there was a good assortment of restaurants and bars. With the bowling and movie theaters inside the complex, why would you need to leave? I saw a LOT of families - and it appeared to be very family-friendly. Last but not least, the casino action was pretty good - nice low table limits, even on a Saturday night, and the payout odds on video keno was the best I've seen. The dealers and pit staff were very friendly - you simply felt good being here. I come to Las Vegas often to visit family living in the area, and I used to stay at the M Resort, but the service and friendliness of this hotel knocked my socks off, so I'll be coming back to South Point from here on out!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, and got great rates - first time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Cunneth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Point from 7 - 12 July for a conference and couldn't have been more pleased. Housekeeping was outstanding, as were the conference facilities and food service for the convention. We were amazed at their ability to accommodate over 1,300 in our conference group, including getting us all fed at three lunches and four continental breakfasts with no delays. We asked for and were free-upgraded to a room with a view of the mountains on the 8th floor. And this despite the fact we had booked during one of their 72-hour specials and got a great rate ($39 for weeknights, $60 for weekend nights). Room and bathroom were both very large and roomy. You should make reservations for the free shuttle well in advance, using their toll-free number. There were some last minute arrivals (stand-by) who didn't get the free ride to the hotel, but on the return to the airport there seemed to be plenty of room. All service overall was excellent. Check-in and -out were very quick and pleasant. My only negative comment was that we didn't learn until our last night that players at the tables drink free -- would have saved us a few dollars if we'd known earlier. The Garden Buffet offers a huge variety for around $15 per person. The Oyster Bar was very good too. This place also seems to be very family-friendly, with lots for kids and non-gamblers to do. The Gift Shop has sandwiches and snacks that were reasonably priced, although for souvenirs I thought the prices were high. Cigarettes are all $8 per pack. We had no problems with noise near our room. We asked for extra clothes hangers and coffee packets which were provided very promptly and the housekeeper made sure we had extra coffee throughout our stay without our having to ask. This was a great experience for our first trip to Las Vegas and we highly recommend the South Point.

Reviews.Title: “Food made me deathly ill!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: soozie-g
Reviews.Content: We ate at this hotel restaurant thinking, "oh it will be okay because it is freshly brand new".....HA!!!! What a joke....I don't remember the name of the actual restaurant, but it was inside amongst all of the slot machines, and roulette tables etc. We had to walk our way through the mayhem to actually get to it. I had gravy and biscuits for breakfast, and my husband had eggs and toast,with bacon (I think)...nothing fancy! Only a few hours later after eating there, with nothing in between, I became violently ill, with vomiting and the worst diarrhea in the world, that I ended up missing my flight home, and into the emergency room with food poisoning, and a $4,000.00 ER bill! p.s. my husband also became ill the day after I did!

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: rainydaymeg
Reviews.Content: Don't get sucked in by the free airport shutttle, only runs about every 2 hours with a driver that wouldn't wait 5 minutes for our party. I did call over 24 hours ahead and was told to wait on standby, ran through the whole airport to see if any seats were available only to be told seats were available but ( the driver) wouldn't wait for the slower people of our group carrying luggage. It costs less for a taxi to the strip with rooms that cost the same. Stay on the strip. If you are a local with a car the room is nice,but bring a cooler. I was parched when we finally got to check in, July=very hot in Vegas, the check in desk is is the casino , and when I very nicely asked a waitress for a water, with the $ TIP OUT was told drinks were for players only. Oh yeah , the graveyard specials in the cafe.... Don't order a drink, cost $1.50 more than my whole meal...plain old OJ. To sum up do not stay here if you are not a local. They are very tight on slots also, hubby and I just gave them our money where I won like crazy on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “I was pretty happy here”
Reviews.Author: mrsguevara
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the South Point over the Fourth of July weekend and I was really happy with it. Not only was it not expensive, the rooms were clean and large. The only thing I would suggest is that they give more of a variety of TV channels. The pool was great! Not overly crowded and clean. The staff was helpful and friendly. The only suggestion I would give is to get some better music. The music was family friendly but at times depressing! The Del Mar Deli was the best! There portions were great for the money. I also enjoyed the movie theater on site. I would definilty stay here again and bring my family with me next time. I would also recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ldevlin818
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 4 days at the South Point over the 4th of July. What a great place and here are some reasons why: On the strip but away from the madness, right off the freeway easy access to the hotel and easy to get back on when you're ready to leave, FREE valet parking, great service, great room with 42 inch plasma TV, best comfy beds ever, clean room, rain shower in tub, great places to eat and affordable, everything is so easy to find and you don't have to walk a mile to get there, places for kids to have fun, movie theater, bowling alley and arcade all next to each other on a different level from the casino, but not to far, lagoon style pool and jacuzzi with plenty of lounges to sit on, the people who work here are friendly and I even went home a winner!!! can't wait to go back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, but what about the BED BUGS?”
Reviews.Author: wannabehappy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the South Point for a family reunion. You talk about incredible prices, oh yes. But at what expense? I moved my room due to bed bugs. Sure they gave us an "upgrade" an above level room but nothing special. This was the thing that made my experience the worst.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Why leave the complex?”
Reviews.Author: travalure
Reviews.Content: The complex is new (opened July 2008) and there are large rooms and baths. The view from the 10th floor was great...a vista to the mountains. The bathtub is average with shower in it, but the sink (with granite counter top) is separate from tub and toilet room. Our bedrm had an entry hall, queen bed with small canopy curtain decor, love seat, table and desk. The piece de resistance was a large flat screen TV! The multiplex movie theater had about 8 first-run movies and the bowling alley has 62 lanes. Both had very reasonable prices. All this and several restaurants (incl. upscale, cafe and deli) with good prices. The pool area is BIG and beautiful; there was live music sometimes. I can't rate the casino since we do not "game". A very large Outlet is about a half-mile away. Bus ride to The Strip took about 45 min. with one transfer (and Vegas has the newest, most fun to ride buses ever!) This casino/hotel (unlike most) has a free shuttle to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at South Point!”
Reviews.Author: kireos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Point for our one year anniversary trip to Las Vegas. This was our first trip to South Point and we didn't know what to expect, but once we arrived - from check in to our room, we were treated with the greatest of service. All of the staff we came in contact with during out stay was pleasant! Even the housekeeping staff asked us BEFORE they cleaned out room if there was anything they could do for us while they cleaned our room. We've never experienced this at any other hotel and it was a great change to have the staff concerned about your stay with them. Our room was probably one of the biggest rooms I've ever stayed in. My jaw dropped in we walked into our room. Everything was so clean and well kept. There wasn't even that "hotel smell" in the room. I remember some gentleman on here complained about how the hotel didn't provide "do not distrub" signs - they do, its located on the desk and its a little square "key" you place in your keyslot on the door to your room. On the front of the key, its says "service please" in blue and on the other side is the "do not distrub" in red. Just incase anyone else would like to know where these are located. We did eat at the Garden buffet and it was so good! For lunch, its only $10 a person, a great deal considered a lot of the buffets on the strip are $25 dollars a person. The quality of the food was really good and the service was wonderful! There wasn't one food item that my husband and I wouldn't eat again - everything was so delicious! On Saturday night, we ordered a pizza from the snack bar by the bowling ally. It was soo good! They make the pizzas fresh when you order them and so once you get them, its nice and hot! It was so nice not travel outside the hotel to get delicious food at a great price! With the pizza, we were able to take it straight to our hotel room in no time! It was so nice to eat in our hotel room so we could relax. There was so much to do at the hotel that we were always able to find something to do. Which is great for those who have families! We even saw a couple of movies while we were there at there theather there. It was so nice and clean! The chairs were very comfortable and it was very nice movie experience. We even gambled a bit at the casino and won a couple of bucks. The only negative I can give about our stay was we weren't informed about the $100 security deposit before our stay. It was quite a surprise and we were out $100 dollars, so our trip plans had to change A LOT because of this. We were quite upset with this, but the staff did do their best to try to resolve this issue the best they could for us, even pulling some strings in order for us to do our deposit in cash. Other than that, our overall expierence was excellent! We are already planning our next trip to South Point within the next couple of months. We have found our Las Vegas hotel and will probably stay here from now on whenever we need to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: lovelasvegas5
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in June for first time at South Point. Nice to have free shuttle since hotel if off of Strip. Check-in was easy and standard room was large and clean. Bed was WAY HARD and I ended up sleeping on the sofa. TV has few free channels but is a nice flat screen. Would have preferred a roomy shower instead of a small shallow old bathtub. Loved having a movie theater in the hotel with lots of choices and good prices. Bingo was also great with nice employees. Cafe has fine American food (nice prime rib) but stay away from the Chinese offerings. Mexican place was a great deal using the coupon. Cheap hot dogs by the Sports Betting but no drinks sold there which is a bummer. I only paid $35 a night so it was overall a good deal and I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER NICE!”
Reviews.Author: Mikeysmama
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the location off the strip, family friendly atmosphere, and low price. It was GREAT! It has a bowling alley and movie theatre. The room was extremely nice with plenty of room. The bed had drapes around the headboard, which was a nice touch. The bathroom was very nice as well, with the sink/vanity being separated from the toilet/shower area. The toilet seat was even contured! The room had a big flat screen TV, but it didnt seem to have a whole bunch of channels, but I'm sure they would rather you be downstairs at the casino. My one big complaint was the smokiness of the main area, which is where the casino is, so that shouldn't be such a big surprise. I also wish that the parking garage connected to where you can go to the rooms so you don't have to drag your luggage down the elevator, then through the casino, then back up the elevator.
