So if you need to bring in your luggage, go through the front doors. Which reminds me, valet parking is free. This hotel is only about 10 minutes south of the main strip so not far at all. If you have kids (or even if you don't) you are gonna LOVE the swimming pool area! Nice hot tub too. Wow it was so nice. Also, the views from our room on the 15th floor was great! I wish it had free internet service-it would have cost around $20 to get it. If you just wanted to show up and stay here and never go on the strip, you will enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Deposit Dilemma”
Reviews.Author: shanook907
Reviews.Content: Its a nice hotel but wait to see how long it takes to get your deposit back. My receipt states " Deposit of 1 night is required and will be charged at time of booking. A credit card authorization will be run at check-in and held until the time of your departure." Well they are still holding it and I have been checked out for 4 days. Now the reservations say's it could take up to 7 days? I think they need to rewrite their policies.

Reviews.Title: “Better than what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel122
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the South Point for two nights. The rooms are very big and clean. The hotel is couple of miles away from the strip, so take a car. The casino is good, not small, not huge. I would stay there again because we got a great deal. If you don't have a car, I would not recommend it, its too far from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: get_out_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at the beginning of a Grand Circle Tour. We were simply looking for a place to relax after a long flight and South Point fit the bill. I am very happy with my choice. We had an excellent buffet dinner with wine for a very reasonable price, our room was quiet, well-appointed, spacious, modern and clean. Exceptional value for the price we payed. Parkiing was free and there was no resort free.. This may not be the best place ot experience Vegas = but it was an excellent choice for an over night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal and Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: strawberrypeach
Reviews.Content: South Point is close to the airport but it is far from the strip. So if you stay here then I would recommend renting a car. The hotel itself is a great deal and is very nice. The rooms are large and the entire hotel was kept very clean and neat. I know there were smokers in the casino but I did not smell smoke in the halls or our room. Our room had a view of the mountains and since we were still on East Coast time, we saw the sun rise every morning. The buffet offered plenty of options and the food was good. The hotel also offered plenty of other entertainment options. You definitely cannot beat the price for a room of this size and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality by the price”
Reviews.Author: manderbra
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel for having a base in Las Vegas and touring around. For this purpose the choice was optimal since the hotel was new, clean, comfortable and at a very low price (less than 50$ per night). It is not convenient for who wants to go to Las Vegas strip, since it is a several miles drive. Moreover there is no free internet, which is quite unpleasant. For everything else it is a very recommendable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Look”
Reviews.Author: decent58
Reviews.Content: South Point Casino was a decent place to stay while I worked on the La Vegas strip. Most areas inside the casino are smoke filled. The gym did not have decent elliptical machine or free weights. It was very smoky in the gym and breathing was uncomfortable. The food selection is great and affordable. The pool seemed small for the resort but was inviting after sitting in the sun. There were no fridges inthe room so bring a cooler.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to get the most bang for your buck.”
Reviews.Author: pbeattie
Reviews.Content: I was amazed at how clean they kept the casino area. They were constantly cleaning up around the machines. Rooms were also very clean and comfortable. The choice of restaurants makes this a great deal for travelers. I just love the place and have stayed with them 4 times.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a very nice room!”
Reviews.Author: fillmap
Reviews.Content: $32. Convenient to airport, but nothing else in Vegas. Great choice if you don't want to walk The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the action”
Reviews.Author: ettalpha
Reviews.Content: I stayed at South Point for one night before staying at a different hotel on the strip. We couldn't afford the Saturday rate at the strip hotel, so we stayed at South Point for just $100 (after taxes and fees). In that regard, it is a great value! The rooms are very big, clean and updated. The service from the staff was *awesome*. Overall, we very much enjoyed our stay at the South Point - our only mistake was attempting to travel to the Strip while there. The cab ride was over $50 (round-trip). If you're going to stay at SP, either don't go to the Strip or drive your own car (parking is free everywhere)! The pool was nice - pretty crowded... but comfortable. The bed was just okay, but definitely do-able for one or two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid It Like The Plague”
Reviews.Author: divgrlfrmcuba
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here this past weekend. I had 3 Mac laptops and 2 iPods stolen from my room. They don't have any hallway video surveillance. I was really surprised by the lack of security on the guest floors. Amazing how they can put 1000 video cameras all over the casino floor, yet next to nothing on the guest floors. I was not impressed by the condition of the hotel either. The carpets look like they need to be replaced and the furniture looks worn. Not a good sign for a hotel that hasn't been open that long.

Reviews.Title: “Another GREAT visit to South Point”
Reviews.Author: bquirouet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I discovered South Point by accident just after it opened. By our second night there, we knew we wanted to return for an extended stay. Our careers keep us nearly exhausted all the time. We knew we wanted a place where we could get away and just REST for a solid week and we knew that South Point would fit the bill. Since this was going to be our 3rd trip to Vegas together (and my 10th), we felt we had seen all we needed to see (excepting City Center) and wanted some place that would keep us entertained. We were greeted by the parking attendant with smiles and assistance. Check-in was a breeze and our room was just as we expected it - large and comfortable. We called for our bags and they arrived in a very short amount of time. The bellman asked if we had any questions or concerns before exiting. Shortly thereafter, I turned on the bedside lamps and discovered one was missing a bulb. I called the front desk and a member of the South Point team arrived IN LESS THAN 10 MINUTES with a bulb. He also asked if we had discovered any other problems before he left. This man was so efficient that he didn't even wait around for a gratuity. We left a note for the housekeeper (along with a daily gratuity) asking for more towels and regular, not decaf, coffee. We always had more towels and coffee than we needed. Since we're from Atlanta and our body clock was still on Eastern Daylight time, we tended to sleep late. We were never disturbed by housekeeping during our entire stay. One day we didn't leave the room until after 2:00 and STILL found our room "done" when we returned at 5. The last week of May was a bit chilly by Vegas standards, so we didn't spend the amount of time we had planned at the pool. We had to resort to spending more time in the casino (oh darn).... and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. My wife's money management system proved to be a good one and we left after a week with a bit more money than we started with!! Everyone in the casino - from the gorgeous waitstaff to the cashiers in the booth - everyone was courteous and helpful. We enjoyed several bingo sessions during our stay and had a wonderful time in the bingo hall. We didn't win any bingo games but felt our money was well spent for the amount of enjoyment. We shared in the joy of someone sitting near us hitting bingo on the "power ball" or whatever it's called... and winning more than $5,000.00. Many on this site have commented on the smell of smoke in the casino. I must say that we did smell some smoke upon first entering on our first day. At no other time, however, did we have any trouble with smoke. We changed machines several times because we were sitting next to a smoker but that was not a problem and no different than in any other casino. Even though the bingo hall has an extensive smoking section, we never smelled any smoke there. We tried 3 of the restaurants while on property. The buffet was adequate and filling - as most buffets are. The food was of great variety and good value for the money. This is not a $20.00 per person buffet and we didn't expect the food to be of that caliber. The prime rib restaurant was outstanding, with a great atmosphere. The cafe food was always good and we ate there on 3 occasions. The service in all venues was great. We always use valet parking when in Vegas and never had to wait more than 5 minutes for our car at South Point. We visited MGM one day and had to wait nearly a half hour for the car. What a relaxing week we had. The weather warmed and we spent the bulk of our final 2 days at the pool. A waiter walked by about every 10 minutes asking if we needed any drinks. At one point, one of the lifeguards went around to everyone to check on their status, telling us to let him know if we needed anything. My wife enjoyed a wonderful message at the spa and reported that it was one of the best ever. We look forward to our next trip to Las Vegas and there is no doubt that we will spend our time enjoying South Point. We highly recommend this property. South Point is not The Belliagio and we didn't expect it to be. We enjoyed utilizing our money in other ways besides paying Belliagio prices. I suspect our room was as big or bigger than one in other properties and was wonderfully comfortable for our entire stay. We look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Nice alternative to the Strip, but beginning to show its age”
Reviews.Author: DenverBrian
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at South Point before and I continue to enjoy the extra-large rooms, entertainment options and easy access to the Strip. The property is really only an alternative if you have a rental car, but they're so cheap these days in Las Vegas - and the hotel itself is as low as $42 midweek - that South Point should really be on your short list for a Vegas trip. Unfortunately, the hotel is beginning to show its age. The engineering staff hasn't learned how to stretch carpet, for instance - huge expanses of bumpy, rolling trip hazards greet you at elevator lobbies and down the long hallways. It's tacky and unnecessary. The casino itself is quite possibly the smokiest in all of Vegas - ventilation is quite poor and you'll find yourself holding your breath as you try to escape outside or into an elevator. South Point's poker room is a joke - it has never been finished and remains a wide spot near the escalators to the multi-screen movie theatre, with four forlorn flat screen TVs jerry-rigged on one wall. As with many large casino hotels, the powers that be have decided (wrongly) that, if they only have 12 channels of TV in the room, you'll go down and gamble more. As I guest, I have decided (rightly) that if you haven't joined the 21st Century on TV options, I'll downrate you and consider other options. The $12.95 daily charge for internet is smarmy as well. South Point's buffet is serviceable and has a very wide selection. When you check in you will receive a coupon book for each guest, and the first coupon is a free breakfast or lunch buffet for one - nice job avoiding the "two for one" or other slimy marketing caveats that other casinos foist on the public. If South Point improves its engineering/maintenance and adds some TV channels, it will continue to be on my value list for Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: JackiefromTarzana
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is quite nice and the room was clean, the bed was horrible. It was hard and lumpy and the room never cooled off all that well. I had two horrible night sleeps because of the bed and the temperature. Don't know if all the rooms have uncomfortable beds, but I wouldn't stay there again. Too bad because the rates are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need in one place - fantastic hotel and great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: michellelovesvegas
Reviews.Content: You can tell from the outset that when you arrive at the South Point, that you will be staying at a lovely quality hotel. My husband and I travel to Vegas (from the UK) nearly every year as we were married in Vegas and like to celebrate our anniversary there. We have stayed at the South Point 3 times and have loved it every time. So what that it isn't in the centre of the strip, the room costs are reasonable, the food is good, you aren't charged extra for electricity or resort fees etc., the rooms are lovely, modern and comfortable, and you can either swim, gamble, sunbathe, bowl, play bingo, go to the movies, eat to your hearts content, dance, drink and have an overall great time without even having to leave the property. There is a shuttle service available at a reasonable cost if you wish to travel to the strip to see the sights, you are only a few miles away from the action and its nice to return to the hotel and relax in the casino before heading to bed (although it always ends up a late night for me and I end up distracted and taking advantage of all the facilities again! ) I have tried a few other hotels in Vegas who have similar rates and I always tend to wish I hadn't bothered and stayed at the Southpoint again instead as I know exactly what service I will receive and what my room will be like. I have to say, my husband booked another hotel to try this year as the rates appeared to be pretty good (no refund for cancellation though - I feel tricked), but after reading some more up to date reviews on this alternative establishment I guess I really need to cancel now especially that I have noticed half price rooms being advertised today for the dates I am in Vegas - Southpoint - why could you not have detailed this deal sooner!! I normally don't bother writing reviews as when they are positive, more people stay at these establishments and I am less likely to get a good deal - I have gone to the effort as I really can't fault the Southpoint and having nothing negative to say whatsoever! All you UK visitors, take advice from another UK tourist to Vegas and get it right first time - you will love this hotel! Hopefully see you on 15th September Southpoint!! Only for 3 days this time but I can't wait!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: RustySuzyQ
Reviews.Content: Our 2nd visit and would stay here again. Good rooms, good value. Plenty of dining options. Easy parking and freeway access very close.

Reviews.Title: “A quality off strip option”
Reviews.Author: Firstnten
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the South Point for 3 nights May 24-26 and had a good time. First the positives: Nice clean large basic room 500 sq. feet with 42 inch plasma, nice bathrooms, I had signed up for the "Favorite Package" which was $79.50 per night for a high floor room with a view, and I also had a third night for free. This offer included 2 free buffets and 4 free cocktails, and when you check in and get their coupon book I received a 3rd free buffet and a 5th free cocktail. $159.00 total for all that, what a deal. I thought the buffet was quite good with a large and varied offerings that would satisfy almost everyone. If you are looking for King crab legs, lobster, caviar, quails eggs, or champagne then you would not like their buffet, everyone else will enjoy it. They also keep all of the stations open for Breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The pool is extremely nice. They have a hot tub with a small waterfall feature, a kids wading pool, and a large regular pool, cocktail service by a near by bar and also cocktail service by cocktail waitresses at/around the pool area. They also feature palm tress and free towel service. Silverado Steakhouse: 5 Stars, I shared a supper with one of the Casino Executive Hosts and we had a great meal. Prompt and polite effective service, an excellent steak, clean, comfortable, and classy--one of the true highlights of my vacation!! Actually, I came into contact with 2 of their Casino Executive Hosts, and I can honestly say that a full 50% of them were polite and decent/respectful towards me. Negatives: Many days before I was to arrive I made sure to request a refrigerator for my King-Smoking-Upper floor room. When I entered my room no refrigerator and no ash trays, this required me to go all the way back down to the front desk and stand in line all over again. Race and Sports book-Clean, modern and tons of viewing angles. Prompt cocktail service during the NBA Playoff games. Cocktail Service-Excellent, and some of the smallest uniforms for the cocktail service gals. " Most " red blooded American Men will appreciate this feature. The slots, at least for me tight, tight, and tight. Did I mention that the slots were tight. You MUST have a rental car to stay here as it is a good 5+ miles further south down Las Vegas Blvd South, But also much less traffic and crowds which I found to be a plus. Did I have a nice time on vacation at South Point, yes Would I stay again, probably Just a few minor things to get straighted out. See you in 2011, "C" Bill B.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, price and overall quality..we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: NewjerseyNiser
Reviews.Content: Our 1 night stay at the Southpoint was the final leg of our 2 week trip to Nevada and California. My only dissappointment is we stayed only 1 night here. We had previously stayed at a 5 star hotel in Vegas but found our stay at the Southpoint ($42.00) to be much more enjoyable and comfortable. Our room (799) was huge,quiet and clean. Toiletries were wonderful.. The beds( 2 Queen) were very comfortable. We had a view roof which I would have requested a change if staying longer than 1 day. We had lunch at the Mexican which was good with GREAT service( can't recall his name).Also ate at the deli and had the BEST huge Corned beef sandwich for $10.00. Check in and check out were a breeze .Check out is 12 noon (bonus!) Hotel is close to the airport and car rental .So much to do without the hustle and bustle of the strip .Next trip will include an extended stay at the Southpoint instead of the overpriced and over hyped strip hotels. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Can't wait to come back to enjoy all that Southpoint has to offer

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied; repeat customer”
Reviews.Author: kewong
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the South Point several times in the past couple of years, and it continues to be one of Las Vegas' hidden values. The rooms are big, clean and extremely quiet. I can honestly say that this is the only hotel we have ever stayed at that we never heard any noise from upper or lower floors, neighboring rooms or the hallway. I never even heard the air conditioner cycle on. Service is excellent throughout the resort, and the good food and entertainment are enough to keep you on site for your entire stay. In fact, we only planned on a long weekend, but extended our vacation after the second day and stayed the entire week. And, we never left the property. This was the best decompressing vacation I have had in years, and with the extended stay, two evenings we actually watched a couple of season finales on regular TV, and we slept in everyday. One of things we really enjoyed was the 16 screen multiplex theater. At home, we never have time to go to the movies, and the ticket prices are outrageous. We just wait for the DVDs to come out. At the South Point, first run movies are $3.00 for seniors, before 4:00 PM, and we saw four movies during our stay. We would have added a fifth after checkout, but instead decided to eat at one one of the restaurants we missed, previously. Speaking of restaurants, the Garden Buffet is great for those who enjoy "all you can eat" fare, and the food is above average. However, after one meal and a free bottle of wine there, the better values are the numerous other restaurants on the property. In several stays, we have still not eaten at all of them. We really enjoyed Primarily Prime Rib, the Big Sur Oyster Bar, Don Vito's Italian, and the Coronado Cafe. The cafe is great for breakfast, and the late nite specials draw a big crowd. Who would think that you would have to wait to be seated after midnight, but the cab driver menu has some great specials! It is probably obvious by now, we aren't big gamblers, although we did walk away from the slots with enough to to buy dinner for two nights. We go for the resort amenities and have not been disappointed in several visits there. And, we will probably return again during the summer because of the mid-week special rates. Besides, we still haven't gone bowling or eaten at Baja Miguel's!

Reviews.Title: “The luxury hotel with affordable rates”
Reviews.Author: andy-mary
Reviews.Content: From the impressive exterior you know you are entering a 1st class hotel. The rooms are some of the largest and well appointed rooms I have stayed in, and that includes the high end strip hotels. The quality of the bedlinens is excellent, mattress toppers make the bed super comfy. Cleanliness throughout the hotel is exceptional. I love it here, I would live here if I could.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Only through Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: suite662
Reviews.Content: Pros - $39 room on a Sunday night, excellent room accommodations Cons - "Knock, knock, knock" at 9:12 a.m. "Room check!" What the...? Since I was with my teen and it was a short stay, we didn't partake in any of the hotel's amenities (eateries, slots, pool, etc.), so I'm not able to speak on them. Now, as for Room 622 specifically, just know that there is absolutely NO view. Didn't bother me at all, but just inquire when booking if you want one. I usually can sleep anywhere, including the floor, but I tossed and turned all night. Although I managed a somewhat decent night's sleep, (sounding like Goldilocks) I think the bed was a little too hard for me. Where's the Sleep Number dial? Also, I'm not sure if South Point provides DND [Do Not Disturb] door hangers, but 622 didn't have one. I DID hear Housekeeping knock on every single door for Room Check though. What is up with that? Will a military bugle be next? LOL Bottom line: If you don't mind driving, South Point, at the very least, has awesomely spacious rooms at ridiculous prices! Oh, and don't detach the coupons from your Fun Book like I did. D'oh! Enjoy all the amenities that South Point offers you.

Reviews.Title: “South Point is the BEST hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGal60188
Reviews.Content: I stayed at South Point from 5/18/10 through 5/25/10. The service was excellent, the standard room we were given was much larger than most I have visited in the past on the strip. The room was well appointed with luxury mattresses and all cotton sheets. I had a room on the 18th floor with a view of the pool and mountains. The bathroom had a granite counter-top and fluted sink (nice touch). There was a private room for the commode and shower. Everything was new and very clean. Maid service was excellent. I found that the decorating was pleasant and cheerful. The halls were cleaned and well maintained. EVERY employee was cheerful and helpful. The swimming pool facility was spectacular! The whirlpool/hot-tub was an enormous oasis. The pool area is open 24 hours a day!!! Even though the main pool wasn't heated, I found that once i got used to the water, it was great. Every guest that I spoke to in the elevators LOVED it there, and were on their 2nd, 3rd trip to South Point. I don't think that I will ever stay anywhere else. The only detriment to some, is that I was glad that i rented a car. It would be a little too expensive to cab it everywhere. I am moving to the Henderson area soon, so I was happy to be a little further down the strip. YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED STAYING AT SOUTH POINT!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!!!”
Reviews.Author: Romnan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is off the strip and if you are more interested in a good hotel,casino Spa this hotel has evrything Bowning alley,theater,lounges night club and all the things that you wold expect to fing in Las vegas. This is a very large complex and again lacks for nothing. the price for an versized room with double beds was unbelievable

Reviews.Title: “Far of Strip”
Reviews.Author: Rebel_BsB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and the rooms are comfortable. I reserved a high floor room with the city view. A unique negative point of this hotel: is far of Strip (9 miles). Positive point: you can check out by TV in your room (not necessary to go until reception). But the next time i will look other hotel in the Strip. If you don´t mind stay far of Strip is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Decor”
Reviews.Author: EastlandMall
Reviews.Content: Tacky, tacky. Holiday Inn decor is not what I expected in a "4 star" room. $12.99 ridiculous internet charge. Free parking. Beware of the drivers in the parking lot. And you'll need a car because everything is miles away.

Reviews.Title: “great value midweek and fabulous bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: LondonKazza
Reviews.Content: Stayed a total of 5 nights here. The hotel is a long way from the main Strip, about 10 miles I guess, but they do have adverts up for a shuttle bus that you can buy tickets for. We didn't use it. We liked the local area as we could get to the shops for camping provisions and we ate out at some local restaurants. (It's also very close to the Fashion Outlet Mall) We're not gamblers so can't advise on that, but we ate in the Coronado Cafe (ok for the price) and had the prime rib buffet which was great value. The hotel lacks a bar where you can actually sit and socialise without having a video gambling game under your nose, but that seems pretty common in vegas casinos. The standard bedrooms are really big, bright and relatively new. Very clean with a well appointed bathroom. Big LCD TV etc. The internet is good but costs $12.99 per computer per day. (go to Buffalo Wild Wings for a drink and use their free service!) The swimming pool is very nice with complimentary towels, a big bubbly hot tub, kids' pool, and a snack bar, though I would get there early if you want a shaded spot, it's quite exposed. Parking was easy midweek, out the front of the hotel, we didn't bother with the valet. We paid around $38 per night, through an agent, which I thought was amazing value for the quality of the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: Aaron_kristen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights end of April. Had booked online, and got a special 50% off room rates. So for 2 nights, stayed for $75. You cannot go wrong. yes you do need a car, as the shuttle that used to take you to Mandalay Bay, is gone. Rooms were clean, well appointed. You are on the south end of the strip, so know that. The midnight specials at the restaurant are awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaFamily3
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great value! It is off of the strip so you need your own vehicle if you want to go to the strip. The restaurant has some great "late night" values for around $2-$3. We received a coupon book upon check-in. The coupon book included a coupon for breakfast or lunch buffet at one of their onsite restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value $75”
Reviews.Author: Hokiecoyote
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Point for $75 on a Friday night. The room was big and well appointed. They charge $12.99 for internet which is ridiculous. The casino floor is more of a 3 star than a 4 star. The smoke wasn't overwhelming like some others have said in their review but the ventilation system is definitely lacking. I would recommend going down the road 5 miles to the M Hotel for a classier environment.

Reviews.Title: “Everything costs extra!”
Reviews.Author: BRs21
Reviews.Content: The rooms were fine - spacious enough and clean, though no fridge. Nice swimming pool BUT the worse thing about this hotel was the fact that everything cost extra - wifi ($12.99/day), local and 1-800 calls a dollar each, fitness centre ($15/day I think) Given it is so far from the strip, I would imagine the hotel would lay on a free shuttle - but is is $8 /person - so would cost $40/day for my family to go anywhere - and there is certainly nothing other than the hotel amenities nearby. So even if the room is good value, the extra costs will quickly not make it so. Food was average - bit like nice school dinners! Some staff helpful and friendly, some not. Virtually whole of bottom floor is taken up with casino - therefore very smoky and nowhere really to go to get away from this - nightmare for children!

Reviews.Title: “Smoky South Point”
Reviews.Author: redhand
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights courtesy of British Airways during the recent flight upheaval. Its a decent hotel with good sized bedroom and an excellent pool area, although, as the name suggests, its a bit isolated and you would really need a car to get around. We would not choose to stay here due to the problem with smoke. Check in is sited in the main casino so you choke on smoke before you even get to your room. The main dining areas are open plan so again smoke fills the air, spoils the food and contaminates your clothes. Smokers would love it but if you value your health, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Stranded at the South Point due to Volcano!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: iloveorlando
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the South Point was not planned or intended, but due to the Volcanic eruption in Iceland closing airspace over Europe. After having a fab week in Vegas at the Wynn Hotel, our BA flight home to the UK was returned to LV due to the Volcanic eruption. BA put us into the South Point as an interim measure, where we faced uncertainty about our travel back home. As mentioned, this stay was a total surprise, but I wanted to thank the staff at South Point for making our stay pleasant and bearable during a traumatic time for us and the 450 + BA passengers offloaded there! I won't harp on about the volcano or our personal issues with getting a flight re-booked, but would like to say that the South Point really is a great hotel; even though it was hard to stay positive in the situation we were placed. It is off strip, away from the hussle and bussle, but it is a little, (or quite large actually) gem with tons of amenities and a great atmosphere. The hotel has many facilities, bowling, bingo, restaurants, equestrian centre, games area, casino and a cinema complex as well as boasting a very nice pool with jacuzzis and pleasant spa area. There are many places to eat and a great variety of restaurants and a great shop which sells anything you may have forgotten or need. The rooms were very large, ours had two king beds, flat screen tv, nice lighting and a lovely re-fitted bathroom with seperate vanity area. The Bath & Body works amenities were lovely. Best of all - they have a tea/coffee maker - !!! a real bonus as you rarely find these in strip hotels. Houskeeping were busy bees and the room was always kept nice. The public areas were very clean and tidy. We only ate at the Garden buffet as this was included as part of our stay, due to our situation, (4 nights by the way). The food choice was great and plentiful. Breakfast was especially good with fresh juice, piping coffee and lots of hot and cold choices. The buffet was busy with long lines, (proving very popular) but we never waited long to be seated and were never rushed. If you stay, remember to check out the coupon book they give out, there are lots of great discount offers - we used one for a free bottle of wine with dinner - great. The desk staff were courteous and helpful and again, due to the influx of passengers from our flight, sometimes the the line was long, but we were processed quickly. Having checked the regular rates I would recommend a stay here - very good value for money and your $ will go much further than being on the strip. The hotel runs shuttles to and from the strip and airport (strip journey payable). Overall we were very pleased to have stayed at the South Point during a time of difficultly and would not hesitate to recommend this great hotel - with excellent facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, great buffet, great cocktails”
Reviews.Author: kwab
Reviews.Content: This is a great LV style hotel and casino. The food is great, the rooms are great, the facilities are great. Bad points... they charge $8 a round trip for the shuttle to the Strip and it only goes every 2 hours. My advice, if you haven't got a car, get the bus. It stops in the car park and is lots more fun than the shuttle. Another bad point. Internet access is $10 a day!! It's free in most places ... and so it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Friendly at Bargain Rates”
Reviews.Author: castaways01
Reviews.Content: Took my mom to South Point for 4 nights in February (Fri-Tues) after spending 6 comped nights at the Venetian. I received a good deal via email and wanted to stay OFF the strip. Also, living outside the U.S. I was hoping to "catch up" on seeing some movies while checking out the hotel and VP machines. We stayed busy the whole time and unfortunately, I didn't even get to the movies! The hotel was a great value over the weekend, when the strip hotels raise rates. The staff seemed friendly and the only complaints I have is that it was very smoky in the casino and their Internet access charge was excessive. The room was clean and A/C blew cool. They were kind enough to bring a refrigerator for mom's insulin and I rented a mobility scooter from them for her. We keep weird hours so I don't think we even used housekeeping, except to exchange towels and get soap. However, they were visible in the hall and seem to work very hard. My mom spent hours on a fish video slot and VP machines closest to the elevators so I always knew where to find her when her cel went unanswered. I played BJ and VP mostly as I found the slots to be tight. We ate at the buffet a couple times and it was reasonably priced with good food. Enjoyed their house wine. No complaints about the cafe. We wanted to try the steak house but didn't get the opportunity. Looking back I don't know where all the time went - we certainly didn't sleep it away. I had a rental car for three of the 4 days at South Point, which made getting around easy. Was able to check out the outlet mall and a couple of other local casinos. I didn't go back to the strip except to return the car to the Venetian. Took the duece to the bus station then local bus back to South Point.. We ended up taking a taxi back and forth to the M the final night so we could try their poker room and casnio. We got back to South Point in time to pack and take their convenient airport shuttle. Overall enjoyed the stay and recommend it as an off strip reasonably priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor treatment of guests”
Reviews.Author: Mfamo
Reviews.Content: We booked our two night stay through a discount booking service. We were obviously given a terrible room to penalize us for booking in this fashion. The room was on the bottom floor and the window faced a blank wall. The room was dark as a cave! To make it worse the smoke from the casino one floor below permeated the lower floors. It was disgusting! A walk around the higher floors showed many empty rooms. Our room had 2 double beds but only 3 pillows. We called for a fourth pillow three times but it never arrived. Maybe guests who don't pay list price don't deserve even a modicum of service. The Mexican restaurant on site was quite good. Overall, avoid this hotel at all costs unless you are paying the exorbitant rack rates! They penalize all others with their worst rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had been HERE all week!”
Reviews.Author: Jstreeboo
Reviews.Content: We were staying at a resort next door - and they couldn't extend us out a night, so we thought we'd come and spend our last night at South Point! I tell ya - I wish we had spent our ENTIRE vacation here! We had enjoyed the casino, the restaurants, the movie theater, and of course - Bingo - and overall - this is a great hotel! The food is better priced than you'll find on the main strip.. you can get anything from sandwiches for under $10 to full-on fancy meals. The Garden Buffet was pretty decent - but I was pretty disappointed in the Coronado Cafe for any meal other than breakfast - Which - by the way - they have GREAT middle of the night breakfast specials. The most awesome was our room!!! We had a king bed room over looking the pool. It was clean - the bed was wonderfully comfortable - it was the best night's sleep I'd had all week. The ONLY suggestion I would make - for the rooms that have the outside up-lights focused on them - you still get a lot of bleed from the strong lights all night long. What about attaching a piece of velcro (sticky-back to the wall), and then the opposite piece on the curtain in a couple places to truly black out those very strong lights? The staff was awesome all week long - even when we weren't guests. They have shuttles running to and from the strip and the airport constantly - it was just really a good experience. I would absolutely recommend this to my friends and family - and I look forward to returning to South Point again one day. Thanks South Point!!! I wish I would have been a guest all week!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better then going to the strip”
Reviews.Author: clivesmom
Reviews.Content: I have gone to five star hotels ont the strip manytimes .Decided to try South Point because I enjoy Bingo. I was very happy I did. I found the spa great. Much better then five star only had 80 minute messages. The food was not great but not that bad. Some of the resturant were pretty good. the room was large not to fancy but fine. Cleane large T.V. coffee maker. I play dice blackjack etc. and found everything fine.Bingo parlor was great. Bus service to the strip for 8 dollars round trip made South Point my new Hotel. The only problem is that there poker room does not get game 4-8 6-12, So you must go to strip.

Reviews.Title: “gamblers paradise”
Reviews.Author: jazz3d
Reviews.Content: notorious gamblers. we stayed here for the first time because we love to play bingo and were not disappointed . went bowling in their 64 lane bowling alley & sat by the pool but never made it to the movie theater. too much to do and not enough time to do it. the hotel does smell quite smoky the first time you walk in the hotel but never noticed it again the rest of the trip. the coffee shop is adequate for breakfast but went out to dinner to restaurants off property because we have favorite places that we eat at every time we go to vegas. love being away from the strip and the traffic that goes along with staying there. rooms were good sized and very comfortable. the beds were the best part of the room. front desk was very accommodating. asked for a pool view on a low floor near the elevator and had no problem getting it. would definitely make this our home away from home when staying in vegas when the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms and friendly staff but terrible food and atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: Larshedegaard
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stay at this hotel to our first visit to Sin City and our first impression was shocking with all the gambling machines, and how focused the hotel was on making money. But I guess that is what Las Vegas is about more than anything else. For example we had to pass all the noisy machines and gambling tables to get to our room and a visit to the gym was a very costly affair. The room we had and the hotel in general, was very clean. No complaints what so ever regarding the room and its decoration. As the matter of fact, if the hotel only should be judged by its rooms, it would be considered top-value. The yoghurt we had for breakfast was disgusting and the tasteless coffee was very disappointing. They served cake for breakfast and like the rest of the hotels we stayed at in US, we didn't have any decent cheese at this place either. Like most americans, the staff at South Point Hotel was helpfull and smiling and should be paid more for showing their pleasant personalities. All in all an OK experience

Reviews.Title: “Rude Rude & Rude”
Reviews.Author: bigmarklasVegas
Reviews.Content: We arrived early , Knowing the rooms would not be ready, we attempted to go and do some bowling, only to be told a a grumpy, and obviously very un happpy person that no bowling was available until 3pm ! , no good for us, So we tried the Cafe, Food was OK, Server was OK, not a grumpy as bowling Man ! , Then when paying the Bill, The Cashier was very rude to us, as we had our CC Cloaned recently, we had a "temp DEbit Card" with no name on, and was made to feel like a criminal, being blunty told they can not accept this, luckly we did have some other means to pay. Well that was enough for us, We left, before we even checked it. There is a Huge Choice in Vegas at the Moment, And we will go to another Hotel, where we will get some respect and proper Service.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, very Inconvenient loctation.”
Reviews.Author: carlsonpar72
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we have stayed at the South Point. Apon arriving at the hotel the front desk was very pleasent and we were able to check in right away. we were given a coupon book at check and did use the free lunch buffet coupon. Which was nice. There were a lot of choices and the food was good. You do however notice the smell of smoke as soon as you walk in the casino. But it is a casino and people do smoke in there, it wasn't bothersome and quickly forgot about it. The rooms are nice size with big flat panel tv's in all rooms. I did not enjoy the bed at all. Not enough pillows either, i did not request more. Air worked fine and you could not hear it come on at all. As for the casino. Drink service is almost nonexistant. My husband and I received one drink the entire time we where playing, the cocktail waitresses are not very friendly and don't come around very often. We are not big gamblers so we don't spend alot of time at the tables or the slots. We took the shuttle to the strip one day, it was only $8 per person (if you pay cash). The shuttle drops you off at the fashion something mall. Which is fine but it was a bit of a walk to get to the strip, and then it is down on the far end near TI. The pool was the best part of the entire trip. Very nice and lots of sun and shade. there is a good size kids pool as well. If I where to bring the kids this would be the perfect place to go, very low key and lots of things for the family to do. I don't we will stay again but we did enjoy ourselves. The one thing I thought was strange is that you have to pay to use the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Avg stay this time”
Reviews.Author: bigfish59
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very busy this past weekend but was still a good stay. We were though very dissapointed in the fact that the fire alarms were going off all night long with no direction from the Hotel employees and it was very chaotic for the guests. I do enjoy this Hotel much more than the M hotel better location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: jwil_001
Reviews.Content: We had the most horrible service at South Point this weekend. Everything was slow... they were so overwhelmed with how many guests they had. They gave a friend's room away without any regard. The fire alarms went off 3 times, once in the middle of the night and they only offered free buffets. The buffet was so horrible that I would have been livid if we had to pay for it. Will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “South Point could be my new home base”
Reviews.Author: Illinoistraveler54
Reviews.Content: Well I had my second real stay at South Point. I booked through a host since I did not know if i would receive a mailer I have heard SP is weak on them. My regular host was on vacation but another I had heard of was glad to comp me a couple of nites since I would again split with Silverton. I did receive a mailer a bit before my trip with free nites and some free play so called and used it. This time I continued to slowly try some more restaurants this time the oyster bar. Next trip I want try Baja Miguel's. Yes there will be a next time. I like the cafe and I am always up early so get the graveyard specials. I like just going up to the counter. But so many choices. I really like as a Video Poker that they have a lot of decent VP machines. Yes I did leave some $ there, but at least I have a chance. Michael thanks for that. This may be the reason I stay my next trip all here. Silverton is doing the opposite. My host said I should be good for 4 nites. But I do hate playing the machines near the sports book. Oh that hot dog cart it keeps pulling me over. And they are from my town Vienna dogs with the nice snap in them. Do not take this away although I believe it is quite safe. My room was nice on the 14th floor and again just like 6 away from the elevators. I only wish they had a small refrigerator. Nice to keep a couple of beers or some water in. But I make good use of the coffee pot. So in a few months too many really I will give Courtney a call about my Nov. trip and maybe all at SP. It has been a few since I have done that. Well see you there for #37.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: annietravelz
Reviews.Content: Internet trick - I only spent $9.99 for for nights total on WIFI because I signed up with Boingo one month access. I canceled Boingo when I got home and there was no cancel fee, or anything else. This is the way to get Internet at South Point. I used their free shuttle service for transportation to and from the airport and it was very convenient. Make sure you reserve it first. I also took their shuttle service ($8 round trip) to the Fashion Show Mall and that was also very easy and lots of available times (no res needed). I got a great Orbitz deal of $35 a night and got 2 free drinks, 2 free buffets, and free popcorn for the theater. I enjoyed going to the theater and sitting by the pool. The gaming staff was friendly and it was always easy to find a good table (blackjack, poker). The slots were pretty loose so I came home with some money. If this is your first trip to Vegas, you want to stay at Wynn or Venetian or something center Strip. If you've seen it all before, stay here. The buffet is pretty good and tons of selection but the oyster bar was absolutely delicious (try the lobster grilled cheese and their homemade chips). The DelMar Deli has cannoli - so good and their breakfast bagels were awesome! The hotel shop has a huge selection of good wines at very reasonable prices - you will have to buy your own corkscrew unless you can get one on the plane or in your luggage. The towels weren't as bad as the previous reviewer went on about. Pretty standard towels in my room. As everyone said before - the rooms are spacious and clean with nice amenities. Play in their evening poker tournament for a good tourney structure and fine starting chip stack. Small poker room but nice dealers. They had a spa that looked pretty nice that I may check out next time. They also have a nice men's barber shop. South Point will be my new home away from home in Vegas. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for staying in LV if you DON'T want to be anywhere near the strip”
Reviews.Author: erk42
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nearly perfect for what I was looking for - a one night stopover in LV on the way to Death Valley for a budget price. I found this on Expedia for a bargain price - one of the cheapest rates I have seen for any hotel of this class. It was located perfectly for my needs. The good - the room was huge, clean, and modern. Beds were comfortable, the flatscreen TV was wall mounted. The negatives - the halls were a bit noisy (but it didn't filter back to where the bed was for me) Also, the walk to the elevators from the parking lot must have been a quarter mile. I am not kidding. Besides that, everything else about my stay was positive. I would call this a solid 3 star hotel which I got for a one star price. Warning - don't book this for a stay in LV unless you don't want to be anywhere near what is going on. This hotel is an island, and is not convenient to the strip at all.

Reviews.Title: “Won't come back”
Reviews.Author: theresorttraveler
Reviews.Content: The South Point has gone straightly downhill after it was sold by the Coast Casinos. I have stayed here many times and this will probably be my last. The rooms have gotten dirtier and the room is wearing out even though it is only been open for a couple years. On the plus side, the rooms are roomy and the location is good. But the hotel also has a lot of rowdy people that messed it up. If you want a pleasant and relaxing stay you probably shouldn’t come here. But if you are on a budget and just want a decent room then this is not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “"Super" South Point Hotel, Casino, Spa”
Reviews.Author: Pippy8
Reviews.Content: Our 3rd fabulous stay @ South Point on the South end of The Strip. 4 min drive to visit The M Resort/Hotel/Casino & 15 min drive straight up The Strip to Mid Strip everything & best yet - 5 min drive to or from airport rental car drop off. Easy Checkin 2 hrs. early (Thursday) easy checkout 1 week later at 5 AM. Used our Slot Card points then too and got 1 night free. Stay March 11-18, 2010 - Super clean casino, bright, airy......majorly packed the weekend we were there (VERY FUN! Loosest slots we played compared to The M, Aria, Mirage, Palms, Orleans, Mandalay Bay). Retsaurants Check menues online - didn't do the buffets), breakfast great, lunch at the Deli (sometimes a line wait) Split a sandwich - YUM - plenty with visit around the corner to the ice cream shop -1 scoop generous. All Casino Bars extra busy Fri-Sun, bartenders overly busy then but always friendly - St. Basketball/soccer Decos when we arrived, changed out for St. Patricks Day Decos and special slot extra points. Evening security to enter elevators - excellent Big winner ?- excellent response/IRS papers and payment.............happened to several people while we were there on all machines! Movie Theatres, bowling, large arena events, shows, Bingo! Room cleaning very nice, choice of having beds linens/towels changed daily or every 3rd day. We enjoyed the choice. Can leave card in door while out requesting cleaning OR Privacy. Cleaning person checked our door card when we requested entrance to the room once while she was cleaning! Very Good Security again. Quick Drive to Center Strip for shows but like "coming home' once back at South Point. Some Spring Breakers there but wonderfully well behaved and fun to be around. NCAA Basketball teams and Girls Soccer teams staying here for tournements..........we enjoyed them all! Not to forget...Valet Service great (we're flexible anyway), Bell service perfect. Ticket services got us wonderful seats for Lion King. Hope to do the trip again and again and again. Have family living in Vegas and employed on The Strip in shows and could stay with them but "LOVE" staying at South Point.!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mahalo65078
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to South Point. This was the second time we have visited South Point for March Madness. Madness means Las Vegas. We love South Point for the Sportbook. Great Sportsbook Bar and great TVs. The bar has the best bartenders we have ever found at a Sportsbook. We remembered many customers from last year's madness and that just adds to the environment. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are spectacular. My days of a Vegas Strip hotel are long gone and we prefer something away from all that. South Point is absolutely perfect for what we want and need. I was hoping to meet Shelley White and thank her for her input on TripAdvisor but she was busy on the three times that I tried to talk with her. I did get to visit with her assistant. You can bet that next year for Madness you will find us at South Point. Thanks for a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel off the strip.”
Reviews.Author: superdave2k
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year for a convention. It is a nice hotel. It is, however, very loud. I think that is expected anywhere in Vegas but the noise here is non-stop and I have stayed at other hotels. However, for the price you can't complain much. Also the TV made weird staticy possessed noises, lol. I would stay here again during a less busy time.

Reviews.Title: “great 2 canadians”
Reviews.Author: red1bull
Reviews.Content: loved the hotel and got treated very well,very clean and loved the casio, layed back

Reviews.Title: “Have a quality experience for a fair price at the South Point.”
Reviews.Author: VegasBuff
Reviews.Content: I am once again pleased with my stay at the Sount Point. Just to keep the facts straight, the South Point is on the strip and has a Las Vegas Blvd address. It is just located way down south on "the strip." Hence, the name south point. The place is unglamorous but it provides the fundamentals very well. Some of the pros: Always speedy elevators Large basic rooms with quality room service No Resort Fees!!! Operates a clean and modern 16-screen movie theater for a fair price Has a large bowling alley and video arcade for the younger crowds Food and coffee is available throughout for a fair price Some of the cons: Air, air, and air. Zero fresh air throughout the building. There is nothing sexy and fresh about this place. Bowling alley becomes a baby sitter in the evening. Bottom line, I would recommend that you do not stay here if this is your first time to Las Vegas and you want to have that "bright lights" experience. Instead head central (TI, Mirage, etc). However, if you are a frequent visitor and, especially, if you drive to Vegas, then I would stay here. Get your fill of gambling, sleep, and food at the SP then take an afternoon drive to the central strip for the day. It is also closest to Primm which has the only Williams-Sonoma outlet store in the south west corner of the US. The SP has an awesome sports and race book which provides that "every man's" experience, In other words, comfortable seats, fast and free drink service, and 75 cent quality hot dogs. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “1st time in Vegas=perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: comet2280
Reviews.Content: As this was our first trip to Las Vegas, we decided to stay off the strip, and rent a car so we were able to see a little more of not only Vegas, but the Hoover Dam as well. Even though everyone I talked to encouraged us to stay on the strip, we could not be any more pleased with South Point. Checking in was a breeze, the room was one of the best we have stayed in with an amazing view of the mountains as we as being very clean and updated. The casino was spacious, had a ton of variety, and they payed decently too!! Our first night we ate at the Silverado, while this was the most disapointing meal we had at the hotel, it was still above average. When we checked in, we both signed up for players cards, which included a coupon booklet that had a free breakfast buffet. Originally the plan was to have the buffet Wednesday morning, then find a place on the strip Thursday, but the buffet was so good, we had to have it another time. I cannot even begin to describe how good Primarily Prime Rib was, by far the best prime rib I have ever had. All in all, the food quality of all the places was an A+. Without a doubt we will be staying at South Point the next time we go to Vegas...I enjoyed my time on the strip, but South Point is so much quieter, and the casino is the best I was in. I would very highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, Great deals, Will be back again, quite & pleasant”
Reviews.Author: lanacura
Reviews.Content: got a great deal on price of staying, stay one nite + free one night $35 nitely. Hotel very clean, pool is very nice & quite, my 4 & 6 yr old love it. Hope to come back again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleep, food, movies, bowling, bingo,livestock arena,large gamble area and texas holdem poker tornaments.”
Reviews.Author: topagent
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a total of 5 times. I like the 2 time a day Texas hold-em tournaments. I came in 3rd one day and we split the 600.00 3 ways. Nice for a $50.00 buy in. They also have 2-4 and no limit cash games. I would get a floor on wing room 1270. where Connie is the maid. She is one of a few that speaks English. She is also very friendly. I saw Avatar for $6.00. The senior before 3pm rate is $3.00 per movie plus if 3d a $3,00 surcharge fee. Sylvia with room 2040 is another good maid. I got a rate of 60.00 per nite for 2 nites and that inculded free access to health exercise area. 2 free lunch or breakfast buffets and a coupon for 2 free anytime buffets. The best one is the Friday or Saturday dinner that cost about 19.00. Also, u get a coupon for a free bottle of wine. I got the rate off their web site that listed hotel promotions. I also got an "edeal rate code" by doing some research on google and got 20 percent off my friday saturday rate. Also, I got ten free buffet books from guest that did not want them. Well, I did pay a buck a book. But it did save me the 11.00 buffet and tax fee. No resort fee here. Free large self parking area. It takes about 7 minutes on 1-15 to drive from hotel to heart of the strip by rental car. U can take a but if u are real poor or catch a taxi to the luxor and get on their free tram to the strip. i like the $3.00 midnight special meals of steak and eggs at the Coronada Cafe. The spa was an extra $10.00 per day fee that is separate from the exercise area and has a great water massage jet that comes out of the ceiling and is around the size of a ping pong ball. They do have a special fee is you are going to the spa more than 3 times.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for 8 days and it was fun and not as expensive as strip.”
Reviews.Author: Tigershot88
Reviews.Content: Very nice. Newer hotel, so very clean. alost dont have to leave the hotel. there is soo much to do here. Movie theater, bowling, shows, all the gambling you need. I accually won about $1000.00 here playing texas Holdem. I will be staying here when I go back.

Reviews.Title: “WELL off the strip. spacious rooms. smoke smell starts in halls”
Reviews.Author: arobin
Reviews.Content: South point offers spacious rooms that are pretty well appointed. Bathrooms are spacious and modern. The beds were comfortable and I was able to get a pretty good nights sleep while staying there. There was a large flat screen tv in the room which was a nice perk. The hotel/casino itself is not bad but it is WELL off the strip (about $30 cab fare) and the hotel facilities (casino/restaurants) do not really compare with the more flashy strip venues. Pros- lots of space in the bedroom. reasonable rates. VERY inexpensive store for purchasing snacks or full bottles of wine/liquor. GOOD IF- you do not mind smoke and if you have a car to drive into the main strip area Cons- despite their best efforts of air filtration- lots of smoke and smoke odor pretty much everywhere! My eyes were itching the entire time. $15 per day gym use fee. daily fee for internet

Reviews.Title: “A great out of the way resort.”
Reviews.Author: vettechgrl
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at South Point. The staff is very friendly and the rooms are very comfortable. Our room had a fantastic view of the sunrise each morning. The Serta mattress and quality linens made this one of the most comfortable rested sleeps I have ever had in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: lvnir
Reviews.Content: The hotel was off the strip which is what I wanted. The rooms were really good. Initially i made the reservation for 3 nights. Everything was good so decided to stay one more night on the last night of my reservation. When i went to the front desk the guy said it was going to be 35 and i decided to extend the stay for one more day. The next day i asked him what the price was for the next night he quoted a higher figure and I asked him for the extended night the price was 35 right? and to which he replied yes. When the checkout time came i was bit hurried because of some emergency at work and ran into some problems with the TV checkout and couldnot check the folio but somehow i got checked out avoiding the lines. When I looked at my credit card statement I found i was overcharged by around 30$ for the last night. When i complained the accounting lady said there is not much they can do and it was my fault i did not check the folio and I should have taken down the name of the front desk person i talked to etc. Since it was only 30$ extra it was not such a big deal but i felt ripped off 1. Even after double confirmation they overcharged me 2. They were not gracious enough to reverse it and blamed it on me. The hotel is nice but be careful if you extend the stay.

Reviews.Title: “got stuck because of storm in n.y. requested hotel on strip got this one”
Reviews.Author: sir-paris
Reviews.Content: what a wonderful hidden surprise, plane was canceled slept in airport ,then decided to leave next day, stay at south point , very pretty clean friendly and nice movie theatre saw a movie bowling alley. lose all my money i was going home broke until i got to south pont won money i was happy. will be back,very nice thank-you

Reviews.Title: “Well off the Strip - for better and for worse”
Reviews.Author: bl12
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a top floor suite with a bunch of friends. If you just want a getaway and some relaxed gambling, then go ahead and hit up South Point. It is affordable, pretty nice, good customer service (reasonable comps), clean, relatively quiet and does not feel as manic as other spots on the Strip. In other words, when you leave a club and get home at 3 in the morning, you almost feel relieved when you walk into the Casino area because you can talk in a normal voice and feel like you can relax a little bit while you play some blackjack to wind down. On the other hand, due in part to its distance from the Strip ($25-30 cab ride), this is not a place you want to stay if you want to eat at the hottest restaurants, party at the trendiest clubs and just feel like a part of the city-wide party Vegas is. Whatever you save on the room by staying at South Point will leave your pocket on cab rides. The Mexican place on the second floor is surprisingly affordable and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “South Point Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GuateRican
Reviews.Content: A Great and Excellent Hotel...That should say it all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice casino hotel off the crowded strip”
Reviews.Author: kelranji
Reviews.Content: We were there in December for a Basketball tournament. It was super nice because the basketball games were right there in the hotel!!! We learned that a lot of the locals come here instead of going down to the strip. The hotel was nice and clean and quiet. The food was good and the casino bars were reasonably priced. I found the bar upstairs near the entrance to the Mexican restaurant was a nice escape from the noise of the slot machines and a great place to watch Sunday NFL.

Reviews.Title: “Team roping event / World series of team roping”
Reviews.Author: DianeP4
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. They need more rooms when it comes to the NFR and the world series of team roping events. It's a nice place to stay. You never have to go anywhere else. It's all there in one Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: TaraS1
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at South Point and it was GREAT!!!! The hotel staff was wonderful, our rooms were very clean & comfy, and the food could not have been better. Our next visit we plan on staying there again & can not wait to eat at Michaels.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but a little far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: Kimber74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the South Point between Christmas and New Year's Eve. The hotel itself was fine - exactly as advertised. The rooms were clean and well-decorated and I found the room service excellent. The front desk/consierge staff tried to be helpful although they could have worked harder to help clients with off-the-beaten track questions. Overall I found the staff friendly, helpful and enthusiastic. My only real issue with this hotel was its distance to the strip. It was a $20 cab ride or a very long bus-ride away. If you are planning to stay at this hotel, you really must rent a car! And don't wait to rent the car while at the hotel - if you do, it'll require yet another expensive cab ride to wherever your rental car is. Best to pick up your rental at the airport. We didn't think to rent at the airport and ended up renting a car from Dream Cars located on the strip on day two. It worked out well - I would recommend Dream Cars for sure - but we did spent a lot of taxis until then. I really enjoy the vibe in Las Vegas and next time around, I will spend the extra money to be closer to the strip. Having said that, If I needed a place to stay away from the strip, I would stay at the South Point again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Food poisoning for the bride!”
Reviews.Author: lizziebarf
Reviews.Content: We came for a quick one-nighter... our friends were getting married and wanted us as witnesses. We booked 3 rooms for Saturday night at $70 with the online special. We checked in around 6pm, coming from southern california. Staff was friendly and helpful. We headed over to get the license for our friends, then returned to get dressed up and get the kids. We needed to be at the wedding commissioner's office by 10 pm to do the wedding. Well, right away they told us the county office was closed, and that they could get married at the Vegas chapel down the street for the same price. Well, this meant standing out in the cold at the drive-thru for the "basic county marriage", and they tried HARD to upsell my friends. They didn't, and we took photos in the drive thru and made the best of it. Back at the South Point, we met for a late dinner at the Coronado coffee house. They took our order for appetizers and they never arrived. Once the dishes arrived, the bride noticed that the stuffing with her turkey tasted rotten and sent it away. The waitstaff finally removed the nonexistent appetizers and the turkey plate when we paid the bill. Management was apologetic. As the hours passed the bride had major food poisoning issues and spent the whole evening in the bathroom. We told the management the next day, and they removed the charges for one of the rooms. We had other complaints- the bed was as hard as a rock, and pillows were thin and in short supply. The valet was extremely slow and we watched others who arrived behind us get their cars sooner. We were on our way to the wedding, and it seemed the rough MMA crowd was being ushered out sooner, regardless of arrival. We will never stay here again. The casino is decent, but the hotel and restaurants left so much to be desired. Internet was horribly overpriced at $13 a day!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem - Has Everything You Could Possibly Need, No Resort Fees!!!”
Reviews.Author: Noholesbarred
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have vacationed in Las Vegas twice a year for the past 3 years now. This month we decided to stay at South Point (for 9 days) again. We stayed here last September and liked it so much, we decided to try it again. We love South Point. This must be one of the last casinos in Las Vegas that is not charging that dreaded "resort fee". We found a deal on Expedia and paid $35.00 per night which came out to just over $39.00 in total. There was no resort fee!!!! How can you beat that price. South Point has a state of the art bingo hall, huge bowling complex, large theatre, and a very inexpensive convenient store that is open 24 hrs/day. We saw Avatar (3D) in their theatre and sat in comfortable leather chairs that rocked. How can you beat that? We bowled after midnight at a cost of $1.00/game. We bought cheap beer and inexpensive California merlot for $4.50 at the convenience store that sells everything from nuts to bolts. We were hungry one night and purchased delicous sandwiches for $3.00/ea. When we checked in we received a fun book that included one free lunch buffet ($9.95). The buffet is not the best we have ever had; however, it was good enough that we ate there 7 out of the 9 days. There are three outdoor pools (one being a large hot tub with tons of jets). One of the pools is for children and the other larger pool for adults. There is a walk up bar just outside the large pool. The rooms are very clean and the beds are made up with white sheets and a white down type blanket which were replaced every day. The towels were soft and not rough to the touch. We have no complaints whatsoever. Give South Point your consideration next time and let us help support their not charging a resort fee!!!! The only ONE thing I would suggest, is that you rent a car because South Point is several miles from the strip. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: moose7496
Reviews.Content: for the price of this hotel it is an exceptional deal, the rooms are nicer than some hotels that are 200.00. yes it is off the strip but if you have a car this place is great. rooms are so nice and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: savedglory
Reviews.Content: South Point is by far my favorite hotel on the strip. It's secluded enough that all the Vegas "crazies" aren't usually filling up the casino or running up and down the halls in drunken stupors at 3am. The buffet is fantastic, they have a bowling alley and movie theatre, and we always win at their slots! Parking garage is fab, the place is safe, the rooms are HUGE (with big comfy beds, nice views, and beautiful flat-screen TVs), and they are always courteous. I'd recommend this place to any family, couple, individual, or business. It's always a great time at South Point.

Reviews.Title: “Smoky!”
Reviews.Author: luvblusky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights for Valentine's weekend. Booked directly through hotel website for $80 per night. However, once I got email confirmation saw that they re-priced room to $96 for 1st night and $64 for 2nd night. They charge your credit card for 1st night stay upon booking so you end up paying a higher deposit which is non-refundable if you cancel within 3 days or no show. We got there at about 4pm on Sat and check-in was a breeze. Walk from parking garage to room elevators is about average compared to other Vegas hotels. We got a non-smoking king on 14th floor with view of pool which was nice. Room was clean and large with good lay-out. Extra amenities were coffee maker, iron and safe. Internet is $12.95 per day. Bed was comfortable and pillows were fluffy. Towels are not as thin as some reviewers have commented and water pressure was decent. Can't comment on gambling as unable to tolerate the smoke at all. I know this is Vegas but smoke was especially noticeable here and surprising since this is a newer hotel. Thankfully, ventilation in room is excellent. Buffet was good value for the price but we've had better as far as quality and number of choices. Food at Coronado Cafe was better. Service in restaurants was efficient but not very personable. We liked that there this is a bowling alley and movie theater but not much nighttime entertainment for adults. Would recommend hotel to smokers and families. Would not recommend if you do not have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Poor front desk service”
Reviews.Author: KeandSh
Reviews.Content: Checked in late Saturday evening. When we got to our room and found that it hadn't been cleaned yet from the night before. We called the front desk and they said they would send a key for a different room. We ended up waiting in the hotel hallway for approximately 20 min. waiting for a key to a new room. The key was also supposed to work for the fitness center and it didnt. People at the front desk didnt seem to care about any of their mistakes. Movies (at their theaters), WIFI, and use of the fitness center at this hotel are grossly overpriced and make up for any money you might save on the room.

Reviews.Title: “a great value! (if you don't need to be on the strip)”
Reviews.Author: winebrat73
Reviews.Content: for the price, our room is GREAT! it is spacious and clean, if I'm being really picky - there is a leaky faucet and the towel rack is loose, but those things aren't that bothersome. We've eaten at a couple of the restaurants - the Garden Buffet offers a good breakfast, all the other food seems average, and the decor is tacky. - the Coronado Cafe has proven to have very nice food and so-so service. - there are a few more restaurants that we didn't try (spending most meals down at the strip). I've spent a lot of time in the poker room. there aren't that many people there most of the time (usually 2 or 3 tables going), but most of the folks there are locals and it feels pretty comfortable to play there (although the fact that they're local means they play a lot & I lost a buck or two to them). we are here for a conference & there is a free shuttle to the strip - if that wasn't the case I imagine the price of the taxis would be significant. so take that into consideration before you go.

Reviews.Title: “$2.49 breakfast. $2.50 coffee”
Reviews.Author: mvdljca
Reviews.Content: I stayed at South Point for three nights over President's Day weekend in February -- including Sunday, Valentine's Day. In spite of its 26 or stories, South Point squats low about five miles south of Las Vegas -- assuming you're talking about the Las Vegas Strip most people come to visit, the south end of which is Mandalay Bay. If you have a car, that's no problem. Just understand, a jackrabbit would have to pack his lunch to walk to the Strip. And cab fare would kill you. South Point is too new to be run down. They keep the brass polished and the carpets vacuumed, but it feels a little downscale, nevertheless. OK, you want Bellagio, go PAY for Bellagio. At a Benjamin-or-so-a-night on a holiday weekend, it was a very good value. The room was large, the bed comfortable and the bathroom nicely appointed. Except for the towels. I did not want to dry myself with these towels. I did not want to put these towels on the floor to walk on. These towels appear to have been bought second-hand from the Bow and Arrow motel on the outskirts of downtown. You certainly wouldn't want to inspect them under UV light. The stacks of plump, soft, clean, white, absorbent towels folded just-so that live in my hotel dreams were nowhere in sight. What is WITH these towels? I live in Southern California, where there's no smoking, period. They've even squelched it on the beach. The smell of cigarette smoke in South Point would gag a maggot on a gut wagon, but this is Vegas and get over it. The restaurants are pleasant, the food well-prepared, waitstaff attendant, and there was a respectable bottle of Kendall Jackson Pino Noir to be enjoyed for $20. If you stay here, eat here. I can't comment on the hotel service, since I'm low maintainence and rarely ask anybody for anything when travellng. I'm an early-bird-gets-the-worm guy, and when I went down to the cafe for breakfast at 5:30 one morning, I ordered a cup of coffee and the $2.49 cabdriver special (eggs, hash browns, sausage, toast). When the check came, it was $4.99 plus tax. The coffee was $2.50 -- more than the breakfast. Gotcha! That's some weird level of cheap. But the real cheap stunt was at check-in. I had booked online through Expedia and when I arrived, I requested (I was very clear about this) a north-facing room with a view of the Strip near an elevator. The desk clerk said it would be a $10-a-night upgrade, so I bought in. But when I got to the room (23rd floor) it faced south, with a breathtaking view of northbound traffic on the I-15. When I called the front desk to inform them of their error, they said no, the NORTH facing view was an extra $20 (on top of the $10). I passed, since I refuse to be victim of a petty fleece. Besides, the strip so far away, there was no view of it, anyway. I had read in earlier reviews that the walk from the parking structure to your room makes the Bataan Death March seem like a stroll in the park. I found a space reasonably close to the elevators in the parking structure and decided to step it off. I counted 136 paces from my car to the elevator, and -- get this -- 367 paces from where I stepped off the elevator in the casino to the door of my room. That's roughly five city blocks, most of it past obese, elderly women sitting at penny slot machines and sucking on cigarettes. But, like I said, you want Bellagio, go PAY for Bellagio. Hey, Vegas is Vegas, warts and all. If you don't like it, don't go. But there's a disturbing mystery behind a hotel with clean, spacious rooms, reasonably good food and sparkling brass that hangs grease rags in the bathroom and calls them towels. What is WITH those towels?

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain”
Reviews.Author: MLJohnson
Reviews.Content: Very large hotel with free parking. It does not have complimentary wifi or free fitness center. It does have several food choices on location. The Garden Buffet was plentiful, but the food was marginal. The Coronado restaurant was better. When you walk into the casino/hotel the smoke odor is very thick. The rooms are very large and comfortable with flat screen tv. However, we had problems with the remote which was old. We got a great rate on this hotel and in addition received a coupon book with other discounts. The hotel is not near the strip so you do need a car. All in all it was a good bargain because of the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, an excellent place”
Reviews.Author: Richie
Reviews.Content: Stayed next door at the Grandview for Superbowl weekend and a mini-military reunion. Southpoint is right next door and is a great spot. Also, the only casino within walking distance. Think of the Orleans. This place was originally designed to be her sister property and is identical in layout. The sportsbook is all you would want, with individual TV's at every table. Well staffed, no waiting. $.75 hot dogs right there. The Del Mar Deli, also next to the sports book, is as good as, or better, than any I've been to in NYC or L.A. The "coffee" shop has anything you can think of, even a chinese menu, 24/7. And the prices are very reasonable. 1 small negative. Southpoint better figure out that there are $5 blackjack players out there. Sorry, one $5 table in the whole place doesn't cut it. Overall, don't see how anyone could knock this place. RP California

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: gembama
