Reviews.Content: I love staying at South Point. Everything is clean, the people that work there are always cheerful and very helpful. It is a ways out, but it has everything you would want to do. They have a great casino, spa, movie theater, bingo room pools and more.

Reviews.Title: “spacious , bright, shiney, and a value”
Reviews.Author: explorerUSA
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we stayed here, Its close to the strip, and with a car, eliminates much of the traffic nightmare. The rooms are large (500 sq feet), the casino is large, everything is clean . Getting around is simple, not having the foot traffic from the strip. The buffet is lower priced than most, and surprisingly better than most. there are some new shopping centers just blocks away with groceries, starbucks, etc. The strip was a short ride, it was always a pleasure to get back to South Point. Getting out of town is so simple.Overall relaxing and self contained.

Reviews.Title: “The Best In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Lauraellis
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at South Point every year since it opened. The hotel is immaculate, the rooms are large and very clean and the staff is wonderful. Lots of places to eat including our favorite "Don Vitos" and the Buffet is great. No traffic jam to get into the hotel with lots of parking always available. Close to the Outlet Shopping Mall. We rent a car, so getting to the "strip" hotels is a breeze. We are returning this April for another weeks stay and can't wait to get "home" to South Point.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Off the Strip choice!!”
Reviews.Author: ageict
Reviews.Content: The main issue I see with a lot of reviews of this property is its distance from the strip. I actually consider this an advantage, especially for a business trip like mine was. I like the strip, but have been there many times and like the lower stress of being off strip for parking, etc. I was in town for business away from the strip and had a rental car so the distance was no issue (and with easy access to I-15 you can get to the strip pretty quickly if you want to go up there!). Service was top notch, quick check in, quick response to any requests I had, and great service from the valet parking every day. Didn't eat there much, but food at Coronado was solid for the price. I found the casino (table games) personnel to be very friendly. Room was very nice, bed a little soft, but not a big deal. HIghly recommend, I will stay here again on my next business trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “We're coming back”
Reviews.Author: bigdaddy1313
Reviews.Content: We've stayed twice at your hotel during our visits with our son, who lives in Las Vegas, and we've enjoyed the property immensely -- from the sports book, to the casino, to the restaurants, to the rooms. We'll spend a few days at our son's home in March. But we'll wrap up our trip with a couple of nights at South Point because we've found it to be one of the most comfortable and accommodating hotels on or off the strip. And, c'mon, who needs mom and dad hanging around the house for more than a few days anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for Business”
Reviews.Author: PHXTrainer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights with a group and ended up having to book an extra night due to airline cancellations. The rooms are large, clean and comfortable. The price was OUTSTANDING. ~$45/night during the week. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We ate at almost all of the restaurants and I was AMAZED at the food. I say this because as a business traveller I have learned that hotel food is usually over priced and marginal. The prices were exceptional and the food was very very good. The italian place I was extremely surprised at. Usually hotel Italian is along the lines of Olive Garden, bland and mushy. Don Vitos was spicy, flavorful and CHEAP. The casino is decent, the poker room is full of locals and they have a theater and bowling alley. The only thing I disliked was after four days my throat hurt from the cigarette smoke, but all casinos have that issue since no one has the guts to go smoke free in a casino. The smoke permeates the property eventually even with the best HVAC and filter systems. The property is WAAAAY off the strip but since it was business I didnt mind as I was awake for my meetings for a change. They must have brought the shuttle back since it picked me up, but it didnt run early enough to take me to my early morning flight. A cab ran about $40. Stay here for an easy comfy place off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “No Shuttle! Big Bucks for Taxis!”
Reviews.Author: ItsVegas2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the South Point this past weekend on the recommendation of family who had stayed there before. We were told there was a shuttle to/from the strip so we were pleased with the hotel rate and accommodations. Only after we arrived did we find out that there was no longer a shuttle (for economic reasons!), and our travel options were the bus or taxi. We spent almost $150 on taxis ($25 each way), to/from the hotel for 3 days we NEVER planned on spending. This hotel is now (due to lack of transportation), NO BARGAIN compared to other hotels much closer to the strip. Any money you save on the room is now wasted on the inconvenience of the bus or on taxis. We will NEVER stay there again! Don't recommend this place to friends! Made our trip so much more expensive than we ever planned on!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Asiunka
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to break the drive from Los Angeles to Utah. We got a fantastic deal through Travelzoo.com and decided to give this place a chance. The hotel is brand new with the rooms very large and clean. The beds were very comfortable and each room came with a large flat screen tv. The bathroom had Bath and Body Works toiletries. The pool area is very nice with pools and a jacuzzi. There is no free wireless, though and the fitness center is also not free. The casino is like other casinos in Vegas. There is a movie theater and bowling alley in the hotel. It is about 5 miles from the Strip so if you have a car, I would recommend this place immensely. There is no Resort Fee which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: ReineH
Reviews.Content: We would love to go back and stay longer at the South Point - there was a lot to do there for kids and the swimming pool was awesome! Movie theater, bowling alley, arcade, etc.

Reviews.Title: “This is now my favorite casino!”
Reviews.Author: GamblinGrandmaNC
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to stay at South Point just two nights, then move on to a Boyd property for the next three. I wound up staying all five nights at South Point. I love everything about this resort - the variety of restaurants, the movies, horse racing and really great video poker. I could also have gone bowling, played bingo and wagered on various sports. There happened to be a gymnastics tournament going on, and I was able to watch that - how fun! It is such a treat to have so many options at one property. And be sure to have the $12.95 complete prime rib dinner (served 24 hours - I had it for breakfast one day in addition to two evenings) at the Coronado Cafe. They could use a little "spit and polish" on the machines to keep them clean and shiny. Other than that, I 'd like to move in!

Reviews.Title: “Rodeo!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dave B
Reviews.Content: Great Place, good whiskey, nice rooms, nice arena for horses/ Need I say more

Reviews.Title: “South Point - Great value”
Reviews.Author: captbill10
Reviews.Content: Very Clean, great food, small casino. Off the strip makes it a great spot if going to other attractions in the area.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amninder
Reviews.Content: i loved this hotel and insist u all to stay there. i am sure u will love the service

Reviews.Title: “I love this place.”
Reviews.Author: smokeyj
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nites on a promotion as a former guest. We had a car, used valet parking several times, used the bell dest to deliver and pickup luggage, Service was polite, prompt and professional. Front desk check in and out flawless. Great prime rib restaurant. Room very large and location requests accomodated (wanted city view near elevator. Casino offers lots of choices. Comped at bar when playing video poker. Coffee in room. Very happy. You probably need a car but getting about on I - 15 is easy from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for the Room”
Reviews.Author: chimmoi
Reviews.Content: Spacious room, large bath with marble tiles. Sink is separate from shower tub & toilet makes it convenient for family of 4. Room was very clean. This hotel does NOT charge the extra "Resort Fee" that other hotels in Vegas do - a big plus ! Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you have a car.”
Reviews.Author: Crabcakeahoy
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here over New Year. When I booked I didn't realise it was so far from the main strip, we didn't hire a car so we had to take two buses to get to the strip. The hotel used to run a shuttle bus to Mandalay Bay but no longer does so which is a shame. The hotel itself was good, the rooms were spacious and clean. However the hotel could do with better restaurants. And the casino was nicer than many on the strip. The time we wasted on the bus versus what we saved staying there didn't quite balance out for us. If you are not planning on going to the strip alot or you have hired a car I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good but can be better!”
Reviews.Author: AhmedFN
Reviews.Content: New property, spacious and clean rooms. Not enough transparency on what is included and not included, e.g. breakfast and internet. The walk to the rooms and to the parking was herrendous, especially if with luggage and no bellboy offering help. The food in the buffet was at best average and not up to the level of the hotel. It is on Las Vegas BLVD, but a good 5 miles drive to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: azuplink
Reviews.Content: I arrived at South Point about 2 hours before check-in time. It took me about 1 minute to get checked into my room which was large, clean and comfortable. The room had a wide screen LCD TV and a king size bed with a decent mattress. The casino was fun with multiple low-limit pai-gow poker tables, just right for this low-roller. I wish there had been free wi-fi, but charging seems to be the norm in Las Vegas. The food in the restaurant was fine and plentiful. Overall I had a great time and wish I could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Place to be”
Reviews.Author: Royalan
Reviews.Content: South Point is a great hotel. It is off the strip but it has a great casino and night club. It is right down the street from Stoney's night club as well. I've been here many times and have enjoyed each stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Priced Rooms”
Reviews.Author: leizy1
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas for Christmas and visited family. We opted to stay at South Point due to pricing (we got a 50% off postcard, so we paid about $140 for 3 nights in a deluxe room about 500 SF). The Hotel is newer so you didn't see anything run down. It has a TON of parking as you come upon the Hotel/Casino. Check in was a breeze, but busy. If you park in the parking structure, it is a long walk from there to your room. If the Hotel would of had a quick way to get from the parking structure to the hotel rooms, I'd probably give it 5 stars. We went to our room and at night they do have security checking for room cards. The room was big and clean. Bedroom was nice sized and not crowded for 3 people. We had a king size bed with a sofa. Bathroom had a coffee maker & Bath & Body Works travel sized items. They seemed to be stingy on the towels, so we had to request more towels. We had a view of the pool, but we only saw 1 person in the pool (in december?)The room was a standard room, no fridge, no microwave. It did have access to the internet if you wanted to pay $12.99 a day, which we did. When you go down stairs from your room, you can either swing a left and go up the stairs for the movie theater, bowling and bingo or you go straight out to the casino or restaurants. The bowling area was busy! We only had the buffet, but were not disappointed in it. Overall, the place is clean and comfy. Just a long walk for hauling luggage through the hotel/casino floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you don't want to go to the strip”
Reviews.Author: missywiener
Reviews.Content: I stayed at South Point last year and it was fine for what we payed. For a budget price, you get a clean room in a clean hotel and casino. The bartenders are friendly and polite and the place has a very pleasant atmosphere. Whenever I have called with questions, the staff has been very helpful. The restaurants are not great but won't make you sick either. However, I do not see myself staying here in the future as they have canceled their free tram service to Mandalay Bay. The only way to access the strip now is by taxi or bus maybe, and I'd rather stay at the Flamingo for a similar price and not have to pay extra on cab fare to walk the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and overall stay”
Reviews.Author: mbtran321
Reviews.Content: Stayed there Friday night to Sunday afternoon. Lots of amenities that you can do in the hotel, kids arcade/bingo/bowling/movie theatre etc. see website. stayed in room with 2 queen beds. clean and soft , everythign was cleaned and turned over every day. Tables were lowest 1 dollar 5 dollar and up etc. the after midnight meals are cheap and great. overall great deal. only thing is that its away from strip and main levas. no problem if have a car rental. for the price and everything great. If you do have a car no problem. If you want to stay in the main hussle and bussle of vegas then this place is not it. Overall great place, clean, overal good environment indoors for all occasions etc

Reviews.Title: “It don't get much better than this!”
Reviews.Author: jackprice
Reviews.Content: Friendly bartenders & waitresses, Possibly the best Video Poker in town, pleasant staff, great race & sports book, better than average buffet, quiet sleeping quarters, cheap late night breakfast. What else could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!! Great Value!!”
Reviews.Author: Iphone12_34QWEC
Reviews.Content: This is a incredible hotel at a great value. It may not be on the strip but after a couple days of staying here you will not mind. For the price of three days at South Point it would cost you one night at a place like the Wynn. You save an incredible amount of money by staying here. The rooms are clean and a good size. The staff are friendly and attentive. This is not a party hotel, but more a family friendly environment. There is bingo, movies, cheap buffets, televisions, bowling. Don't wast money at the expensive hotels. This hotel will save you a ton of money. Don't expect four star dining or food, but it's great for a quick bite and then going somewhere else for dinner. Don't waste money stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time at the South Point”
Reviews.Author: Lucywestie
Reviews.Content: Just back [literally returned two hours ago] after spending a very pleasant week over Christmas at the South Point. Arrived at midday on the 22nd Dec and check in took about 2 minutes. Got upgraded to a high floor King size room from the Double Queen I had initially booked. Stated we would pay but the chap said there was no charge. Had room 1969 which is the 19th floor and sort of looks NW out of Vegas. Nice view of the mountains etc. Room was clean, comfortable and met all our needs. My wife especially likes the Bath and Body Works products. Maid service was very efficient and the room was always clean and bed made up etc. We did all our gambling at the hotel, video poker and slots and found that our money lasted a long time. Hit some bigger wins on the penny slots which enabled us to play longer though we came equipped with cash anyway! Fantastic bar service and excellent cocktail waitress service on the floor when gambling, never had to wait long and they were fast and efficient, ok, have to say, the outfits waitresses wear are pretty awesome, my wife allowed me to stare if I wanted as we were on holiday! Dont know how they can wear that at 6 in the morning though!! Ate in nearly all the restaurants except for Don Vitos. Loved Primarily Prime Rib though I didnt realise they had a set christmas menu, still, had the prime rib and it was huge and delicious. Only place we werent enthused with was the Silverado, thought that the service was a bit rushed [trying to get us out of there, collecting plates while we were still eating] and was a bit over priced for what was really just an average steak. Still, if this was the worst meal of the trip then it was still a good bad meal! Yes the South Point is a fair distance from the strip but we had rented a car and the drive in and out of the city was a breeze. Lots of places to eat and shop near to the hotel and lots of parking that is easy to access from the hotel. We have already said we will return and stay on our next trip to LV, just cant beat the service and quality. If you want more indepth reviews read my postings under my screen name and you will see that I am not a first timer posting on these boards Love ya South Point! You made for a great Christmas, just wish we had the holiday time to stay for New Years!

Reviews.Title: “A Stopped Toilet Plust VERY STINGY Slots Ruin the Fun”
Reviews.Author: Socalreporter
Reviews.Content: If you want a comfortable hotel just off the freeway 5 miles from the strip, this is a decent place to start. Unfortunately, my trip was not what I hoped when I discovered the VERY STINGY payoffs for video poker and woke up to a nonfunctioning toilet on the first day of my stay. FWIW, the water pressure in the shower is also pretty weak. I was trying to be optimistic because the rooms are particularly large and clean if you don't look too closely. The carpet in the hallways is lumpy and stained in places, and there seemed to be some crusty substance on the decorative quilt on the bed. The bathroom seemed very clean. When I contacted the front desk about the problem with the toilet in my room, they said they'd send engineering up. I guess I was to use a public toilet in the meantime, especially not knowing how long it would take for engineering to show up. I politely requested compensation, and the front desk rep offered me two buffets with a rather unfriendly look on her face. I thanked her and said it was quite an inconvenience to be in a room with a broken toilet. I didn't notice the coupons were for breakfast, which we wouldn't be able to use, so I had to go back and request lunch, standing around for another few minutes while another front desk rep retrieved lunch buffet coupons. I ate in the Coronado Cafe, and the service was very friendly and fairly efficient. The food was cooked as I asked, but bland and unimpressive. The selection for casual dining is small, and I would have appreciated a bigger selection for the teenagers I was traveling with. I'm still at South Point Hotel as I write this, and I'm quite sure I won't be back. Hopefully, there won't be another problem with the toilet. It adds a nice touch to the vacation to have to be thinking about that.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, large rooms, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jbg7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a wonderful 6 day break in LV. We split our stay between the Golden Nugget and the SP. We spent 3 nights at the SP Hotel. The distance the SP was from the main strip area didn't put us off because we had a rental car to get around in. If anything we preferred being away from the hustle and bustle of the strip and enjoyed returning to the quiet and relaxed atmosphere of the SP. We found the reception staff to be friendly and accomodating. The waitresses in the casino were entertaining too. The room was big and spacious with a large comfortable king size bed. The SP had everything you needed, a bowling alley, cinema, sports arena and numerous eating places. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants but did eat at the Del Mar Deli. The pizza was huge and was covered with cheese. My wife and I failed to finish it. The ice cream parlour was good but we encountered a rather grumpy and unhelpful attendant on one occasion we went there. The coffee shop next to it was great and we were warmly greeted each morning by the staff members due to our request for 2 triple shot lattes! We used the gym whilst there. Theres a $15.00 entry fee and is accessible 24hrs. It's well equiped with weight machines and cardio machines. The jacuzzi next to the main pool was nice after a good work out. We didn't use the spa facilities but these also looked good. The main strip is only 10 minutes if you self drive. I'm not sure if there is a shuttle service provided by the SP or what the public transport is like. If you don't mind the distance the SP is from the main strip area then I would thoroughly recommend the SP.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulobster
Reviews.Content: The South Point is a wonderful hotel with comfortable rooms, a highly professional staff and a wide assortment of activities other than gaming- although their gaming selection is good as well. The rooms are spacious with attentive housekeeping and nice amenities. I like the single serve coffee maker that provides a freshly brewed cup whenever you want one. Where other properties seem to be cutting back in the down economy, The South Point continues to provide a great experience. I especially liked the promotion that provided a 50% discount to the restaurants if you paid with points. We had a great breakfast for two for under $10 total after the discount.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Bang for the buck!”
Reviews.Author: SandraleeDallas
Reviews.Content: Big rooms, great food, bowling alley and a spa, plus a rodeo arena and even a movie theater! And as a smoker, I appreciated the accommodation. We were there with 8 friends for the National Finals Rodeo, and shuttle service to Mack center was free. Only major drawback: absolutely NO humidity! No hotel in Vegas should ever be so dry that one has to let the shower run for a half hour just to be able to breathe. We all came home with colds and sinus problems requiring doctor's visits.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: rkselbs
Reviews.Content: South Point was a pretty sweet place to stay, with a movie theater, casino, and equestrian center wrapped into one.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: jasonj24680
Reviews.Content: Well I'd like to start off by thinking the staff for the early check in. I must say a complementary upgraded room would have been nice. However, their normal rooms are just fine. We had great service throughout are stay. From the valet, to the bellhop, and to the servers at the Coranado Cafe, everything was great. We always stay here when were in Vegas. While it is 10 minutes from the strip, everything you need is here. The strip is just a mess with the terrible traffic. I even saw Floyd Mayweather while playing some blackjack in their great casino. We hope to be coming back in December. They could however drop the need to charge $15 a night to use internet.

Reviews.Title: “Just what the doctor ordered.”
Reviews.Author: MUTiger1997
Reviews.Content: First of all, it always confuses me when people downgrade a property for something they could have easily researched. The South Point is frequently criticized for being so far from the Strip. I think that was the point, and as far as I'm concerned it's a strength, not a weakness. During my latest trip I took an early morning drive down the Strip. No thank you. For my taste, SP is both a perfect size and distance from the action. With a rental nothing is more than 10-15 minutes away anyway. I also would prefer there were no charges for the Internet and exercise room, but the fact is that is the norm in LV. I don't know of any property that offers complimentary Internet and gym access. Criticizing the SP for something everyone else does doesn't make sense to me. So we what it doesn't have, how about what it can offer. For my money, what little of it I need to spend to stay at SP, there is no better property in all of Vegas. During a recent stay I paid all of $100 for a 3- night stay. For that very reasonable price I got to stay in a large, clean room that would put to shame many room from higher-end hotels. The casino is a perfect size as well. Big enough to offer a variety of games, but not so large it had different zip codes. During my visit I had two fantastic meals - one at Primarily Prime Rib and the other at Silverado (there pretzel bread is the absolute best). Having stayed at SP before, but not having tried the buffet, I also decided to give it a whirl. It was satisfactory. I have nothing to either overly complain or compliment. In leading up to my recent trip I had a hard time deciding where to stay. I'm happy I chose the SP, and would happily do so again. Very happily.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap No NHL”
Reviews.Author: jdjfkdlwlefwjefwkef
Reviews.Content: Cheap rooms bad sports book! You will never see an NHL Hockey game played in this sports book.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, beds and pools especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: Roadstarwarrior
Reviews.Content: I have stayed her multiple times and for $25 a night you can't go wrong. Pros: The rooms and bathrooms are large, nice and look brand new. The roomservice is fast and friendly but a little pricey for what you get but where isn't that the case. The restaurant food is good. Pools are awesome. Some of my local friends always come her just for the pools. The gym is nice. Check-in is always a breeze. Cons: Off the beaten path. If you don't have your own transportation I would not recommend staying here. The casino floor sometimes smells realy smokie which is irritating. I would expect ventilation to be better. The gym is an addition fee. Overall I think the rooms, faculty and facilities are great. I choose this place because it's the best bang for the buck. Things you should know. I don't come to gamble

Reviews.Title: “A couple changes and this place will be perfect”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Toronto_ON
Reviews.Content: Very simple...Great quiet hotel and casino.... Prices are reasonable, rooms are nice and the staff is great... Two changes required: 1) Free shuttle to the strip 2) Free Wi-Fi Those two things happen in the future, and I will book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Treated very well”
Reviews.Author: OzymandiasHoustion
Reviews.Content: Even though I can get comped rooms in many places along the strip, this place has become my stay of choice in Vegas. It is rather laid back with excellent restaurants at reasonable prices. The Cioppino in the Italian restaurant is my favorite.The normal room is quite spacious, well cared for and leaves me totally satisfied. Unfortunately, my gambling has not been too successful there, but they do give you a good play for your money with a decent blackjack game, decent video poker and a good players club. The location is such that I always rent a car when I stay there, but I use it very little since I enjoy the hotel so much. My wife and I are looking forward to being back between Christmas and New Years again this year. I was pleasently surprised when I checked in last trip to see that I had been comped upfront without having even spoken with a host. This tells me that the management has something on the ball, to check their bookings so that they were aware that someone who likes to play is coming. I am not a huge player, but they still act like they appreciate my patronage.

Reviews.Title: “You take the good, you take the bad, you take them both and there you have”
Reviews.Author: JakeMcKay
Reviews.Content: This is an interesting property to review. The real estate is very nice. The rooms are large and comfortable. The housekeeping staff does an excellent job. The restaurants are nice. The food is good and the prices are very reasonable. I have been to many hotels that are not remotely as nice as this one. If you are looking for a place to gamble, sleep and eat this is a great choice. Overall the employees are well trained. I'm guessing that this resort has a very well thought out training curriculum that is focused on roles and responsibilities. The training could be improved by focusing more on customer satisfaction. I felt like I had my role and the employees had theirs and that rules were rules. If you want to have a drink at South Point you have two alternatives. You can sit on the casino floor which I do not find relaxing or you can go upstairs and listen to a bunch of televisions in the Mexican bar. I recognize that the owner of South Point is not pursuing the Hip Hop demographic but a simple club would help. If that is not possible it would be a significant selling point if the resort provided a shuttle to the strip. Even if there was a charge for a 24 hour pass to go back and forth it would be preferable to being completely isolated and dependent upon taxi cabs. It will cost you $25 plus tip each way if you want to go "down town". Sixty dollars to go dancing or to the mall is outrageous and will keep me from staying at South Point in the future. This place has great potential. I think with some small tweaks it could be GREAT.

Reviews.Title: “Swell 2nd Trip”
Reviews.Author: sunshadows
Reviews.Content: Stayed during PBR finals. Soaked up the sun by the jaccuzzi (pool area is beautiful/clean, but not as 'perfect' as our first visit). Never more than a handfull of people outside and we had the whole place to ourselves one evening. No free shuttle to the strip anymore, but valet told us of hourly, reasonable shuttle to Excaliber from timeshare facility right next door. Airport shuttle is still free. Comped the shuttle to Thomas and Mack, but had to ask the manager (desk clerks insisted on $20 per person). We will rent a car next time, but I really don't feel a need to leave South Point. Food was excellent both at the buffet and cafe. Very inexpensive, too. Use their fun book coupons for free meals, wine, etc. Great room, linens and lotions and their housekeeping is just spotless! More of the bull riding events were held right at South Point our first trip. Probably would have enjoyed some 'country' entertainer in the show room, but had no desire to see Vicki Lawrence (!) Their big equestrian facility stood empty all weekend. With all the cattle/horse crowd on hand, that could have been utilized. They are having more events there during the NFR. Every Vegas hotel is trying to keep everyone in the casino for as long as possible. Speedy, free cocktails while gambling and a good selection of games, although no big winnings for us, decent odds.

Reviews.Title: “Overall wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: jb2186
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Las Vegas for a business meeting which was being held at the South Point. The Rooms were great...very large...and the bathroom was huge and well laid out with seperate vanity/sink area. Nice for one of us to be showering, and one to still be getting ready. HUGE Plasma TV, and a great view of the strip. Check in and out was so quick and easy, and the staff was very friendly. Would like to see a refrigerator, and possibly even a microwave in the room...however, the staff did bring me a refrigerator for my medication when requested. Seeing how we were here on business, Internet was a must, and it was a bit of a pain to get that going. So many motels/hotels have free Wi Fi, I think that would be a great addition since you have such a wonderful conference center. Overall, a great experience, we'll be back. Oh, bring your own pillow...had to go out and buy my own!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Jiddodon
Reviews.Content: What started out to be a liability in location is now a hugh plus. All the traffic on the strip has made it very uncomfortable to walk. Just too many people! South Points location is quiet and really not that far out anymore. The hotels prices are well in line and the people there make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Increased price after booking”
Reviews.Author: Matchless22
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 rooms for 5 days for the motorcycle auction last January. I had an aggreed price but they charged an extra $40 for 2 of the days for all 3 rooms. I complained and even wrote a letter to them after my return to the UK wich they never even replyed to. I woud never stay there again, there is plenty of choice and i do not know how they stay in business

Reviews.Title: “Supurb Choise”
Reviews.Author: gateshead1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in South Point for 3 nights after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. We were so pleased with the hotel. This hotel is a medium sized hotel a short taxi drive from the strip. I had hired a car as we had travelled from LA - so we parked in the hotel car park for free and could easily drive to the strip and you can park in any of the large hotels on the strip for free. Room was very clean, large and comfortable. The hotel spa was good - very relaxing and the choice of places to eat in the hotel was also good. THere is a buffet - all you can eat, which was very good and very reasonably proced. There is another reasonably priced resturant, and 2 more expensive dining rooms. The casino was smoky but no worse than all the casinos on the strip. We paid £65 per night and felt that this hotel was excellent value for money and to be honest when travelling around dont think there is a better alternative unless you want to stay in one of the big hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SummerGirl914
Reviews.Content: The good thing about this hotel, it did not have the Strip prices. This was my 3rd trip to Vegas, and someone booked off the strip at South Point. The rooms were beautiful (no view though), and there was a lot to do at the hotel, movies, bowling, gambling etc). It was a $30.00 cab ride one way to the strip, and we were on the strip every day, so that was my only complaint!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed over all”
Reviews.Author: lrobin622
Reviews.Content: Stayed there a couple of nights in August. Checked in early and went to the pool, too bad Las Vegas was having a wind storm. Didnt stay long at the pool, went to dinner at the Mexican place, not bad. I think the coolest thing was the Friday night happy hour from 5-10. The place was packed, sat withsome great locals and geat time. Next day the wind died down was able to relax at pool, I will say that the pool is not heated so beware when jumping in. If you are looking for lots of young woman this not for you. Lots of familes with young ones. Alll and all this place is great vaule if you dont mind being a way from the strip. I just needed some R&R so it worked out for me.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: dcbbqsr
Reviews.Content: I visited this property last January and had an outstanding experience. I just spent 6 days at this Hotel and was surprised to see a difference in a short time. On first visit we did not notice a smoking problem in the casino. This time the smoke was so bad we did not go to the casino at all. The rooms both times were excellent and the service in the restuarants was good. If you don't mind an off strip Hotel it is OK. If you have issues with smoking, you might consider another location.

Reviews.Title: “South Point is Awsome”
Reviews.Author: snuffy1946
Reviews.Content: My husband & I love the Oster Bar the waiters are so kind and make you feel special. The food is the best in town, there is one particular waiter his name is James that will bend over backwards to make your meal and dining experience special ,so kind and polite we have told all are friends and family about the Oster bar at South Point and always take our guest when in town never ever had a bad experience there, everyone there is great, so if you like seafood its the best, all the resturants are great also have eaten at all of them, the bartenders are professionals always kind and make you feel welcome, my husband and I give the staff, food, over all casino a 10 fun place to have a great time and dine.

Reviews.Title: “Too Smokey”
Reviews.Author: Tippet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Southpoint Hotel from October 22nd through the 24th on the advice of friends. This hotel is very similiar to The Orleans Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas where we have previously stayed. We wish we had gone back to the Orleans as the Southpoint Hotel and Casino had a VERY noticable smell of smoke from cigaretts throughout the facility. Many guests were smoking right in front of signs in the elevators and elsewhere that said "No Smoking". One wonders if thier HVAC systems were working properly or if they even try to enforce the "non-smoking" areas. The room rate jumped from $70 per night during the week to $129 for the week-end which we found to be high for Vegas especially considering todays economy. The smell of smoke really affected our stay in a negative way. Other Casinos in Vegas are able to clense the air better than the Southpoint.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Jac288
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of the ratings on Tripadvisor. We've stayed at fancier hotels on the strip and was a bit nervous about being off the strip and at such a low price. But we had a ok stay and everything was fine until we were locked out twice from our room because of error from front desk. They acknowledge their mistake but made no effort or apologize for their error. Overall it was a satisfactory stay. I'll go back only if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: bratdog
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and it was as nice or better than the rooms on the strip. We could have stayed at the hotel the entire time but decided to shop at the outlet mall and then hit some of the casinos at the north end. Then we went to Fremont St. on another day. The buffet was good. The cafe was hit or miss, the early, early (midnight) breakfast was good and cheap (hamburger was good also) but on another night it was cold like it was left over from breakfast and kept in the refrigerator! The slots were loose enough for us to keep playing while the slots at the other casinos just took our $$. We finally figured out the bus system and that was a plus since it picked us up at the hotel's valet parking -- $7 for an all day pass, $1.75 to go to the outlet mall. The shuttle to/from the airport was the best! If you take a taxi from the airport, be prepared to shell out $28 for just the fare!! The rooms and the casino was clean. We had a view of the mountains and it looked over the stable and arena. The pool looked very nice. It was nice to be off the strip, away from the crowds from the surrounding casinos. I'd definitely stay here again. We were fortunately to get one night free if you booked 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel With Super Low Rates”
Reviews.Author: chitown2bayarea
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights for $35 per night ($70 buy 1 night get 1 night free) through their reservations who matched the hotels.com rate. Tried to check in early but they were sold out the previous night so I had to wait a few hours until HK could clean a room. I had just driven 8 hours from Napa, CA overnight and was exhausted but I didn't care because I was happy to be in Vegas. So, I had some breakfast at the buffet which was not very impressing and checked into my room . I didn't get a view but the room was huge! Im not too sure but I think the lady that checked me in gave me an upgraded suite since that was the only 1 clean. After a 4 hour nap on a comfortable king size bed, I check out the casino which is conveniently designed and well staffed, consisting of mostly hot cocktail waitresses of mixed races and very few "over-the-hill" ones. Valet staff was excellent and the Asian girl that helped me was very personable and welcoming. Had some late night dinner and cheesecake from the cafe which made up for the buffet from earlier. Overall a very nice hotel with an awesome location (5 minutes from the strip) and awesome servce.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property............”
Reviews.Author: AnewMunsterfan
Reviews.Content: Rooms are bright and spacious.............mattresses on the hard side...........I need my sleep! Well appointed design and large bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Very good off-strip value”
Reviews.Author: msr015100
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights earlier this week, and before that did more than a few trade shows here, but this was my first trip to this casino as a pleasure traveler. I would rank the quality of the room I got in the new wing as somewhere around a Marriott or Hilton, though a little bit bigger. I got a smoking room so I could puff on my stogies while checking my email, but couldn't detect any tobacco smoke in it. The crowd at the casino itself was...interesting. Image a small-town Wal-Mart with people playing slot machines instead of shopping. The crowd itself was a little more energetic than at your average Station casino. The buffet was middling, it might impress someone who's used to eating at Golden Corral, but it didn't impress me. On the plus side, it had very quick and attentive staff, and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “SMOKEY”
Reviews.Author: JuneauGirlNevada
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice but the stench of smoke permeated the entire complex, even in the "non-smoking" rooms. Also $13 a day for internet access is ridiculous!!! Stayed 3 nights in October based on TA reviews.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE THE BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: plainguy
Reviews.Content: I was shacked up there by the airline due to the fact my flight was cancelled. It was excellent value for what it was (no Bellagio or Ceasars where I usually stay but good). They have nice big rooms with LCD TV's and the place seems relatively new. They have quite a nice a pool and when you think you can stay there for 50 bucks a night you can't go wrong! Food was good in the buffet but absolutely horrible in the 24 hour restaurant. I was surprised I didn't end up with food poisoning. Oh and its way off the strip so if you think you can stay here for cheap and taxi it to strip its not happening. Its a 28 dollar cab ride from the airport and its the opposite direction to the main strip. For the price of a daily rental car you might as well stay in the imperial palace or something. BUT TAKE MY ADVICE CHECK YOUR BED BEFORE YOU SLEEP IN IT (see internet for instruction on how to do this). I slept on the 6th floor for (no joke) not even 5 hours as my flight left in the morning and was BITTEN 20 TIMES; YES 20 TIMES!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: DrumValley
Reviews.Content: We stayed five days at South Point in September and really enjoyed the stay. The room was nice, beds were comfortable and we had a flat screen TV. We especially enjoyed the pools, which are a very nice size for liesurely swimming. We only ate at the buffet, but others spoke highly of the prime rib restaurant on the second floor. The actual casino seemed a little small for the size of the place. We drove to Vegas, and found the location great. South Point is just off the freeway and Las Vegas Blvd, making travel fairly easy. Overall this is a really good spot for people who don't need to be on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “This is Vegas, baby! Love this hotel..”
Reviews.Author: janstess29
Reviews.Content: This is the second time staying at the Southpoint Hotel/Casino/Spa. I was a limo driver in Vegas for 10 years, and I would much rather stay off of the Strip because you really do get more for your money. This is a real 4-Star Hotel. The food is very good, even in the buffet and I don't usually care for buffets. You will receive a coupon book upon arrival which is good for 2 for 1 buffet, and you even get a complimentary bottle of wine. The pool area is wonderful as well. My absolute favorite place to eat is Don Vito's..and you even get coupons for a free desert. There is so much to do right in the hotel, but if you must go to the Strip, it is only about 10 minutes away. Not that far. Enjoy, very nice place to stay..Upon arrival at the Airport, you might as well grab a Limo..Most of the companies offer them at a real fare price. The price that you are quoted will be for ONE HOUR, so you might as well have the driver give you a little tour before they drop you off..Don't forget to "Tip" your servers..Everyone is Vegas works for "Tips"..Bus drivers (tour and shuttle, even the bus that takes you to the car rental areas) Always leave a "tip" in the buffets too. You tip the door men, taxi drivers, what ever people that give you service of some sort. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: markmdavis
Reviews.Content: I love staying at the South Point Every one is so friendly and the rooms are great, I wont repaeat everything else that has already been said here, but I will add that even the T.P. is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “good basic economical hotel and conference center”
Reviews.Author: Frammie
Reviews.Content: This location was a good basic hotel and casino. It has some nice restaurants and basic amenities. It was convenient to the bus stop to go down to the strip. Rooms were nice and service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, not on the strip”
Reviews.Author: WXYandZ
Reviews.Content: The South Point is a fairly new hotel that offers incredible deals. It is a self-contained casino hotel approximately 10 - 15 minutes by car from the Las Vegas strip. The South Point has its own bowling alley, a 16-theater movie place (nice), casino, 8 restaurants, spa, beautiful pool facilities, barber shop, and more. We rented this hotel for the price and value, but had to rent a car to go to the action on the strip. I would recommend it as a place to stay if you plan on renting a car when visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: chardlu18
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a $28 cab ride to the strip but well worth it. Although I love the strip it's nice to be in a hotel that is quieter but still has all the amenities you would find on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value...esp if you have a car :)”
Reviews.Author: jilliannoelle
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice--check-in was a breeze. The rooms were really nice with updated modern bathroom. The toilet and shower are separate from the mirror and sinks, which makes getting ready easy among friends. Not close to the strip, so you need a car or a friend with a car to fully explore Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: winkiebum
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is Not on the Strip but is Clean, Comfortable and elegant. The rooms are oversized and have 46 Inch flat screen TV's. The beds are very comfortable and clean and look brand new. We had a great view of the desert skyline from the 10th floor. I would take this hotel over most overpriced "Strip" hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bargain in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: sricks1972
Reviews.Content: I am extremely picky about the hotel rooms I stay in. In my search for a reasonably priced hotel off the strip, I thought the bargain price I found for South Point must certainly be too good to be true. Our deluxe room was more than I hoped for--very clean and roomy, and well decorated too. Our beds were extremely comfy with fabulous linens. The service was good. We did have quite a long wait for the bellman to deliver our luggage, but when requesting extra coffee the next morning, it was there in a flash. For such a lovely room at such an incredible price, I highly recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal.”
Reviews.Author: jyoo
Reviews.Content: Even though the location is off from the main street, the hotel is full of positive things, such as better quality/price, very clean rooms, open and beautiful view, and etc. If you don't want to be in the middle of the main street, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Time”
Reviews.Author: NJtogo
Reviews.Content: Great place, stayed right next door. But had to go to south point to gamble. Won some cash and was treated like a high roller with only 200 in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal i got all holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Mancy_boy
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here just for one night as we flew in to Las Vegas before doing the drive down to L.A the next day so just wanted somewhere cheap to rest at before the long drive and this hotel was perfect in everyway. I have stayed at plenty of 4* hotels in the UK and for me this was better than the vast majority of them. As you should well know before booking this hotel it is out on it own at the south end of the strip and you will need a car or a reasonably hefty cab ride to get you up to where the action is however they do have regular shuttles running from the hotel that are free and really handy. The room was a good size, spotless and packed with everything you needed. The pool area was excellent with very attentive drinks staff. We were also passed a book on arrival complete with a voucher for casino free play, and a voucher that you can use to get the buffet for $10 each, i would highly reccomend the buffet and if im honest although it wasn't as glam as the Bellagio one when we stayed there the second week for some food choices i honestly thought the South Point was using better quality produce. Superb hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Past the airport, but worth the drive”
Reviews.Author: KED17
Reviews.Content: South Point was lovely. We stayed here after a vacation in Utah and Arizona and enjoyed it very much. It is a bit out of the way if you do not have a car, but well worth the trip if you do have a car. It's just off RT. 15, convenient to the airport, and quiet. The hotel is newer, our room was very large and very clean, the breakfast buffet is outstanding, and the whole experience was great. Room rates were low during the week. We are not gamblers so don't know how loose the slots are. There is an equestrian event hall where all sorts of shows are presented. They have a 64 lane bowling center and a large bingo hall.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay off strip, good price”
Reviews.Author: sd2travel
Reviews.Content: Comfortable Hotel off the strip. As others have mentioned, you will need a car. It's a $30 cab fare (as told from another guest who took a cab) each way to the strip.. there are no shuttles to the strip or any attractions. There is a free shuttle from the airport, however the shuttles don't start till 6:00am and we had to be to the airport before then, so that was inconvenient. Rooms are very large, thought the beds were very comfortable, the sheets were even soft & Pillows were OK too. Good nights rest. We were at the very end of a hall which is nice cuz we had no traffic by our room so it was quiet. Pool was OK, it gets full of splashing kids on the weekends which was a bit annoying to me, as I was trying to relax. Weekdays the pool was nice though & not crowded. The Garden Buffet was a great deal...coupon when you check in for 2 for 1 price on weekdays...and it was only $6.95 to begin with. The Buffet goes up to $13.95 on Sat/Sun. We thought the buffet was very good.. it had a very large selection of many different items.. honestly if you can't find something on there you like, maybe you are just to fussy. We thought it was very good. The Deli is a bit over priced, but it is Vegas. Movie Theater was good. Love the Happy Hour Marguarita special at Miguels Tequila Bar from 5-7 pm.. $2 marguaritas... can't beat it!! Wanted to try the other restaurants but never got around to it. The only problem we had is that at times our keys wouldn't work... We had 2 keys so usually one key would work, but not very convenient when you aren't together all the time. On several occasions one of us couldn't get in, because the key wouldnt work, so we had to call & wait for someone to come up to let us in.. or run all the way down to the desk & get a replacement. very annoying & inconvenient. All in all a good stay.. very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: aufan4ever
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent experience. The room was clean, nice size, the bed was comfortable, it was an A stay all the way. The casino is also wonderful and the buffet is wonderful, there is also a good sports bar. After searching, this is probably the best value out there! The only slight complaint is the distance from the strip and downtown but they have a shuttle that runs regularly. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just great!”
Reviews.Author: MaryMaryAZ
Reviews.Content: Every one of the positive reviews is right on. I thought the hotel was new because everything was spotless, bright and shiny. The room was large and beautiful with an outstanding accessible shower. We loved coffee in the rooms, and you can buy alcohol in the gift shop really saving money at the bar for drinks. They have every imaginable drink from Chambord to Champagne, and a wall of wines. We checked in Saturday night and have to admit it was jamming with kids from newborns to teens. Strollers everywhere. My husband refused to try the pool because there were so many kids in it. However, at noon Sunday they all went away. We found several slots that were a blast and gambled for about 12 hours having no concept of time. Most food was wonderful but did have tough, dry pancakes in the cafe Sunday afternoon. The night before I had the best prime rib in my life in the same cafe (for $12.95!!!), so no complaints. Their shows are affordable and terrific, aminities are great and all services were fast, friendly and efficient. We liked it so much here I don't think we'll ever stay on the strip again!

Reviews.Title: “Huge room...great views!”
Reviews.Author: GAndersGardens
Reviews.Content: Other than being off the strip, which does not turn me on, the place is fabulous. Never once was a food issue involved. Terrific bath ammenities. Very comfortable beds and a spacious pool. Good native habitat viewing poolside with friendly cocktail servers. Hallways got a bit dirty by the end of Saturday... My place to stay in Vegas along with the group I represent!

Reviews.Title: “Spazmatically Awesome 1st time @ South Point , (best bang for the buck so far)!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pink-n-Teased
Reviews.Content: It was a totally rad experience to be able to stay in the same hotel (South Point) as the Spazmatics were having their concert. The price was so affordable and they had all the perks of most of the expensive Las Vegas hotels. (We have visited many in the last 5 years) Our group of friends, (ages 35(?) to 46&1/2) meet in Las Vegas every year to see the Spazmatics! We dress the part... Yes, crazy colored and frizzy hairstyles, peg legged jeans or leggings with leg warmers, etc.etc.( there coming back in style ya know?) So freaking FUN! Everything we wanted to do was right in this casino, we ALL had a blast and we never left the hotel except to head to the mall and shop... Duh, we were a group of 5 women, that’s to be expected!!! We took Salsa lessons ate at all the diners and met some terrific people from all over (New Orleans too) who all seemed to be enjoying themselves, some way too much some were trying for more... Alan!! (Shameful). The rooms were large, beds were comfy, food was great and everything was very clean. The staff was pleasant and very helpful... Mostly Miss Long at the front desk! We will plan our annual vacations at the South Point from now on; we have even decided that for the price we might be able to hook up there twice a year.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT ALL-IN-ONE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: KSScubaDiver
Reviews.Content: This Hotel offers a little bit of everything and at a great price! My husband enjoys gambling and I just enjoy the relaxation of getting away from home. If we weren't attending a show on the "strip", we would have had no need to even leave the Hotel. This location offers gambling, a large sports book, many dining options, bowling, movie theatres, a beautiful pool area and spa. Highly recommend and this is a suitable place in Vegas to bring children.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - kinda smokey in the casino”
Reviews.Author: bbqbob99
Reviews.Content: We booked Southpoint based upon a book-a-night-get-one-night-free promo and gnenerally were happy with the facility. The maid service fell down only because the ice bucket was ignored during the room freshening and so had no plastic bag replaced. The room and bed were excellent - only possible thing I can fault was that there was no refrigerator. The casino always reeked of cigarette smoke - even at 09:00 when there were very few people in it. That's enough to keep us from booking it again - I find Texas Station to be much nicer. The blackjack tables during the week were always $5 and at least one was always a double-deck with few restrictions. Better by far than the center Strip casinos. We only ate once at the 24-hour coffee shop (Coronado) and were pleased with the service and food.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Awesome, Can You say Awesome?”
Reviews.Author: goatsrus
Reviews.Content: This was our third time visit to the South Point, and this time my husband and I took my friend. We are 40-years four times a year Vegas Visitors and we have found our new " home away from home" and will not stay anywhere else, We love the location right off the freeway without having to battle the traffic in town. This is a destination resort not for those who want to casino hop with the cars and crowds of the strip. . We got there on a Wednesday and I came down with a health problem that sent me to the hospital ER. The security and valet staff were over the top helpful directing us there. In fact, all of the employees everywhere were over the top nice and considerate.As usual the rooms were impeccable and the food everywhere was top notch. My husband enjoys the movies whilst my friend and I must have played every slot in the place! We had a blast and the cocktail servers are so sweet and rapid with the drinks its just awesome.We all slept so well as the rooms are the most quiet I have ever stayed in. One word on the negative side.. we had to extend our trip to include Friday night and boy oh boy could you see the demographic change before your eyes all day Friday. We are all over 50 and prefer a more subdued, well dressed older crowd but Friday the very young rowdies came in and were shouting bad words and insulting the cocktail servers and were dressed in all of their "costumes" is the only way I can put it and kinda made it seem trashy. So, my advice is if you want to party with rowdy young folks make sure to stay on a weekend but if you prefer an older classier crowd keep your stay to mid week. We shall be going back as soon as we can.. on a weekday.

Reviews.Title: “nice - need a car though, it's far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: achristie
Reviews.Content: Great bed - nice shampoo, conditioner, etc - flat screen tv - courteous staff. Price was unbeatable so a great value. Lots to do with bowling and movies as well as gambling. Pretty nice pool area. Food at 24 hour cafe was good, late night specials are a real deal. We were going to try the mexican restaurant, but it was closed on Monday and Tuesday. Only have a couple of complaints - casino seemed full of cigarette smoke all the time. View from our room was of the parking garage. This hotel is not a good choice if you don't have a car. It is too far to walk to any other casinos. Would stay here again - very pleased overall.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: aberdeen2009
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Las Vegas (during a stop-over to California) and we decided not to stay on the main strip. We stayed at the South Point Hotel for two days and were impressed with the room size (500 sq.ft), and the cleanliness. The hotel has several restaurants on site. We ate at two locations there and the food was delicious and prices were reasonable. Upon our return from California (we had another stop-over in Las Vegas) and returned to the South Point and spent an additional night there. We will definitely stay at the hotel again if and when we go back to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, blah food & decor”
Reviews.Author: kizern1
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights at the South Point last week with my boyfriend. It was my first time to Las Vegas and his fourth time, but we were there for free as he won a contest for free nights there by playing poker online. My first impressions were that I was a little disappointed that the hotel was so far away from the strip. I also found the lobby and casino part of the hotel were kind of blah. There wasn't too much to look at, unlike some of the hotel/casinos on the strip. The room, however, was very nice. It was spacious, with a very comfortable bed, new flat screen tv on the wall, and a roomy bathroom with a great shower. It was also kept very tidy and clean. The pool area was also extremely nice- there were even cocktail waitresses who brought around drinks to you in the pool or on your beach chair. We unfortunately found that the food at the hotel was nothing more than mediocre. The service was fine though. A few things I did not particularly like about the hotel were: -There was no refridgerator in the room- it would have been nice to keep some snacks or drinks cold. -There was a substantial charge to use the fitness facilities. I thought that was kind of tacky. I do like to use a gym when I travel, but I didn't want to spend $15 per day for that! But there were plenty of activities to keep one busy at the hotel, which was nice. There is a movie theater, a bowling alley, and an arcade for kids (and slots and table games for the adults of course). A friend of mine described this hotel as a "locals casino", which I would agree with. For someone from out of town looking for a typical "Vegas experience", I wouildn't recommend staying here. But if you are in Vegas for a conference or there with kids you'll have a great time. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Only played here, but will stay in the future - great clean place”
Reviews.Author: kctx01
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our yearly trip to Vegas and decided to venture off the strip this year to areas not seen before. Stopped at this Hotel/Casino and we loved the place. To compare to the strip places - it was not crowed, had just the right amount of gamblers, clean, smoke didn't kill you and the dealers were very nice! We won $ at this casino each time we went there, where as we lost $ on the strip. Definately a place to check out and stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best and great rates, rent car”
Reviews.Author: garsusie
Reviews.Content: We lived in LV for 6 years and moved back to the midwest 3 years ago. We always stay at the Southpoint when we go back. the rates are great and the hotel is elegant and the service is always good. They have some great restaurants too that don't clean out your wallet. As for being far from the strip, people really should get out of the casinos a little and see some of the country around Vegas. The Valley of Fire is gorgeous and everyond should at least go to Hoover Dam. Car rental rates are usually cheaper than taxis The off strip casinos are great too. They are short drives and the roads are top-notch and easy to get around on.(no snow and freezing to make pot holes Some of the small casinos are better payers too. There are great restaurants off the strip too.

Reviews.Title: “Too Far Away! $60 To get to the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: mscrog
Reviews.Content: At first, this hotel looks like a good value which it is in many ways. It is clean with large rooms and relatively new. The staff is polite and helpful. However, they have done away with the shuttle that use to go to the strip. Taxi fare there and back is $55-$65 round trip! That really boost the effective cost of your room if you don't have a car. They say you can take a city bus for $4 a day unlimited pass, but you have to wait out in the sun for it to arrive and then you must change buses to get to the strip. The whole process takes a hour each way! Who has that much time to waste on vacation. I think a much better value is the Hooters Hotel for an amazing $16 a night during the week and you are only one block from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Most of the negatives are by people that have never been to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JohnSocal
Reviews.Content: I am not going to reiterate the pros about room size, etc. The service was very good. Good pool area, lots to do, casino has 2,270 slot/video poker machines which is larger than most of the strip casinos. My wife and I have been going to Las Vegas for several years and have spend at least 30-40 nights per year there at various strip hotels. The Paris is our regular strip hotel. My main reason for writing this review is to point out that the complaints about the location, lack of TV channels, charges for Internet and spa are totally bogus. First, the complaints about the location are absurd. If you want to be on the strip then stay on the strip. Any intelligent person is well aware that the South Point is not close to what is referred to as the "Strip". If you are not aware then I suggest you check next time. Almost NO casino hotel offers much in the way of TV channels. They do this on purpose as they don't want you sitting in your room watching TV. This is not just at the South Point. Charging for the Internet and gym/spa is standard for casino/hotels. If you want to have lots of TV channels and free Internet access then stay at a non-casino hotel. At least the South Point doesn't charge a mandatory amenities charge that is becoming common at some Las Vegas casino hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money------But............”
Reviews.Author: vincent547
Reviews.Content: For a four star rated hotel, I expected an above average all around experience. Now don't get me wrong---the rooms were very clean, nicely appointed, and the bed was very comfortable. You couldn't beat the room rate, if you were judging by the quality of the room and the overall condition of the hotel. The food was good--not great.. The negative that I couldn't help but notice consistently was the type of people that were guests there. Because of the affordable rate you had many guests that normally wouldn't frequent a 4 or 5 star quality hotel. The lobby at night especially was overloaded with bling wearing, tattooed, baggy pants, backward baseball capped wearing, young people! There were a few "traditionally" dressed people such as ourselves, but we were definitely in the minority. They appeared to be the California "wuz up, wuz happenin'" kind of crowd. Not our cup of tea. However, we would probably stay here again because of the reasonable rates, room quality, and the 6-7 mile distance from the strip, which we found to actually be an advantage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Excellent Value, Will Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixAirstreamer
Reviews.Content: Like many others, we booked here because of the extremely low rates; but we were not disappointed. The rooms might be described as larger than standard rooms at the Luxor, but not as large or luxurous as Mandalay Bay. Overall an excellent value, and we are already planning another extended weekend at this hotel. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, and this was the quietest hotel in which we have ever stayed. We heard absolutely nothing through the walls or floors during our entire stay, except for running water during early to mid-mornings, and this was only audible in our bathroom. The in-room safe was a nice convenience, though we left our diamond studs and other expensive jewelry and bundles of cash at home (just kidding). The food was very good at each restaurant we visited, and of particular note was the prime rib at Primarily Prime Rib, the crab legs and clam chowder at the Big Sur Oyster Bar, the biscuits and gravy in the Coronado Cafe, and about anything in the Del Mar Deli. The turnovers were each equivalent to about one-half of a fruit pie, and I am embarrassed to admit how many of those flaky pasteries we ate during our stay. Also, their sandwiches seem a little high in price, but they are HUGE! The pools (and the whole resort) is family friendly. The main pool area is actually three overlapping/connected pools. If I recall correctly, the two on the ends are graduated and only about 3 feet deep max, and the center pool was only 5 feet max. There were a lot of families there, but we didn't feel crowded. One day, we spent most of the afternoon in the multi-screen theater (seniors get in before 3 PM everyday for $3, using their Club Card). It was a nice break from the casino activities. Also, there is a 60 lane bowling alley next to the theater (both upstairs over the casino floor), but there was some kind of tournament going on when we looked in, with bleacher seats set up and only two people bowling. Also, there is a small arcade right outside the bowling alley, which had a pretty good, but limited assortment of the usual games. If you don't need the excitement of being on the strip, or you have a car and don't mind driving about 5 minutes to get to the action there, this might be the resort for you. We no longer consider Harrah's, the Luxor or Mandalay Bay in our Las Vegas plans, and South Point is our destination hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Really good customer service”
Reviews.Author: kimshi
Reviews.Content: This place was beyond what I had expected. Since the hotel was built recently, everything was clean and new. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was large w/ bath & body products. Check-in was easy and every worker we ran into was helpful and nice. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value...but so far away!”
Reviews.Author: Vinkat10
Reviews.Content: South Point is a pretty hotel. We traveled with our 6 year old and 7 month old, so we weren't really there to gamble. The appearance is what mattered most to us, since that is what mattered most to our daughter. Everything was very clean and attractive. The beds were comfortable and the hallways and room were quiet. The pool is very nice, with different areas in which to swim or sunbathe. The Casino was pretty smoky, but that appears to be the rule here in Vegas. We didn't eat at South Point, but having a Seattle's Best in-house was really nice (if you are picky about your coffee and don't want to use the coffee maker in the bathroom). We drove to Vegas, so we thought being waaaaaaay down the Strip wouldn't be an issue. We didn't count on the difficulties of navigating around the Strip, so next time we will probably stay a little closer to the action. Driving from South Point and finding our way around was not ideal, it turned out. I do wish that they had free wi-fi or free high speed internet. It costs $12.99 per day. Overall, a really nice place to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Hotel, Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: AnnualPolicy
Reviews.Content: Typical of most Las Vegas Hotels, the ground floor restaurants are all located around a noisy casino. Food is adequate, and good value for money. The hotel is of a good standard, clean, and pleasant. We paid less than $40 per night per room - very good value for money. Hotel rooms very quiet. The only problem is the location - though on the strip, it is about 6 miles south of the heart of the action (TI, Venetan, Mirage, Caesars', Ballagio, etc). There is a mediocre Outlet Mall about 2.5 miles north on the strip. A much better outlet mall is 40minutes drive south on Interstate 15 at Primm on the Nevada/California border. On the plus side there is loads of free parking space and good access to I15, and that's useful because you shouldn't consider staying at this 'out-of-town' location without a car to get you around!

Reviews.Title: “BUGS IN THE PENTHOUSE”
Reviews.Author: MIKE-TRIP
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at a local place for the first 2 days of our trip to avoid the weekend party people. We have gambled here before and liked it so we gave it a try. We usually stay at the skylofts at the mgm. Well the room was very nice but in the morning I got a very big surprise. I had bugs in the bathroom and the worst part the bugs were inside the new towels. I wasn't going to stay. So when we went down I really didn't want to cause a stir so I said in a low voice you have bugs I'm leaving. This guy didn't even look up and he said in a normal voice for all to here WHAT TYPE OF BUGS without looking up. I already told my wife if they offered a discount I wasn't taking any I was paying for the room. This did happen in the morning. We didn't see any in the towels we used before bed. ( guess we did have luck picked the 2 clean towels ). He didn't even offer a sorry or anything he just handed me my checkout form and NEVER looked up. I got a good laugh. The only thing he said was he would send up house keeping. I like the casino and it seemed clean but if I had bugs in the 2 bedroom penthouse on the top floor inside the towels that says beware. I will continue to visit the casino but could never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “My latest stay in Vegas, Just Great!”
Reviews.Author: luisistaz
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vegas 2 or 3 times a year, and this time(as well as last december), I stayed at the South Point Hotel Casino. Let me tell you, first of all, I was in charge of a group, and we needed about 87 rooms. The sales department was very helpful and understanding, even in some cases when last minute name changes and cancelations had to be done. There where no complaints at all. As for my self, first of all, to my surprise my room was comped, and upgradded to a suite (in all 7 years I've stayed at The Orleans that never happened). The suite was very nice, not as fancy as say Bellagio or Wynn, but it was more than expected, more for less,with a great view to. Room service was just fine no complaints, th e hole staff was very friendly. Food here was good, Silverado Steakhouse was a bargain, as Primarily Prime. didn't have a chance to eat at Vito's, mabe next time, but let me tell you, Michael's is a great old school restaurant, not an extensive menu, but the quality is great, expensive but great!. Coronado Cafe was better than average and has good graveyard specials. As for play, the slots where a lot better (loose) than other places I visited this time. Overall a very good experience, It seems to me the guys at South Point are just trying harder to please teir customers, something that used to happen at The Orleans, but not lately. I'm planing to return next Augus, this time I'll be at The Orleans just to compare.

Reviews.Title: “I'm never returning !!!!”
Reviews.Author: sammiedogtwo
Reviews.Content: 1. Very poor shuttle service, $50.00 everytime you want to go somewhere, Over an hour wait at the airport if you wanted to wait for there shuttle. No shuttles to the strip 2 Get this room was out of toilet paper when we arrived, 2 towles for 2 people my wife has long hair, we got more by asking but come on! 3. No hot water at 7;15 am 4. No premium channles, ( super 8 has those, not everyone is there to gamble) 5. The smoke filled hallways were nasty, you need to be a smoker to stay here. 6. Food wasn't bad, but South Point lacks basic services for a high priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As said by others, best hotel off the strip!”
Reviews.Author: jjluke
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue but I will try to convey as much as I remember. First off, if you plan on staying at this hotel, a car rental is a must! For the price of the car rental and hotel, our stay at the South Point still came to less than others on the strip. The rooms are exceptionally appointed with a plasma, large beds and are roomy. The food is great and the service is as good as the others. The hotel/casino itself is very nicely appointed, with awesome pool, convention center, nightclub, etc. Very comporable to higher end hotels on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “South Point is a good deal”
Reviews.Author: OilersLuvr4ever
Reviews.Content: The only negative I have to say about South Point is that it is far away from the strip. We had some problems with the room key cards which was incredibly frustrating. We had to replace them a few times as they either became demagnetized or we just had a defective lock. I do not know. Other than that, it was easy to navigate and as I was there for a conference it was nice to not have to walk 2 miles to get from the hotel room to the conference room. Buffet left much to be desired, but the Deli and restaurants were good. I found the hotel room very comfortable and spacious and I liked that the toilet and shower were separate from the rest of the bathroom, which came in handy with 3 girls sharing one room. Because it is off the strip, it is less expensive. If you are going to Vegas for the strip, you should stay in a hotel that is closer or have your own vehicle. Otherwise be prepared to take the bus or pay for expensive cab rides.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure about hotel, but they will take your money and deny you service on the floors”
Reviews.Author: vegaspixie81
Reviews.Content: My husband just sat down at the Black Jack tables, literally for 5 minutes, while he was waiting for a friend. He lost $350 in that 5 minutes, and the dealer told him he wasn't allowed to play black jack at South Point anymore..but that he was allowed to play any other game they had available!!?! What kind of business are they running there? I plan to let everyone know not to give this casino any of their money! I'm appalled

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, decent property”
Reviews.Author: mauiwolf
Reviews.Content: I have actually stayed at the South Point a couple of times. The rooms are top-notch and are as nice as any of the four-star properties on the Strip. I love the big plasma t.v.'s and the large bathrooms and large rooms. The only drawbacks are that the hotel is only good if you have a vehicle so you can get around since it is several miles from everything. and the buffet is not good at all. Other than that, there are plenty of amenities, like bowling alley and movie theaters. The cafe is decent and there are a couple of other restaurants that are good. I would definitely recommend staying here is you don't need to stay on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and a Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: unchindeliz
Reviews.Content: We booked a room here for two nights in June at $35/night. I had read some great reviews on here and decided to take the plunge because the price could not be beat. We had an excellent time. The rooms were huge (about 500 square feet) with a large bathroom. The shampoo and lotion were from Bath and Body Works, a nice touch. The bed was comfortable and the room was very, very quiet. We never heard a peep from the rooms on either side, and we hardly saw anyone in the hallway. It was lovely. The only thing I would have liked to see in the room would be a mini fridge for keeping drinks cool (instead we used the ice bucket). Other than that, the room was fantastic! Our room faced the freeway and the pool, which was fine. Although we didn't spend time in the pool, it looked really nice and well kept.
