There were plenty of towels and each morning the staff was out there hustling to get it cleaned up and ready. During our time at SP, we bowled on the cheap with a coupon they gave us at check-in. It was fun, and not crowded. We also partook in the breakfast buffet buy one get one free special, I think it was about $9 for both of us. The food wasn't super fancy, but it was fine and the service was prompt and pleasant. All of the hotel bars have a happy hour special from 4-10pm, $1 for any drink. Again, we didn't partake (we're not huge drinkers) but that's a good deal. The gym facility here costs $15/day I believe. Rather than pay that, we drove to the 24 Fitness right down the street and used our membership there. There were plenty of grocery stores and chain restaurants nearby if you want to purchase dinner out or get water or snacks to have in your room. Parking at the hotel was, of course, complimentary. We're going back for our anniversary in a few weeks, again for $35/night! We'll hit the pool and the movie theater this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but the smoke is unaviodable King bed”
Reviews.Author: relayer
Reviews.Content: We needed a place close to the rental car drop for the airport and South Point was a good choice for its location. I saw it on Hotwire for $39 and grabbed it. Of course South Point then ran a special at 50% off and could have had the room for $35. Either way it's still a bargain. Check-in was only a 10-minute wait so no complaints there. My only big issue with South Point is the smoke distribution. Right away the smoke hit me walking inside to register. It really is unavoidable, as one needs to walk through the casino to reach the elevators, or travel to the parking garage, or use one of the restaurants. You can tell I'm from the east coast where everything is smoke-free. We loved the room, a king on the 20th floor overlooking the pool and mountains in the distance. It was very roomy including the bathroom. They must have some pretty thick walls because we heard nothing when sleeping at night. Again, why have elaborate TV's and offer no HD channels. Yes the hotel is a distance from the strip. However there is a lot to do here. The pool complex is nice and big. The second floor offers a movie theater, 60 lane bowling ally, bingo center and an arcade. Of course there is the casino and sports book. I can say we tolerated the smoke and participated in a little gambling ourselves. We grabbed a bite to eat at the deli. Kind of ironic that many of the restaurants are open on the casino floor, but ask you not to smoke. I guess they never heard of drifting. I can see charging for internet access as many hotels do this, but charging $15 to use the fitness center? I totally disagree with that decision. Get the coupon book when checking in. We saved a little cash at the deli.

Reviews.Title: “Too Far from Strip”
Reviews.Author: ScottnKathleen
Reviews.Content: My wife joined me here for a conference. Conference amenities were very good. Room service was very good. The dinner buffet was horrible. The cafe was decent for lunch. The Mexican restaurant food was pretty good but margaritas were lame (with a coupon). The service at the steakhouse was below average but the meal was overall very good with an excellent steak. They tout their bowling alley which is huge but it is open for leagues ONLY in the evening. The pool area was very nice but it was too cold to swim while we were there. The spa was not hot enough to enjoy. I don't game but my wife enjoys blackjack. She didn't have any luck. The biggest drawback to South Point is their location. We didn't have a car and they do not provide a shuttle. Cabs are pricey and the public transportation inconvenient. Being stuck at this place in the boonies is a deal breaker for us. We would consider staying there again IF they had a shuttle, even if they charged a nominal fee.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it's on the strip...”
Reviews.Author: County-Hunter
Reviews.Content: ...but it's not close to any other major casino. According to mapquest, it's nearly 6 miles to the next major casino going north (Mandalay Bay). That wasn't a major show stopper though as South Point has everything that you need for a great stay even if you don't leave the hotel. The line for check-in was a little long, but a manager came out with a case of cold water bottles that he handed out to everyone in line. A very nice touch I thought. And the line moved fast so I couldn't complain. As others have mentioned, use the coupon book that they give you upon checking-in. My wife signed up for their players club and they gave her $25 of slot play which she turned into $35 cash in her pocket which almost paid for the buffet for all three of us. I thought the buffet was quite good, better than the ones at Excalibur, Circus Circus and Sahara which I have all tried recently. And at only $15.95 and a free bottle of wine (with a coupon from the book), it was quite a bargain. The room was spacious and well-appointed with 50" plasma HD sets mounted on the wall. Didn't have HD channels though as others have pointed out. Bathrooms are large with a separate tub/shower room. We tried out the pool and even though it was July 4th, I didn't think it was over-crowded. But there was no mistaking it for an "adult only" place with kids snorkeling in the large circular jacuzzi pool. If you don't mind being a short drive from the action on the strip, then this is the place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jbfromva
Reviews.Content: I must say, at first I was skeptical of this hotel for our Honeymoon after reading some of the reviews! As other reviewers stated, this hotel is not on the strip, but its only like a 10-15 min drive very easy access to 15 and most of the hotels on the strip has free parking, so it wasn't a big deal. Check in for us was a breeze; unlike so others there weren't a lot of people checkin in when we got there (about 5pm on Memorial Day)! Not only was I glad we went with this hotel, my wife was very pleased and we didn't have to deal with all the nonesense that comes with being on the strip. The rooms were very large, nice flat screen on the wall, even though there were no hd channels, which kills me but i guess thats a "guy" thing cuz it didn't seem to bother my wife, huge windows for view (although there wasn't much of a view from our side, but again no biggie), and the bathrooms were pretty big with tub/shower seperate from toilet and sink area. This hotel has a lot of things besides gambling right there inside the hotel, bowling, bingo, gym, spa, Movie theater ect. The restaurants were ok, the breakfast and dinner at the buffet wasn't that bad. My wife ate at one of the restaurants, and bragged about the crab legs the entire time! Make sure u take advantage of the coupon book they give u at check in. After spending the first 3 or 4 days out on the strip and sight seeing, we decided to spend a lil time at our own hotel. The pool area was very relaxing, not overly packed like it was for some, and the poolside waitress kept the drinks coming! We didn't get to go bowling, but we did catch a movie at the Theater with some of our friends that were staying on the strip. I think they enjoyed that more than we did! Overall we had a great time at South Point and Vegas! Although this hotel seems to cater to families with children, it didn't seem to be a problem for us because we spent most of the day out on the strip and when we returned it was pretty late and nothing but adults in the casino area. If you do one of the Time Share presentations, do the Planet Hollywood one, the breakfast alone is well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip but ON target for Service & Value”
Reviews.Author: daposton222
Reviews.Content: On our last day in Las Vegas, on our way home, we decided that we might stay another day so we popped into the South Point. It was a Thursday, and we booked it for $56 plus tax. Really glad we did. Front Desk/Rooms: Long line to check in, but to alleviate the situation, the drink waitress walked by and handed everyone in line a bottle of water for free. Nice Touch!! Check in was prompt. Got a king bed room with a view to the east. There is one wing of the hotel that has a view of the strip, so if you want that, ask. Might be worth it, since the rooms had a large floor to ceiling window. We stayed on the 26th floor, so not sure if every room shares that cool feature. Bed was comfortable, room was very nicely appointed, large banister/counter area in the bath. See photos. Pool: Awesome--very good for kids & adults. Jaccuzzi jets blow very hard. Pool temp was very refreshing, nice & cool to escape the desert sun. Food: Only ate one place: Don Vito restaurant. Waiter was “Gunther,” an older German fellow. The service was outstanding! I cannot say enough about how good that made the meal. We ate fried mozzarella for an appetizer, chicken parmesan, lasagna and another pasta dish I cannot remember as well as a Caesar salad and two house salads. The food was excellent. For a restaurant in a casino, it is one of the best we’ve eaten at, and we’ve visited Las Vegas at least a few times a year for the past twenty years. Only thing I didn’t like about the restaurant: The name! Don Vito?!? Corny and not fitting at all of the class this place possesses. Overall: Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: Benefits
Reviews.Content: First and foremost remember you're not on the strip. You're on las vegas blvd, the strip begins about 5 miles or so north. As I've stayed numerous times in las vegas, never at the same property twice, I decided to give the south point a try as they had a good deal for the 4th of july weekend (stayed 3rd and 4th). The package I booked had 2 free buffets along with 4 free drinks for like 150/2 nights on a holiday weekend, what a deal. The hotel itself is a 4 star property. The room was clean, large, ergonomically designed well, large safe/closet, good size sitting area. Let me tell you I've stayed on the strip in 4 star propertys for much more money that were'nt in as good a shape. Only things in the room that were issues were peeling of coating on the bathroom floor that may or may not stick to your feet. Also tv is a hd set with no hd channels, kind of silly. Neither of these were deal breakers. Air exchange in the casino seemed pretty good. Used the pool which was loaded with families, alot of kids but the hotel seems to cater to that. Very busy on the holiday weekend and the cheap rates brought in some unusual folks but I will say that everyone seemed very respectful so it wasn't an issue. All in all I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Casino!”
Reviews.Author: DoxieMomof2
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a long weekend at South Point Hotel. Great hotel, casino and restaurants! We had a great time even though we did not do so well at Black Jack or bowling. The hotel is not close to the strip, so if you want to go to the strip, you'll need a car. In my opinion, there really is no reason to leave SouthPoint, they had everythingwe wanted and needed. Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel a few miles from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: BearAndPenguin
Reviews.Content: The pros: new hotel easy to get to from the freeway. The check-in line was long (it was the 4th of July weekend) but it moved fast and they gave us bottled water while we waited. The hotel elevator wasn't too far from the front desk (this is not always the case in Vegas - I think it took me over 15 minutes to walk to my room at the MGM from the front desk) and the hotel was very clean and our room was huge! And the bathroom was large and nice too. The walls must be thick because I didn't hear anything while we were in the room. Parking is free - there is surface parking or garage parking - your choice. Of course, you are several miles from the strip so you can take the shuttle, a cab or drive. We drove and parked for free at the Fashion Show Mall right on the Strip where parking was free. The pool was nice but way too crowded, but this always seems to be the case in Vegas - I would recommend staying far from the strip if you want to be able to swim in a hotel pool. If you are not planning on just doing the strip, it is nice to be located off the Strip since you can drive in and out a lot faster than if you were always stuck in the Strip traffic. Oh yeah, and we got a great deal through Expedia and paid only $75/night including taxes etc. The cons: a few miles from the strip and you have to pay for internet access (but maybe this is the case at the other Vegas hotels too, I can't remember).

Reviews.Title: “What you'd get if you crossed a Best Western with Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: Blue_Morpho_Flyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here an entire week for a convention. As others have noted, it's far from the real lights and action in Las Vegas. It took a long time to drive anywhere to see shows downtown, etc. The standard rooms were spacious and clean, but poor staff service overall was a continuous issue and a disappointment. Pros: * Price * Fast elevators (2 banks) to rooms * Free in-room safe * Free coupon for some free slot play * Spacious bathroom plus couch and coffee table in standard room * Digital thermostat * Large windows (view varies) * Newer look/feel, with modern color palette in rooms * Rooms felt and looked clean Cons: * Always enormous lines at registration, no matter day or time * No electric, sensor-operated doors at front of hotel--you get the joy of wrestling them open manually each time, and they are heavy * A very long hike to and from main entrance to rooms, doubly challenging when dragging your suitcases, and each way you are forced to navigate through a casino thick with smoke (asthmatics beware!) * Limited hours for food vendors, and only Pepsi throughout hotel (yes, that matters to some of us) * Skimpy supply of thin towels -- one per person; we requested extras several times, but only received them once * We asked to borrow a bottle opener several times from room service, and it was promised every time but never delivered * Shower was very low pressure; water only lukewarm * Very few TV channels, and an odd mixture--many horse racing channels (for placing bets), Chinese and Spanish news channels, but not your typical CNN, HBO, Weather Channel, or anything useful * Our TV picture tube blew out on the third day, was reported but never replaced during our stay (not that I really missed my nightly dose of the news delivered in Chinese anyway!) * Business center had very limited hours and was very expensive--around $12 for an hour of Internet, and you could not save any of the paid time for later use * We had read the slots were the second loosest in Vegas here, but that was not our experience * The Garden Buffet was very disappointing. Food was poor to average at best. For dessert I chose a cheesecake which turned out to be warm Jell-O cheesecake (not the real stuff) and it had congealed fruit topping. It had been sitting out for a long time without refrigeration. Salad bar was limited and the lettuce was wilted. Conclusion: A decent choice for budget travelers; if you value cleanliness over service; and are willing to drive a good distance for decent restaurants or shows.

Reviews.Title: “South Point Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: TRavEL_loVer_Canada
Reviews.Content: South Point Hotel Review My wife and I visited South Point Casino from June 24th ~ 27th. First of all, let me please start with… Pros & What to do while staying @ South Point Casino 1. Use your coupon! You will receive a small coupon booklet as you check in. I personally used $25 Slot Machine Credit Coupon as well as Buffet coupon (2 for 1). And also, take the gift giveaway coupon to the small grocery store in the casino, and you will receive a key chain. Not very valuable one, but remember, it’s free. :) 2. Buffet & Other restaurants Do not expect 5 star high quality dishes at the buffet, but certainly, it’s not bad at all! Many different kinds available! At least, I found it delicious. And also, check out the other restaurants as well. 4 to 5 different restaurants available including Steakhouse & Mexican restaurant. 3. Slot Machines I only played slot machines rather than the table games and I actually saw some people hitting the jackpot. I saw a gentleman winning $4,000 playing Video Poker game. I personally had ups & downs but overall, they wouldn’t just take your money right away. Just learn when to STOP playing when you earned some! :) In addition, ASK FOR LOCAL BEERs or COCKTAILs while gambling! They are all free! I was able to enjoy playing slot machines while drinking beers. Yay!!! 4. Family Oriented; Movie & Bowling We watched Transformer Two on 24th of June. We expected a lot of people, but it really wasn’t bad at all. Get a free popcorn using the coupon!!! Right beside the movie theater, you will be able to see a huge bowling center. Again, use the coupon if your plan is to play bowling! Please be advised that I did not swim nor have a massage. I am not sure how the swimming pool or the spa qualities are like @ South Point. 5. If you have your own car, it’s not a bad idea to drive away from Strip (Casino) area!!! I visited Hoover Dam as well as Red Canyon Region. It takes about one hour to get to Hoover Dam from South Point. Check out “Lake Mead” too on the way to Hoover Dam. Hoover Dam definitely offers something to watch! Now, let’s go over… Cons & Why South Point Casino cannot be Five Star Hotel 1. Smoky Smoky Smoky Casino. Yes, I am very well aware of the fact that all the other hotels are the same as well where we will have lots of smokers while playing games. At South Point Casino, I do realize that they have the air filter system; however, there are perhaps too many smokers or what? Compared to any other hotels on the Strip, you can definitely feel the low quality of the air. After spending about an hour playing slot machine, you will be able to smell the smoky smell from your clothes all day long. 2. Distance from the Strip You don’t have a car? Then, I am pretty sure that your plan is just to stay @ South Point. It does take 15 minutes to 30 minutes (depending on the time) to get to the Strip. Other than these two, I really don’t have any other points to complain about. As you see, I have more PROs than Cons; and therefore, I would rate this hotel as FOUR STAR. Overall, you are just receiving what you “paid” for. You wouldn’t be able to stay @ Bellagio or Venetian with the money you are paying in order to stay @ South Point, right? There’re always reasons to have the rooms available @ very cheap price compared to the market price @ Vegas. Oh! well, at least, I personally was very satisfied with South Point after all. Thank you for reading!

Reviews.Title: “Okay place along the lines of the Station hotels but far away and Friday night was really weird.”
Reviews.Author: TexasYokel
Reviews.Content: Booked a cheap rate through Hotwire, who frankly fraudulently deemed this hotel "near strip south." it's 7 miles from the MGM, which is practically at the end of the strip. Huge development, fairly high end and clean. Lots of the amenities : two arcades, bowling, movies attract families; so there were lots of families there. Retirees and locals, until Friday night a good enough mix. On Friday huge hordes of grubby teenagers/twentysomethings were everywhere. Nice kids I'm sure but more a reenactment in the oughties of rock and roll high school than the scrubbed clubbing youngsters you see on the strip. Asked a blackjack dealer where they all came from and she said "TGIF." I'm guessing nickel beer and really relaxed security. I fled. Not sure if the whold weekend was like that but it was plenty to keep me away. To be fair the room was huge and very clean. Lots of marble and a big flat screen tv. Oddly for the quality finish out the tub/shower weren't upgraded. With the cheap price on Hotwire and a rent a car it was fine for me but those partaking of alcohol would more than give back their savings in cabfare. Decent enough except for whatever happens on Friday.

Reviews.Title: “Money well spent!”
Reviews.Author: kharding83
Reviews.Content: Fri-Sat 2 night stay for less than $150.00. Room has 2 Full-Size beds (they consider them queen). Large 42in LCD tv. Large bathroom. Everything was very clean, and organized in the room. Bath and Body Works shampoo, and conditioner along with mouth wash. Gambling was excellent (slots). The crowd is approx about 35-65yrs old. The coupon book gives you a $25 free slot play coupon. Movies are $7-$10, depending on times. Overall i would give this hotel/casino a 8/10. Mexican food was good at a GREAT price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Vegas if you don't mind a drive to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: zandychicago_IL
Reviews.Content: We usually stay on the Strip, but we were sick of overpaying for old, dingy hotel rooms so we decided to chance it and stay at the South Point. We stayed around the time of the name change from South Coast to South Point and everything was brand new. Great, huge room - very updated and CLEAN! We rented a car and drove to our favorite places on the Strip and got to drive around all see some other casinos as well. We usually go to Vegas to gamble and have a good time and South Point definitely fit the bill!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price, just consider the tradeoff of its location.”
Reviews.Author: WalkingTraveller
Reviews.Content: The South Point was the official hotel for an event that I attended for 5 days in early June 2009. Can't beat the price! In fact, I got a $45 a night room rate through Travelocity for the week days portion of my stay, which was lower than the supposed advance discount rate offered through the event that I was attending. For such a low rate, you get a big room, with all the amenities. While the style and decoration may not strike you as luxurious, everything is of a good quality. The carpet, wall treatments, molding, bathroom floor and tile, fixtures, etc. The room had a king size bed, sofa & coffee table, small round table with 2 chairs, plus a separate desk with a chair. And even with all of that furniture, there was still lots of open floorspace in the room. You've no doubt read about the bowling alley, movieplex, bingo hall and equestrian center. All are very modern and very popular. I ate a lot of meals off-site, so I don't feel qualified to comment on the South Point's restaurants. The casino had all the typical machines and table games, but was small by Vegas standards. And it was very smokey. Obviously one area where they saved construction money was by not installing a mega-strength filtering system, like they have at some of the higher end Vegas hotels. Is the hotel's location a pro or a con? I would say that you just have to be realistic about the tradeoff of off-Strip location vs. value. South Point is located far south of what is considered the southern tip of the Strip ... Mandalay Bay, Four Seasons, etc. You absolutely cannot walk to the Strip. Taxi is approximately $30 each way, more if you go to the northern area of the Strip. The famous Deuce bus that many visitors use to economically get up and down the Strip does not come anywhere near the South Point. At this point in time, the hotel does not offer a shuttle to the Strip. So if you will travel to Vegas by car, you won't have an issue. Otherwise, I strongly suggest that you rent a car, for a least a few days. I did that and was pleasantly surprised that having a car in Vegas was not a hassle at all. All of the Strip casinos have free self-park garages, and even if you use valet parking, the only cost is a tip to the attendant. Traffic wasn't that bad either, even on Las Vegas Blvd. Now some of the lack of parking fees and traffic may have been because the visitor counts are way down during the current recession, so if you are reading this review months later, you may want to investigate to verify that these factors are still true. All in all, I highly recommend the South Point, as long as you understand what you are getting for that attractively low room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: ray219
Reviews.Content: Our stay was the weekend of June 6-11 Large spacious rooms with daily maid service. If you have kids like me, bring a PS2 with you to hook to the tv for dvd's and games, when they are not out. the hotel is clean and friendly and kids can be trusted to roam around with little supervision, some days I didn't see them for hours. This is a great hotel that is family oriented. They have a large outside pool that is 4 feet deep but doesn't get to warm so during our stay it was weird that adults were in the kiddie pool and kiddies were in the spa/hot tub with no one really in the large pool. Also note that although it is family oriented, i noticed a woman laying on her stomach with her top off tanning, i saw this on at least two different days, no one complained. The kids loved bowling,movies,and the arcade. Looking forward to returning again, when it is cooler. If u need to go to the strip rent a car or share a taxi if your bold enough to ask someone to share. For food, I would suggest eating the breakfast buffet $6.95, then they have a 75 cent hot dog cart. If u go to the strip, there is fast food everywhere and make sure to get discount tickets by the big coke to save on shows.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the drive to the strip!”
Reviews.Author: yuckybeans
Reviews.Content: Planned to stay here for just one night, but we decided to extend our trip because we were having such a great time. A distance from the strip but well worth the drive. South Point is not crowded (a negative if you are looking for a "nightlife" experience--which I wasn't), has sumputuous rooms, and has plenty to do. We went bowling, went to the movies, enjoyed the pool, played bingo, enjoyed some delicious meals, gambled, and played bingo all without leaving the hotel. The room was large and the bed was divine. I had two wonderful nights sleep and I don't usually sleep well in hotels. One night will not be enough---book two with the Internet special (which is a terrific deal!)

Reviews.Title: “Over-hyped”
Reviews.Author: sfman38
Reviews.Content: I booked the South Point on a recent trip to Vegas because it received such incredible reviews on this site. Perhaps my expectations were too high. Sure, I got a great deal on my stay, but for just 10 or 15 dollars more I could have stayed on the strip and believe I would have been much happier. The location, obviously, is not good compared to the strip casinos, but this should be obvious. My real problem was with the service. As I've seen others write, I had a long wait at check-in. When I finally got to the front, the lady at the desk did not apologize for the wait or even acknowledge me. I had to say, "Hi, checking in" before she even looked up. After that she said maybe ten words to me and sent me on my way. When I called down to the front desk later because of a problem, I had a ten-minute wait on the phone, and then they couldn't even solve my problem. The rooms are nice, I will give the casino that much. But the casino and lobby area is nothing memorable. It's basically one big room, and has nothing special about it. It's much smaller than the strip casinos, too, and doesn't offer nearly the same amount of restaurants and bars. Add all this together, and I was disappointed in my stay considering how rave the reviews are on this site. It's a decent hotel with nice rooms, and probably one of the better casino hotels for families. But for the average traveler, I would recommend looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Fault It”
Reviews.Author: skyewalker16
Reviews.Content: After two days staying in the Venetian and a 15-hour day driving to/from the Grand Canyon I was not expecting much. I had pre-booked the room at a cost of less than £25.00. Booked on the strength of previous TA reviews and just to let you know the previous reviews are spot on. I was very surprised and pleased. The room was large with 2 king size beds. Large TV on wall but not many channels to choose from. Large bathroom, not quite the Venetian but functional none the less. Room was spotless. Was given a voucher book upon arrival offering discounts in the bars, restaurants etc. There appeared to be no catches in using the vouchers and all were taken without any problems. The casino appealed to us, none of us are gamblers. It was nice to see lower value blackjack and roulette tables. Still lose the same amount of money but it just takes longer at the South Point. The next morning we had the buffet breakfast again using the vouchers. Can't fault it. Good choice and all food was hot and plentiful. For the price we paid this Hotel is without doubt the best value hotel I have ever stayed in. If you're looking for a hotel on the strip then this is not it. If you are looking for a great value, clean hotel for a stop over perhaps after a days sightseeing then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: db98026
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights at the South Point on a busy Nascar weekend and had NO problems whatsoever. The staff was friendly and the room was fantastic! I think people going to Vegas sometimes expect to be treated like they are the ONLY people staying there so sometimes a little rerspect for the people you are dealing with can go a long way. When it comes to peoples complaints about cab fare to the strip..HELLO did you not look on a map where you are staying or maybe you should have thought about renting a CAR.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: weimaraner71
Reviews.Content: Absolutely no complaints. Great price, arrived early and they arranged a room for us. We had a $25 free voucher for gambling and I walked away with $18 and my room was $35. Also other great value coupons. Pool was clean. I would never stay anywhere else! Good security.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS HOTEL, staying here every time in Vegas from now on!”
Reviews.Author: acposu
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel, it is not yet worn out like some others on the strip. Rooms Are HUGE! Real nice bathroom, bed was nice, flat screen tv. Stayed in May 09 sunday night thru thursday night for $45/nt...absolutely the BEST DEAL IN TOWN. 16 screen movie theater is nice, bingo hall with the computer cards very nice (though I didn't play), big parking lot valet is free but I tipped generously each time they are FAST getting the car, discount show tickets readily available (LE REVE was awesome, I thought it would be for the wife but I loved it), 64 lane bowling alley! great idea and it is still brand new. great room service, really nice staff, buffet and restaurants were good and not pricey like on the strip. You prob think I work there but I don't. I'll tell you I will be staying at this place every time I go to Vegas in the future. I've stayed at hotels costing $300+ that weren't as nice. Casino has all the slot machines I love by the way, not that it really matters as far as payouts. No nightclub, pool is very nice, no view to speak of from rooms (off strip), cheap extensive list of liquor in the lobby store.

Reviews.Title: “Really Perfect Hotel, Cheapy! Value for money!!!!”
Reviews.Author: johan3
Reviews.Content: I saw many hotels in my life because I work in a travel agency. Of course every place you must look to price-quality. This was really good, we took the favorite package, 107 dollar including 2 nights, 4 cocktails, 2 free buffets in garden restaurant (which was good, much choice) and free fitness. Really very cheap,same package in weekend is 140 dollar and still cheap. It is really a 4 star hotel, very nice big pool with sunbeds, nice music, cocktails and so on, and really a tropical admosphere (like you are in Cuba or so). Very nice spa, fitness, 8 restaurants. Rooms are also excellent, big, clean. We stayed on the 24 Floor, so nice view! By car it is about 10-15 minutes on the I 15 to the Strip, very easy!!!! Hotel is only 2 years old, 2200 rooms totally. I really liked it. Only one point, internet wifi will cost you 13 dollar for each 24 hours extra.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the SouthPoint”
Reviews.Author: broncosrock
Reviews.Content: This hotel/resort/casino is fabulous. The rooms are the most comfortable I have ever had in Las Vegas. The food is excellant. The service was wonderful. And the casino is very large with a great assortment of machines that seem to pay much more generously than the strip. We had a car and went to the strip one evening but were anxious to get back. I am not sure on the next trip that we wil even go to the strip. The SouthPoint has everything and it is so comfortable and easy to enjoy. Each of us in our party were most impressed and hope to return soon. I would highly recommend the SouthPoint.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, big pool, fun casino, several restaurants, easy to get to!”
Reviews.Author: EandJ_PDX
Reviews.Content: To say that South Point is south of the Strip is a bit of an understatement ... it's a good 5 miles south of MGM & Luxor, which are at the south end of the Strip. Knowing that going in, South Point was a great value. We booked our room via Hotels.com for a Memorial Day weekend stay and got a rate about 40% less than through the hotel's website. Our room was spacious and clean, had a large sitting area, king bed, windows overlooking the pool, flat screen TV, in-room safe, and a huge bathroom. Considering that it sat above a rocking casino and the pool, it was perfectly quiet except for a bit of hallway noise at times...something experienced in all hotels. The casino offered a variety of table and slot/video poker games, had a large sports book, a bingo room, and a poker room. Table minimums were mainly $10, but even on this holiday weekend they kept a few $5 tables open all the time. Food at the three restaurants we ate at was good if not spectacular, but for the diner-range prices we paid, weren't a bad value. There were lots of poolside lounge chairs and plenty of room in the pool. The hotel also offers a spa; one of us took advantage of it and had a great massage there. If you're in Vegas to explore the Strip, the location is a bit limiting: the "Deuce" city bus doesn't go this far south and there's no shuttle to the Strip or downtown. But, if you have a car and a designated driver, its location right next to I-15 makes it an easy freeway drive to the big Strip casinos. Driving up the Strip from South Point was excruciatingly slow. Internet access is a steep $13/day, but who wants to check their e-mail when there are free cocktails in the casino? All in all, if the price here beats anything available on the Strip, we'd stay here again. But if we could find a comparable price at a hotel on the Strip with an outdoor pool, we'd probably pass.

Reviews.Title: “4-Star Quality at 2-Star rates”
Reviews.Author: Jim D
Reviews.Content: The South Point Hotel needs to be placed on the top-10 hotel bargains in the USA. For $70 plus change we stayed in the most basic room available. We walked into the room and immediately said, "Wow . . . and this ISN"T a suite?" The room was huge and elegant, down to the finest detail. Since my wife and I use Las Vegas as a launching pad for adventures in the southwest. we rarely stay there more than one night. On our last trip, we wished we had stayed several. The spectacular buffet is very reasonable, and the food is the best buffet food that we've ever had. The buffet is the peer of any fru-fru of the Sunday brunch buffets that we've been to. My only complaint was the check-in line: it took us an hour to check in. That said, there were 8 people working at the check-in desk.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: GTKDKKLHK
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal online for our stay. The hotel is a little outside of the Strip, but VERY convenient access to the freeway. Got to the hotel at 3:00, and it took us about 30 min. in line to get checked in. The casino is pretty smokey for a strip hotel. It's a bit of a walk to the elevators (but it's that way in most strip hotels), but was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room. Very spacious. Housekeeping needs to be a little more meticulous, but I am very picky about cleanliness. Very quiet rooms, but we had no view. We were on the 6th floor, and were facing a wall. At least we didn't have to worry about anyone looking in from the windows. I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the bowling alley-over 60 lanes. Large theater complex. Average arcade for the kids. Took advantage of the coffee bar every morning, although the rooms do come with a coffee maker. Would have a liked a refrigerator to come with the room though (there's certainly enough space for one). Had dinner one night at the Garden Buffet. Nice, average food. Our package included 2 free buffets, so can't really complain. I didn't get to take a look at the pool on this trip, but noticed that a lot of people were making good use of it. Overall, very happy with our stay, and would definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Off Strip Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dawn52
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 5/17-22. This is my second stay here. The Hotel feels good. I like that it is away from the congestion and constant construction of the strip. It is very hard to find the entrance to the hotels on the strip for all the construction. The hotel is new and feels that way. The rooms are very clean and large. Nice large vanity in the bathroom. If you come near check in time you'll have to wait. I can't understand the moaners who think they are the only people checking in. They passed out water while waiting. Check in was pleasant. The maids were very nice. The food at the Buffet is average. The cafe is good. It's hard to get waited on in the Del Mar Deli. Seattle's coffee and ice cream parlor next door are quick and good. The pool was good. They have all the games the other casinos do. The shuttle had been discontinued. I think they still have one to the airport, but not to the strip. I like the choice of parking in the front or in the parking garage. Parking garage very roomy. Not like the sardine spaces at the older casinos on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: slw95756
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas. I used this site to select a hotel prior to my trip for the second time and was very happy with the results, so here is my contribution. You cannot beat the value at this hotel. Only a year or two old, very clean, nicely decorated, and good service. Although off the strip, the location is great at the I-15 exit, quick access to anywhere. The resturants are mediocre but reasonably priced. The casino is sizable and not overcrowded. The pool is good but the lounge chairs could be better. The beds are excellent and rooms are sizable. A reasonably priced hotel away from the crowd hassles with good service and comfortable accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HikerBiker2
Reviews.Content: Would stay here again. Everything was excellent. Room, bath, beds all excellent. But no fridge or microwave in room. Pool and hot tub were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “lines, loud, but the room was really nice”
Reviews.Author: travelpatch
Reviews.Content: once I got past the smoky, cacophonous, gaudy entryway/casino area, my room was lovely, large, clean, and quiet. But it takes a lot to get through that entryway, as to check-in or get food one must wait-wait-wait (as long as 25 minutes!). on the other hand, they were very speedy getting me my free gambling coupon, which I happily cashed out for $49 twenty minutes later. the service was very good - they gaveme a free gym pass due to the wait and a misunderstanding at the front desk. But yes, otherwise it is $15 to hit the gym!! You'll also pay $12/day for high speed internet and more than that to print at the business center. The buffet is pretty good. The pool was MOBBED. Also, don;t fail to notice you are a $10-15 cab rude from the strip., This was also the first hotel I have stayed in with instructions for clean needle disposal in the bathroom. If you expected something really classy, you might be disappointed, but it was a very nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 6 miles from strip, but nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: langlish
Reviews.Content: The hotels is kind of nice. The check in Service was not very friendly, he tried to downgrade my room for some reason, when I complained he mumbled somehting and gave me the room that I had payed for. It is $30 taxi ride to get to the strip which was kind of a surprise as there are reviews below that say "it is off the strip" I just scanned through them and realised aftwards it is 6 miles off the strip. Anyway to the rooms are nice, and reasonably priced. The beds have some kind of plastic sheet which makes them very sweaty, but they are comfortable. The Sunday Brunch buffet was OK, but nothing very special. Would recommend this hotel to anyone that is not too woried about being on the strip as the rooms are reasonably priced, you have everything you need. However for someone who wants to visit Las Vegas, do not go here!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: iluvvegas
Reviews.Content: This is probably the 3-4th time we've stayed at South Point and it's always been great. Checked-in early (noon) on a Sunday and got a king n/s room in the new wing on the 10th floor overlooking the pool. Great room as usual! The A/C is always nice and cold, the bathroom is roomy and has very nice Bath & Body toiletries, and the bed is comfy. We rent a car so we don't mind being off the strip. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lots to offer at South Point”
Reviews.Author: Floresvacation
Reviews.Content: South Point was a pleasant surprise. We read reviews before we went, some good, some bad, but we wanted to be our own judge. First off there is a free shuttle to and from the airport, the hotel is clean and nice, it is off the strip about 6 miles but there is a bus route that you can pick up and go to the strip and downtown, for $3.00 a day the bus was well worth it! The room was nice, not much of a view from our room, but that was okay, the bed was comfortable, they do have a plastic mattress pad which does get a little hot but it was tolerable and we felt better knowing it was on a bed others have slept on. We ate at the buffet which was decent but the day before we left we stumbled upon Del Mar Deli, WOW!, the desserts were amazing, the bagels and sandwiches were huge! The next time we go we are eating most of our meals there! You have to look for the deli a bit, it is tucked away in a corner by the betting areas, but there was no lack of customers, people knew about this place. Seattle's Best coffee shop was very good as well. There is a bowling alley and Bingo hall and a movie theater, we took advantage of that two times! The gambling was good, we came home with money! They have $5.00 tables most of the time, where on the strip they were no less then $10.00! They have a health club with very nice equipment, you do have to pay for the gym, but if you like to work out, you should take advantage of it. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here everytime we go to Vegas!!!!”
Reviews.Author: klunckr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful!! The staff was great, the maid service was wonderful, our rooms were BIG and quiet! The hotel was almost full and we didn't hear our neighbors, which is a wonderful surprise when your used to hearing everything in a hotel. The pool and hot tub were beautiful. We ate almost every meal right at the hotel, it was cheap and good food. Some people complain that it's to far from the strip, but it only took us 30 min to get to the Riviera where my parents were staying (after they saw Southpoint they wished they stayed there too) and we liked being away from the madness. There is a great outlet mall only 3 miles from this hotel and it's awesome. There are also lots of other shopping and resturants near this hotel. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a hotel with wonderful rooms/beds, good food and friendly service!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice than you would expect”
Reviews.Author: JOEJAGENT
Reviews.Content: I live in Los Angeles and come to las Vegas every other month or so. I stay in different places all the time, from the lowly Wild West (please don't ever stay there, ever) to a suite at Mandalay Bay or Caesars. This trip I wanted to do cheap (but not as cheap as the other time I ended up at Wild West) so I booked this hotel through Hot Wire (selected cheapest 4 star). It was $48 (hotel advertised $70). Checked in was quick and no add on "facility fee" that some places charge if you book on a discount site. Room was nice, not grand, but nice. Bigger than I expected. Everything worked and good repair. Good quality bed. Perfectly clean. Could not hear neighbors. I saw other posts, my room did not smell. Water pressure was great. I don't iron so except for seeing there was one I can't comment. I saw no problem them running an authorization for 4100. Most hotels do it for more than that. Pool was nice. Snack bar limited. I missed the restaurants because we went to a show, got back at 11 pm and all was closed except the Cafe. Had dinner anyway and it was reasonable priced and very good (we had lunch there earlier and also very good). Both lunch and dinner ran under $40 for two with tip. Gambling was OK, machines were newer and worked, table games are table game. Staff was friendly, and people came often asking if you wanted a drink. Downside: It is 10-15 minutes from the main strip area by car. No car you are pretty stuck and miss out on a lot. Could use more help in the cafe. Took a while to place orders, but after that service was very good. Tried calling concierge and the pool and no one ever did pick up. I always drive in so I would stay here again as long as it is half the price of a 4 star strip hotel. They do charge about $12 for Internet which is a rip off. I also liked the choice of parking in a high rise lot or in a flat lot right outside the main door. Oh, and there is a really good Dunkin Donuts only about a mile east of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: KerryBorn
Reviews.Content: Hotel is about 5 years old, has lovely spacious rooms, and is well-run. It is conveniently close to the airport. If you don't have to be close to the Strip it is a great place to stay. I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Average in every sense”
Reviews.Author: anotherpostcard
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel using a site that blindly said I'd be getting the highest star hotel in the southern part of the strip. I figured it was a well known property only to learn it was here. The hotel and casino are perfectly average. There's nothing to write home about but there's also nothing necessarily to complain about. I describe this as a fine, clean hotel and casino that could be located anywhere in the U.S. where gambling is legal. So that's my issue with it -- there's nothing about it that says Las Vegas. Everything is clean. But the casino is really brightly lit and there's no "vibe." We wanted to feel like we were in Vegas but had to go elsewhere (Caesar's, Bellagio, etc.) to do that. It's also really far -- we saved a lot by renting a car but that meant less partying on the strip. The free parking made it less painful. I'd much rather pay more for a room in a well known hotel on the strip or book far in advance. But if you're not into the Vegas scene, you may be happy here. I was happy when I saw my bill at check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Advice”
Reviews.Author: oldposhfan
Reviews.Content: After the madness of the Casino in the lobby we were thrilled with the quality and size of the rooms. Pool is great!

Reviews.Title: “Super place = Super fun!”
Reviews.Author: Scottysmom
Reviews.Content: The South Point Hotel, Casino and Spa is a great place to stay all the way - everyone is great to deal with, spent 6 nights there and enjoyed everything about the place!

Reviews.Title: “South Point: south of The Strip's congestion and super fun”
Reviews.Author: ronsantacruz
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at South Point Casino during the spring holiday. My girlfriend and I were first time guests at South Point, but we felt right at home thanks to the generous spirit their employees. After taking an excellent free craps class, we jumped into a game. With the help of the gaming staff, we slowly became acquainted with craps. By the second day of playing our confidence had increased; so we opened up a $500 line of credit and played some more. We plan on returning with family in a few months to celebrate a belated birthday for my grandmother. Our previous Las Vegas get together was at the claustrophobic Luxor, but I’ve convinced them to make South Point our Vegas base this time. Good travels, ronsantacruz

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC FIND OFF THE STRIP”
Reviews.Author: Cactus0
Reviews.Content: We were travelling during Spring Break with two teens and purposely wanted a hotel off the Strip. We had a rental car to drive to the Strip daily. Check-in was a breeze and you can check out through the TV in the room. Pleasant ly surprised with the large room, two queen beds, bathroom had separate shower and toilet from the sink and large countertop for all our toiletries. The only complaint we could make was that the pillows were on the small and hard side. If you are driving in, bring your own. Nice flat screen TV, Great outdoor view of the pool on the 15th floor. Room smelled amazing, perhaps it was the great Bath and Body Works complimentary toiletries in the room daily. Very clean, important to us. Lots of families with small children and teen sports teams over the weekend. Not the same frenetic pace and clientele as the Strip. Used by a lot of locals, apparently. Easy to use the self-park garage, or valet. Food was more than adequate and the prices were so reasonable, my goodness, buffet breakfast was less than a meal at a popular fast food restaurant. Loved the Mexican restaurant upstairs. Surprise was the Deli, good food, but overpriced. All staff was very friendly. Pool was awesome, lots of room when we were there. Seemed much more family oriented with the bowling alleys and theatres. Plus large equestrian centre. Researched for a couple of months before deciding on this Hotel and we HIT THE JACKPOT. Do not hesitate to recommend to families.

Reviews.Title: “For the money = 10+++, hit and miss on the service!! Dirt Biking +++++”
Reviews.Author: my_travel_CA
Reviews.Content: First time writer, long time reader. My family, wife and 3 kids (2 teenagers and 1 pre-teen) decided to spend spring break riding dirt bikes - my wife and pre-teen are not riders so going to Octellio Wells was a bore for them. So we decided to stay in Vegas and ride to many of the places around vegas (less than 40 mins away - if you want a list- Nelson Hills, Apex, etcc. just Google and you'll find list offered). So we got 2 rooms - one for the kids and one for the Mrs. and I - I tell you what, I was surprise at the cost $35.00/Room/Night - $70/night less than renting a toy hauler. The rooms were clean and big - nice to shower in a large bathroom after a day of riding. So here's a short list of: Pros - Great value for the money Coupon book with 2for1 buffet, and $25 slots (which I won $120 - not bad!!).. Clean rooms Large bathrooms Cons- Bed is not as comfortable - better than a toy hauler but not as nice as say the Marriott Casino has poor air circulation - but once in your room and floor - can't tell Hit and Miss Service - great a the cafe, poor at the cashier (need some happy pills for them!!) Away from the Strip - Great for the family, but a bit of a trouble hauling the bikes in the back and parking WIll DO IT AGAIN !!! for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel off The Strip. Good for families.”
Reviews.Author: jmjones1974
Reviews.Content: Rooms are really nice, spacious, comfortable and perfecly clean. The hotel is full of fun ameneties for families with children (pool, bowling, movies, arcade). No complaints about the service. The hotel is several miles south of The Strip, but not a problem if you have a car. We actually kind of enjoyed getting away from the crowds of the Strip and back to the hotel. The TV was nice and the beds very comfortable. We paid $40 a night and it felt like a steal. Highly recommended if you don't mind being away from the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Some good things, some bad”
Reviews.Author: mkjbs
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights with family. Long wait to check in. Though room was paid in advance, had to give credit card for $100 authorization (nothing charged to it on check out). Didn't like not knowing that. Did book great rate on room as got one night free. Had requested non-smoking room, got one, but clearly previous occupants had been smoking as room smelled terrible. Didn't want to have to wait down at desk again, so kept room and hoped the smell would diminish, (it did). Room was nice, clean, and had flat screen tv. Not crazy about walking through the casino every time to get to from rooms to main entrance, but guess can't complain since it is Las Vegas. Food at any of their restaurants (we did the buffet and cafe) was average. If you don't have a car, you can't get down to the main strip. Parking was simple and free. Nothing really around the hotel so having the bowling alley and movie theater in hotel was good (we used both). Pool area seemed a little on the small side and busy. There is an office to get tickets (some discounted) to other hotel shows. We used the office and it was helpful as we were a little disappointed in their show while there, Debbie Reynolds was the highlight (not exactly someone even close to current). Access to highway and back to airport was easy. Depends if I would recommend to friend based on what they are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “South Point , way up”
Reviews.Author: randyhuber
Reviews.Content: Very nice and felt very new property, with friendly employees and clean well maintained rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: hotelrvwr
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very good! There was one minor flaw and that was the wimpy shower head in the shower. I like alot of water pressure it was like taking a shower in a wimpy rain storm.The buffet was great! The variety of food was good. I didnt get to use the jacuzzi on the hotel premises,but my daughters thought it was nice.

Reviews.Title: “The Casino/hotel sucks”
Reviews.Author: Torpedo10x
Reviews.Content: I can't begin to list all the shortcomings of this Hotel that claims to set a new standard for Las Vegas. What a joke. It is nothing but a barn with no NONE of the glam one expects from a Vegas vacation. They have cut back on their amenities in a big way . $12.99 a DAY for internet access. $15.00 a DAY for access to a gym no bigger than your kitchen. The WORST crap odd in Vegas. An abysmal buffet. Terrible "free" drinks for players. I could go on and on. I have met friends there for three years in a row. I will NEVER go back. Check out the M resort down the road. They will put the South point out of business. Hopefully.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: alanaher
Reviews.Content: This is our third visit to the South Point, always for 1st week of March Madness. As always, we were very pleased with our stay. Check-in simple. Rooms are large, clean, and comfortable. The pool and hot tub area are great. Restaurants and bars are good (Del Mar Deli pricey). Sports betting crowded (as you would expect for March Madness) - staff pleasant (ask for drink coupon - they are not offered). Lots of penny slots and low table minimums. Shop open 24 hours (liquor, gifts, some food). Plenty of on-site parking, either in front of hotel/casino, or in parking garage. Miss the dueling pianos at the Del Mar Bar. Able to print my boarding pass at the Business Center (for a charge). Overall, a very good deal. Will be back next March.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Management - No Customer Service Skills!”
Reviews.Author: Krazy4
Reviews.Content: When we booked with Expedia, under the hotel loc it noted a Trolley service existed from the Hotel to Strip for $5.Upon arrival, we asked Hotel staff where the Trolley pickup was and they directed us to a side entrance. After 10 mins we decided to ask other Staff associates how often the Trolley ran & were shocked by their response-Trolley was discontinued in Dec.2008 & they recommended we inform Hotel Management. Discussed with Front Desk Supervisor he offered a free buffet for our inconvenience but expressed that he didn't believe that this infor existed on-line. We persisted,requested review Expedia under loc-after 15 mins he found the Trolley info. No apology occurred after incorrect info was located & still a free buffet was the offer-a $9. compensation replacing a round-trip taxi cost of $60.perday. Requested to speak to his Superior - we waited another hour - Speaking with Hotel Dir. proved fruitless except for receiving an apology. The HotelDir noted no monetary compensation or alternate transportation would be provided from the Hotel-even though Expedia website and Hotel staff had misinformed their customers. I noted we were looking at the difference between Trolley costs and Taxi-did not happen! Hotel Dir response is making Expedia aware of issue. This is Fraudulent Advertising, & the Hotel should take responsiblity, as the Trolley has not been available for 3 months and their OWN STAFF was incorrectly informing customers. We are out $50. per day for 5 days-$250 total. Had we known that NO reasonable cost transportation was available from the Hotel, we would not have booked at this hotel. Stay on the Strip for the same $ deals for a 4* rating, and avoid frustration when dealing with Hotel management's attitudes with no concern for their customers and fighting for re-imbursement!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: VernalPoole
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value. The room was huge, comfortable and clean. However, there were several drawbacks: 1) the hotel takes a $100 deposit to ensure that you will not trash your room, 2) For the most part, the food was sketchy at the buffet. The waffles and coffee were quite good though, 3) the iron was tethered to the board so you would not run off with it, 4) there were lots of tacky paintings of horses and girls with horses in my room, 5) there was a prominent sign in the bathroom about proper needle disposal and I am sure that it did not refer to diabetics, 6) there was a warning that the fire marshal was going to test the fire alarm very early in morning. Thankfully, this did not occur as I got in very late from the East Coast.

Reviews.Title: “COUGH!! SNEEZE!!, SNIFFLE!!”
Reviews.Author: vagabondaddy
Reviews.Content: too bad they don't have a clue how to keep their air clean. If I wasn't choking on the air pollution, it would have been an good stay but since I can't hold my breath for more than a few seconds, I ended up miserable the whole time. When I first walked into the room, it was beautiful but the air was horrible. I looked into the AC intake filter and saw it was caked with years worth of crud. Called the front desk and they sent up a maintenance man to change the filter. A little bald headed chap with an attitude showed up, cussed at the 2 screws he had to turn to take the cover off, proceeds to bend the filter in the middle creating a crease that breaks any chance of a seal and stormed off like he had something better to do. The windows do not open so there is no chance for fresh air unles you take the elevator down and walk past a row of 30-40 ringing machines and step outside. Something i did several times near the end of my stay. The walls are paper thin I could hear people laughing shouting from 2 rooms away. I booked for a week as I was relocating to Vegas and spent most of the day driving around looking at houses for sale. But in the evenings I would browse online listing. By the end of the week stay, my internet charges added up to $90. Yep.. a cool $12.99/ 24 hrs A service that most hotels gladly offer for free. I guess they must be ashamed to charge for the internet cuz they say on the TV menu that "only wireless requires access code, the wired internet is free. This turned out to be a blatant lie as I tried to connect with my own cable and it took me right back to the to the "pay now or no internet" page. When I asked the maintenance man what that "only wireless requires access" meant, he shrugged and rolled his eyes and pointed to the cable and repeated that it is $12.99 that requires an access code. The TV is nice. A big 42 flat screen hanging on the wall. You turn it on and it starts blaring ads for the casino. Ok, no problem, change the channel and find there are very few choices. Put it on something you want to watch and a few minutes later, it reverts back to a droning female voice suggesting over and over again "what are you waiting for, click menu now for some porno. Titles will not show on your bill. Click menu now. What are you waiting for... aaaarrrrggghhhh " Click!!! the TV is off. Over all I would not have complained about anything if the air was clean. The rooms are very nice, the garden buffet was excellent, I will go back for that sometime. Best lasagna I have had in years. But if I cant breathe, I cant stay sorry... I moved to an extended stay hotel just down the street from this place. I can breathe, I am paying less than 1/2 of the other place. Internet is free. I am happy. I feel sorry for the people that have to work there all day long day after day. It would make me physically sick as I could hardly stand 1 week of it. If they chanced all the filters regularly, and used commercial grade hepa vacuum cleaners, it would go a long way to making guests comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms but it is a casino”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravels68
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great value (seem to be available on Priceline for prices in the $40s), and are spacious with good views of the surrounding mountains. The rooms are very clean. Really the rooms are more like those at a 5 * hotel. Parking is easy at the front of the hotel They do charge a lot for internet access ($12.95 per day) and the rooms don't have fridges or microwaves. For us, the major disadvantage was that it is a casino and the rooms are there to support the casino operation. Everytime you want to enter or leave the hotel you have a pretty long walk through the smoky casino. Seeing a heavily pregnant woman smoking and gambling was not a pretty sight. We were visiting the surrounding area and so this hotel made some sense. The interstate is close by and so access is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “We will definately go back”
Reviews.Author: bunty1965
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mirage for three nights on our first trip to Vegas-I thought this hotel was nice but this would be our last visit to Vegas. But on our final night we decided to stay at the South Point for a change of scenery. We were so impressed with the South Point and have decided to definitely come back and stay here again. The rooms were beautiful and huge. The washrooms has a separate bathtub and toilet area. The only thing I did not like about any of the casino's were they all seemed to be full of smoke, even though they tried to clear the air...it still smelled of smoke. The only draw back is it was very south of the strip, but that is not necessarily a bad thing. The service at the reception was second to none. They offered to print our boarding passes for our flight. They gave us coupon books when we checked in and also an additional coupon to get a discount on our next stay. When I asked for a coupon book at the Mirage, they said they didn't have any-then when I asked someone else they told me to go the concierge...in my opinion, they should have offered it to me up front. The restaurants were excellent and there was a mixture of budget, mid and higher range restaurants. In the coupon books they gave two for one coupons, etc. The Garden Buffet for breakfast was unbelievable at $6.95 pp (and we also used a 2 for 1 coupon). The bowling alley with its 64 lanes was so impressive. My two teenage boys spent some time up there. We were totally comfortable allowing them to roam on their own. At night, there was a security guard checking to make sure we were guests before we went up the elevator. They also offer complimentary shuttle to the airport. I am looking forward to going again. We also purchased high speed internet for $12.99 us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: cef46580
Reviews.Content: We booked the room about a month ahead of time and the hotel matched the rate I found on expedia of $49 a night, which I thought was a good rate for a weekend. We got to the hotel at about 9pm and were quickly checked in. Our room was very nice and clean. In my opinion the only draw back to this hotel is its location. It is quite a bit south of the strip, we had a rental car so it worked out ok for us but it can be a pain getting back and forth to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, bet on it !!!”
Reviews.Author: Fred_Brazil_69
Reviews.Content: It was our second time in Vegas and this hotel were a great pleasure to be in. It's about 10 minutes by car from the strip but it wasn't a problem for us. We love to drive and know 'secret' places ! Go to South Point with no fear. You can bet on it !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bamandbaf
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas for the NASCAR race. We have never been to Vegas and decided to combine it with the race. We loved everything about the hotel. We did go to the strip one day and to Freemont St. another. Honestly, I didnt care for either, but was glad we went since we had never been before. Everyone at the hotel, including the people in the casino, were so nice. Did not rent a car, took taxi to and from. We had 4 people, so the cost was worth it. We were happy with that as we were drinking and didn't want to chance it. The bus to and from the race was very organized and it wasnt a long nightmare trip like everyone was saying it would be. If we go back we will be staying at Southpoint.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for a Nice Price!”
Reviews.Author: Brewfan
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at Southpoint. My wife and I were in town to do some Christmas shopping down at Primm so we decided to stay on the South end of the strip and save a little time and money. Southpoint fit the bill! The room was very clean and comfortable and the casino was open and spacious. The spa was above average and we really enjoyed having a movie theater and bowling alley right on site. Our timing was good with free rodeo events going on in the event center. Food was above average and the staff were very helpful and courteous. For $70 per night we couldn't complain. If you stay here its helps to have a rental car since you are definately off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly and home like stay, people were nice.”
Reviews.Author: mammie2cats
Reviews.Content: This place was the best of all the places I was at, because it was not on the strip. People were very friendly and nice, the place was clean. Wish we had one back home in Pa. If and when we visit again, we will come back to South Point.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel super friendly staff Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: cuttie240
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and I's first trip to Vegas. When i first booked the trip i was worried about all the other reviews i had read regarding the distance from the strip. It only takes maybe 3-5 minutes to drive to the strip, so if you rent a car, which i don't see why anyone wouldn't rent a car anyway you will be fine. Check in was fast and easy and the staff was awesome. Everyone here was friendly and super helpful. The room was really clean and the beds were so comfortable i had a hard time getting up, especially after only 2-3 hours of sleep each night. We were on our way to the hoover dam one day and this really sweet lady which worked for security gave us excellent directions, we got there with no problems at all. They have $1 roulette tables which were awesome with friendly dealers, great food, slot machines, bowling alley, movie theatre. The del taco place across the street is good, dunkin doughnuts, walmart right down the road. We stayed on the 24th floor and had a beautiful view of the mountains every morning for 8 days. We will definitely be going back. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “great room!”
Reviews.Author: mahlmeister4
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Vegas before and were only going for shows and the fun of the strip. We loved South Point because it was very nice and comfortable. The only down side was we had no rental car and the shuttle was very limited. The price was much better than a lot of the hotels on the strip and that was why we went with it. I like the fact that you can walk thru this hotel without being begged to listen to a timeshare. We hated that! Overall we were very satisfied with the hotel. Food was pretty decent too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Affordable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kosh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at South Point for one night, Sunday, Feb. 22. With the current promotion the price for a regular room is $57 including tax. We used 5,700 Citi Thank You points, so for us it was Free. The hotel's public areas and the room were immaculate. The room is a less fancy imitation of a room at the Venetian., where we stayed another time and paid four times as much. There is a 42 inch plasma TV in every room. Phones in room and bathroom. Bath and Body works Lime Coconut Verbena shampoo, conditioner, body wash, soap and lotion, and mint mouthwash. Beds extremely conformtable, and a sofa - bed in the room. When we checked in, I asked for a complimentary upgrade to a suite -- I always do this -- no harm in asking. I was told we could have a suite for $50 -- which I think is a great rate for a suite . From checking their website, I think the suites have extra amenities and are quite large. The check in woman was all smiles, and said that she could upgrade us to the 23rd floor -- out of 27 floors -- which had a beautiful view -- for free. She also gave us a coupon book which had numerous coupons such as buy one breakfast or lunch buffet, get one free, free drink, free deserts at various restaurants, and $25 free gambling money if you sign up for their "player's card." They have several lovely restaurants -- Italian, 2 steak houses, Mexican, and NY style deli, Seattles Best Coffee. They also have a showroom with featuring different types of acts and a spa offering all the services and treatments you could imagine. It looked gorgeous in the photos. We ate dinner at the Garden Buffet which cost $14.99 per person and we used a coupon in our coupon book for a free bottle of wine if you purchased 2 dinner buffets. The quality of the food at the buffet was very good and there was a fair amount of variety, including Prime Rib, Roast Turkey, Italain and Asian selections. They salad bar was excellent. In these economically distressed times, the South Point was doing a brisk business. I think this is because they provide excellent accomodations, friendly cheerfull staff and a variety of things to do and places to eat all at a VERY affordable price. The casino looked very nice and was quite busy. But we are not gamblers, as it seems to me that 95% of the money people gamble goes to the casino, and I can't afford to take that kind of risk. But if you like to gamble, South Point has all the gambling options of any major, established casino in Vegas. There were quite a few Penny slots, so if you find slot machines entertaining, you could entertain yourself for quite some time without losing too much money. The hotel also has an on site movie theatre with about 8 movies showing, and a bowling alley. They give you coupons for disounts at these also. And they have a beautiful pool area. All in all, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JOHNSTOJ2
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week-end in Vegas and stayed at the South Point Hotel. This hotel was amazing. The room was large and VERY clean. The staff was very friendly and very accommodating. The kids went to see a movie at the movie theater and there was still garbage on the floor from the previous showings. But all in all this was a beautiful place. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay in my Life”
Reviews.Author: kyhoma
Reviews.Content: I waited some time after our trip to write this review, mainly because I was so upset when we left, that I thought perhaps after some time had passed, I would also be able to remember the good parts of our stay. This did work somewhat, but the general feeling is still that I wasted a week of my life at this hotel. I will begin with the positives: The room was clean and large and nicely furnished. Our teenage son enjoyed the arcade games, although the staff there was extremely rude to him on several occasions regarding change, etc. They were always nice to me; I think they just were on a power trip and thought it was fun to be mean to the younger kids. We enjoyed the bowling alley, but the staff there was also rude and uncompromising, until I got the manager. (This was a matter of having the bumpers up for a handicapped member of our group, but "this is not allowed for people over 10 years old", even in an obvious situation.) We enjoyed the large jacuzzi pool, which was warm enough even in the unusual cold snap Las Vegas was having. (See, I did think of a few nice things. ) Here is the rest: The staff was generally rude, no matter if it was restaurant or coffee shop or front desk or bell staff. Just rude, couldn't care less if you return to this hotel or not. We booked this hotel over New Year's because we got a good price, and were counting on the shuttle to the strip, which was cancelled without notice on December 15. I have filed a complaint of false advertising with the Las Vegas Better Business Bureau. We had to use taxis a lot to accomodate a handicapped member of our group, since the bus stops were too far for her to walk. A one-way trip to the strip with taxi was minimum $25. When possible, we used the public bus, but it took more than an hour to get to the strip that way. Our 14 year old son got food poisoning in the Coronado Cafe. The front desk supervisor, Tiffany Cox, refused to comp this meal or the resulting laundry costs. This would have been a good will gesture in the total amount of about $45.00, after we were in the hotel a week and spent a great deal of money there. But as I stated before, the staff at this hotel couldn't care less if they have guests or not, apparently. By the way, I also filed a complaint with the Las Vegas Health Department regarding the food poisoning. I could go on about this dreadful experience, but to be honest, I am starting to get a headache just remembering how bad it was. Please read my other reviews, and you will see that I am generally a positive person, but I just can't do any better with this review.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, What a nice place!”
Reviews.Author: mwillkie
Reviews.Content: We had a bad experience at Caesars Palace and decided to move to South Point for the rest of our stay. It was the right thing to do, this is a great place. Check in was a breeze, the lady could not have been nicer. The room was big, new and beautiful. The bed was comfy, accept that it had some kind of plastic mattress cover that cuased me to get hot at night. The bathroom was very nice, shower was great. We ate at the buffet, it was great. We played all the table games, they were good.Made money at the slots. This place has it all, movie theatre, bowling alley, nice pool. We could not have been happier, we will be back. This would be a good place to bring your kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at South Point !”
Reviews.Author: ncreviews
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week stay at South Point Hotel, and had a WONDERFUL time!! Pros: 1. So much to do! Bowling, movie theater, large casino, lots of restaurants, arcade, equestrian center, shows, bars, night clubs, a very nice spa/gym - all right in the hotel! 2. The room! Very large, had a sofa, small table and desk, separate bathroom area from the sinks/vanity area. The bed was wonderful! 3. The view from the higher rooms are amazing. We were on the 17th floor, and had a million dollar southern view. 4. Price - Can't beat the price for the room - anywhere. 5. Staff - everyone was really nice. 6. Gift shop - we found out from an insider that the alcohol they sell at the gift shop is the lowest price - anywhere in vegas - and they were right. Really amazing prices on nice wine and premium liquor. 7. Breakfast buffet - great price for a lot of great food - be sure to use your coupon book! 8. We also really enjoyed the Mexican restaurant. 9. Cleanliness - the place is immaculate - the cleaning staff is really friendly and very efficient. 10. Very large flat screen HD TV. 11. Not far from anything - short drive to the strip and shopping. 12. We had a car - and liked being off the strip - keep in mind that all parking on the strip is free, so it's not that hard to get around down town. 13. Very nice spa and gym. (although you do have to pay to use it) 14. Great room service! Cons: 1. Paying for gym usage - this wasn't a big deal for me, it was 69 dollars for 5 days which included use of the spa - which was really nice, and worth it, in my opinion. The spa has a hot jetted tub, steam room, sauna, cooling pool, aroma therapy showers, a lounge with cool drinks, hot drinks, large flat screen tv, and plenty of places to relax. I would have like to see an option for just gym use - but again, it wasn't that big of a deal, definitely worth it if you are wanting to work out. 2. Internet fee of 12.99 per day. I looked around and most hotels in Vegas charge for Internet, I think they would get even more bookings if they offered free or reduced Internet, it is a great business hotel, and would be even better with free or reduced Internet. I can't think of any other cons - I would definitely recommend this hotel! If you like luxury and a place with lots to do that is close to every thing - this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Spa is amazing! Kevin is outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: freespiritjustsoul
Reviews.Content: Didn't stay at the hotel. Used the spa on a friend's recommendation. BEST warm stone massage I have EVER received. Kevin was my massage therapist. He is very knowledgeable about anatomy and physiology, he REDIFINES a therapeutic massage. All of the the staff were friendly, professional and respectful. The facility is gorgeous!! I wish I could stay for a week!!

Reviews.Title: “Great rate for nice big clean room but stay above 6th floor and no HD.”
Reviews.Author: augustojr
Reviews.Content: Best 4 star room rate in vegas. Nice clean, big rooms (carpet a little worn though). Staff was friendly and nice and gave me a coupon book which was a nice touch, just ask for it if you plan to spend any time in hotel, good BOGO deals and $25 in slots (which we won $24 with).
