My biggest gripe was the views. We stayed on the 6th floor and we had a nice view of the parking structure wall. See attached photo, was kind of comical. 7th floor seemed to be fine. My other gripe was that they had nice big flatscreen HDTVs, but not 1 single channel was in HD. I'm a geek and it disappointed me to say the least, and no free internet, but still a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Snakeytail
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a trip with my dad. I booked it because I found a very good deal online ($40/night). I wasn't expecting anything fancy, but the room was gorgeous. Bathroom was nice becase the shower/toilet was separate from the sink and mirror. Very decent for food. However, it is a ways from the strip, about a 10 minute drive. We rented a car so it was not a problem. Shuttles do run to and from the strip, but end rather early. This is an excellent hotel to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city, but I would recommend having a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JudyJFLA
Reviews.Content: I booked the South Point after reading scores of reviews. I cancelled my inital $52 a night reservation when I found a New Years on day $35 a night special. Even though it is a few miles south of the main strip, this was a great stay, from the friendly staff to the super clean room in great condition, I loved the lime verbena, coconut amenity collection in the bathroom each day. Also the safe was lower in the closet so I didn't for once have to get on a chair to see if I had everything out when leaving. The hotel gives a coupon book on check in that was pretty useful: a bogo breakfast or lunch buffet, a discount on the deli (huge sandwiches), free beads, free popcorn at the theatre ( great diverson) and bowling discounts. Free drinks at the mexican restaurant, and the food was reasonable and really good. The only day the casino was smoky was on the sunday of the nfl playoffs, otherwise not noticable. Parking is a bit far if you have to park in the garage, but I usually found a spot out front. Bingo was friendly and cheap and slow enough for mom to follow and I actually won $300! We requested at check-in a high floor and close to the elevator which was cheerfully honored. I played many of the slots and came home with more than I left with so a good trip. A friend joined us and it was no problem for her to get the free airport shuttle at 5:50 am, with only a phone call the evening before. I opted for a car rental from car rentals dot com with Payless for $118 for the week. Her room had 1 king bed and a sofa, ours had 2 queens and a table. All beds have duvet covers and there are alot of extra pillows. Hot water was really hot and instant. Really cool to see all the cowboys arriving for the bull riding weekend. Last tip is for shows, we booked Bette Midler at Caesars on a discount from travelzoo for $45 in the upper balcony, on arrival we were laughing coming up the escalator and the usher could see we were having a good time and upgraded out tix for free to the lower floor about 20 feet from the stage, $250 tix. A great show, made even better by Ryan the usher! After seeing alot of Vegas all week, we were overjoyed each evening to return to the South Point, our new home in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “great value, large clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travel2Eat
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights in deluxe king non-smoking room. Primary purpose of visit was a tradeshow. Room was large with excellent housekeeping. Safe in closet was larger than many. Room had king bed, two nightstands, desk/chair, couch, coffee table, armoire with TV. Drawers in armoire did not have that nasty old/fake-wood smell that hotel drawers often have. Coffeemaker is the little single-cup with disposable brew pouch holder variety. But nice to have coffee in the room! Large vanity but only one sink. Plenty of hot water, bow-shaped shower rod. Toilet and shower are in separate room, which is convenient. Checkin was quick, and all employees that we encountered were pleasant. We did not gamble on this visit nor did we eat at the SouthPoint. Negatives: - the long hike from the parking garage to the room (and through the casino area), but it is no longer (and probably shorter) than many casino hotels. - wireless internet did not work for me. Used wired, which limited use to the desk area. Charge is $12.99 per 24-hr period. All in all a great experience and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel as always”
Reviews.Author: My_kids_Mom6
Reviews.Content: Second time stay here. I enjoyed it as always. The outdoor hot tub was open for the winter even though the big pool was closed for the season. Loved sitting outside by the hot tub and soaking in the sunshine. Lots of other people doing the same. The staff was great. The buffet is wonderful. Make sure you use your "2 for 1" buffet coupon that you get at check-in. Watch for on-line special rates at the hotel website and book early as the special rates sell out. Love the flat screen tvs in the rooms. I like the new-ness of this hotel. And, I actually like being away from the strip because its easier to drive around. Easy off ramp from the expressway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Odds!”
Reviews.Author: SouthWestBound
Reviews.Content: Our short (but intense) 2-night stay at the South Point was worth every penny, especially considering the great rate we obtained months ago. Their website does not lie and we found our room to be quite luxurious, compared to what we were previously used to. It was clean and everything worked just fine. The King size bed was very comfortable as were the oversized pillows. The bath products provided are really cool too. The shower aptly delivers. It’s great to have a 42” flat screen TV but the cable package is very (very) limited and not in HD so that sort of kills the deal a bit. The view from our room (5th floor) was a nice big cement wall. But we did not go to Vegas to stay in our room and watch TV so no big deal. Being away from the strip area is actually a plus because you’re not stuck in traffic when you’re heading back and it’s quieter all around. The casino itself seems just like any other and we don’t gamble so we can’t really advise you one way or the other. We had brunch at the Garden Buffet which was OK considering we used the two-for-one coupon given to us upon checking in. But I would have been reluctant to pay $13 for that quality of food. We also tried the Del Mar deli and as reported, one sandwich is good enough for two “normally proportioned” individuals. And satisfying enough for those with a BIG appetite. The convenience/gift/liquor shop is second to none for liquor prices. I had the opportunity to compare certain product prices with supermarket prices and South Point beat them by an average of 5-10% so there’s no need to drive elsewhere to get your libations. They obviously understand the concept of one-stop shopping and apply it without taking their guests for idiots (compared to places who charge airport-like prices). Overall, we would definitely return to the South Point providing such advantageous rates are still made available. If you’re renting a car, it’s the best deal in Vegas! Tip: if you booked Cirque du Soleil tickets in advance for pickup at the venue, don’t wait until show time to get them unless you’re sure to be there more than an hour before. If like us you go to Red Rock Canyon for the day and your plan is to swing by the venue around 16h00-16h30 to pick up your tickets (for the 19h00 show), go back to the South Point to freshen up and make it back to the strip, you might have a surprise. Because of the heavy traffic and the time it takes to make it to the venue, park, queue up for the tickets and finally have them in hand, you realize you’ll have no time to go back to the South Point, shower, drink a bit and come back. So instead, we got “stuck” having drinks at Wolfgang Puck (MGM) and paying airport prices. But it was fun anyway and we enjoyed every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: fastandfurious4
Reviews.Content: I love staying at South Point. The rooms are new, bright and very nicely decorated. I love the brightness of the hotel and casino. The staff were all great. The cocktail waitress's are friendly however a tad bit slow getting around to taking your order while your playing. The hotel is located just before you get to the strip which makes it easy to get in and out of and still close enough to access everything on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for us!”
Reviews.Author: BThiele
Reviews.Content: We booked a great hotel at a fantastic price for a Saturday night in Las Vegas. This hotel will work out best for those that have a rental car. We loved the size of the room and the comfortable bed. Every employee that we had contact with was very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Good locals casino (far from main strip)”
Reviews.Author: fulkgl
Reviews.Content: I am a gambler, so casinos will often "comp" my rooms and meals. "Comp" means complimentary, free. This trip was my first visit to South Point, and the hotel room was free before I arrived. So I can't comment on the room rates. Location (poor). This is a locals hotel and casino. Yes, it is on the strip, but many miles south of Madalay Bay and the rest of the strip hotels and casinos. If you are planning to visit the "real" strip or downtown you will need a rental car. The good news is that cheap rental cars are easy to get in LV. The hotel is supposed to have a shuttle, but I didn't try it. I just rented a cheap car. Room (very good). Enough room and nicely appointed. I don't spend much time in my room (other than shower and sleep) when in LV. Maid service did a good job and everything appeared to be in working order. One very big negative is the internet (see below). Temperature controls were quiet. That's a big plus for me since I'm a light sleeper. Internet access (very bad). Like a lot of hotels SP is trying to grossly overcharge customers for internet access. Only the hotel's hotspots can be found on this property. Some center strip hotels you can access hotspots outside your hotel, but not at SP. Both the wifi and wired connections are unbelievably expensive. Stay away from it. I'd drive down the street to a Starbucks or McDonalds and use their wifi service instead. Gambling (good). I didn't see anything to call overwhelmingly great or terrible. Note, many LV casinos have significantly worsened their rules in recent years. In fact, LV is no longer my favorite destination for solely gambling purposes because so many places have worsened their rules. SP is ok. SP's cage and club are much too slow. I saw 2 hour lines that the player's club. Food (fair). Quality was good in the buffet and ok in the cafe. Prices were too high in my opinion. My meals were paid for, but I don't know if I'd go there without the comps. Atmosphere (cowboy). You'll swear your in the old west. A high percentage of the patrons walk around with cowboy hats, fig leaf sized belt buckles, boots and jeans. If you like red necks and cowboys, you'll love it. Note, they have many rodeo and similarly related events in the arena here. Family (fair). I don't like kids in a casino. Like too many LV locations you can't get anyplace without going through the middle of the casino floor: front desk, parking garage, room access, restaurants, everything goes through the casino. After going through the casino floor you can access the arena, movie theaters, bowling lanes. There are things for families to do here. But I don't like that the kids and strollers have to go through the middle of the casino all the time. Smoke (bad). Like a lot of casinos the smoke handling is rather poor. I'm surprised because a newer location like SP should have built in better smoke handling. On a Saturday night, it's bad. Parking (good). Easy access to LV Blvd (many miles south of the real strip), to I-15. Quick and easy getting to and from the airport. Much easier than center strip locations. Valet was reasonably quick, and Summary best: rooms worst: smoke handling

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay ever in LV”
Reviews.Author: phxazdave
Reviews.Content: Stayed 12/30/08-01/02/09 King bed/new tower About a 1 minute wait to check-in at 4:30, yet it would be an hour for the bell staff to deliver bags to room. Explain that. Long walk from parking garage to room tower. The room was large, but not even completely furnished. Coffee table along with the table and chairs by the window in their picture didn't exist.. Since we rarely spend much time in the room, it really didn't matter to us, but this is a LV first for us, a partially furnished room. The sheets and pillowcases were tattered, and the 42" tv was mounted crooked on the wall. The bathroom was large but only had a single sink. The closet with a safe was nice (but we didn't sit in the closet or watch the safe). Went to Don Vitos at 8;30 (opens at 5) which wasn't busy (I later would know why) and were told they ran out of lasagne. Probably the busiest period in LV and they run out of lasagne in their Italian restaurant. Explain that. Service was terrible and phony. Waited about 10 minutes after salad for main course (I upgraded the salad to a Caesar for $1 as their menu suggested. The salad I got was the same as a regular, no additional items in it). Waiter suggested an alternative to the lasagne which I took, with regret expressed. The pasta had the texture of beef jerky, and the sauce and italian sausage tasted acidic. The waiter came by and asked if everything was good, to which I said 'no'. Without breaking stride he patted me on the back and said 'atta-boy'. Needless to say, little of this dish was eaten. When resaurant management was made aware of the food quality and service, their solution was 'come back and we'll comp the meal'. Like we would ever eat there again. That night, I got very sick, unable to even leave the room til 2pm the next day. Gee, wonder what caused that? The room's temperature was fine, but the rest of the property was terribly hot. Patrons, as well as staff, complained of this throughout our duration there. It was uncomfortable, and coupled with the worst drink service we have ever seen in LV, it wasn't fun to game. In 25+ hours of gaming, I was offered 5 drinks. Maybe the beverages were being shipped in with the lasagne. Ashtrays in the casino were rarely emptied, and empty glasses rarely picked up (although, there weren't many of those around as drinks were rarely offered). Bingo parlor was nice, big easy to read number boards. But the NY Eve bingo session wasn't a lot of fun. 600 people jammed in there, in the heat, for 4 1/2 hours. (There was one break). We drove, so we weren't stranded there. With no shuttle being offered anymore to the strip, your stuck (unless you pay $$$$ for a cab or opt for what looks like a long bus trip). This place is in the boonies, nothing really at all within walking distance. So save time, money and enjoy LV, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A Lotta Bang For The Buck---Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: ROCNRIOS
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note after returning from 3 days at South Point. HOLY COW!! My buddy and I travel to Vegas every year for the NFL playoffs. Thought Id give this place a try.......worth every penny! 1) Incredible sports book. 2) Great rooms with 42 plasmas. 3) Every meal was a delight. 4) The outfits on the waitresses are incredible! 5) Only $15.00 more a night than PRIMM! 6) A Spa for men and women that is like a private country club. 7)Workout room with a T.V. on every machine. 8) Pool and Jacuzzi that rival Caesars. 9)Wives are going to love it too! Only complaint was one pissy waitress. She probably wont be there long. Everyone else appreciated having us--and treated us like kings. Our place to stay from now on!! James

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: disappointed03
Reviews.Content: NO SHUTTLE (false advertising). We were assured that we would have access to free shuttle service ( or we would have booked closer to the strip). We had to spend a small fortune on taxi cabs, or suffer 2-3 hour bus trips. Call ahead days early if you even want to take an airport shuttle, or you won't get one. The shuttle also leaves too late for early flights out. Also, travelers beware of the rooms with a poor view. Cheaper rates also mean "bad views". We were not told this upon booking our room, and we had to pay additional money for an okay view of the empty pool below. The other choice was a brick wall. Advise: Ask lots of questions and get it in writing before you book with South Point.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay...”
Reviews.Author: erldprl
Reviews.Content: The South Point is one of the best hotels in Vegas if you want to get away from it all without breaking the bank. This is my 4th stay here and the place gets better all the time. Was here for business and vacation so it worked out great for me. Was able to rent a car and stay and extra night for about 1/2 what the other strip hotels wanted. There was no noise in the hotel that I noticed so it was very relaxing. I can tell that the word of mouth is getting around since the place was much busier than I had seen in past stays. Also found another hidden gem which is Fox Car Rental which is just a stones throw from the SP. It looks like all the construction is done on the second tower so that is great to. Thanks again for a great Stay SP staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: awesomebillfans
Reviews.Content: Just back from the South Point and our stay was wonderful. The entire staff with whom we had contact were very helpful and always pleasant to deal with. If we needed anything, the response was swift and always in a very pleasant manner. The atmosphere throughout was very enjoyable and provided us with a very worthwhile stay. The hotel and casino are a nice break from the strip which looks more like a construction zone rather than a vacation destination. Access to and from the property is easy and convenient. This allowed us to visit many more of the Las Vegas places of entertainment, dining and attractions with out spending an hour trying to navigate the strip for an hour just to get in or out of our hotel. Free self parking is very conveniently located at the South Point. We had a rental car so we did not have to listen to the cadre of complainers who wanted the shuttle to run on "THEIR" schedule rather than one that best fits the majority of the patrons. This is our second stay at the South point and definately will not be our last. The casino is very well lit and not cramped together like many of the properties on the main part of the strip. We did not win a fortune but we also did not lose. The return on our gambling dollar was very reasonable and playing the various games was extremely enjoyable. Dining was enjoyable and reasonably priced. Everyone we talked to at the hotel and in the casino had nothing but praise for the facility and the staff. The South Point has been and continues to be our choice of places to stay and gamble in Las Vegas and trust me, we have stayed on the strip at Places like the MGM, Luxor etc... and this beats them all for our buck. If all you can do is complain, maybe you ought to rethink what your idea of a vacation is or go elswhere. For us, we will continue to stay at South Point.

Reviews.Title: “Its a long way to the Strip if you want to Rock n Roll”
Reviews.Author: KiwiR0b
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the South Point Casino based on Trip Advisor reports and found it to be a very pleasant hotel next to the Freeway on the edge of the city . The Hotel was large with plenty of free parking ,it also had a very efficient valet check in service which we used as it was raining and cold ! Check in was very quick and the check in clerk very helpful in telling us about the facilities and how to get to the strip which is another story . The rooms we had were on a non smoking floor and cost us $107.90 for 2 nights INCLUDING 2 garden buffets ,free fitness center entry and 4 free cocktails . This is a promotion South Point Run and the offer code is BBFAVPKG. We had a super king bed in a spacious room that was all you would expect of a 3 to 4 star hotel . Had to say even tho i am not big at 190lbs the towels were tiny and made me think we had stumbled on a small persons bathroom ! One thing about Vegas that bugs us is how people smoke in just about every space , even the elevator ! Jerks... The food was nothing to write home about and we only ate at the Garden Buffet once and went out to eat . Since South Point is out of Las Vegas you can either drive in or catch the Shuttle to the Mandalay Bay . It takes 15-20 minutes dependant on traffic and was a pain in the butt . We are going to Vegas in Jan 09 and will stay nearer to the Strip at the Hilton . Its a good value hotel that will appeal to those looking for value and larger rooms .

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel. I think my new favorite in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jason7772
Reviews.Content: Large hotel casino about 10 minute drive south of the south end of the strip. They have a large parking garage or you may use valet. Check-in about 3pm was quick compared to others I have been to. It took about 10 minutes wait in line and about 5 minutes or less once to the desk. Reserved a high floor smoking king and that is what I got. Great view looking north across the city toward the strip. Upon entering room I was very impressed. Clean!! Large flat panel on the wall. Bed was very comfy with like 5 large pillows on the bed. Large clean bathroom stocked with Bath & Body Works products. If you like to talk on the phone while in the bathroom you can do it here. Casino has many slots, table games, video poker, a sports book, race book for parimutual races. I found the buffet to be reasonably priced and quite tasty. Prime rib on Wednesday was $15. Included an Asian station, seafood, mexican, bbq, italian, salad bar, dessert bar. Service was friendly and attentive. Hotel has several other restaurants, bars, gift shop, business center, movie theatre, arcade for the kids. I ordered room service once and it came in about 30 minutes. A little pricey but very good. I played slots and had good luck on the penny machines. Hotel was built in 2005 and is in very good condition. Housekeeping took good care of me and kept me in towels, made the bed and left bath products. About 4 miles south of the strip but an easy, quick drive if you have a car. I found other guests to be friendly also. Not your "strip" crowd. They charged my CC a $100 incidental deposit with the unused funds returned as credited on the card 4 days after check-out. Loved it, almost luxurious. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Terror”
Reviews.Author: Penguinone
Reviews.Content: Don't be deceived : the South Point is not a classy hotel. Their non-smoking areas were poorly marked and very small, and complaints to the staff about such were literally mocked ("This is Las Vegas" -- oh, I didn't notice). The staff didn't know their way around their own casino, and the advertised free shuttle to the strip was magically 'discontinued' just before our stay. Definitely a casino with hotel-like pretences -- they didn't seem to care about their guests at all.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Service”
Reviews.Author: Neg123
Reviews.Content: Bad Garden Buffet service, terrible food, negative disabled services

Reviews.Title: “almost everything was amazing. . . .”
Reviews.Author: redcat93
Reviews.Content: We didn't really know what we were getting into because we booked our stay through Priceline, but after we arrived and settled in, we only had one complaint! Our room was spacious and clean (we had a problem with the toilet leaking, but the hotel took care of it very quickly)- casino has great variety (although SUPER SMOKY in certain areas)- wonderful food options (cafe is the BEST value. delicious food!!). There's also a huge bingo hall, pool, bowling, and a movie theatre! It's also supposed to be a spa, but after trying to get assistance over the phone- (no one ever answered) then going down to the spa desk to ask my questions and getting the RUDEST JERK EVER- I decided not to waste my time. (and that was a major disappointment, since the spa was one of the things I was most looking forward to!) Everything else was wonderful wonderful wonderful. I would stay there again in a heartbeat! (and I'll take the shuttle to another hotel's spa!! you snooze, you lose South Point!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellant value”
Reviews.Author: curatokid
Reviews.Content: Stayed there before and returned to find hotel as good as ever with very competitive rates ( ask for best rate) if I had to find fault I think that the food and service has declined in the Garden Buffet but still good value, I would never stay on the strip when you can use valet parking at any hotel for a couple of dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikenchris
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at South Point over X-Mas with family..We booked a 2 bedroom luxury suite ..Room was gorgeous and clean..Each bedrooom had an unbelieveable shower and seperate large tub..My kids were happy, my wife was happy..Casino is nice , not as crowded as the casinos on the main part of the strip..We rented a car and it was a quick 15 minute drive to the main strip , so we got to enjoy all of Vegas but went back home to South Point..I highly recommend especially if you are travelling with family and kids..

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: rogersnet
Reviews.Content: South Point is off the Strip, but great for visiting relatives that live near Henderson,NV. Fairly new, large & clean rooms & casino. Hotel has movies, bowling, pool, etc...family friendly. Great price over Christmas! Locals use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Southpoint Hotel rip off scam”
Reviews.Author: trailboss05
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite nice,clean, smoky everywhere,good service at resturants and bars. I got ripped off with some sort of scam from the maid service and Hotel administration.I was there for my 50th birthday with my girlfriend and was accused of damaging the room, days after I left.They just charged a room damage charge of $75.00 to my credit card with no authourization or notification,no report,no pictures to back their allegation.Poor service at registration and hotel management.I spent minimun time in the room and I am not the type to damage a room. I left money for the maid service and within 3 minutes of walking out of the room, the money was gone after I came back to the room with another $10.00 that I was going to leave but didn't after that. Just as well as they ripped me off after I went home. They offered no help at the hotel administration to recover this allegation.Beware of their scam!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel off the strip - right place at the right price”
Reviews.Author: OhBrian
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here while in Vegas for my son's basketball tournament. My wife & I don't like staying on the strip because its too much of a zoo, so this seemed like a good alternative. The hotel is located about five miles south of the strip and has great acess from the freeway. Plus it has a large outside parking lot, so you don't have to valet park your car (in Vegas it can take a long time to get your car when its valet parked). The rooms are nice - they are good sized, very clean, newer furniture and ours had a large plasma TV, which was a plus. All in all, a very good hotel at a very reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “South Point Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: Grey75t
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here about five differnet times for business. It is fairy new and in a great location for a salesman. It is at the far south end of the strip and is easy to get around and avoid traffic. The rooms are great and the prices are very low compaired to others hotels that are similar. They ahve great places to eat within the hotel and friendly staff. The parking is fairly close to the hotel if you want to self park which makes it nice. Location is great for stores, gas, etc.. Stay here if you want a great hotel at a great low price.

Reviews.Title: “Magical birthday party event”
Reviews.Author: lans98
Reviews.Content: My first stay at the Southpoint Hotel was in May, 2008 and I enjoyed every aspect. I coordinated a Special Birthday Event involving over 75 people and the Southpoint Hotel selection for lodging only could not have been better. I worked with the Sales & Catering Department and found them to be professional and accommodating. This event took place Oct. 2-6, 2008 and every single guest who stayed at the Southpoint enjoyed the facility. Over the past 25 years my husband and I try to visit Las Vegas at least once or twice a year and would always stay on the Strip (in the block where Caesar's Palace is located) BUT FROM THIS POINT ON WE WILL MOST LIKELY STAY AT THE SOUTHPOINT. Since we always rent a car, we did not have the opportunity to use the Hotel Shuttle services, however, many of the guests did and they found it to be satisfactory, and did not register one complaint with me. I have dined at all of the restaurants, with the exception of one, and was pleased with the food. I must admit that the Oyster Bar at Harrah's is still better than Southpoint, however, that is just my personal opinion. My closing comments are: If you enjoy immaculate comfortable large rooms -stay at the Southpoint Hotel. If you enjoy delicious reasonably priced food- stay at the Southpoint Hotel. If you enjoy having the option of participating in recreational activities other than gambling, such as bowling, bingo, and going to a Movie Theater, stay at the Southpoint Hotel. If you like easy access to and from the hotel, stay at the Southpoint Hotel. *I definitely look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “South Point - OK”
Reviews.Author: PburgTravel
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a friend's 50th Birthday Party at the South Point, in Las Vegas. The Casino, Hotel, Spa, and Equestrian Center are nice. Two Positive Comments First - rooms were simple, clean and spacious. We stayed in a regular king room. Worked fine for a Vegas Vacation. Second - the casino was good, although the venilation was sub-par, as cigarette smoke seemed to always be around you. Two negative comments. First - The food was just OK. Very dissapointed in the buffet and the cafe. We did eat one night the italian restaurant, and it was good. But the buffet reminded me of a low end - all inclusive mexican resort. Second - You are seven miles south of Mandalay Bay, so it is a $30 cab ride (each way) if you want to go to the strip for a show, etc. So if you are in Vegas for an extended time, you may get bored at the Point, or have some cab/car fares to deal with. Overall the service and property was good.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Vegas Deal”
Reviews.Author: KittyChan
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed at South Point (SP) five times, and the place keeps growing on me. (I was last there in July '08, and I'll be there again at the end of December '08.) I've stayed at many of Vegas's storied Strip hotels, from the Venetian to THEHotel and most of the big places in between, but for most of my frequent visits to Sin City, SP has become my hotel of choice. Why? My reasons are pretty much the same as those of my fellow TA reviewers: SP's excellent rooms, very low prices, and high standards of comfort and cleanliness. True, the hotel is only 3 years old, but it still seems brand new, no mean feat given its huge size and, er, less than high-end clientele. If you want glitz, glamour, and high prices, dozens of Vegas hotels can meet those desires. If, however, you want a spacious, very comfortable room that's quiet, relaxing, and well equipped, surf the web for SP's best room rates. (Hint: they're not usually found on the hotel's own web site, although SP promises to match any bonafide rate you find elsewhere; I had them make good on that promise once, and SP matched the rate I found on Expedia.) I've never paid more than $50 a night. At that rate, SP is a true Vegas bargain. A bit more on the rooms: at a minimum, you'll get a large room with a king or queen bed, a huge (42") plasma TV, and a great bathroom with the best amenities I've encountered in a Vegas hotel: Bath & Body Works Coconut and Lime products -- they smell good enough to eat! The higher-floor rooms have great views over Vegas, the mountains, and/or the desert; SP's cottoned to the appeal of the higher-floor rooms and recently introduced a three-tier price scheme for its basic ("Deluxe") rooms, charging more for "mid" and "higher" floors. Again, I recommend booking via a website other than the hotel's and then making your room request once you arrive; I've had good results doing so. SP's location is also, at least for me, a strong point. It's a few miles south of -- but only a few minutes by car via either LV Boulevard or I-15 from -- the Strip, and it's very easy to access and park at the hotel, something you can't say for most of the Strip properties. Unlike most huge Vegas hotels, SP has no discernible theme: it's bland, but in a pleasant, welcoming way; and I find the decor a welcome relief after dining and gambling at the sequined palaces on the Strip. SP's casino is airy and bright, and while it has as many smokers as any other big casino in Vegas, it seems less smoky. Even when crowded, there always seems to be enough space between you and all of the other gamblers and blinking machines. In short, SP deserves its hundreds of rave reviews and high ranking on TA. Give it a try, and I bet you'll appreciate your time on the Strip more by staying at South Point.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: catch2222
Reviews.Content: Ok, so this is my second review now. We first stayed at Buffalo Bills in Primm. It was our first trip to las Vegas and we wanted to see it all. I would recommend doing it this way if you've never been it gives the opportunity to see the adjacent hotels and you don't feel like you're going too far from your hotel. Ok, now for the review. We arrived 3 hours early with the intention of gambling for a bit and then checking in. When we got to the desk checking in that early was NO problem. The counter staff was very nice and helpful. Make sure when you check in you get the coupon book for the hotel there are some great values in it. I think we used almost every coupon in the 3 days we stayed there, everything from buffet coupons, to bowling coupons. When we got up to the room we were amazed at the size and cleanliness of the room. We had a non smoking room, and to our surprise it didn't smell of smoke like the rest seem to. We had everything we needed in the room, a nice TV, a nice shower, and really nice beds. The view was not all that great as we were able to look at the building right beside, and nothing else but who goes to look out the window right? The pool and hot tub are just beautiful. Unfortunately they close at 5 pm so if you want to go for a swim make sure it's early. There were always clean towels out there, and I even felt safe leaving my stuff on a chair when I went to swim. The Casino is quite large and offered a nice variety of games. The service was really fast in the casino as well. Your drink was still cold when they got it to you. The gambling was good as well, some win some lose, I won I'm not saying millions, but I won enough to keep me in the casino and having a good time. The food choices are good, we ate the buffet which was probably the best we had all week in Vegas as far as selection and quality goes. We also ate at the deli, with a coupon from check in. Upon looking at the menu, it seems over priced but it's really not, the portions are just huge. We also did the bowling which was a lot of fun. With the coupon from check in 2 of us bowled 3 games for 13 dollars including shoe rental. This casino was the nicest we stayed at all week, the price was right and I'm already booking it for my return next year. But I will be staying there all week instead of bouncing around.

Reviews.Title: “South Point - Great Value Off-Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cazzvant
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the South Point in August 08 for one week. We knew when booking that the South Point was a 15 minute drive south of the Strip and thought we would be fine taking the shuttle provided from the hotel. Unfortunately, we hadn't bargained on the temperature being 113 degrees in the shade and found hiring an air-conditioned car was far more suitable for us! We were able to visit all the hotels, casinos and malls on the Strip and parking was free in the self-park garages available at all the Strip hotels. The South Point was a great hotel and easy to navigate, despite its size. The rooms were very clean, spacious and well equiped. We did especially like the complimentary Bath & Body Works toiletries, which we are now trying to purchase in the UK! There were plenty of eateries in the hotel, the Deli was great value and the food really good. There are a host of amenities at this hotel - pool, cinema, bowling alleys but we didn't use any of these as we just wanted a base for exploring Vegas. In all, we had a great time at the South Point and would definitely use it again when we return to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: BigSausage
Reviews.Content: After reading a ton of reviews about this hotel we decided to give it a try. I was somewhat apprehensive about staying so far from the strip but seeing it was a straight shot up las Vegas Blvd I decided to give it a shot. The check in was no problem, the clerk was nice and very efficient,had the room key in my hand in less then five minutes. The room to my surprise was everything and more as discussed on this forum, large but with no view but I didn't come to Vegas to look out the window. The whole experience from room to food to the casino was top notch and well worth the small amount we paid for the room, I would recommend a stay for anyone who doesn't mind the short drive or catching the hotel bus to the strip. I think you may enjoy the stay as much as we did !

Reviews.Title: “Good with Some Issues”
Reviews.Author: MarcoPolo555
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Point Hotel in September 2008. Our visit was nice and comfortable but there were some issues with the hotel, mainly with customer service. Hotel: The hotel is family friendly and nice looking, but don’t expect the extravagant look of other Vegas hotels. It is new and absolutely okay-looking, but the décor is plain. The reason we chose it was the children’s entertainment. They have a movie theatre, bowling and arcade. The arcade was lots of fun for the kids, but we never got to bowl – the wait on a Saturday night was about 90 minutes. The casino, pool and gift shop were good. Rooms: The rooms were clean and comfortable, and to our surprise, very spacious. That was good because the kids didn’t feel too crowded. I agree with another reviewer – the towels were too small/thin, but the sheets were especially soft and luxurious. However, the furniture and décor were very plain and simple. We didn’t care because we traveled with friends and were more interested in the company than in a fancy look. Restaurants: The first night we ate at Coronado Café. It was a disaster. Out of 11 entrees, only one was edible. Most of us didn’t touch the food, which was cold and tasteless. The dishes didn’t arrive together, the service was extremely slow and sloppy, and the waiters hardly understood English. They even forgot some of the items we ordered, which wasn’t a big loss anyway. Prices were cheap, but what good is it if you can’t eat your food? Don’t waste your time there. In the morning we ate at Garden Buffet. That was a much better experience than the night before. For breakfast, it’s completely okay, and not expensive. The selection was rich and food was good+. They have different sections (Mexican, Italian, American, Asian, etc.), and everybody can find something to eat - absolutely recommended for breakfast. Service was better than at the café. Then at night we ate at Primarily Prime Rib. It was nice. The only problem was that they couldn’t accommodate such large group as ours (24 people), so we had to sit in two separate tables, but it was worth it. Although we experienced better food at other fine dining restaurants, this one had absolutely great food for the prices. The portions were big and the wine was good, the selection was average, and the food was good++, but not extraordinary or unique. However, no one was disappointed. The service was wonderful and extra quick, and the waiters were super nice. When my husband asked for jalapeno, which they didn’t have, they ran to the restaurant next door to get him some. If you don’t want to leave the hotel or spend big bucks at the other hotels, Prime Rib is totally acceptable for a nice dinner. Customer service: This is where the hotel needs the most improvement. Because of the size of our party, we had to make multiple phone calls/reservations. Every representative gave us different information about everything, and some were very unprofessional on the phone. They made an error and gave someone in our group the key to someone else’s room. That was outrageous. Luckily, it was people who knew each other, but I’ve never heard of an error like this – a stranger getting the key to your room! When the guests who originally had the room tried to get in, their key was deactivated so they were locked out. It took the front desk a long time to figure out the error and fix it, and they barely apologized for the mistake. We had to go to higher management for that. They should really train their staff better. To summarize, the hotel is nice and we recommend it, especially if you travel with kids, but keep your expectations on the low side and avoid Coronado Café. For the hotel's low rates - it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to return to the South Point”
Reviews.Author: marlegal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the South Point from Oct 5 through 9, 2008. Could not believe how large the room was for the price paid. Watch for Internet special rates even after you book. As long as you booked online through the hotel's site, they'll honor any special offers that are posted for your time frame. The buffet was wonderful for both breakfast and dinner, especially with the coupon for a free bottle of wine (full size). I booked a facial at the spa with another friend and we spent hours there just enjoying the pools and showers after we were done. The staff at the spa in particular were extremely helpful whenever we asked for something extra. We had a group of 20 for dinner at Don Vito's restaurant. We weren't happy with the seating arrangement and the hostess totally redid a section of the restaurant so that we could all sit together. The food there was first rate. I used the shuttle to go to the airport on departure - left on time and smooth ride to the airport. The only drawback for some might be the distance from the strip - I'd say 15 minutes by car - but I've stayed on the strip before and didn't feel the need to be so close this time. We went up two nights to the strip, once by private bus for our group of 20, another night by cab. Overall, I couldn't have been more pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Stay, Laid Back, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Son_of_a_Sailor_51
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the end of February, beginning of November. The following are our observations and comments. Arrival: Shuttle was at LAS at the appointed time of 1:30pm. Our flt arrived early so we had to wait a bit, but nothing major. (will comment more on the shuttle(s) at the end of this review.) Check-in: Fast, courteous and extremely friendly. We were given a hotel map, coupon book, by a very personable woman. She gave us the feeling that she was really glad we chose South Point. (Unfortunately her name slips our minds) Room: Clean, spacious, nice view of the pool. The beds and linens were comfy. The bathroom was great, as the sink, mirror etc were separate from the toiler and bath/shower. The rooms were spotless every day. We were so impressed, we tracked down our housekeeper, and thanked her, and gave her a little extra spending money. Casino: Had most of the usual slots/games/tables as the other bigger casinos, but it was great not to have to walk too far to anything. We enjoyed ourselves, especially since we took "their" money home with us...woohoo. (and the cocktail waitresses are frequent) Buffets/Restaurants: We had no problem in choices of something to eat. If we found something in the buffet that was not to our liking, we simply tried another item. The deli makes a killler Pastrami sandwich, big enough for two. Also, the 75 cent hotdogs on Sunday football was a nice treat, with a cold beer. No complaints in the food department. Bowling Alley/Theatres: We had a look, but did not use. We both thought it would have been nice to have something like this when our kids were younger, so that they could cut loose on their own for a while. There were alot of kids there, but they were having a good time. Pool Area: We lay outside for a couple of hours, as the weather was nice. The pool area is nicely laid out, and the big whirlpool jetted spa was really relaxing. A couple of comments: 1. Alot has been mentioned in the reviews about the Shuttle service. We reserved the "Airport" shuttle 24 hours in advance for our pick-up. No problems. The same again for the return to the airport. This shuttle drops/pick-up in the main entrance to the hotel. The "Mandalay Bay" shuttle runs approximately on the hour from South Point. This shuttle leaves from the north side of the casino. Depending on traffic, it was no real problem. (note: according to the Mandalay Bay shuttle driver, this service will end December 14th.) We feel that the hotel should keep it, as its a nice selling point to be able to hop aboard and then catch the tram to the Excalibur. There are taxis, but they are gonna cost you about $45 return. 2. Smokey Casino. Much more than the casino at the Mandalay Bay. We attributed this to the casino being packed both Saturday and Sunday night. Maybe their system cannot keep up, but if you are a non-smoker you will notice. 3.Internet is not free. It will cost you approx $12 for 24 hours, but we looked around at a couple of other hotels and this seems to be the norm. Again it would be a nice selling point, if they didn't charge or gave you an hour free a day, or something like that. Overall we had a good time. We both agreed that the staff at this hotel was one of the more accomodating and friendly that we have dealt with in sometime. Another trip down the pipe...Later from Ladner

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, a few annoyances”
Reviews.Author: outofottawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Point with our two children, ages 8 and 11. We were on the whole pleased with our experience. Valet parking was quick and prompt for both drop off and pick up. Check in was fast. Our room was large and very comfortable for the four of us. The bathroom was large with a separate room for the toilet and shower/tub. A nice plus when travelling with family. The pool area is large and well laid out. The buffet restaurant was fine enough. Not spectacular, but still okay. We enjoyed the bowling as we never did this as a family beforehand though it was quite pricey. I did enjoy the casino experience as well. The down sides: 1) I was very surprised that any extra guests above the first two in a room, over the age of 5 , are charged as additional "adult" guests. I have never experienced this low a cut off in age and I have stayed at Westins, Ritz Carltons, Fairmonts etc. 2) My children were charged the full adult fare at the buffets. How much can my 8 and 11 year olds eat? 3) There is an extra fee to use the gym. I understand that the hotel wants everyone at the tables rather than the gym but still. 4) Internet charges. I cannot recall but was around $12 / day. I know this is often the norm but still annoying. I would stay here again but would prefer if management did not nickel dime families. I could only surmise that management is not very interested in families staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Totally satisfied customer”
Reviews.Author: Sebastien313
Reviews.Content: We spent one week at the South Point from October 27 to november 3rd. It was great. The room is big and very spacious, so is the bathroom. The in-room safe is very useful since we came down from Canada and had a lot of money and our passport to put away. Check in took about 5 minutes, the staff was friendly and helpful when we needed something. We ate at the Silverado Steakhouse, the buffet, Don Vito's, the Coronado Cafe and the Del Mar deli. The food was very good everywhere. The pool area was nice and the bingo room was fun, even if the games were a little bit boring. The shuttle from the airport is a very good thing, so was the shuttle that bring us to the strip. We never waited more then 10 minutes for the shuttle. The poker room is tiny but it's really fun and relax to play there. They give a coupon book when you check in, use it, you'll save some money!! We recommend this hotel to everyone, it's a great and quiet place to stay and we won't hesitate to come back here!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Fine "Value, Strip-Style" Las Vegas Resort/Hotel/Casino/Spa”
Reviews.Author: Bengali_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel/Resort/Casino for 4 nights as part of a business trip along with a number of my colleagues. Overall the stay was fine, and the impression I got was that the South Point was attempting to be a "value" resort like the ones on the strip, but for a much lower room rate, and slightly lower ameneties. Here are some specifics I noticed. Positives: • Very reasonable rates for a LV Strip style mega-casino/hotel. My room averaged $100/night over 4 nights. • Like the Strip hotels, there are many entertainment and dining options on-site, and of course a full casino. All three, however, are slightly limited compared to the on-the-Strip mega-hotels. There are bowling lanes and a full movie theater, a live entertainment theater and an equestrian/rodeo/dirt bike venue in the building. Negatives: • The South Point aims to compete with the Strip mega-hotels, but their décor and style are a little bland (which could be refreshing in Vegas). They have no theme, and while everything is clean and modern enough, it lack character, which is what Vegas is famous for. • The South Point is not on the Las Vegas Strip, and is actually further than it seems to be. A free shuttle is provided from the South Point to the Strip and to the Airport, but it is not as convenient as it should be to encourage more people to stay at this fine hotel otherwise. The shuttles to the Strip actually only run to the Mandalay Bay resort, the southernmost point on the Strip, from where transportation needs to be arranged to any other point on the Strip. The shuttles do not run very frequently (about once every 25 minutes, I think), and the last one back to the hotel is at 1am – which is not particularly late for Las Vegas. I would suggest that they run multiple shuttles at the same time, and stop at 3 locations on the Strip or so, and keep running until about 3am – at least on Friday and Saturday. The free airport shuttle requires reservations beforehand, and also runs infrequently. (Also note that this shuttle does not leave from the “Shuttle Stand”, which I found out is only for the Strip Shuttle, after I almost missed the airport shuttle, which leaves from the front of the hotel.) • I did not see a prominent concierge desk at this hotel as I have at other LV hotels. Perhaps I missed it, or the front desk can provide similar services, but considering how busy the front desk is, a dedicated concierge is a necessity in Las Vegas, where so many people need assistance with reservations, activities, and transportation (especially being far from the action). • Exorbitant rates for internet access. I believe it was roughly $12 per day. I was traveling on business and needed access to my email, so I signed up regardless. My company paid, but I felt like I was robbed. I went to the Business Center to see if I could use their printer to print out my boarding pass, and found that I had to pay for a minimum of 1 hour of computer time, plus some amount for each page printed. Unfortunately, I think this is common to many of the hotels on/near the LV Strip – it was at the hotel I stayed on the Strip last year. • While I am sure that watching TV is not a common pastime in Vegas, I find it puzzling that the South Point TV does not offer even all of the basic cable channels, let alone HBO, Showtime, etc. Most people won’t care about the TV, I guess, but if it is to be a premiere hotel, they should at least try to match the Red Roof Inn’s selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great property! Awesome staff.”
Reviews.Author: yamaudio
Reviews.Content: We only had a one night stay, but i am looking forward to going back for a weekend. This place is a bit out of the way, but all you need is right there... Rooms are clean and quiet, with flat screen TVs and plenty of room.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful option”
Reviews.Author: cather
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caesar's for a conference for 3 days, then took off for the national parks. We needed a night at the end of our trip before flying home, and booked the South Point based on the reviews and the phenomenal rate (around $60 on a Monday night). The room was beautiful, the bathroom extraordinary. Everything was clean and comfortable. The restaurants in the hotel were very good values and very pleasant. And it was so nice not to be in the heart of the strip - there was just nothing there of interest to us, as we didn't gamble and felt that it was all overpriced. If you have to go to Vegas, the South Point is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Peaches1209
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a car auction in Las Vegas. It was held at a different site but we stayed at South Point. Having a shuttle that would drop us off at the auction site was what attracted me to South Point in the first place. I wasn't sure if I made the right decision when I booked the trip but I am soooo glad we gave this place a try. Beautiful rooms, wonderful food, loose slots. The people bent over backwards to make sure we had everything we could ask for. I will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Liked the South Point”
Reviews.Author: susselsprout
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference this past week. I really liked the South Point Hotel overall. The shuttle service was great, rendering car rental unnecessary unless you planned to do sightseeing off the Strip. The only thing that keeps me from giving the hotel an excellent rating would be the restaurants. My husband and I didn't go to all of them--just the Garden Buffet, the Coronado Cafe, the Del Mar Deli and Baja Miguel's. The Garden Buffet was pretty good. The Coronado was so-so. The Del Mar was pretty tasty--I had a really good cheesesteak sandwich there, but Baja Miguel was yuck. The chicken in my husband's and my dinners were obviously processed given their squared edges and 90-degree angles. We didn't eat our meals, and the waiter only smiled and said "okay" when we said we didn't care for our food. Lousy customer service. No "can I get you something else?" or credit offered.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased, will return”
Reviews.Author: FightOn
Reviews.Content: The reviews are basically right on for the South Point. I stayed 4 nights for a larger conference and enjoyed my stay. It was my first time staying off-strip and I will not hesitate to stay at the South Point again. Everything is priced better From $1 roulette minimums to drinks that are not going to set you back $8-$10 a pop. The coupon books they hand out upon check-in saved me at least $25 over the course of my stay. When not doing conference related activities, I enjoyed the bowling alley, sports book and gaming. Didn't have time to lay out by the pool, but from the looks of it, I would have gotten some nice relaxation if I had the time. At check-in, I asked for a room on a high floor and was given a room on the 24th floor (in the new wing) facing the strip. The room is large by any standard, with a spacious bathroom to match. I never seemed to wait more than 10 seconds for an elevator. Overall, I thought the food was good (both the buffet and the food served at the conference), but for a special night out something on the strip is still the best bet. As for the drawbacks, it is quite a bit off the strip as everyone has stated and I did hear some complaints about the shuttle. I rented a car and had no problem getting around. Parking is free almost everywhere on the Strip so no worries about parking there. And the smoke, it doesn't seem as the filtration system on the casino level is as good as other. But overall, just minor irritants.

Reviews.Title: “Loved South Point”
Reviews.Author: suru
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend spent with some freinds at the South Point Resort and we loved it. This was the first time staying here. Check in was quick and easy and the staff friendly. I asked for a high room with a good view and was given a beautiful room with an amazing view in the new wing on the 20th floor facing the strip. The room was spotless and very well appointed. The bathroom was large and everything was decorated very nicely. I liked that the hallways were well lit and they have security officers at night checking for room keys before you can get on the elevators. The casino did seem a little smokier than normal but I think that is because there seemed to be a huge number of smokers compared to other casinos we visited. Very rarely could I sit at a machine without someone next to me lighting up. I didn't have this problem at the other casinos. I guess we just visited on a weekend with lots of smokers (I don't smoke, so I am very sensitive to it). The casino had a huge number of very fun penny slots. I like the penny slots because you can bet from 1 cent to $2.10 depending on your whim. I actually won some money this trip and there was a huge variety of machines to play on. The casino had a very fun vibe and everyone seemed to be relaxed and having a good time. The tables games were always pretty full and we were having fun with the slots so we didn't partake. We did play bingo in a really nice bingo hall and had a good time. We didn't visit the pool, bowling alley, or theatre, so I can't comment. We ate at Baja Miguels, which I didn't like the food at all, but my husband did. We ate at the buffet once and the coffee shop once. The food and service at both was good. My husband hung out at the casino bar while my girlfriend and I gambled and he had a great time with the bartenders who he said were very friendly and personable. He said one bartender even took the time to teach a patron how to play the video poker machine. Most of the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful except for one cashier in the gift shop who was extremely surly, but she was the one bad apple and everyone else was great. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Las Vegas. It is not as hectic as hotels on the strip and if you want to go there it was only a 10 minute drive. The rooms are very nice and spacious, the staff friendly, and the casino was great. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good!”
Reviews.Author: kalayka
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed in this hotel and I think this is one of the best. It is far from the strip but it is no problem for me as I always have a rental car. Just like all the others, there is always that cigarette smell as you pass through the casino floor on your way to your room but you can ask for a non-smoking room. Its new wing has just been completed and I was lucky to get a brand new room without asking for it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: AnzacTraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I originally intended to stay only one night at Southpoint as a stopover before heading to Death Valley National Park. But we changed our plans and decided to spend one more day in Vegas to recuperate from our long road trip. The hotel had a great 3D2N "South Point Favourite Package" which came with free cocktails and buffets. Upon request, the receptionist immediately changed our original booking, no questions asked. How's that for service and sense of welcome! Unlike the other hotels on the Strip, Southpoint was much better laid out, and the whole place seemed to be more spacious. I very much liked the decor, and the yellow/orangey lighting made the place brighter and more cheerful compared to the "ever nightime" feeling I got in the other Strip hotels. The room itself was superbly maintained. I wouldn't have thought that I'd got this room for the money that I'd paid. As for the casino itself, the games were pretty much standard, though I find the variety quite limited, albeit from an Asian perspective. Would prefer more dice games. The multi-storey car park was well within reach of the main building and lift lobby to the rooms, and there was plenty of parking space. Unless you are here to soak in the Strip atmosphere, the Southpoint is an oasis from the hustle and bustle of activities. It is a good place to relax by the pool, enjoy a few rounds at the tables, before taking up the option of hitting the Strip at night, an easy 10min drive northwards along Las Vegas Boulevard. And you get to go past the "Fabulous Las Vegas" sign. =) Southpoint is indeed an extremely good bargain and value for money for Las Vegas. Highly recommended! And to all the multi-national staff at Southpoint, keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: sammyb
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a hotel with good reviews, good price and clean up to date rooms as well as a full service hotel. Found all of that and more wtih Southpoint. Clean, modern rooms with great comfortable beds. Breakfast buffet at the hotel was great dinner so so. Full service casino as well. Location was not a problem we had a vehicle and hit the highway and was at the strip in a matter of minutes. Only thing I would have liked is a fridge in the room. But everything else was great. Huge bathroom/full length mirror/small sitting area and large room. Great stay !

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: bluebells22
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Indian Rodeo weekend, it was fantasic. The hotel was buzzing but no long lines anywhere. The rooms are beautiful, large, bathroom likewise. We ate in buffet, cafe & the deli all of which were excellent and so cheap if you use the coupon book you get at check in. The atmosphere was brilliant. The price over the weekend was a bargain at $170 for two nights, great value. We had $25 free play for new members, I won $103 with the free play, cashed it in and paid the balance of the room, now thats what I call value!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: CathyC3
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel had a lot to offer (bowling alley, movie theater, gift shop, etc.). The room was really big, with comfortable beds, a plasma tv and a really nice bathroom. The safe is really large. My husband loved the sports book, which played all the football games on sunday. I loved the Del Mar Deli, which had amazing bagel sandwiches for really cheap prices. A coupon book was given to us upon check-in, which had 2 for 1 buffet tickets, free desserts, free drinks, etc. The only draw back is the location. It's not close to anything, but we had a car to drive to the strip everyday, which was about 10 mins away. The price is amazing for this type of hotel and I would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: robtob11
Reviews.Content: Having visited Las Vegas many times, staying at some of the best hotels on the Strip, we decided to give the South Point a try on this trip. To be honest we were a bit sceptical because the rates seemed too good to be true, but we needn't have worried in the slightest!! The hotel, staff, customer service, the food and the pool are all excellent. The rooms are larger and better equipped than some, much more expensive, that we've stayed in and the whole experience was second to none. Even the the panoramic view of the Strip from our room was the best we've ever had. We can't fault anything about our entire two week stay, the South Point will definitely be 'our' hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at the South Point!”
Reviews.Author: Susanneke
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at the relatively new South Point Hotel last month. Room was excellent and very spacious, nicely decorated, great bed, huge TV screen on the wall and good A/C, not too loud. Nice full bath with granite details. Rooms were well-isolated, as wasn't the case in several other hotels we stayed at during our trip... Housekeeping was friendly and assisted promptly. Got coupons when checking in which, for example, could be used for a free drink at the bar or 2 breakfast buffets for the price of 1, i.e. US$ 7.50 total for 2 people! Breakfast buffet was excellent, service too. At night, we used the free shuttle to the Mandalay Bay, which didn't even take 10 minutes. After strolling down the Strip for a couple of hours, the shuttle took us back to the peaceful South Point Hotel where we had a good night in a great bed! Great quality-price ratio, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Russnot
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week at South Point which turned out to be just as advertised-very enjoyable. If you've ever stayed at The Orleans, you will know what to expect, as it is very similar, and used to be part of the same group. I'd score it higher than The Orleans on having a very straightforward layout, and, in particular, a much less smoky casino. I'd perhaps score it lower on the buffet, which I could only describe as average. I sampled a few other of the food places and found them all to be of good quality at very reasonable prices. There is a free shuttle to the airport and also to The Mandalay Bay, on The Strip. They don't really advertise The Strip shuttle and you have to find the casino entrance by the parking garage for the pick up point, but it did run every 30 minutes and was only about a ten minute ride. The temperature was in the mid nineties so I really enjoyed relaxing by the pool every day. Nothing fancy but very pleasant, clean and well maintained. The room itself was great. Very comfortable king size bed, nice bathroom, very quiet but efficient air conditioning and perfectly cleaned by the room staff every day. 42" TV on the wall was good for watching the Baseball Playoffs (shame it wasn't in HD though). The only downer on the room (5th floor) was that my "view" was the wall of another building, so perhaps you should mention that when you book, if you do want to see something/anything out the window. The casino was well laid out with a good selection of games. I stick to slots and video poker and ended up spending only half my budget. It's worth joining The Players Club as I got back over $120 by the end of my week. A few reviews have mentioned poor service, but I can honestly say that I had no problem at all with any of the staff. They all seemed friendly and efficient. In general the place appears to be well run. The first half of the week there were mostly middle aged and elderly visitors with some families and children. Later in the week there was a Native American rodeo event at the equestrian centre. As a Brit I found this most interesting as many of them wore Cowboy hats (not like in those old movies) and also spoke in their own languages. As far as I could see, everyone from whatever background got on very well together, and had a good time in the nice relaxed atmosphere in the casino. It is true that South Point is a few miles south of the main Strip, so if you want to be in the middle of all the action, this is probably not the place for you. But if you are looking for good quality at a reasonable price I can thoroughly recommend this hotel/casino to you.

Reviews.Title: “Full points for South Point”
Reviews.Author: JAKELBE
Reviews.Content: If you would prefer peace and quiet, the South Point is excellent we stayed there on our first 2 nights in Vegas, and believe me after travelling for 12 hours peace and quiet is what we needed. We found the staff more than accommodating, friendly and pleasant. Rooms are very nice, all in all I would recommend the South Point to anyone wanting stylish, clean, comfortable accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “South Point is a special place to stay”
Reviews.Author: laine25
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! It is south of the Strip so it is easy to get in and out of the hotel property and not that much traffic. Our room was really nice, had a plasma TV screen. It was easy to find everything--some hotels you go in are so large you get overwhelmed. We ate at the deli and sandwich I had and soup were very good. They have specials there. Seattle's Best Coffee was great too. There is an exit to the freeway nearby so it makes it easy to get around. I felt the price was right and I definitely would stay there again. I have no complaints about this hotel. Oh, I got in early and still was allowed to check in early which was nice. Oh, upon check-in you get a coupon book which gives you some savings at restaurants at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: Roadie-Rick
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 4 night enjoyable stay at the South Point. Airport shuttle picked me up at quarter after the hour (I think) at Bus Bay #17 on Lower Level. Check in was reasonably quick and front desk staff courteous. Room was spacious and comfortable. Big 42" plasma TV a bonus for those who need to watch television while on holidays. Large pool in back. Great for swimming, not so great for quiet time as they seem to want to continuously play loud music all day. Large bowling alley (something like 64 lanes), great for kids. Multiplex theater, great for kids. Casino...REALLY SMOKEY!!!...not so great for kids or adults. Buffet...reasonably priced...good food. (If you want a truly great buffet experience, try the Spice Market Buffet at Planet Hollywood. You can get a $5 off coupon there just by registering in their casino for a player's club card). Shuttle to the Mandalay Bay is great. Runs very frequently until 1:00 in the a.m. Off the shuttle, up the escalator, through the hotel, up the escalator and your at the Tram to Excalibur. There are 2 trams. The inside one stops at the Luxor before heading on to Excalibur, while the outside one goes direct. Once outside off of the tram, you are a short walk to New York, New York, MGM Grand, and a few blocks away from Planet Hollywood, Paris, Ballys, Bellagio and Caesars. For an adventure, hop on the Deuce (double decker bus) on the strip, and take it up to the Fremont area. You won't be disappointed (make sure you hang around in the evening for the Fremont street experience). The Deuce bus ride is $2 one way or $5 for an all day pass. It's a great A/C ride that'll give you a bit of a tour up the strip. Go upstairs on the bus...better view...less people.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: happlytraveler
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation through the hotel website and was given a special with a good rate with buffet(2), cocktail(4), and access to the fitness room. Upon arrival, the front desk personnel were very rude and didn't tell us anything about our buffet/cocktail/fitness. Didn't know our reservation was changed with a different rate until checkout. Showed them the receipt and the amount that was charged, but the supervisor at the front desk kept saying they didn't have that rate and refused. When she finally agreed then didn't honor the buffet/cocktail/fitness. Seem that their personnel doesn't know what rate is given on their own website and why was the rate changed without notification???? When questioned, there was a clinch in their internet. When the reservation is taken on their website - goes to the hotel reservation (that's when it got changed) for a deposit. WHY????? No answer given. Personnel there are very RUDE. I never plan to stay again. I have stayed at this location before and the front desk personnel is always RUDE.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great location but can't beat the price”
Reviews.Author: MKKplus2
Reviews.Content: Got a good rate theu expedia. We expected a nice room since the hotel is relatively new and was not disappointed. Our room was spacious and clean. The pool was cold even though the temperatures were so hot, luckily the kiddie pool was heated and my daughter is still short enough to enjoy the shallow water at the kiddie pool. the breakfast buffet was not that great. standard breakfast fare, but quality wasn't there. we used a 2 for 1 coupon so price wise it was reasonable. if we had to pay full price i would have been even more disappointed. we ate at the cafe one late night and the midnight to 6am specials were great. i had hash browns, toast, eggs and bacon for only $2.95. hubby had steak and eggs for $5.95. service wasn't too good but we didn't mind since we were in no rush. ordered root beer floats and while there was a lot of ice cream, not much root beer. ate at the deli one night, the food at the deli was good. large portions and reasonable prices. the casino is not that big, enjoyed playing bingo there. used to be a loyal plaza bingo fan but now i will be playing at south point. look forward to returning here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay away from the hustle & bustle”
Reviews.Author: kevincognito
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 3 night stay with a group of 10 people. We chose this hotel for the value and because we were going to rent a couple of cars for the group it was not an issue that we were 5 miles south of the Strip. This ended up being a very good choice and not 1 in our group had a complaint. It was nice to get back to the hotel at 1 or 2 in the morning and find a quieter place to sit down and get a drink. The big hotels on the strip were packed at that time and also the drink prices were double if not more. The room we had was on the 5th floor with a view of a brick wall. Other than that, it was well appointed and roomy. We tried the buffet and the cafe for breakfast, we went to the cafe for one dinner and also to the prime rib restaurant one night. All three places were great food at a great price. The Deli was also a hit for the lunch or late night snack. The location of this hotel is a little far from the action, so unless you plan on renting a car, or cabbing it back into town, there is not much else in the area outher than the outlet mall. Cars are cheap to rent from the airport and parking is plentifull and free in every casino so it was no big deal to drive to the strip and park and walk to a few casinos then move to the next block whenever you pleased and walk some more. The pool area was large enough and not crowded at all when we were there. The movie theatres are large and the selection of movies was like any large city and the bowling lanes were busy but there was always something available. I did not check out the equestrian portion so I have no comment. The only disappointing amenity I can think of is that the gym cost $20 but who needs excercise when you are walking all day long. A tip for everyone....when you check in they give you a coupon book....use it. There is a 2 for 1 for the breakfast buffet, if you are there on the weekend use it on one of those days because it doubles in price to $14. There are many other discount coupons to use within the hotel property so if you plan on eating and drinking there they will come in handy. The whole group of us went to see "O" by cirque de soleil and it was awsome. The girls had tickets to Cher one night but she cancelled and the guys went one night to Criss Angel Beleive but it was horrible and there were dozens of people walking out of the show before it was over so stay away from that one. All in all a great place to stay while in Vegas as long as you don't have to be in the heart of the action all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Too Far Off Strip For My Liking”
Reviews.Author: ROSE4059
Reviews.Content: This is the first time when being in Las Vegas that I have stayed "off Strip" and with that said I'd much prefer to stay "on Strip". The South Point hotel/casino was much nicer than I expected and the room was a pleasant surprise. I had requested a King Smoking but they only had Queen Smoking when I checked in. Since it was just myself in the room I didn't really care and had decided that if I didn't like the room that I'd check later on to see if a King Smoking had opened up. As it was the room was just fine and I didn't change. For a smoking room it didn't have that stale, old cigarette smell that most do. Air conditioner was awesome and got the room really nice and "cold". The flat screen TV was huge and it was a nice touch that they had a coffee/tea machine in bathroom. Most Vegas hotels don't offer that any longer. And the best thing about the rooms is the in-room safe at no charge! I locked up all my valuables, dvd player and money each time I left the room and was able to do so with complete peace of mind. Absolutely the best feature of the room. The casino was very comfortable and I was estatic to see $1 minimum roulette!! It was a casino that I felt completely comfortable and safe on my own in. My only complaint is that the roulette dealers weren't very personable - would it hurt them to smile or crack a joke?? Needless to say I only leave a tip for the dealers if I have a pleasant experience and part of that experience is the attitude of the dealers. If it seems like it's a chore for them to have me at their table then it's a chore for me to leave them a little something something. Oh, and what's up with having beads hanging at the table, I assume to give to players to make them feel welcome, and not giving them out? I actually had someone who must work at the casino who was on their day off come up and play at the roulette table I was on and jokingly gave the pit boss a hard time about handing out some beads- then and only then- was I given some beads. Granted this seems like a stupid and petty complaint but it all adds to the fun & atmosphere of the casino. Didn't eat at any of the resturants so I can't comment on them. The Seattle Coffee Company was wonderful in the morning and the people working there were always happy with smiles on their faces. A real treat when trying to face the morning- kudos to the Seattle Coffee Company baristas! Pool area was small but pleasant. The astroturf was hotter than the concrete so don't fool yourself thinking you can walk on the fake grass without sandles! I can only imagine how crowded it was during the summer and with the 800 hotel rooms being added that is only going to add to the crowding at the pool. Overall I have to say the hotel & casino was very pleasant but without a rental car (which I did have) it would have been a real pain to wait on and take shuttles to and from the Strip and a real expense to take taxis.
