I'd definately stay here again IF there was no other option or if finances were tight but I'm a "Strip" kinda girl and would much rather be closer to the glitz and lights! I'd still recommend the South Point, can't go wrong if you get a nice low rate like I did.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the price sway you...”
Reviews.Author: jewelsnoel1977
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything the pictures showed. It was very nice. That's the nicest thing I can say about the whole South Point experience. The staff was incredibly rude and unwilling to take any responsibility for the services they provide. The shuttles do not run on the hour, so you can find yourself sitting at the pick up or drop off points for more than 30 minutes. If you're expecting to catch the last shuttle back from the strip at midnight, BEWARE! You must make sure you're standing in the correct location at Mandalay Bay, because the staff at Mandalay isn't familiar with the Share Point shuttle pick up location. There is seating room only on the shuttle, so if you're not willing to shove your way through the crowd, you may have spent your time waiting for nothing. They WILL kick you off and with no apologies or other options whatsoever. We ended up taking cabs nearly every night due to some awful experience with the shuttle. As I said, the hotel takes no responsibility for any issues with the shuttle. The shuttle service is contracted out the Bel Trans, and even though South Point's name is ALL over the bus, they could care less how rude the service was. If you're planning on taking the shuttle to the airport, have a back up plan. Again, this shuttle does not run on the hour and according to the hotel, you need to make reservations for the shuttle to the airport. This was not something the hotel made us aware of upon checking in. The security in the hotel is extremely rude, and inconsistent. We were only allowed 2 room keys, even though there were 3 of us staying there. Well, security chooses to do their job when it's convenient for them and requests to see your room key before entering the elevator area. If you're without a room key, they will make you show proof that you're staying there. This only happened maybe 2 times during our entire stay so be prepared for inconsistency. The vending machines for sodas do not have sodas in them, so be prepared to spend upwards of $4.00 per soda. The food is mediocre, so your best bet is going someplace else. The hotel is FILLED with cigerette smoke, so if you're sensitive to this, stay somewhere is. Overall, it was not a good experience... Oh yea, and there was urine on our toilet upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms… but beware of the extras!”
Reviews.Author: vincentmontreal
Reviews.Content: We spend 2 nights at the South Point in September 2008. Let’s start with the good stuff. The rate was about $75, which was quite a bit lower than the major hotels on the Strip (for the days we were there). The room that we had was very spacious and very modern. The AC worked well and was very quiet. The bathroom had a separate section for the toilet and shower and the room had a full size couch next to the king-sized bed. Another great thing that you will not find in the mega-hotels on the Strip is that you can park your car right in front of the main entrance. (There is also a parking garage but we never had to go there.) With respect to the location, the South Point advertises that they are 7 minutes from the Strip…. You will need in fact about 10 minutes to get to the Welcome to Fabulous Las Vegas sign at the beginning of the Strip but you must then budget another 10-15 minutes minimum to get your car parked in any one of the major mega-complex of the Strip. One way to shorten this a bit is take the truck road right after the Welcome to Fabulous Las Vegas sign. You will avoid all the traffic lights of the Strip. The South Point offers a shuttle to the Mandalay Bay resort but, again, this is the very first complex of the Strip and there will be a lot of walking to do if you intend to visit the other complexes further north. The disappointing points were as follows. On a nice Sunday afternoon with 108 degrees outside, the pool was closed for some “special event”….we were glad we were not traveling with kids… Also, beware of the extras. The WI-FI is $12.00 per day and the gym (which seemed quite nice) is a whoppy $15 per day (based on another experience, this is not uncommon in Las Vegas…) Finally, we had a booklet in the rooms with a set of coupons. The booklet included a 2 for 1 coupon for the breakfast buffet, which is pretty good (but definitely not as good as the buffets on the major hotels on the strip). Nevertheless, we had breakfast for 2 for a total of $6.95 + tx so it is difficult to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to relax off the strip”
Reviews.Author: 3602daryl
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to Vegas and first staying off the strip. Room was large clean and comfortable Pool was clean and quite Food a the buffet was alright, the other restaurants we tried were very good. The shuttle to the strip was convenient and usually on time would stay here again if looking to relax if looking to party another casino would be better

Reviews.Title: “Vegastastic!!”
Reviews.Author: markjones5150
Reviews.Content: I had visted Vegas previously and I must admit, I had my reservations about staying "off The Strip". On arrival all those reservations quickly dissapeared. The South Point is absolutely superb. This hotel is enormous but luxuriuos. Yes, its quite a way off the Strip but the hotel provides modern air-conditioned courtesy buses that run throughout the day, up to half a dozen times an hour. You are never waiting for more than ten minutes for a bus to turn up and whip you down to the Madalay Bay. Pickups from the Strip run much later into the evening than other lesser-hotels situated Off-Strip. The South Point has just undergone a major extension and refurb and looks simply stunning against the backdrop of the Nevada desert. However, even though the work had not yet been finished when we visted eralier this year there was no noisy or dust. The only gripe I had was that the simming pool was closed and the hotel didn't offer any alternative or made provisions at a sister hotel. Everything else was WorldClass. The major advantage of Off-Strip are the sunrise and sunsets, simply spectacular and breathtaking. Price? Well value for money doesn't come into it. This is better than value for money! This is the cheapest luxury hotel I have ever had the fortune to stay in. Forget the Luxor or the MGM, when I'm coming back it will be the South Point everytime!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Delightful place!”
Reviews.Author: sansue
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at South Point and we were absolutely delighted! The staff was friendly and courteous. The casino is bright and clean and not smokey. Our room was large and clean and the beds were very comfortable. Housekeeping did a marvelous job of cleaning and maintaining the rooms. The rooms are quite large and have nice safes for valuables and coffee makers. We had one of the newer rooms and were very happy with it. We hope to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gram4020
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a week in September. We've been to Vegas before & decided to stay off strip, so as to escape the crowds at the end of the day. Firstly, as others have said, it is a very large newish hotel. It is very clean, both in the rooms and the rest of the hotel. The room was large with a nice flatscreen TV. The shower was over the bath and was not the best for pressure. We ate at a few of the eateries. The buffet was average, the steakhouse and prime rib restaurant were good & the deli was excellent. The swimming pool area was very nice, but the pool itself was freezing. Not just cold, but freezing! How they manage to keep it at such a low temperature when it's 100 degrees outside mystifies me. Drinks service in the casino was good and the staff were generally pleasant. We used the cinema, which was excellent and good value. We both used the spa and were very happy with it. We didn't drive, but used their shuttle frequently. We never waited more than about 10 minutes for it. That's pretty good. Would I stay there again? Well no, not without a car. It's just a bit too far from the main action. Using the shuttle was fine, but time consuming. Also shops were a long walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: BobAdams111
Reviews.Content: We reserved two nights at this hotel for $45 per night. The hotel is a relatively new (at least it looks new) and clean hotel. The rooms were spacious, well appointed, and very clean. For $45, this is the best value that I have gotten for the money. This is a high 3-star or low 4-star hotel. All in all, we were very satisfied with our experience here and would return if the price is right. Here are some annoyances: 1. The front desk was disorganized and unfriendly. We waited 25 minutes in line to check in. 2. The hotel offers free shuttle to the strip. The shuttle is infrequent (every 30 minutes) and very unreliable (it doesn't stick to the schedule). It also fills up frequently and you have to wait until the next shuttle (30 minutes later). For $45, we justified use of taxis, which run $25 each way to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with some issues”
Reviews.Author: Abelbooty
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. Room is large, nicely decorated. Very large window with views of the strip to the north. Bathroom was nice and very large. Room had a closet with safe, large flat panel tv mounted above the dresser. Now for the issues. The check in was fast yet I didn't think the girl was very outwardly friendly. I can live with that. The Friday seafood buffet was good but crowded. Line for a table moved fast enough yet the guy seated his friends before us and we were there before them. Waitress was good though. Food was typical Vegas buffet which was ok. Orlean's buffet is better. USE THE COUPONS IN THE BOOKLET THEY GIVE YOU AT CHECK IN.!!!!!The housekeeping did do a nice job WHEN they did it. We were there from Friday to Sunday and they never cleaned our room. Granted we slept in on Saturday but left leaving the sign to service the room. Came back 4 hours later and nothing. While napping they came to the door with a man saything he was assigned our room. We said we were here for 2 nights and they left. Front desk must have made a mistake. We left Saturday to go to a show around 5pm, still leaving the service the room sign out. Nothing happened. Word of warning though. Do NOT get out of your car in the night in Vegas unless you are in a hotel lot. My husband was assaulted by an angry hispanic motorist. He ended up going to ER with a broken nose. Police made no arrest seeing they did not witness it. This happened on the street corner outside of the hotel. Hotel security was excellent at coming to our aid though. This will be our LAST trip to Vegas thanks to that idiot. I booked through Expedia and got a Friday/Saturday stay for only $76 a night and this hotel far exceeds that price! It is a sweet deal!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rallen1023
Reviews.Content: My first stay at the South Point was in May 2006, although it was called South Coast then. It was less than 6 months old with spacious rooms and a 42 inch plasma TV in the room. The casino floor is bright and inviting. Not overcrowded like those further up on the strip. The "Gift shop" has the best liquor prices around. Every year I have been going back at least once (I live in LA) and I still love the hotel. Sign up for the players club to get great deals sent to your e-mail address year round. I tell all my friends about this place. The only caveat I would tell anyone is that this is NOT the strip. And THAT's why I love it. If this is a first visit to Las Vegas, you might think it is a little too far away. I would always recommend getting a car too if you stay here, but having said that, you are close to the I-15 Freeway and can be to the strip or downtown in 10 - 20 minutes. I was here for a weekend in July and I just booked a room for my birthday weekend in October!

Reviews.Title: “great value that exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: lucky-we-live-Hawaii
Reviews.Content: what a great place to stay in Vegas......large clean rooms, a great casino, a beautiful spa, even a multiplex cinema.......keep up the good work Southpoint.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints!!!”
Reviews.Author: EL_GQ
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel is about 10 min south of the strip, it was still a great location. My checking in process was fast and easy, and the staff member Takeo was helpful with answering all my questions. I was given a room on the 14th floor and I must say as soon as I walked in I was impressed. The room I booked was a basic king size non-smoking but my room looked like a mini suite. Spacious, clean, plasma TV I cannot complain. The bathroom was big and clean as well and they supplied lotions and shower gel from Bath & Body Works. I had a good night sleep with my pillows, and bed. I cannot complain. The price for what I got was GREAT.

Reviews.Title: “Value and fun south of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: nameisalreadytaken
Reviews.Content: Excellent value, very clean, still glitzy although a few miles south of the main Vegas strip. Very similar to Orleans Casino - formerly their sister hotel, also reviewed - but a bit more sophisticated. Spacious room with excellent decor, all the amenities - hair dryer, phone in twelve-foot bathroom - and more interesting pool. Cons: Location is limiting without a car; local and 800 calls start at $1 each; Internet charges outrageous at $12 daily your PC or $11 hourly for their shared PC. This review is limited as only stayed for one day and used few facilities or food.

Reviews.Title: “Non-smoking room, supposedly, with 3 ashtrays and matches....”
Reviews.Author: CarShowIllustrated
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before and been happy overall. This time I checked in with no problems (around 11pm), went to my room, and that's when the problems started. The room smelled like cigarettes and I requested, and was confirmed for a non-smoking room. Then I saw the first ashtry and matches and called the front desk (about 1 minute after getting to the room) and asked the person at the other end if my room was non-smoking. She said in the computer it said it was. I asked her if that was true, then why were there no signs stating this in the hallway or in the room, and there were 3 ashtrays with fresh books of matches in several locations of the room. She said that the room I has was the only room left, it was supposedly non-smoking, and then offered to send house keeping to "spray something" if I wanted. I told her that it smelled bad enough without then having to breathe more chemicals,etc. and that I wouldn't be staying there ever again. She said "fine". I won't be going back. The only reason I gave them 2 instead of 1 "star" is because I like their movie theater and steak house. I guess you get what you pay for. I paid $89 for one night in a smelly room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Off-theStrip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: parma87
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at SouthPoint to celebrate my birthday and it was great! I had stayed here before but couldn't remember too much but I will definitely return! Free easy parking was a huge plus. The shuttle was also great even though it only took you from the hotel to Mandalay Bay so if you wanted to go anywhere else, you had to walk or use the trams provided at some hotels. The pool scene was great because it wasn't too crowded and since the sun was beating down, even at 10am, it was very hot. The room was huge! Our king size bed only took up about half the room and then there was a little coffee table and a couch along with another table and chairs. The curtains, at least in our room, were blackout curtains which made sleeping in very easy. My only two complaints were that there is no fridge in the room so when you get leftovers at a restaurant, you have no where to keep them. Also, the bed didn't have a fitted sheet on the bottom, it was a regular sheet so at night, I toss and turned and the bottom sheet would always slide up. Other than that, it was a great stay and I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rlgood
Reviews.Content: Staied from 8/30/08 to 9/5/08 ; rooms are nice and large the maids do a good job of cleaning. Ate at the Buffet , coffee shop and the deli ,coffee shop prices a little on the high side. The sandwhiches in the deli and the soup were very good with reasonable prices the best deal was the hot dog cart 75 cents for aquarter pound Vienna hot dog. If you had a problem with a slot machine the slot personal had it fixed right away. At night Security checks for room keys before you can get to the elevators With South Point being 5 miles from THE STRIP it is best to rent a car , access to I 15 is right behind South Point making travel to any part of Las Vegas easy the price S.P.charges for the Internet could be lower

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Hassle Free”
Reviews.Author: angelfan2
Reviews.Content: To start, I booked my room on their web-site and later discovered that Expedia was 38 dollars cheaper. I called the hotel and was cheerfully refunded the difference. At check-in, we were greeted by a pleasant and friendly associate. The room was superb, clean, comfortable and quiet. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on. The buffet was had a lot of choices and the food was very good. The location is several miles south of the Strip and is easy to get to from I-15. If one wants to visit the Strip, it is an easy drive up I-15. I can't rate the casino since I wasn't in town to play the tables and don't usually gamble as it is, but it was a good sized one with lot's of options. We will not hesitate to stay there again on our next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: notsopickyi
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at South Point. It's location is just as suggested by the name, 3-4 miles south of the Strip. So it is better to have a car to get around. Since it is not right on the strip, we found it is easy to get in and out. The valet parking service is quick and convenient. It is not too much walk to get to the rooms from the main entrance. The elevators to the rooms are very easy to find, just walk straight through the casino. The room is clean and quiet. We had very good rest after getting exhausted at other places. The air conditioner system is the best I have ever experienced. We did not hear any venting air noise. We also liked the flat TV. There is no Vegas show in house. We tried the bowling lane and liked it. There is a ticketing machine near the elevators selling half-priced show tickets. A screen next to it displays the show information. We bought tickets at the machine. We were glad we did that when we saw people waiting in long lines outside the ticketing booths on the strip to get the same tickets, and the temperature was 106 degree. The places is not as luxury as Wynn. But it is comfortable and well managed. Highly recommended for family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: DoloBarcelona
Reviews.Content: Fantastic luxury room and bathroom. Clean and near downtown. It is a couple of miles from the strip. It was not a problem for us because we had a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “very big rooms”
Reviews.Author: Hans49
Reviews.Content: Very new hotel, clean, very big rooms, large lcd. It is a 20 min. drive to central strip. All parking on the strip is free, so it isn't a great problem. There is a hotel shuttle to the strip if you don't want to drive

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kbusacco
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed from 3/25 to 4/1 - it was great week. We found the hotel on Vegas.com - picked it from reading Trip Advisor's reviews - what a pick!!! The rates were great - paid half of what we would have paid on the strip - booked the Luxor then cancelled. We rented a car to get around - did the Grand Canyon & so on. The pool was closed - our only complaint - but we did other things in place of it. The bowling alley & theatre are huge - but didn't go to them. I did play bingo a few nights while hubyy played craps - he said the people were so nice on the floor. Our room was very clean & the king size bed was so comfy - we were in 1941 - the view was nice, the a/c worked just fine, the TV was great, the toiletries were nice - only thing we are use to a frig & micro - but we managed - the extra fees are what keeps the room rates so low - rather the low rates! We ate at the buffet for breakfast - the food was really good & much cheaper then the strip buffets. The deli was good also - had breakfast & lunch there. The store had great things & the liquor was reasonable too. We were suppose to stay here for 5 nights & 2 nights at the MGM - but didn't have the same treatment there so went back to Southopint for the last 2 nights - so the hotel on the strips are more money & way more crowded. We went for the Monster Truck show - which was amazing - a must see at least once! Can't wait to go back - will stay here in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “It's our secret hotel”
Reviews.Author: Meeshel
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at South Point and we will go back. After going to Vegas multiple times a year for a very long time we have gotten sick of the outrageous prices the hotels on the strip are charging so we found South Point. Since we drive from LA, the fact that it's off the strip isn't a big deal to us, but there are always taxis and I hear they have a shuttle service that goes to Mandalay Bay every 15 minutes. The rooms are clean, huge, and you get a nice big tv. The bathrooms come stocked with Bath and Body Works products which I love. My only gripe this trip was the maid service. When we arrived at midnight, our room door was open and we didn't have any soap or shampoo and conditioner. Our floor obviously hadn't been vacuumed since there were some sort of crumbs by the couch...but at midnight and after a full day of work and a 4 hour drive to Vegas, we just didn't care to make the effort to call the front desk. The next day when the maids came our room still wasn't vacuumed and they still didn't leave us soap or anything else. We aren't too high maintenance so it wasn't a big deal but it's still annoying. The drinks are cheap, 3 bucks at the bars. The buffet was the worst buffet I have ever been to and even with our coupon for a free buffet I wanted my six bucks back. I felt robbed. I seriously want to gag every time I think about the buffet experience. All in all we'll go back again if I can't find a decent rate at the Mirage or the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: crapsguy
Reviews.Content: This is a great deal for a hotel on the Las Vegas strip. However, the hotel is located about 3 miles south of Mandalay Bay, which is the normally the south end of the strip. This is a very new hotel and it seems that the hotel is trying to build clients. It would seem that they are as the valet parking was very busy the day we check in and out. This was one of the few short comings for the hotel. It might be better to park in the self parking and walk to the hotel. It will be quicker to check in and get your car when you leave the hotel. The rooms at the hotel are big, about 500 sq ft with a very comfortable king bed with a sofa in the room, not a pull out. There is also a desk, table and dresser in the room along with a large flat screen TV. The bathroom is large and well appointed. The best thing about the hotel is the restaurants. We ate at the Prime Rib and Silverado Steak restaurants. The food qualtiy and service were first rate at the two restuarants while the cost was below what I am used to spending for comparable food and service. The htoel also has a 156 scree movie theater and a 60 lane bowling alley. This is a kid friendly hotel! I would suggest you book here soon before they start raising the rates. I paid a total of $190 for three night, including a Friday night. This is way below other strip hotels and for the quality can not be beat. My only complaint is I didn't have much luck in the casino but was treated well by the dealers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Zuix
Reviews.Content: This might be one of the best deals in Vegas. I ended up booking and paying their standard price and was impressed with how large and nice the rooms were. The pool was really nice as well. The hotel is a good alternative if you dont' want to stay on the Strip. They have a shuttle that takes you to the Mandalay Bay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: DiamondgeeezerLondon
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the fact that the rooms were bigger than average as we had our three teenage children in a room to themselves. It was ideal. theres so much space for the money. No wonder its rated so high. The only disavantage to Strip lovers is that its 10 mins by car. Dont do what I did and hire one! its cheaper to get cabs plus you dont have to waste time parking. The pool is huge and an ideal way to chill out after the endless walking round the many many hotels and shops in the strip. Only thing I found strange was the hire fee for a fridge. The shop was great value even compared to a 7-11. Massive cinema, bowling alley and er.... an Equestrian Centre, yeah! Complmentary vouchers were a help the budget. Food buffet was great value too and surprisingly good. All in all an ideal place for famillies and people who dont want 24 hour mayhem on thier door step!

Reviews.Title: “Moderate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shasharugby
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week end stay at South Point. The hotel is moderate. The pictures make it look like a glitzy modern hotel however its more like a standard Comfort/ Holiday Inn. The casino and pool are quite crowded tough to find a seat at the gaming tables. Seems to be filled with tourists and a large number of locals. We stayed in a King Room which was quite spacious but who needs tons of space when you are only in a room to sleep. Sleeping on the otherhand was quite an experience. The mattress is covered in some sort of plastic mat so everytime you move it crackles not mention it does not allow for ventilation. Making sleeping quite uncomfortable. The room was clean the hallways however leading to the room the carpet was filthy. Several stains throughout. There are several different options for dining we tried the Buffet for breakfast which was average and the Mexican Restaurant which was very good. The pool is nice but don't expect to relax. There was an unusually large amount of children for a Vegas hotel. The hotel allows floats so if you just want to take a dip to cool off its tough to find a spot to get in avoiding all of the pool games going on with the children. Aside from that they also allow guests to bring coolers to the pool so there is a large amount of trash and beer cans all around the pool. The Spa looks very modern although we were not interested in paying an extra $20 per day for use of the gym. We paid $89 per night for our room which is not bad but when you can get a room on the strip for the same amount or a couple dollars more I will stay on the strip. The hotel offers a shuttle to the Mandalay Bay but expect it to take about an hour from the time you leave South Point to reach locations mid strip such as the Bellagio and about 30 minutes longer to get to The Wynn. I would reccommend not staying here if you do not have a car and plan on doing anything on the strip. Overall if you want a bargain trip this is the place to stay just don't expect it to be anymore than a bargain. Attached are the photos I forwarded to the hotel in reference to the carpet issue and a photo of Flavor Flav standing in the middle of the Casino, hey if its good enough for Flavor maybe its not so bad : )

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased !”
Reviews.Author: SamandTaylor
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the South Point less than 48 hours in advance, and got a good weekday rate ($45/night). I thought the property was one of the older ones - so was expecting something smaller and more run down. Was very pleased to find a huge room (500 sf) and plenty of ammenities, and not showing signs of neglect. Some 'gripes' only if I had to be really picky : 1) A vanity mirror and/or vanity area for women to primp would be nice - the bathroom lighting and distance of mirror is rough for us. There is plenty of room for one outside the bathroom and they would be inexpensive for the hotel to install. 2) No 'snack bar' to get a hot dog or other mini-meal in the middle of the night. I come back from late-night Vegas strip-crawling tired and hungry, and don't necessarily want to sit in coffee shop or pay big $ for a room-service meal. Maybe the coffee shop could sell bagels and cream cheese 'to go'? Other than those two things, it was a real gem - staff was nice enough, hotel was nicely appointed, and rooms exceeded my expectations. If you have transportation, and are willing to stay 'off strip', this is a great option. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit”
Reviews.Author: billyfiske
Reviews.Content: A very reasonably priced hotel situated off the strip. A shuttle was available to drop you off at the Mandalay Bay hotel. It takes about 10 minutes and runs until after midnight. The rooms were large, clean and very quiet. We were on the 12th floor. The bed was large and comfortable. The breakfast at the Coronada restaurant was freshly cooked and reasonably priced. Had room service once and the portion was enormous. Given the outside temperature in excess of 100 degrees the air conditioning was great, and one of the quietest I have come across. If you don't mind being off strip then this hotel is an excellent choice and the room price is great for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 142ritch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights which we booked via the website. We arrived midweek so checking in not a problem. We were going to upgrade to a larger room but the receptions said that our standard room was large enough and sure enough it's a great size room. I loved the location - the main strip was a short drive upt to the Luxor carpark. Las Vegas is gambling and shopping so we had a great time just looking at the different hotels. We had the buffet at the hotel which had a great variety of food. We would stay here again. Dave R www.daveritchie.com

Reviews.Title: “South Point”
Reviews.Author: Alvin1975
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice of hotel if you want to stay off the strip. Price was competitive. Rooms were quiet, clean and tidy. We did hire a car to get out and about to shopping malls, Hoover Dam, the strip etc. Only negative thing was paying to use hotel amenities such as the spa/gym - I believe this however is standard in most Las Vegas Hotels. We will stay here again on our return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the South Point”
Reviews.Author: Terri A
Reviews.Content: South Point was great, we enjoyed our stay. Rooms were clean and spacious. Casino has cheap tables (low minimum bets) and I thought Don Vito's Italian was wonderful!! The only drawback is the location. I arrived at a time when the hotel airport shuttle was not scheduled to run and taxi was $30.00. We were not visiting the strip this trip, so the location was not a big deal, but ifyou plan to visit the strip, this hotel is quite a ways out. They do, however, offer shuttle service to Mandalay Bay. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ron3573
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Las Vegas. This was our first visit to Vegas and we enjoyed our stay at South Point. We pick this hotel because of it being off the strip and the price was unbelievable. They have a special summer rate and our average price was around $57 per night. For what you get that was a terrific value, but do not be fooled. Some of the amenities that normally are free are fee based at this hotel. Those amenities are not deal breakers though. For example the gym and internet are fee based. I normally skip workouts on vacation, but I did miss the internet a little. This place is massive with more amenities than the average hotel. My nine year old compared it to a mall and I agree. We were lucky to be the first to stay in a new wing that just opened two days before we arrived. The room was brand new. The rooms are very large with Thomasville furnishings and granite counter tops in the bathrooms. The room also has a 42” LCD TV. The beds were a little too soft. The room being new had a minor problem. One of the walls did not have power and the engineers could not find the breaker when the outage was reported. The hotel immediately offered to send their staff to move us, but it was not a big deal to us. They fixed the problem the following day while we were out. The entire hotel also had a water outage that day, which was a big deal because it wasted some of our day, but that was fixed as well. Overall this is a good hotel compared to others on the strip which are in need of renovations. If we did not have the outages I would have easily given this hotel an excellent on our stay. If you are going soon try to catch the summer rates they can not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Way Off The Strip, but a Very Nice Prpperty”
Reviews.Author: Cathy_ann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last summer and really enjoyed the property. There wasn't much reason to leave the property. There's a multi-plex movie theater, bowling, gym/spa, entertainment, gambling, a very nice pool area and decent food. You get a lot of bang for your buck here. We paid less than 50 dollars per night (what a deal). The major downside would be that's it way off the strip, so you must have a car. One other plus is that the outlet mall is not that far away, if you like that type of shopping. It's a great location for kids, there's no way they should ever complain of boredom!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and good for young adults”
Reviews.Author: 5.10b
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely of great value. It is not upscale as in Wynn or Bellagio, but has many many excellent features. It's a good hotel for young adults (has a movie theatre and bowling alley attached). Spa is actually EXCELLENT! Hotel is about 20 minutes away from the Strip. For the excellent value, can have extra money for spa treatment. There were many teenagers that weekend, but the hotel was hosting Girls Day Out. Check in: pretty fast (we checked in at 11pm though). Food: Only ate at the buffet for breakfast (good selection for the price) and the lines moves at a good speech. The orange juice was kind of diluted. But can't beat the price (esp with 2 for 1 coupon in the coupon book). Breakfast was $6.95. Ate late evening snack at the cafe that has good variety of food. Midnight Chinese food is really nice. ROOM: large and clean, wood furniture and updated bathroom, with plasma tv. POOL: nice shape, but didn't try. No wave machine that I can tell. SPA: Really loved the spa on women side. Facial treatment was better than other places. It's clean and not crowded. They supply robe, towel, locker, slipper, refreshments, and lotion. Bottled water is available everywhere. Can use the facility all day with purchase of treatment or day pass. TIP: South Point's coupon book offers 2 for 1 breakfast or lunch buffet. TIP#2: Bellagio has a fantastic lunch buffet during weekend. If you get in around 3:30pm, can get in for lunch price and get to try the dinner menu too. The prime rib definitely top quality. Don't miss the lobster ravioli.

Reviews.Title: “Big Rooms”
Reviews.Author: cafcolonel
Reviews.Content: I knew this place was going to be away from the strip, so I was expecting the worst. The hotel is new and big, and in a quiet area that looks very safe. I was surprised to see how big the room was. The restaurants in the hotel offer a good deal, and the discount / freebies coupon book is pretty good that you get at check-in, since it included a free bottle of wine with dinner. There is a lot of free parking, and there is a free shuttle bus to and from the airport and the strip. I think the airport bus runs hourly, so check. While we were there, many NASCAR teams stayed there, and there was a cattle show going on. The security is pretty tight at the hotel, and a guard is posted in the evenings by the elevator. The only thing that took long was the check in line at the front desk. But I forgot about that as I started walking around and seeing the theaters and bowling alleys, and all the other stuff going. I was pleasantly surprised, and would stay there again because of the value.

Reviews.Title: “What value for money”
Reviews.Author: Keith2402
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and was really suprised about how good the hotel was. My experience was that it was very clean, staff very helpful and very good facilities (pool, cinema, bowling alley, restaurants) . From the time we arrived and just walked straight up to the check-in (no queue) to the time we checked out (again no queue) we had a really nice time. Having stayed on the main strip before (Mirage, Luxor and Alladin, now Planet Hollywood) this hotel is far better value, not just because of the excellent price but the levels of facilities and service. They provide a free shuttle service to the strip (Mandalay Bay Hotel) and from there you can take the deuce bus to anywhere on the strip or take the free mono rail to the excalibur hotel further up the strip. They also provide a free shuttle service to and from the airport (saving $25 to $30 each way, compard to getting a taxi). Would stay in this hotel again without a moments hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: CRedRedRose
Reviews.Content: This was a very good stay. The hotel was nicely updated. The variety of food shops was great. You will need a rental car to get to the main Vegas strip. My only complaint was my hotel room view. I was on the 3rd floor and only had a view of a wall and a palm tree below. I would recommend this hotel and plan to stay again on a higher floor. CRedRedRose Hyattsville, Maryland

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: JP-n-CO
Reviews.Content: We just needed a place to crash for a night and the day of our red-eye flight. I didn't want to pay an arm and leg, so I Priceline-ed this hotel for 45 bucks. I must say, I was pleasantly surprised. This hotel is waaaaaay off the strip, but tries to make up for that by having everything right there inside the hotel. We parked ourselves in the garage, and check-in was easy (although, hard to find, as in Las Vegas every hotel makes you walk through the entire casino before checking in or going to the garage). I asked for a room on a high floor away from the elevators, and we had a really quiet room on the 24th floor. This hotel is newish (2005) so everything is still fairly clean and modern. The room was surprisingly big. Two comfie queen beds, a sitting area, huge windows overlooking vegas, and a huge bathroom and separate toilet/shower area. Even the coffee maker was modern. There was extra room for us to open all of our luggage on the floor. Really nice, large flat screen tv. Bath & bodyworks lotion/shampoo (Coconut Lime Verbena--our favorite) was a nice touch. The casino takes up most of the first floor, amongst some restaurants and bars. The food was so-so, but we expected that. When we checked in we were given a coupon booklet--lots of free stuff, so we ate at the breakfast buffet, two of us, for 6 bucks. Has a huge movie theater (16 screens?) and nice bowling alley. Lots of stuff for the kids to do while mommy goes and gambles for a couple of hours. The pool area was big, full of kids and semi-drunk adults. Pool water looked filmy and cloudy, so, I didn't swim too long. They have shuttles if you want to go to the strip, but we didn't venture, as we were there just long enough to eat, sleep, watch a movie, etc. Overall, this was a great value. It's a good place for a family to stay for a couple of days, or for those with time to spend at the hotel and venture to the strip (it's probably a good 3 miles).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great value at The South Point”
Reviews.Author: ImPops
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at The South Point for two nights, starting on July 27. It was great. We were on the 21st floor, room 2154. It was the perfect place to celebrate my wife's birthday! Security was at the elevators every evening and checked room keys. There was lots of security in and around the hotel, on foot, in cars and on bikes. We felt very safe even at night in the parking garage. The casino was not too smoky. Check in went smoothly. The girl that checked us in, Nicole, was very friendly and helpful and saw that we had a non smoking room on a high floor, facing the hills, just like we requested. We checked in about 1pm and even though check in is not until 3pm they had no problem letting us check in two hours early. The room was VERY comfortable. We had a king size bed that was very firm but plush and the sheets were great. The pillows were very comfortable. There was triple sheeting on the bed. The blackout curtains worked very well and kept the room absolutely dark, great the next morning after a late night when we wanted to sleep in. We didn't hear a sound from outside the room, not once while we were there. Air conditioning worked great and was very quiet. The hotel supplied soap, shampoo and shower gel from Bath and Body Works and the wife just loved that. We even had a bottle of mouthwash! The lighting was good in the room and so was the water pressure. Wireless internet worked great from the room when we purchased it for one day. There is a huge safe that you can set your own code for. It held our 15 in and 17 inch widescreen laptops and my wife's large purse and there was still room left! There is an ironing board and iron in the room, and a couch and coffee table, as well as a small dining table with two chairs. It was like a mini suite. I see that some reviews mentioned power and water problems earlier this month, but apparently that has been fixed. Our water pressure was great the entire time, and our lights never flickered once. The 42 in plasma TV had a nice selection of channels, for Vegas, and we hooked up an S video to it one night and watched a movie using a laptop. The picture on the DVD was great too. We didn't visit the pool area this time, but could see it from our room and it looked very inviting. Next time we will visit it for sure. The buffet had a great selection for lunch and we had a buy one get one free coupon given to us at check in. It was a great value at $7.99. We ate dinner in the Coronado Cafe one night. Wife had the T bone special and I had the rack of ribs. Both meals were very good. The graveyard specials were good too, and very reasonable. We don't gamble much, we do more sight seeing while we are in Vegas, but we did play the slots a little one night, and they were pretty loose for us. We came home ahead. The waitress came by frequently asking if we wanted something to drink. Every employee we met on the casino floor was friendly to us, whether we were gambling at the time or just observing or looking around. We didn't meet any employees that were rude or unfriendly during our stay. We liked that the South Point is a little ways from the strip. It was quieter there and we felt it was a great value for the money spent. We look forward to going back later this year and staying again at The South Point.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely facility!”
Reviews.Author: awesmbl94
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Las Vegas and staying at the South Point. The facility is lovely!!! The food at the Oyster Bar was delicious. Pool is awesome. Had a lovely time. It's off the strip so you don't have to deal with that mess if you don't wish to. If you wish to, there is a free shuttle to and from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best!! Can't recommend it more highly!!!”
Reviews.Author: wy0c0wb0y
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the South Point from July 24-27, 2008, after the Meridian Suites canceled a "months made in advance" reservation we had with them. I found the South Point thru TA, and it sure paid off for us. We are not gamblers, so I can not report what the gaming was like, but there was a TON of activity in the casino every night, so some were enjoying it. We had just a run-of-the-mill non-smoking, king, but the room was fantastic. Very clean, bed was awesome (I stay in hotels probably 150 nights a year, so the bed is a big deal for me), and we had a sixth floor room overlooking the pool, so the view was great. The maid service was tremendous, room was always clean and fresh, and we never heard , saw or smelled anything "untoward" our whole stay. We only ate in one of the restaurants in the hotel during our stay (we drove out this time, so we had a car, which gave us freedom to hit some places we normally don't get to), but the one we did eat in, the steakhouse, was phenomenal. Everyone enjoyed their meals, and the service was perfect. If the other restaurants in the hotel are equal to this one, they all would be great places to eat and based upon the lines to get into them, they must be close). The only complaint I had (and it's minor) was the service from the bartenders at the many bars around the hotel. Getting a drink from any of the male bartenders was a chore, they were much more interested in attending to the cocktail waitresses needs than those sitting at a bar, or at one of the tables in one of the bar areas. While the cocktail waitresses were well worth watching, it is a little irritating to have to virtually reach out and grab a bartender in order to pay him $8.00 for a drink. Didn't have this problem with the female bartenders (bartendresses???), they were right there as soon as you sat down, and the service from them was on par with the rest of the South Point---impeccable. Were going back to Vegas for the National Finals Rodeo in December, and I have already changed my reservation to the South Point. Can't imagine staying anywhere else now.

Reviews.Title: “10 Reasons why its the best !”
Reviews.Author: davesupercool
Reviews.Content: First the downside - Its a long way from the strip so if you dont have a car and want to visit Vegas its a 5 minute car ride. Now the upsides - 1.Its a long way from the strip so you arent overrun with light-gazing tourists, overdressed wanabees and , for want of a better phrase, hos & playas ! 2.The rooms are awesome - 42 inch plasma, nice bed set up and very comfortable, spacious, modern, clean and a nice bathroom area .Windows soundproofed. 3.Pool area is spacious , never crowded and has a bar and food service.Only a certain amount of beds are put out so you arent tripping over people (Mirage , for example) .And their pool hours are flexible if you want an early morning or late night swim. 4.Casino area is large and has high ceilings making it bright and airy (if thats possible with no windows).It never was smoky, unlike most strip casinos .Slots were loose (blackjack, wheel of fortune) and the craps tables were never too crowded. 5.Food - Deli was great for a quick snack with huge portions ; 2 for 1 lunch buffet means $4 each making it a bargain (desserts really good) ; 24 hour cafe great though chinese food just ok ; and for sports fans, check out the 75 cents hot dogs 6.Entertainment - Bowling and Cinemas both very good and clean ; also showroom on Friday & Saturdays have a Prince / Funk tribute band and the Spazzmatics (image 80s music meets Napoleon Dynamite 7.Housekeeping, Valet and Bell desk all excellent 8.Bingo great fun and good staff.They have electronic boards so you can just sit and drink free drinks for an hour (plus we won a $250 coverall) 9.Price - bargain ! 10 Front desk were fast and helpful.And express checkout on your tv will save time as well. My wife and i are in our late 30s, have visited Las Vegas over a dozen times and love the place.And if you want a great base for an extended stay look no further than here.We are going back i9n April & July 2009

Reviews.Title: “A haven away from the bustling crowds”
Reviews.Author: NickyToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband while he was attending a conference at The South Point Hotel. Although I have travelled a great deal this was my first trip to Las Vegas and frankly did not know what to expect. My first view of the South Point was impressive and from that moment on the hotel did not fail me. The large room was very nicely appointed and clean clean clean with all of the amenities to make life comfortable during our stay. Most days were spent sight seeing on the strip while my husband worked, and the convenient bus shuttle worked extremely well. Frankly if I had to wait a 'few' minutes for the shuttle to arrive they were welcome minutes to cool down in the pleasant air conditioned lobby at The Mandalay Hotel pick up and drop off point. On returning to The South Point and far from the maddening crowd of down town, it was always a good feeling to step off the bus and into the comfort of the hotel where I knew my lovely peaceful air conditioned room awaited me for a pleasant relaxation before the evening entertainment began. At the South Point it appeared there was something for everyone to enjoy and to cater for every taste. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again, thank you also to the pleasant South Point staff, this was a good experience and should I return to Las Vegas this will definitely be a destination of choice..

Reviews.Title: “don't take a taxi!”
Reviews.Author: debmarst
Reviews.Content: It's very beautiful and clean. we got a $49.00 nightly rate the first go round, booking early so stayed again on our way back from Colorado but the rate was $79 this time. Do not take a taxi to the strip. Cost was $30 one way! It's FREE to shuttle to Mandalay Bay and then take the tram to either Luxor or Excaliber.

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: NCJetSetter
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the South Point Hotel from July 18th thru 20th of 2008 and needless to say we were not impressed. The hotel rooms were clean but the service was awful. The decor is mediocre and it reminds me of a large scale choice hotel. We booked our room through travelocity and we felt that we had received a great rate, however no amount of money would have sufficed the inconvenience we experienced during our stay. We were awaken 2 mornings in a row at 7am to a fire alarm testing and an annoying message over the loud speaker. Why this was done so early, I'm not sure but the first morning that it happened was the worst because it lasted off and on for 2 hours. We had only been sleep for two hours befor it started. As a result I had a pounding headache when we got up that day. Since this was our first stay in Vegas we went to the Strip on the complimentary shuttle and like everyone says they barely get you there (you get dropped off at the end of the strip at Mandalay Bay). Prior to us leaving South Point none of the hotel workers knew when we could get the shuttle they only knew that it came every 20 minutes. We sat outside and waited in the Vegas heat for about 30 minutes, by then my headache had turned into nausea. Before we checked out the next day they had a water main break and we were without hot water in our room. Front desk kept telling us it would be back on in 20 minutes, we waited 2 hours and it never happened. That was the straw that broke the camels back, On our way to check out we asked other guest if they had hot water and everyone else said that they did (that made us feel great). We asked the manager for a reduced rate but he wouldn't give it to us. When we checked out of the South Point we went to the Signature at MGM and that was like stepping into heaven. I highly recommend this hotel over South Point anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Toilets and Showers didn't work for hours, power problems + + +”
Reviews.Author: Sapppro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southpoint for a karate tournament from July 17th - 19th. When we first arrived in our room the bathroom lights didn't work. Got it fixed. Then each morning, the power would go out for about 30 minutes while they tested backup generators. Very annoying being awaken at 7am through the intercom when I just got into bed a few hours ealier. My daughter had to at the karate seminars in the morning and couldn't get ready properly in a dark bathroom. When I returned to my room at 3am in the morning after a long night of partying, my room keys didn't work. Luckily my daughter & friend were in the room. Then on Sunday morning before we left, again the power went out in the morning. Next - We did not have any water pressure from 8am until 11:45am. We checked out at 11:50 am, smelling like smoke from the night before - - without taking a shower or using our own toilets. The best the Southpoint could do was issue us a $20 credit for two night. The customer service at this place is Terrible. Don'T Stay here unless you don't need a shower or toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Experience...A little far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: Gemelli
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 2006 and forgot that I didn't do a review until just now when I was reviewing my most recent LV trip. Stayed here with my boyfriend December 26th-29th, 2006. The hotel rooms are awesome. Almost as nice as the Venezia rooms at the Venetian. The casino seems a little smaller than most. We took the shuttle once and didn't have to wait too long, but there is no set schedule which is understandable because of strip traffic. This is a first class hotel. The distance from the strip is a plus or minus depending on your point of view. It did not ruin our trip but we prefer being on the strip. However, we will stay there again because of the great deal we got on the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...again and again!!!”
Reviews.Author: SBK73
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas twice a year, and have stayed at the South Point several times. I am picky about hotel cleanliness, and this hotel is one I highly recommend. The rooms are always very clean and nice. The price is very reasonable... Our most recent stay was July 6 through the 11th.The room we were first checked into had some problems with the air conditioner. They came right away to try to fix it, but never really cooled down. So we were moved to another room which was much better. The lady at the front desk was very nice and apologetic about the problem, and gave us 2 free buffets for the inconvenience. She was very adamant about wanting the customers happy and pleased with their stay. The bed was so-o-o comfortable, great t.v., spotless bathroom, Bath and Body products. The pressure in shower was a little low. They were checking fire alarms, as they are opening a new tower soon. Also, they were washing windows on the outside of the rooms, but they left a note about these things, in the room, so we were aware of them. Just minor things, which are not the norm. This is the first time we've used the pool, and it was great. Not too crowded. Lots of chairs. Nice big towels. It would be nice if the snack bar would open earlier, for cold drinks...even at 9 am you get very hot and thirsty in the Vegas sun...it is a DRY HEAT, though:)!!! There are several good restaurants, we ate at the cafe, the Mexican restaurant on the second floor, and the buffet...also the ice cream shop...The buffet didn't seem to be as good, but it was almost time to close....when they say they stop serving at a certain time, they food starts dissappearing right then! Slots seemed tight, but that seems to happen every where I go!!! I do recommend a car, it is a ways from the strip. We have used the shuttle before, but a car is much more convenient, that way you don't spend alot of time waiting around. Nice bowling alley and movie theater...also a bingo room, which we went for the first time. They have a nice gift and snack shop, which I believe is open 24 hours (I am not real sure on that, but it was always open when we went to our room , which was very late) Only things I would change about this place, is drop the fee they charge for the exercise room, and open the pool snack bar earlier. Oh, a jackpot or two would be a good idea!!! The South Point is the place for you if you want a spacious and spotless room to relax in...

Reviews.Title: “They cant seem to do anything right”
Reviews.Author: Spin359
Reviews.Content: I recently spent three days at the casino. The floor staff of the casino is very rude. A few of the dealers are OK, but the floor people walking around are nothing but rude. The buffet is really horrible for the cost and most of the food places in there stink. The big sur seafood place is good and the seafood is good. The Ice cream parlor is nice but how hard is it to dish ice cream. The hotel room is nice but since they are adding onto the hotel they are occasionally setting off the fire alarms and annoying people. Its hard to sleep through a fire alarms and loud speaker announcements. I left on 7/19/08 and on that day, Saturday morning, they did a generator test at 7 30 AM, Which entailed loud announcements and 3 or 4 fire alarms. AT 7:30 AM ON SATURDAY MORNING!!! . The room service was ok and quick but overall the place just stinks. (its also hard to take a shower in pitch black when the power is off) Avoid this place at all costs, for at least a year or two, maybe then they will have worked out there problems one more thing, unless your a slot player, there will be no comps. not even a free meal....

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the South Point!”
Reviews.Author: laurap931
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the South Point from July 16 thru 18. This two night stay followed a four night stay at the MGM grand in the West Wing. Our vacation was extended for two nights and we wanted to give the South Point a try. We were pleasantly surprised at such a great property. The room was huge and we had a nice view of the mountains! It is very easy to get in and out of. I do suggest a car if staying there. We'd spend the day on the strip by parking at one of the casinos and then head back to south point for the night's gambling and eating! Everyone was very nice there. The cocktail waitresses were very attentive and drinks were just right. I have one complaint only. The water pressure in the shower was not as strong as we like. Other than that, it was a great time. If you are looking for a middle of the strip type experience this is not the place for you. But if you are looking for a great stay at a reasonable price, keep this place in mind. We'd like to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: purple_petunia
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas for a family event, and needed a hotel close to the events in Henderson. South Point was a great choice. The place is new, and the rooms are in great condition. The elevators were very fast, and the hotel part of the casino was well guarded with security staff. The bed was comfortable, the air conditioning worked well, and it was quite clean. The room and bathroom were quite spacious. Housekeeping calls for additional towels were attended to very quickly. Only minor complaints - the showerhead was terrible, more of a dribble than a spray. There were no windows that opened in the room, which would have been nice, since the ventilation there is not good. Smoke has permeated everything there, from the casino on up to the rooms. I didn't use most of the facilities due to the nature of my stay, but the pool, spa, etc seemed nice. A good choice for those who want quality at a decent price and don't mind not being right in the thick of things.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in vegas”
Reviews.Author: Cedar240
Reviews.Content: Hi, we stayed at the Southpoint on June 29 2008 - July 3, 2008 . What a wonderful hotel and it is getting better...they have opened two new restaraunts we tried the Prime Rib restaraunt....excellent...and very affordable..three of us with wine and desert $60.00...the prime rib was excellent...The hotel rooms are excellent...the flat screen TV, clean confortable rooms, maid service was outstanding...and they do not bang on others doors so you can get a restful sleep..like other hotels we have stayed at in Vegas..(The Mirage) Pool area outstanding...We tried the deli...oh my gosh...excellent...Sandwiches big enough to be shared...Again I give the Southpoint 5 stars...yes it is south of the strip...and they do offer complimentary bus service to the Mandalay Bay...which is a 5 minute bus ride...Outstanding hotel...and they have plenty for the kids to do too...check out their website...I hope you have as much fun as we did...

Reviews.Title: “Yes its off the strip! Great Place”
Reviews.Author: bjm1271
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6/28 - 7/3. (HOT 101-111 degrees) Had a rental car. Arrived at the hotel a little before 11:00 and waited in line for a couple of minutes. Front Desk informed me that they are not checking anyone in yet and to come back in about an hour. No problem for us, we checked our bags with the Bell desk and headed out to In N Out Burger. Its a ritual for us being from NY/NJ, we are deprived. Came back to the hotel around 12:30, waited a couple of minutes in line then were given a nice room on the 21st floor. Room Review: Very clean & large. Bed was comfortable but sheets were a little rough (no big deal). One improvement I recommended was larger bath towels. Restaurants: Coronado Cafe - okay dinner type food. Didn't care for the chinese food but I am comparing it to NYC Chinatown. Baja Miguel's - Not bad. Was better then some of the chain restaurants (Chevy's, On the Border). Big Sur Oyster Bar - Good. Crispy fried Calamari & chunky New England Clam Chowder. Casino: We lost but that's why they call it gambling. The drink hostesses were great, always coming around/fast service + cold beer. Overall the casino was clean and not very smokey. Check-Out: Waited in line for a couple of minutes. The only issue I had was a $15 per day charge for a room refrigerator. This was dropped b/c it was required for medical/medicine. I checked on this before I checked in but was something missed by the front desk, no biggie! Tips: 1. If you have a car and are heading to the strip use the I-15 entrance at the back of hotel. You can fly up the highway and get off at many spots along the strip. Time & gas saver. 2. They sell liquor in the gift store in the casino. 3. Graveyard specials @ Coronado's from 12:00 - 6:00am. Several dishes are $3 - $5. Things I would change: 1. $10 a day fee to use the gym 2. $12 a day for internet access 3. Some employees need to learn how to smile at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “WOW POW BING ZING almost like the bat cave”
Reviews.Author: IrvineCATrooper
Reviews.Content: All hotels booked when we tried to book on the strip so we decided to try this one .What a place clean bright, plesant staff, food to kill for and the food servers wer better than 100%. The check in was very fast and the clerk said our names several times directed us to various areas of the casino and places to eat. The room was very big and very BRIGHT and very clean, the TV was the bigest we have seen in any of the major hotes we have stayed at and we have done all the big ones. The bathroom was very big with plenty of towels and other items to wash with. Yes the pool need some shade areas but the water was clean and the staff were more than happy to help in any way. The price was very reasonable for this size room and the service provided. We are sold on this place and will book over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “A great family stopover”
Reviews.Author: bcreilly
Reviews.Content: Our family spent 2 nights here in June as part of a longer trip and will certainly return again when our travel plans bring us back to Vegas. We have stayed in 3 different off-strip Vegas hotels in the past 12 months and this was easily the best and the best value. The Orleans and Sunset Station were the other 2 highly rated, inexpensive hotels that we have visited. The hotel was very easy to find from the airport, and check in was very quick (although it was at 1am). The standard room was huge and had a nice flat panel (42"?) screen with a full selection of cable channels for the kids. The bathroom had separate sink and shower areas so several people could get ready at once. The rooms and furnishings all appeared new. The recently remodeled pool area had a large hot tub and a kiddie pool for the littlest one, but not much shade on the 108 degree days. They also closed it early (5pm) when we were there for a concert. Plenty of parking was available right in front of the lobby. Security was very visible each evening as well to protect access to the hotel elevators. There is construction (800+ more rooms) going on, but we never heard or saw any equipment. We found good rates on travelworm.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you are willing to stay offstrip”
Reviews.Author: SimpleZeal
Reviews.Content: Chose it because it was a very highly rated hotel on http://www.tripadvisor.com. Found decent deal on Hotels.com. Check-in was quick, ample free parking in the hotel. Room was big and well maintained, nice bathroom, toiletries, towels. Nice bed, decent air conditioning [with outside temperature @ 110], nice 42" plasma screen albeit with limited channels. Would have been nice if there was refrigerator in the room for cold water and ice. Buy one get one free coupon for Garden buffet was nice. Decent buffet. Free drink coupon was welcome. Casino was pretty clean, lots of people playing. Location was not a problem since we rented a car. Be careful while driving to strip, saw two similar accidents within 0.5 mile of the hotel for 2 two consecutive days. Checkout was real quick but they charge 11.99 for Internet access per day. Keep an eye on the hotel price as it dropped as we got closer to out intended date of stay. Experience of booking with Hotels.com was horrible since they didn't fulfill their price match guarantee. Email support was non existent, phone support from call center in India was terrible. Will stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: mc1honey21
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel. I am pretty picky when it comes to hotels so it was nice to find that this hotel was not only affordable, but also very clean. The room was clean and had a nice scent. Nice huge TV. Room was made up daily which included bathroom toiletries from Bath and Body Works. I loved the huge shower. Also, the Silverado Steakhouse is pretty pricey and the food was good. I expected more for the money however the service was wonderful. Everyone needs to splurge once is a while : ) Don't forget to use the coupons in the Fun Book provided at check-in. It saves you money. Don't detach the coupons before use or they will be voided. The casino was a lot of fun. I won $175 which made it even more exciting. The staff was very friendly and responsive. I had a problem with the in room safe and an Engineer showed up within 5 minutes and took care of the problem. I am coming back to this hotel on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: Fuddy
Reviews.Content: The South Point Hotel is a wonderful place to stay for a very good price. We booked through Travelocity and didn't have any problems. Our room was very clean and comfortable and the floor was quiet. The restaurants, especially Don Vito's, were excellent, and the pool was very nice. I got an amazing hot stone massage at the spa and was able to use the facilities for the entire day. Although the hotel isn't on the Strip, they offer a free shuttle to and from Mandalay Bay which is very convenient. My only (very minor) complaint would be that they don't have pizza in any of the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: UtahBrowntrout
Reviews.Content: I, my wife and three daughters stayed two weeknights. We found an amazing rate through Travelocity. Kids loved the pool and arcade. Using the coupons we had two good and reasonable meals. Dinner at Baja Miguels and breakfast at the buffet. this was our second stay and we'll be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: HunnyBunnyTX
Reviews.Content: Date of stay: June 24-26, 2008 My dad (77) and I stayed at the South Point Hotel, Casino and Spa on the recommendation of family members. We were able to get our hotel stay as a buy one get one night free. Also using our MC to pay, we each receive $25 gas cards. The staff was very helpful in getting us rooms next to each other on a day they were at capacity. Our rooms were clean, the beds very comfortable and the bathrooms are very spacious. The complimentary toiletries are from Bath & Body Works. There were plenty of activities to keep us busy for our stay. We played Bingo (a favorite hobby of my Dad) and were able to use computerized machines to keep track of our cards. The machines do everything for you except yell out "Bingo!” if you do have a bingo the machine plays a song to let you know it. The Casino was very clean and the floor plan was easy to follow; I was able to navigate my dad through the Casino with little trouble. I was able to leave my dad alone for a little while he was playing and felt comfortable doing so. South Point also has bowling, a movie theater an equestrian center. It is definitely a place I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Overall Stay Check in Stank”
Reviews.Author: agashi24
Reviews.Content: Overall I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and our guests did as well. Ages of our group ranged from 14 - 79 and there was something for everyone. The worst part of the trip was checking-in. They had an average of 3 people at the front counter at any time (I checked in two groups of people at two different times/days). They were slow as molasses! Once we went through that hassle we went into our rooms which were very clean and spacious. Ensure you make reservations for the airport shuttle 24 hours in advance. The security at night going up to the rooms left something to be desired. It was a security guard glancing at you when you walked by to see if you had a key card. That's if they weren't too busy text messaging. We ate at four of the restaurants and were very pleased with the quality of the food and superb customer service. If you don't want to wait an hour in line to check out you can do it through guest services on your TV, HIGHLY Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: surfergirls
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed at South Point, and I would definitely stay there again. Everything was great, from the speed of check-in to the cleanliness of the guest rooms. The food was great, too!

Reviews.Title: “Great off-strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: bikom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the South Point in early June and since I was by myself, and playing poker most of the day, I really just needed a nice, cheap place to sleep. The South Point was a great choice. The room was wonderful, clean, and seemed brand new. Althought there are many "locals" casinos that have bargain rates, I can't imagine any of them being nicer than the SP, and I've stayed at a few others. However, I had my car with me, and that makes a huge difference in staying here. The staff seemed very nice, and I did take one quick dip in the pool, but did not eat or gamble there this trip. The next time I travel to Vegas by myself, I will definately make South Point my first choice. Got a great rate at their website for 50 dollars a night.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there 3 times and loved it everytime!”
Reviews.Author: Linney2
Reviews.Content: It was our third time at the hotel/casino and we love it there. If your a player, the comps are really good. Because it was my husbands birthday, we stayed in the 1000 sq ft suite on the 25th floor. It was so comfortable, I could have lived in the room. The food is alway's excellent, it doesn't matter which place you choose to eat. I seriously, don't have any complaints about anything! Yea, it's far from the strip... but for the service and price, who cares? I would give their service 5 stars.. I've stayed at the Ritz (more than once) in Henderson, and I would say my overall opinion of the Southpoint is just about the same. 5 Stars

Reviews.Title: “A great Value and a great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lenexajones
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the South Point and I was super impressed. The room was spacious and clean. Hotel was spotless and with the construction nearing completion, no unpleasant noise, just a parade of workmen coming and going very quietly. If you rent a car, this is the perfect place to serve as HQ for a nice Vegas trip. The best thing is that you don't have the mad rush of other tourists in the lobby, etc. Casino was friendly and always had $5 tables ready. This certainly will be my place of choice upon a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for for overcharging!”
Reviews.Author: grumpa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is still going through "growing pains". It is a great value Las Vegas hotel- we paid $47 a night for a 3 night stay & $55 for a single night's stay by booking directly through the hotel's internet site. We had a large comfortable room each of our visits. The buffet and the cafe were both good value. That said, BOTH reservations were not as confirmed and - surprise, surprise - we were charged more than the agreed rate at check out! I contacted the Hotel's reservation department after arriving home about our experience to see if it was the hotel's policy to overcharge and then effectively call guests "liars" when the mistake was pointed out until printed proof of the hotel's error was submitted. The South Point Hotel declined to respond to my email which leads me to believe that it indeed IS the hotel's policy to overcharge AND it gives you an idea about the hotel's level of customer service. Make sure you have a copy of your reservation confirmation and brace yourself for being hassled at check out! Other issues we faced included: The rooms smelled strongly of disinfectant on check-in; Internet access was $11.95 per day; Local phone calls were $1; There were no bellmen on duty on arrival for the 1st visit; Our calls to the front desk took an average of 5 minutes to be answered; and The telephone answering system did not work in BOTH rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: HartfordNatty
Reviews.Content: This was my first four star hotel on a two star hotel budget. I still can't believe the great deal that I got on this hotel $613 from Hartford to Las Vegas Air and Hotel for 5 days / 4 nights. The hotel was clean, room was spacious, plasma television with cable service. The photos on their website is WYSIWYG. Internet access sounded high at $11.99 for 24 hours, but I heard complaints from others that other properties were charging a higher rate. This hotel has a definate Western, horse theme and is a great property for horse enthusiast and families. FREE shuttle transportation is available from the airport to the hotel and from the hotel to the main strip, but I would highly recommend a rental car. FREE parking is available at almost all of the hotels on the main strip. I parked in both Caesers Palace and Harrahs without any problems or incidents. Traffic is super heavy on the mainstrip, so if you are there for a convention, give yourself at least 30 minutes to travel from the South Point to the mainstrip locations and to find parking to get to your seminars (if your convention is not being held at the South Point). South Point offers bowling, movie theater and great restaurants. I ate exclusively at the Garden Buffet. The options were plentiful and tasted great.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel south of the strip”
Reviews.Author: gailzmarie
Reviews.Content: South Point is all thumbs up. I read a lot of the reviews about the Hotel and Casino before I booked it and was pleasantly pleased with my choice. The rooms are very nice, clean, and quiet. The swimming pool area is very nice, but there is construction noise close by with the hotel currently adding additional rooms. We tried two of the in-house restaurants and we were pleased with the service and quality. The parking garage is covered and free, so is the shuttle. The only extra I over-looked is wireless internet service - there is a fee to connect. All-in-all, if you don't mind being 5 miles south of the strip, this place is an affordable, convenient option. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel but far from strip”
Reviews.Author: coolnagard
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night so can not comment on much. but what i can say is that the hotel is quite far from the strip. the room was lovely, it was a good size and very clean. we ate breakfast in the buffet and the coupons meant we both ate for $5.00 which was good value and set us up for a long day travelling. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Overall I liked this hotel but wouldnt stay again as it is too far away from the strip but we didnt get a chance to see all that it offers.

Reviews.Title: “South Point Anniversary Get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: tootsieroll35
Reviews.Content: Our children gave us an all expenses paid two week trip to Las Vegas for our 50th wedding anniversary with a thousand dollars to spend on the slots. They chose the South Point for our stay. Accommodations were made for a handicap room, close to the elevators which was quite helpful. The room was spacious, clean, nice TV and other amenities. Loved the toiletries. The bathroom was large and shower area ideal for a handicapped person. Beds were comfortable. Check in and maid service excellent. Would have enjoyed free internet hookup. Casino floor and restaurants easy to get to. Good food, good prices. Deli was the greatest. Pool closed during renovations. Men at work with jackhammers very early in morning but we were early risers anyhow. Furniture and bed linens had fine coating of dust from work being done on upper floor which caused some breathing problems along with smoke on casino floor. Management did make apologies for inconvenience during work. Would have enjoyed having a nice couch or two comfortable chairs for older people to sit in rather than ones which were in the room. A nice area with a few benches to sit on would have been nice outside the casino, other than around pool area. Saw only two out front of the casino. Ample parking outside and in garage. Quick elevators. Security good. Plenty of slot machines, loved the penny slots and enjoyed spending our money AND also winning some to take home. Service on casino floor very good. We had a car rental so getting around was not a problem. We have been to Vegas several times, staying on the strip at the bigger hotels but found South Point more comfortable, offering a variety of things to do. We will return to Vegas for the month of July as we have done for the past 6 years. We stay in a rented house during that time.
