We will certainly visit South Point often as we have done in the past, to enjoy playing in the casino and eating at the restaurants. Staying at the South Point helped to make our anniversary a most enjoyable event. I would recommend staying at the South Point for singles, young and old, families with children, a honeymoon, and business conventions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: TrailBlazers04
Reviews.Content: South Point is a lovely hotel. Simply decorated, but bright and cheery. Toiletries in the rooms are from the Bath and Body Works line. It offers a nice range of dining experiences. Everything was very clean. The only draw back we found the location was little inconvenient if you are hoping to go the main strip. The hotel is located about 5 miles South of Mandlay Bay. They only have two shuttle stops one at Mandalay Bay and Mcaren Airport. Unless you are a heavy gambler there really isn't much to to do other than bowling or a movie in their theater. They have one gift shop that offers a limited amount of gifts. There is no shuttle schedule posted, as like other hotels we have stayed at in Vegas. When we asked the hotel staff we were told there really was not a schedule. So while waiting for the shuttle we had no idea if we had just missed it or if it was due to arrive. It dropped us off in what was almost a back entrance to Mandalay Bay to which we saw not other hotel shuttles droping people off in this area. Thus leaving us to walk quite a way to where we needed to catch the tram to reach our destination. This was not very handicap friendly to our friend who cannot walk a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Great off strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diamondwatcher
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to Vegas, so we tried a change from the strip hotels. The standard at the this hotel far exceeded what we expected given the price we paid. The room was huge, as was the bed. It was clean and well cooled. The corridor was actually too cold and we did get occasional noise from the corridor air conditioner. We used the casino restaurant quite a lot and never had a bad meal there, day or night. We saw a lot of staff members from the big strip casinos eating and playing there. Although we had a hire car we found the free shuttle to the strip convenient,this was free except we always tipped the driver.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the South Point”
Reviews.Author: cookiedino
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the South Point and was very satisfied with every aspect of my stay. My husband and I did fairly well at the casino, the choice of restaurants are varied and reasonably priced, and our room was spacious with a large plasma t.v. I liked the pool area alot- also very spacious, clean, and pleasant. My husband and I had a massage at the spa and thought the whole experience was excellent. The spa had numerous enjoyable amenities which included robes and slippers, a jacuzzi and a cool pool, a eculyptus steam room and sauna, and a waterfall of super high pressure water to let fall on your shoulders or back. There also was a relaxation room with all types of non-alcoholic beverages, fruit, comfy chairs and a fireplace. Additonally, the hotel has movie theaters, a bowling alley, and an equestrian center. We stayed for there for 2 nights and never needed to leave the property. I highly suggest joining the slot club as they send promotions through the mail. I stayed on a promotion I received which included 2 nights for the price of one, a $20 food credit, a $10 slot credit, and 20% off spa services. It was an unbelievable value and we had a great time at the South Point. I highly recommend this hotel. For me, there was no downside but I am middle aged and appreciated the spaciousness and quiet. I am not sure this hotel would appeal to a 20-something who likes to go clubbing and be near the strip. This hotel is about 15 minutes from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value but had some issues...”
Reviews.Author: evelynjean03
Reviews.Content: First off, let me just say what a great value this hotel is! It is definitely south of the strip but for less than $100 a night, it is worth the drive. We were pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and quality of our room. The rooms are a little on the yellow side...the pictures do not exaggerate that. My only complaint is on our third night, we got stuck in the elevator with our 4 year old daughter. The operator on the other end of the elevator phone was very nice and kept in contact with us while the service guys tried to get the elevator functioning again. They tried in vain for about 15 minutes and my husband finally tried to pry the elevator doors open and was able to get them open(good thing he's a construction worker) and get us out. I don't know how long we would have waited if my husband hadn't taken the initiative to get the doors open. I was relieved because I'm pregnant and my bladder was getting full. Needless to say, the manager came to our room asked if we were okay and then promptly left. We were a little rattled but no worse for the wear but I was a little surprised that she wasn't a little more concerned. I honestly expected our stay to be comped or at least the situation addressed by management by the time we checked out but NOTHING. We had to ASK for some kind of compensation and the the desk clerk grudgingly went back to ask the manager and she took one meal off our room service bill. The service was lacking and my daughter is a little rattled about elevators, but if you are looking for economy this is your place. We will be staying somewhere else next time we come to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AUDIDAVE
Reviews.Content: South Point really is a fantastic place to stay.The hotel is only a few years old so everything still feels nice and new. The rooms are lovely...huge with nice comfy beds.The food is great value and really quite good considering the low prices. The bowling alley is huge and is very cheap compared to the ones in the UK.The cinema is a great added extra. I fell lucky with the pool,because when i booked, the pool was closed and not due to re-open until 23rd May(2 days after my departure) due to construction work.However,it re-opened early and my son was delighted.It is a lovely heated pool and never got nowhere near crowded during our stay.It was nice to be able to chill out without the crowds. Be warned-----the jacuzzi pool is like stepping into a hot bath---quite strange in the middle of the desert. I diidnt go to Las Vegas for the gambling,but the casino seemed nice and light and airy.....not one hint of tobacco smoke. The hotel shuttle runs to the Mandalay Bay,with the last return trip at 1.30am.If you miss the shuttle the taxi fare from the Mandalay is around $15. I really cannot find anything negative to say about this hotel.I highly recommend it. p.s the construction work was just about completed during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “before you sleep tell the housekeeper to change the pillows or be paranoid....”
Reviews.Author: lielietrang
Reviews.Content: i loved the new hotel atmosphere. right when you step into the hallway to the rooms, you can smell the new carpeting. that was the best part of the experience. however, when you stay over that's when you'll be discontent. when you sleep with stinky pillows, from them not changing the pillows daily, that ruins everything. you start getting paranoid as i was with the towels, to see if they really do wash them. since you're not there most of the time only to sleep, you won't notice these things until bedtime. by that time, there's no housekeeping around 1/2 am. especially when you're on a schedule, you don't wanna waste your day watching over the housekeepers to see if they do replace the towels/sheets after each guest leaves. my guess is that they probably don't since i got the smell. hope the next person's experience is a better experience than mines.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!1”
Reviews.Author: chris_stfc
Reviews.Content: After an exhausting search for a honeymoon hotel it came to a toss up between the South Point, The Orleans or the Red Rock. We finally plumped for the South Point....and we are glad we did!!! The room was wonderful, a beautiful view of the mountains large and very clean. The hotel as a whole was also very clean, the staff very friendly and helpful check in and check out was very smooth. Excellent restaurants, wonderful room service and a great casino! We would definitely go back there again!!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Fit for our Vegas Vacation”
Reviews.Author: tandh2007
Reviews.Content: As a first-timer to Vegas and a non-gambler, I was more excited about seeing the sites and experiencing the thrills.... from a distance. My husband found this hotel. We loved the price and appreciated that it was just a few minutes off of the strip. The hotel is enormous and even still it's growing. There was an entire wing still under construction. (The construction didn't disrupt our stay. We didn't hear a thing.) Our room was more than spacious, the bathroom was clean and stocked with Bath & Body Works product. The bed was comfortable. The room was quiet. We over-looked the pool. But a couple weeks before the trip we were informed our rate dropped $10/night. When we arrived we realized why... the pool was closed. Darn. But it looked nice! We ate at Michael's. It was pricey -to say the least- but well worth it. We enjoyed our meals and the extra "courses" that we didn't expect (large relish tray while we cruised the menu, sorbet before the entree, and chocolate covered fruit with the check). It was truly high-class. Next time I won't wear jeans and flip-flops! Still the service treated us like we were royalty. Save your winnings and spend it here!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: RileyNEEngland
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that we have stayed at this hotel and we love it! The hotel is about 5 miles from the Strip, but as we don't go to Vegas for the casinos, it suits us fine. There is a regular shuttle from the hotel (every 15ish minutes) to the Mandalay Bay, so it's easy to get to the Strip. The rooms are large, modern and clean and all have a LARGE screened TV. There are several places to eat at the hotel, the breakfast and dinner are both excellent value. Staff have always been very helpful and friendly. The hotel is currently being extended (to include another 800 rooms), but even though we saw the builders accessing the stairwells, they did not pose any problems. There are notices apologising to guests for the presence of dust due to the building work. It's easy to get to the Car Rental Returns from the hotel, and there is also an airport shuttle. We will definitely use this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Low priced but several miles frin the main strip”
Reviews.Author: bubbafb
Reviews.Content: This casino resort is located several miles south of the Las Vegas strip. Because of its location, a car or use of taxis is necessary if you really want to enjoy Vegas. The hotel does offer complimentary shuttle service to Mandalay Bay. The hotel is about 2 years old and the property is in good shape. Although advertised as “affordable luxury” (with the rooms at $53 it is definitely affordable), this is a 3 star resort and definitely lacks the charm of many of the strip properties. No themes or grand entrances. Check-in was quick during this midweek May stay. Staff was friendly. The workout facility ($10 per day) and the spa (another $5 per day) are above par with plenty of equipment in the gym. The men’s spa was clean and had what you would expect with a sauna, steam room and a couple of hot / cool tub options. The pool was closed for new construction. Although I did not seem them, there is an equestrian center, bowling alley and movie theater on site. There are several restaurant choices but only ate at Coronado’s Café (coffee shop) and the Del Mar Deli. Both were fair. There are several casino bars around but no real nightlife and no clubs. It looked like one of the casino bars was setup for a band but none was playing that I saw. Tried The Social House at TI for dinner and thought it was overpriced and not that great; ESPN Zone at NY NY is a great choice for bar type food and watching the games. The casino had plenty of $5 tables and it was easy to get a seat. Beverage service was also plentiful. The rooms are large and have nice HD TVs, comfortable bedding, a desk area and a decent sized bathroom. The view from the 6th floor was non-existent so if you want to see something out the window, you may want to go higher. Overall, this is a decent option for budget minded travelers that have a car and are willingly to head out for better dining and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Breadhead1
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for the Interop Convention held at Mandalay Bay. Last year we stayed at Mandalay and were very disappointed - long check in, couldn't get near the pools, worn room, TV in bathroom didn't work, lots of noise from hallway, etc. definitely not worth the price. So, this year we decided to stay off the strip as we always rent a car so that was not a problem. SP does have shuttles to the strip and airport. Check in was a breeze and we were given a coupon book plus we got extra points at the slot club since both our birthdays were in April and we stayed there during our birthday month. Plus they had a members promotion going on one day and we got 2 T-shirts and a nice Thermos set. The staff were extremely friendly and service oriented. We checked in early and they put us in a room away from the construction. Not much of a view but the room was quiet and like new with a large, flat screen TV. Another nice feature was that the bathtub/shower and toilet are in a separate room from the vanity/sink area so we could both get ready at the same time. The only negative was that the pool was closed due to the construction but it is supposed to be open for the summer. We used a coupon from the book for a 2 for 1 breakfast buffet which was good. We also shared a huge sandwich at the Deli one day which was very good. They also had gigantic pastries. The dinner buffet was just average. One morning we had breakfast in the Del Mar Cafe which was also very good. They also have a Steakhouse and Mexican restaurant which we never got to try. The Sports Book had 75 cent Vienna hot dogs. There are numerous bars with nightly entertainment. We had originally planned to go to the Bill Medley/Paul Revere and the Raiders show but had a change in plans. The casino has ample slot machines and tables with low limits. Quite a few times the whole place would be humming when we walked in from the parking garage and we would just have to stop and play and it paid off nicely a few times. South Point is definitely not suffering from the cutbacks, rude employees and low payouts I keep reading about at the Strip casinos. For 1/4 the price of what we'd have paid for Mandalay this was a real deal and we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “*****Awesome hotel and ammenities!!!”
Reviews.Author: laribee
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous rooms, all you need under one roof for entertainment, great buffet, convenient shuttle service to the strip. We had a great time here, highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Large beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: Oscuro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Point for only one night while travelling through Vegas. It was very convenient for us being south of the strip and just off the interstate. We didn't have any delay checking in but then we also got there about 11 pm. Our room had already been charged to our card and there was a record of that so we had absolutley no problem with registration. The room was just as we expected, only better. New, large, beautful. Lovely toiletries in the bathroom. Bath was separate from sink and toilet - very smart idea! It was very quiet - didn't hear a thing from any where and I am a very light sleeper. In this age of the internet, folks should not be surprised by what they do or do not find in the rooms. The hotel web site is very clear about what is included. We could have used a fridge but knew ahead of time there wasn't one so no complaints from me for the lack of one! We ordered up room service. It was fast, the food was very good (and we are picky eaters) and the staff person was very professional. I would comment that folks who are staying longer might want to request a room change if they get a room in the front on the first few floors. You don't have a view at all - you are behind the front wall of the hotel! It didn't matter for us - we found it funny. I can understand the complaints from folks about the casino and smoke and registration being all in one place. That would be my only negative about this hotel. If you can get passed that, you will have a lovely big new room in a beautiful hotel. Earlier in this same holiday we stayed for 4 days in another hotel in Vegas and toured around most of the big properties. The one thing that we really liked was the stunning beautful lobbies. If this hotel had bothered to do that, I would have rated it a 5.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay from now on”
Reviews.Author: birches321
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with our stay. We checked in on a Sunday for one night. Check in was a little slow, but we have found this is true with other Vegas hotels. The room was amazing. The bed is so soft and the pillows are great - I wanted to take them home! The bathroom is very nice with a BIG counter and a separate toilet/shower area. There is a phone in the bathroom too! Fancy. The Internet is $11.99 for 24 hours. We got a coupon book at check-in which included 2-1 buffet, free cocktail, and discounts at almost all the restaurants. The TV was a large flat screen and had great quality, but not quite HD. The bathroom amenities are Bath and Body Works and smell great. There was also a coffee maker with coffee and tea packets. We had better luck gambling here than any other casino. Overall we had a great stay and plan on coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Fairly nice...but under construction right now..”
Reviews.Author: euscarol
Reviews.Content: Nice from outside. Nice interior in lobby and casino area. Most casino's are dark but this one is well lit . Very good price for the room on line at their website. Pool is closed due to construction. They sent email after I reserved on line. Renovation is in progress at the hotel and planned to continue for a couple more months. Checkin and Checkout were very slow. Only one person checking in people. Room was very noisy and heard a windy noise by the door all night. The door was not secure so a constant windy noise kept me awake. I called engineering and they said it was outside wind. I ended up putting a towel under the door and the noise went away. The electrical circuits were not working in my room. I reported that too. Seemed like the new construction caused some of these problems. Parking is good. No high rise structures to navigate. Good handicapped parking too. Good buffet and restaurants. Reasonably priced and away from main strip. Good shopping nearby. Movie theatres and bowling are also part of the hotel so you don't need to go out to find things to do. Good for family travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Attempted false billing charges at checkout-- AVOID THIS HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: Hedgefundguy
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel! They tried to add a false room service charge to my bill at checkout. I said I never ordered room service & their response was they had to charge me anyways. If on further investigation they found it wasn't my charge, they would remove. THIS IS EXACTLY BACKWARDS! You don't charge if the customer disputes, you find your computer error first and charge later. This is becoming a trend in Las Vegas, check your bills closely on checkout!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: ghisl
Reviews.Content: After reading such great reviews, I was disappointed. More staff is definitely needed at registration as we were made to wait 20-30 minutes to check in. For a hotel that is supposed to be so new, I wasn't impressed. The only redeeming feature to our room was the plasma TV. The blanket on our bed had a hole in it. The handle to the very cheaply made dresser was almost hanging off. Everything about the room (except for the TV) was disappointing. Our window kept making this odd rattling noise every once in a while likely caused by the wind. We decided to make the best of it that night but we did check out a day early. Dinner at Silverado Steak House was very good and very good value - we were both impressed by our meals and the wonderful attentive service in this restaurant. Not having a pool was also a factor something which we should have checked out beforehand. My suggestion is that you can do better on the strip if you do your research.

Reviews.Title: “Best Casino in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: parked
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Point April 12th - 17th, we were slighlty concerned when I booked this hotel because it is 6 miles South, off the strip, and the reviews said that you needed a car, you don't need a car as the hotel runs a free shuttle bus, every twenty minutes or so, which takes you to and from the strip all day. The hotel room was excellent, the casino was well laid out and easy to find your way around, the staff and all the ameneties were excellent. The strip is very busy and if you are looking for a bit of peace and quite away from the strip then this is the place for you, I would recommend this place to anyone who is going to Vegas, the only down side was the pool being closed because they are expanding the hotel, so check first before booking if the pool is a must. I would recommend this hotel and casino to anyone who is thinking of going to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay off the strip in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: PONYRCR
Reviews.Content: First let me say that I'm a single mom traveling with teenage boys, and my mother. We travel on a budget and don't have 5 star hotel experiences to compare this to. We only ask two things of a hotel/motel. 1) It's clean. No bugs, rodents or creepy crawlers in the room. 2) It's safe and secure. We can lay our heads down on our pillows and not feel like we have to sleep with one eye open. We bring our own pillows from home and always bring a safety door look no matter where we are traveling. The South Point was the last stop on a 6 day road trip. This is a nice place to stay. As soon as we pulled up a bellman came out to get our luggage, and a valet was there to park our car. After days of unpacking and repacking and driving this was very nice. We did have a small problem on check-in. We had booked with Hotels.com yet the hotel did not have our reservation. This wasn't that big of a deal and was quickly corrected. Our room was large and comfortable. By far the best room we had during our trip. The beds were comfy, and the pillows nice and thick. The shower head was one of those "rain" type shower heads. I don't like these. By the time the water reaches my head it's a trickle. It makes it hard to get all the shampoo out of my hair. There was a large 42' plasma screen TV in the room. My kids loved this. As a horse racing fan I was quite pleased to see that we got TVG in our room. There was a single cup coffee maker in the room. Unfortunately they don't give you enough coffee. A call to housekeeping quickly resolved this. The shower and toilet are in a seperate area from the sink and vanity. This is nice when more then one person needs to get ready to go out. You have to pay for Wi-fi. $11.99 for 24 hours of Internet service. I didn't like this. I feel it should be free. Of course our lap top BSOD'ed and that was $11.99 down the tubes. I did like that there was plenty of light available in this room. Our last two rooms had very low lighting, so this was a nice change. There weren't many eating options in this hotel. I've stayed at other off-the-strip hotels in the past that had more choices in food. That said, the "Del Mar Deli" made a pretty good pizza, and a fabulous Black Forest Cake. The Garden Buffet served a really good breakfast. By far the best buffet food we had all week. The South Point is currently under construction. Except for the pool not being available this was not an issue. They have a bowling alley which would have been nice to use, expect that the one night we had available to bowl there was no open bowling. I was a bit chagrined by this. The South Point is off the strip, closer to Henderson, but it's an easy drive down Las Vegas Blvd to the strip. The hotel does offer a shuttle to the Mandalay Bay, but we found it very easy to drive. We were there mid-week so traffic and parking were easy enough. As for the people who complained about the smoke....come on folks it's Las Vegas. What did you expect. Yes the casinos are smokey, but it isn't that bad. I have asthma and I was o.k. I can remember being in Vegas as a kid (about 30+ years ago) and it was awful then. The smoke was so thick you could see it hanging in the air. They do allow smoking in the casinos, but they don't allow smoking near the eating establishments in the casinos. Re: the photos, yes there really was a golden/yellow cast to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mrsstats
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 1 night as we were checking into a timeshare on Sunday. Room was large, bathroom was a good size. Flat screen TV. No refrig. The hotel is off strip. They have a shuttle that picks you up at the airport. Also a shuttle goes to Mandalay Bay. We ate in the coffee shop for breakfast, nice, reasonable prices. Would recommend this to anyone looking for a nice hotel and doesnt mind being off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not Staying Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: IdahoFamily4
Reviews.Content: First of all when you walk into the Hotel, all you smell is smoke. You have to go through all the smoke to get to the Hotel Registration. My kids were covering their noses while we stood in line to check in. When we got to our room, there was no refrigerator or microwave. My husband had to keep his diabetic medicine in an ice bucket for 4 days! With a place as big as South Point, you'd think they could afford a refrigerator in their rooms. I asked the Housekeeper in the hall if they had any pillows that weren't "fluffy", she said I'd have to call Housekeeping. (geez, I am a housekeeper myself and I can just go get a pillow for a guest) When I called, they said there were no other pillows. What? No other pillows besides huge fluffy ones? I had to sleep on a folded up towel for 4 days. What joy. Thank goodness for earplugs because the heater/air conditioner rattled all night, so I am told by my family. We did enjoy the buffet and the cinema. There were no events going on at the time, so I can't comment on that. Oh and the slots are so not "looser". More like Loser slots!

Reviews.Title: “We stay here again”
Reviews.Author: msquiggy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Point March 20-21 We arrived at 11:30 am and had no trouble checking in very nice service. We requested a room away from the construction and they put us in 1407 with a view of the airport. Our room was clean, spacious and the bedding wasn't too bad. Casino was nice not as smoky as others have stated and I am a non smoker.The machines didn't pay off very well but they didn't pay off well at any of the casino's we stayed at this time. We played Bingo and it was okay. The bowling alley is great. The movie threater is another great feature. As for the buffets we had no problem with the two meals we ate there,(Breakfast and dinner)They do have alot to offer for those who want to get away from the fast pace of the strip. We will definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Vicguy_8
Reviews.Content: Chose South Point on the basis of the reviews here on Tripadvisor and was not disappointed. Arrived around 11.30 am and on entering the hotel/casino there is a large sign that reads "Registration". Lined up for 30 minutes, only to be told that they were not checking anyone in until 1.00 pm. Not that that was a problem, but not quite sure why there were not different sections for check out and check in. Perhaps a sign at the entrance to the line up would have saved us the trouble of standing in line and we would have returned later. Front desk staff, all thee of them seemed to be bored with their jobs. Spent more time on the phone and less time with the folks who waiting to check out. When we did check in, the lady on duty then was quite pleasant, but seemed to be hampered by the computer system. Took forever to find two rooms on the same floor. The rooms themselves are the highlight of the hotel. Large and well maintained. Only problem we had was the constant noise from the air conditioning units or generators on the top of the casino roof. We were on the 15th floor on the east side. Had dinner in Don Vito's and the service and food were excellent. Did not eat in any other facility so cannot comment on the quality of food or service. Drinks at the bar were reasonable compared to other casino's and staff were very friendly. A car is essential, in my opinion to stay at this hotel, due to it's location. It is fairly close to the airport, but if you want to visit the strip it is either a car or taxi. Would probably stay in another hotel next time that was closer to the strip, but the value for money at South Point is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed more and more each day!”
Reviews.Author: r_r_and_fun
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Las Vegas before, we did not know what to expect with Vegas or its hotels. After reading reviews I was also apprehensive about the smoke at South Point, but decided to book anyhow. We are very happy that we did! By late-afternoon the smoke in the casino was strong, and you do have to go through the casino to get to a lot of things. The only place that smoking is allowed at South Point is in the casino (like most hotels). This hotel makes a great effort to rid the smoke in the casino. Every morning the casino smelled fresh and clean, so we did our gambling at South Point early in the morning. There was not a scent of smoke in the guest rooms, cinemas, equestrian arena, bowling alley or restaurants. South Point is continuously cleaning (including carpets via a zamboni) and it shows. Our room was spotless, large and comfortable. Of all the restaurants that we ate at in Las Vegas, we agreed that the Silverado Steak House at South Point was our favorite overall for quality of food, wait staff, and atmosphere. There was a horse show during our stay that drew a lot of cowboy/girl guests. They were a very nice crowd of people...I can think of a lot of worse groups to occupy a hotel with! There was a scent of horse/cattle the nearer you were to the arena, but coming from a rural area ourselves, it did not bother us. It was obvious to us that the staff at South Point was happy; they were very friendly, smiling and helpful throughout our stay. Everyday that we spent at this hotel made us like it even more. We visited the big name hotels (Bellagio, Ceasars, Venetian & Palazzo) during our trip and they are more glamorus than South Point. But, don't get me wrong, South Point has some very tastefully and expensively decorated areas (some of the restaurants, guestrooms, spa, fitness center, convention center), but people stay at South Point for different reasons than the Bellagio's of the world. For $200 less per night than the high rent hotels, this is a bargain. The hotel is undergoing construction which caused some minor early morning disturbance, but not intolerable. We rented a car which worked very well for us to travel to the strip. Finding parking was never a problem at the hotel or on the strip. Elevators in this hotel are lightning fast; we never waited over 15 seconds for one. Even if you don't wish to use the spa, bowling alley, cinema or arena during your stay, at least visit them, we were very impressed. For all these reasons we really enjoyed South Point and look forward to seeing how it has changed when we stay the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, very Friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: anotherhappywonderer
Reviews.Content: My wife, sister & I stayed for a week, we are all 58+ years of age, the Hotel is very clean, a bit off the strip, which to be honest did not mar our stay, the free blue bus is a law unto itself, as there is no firm time rota to rely on, whilst taxi's charge what they like & take whatever route suits them, at an extra cost we noted. I do suggest car hire here. The food at the hotel is exceptional, the garden buffet is really well catered for & well stocked, reasonably priced, my wife has celiac disease (can't eat wheat/Gluten) the staff were unaware of this condition and did not understand her needs, to be fair here not many hotels-restaurants do, which is a pity, the high though, was when I asked the head waitress if she would wish my sister a happy 60th birthday, to which she presented Sheila, with a cake & candle, whilst the waiters sang to her, wonderfully thoughtful & considerate. which was amazing....( grace.. many Thanks to you & your staff..xx ) We have no hesitation in staying here in the future, oh by the way,,,,take the helicopter tour of the grand Canyon, well worth the money. <Thank you South Point> we enjoyed you.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel OFF the Strip”
Reviews.Author: tneureiter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the South Point last year in September and we will be staying there again in April 08. I just love this Hotel. I don't know why people keep on complaining about how far it is off the strip. Yes it is far but before I book a hotel, I always check out where it is located and since almost everybody has internet it should not be a problem anymore to see how far it is off the strip. If you have a car it really is no problem at all to get to the strip. The freeway ramp is next to the hotel and if you know where you want to got on the strip you just take that exit. If you plan on cruising the strip you will have a problem no matter where you stay even if you stay on the strip because the traffic is awful. We just park our car somewhere on the strip and then walk the strip. The next problem people keep complaining about is the shuttle. It is only logical that the shuttle can never be on time since there is so much traffic. So if you don't mind waiting for a shuttle or spending 20$ for a cab or you have your own car than this is the perfect hotel. Then people keep on complaining about the smoke. I'm a non-smoker(used to smoke) and I can't say that the casino is that smoky, everywhere where there is a big room (orleans, palace station etc.)and a lot of people smoke it allways looks smokier than in a casino with a lot of walls and corners. (Mirage, Excal. etc). What i like about the south point is that the rooms are still pretty new and clean. I dont have to worry about walking barefoot on the carpet becaus there are some discusting stains or sleeping on a bed where there are sheets with little holes or stains. (Not yet anyway) Hope it stays that way. The price is also great for what you get. When we were there in september they were already having construction, we were up on the 17th floor facing the construction and the pool and the beautiful mountains. I am also a pretty light sleeper but i did not here anything from the construction. It is true that you probably dont spend that much time in your room except for sleeping but if i dont have a good night sleep because i have to worry about discusting stains or bugs or something like that, than my day and my mood won' t be as good. I'd rather stay a little OFF the strip (with a car)in a super nice clean room, than on the strip for a little or a lot more expensive room that might not be as new and clean and comfortable. So, I hope this review helps some people to make there decision.

Reviews.Title: “Great spa, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: kbankatt
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is lovely, very clean and busy. Eat somewhere else. The bueffet breakfast at the Garde Cafe` was mediocre at best. I had a very bad and expensive chicken sandwich at the deli $11.00 for sandwich, fries and soda. I did not eat at the hotel again during my stay. The staff at the front desk and bell station were polite, but not friendly. The house keepers and spa personnel were friendly and welcoming. The spa was excellent. Make sure you book before you go. If you wait you may not be able to get an appointment. I had the hot stone message with reflexology and aromatherapy and topped it off with a caba san foot treatment. I thought the spa prices were reasonable. There was a fee ($15.00 a day or 3 days for $39.00) for use of the fitness center, but it was well worth it as it also provided access to the spa facilities, i.e. sauna, steam, cooling pool, hot tub and more. Spa day was the best day at the hotel. The hotel shuttle which was supposed to run every half an hour was too unpredictable and more than once I waited more than 45 minutes for the shuttle. Additionally, though the strip is always up. The shuttle stops running at 1:00am. There is no convenient public transportation to and from the hotel. Although it is possible to take the Deuce and CAT from the strip to South Point make sure you have plenty of time and patience. The public bus stops running at 12:30am. A cab from the strip (Mandalay Bay) to South Point is no less than $20.00 w/o tip and typically about $24.00. Because of the inefficiency of other modes of transportation, you will probably wind up taking a cab on more than one occasion. The standard room with double bed was spacious and comfortable, not spectacular. Overall, I enjoyed my stay. If they get better chefs/cooks, lower some of the food prices, encourage the staff to be more welcoming and run the shuttles later and on time, it will be a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - you get what you pay for and more”
Reviews.Author: sara_scarlette
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked our stay at South Point after poring over many different hotel reviews. We drove down from Alberta, so being off the Strip was not a problem. In many reviews, people complain about it taking forever to get to the Strip hotels - maybe next time, check where the hotel is on a map before you go! Yes, it is about a $20 taxi ride to the Strip. Either rent a car, shell out the cash, or catch the shuttle (we never did - I can't tell you what that's like). Anyways, we were very happy with just about everything at the hotel. The casino and restaurants are very similar to most of the hotels in Vegas. The casino smells like smoke, but most of Las Vegas smells like smoke so we didn't worry about it too much. We checked in rather quickly, and our room was fantastic for the price. Nice big bathroom, lovely big bed, and plenty of space to spread out. No complaints at all. If I had to find something bad to say, it would be that the food was perhaps a bit sub-par. The breakfast buffet is good value, but don't expect gourmet fare. In general, the buffet and cafe food are like diner food. A lot of fried items, but generally we were able to find something to eat. Room service was expensive but still good. We ended up eating at the little Deli and coffee shop more than the restaurants. The spa was fantastic! They really treat you well, and the amenities are really lovely. I loved the cascading showers. If you have time, book a treatment and enjoy the facilities (including pool, hot tub, fabulous showers, exercise equipment, etc). In the end, I am glad we stayed at South Point. The rate was very reasonable (about $100 US/night) and we didn't have any major problems. If you want to be on the Strip and receive 5-star service, go stay at one of the the big hotels the strip and pay $500 a night. Otherwise, South Point is a great choice for value and comfort!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed, and more!!”
Reviews.Author: kit2008
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I are seasoned Vegas travelers who usually like to stay mid-strip. We selected this hotel for its amenities and location to the LV Sports Centre. (were in town with our 14 year old son who was competing at the centre) The hotel did not disappoint: The rooms are exactly as pictured on the web-site. Large and spacious and the bathroom set-up was a bonus. Loved that there was a separate door enclosing the large vanity area, plus another door to the tub/toilet area. Tub was nice with a wide ledge for toiletries and a rain shower-head. Single cup coffee-maker was handy – was the kind with the pre-packaged pouches and disposable cartridge, so was also able to make a decent cup of tea. Bath products were also very nice and always re-stocked when a tip was left for housekeeping. We ate at the buffet for breakfast ( 2 for 1 coupon upon check-in), Coronado Café and Baja Miguel’s. All were good value and decent food. • Lot’s of penny slots. • Hotel store was excellent –Water, Milk, Juices and snacks at grocery store prices. • Barber shop was great – son wanted a haircut and got in right away. • Good elevators, express elevator to higher floors so never had to wait. • Security always checked for hotel keys (nights) so felt secure. • Flat screen TV was enjoyed by our son, and movie rental was good pricing. • Bowling alley was a draw for us and our son and his colleagues had a great time. • Deli had great pastries for quick “sweet cravings” • Parking garage was easy to navigate and we opted to park on the 5th floor to avoid having to turn left into the incoming parkers. Figured this out after the first day, and worked like a charm after that. • South strip traffic was not heavy so was quick and easy to get out to Hoover Dam, Red-rock, etc. • The hotel is expanding and construction is on the back side. We were first assigned a room on the back side, but asked to be switched after the first night. Moved to a room on the front for the next 5 nights, and all was well. Others in our group were not bothered by the construction noise at all but we’re light sleepers. We had a great stay at South Point. It suited our needs perfectly and service and amenities were excellent. It was a great option for us as we used the hotel as our home base for the sports centre and site-seeing and shopping. It offered entertainment options for our son, plus great value for our money!!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal but caution required!”
Reviews.Author: ranjean2003
Reviews.Content: Vegas changes fast! Had a good stay here in October, so didn't do any homework this time when they offered me an email promotion for $60 a night. Surprise! New tower under construction adjoining current hotel. First night they had me on the construction (West) side 15 floors up. 6am the back-up beepers start and worse - some type of horn they blast to signal the cranes. So even I had to go to the desk in the morning (no line) and say please give me a quieter room. She had to pretend she was surprised I could hear any noise from there (come on hon, you must get this 20 times a day so spare me). She moved me to 23rd floor, end of hall, East side. Long walk but good thing because the jackhammers were going in the middle section where the elevators were and the sound didn't fade til I was way down the hall. Once I got to this room, same great stay as before. Brand new furnishings, spacious, nice staff. Pool won't be opening anytime soon due to the construction but it looks like a damn nice one. Still 7 miles out of town so you basically have to have a car to make it work. Then, don't travel at rush hour and the commute to the strip is tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: walbern
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2/14/08 to 2/18/08 and had a great expieience. Check-in was fast and polite. Rooms are better than anything I have stayed in previously in Vegas at MGM or TI. Buffet was average, Primarily Prime Rib was excellent and very reasonable prices. Casino is very bright and drink service was average. If you stay here spend the money you save and rent a car, it's nice to have the extra freedom. It is very easy to get to the strip with the new I-15 entrance right next door. Downtown, Outlet malls and strip hotels are only minutes away except maybe at rush hour. If you stay before the construction is done ask for a east facing room and the noise won't be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Really South”
Reviews.Author: mamareada
Reviews.Content: I would not stay there again unless I was traveling with family members such as children or elderly. It is a good 15-20 minutes from the strip(on the free-way). It is really far south. To go out to shows or sight seeing on the strip was either an expensive taxi ride ($30) or waiting for the bright blue South Point shuttle. My husband was attending meeting there and, even though free shuttle is provided, had to plan to leave in plenty of time to wait for shuttle and then the drive. It took us an hour to get to the Rio for a show (shuttle to Mandalay Bay and then taxi line and taxi to Rio). Luckily we left enough time to eat, but ended up settling for fast Chinese at the Rio instead of a nicer restaurant there. I have to say I did appreciate that there was security at elevator bay (night only) and you had to show your hotel key to enter the elevator bays. Again, if you are traveling with teens, this is a good choice. The rooms are huge but offer no mini bar or refrigerator. Our view was of a wall, granted a pretty yellow wall, but a wall nonetheless. The bed was amazing! The linens were high quality and the mattress was perhaps the best hotel mattress I've slept on. Room was clean but furniture cheap and starting to show wear already. Every room has flat screen on the wall. Bathroom also quite big, clean and nicely decorated. However, the towels were Motel 6 size and quality. Small and scratchy. I was surprised the lines were such different quality. If I had to choose, I'm glad they splurged on the bedding and saved on the towels. We ate at the Cafe in South Point twice. Once upon our arrival, we were tired and hungry, and then the next day for breakfast. Our dinner food was good but service was awful. Our breakfast service was better but the food was awful. How could bacon and eggs be awful, you ask. I don't know but it was! My bacon was just pure grease and no taste though my eggs were OK. My husband had the South Point special and said the sausage was like chopped up hot dog. He barely touched it. If I were traveling with children under 21, I would stay there again because it is so far from the strip, the security, and the bowling alley. If I wanted to go to Vegas to shop and rented a car, I might stay there again. There is a nice bowling alley there and I guess pool and movie theater though we never checked that out. Service was mixed. When we asked how to get to the cafe the first two people we stopped didn't even know!! One bus driver was quiet and somewhat surly, another friendly and helpful. The valet was super!! He showed us how to get where we were going (Hoover Dam) on the map answered lots of questions. One waitress never came back to check on us, another brought things we didn't even ask for. I thought the casino was one of the smokiest ones we went to. We are 50 years old and were on the young side of the average crowd, except for the several high school soccer teams staying there. I have to add the room was very quiet. There was absolutely no hall noise once inside your room. Even with high school soccer team on same floor. Several business associates also chose to stay there (same meeting) and several of them thought it was great. They liked staying off strip and having such big rooms and nearby shopping. I don't go to Vegas to shop, we go for the shows and people watching so I would rather stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Pippsyo
Reviews.Content: Cheap and Cheerful - rooms are big and comfortable. It's bland and boring but provides everything you need and at a great rate. Food very average and there's the usual problem of hotel rooms in Vegas - the windows don't open in case guests want to kill themselves after a great night donating money to the casino owners in the city. Which means that the rooms smell of air freshener and I don't love that. It's a convenient overnight spot on the I-15 and doesn't take longer than about 20 mins to the Strip. Just fine and feels exactly the same as the Suncoast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravlinStarre
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the South Point Hotel and were pleasantly surprised! The hotel was very reasonable (matched Hotel.com pricing) and was very clean. The bathrooms had marble/granite counter tops, and the shower was a nice tile......they cleaned everyday and left everything immaculate.......their soaps and shampoo's were 'Bath & Body Works', which I thought was a very nice touch......the rooms had NO oder of smoke smells at all, and considering these rooms are above the Casino that is pretty amazing.....the rooms were also very quiet....we will def. stay there again~ Two thumbs up!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy-under construction”
Reviews.Author: TravelTime22
Reviews.Content: 2/13/08: Don't stay here until late 2008 unless you want to be woken at 530am. They're adding 800 rooms and start very early! Management didn't seem to care too much either. There was no warning or even a mention about construction. Instead of sleep in like I expected, I was disturbed by machine noises, backup beepers, motors running and many other noises that made sleep impossible. I brought this to the attention of the front desk manager, but was told they had no idea what the construction schedule was, which made me even angrier!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for the price!”
Reviews.Author: runningman5k
Reviews.Content: Stayed Sept. 1-5, 2007. A very, very nice hotel. Good, reasonably priced food. Large casino with just about every game you can want. Staff was friendly, attentive and very pleasant. Some of the dealers were not pleasant, but you find a few of those in every casino. The hotel is south of the main strip and airport, but nothing a rental car can't handle. A gross overexaggeration of taking 20 mins. to get to the south end of the strip. I got to NY/NY and parked in less than 10 during the evening. Also did the standard tour of Hoover Dam (hadn't been in a while) and also discovered Red Rock Canyon. A must-see. Rooms are above average in size, very clean and comfortable. Also enjoyed an hour watching the Jerry Lewis telethon live! Quite an experience. Contrary to previous reviews, the casino is not as smoky as some have made it out to be. And you don't have to pay $3.50 to get a cup of coffee at Seattle's Best. If you want to cut your expenses on certain items (like morning coffee), there is a convenience store not far down the street. The spa is a hidden treasure. Due to the construction, we had free run of the workout facility and 30% off massages. Highly recommend. If you want the fancy glitz of the strip, this is not the hotel for you. However, if you don't mind being out of the hustle and bustle this hotel is perfect and in my opinion one of the best values in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Little Known Gem”
Reviews.Author: traveler460
Reviews.Content: The South Point is an excellent hotel. Rooms are large and confortable. The casino floor is well lit and easy to navigate when compared to many Las Vegas casino hotels. It also has very good restaurants at moderate prices

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor Reviews spot on”
Reviews.Author: Peggysue45
Reviews.Content: Again another Hotel that has lived up 2 the reviews on TA...what would we do without TA so thank you 2 all the people who take the time 2 write such reviews good & bad. AS we had been 2 Vegas b4 & only here this time 4 2days we decided on the SouthPoint. From room rate 2 our room 2 the excellent buffet dinners & breakfasts & the free (park yourself) multi level undercover parking we could not have wished for better (having previously stayed at the Mandalay & MGM) yes it is away from the glitz of main stream Vegas & a car would be very handy but for our length of stay it was all we wanted as our main interest was driving 2 the Grand Canyon Skywalk The Alaskan crab legs at the Seafood Buffet were delicious (thank you 2 the guys who risk their lives to catch them) the whole Buffet is amazing both for dinner & breakfast & when you use your voucher from the booklet given to you at check in breakfast then becomes $3.95 each...also if anyone is interested in buying alcohol wait until the SouthPoint. A 1.75lt of Bacardi was USD$19.95 whereas duty free in Australia was 1lt for $25..would not hesitate to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice...for a 70 dollar hotel.”
Reviews.Author: runningpie
Reviews.Content: Everything you read about this place should have the addendum:"...for a 70 dollar hotel." The rooms are spacious and nice...for a 70 dollar hotel. The facility and restaurants are nice...for a 70 dollar hotel, etc. It is a good place if you are on a budget, but it doesn't measure up to the (admittedly more expensive) places on the strip it is grouped with in the Trip Advisor ratings. The room is large and clean. The TV is big...that's about it. It's all perfectly pleasant I guess, but completely generic. It's just a big lit up box out in the desert - very far from the strip - hardly in Vegas at all. To get anywhere from your room you are forced to do "the walk" through the smoky casino. The food options are unexciting, and its still $3.50 for a cup of coffee at the Seattle's Best. The movie theatre and the bowling alley are nice features, but to say that this is a family hotel when it is so smokey in the common areas seems almost immoral. People were wheeling their babies in carriages thru the haze to get to their rooms. Kind of creepy I thought. The construction is an ongoing noise issue in your room. It would have been a bummer if I wanted to sleep late. I can't imagine being a prisoner to the shuttle to get to the strip. Even with a rental car it was a 20 minute plus ride to the South end of the strip - never mind the rest of Vegas. There is nothing extra anywhere with this place - no fridge in the room, no microwave - it's nothing fancy - just basic straightforward accomodation far away from the strip. If that's what you're looking for then I'm sure you'll be satisfied. If you want to be in the middle of the action of the strip or are looking for an upscale lodging experience...this is not it. It's a 70 dollar hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and Excellent Las Vegas Option”
Reviews.Author: Likescleanrooms
Reviews.Content: I just checked into this hotel and I must say I decided to stay here because of the reviews, and I am not diappointed at all. This is really a nice hotel and casino, everything is clean and comfortable, thus I'm looking forward to the next three nights. The best part of this experience so far, though, is the person who took care of our party at check in. Her name is Carmen and should she be your representative at check-in, you will feel like royalty. Carmen gave us a wonderful overview of the hotel ammenities, and encouraged us to be comfortable. I cannot remember when someone has treated me so kindly. Once I leave, I'll write the full review, but for now...everything is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fizikal
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel!!! especially after spending a night at the TROPICANA!!! but I wont go there. It is a little ways form the strip but there is a frequent shuttle to Mandalay Bay. We did take a cab when we were out after 1am about $20. It was so refreshing to get to a hotel and it was exactly as it was portrayed on the net. Very spacious and clean rooms with 42 inch Flat screens. Decor was great and bed was very comfy. The view of the mountains form the 24th floor was great. Service was excellent. We had some trouble with our reservation but the check in staff was so helpful and we were checked in in no time. We stopped at the front desk on the way up to our room to request extra toiletries and ran into housekeeping leaving our room when we got up there. Restaurants were good including the buffet. I definitely recommend this location. Between the restaurants, bars, casino, bowling, movies, 1/2 off ticket kiosk South Point has it all. It was nice to pay $60 for a room equivalent of what I have payed 100s of dollars for.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice, but a long way from the strip”
Reviews.Author: Paddyj
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great and the staff very friendly. Bull riders were in town so lots of cowboys and girls. Two things to be aware of before you go; 1. Book your transporation before you go, we didn't and had to take a taxi. @$25 2. Hotel is a long way from the strip. They offer a shuttle but your odds of getting on it are the same for winning big. hee hee $30 taxi ride to the strip. 64 lane bowling alley and huge movie theater. Book the bowling ahead of time on the weekends or you won't get it. Super breakfast buffet. Win BIG PJ

Reviews.Title: “Great IF you have a car”
Reviews.Author: FTAListCom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for CES, and found it to be a great deal for its reasonable price, but with one problem. The room was great, with a wall-mounted flat-screen TV, lots of toiletries, and a clean, comfortable bed. Looking out the window at the pool, it looked a lot nicer than the standard rectangle I would expect from a locals' casino. Check-in was fast and friendly. The buffet was very nice for both breakfast and dinner, and the casino held a nice variety of games with good paybacks. The problem was transportation. The South Point runs a shuttle to the south end of Mandalay Bay, but the service was sporadic at best. I waited a half hour on the evening I checked in before the shuttle arrived. The next morning, after 45 minutes, I gave up and paid the Vegas trolley for the same trip. If there's not a huge convention in town snarling traffic, and if you've got a car, this would be a great place to stay. But the next time I'm at a convention, I'll pay a little extra to get a room at a hotel served by the monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunnygrl98
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the South Point Hotel. Our room was beautiful and very spacious, with a couch, desk, table and very large bathroom. I had no problems whatsoever with the hotel. We paid $80 for Thurs and Sun night and $120 for Fri and Sat. The spa facilites were wonderful....beautiful lounge areas and plenty of space. My husband and I both had Swedish massages. They were fine; not spectacular, but good. They do charge you a $15 fee per day to use the fitness center and spa. If you are having a service that day, though, it is free. We ate at Baja Miguel's when we first arrived. The taco salads were great and service was friendly and efficient. We ate at Don Vito's, which was also very good. They bring you warm bread with a relish that is absolutely fantastic. Very reasonable prices. We also ate at the buffet for breakfast and lunch, both had a large selection of food. The Coronado Cafe looks very basic, with a no-theme menu. I ordered the filet mignon with low expectations, but was pleasantly surprised. The Professional Bull Riding Competition was there the same weekend we were, but the hotel did not feel overcrowded....they handled the group very well with no sacrifice of service for the rest of us. One other thing that impressed us was the gift shop prices. Although some of their souviniers were expensive, it was nice to not pay $3.50 for a bottlle of water. Their drink and snack prices were very comparable to what you would pay at a 7-11. Overall, we were very, very pleased and definitely plan to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: mattkaitlyn
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel several times. It's the best deal. Newer hotel, comfortable beds and child friendly. They have a bowling alley, movie theatre, arcade, baby sitting, restaurants and spa. The spa was wonderful and clean. Only con is its not to close to the main strip.

Reviews.Title: “A so so hotel”
Reviews.Author: travblog
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the CE tradeshow on Jan 7. It is clean due to it being newly built ( around 2005). Other than that, the room , the bed, the bathroom are all average consistent with the its rating (3 star). My bed didn't even have a comforter. I called the front desk 3 times without a person answering the phone. The location is at the quite far to the south of the strip. Overall it's an average hotel having some problems with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Going South on the Strip Can Be A Good Thing....”
Reviews.Author: tymetraveler222
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at the South Point Hotel, located on the South Strip in Las Vegas. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Check-in was quick and efficient, the hotel clerk very helpful with my questions. Compared to other hotels, our distance from the entry to the hotel to our room was not overwhelming. Valet parking is available, and we always used it. They were very quick on retrieving our car at all times. There are also heaters outside while waiting for your vehicle. Our room was lovely. We had a very spacious bathroom, with a separate area containing the shower/tub and toilet. There is a phone in the bathroom, if needed. All tile and wallcoverings were appropriate for a bathroom. The sink area is large, with lots of counter space. There is a coffee pot/hair dryer/ice bucket/glasses located here. Plenty of thick, white towels. The entry to our room widened upon entering the door, where you can store your luggage, or put the items you will need each day for your adventures, and are out of the way as needed. There is a full length mirror here also. The closet has an ironing board/ iron and safe. Several hangers, though they could use more of them. A large shelf that goes the entire length of the closet, as well as one luggage rack. Plenty of floor space for a couple suitcases in the closet. The room has a very comfortable bed, several pillows, a pull-out couch, coffee table, wonderful flat screen TV mounted on the wall, 6 drawer dresser, desk and chair, and a table with 2 chairs. Two phones are in the room, one on the nightstand, and one on the desk. One large window. A nightstand on each side of the bed. I found the colors soothing, all various shades of yellow. The lighting was excellent. All things important to me worked: lights, locks, water pressure, plugs, TV remote, phone etc.! The heating worked very well, and we adjusted it several times. Housekeeping was left a tip every day and our room was spotless each day we returned. The hotel has a very nice, almost smoke free casino. Seems to have a lot of local business. Nice variety of restaurants. A huge bowling alley, though we did not partake. Theater. Equestrian Center, though no events were in progress while we visited. The hotel does have a decent store, but was the only shopping venue. We used the business center to print our boarding passes ($1.00 a page) and they were quick and efficient. Check-out was also a breeze, and they gave me an added discount I was not expecting. Overall, the hotel is an excellent choice if you want to stay off-Strip. You will need a vehicle if you want easy access to the Strip and other tourist areas. Takes about 10 minutes to reach the Strip. We appreciated the quiet of the hotel (floor 21-away from the construction), and there are many conveniences located directly around the hotel-gas stations, convenience stores, outlet mall etc. I highly recommend the South Point Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sledgey
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Rooms were clean and fresh, bed was huge and bathroom was spot on! Casino was great value! Dealers were a pleasure to play with. Food was out of this world ( you could tell a former chef owns this place). I'd recommend the oyster bar as better than any other in vegas!! It's a bit off the strip, $20-$25 taxi ride to the strip, 30 to Fremont St (ask the taxi driver for a price and make him stick to it). It's a pity this hotel isn't on the stríp, it would clean up all the others. Movie theater, bowling ally lots for the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel but to far of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine C
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel rooms were good size and very clean, clean towels and sheets every day. Check in was good we got our room early. Staff polite and friendly. We ate in two of the restaurants the food was very good and reasonable. The hotel was very busy lot of locals use the hotel, but it was never noisy even though there was work going on it never disturbed us. if your english take your own tea bags, for in your room. I have no complaints about the hotel its self. But it is a lot further away from the strip than you think, we had friends stayin at Ballys and Bellagio, and although there is a free shuttle to Mandalays it is still a way of the strip we used taxis most of the time. So although the hotel was very resonable you spend a lot on taxis. If you are travelling and have a car it probably wouldnt be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Rates, Recommend You have a Rental Car”
Reviews.Author: Hadjisan
Reviews.Content: The room was just wonderful!! Clean, well lit, large flat screen TV's. Great view of the mountains to the west. Huge (2 room) bathroom for the wife to spread out all of her make-up stuff. Sign up on their web site and you will get notifications of internet discounts. All of the staff were courteous and professional. Meals available on site were excellent and well priced. I do recommend you have a car of some type though as the hotel is well south of what most people consider the "strip". The hotel has a shuttle, but we did not make use of it. Bottom Line: We'll stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the distance”
Reviews.Author: FlyguyAustin
Reviews.Content: Some distance from the strip, but worth the travel time. Large, quiet rooms, the equivalent of 3.5 stars. My room had two TV's including a large flat panel. Casino was friendly and had low table minimums. I was given a gift bag of samples when I checked in (useful stuff) ,which was a nice touch. I checked in late so that was quick and front desk staff had a small computer problem but she kept me entertained as she worked through it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Corpfab
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest off strip hotels there is. Room has a large flat screen and is nicely decorated. Plenty of restaurants inisde the hotel. Staff was wonderful, and this casino is pretty generous with the comps (especially buffets). You do need a car if you are planning on going to the strip so be advised in advance. Never had a problem parking and it was really peaceful. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The South Point Hotel is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: JstLv2Crz
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here a few days before Christmas for a short getaway. The hotel is pretty new, and very conviently located close to the fwy. Check-in was quick and painless, and our room had a mountain view which was very nice. The room it self was big and roomy and very clean and had a very comfy bed. We ate at the buffet for lunch which was very inexpensive with the two for 1 coupon that you get when you check in. The food, let me say, didn't even taste like buffet food. It was all great! There were 7 different stations for you to pick your food from and all of it was hot/cold as it should have been served. Excellent, excellent, excellent! Gambling was good too! Loved this hotel, will stay at this hotel again the next time we are in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations for the price.”
Reviews.Author: carmat3
Reviews.Content: This is one of those big hotels on Las Vegas Blvd, but further south on the Strip.. The place is very nice and clean, and a bit busy when we arrived which was about midnight. We got a room on the Tenth floor over looking the pool and the desert. The room was magnificent, it was like a luxury suite, With a separate bed room and living area, even had a small office tucked away around the corner.. The bathroom was just huge... Two large 42 inch or larger flat screens, and well furnished, also very clean.... The casino floor had it all, and the bowling alley was huge on one of the other floors. They had several restaurants, and we sat and ate at one around 1am. Ordered breakfast, with some drinks.. Overall this was a great deal, and would stay here again.. Its not on the main part of the strip, but driving up to the other hotels wasn't a big deal, and only took a few minutes.. I paid about 165 for the room, and got more than i expected.....

Reviews.Title: “great value, very modern hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: otaecka_odjur
Reviews.Content: This hotel and casino which is about 2 years old gives you an excellent value for your money. We stayed for five nights, Sunday through Friday, and paid only $65 per room/night. Room: The room is huge, either has 2 queens or 1 king, a sofa and a large flatscreen tv. Also the bathroom with tub/shower is huge. Location: even though it is almost 5 miles down the strip, but with a rental car and free parking at all the hotels and casinos at the strip that is no problem at all. Going up the strip you pass an outlet mall or the gigantic Fry´s electronics as well. Pool: the pool area maybe does not have such a nice garden scenery like some of the other hotels, but it´s nice enough (even though construction for the 800 room extension is going on next to it). The pool area was never over crowded, so that was nice and enjoyable to relax. Casino: lots of penny slots and in general kind of country/Western style (probably due to the large Equestrian Center as well) Restaurants: their graveyard special at the Coronade Cafe @ $ 1.99 is now unfortunately only available between midnight and 6 am (it used to be 9 am). But also the buffet @ around $ 6.50 is a great deal. When checking in you also receive a booklet with lots of coupons, e.g. buy 1 , get 1 buffet free (breakfast or lunch). other activities (apart from gambling): movie theater and bowling (the largest I´ve ever seen) 1 tiny complaint: 1 morning around 10 am suddenly we didn´t have any water for about 2 hours. When we complained at the front desk, we were told that this was due to some breakdown (I would assume it was because of the contstruction going on for the hotel extension). Unfortunately this was neither lamented or any small compensation for the inconveniences offered.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a family”
Reviews.Author: pdlpsher
Reviews.Content: We stayed over here during Christmas this year. I booked this hotel based on recommendations from this site and we weren't disappointed. The room is large, with floor to ceiling window looking out towards the mountains. We requested non-smoking rooms and we couldn't smell any smoke in our room or the hallway. My parents also stayed here with us and we requested two adjacent rooms with a mountain view. Our request was met and they put us on the 19th floor. The food is inexpensive and decent, and there was a variety of ethnic foods to choose from (i.e. Chinese and Italian) at the buffet. The kids loved the bowling alley. We had a total four people and we played one game x four people and it cost us only $15 with a two-for-the-price-of-one voucher. After midnight the games are $1 each, a great value if you like to bowl. Access to the strip was a breeze. The hotel is located just off of I-15. To get to the strip we always take the I-15 since the strip runs parallel to I-15.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RN2travel2
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nites in this quiet hotel a couple of miles off the strip. The rooms were very clean and quiet. The bed was very comfortable. I really liked the fact you could go outside and not be assaulted by people selling sex shows etc. as happens on the strip. The casino was nicely laid out, and we were able to play long hours for little money. My husband enjoyed the big screen tv in the room very much. We will stay here for all our further stays in the Vegas area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nottmgal
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights over Christmas. Great value hotel (using a promo code we got a fantastic rate of $60 per room per night) with nice big rooms, good facilities and a good choice of restaurants. The rooms were spacious and clean with comfortable beds, plasma TVs, large well stocked bathrooms and safe. I would have liked a mini-bar and prefer a shower with a moveable head but they are small points. We found the buffet breakfast to be fantastic value at $5.95 with the quality of food the same as those hotels charging 3 times as much. We also had breakfast in the Cafe and dinner in the Silverado Steakhouse and Primarily Prime Rib and we enjoyed them all (apart from the screaming kids in the Steakhouse on Christmas Eve). We were aware of the location of the hotel and as we always rent a car it was not an issue. What was an issue though was the construction noise. At check in we requested rooms as far away from the noise as possible but were not told that all the handicap rooms were on the side of the hotel where the construction was. On the first morning my parents were awoken by deafening noise, looked out of their window and could actually wave to the builders as the were directly by the new extension (room 832)! They moved room but had to manage with a normal bathroom for the rest of the holiday. Overall, we would recommend the South Point to travellers who have been to Vegas before and are happy to stay a bit further out and have their own transport (although there is a shuttle bus).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: albe1
Reviews.Content: My wife, daugjther, mother-in-law, and I all stayed here for one night before flying out of Las Vegas the following morning. We decided to stay here because of the low price but I was greatly surprised by how much we loved this place. We ate at the buffet they had and the selection was spectacular. By far, the largest selection of any I have ever seen and it was all delicious. My wife stopped by the slot machines on the way back to the room and won about $8 in the few minutes that she played which made up to the $8 that I lost in the few minutes that I played. The room was very clean and was practically brand new. Parking was free and it was close to the airport. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lacks charm - won't stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: KrisKros
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for three nights in September, and unfortunately I have to say that this was the worse hotel we stayed at during our roadtrip in the US. It’s an enormous place, with spacious rooms, huge plasma television screens and lots of entertainment, but it just lacks charm. It just lacks the extra that is needed to get to the next level…if you know what I mean. Compared to Omni, Intercontinental, Sheraton and Westin – the South Point is a totally soulless place! The clientele at this hotel is really “weird” in a strange way… I’ve never been to Vegas before, but we ate at both La Mirage and Planet Hollywood and the clientele there can’t be compared with what we ran into at South Point. I don’t know what South Point is rated as, but it’s for sure not a 4* hotel! A 4* hotel will always have adapters available for their international guests, they won’t put you in a handicap room, when you’ve booked and paid for a regular double-room and they won’t make you wait for 30 min in a line, when you’ve been promised a new and regular room the next morning – just to find out that you’ve been moved to a room with terrible view, furthest down the corridor. The beds were also of poor quality – can’t be compared with the heavenly beds at Westin and Omni –and the cleanliness was so and so…. Just felt like South Point was a tasteless place and will for sure never stay there again. Can’t understand how people can rate it as a 5! Have we been to different places?....

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable - Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Bubba'sDad
Reviews.Content: The photos and commentary of previous reviewers are accurate. My wife and I would definitely stay here again. I will fill in some additional details that I found which might be useful to others. South Point will give a AAA discount if you call or email to the hotel reservations representatives. They will match room prices that you find at other websites for the hotel. My emails to reservations were returned within minutes. Check-in and check out were quick. The prices in the liquor/gift shop were very competitive. Internet access for your laptop is $12 per 24-hour period via wireless connection. One gets an access code using a function on the room television, which links your usage to your hotel bill. If you want wireless Internet connectivity for free, drive north on Las Vegas Blvd a few blocks to the Clark County Library, Enterprise branch. The in-room safe is large enough for a laptop plus other items. The LCD TV is very nice but it operates in stretched analog mode and not widescreen HD. A menu on the TV (that is somewhat hard to find) will show what local and cable stations are available. Our room on the front of the hotel building was quiet although there is construction going on at the back of the hotel to build a new wing. We did not detect any cigarette smoke smell in the casino or hotel room except in the vicinity of the sports book area. I would strongly recommend renting a car. Parking is ample in the outdoor lot and the parking deck on the north side of the hotel. I parked overnight in the parking deck and outdoors during the day. Security patrols were prominent. The hotel is located at the southwest corner of the intersection of Las Vegas Blvd and Silverado Ranch Blvd. Exit the hotel parking lot and turn left on Silverado Ranch to enter Interstate 15 north or south. It is the easiest way to the strip or downtown (north on I-15). The Las Vegas Outlet Mall is north on Las Vegas Blvd on the right side (PS we witnessed the aftermath of a car burglary at the outlet mall so don’t leave your belongings or packages inside a parked car). Steiner’s is a great sports bar that is also north on Las Vegas Blvd on the right side in an unassuming, but new building, in front of a strip shopping center. Rental car return requires an easy drive north on Las Vegas Blvd from the hotel. Look for the sign indicating a right turn to the off-airport, consolidated rental car facility.

Reviews.Title: “Great off-strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jude57
Reviews.Content: My partner, daughter and I stayed at South point from the 29th October to the 8th November. Our friends joined us from the 3rd to the 8th. We are Scottish, are well travelled and have been to LV a few times before and stayed at various on and off-strip hotels including Luxor. We booked the king room through Expedia and requested a high floor with a nice view, along with a rollaway bed and a mini-fridge for meds, as suggested on TA. The cost was just over $1000 for the 3 of us for 10 nights which we though was very good value.
