After a long day of travelling from Edinburgh via Newark with Continental (approximately $1000 each) and missing a set of golf clubs, we picked up our hire car from Dollar, a Chrysler Pacifica 4lt (approximately $500), and arrived at South Point late afternoon. The drive from the car rental pick-up was easy and took no more than 15 minutes (probably less). Check-in was no problem. They had the room we requested ready for us along with the rollaway bed and fridge. We paid extra for the additional adult in the room at the time of booking with Expedia, and then paid extra for the rollaway bed at check-out. We were given our book of vouchers at check-in and used amny during our stay. Within 2 minutes of arriving in our room, the rollaway bed and fridge followed. Golf clubs arrived from Continental the next day!! Our room was on the 17th floor with a view out over the pool towards the western mountains, beautiful at sunset. As has been said already, the rooms are very big and well thought out with a nice changing area, large TV, very comfy bed, couch, coffee table, table and chairs, desk, chest of drawers, good sized wardrobe, iron/ironing board, electronic safe, vanity area in bathroom and separate W/C and bath/shower. Good quality toiletries are provided. Towels could have been larger and softer but were plentiful. There is also a one cup tea/coffee maker on the vanity top. I like my cups of tea in the morning and at bed time so we bought a kettle and some larger mugs at the Outlets, then left them for the maid when we left. If we looked out the window to the right we could see the new wing being built, but it did not bother us at all, except for the pool being closed on the 1st November. We did manage to use the pool once and the spa/hot tub part was superb. I'm sure it will all be very nice again once construction is finished. We used the buffet each morning and found it very good value with an outstanding selection of foods. We also used the buffet most nights as well and really enjoyed the speciality nights of steak, prime rib and seafood. The buffet area is a bit open and does not have a lot of ambience but is nice and bright all the same. All the staff were very friendly and service was quick and efficient. Went to the steak house one night and had a nice meal, but nothing special. Used the coffee shop at 6am to get drinks and pastries before going off to golf. The hotel shop was well stocked and had a liquor store as well, with very good prices. Great choice of clothes and gifts as well. There was show jumping on in the Equestrian Centre while we were there so we watched a few rounds, which was great for a horse nut like myself. We used our vouchers for the bowling alley and had a great time. We did play a few slots but do not know much about gambling so cannot comment on payouts. Our friends won about $250 on the slots one night, so were quite pleased. The casino looked brighter than most we visited on the strip and was certainly a lot less smokey. There seemed to be lots of slots and tables. The drinks service was very efficient. We were a bit disappointed to find that the gym was not included in the room price, but was $15 per person per day extra. As we were staying for 10 days and there were 3 of us, that was going to be $450 extra, so we did not bother, which as a pity as we had intended to work-out each day to try to combat the food consumption!! South Point is in a great position for exploring the Las Vegas area with a hire car. The ramp to the interstate is right beside the hotel. It was very easy to get to the strip, either using Las Vegas Blvd, I15 or our preferred option, Dean Martin Dr. It was also easy to get east of the airport using Warm Springs Road and Eastern Avenue. Went hiking up on Mount Charleston which was so beautiful and peaceful and such a contrast from LV. Had a great lunch in the Ski Lodge on Halloween and all the staff were in costumes. They were all so helpful and lunch was so nice that we will go back there again some day. Also went hiking in the Red Rock Canyon, again a beautiful and interesting area, and saw the mountain sheep. Had late lunch at the Silverton buffet on the way back and liked the choice. The buffet area was nicer and more intimate than South Point but was much smaller. The choice of food was very good. The casino area was very dark. Loved the Pro bass Shop. Also went to Grand Canyon West to walk on the glass bridge. What an experience, I was terrified. But the trip was well worth the drive and we found the whole set up very well done and good value. Buses take you around to all the view points and sites. Our main reason for going to LV this time as the PBR World Finals at the Thomas & Mack Centre. We had booked our seats months in advance through Alliance Tickets/VegasTickets.com and had a great view of both sets of chutes from the end of the arena. The finals were superb, but over too quick for us. A big extra for us was the fact that an episode of CSI was being filmed alongside the PBR finals and we saw Grissom and Brass!! We booked Blue Man Group and Spamalot online before we left and had good seats for both. We really enjoyed the shows, but especially loved the Monty Python spoof (although it seemed that a lot of our US friends did not get the jokes). Had the buffet in the Wynn before the show which was really great with a huge selection. Just found the staff to be very aloof and not that helpful. Also had the lunch buffet at TI one day because we were hungry and happened to be passing. Nice selection of food, just a bit noisy with too many kids for my liking. As usual we went to Strip a few times and walked through all the hotels and shops. Fashion Show Mall is great as is the new one at PH. Loved The Forum at Caesars Palace and also the shops at the Venetian. Found a Zappos on Dean Martin just north of Silverton and got some great shoe deals there. We went to the LV outlets a few times which was not very far away from South Point. Prices were very good for us Brits so we bought lots. The guys played golf at Desert Pines and Royal Links and really enjoyed the courses. I had booked online in advance using our Walters Golf preferred card and got good rates. We also used the driving range at Desert Pines one day as well. Did the Heli USA night flight over the strip on the last evening which was great. We booked online in advance. Pick up was from Mandalay Bay and this was our only small niggle as they would not valet park at the main entrance, which was very difficult to find, as we were not guests. We then had to go round to the back to the West entrance and then navigate through the hotel to the pick-up point at the beach level doors. Went down to Fremont Street after the heli tour and enjoyed the experience, even though it was obvious that the clientele were different than at South Point and on the strip. The entertainment was great and the place was buzzing. We just felt that we had to watch our purses a bit more. So all-in-all we had a wonderful trip and would recommend South Point to anyone who hires a car and intends to do a bit more than just gamble.

Reviews.Title: “An off-strip oasis in Crazy Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: travelinpringles
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for three nights on our first trip to Las Vegas in November 2007. I booked the hotel through a booking agent after reading the reviews here on Tripadvisor. The South Point is the cheapest out of the highest ranked hotels and represents the best value for money! We got a taxi from Macarran Airport which took around 15 minutes and cost around $25. Check in was great! Quick, easy and efficient staff. We were on the 23rd floor but this wasn't a problem as the hotel has several lifts. The hotel itself is immaculate, very clean and new. There are ice vending machines on each floor. Our room was enormous and spacious, with air con, a huge flat screen TV on the wall, two large double beds and an all important safe for valuables! Our room had a great view of the desert landscape and the room service menu was extensive. The hotel casino has a number of top quality restaurants including a steak house and our favourite was the 'all you can eat' buffet which served breakfast until 10am where you could have anything from cereals, eggs, waffles, pancakes etc. and for the lunch buffet a wide variety of foods: italian, seafood, salads, steaks and all for around $12 which was great value for money. Entertainment wise, the casino has an enormous bowling alley, games arcade, cinema and a luxurious health spa! I recommend the full body swedish massage!! There are also several bars open around the clock! The prices are great compared to the bars on the strip ($2.75 for a beer!) The hotel is set up so that you never want to leave! However they do offer a free shuttle bus which runs around every half hour and takes you onto the strip at the Mandalay Bay resort. Its about a 10 minute journey so its not bad at all. Vegas itself is crazy, we enjoyed wandering in and out of all the themed hotels but at the end of the day, we were glad to retreat back to The South Point for some relaxation!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants good value for money accommodation in a top quality hotel!

Reviews.Title: “First stay at South Point”
Reviews.Author: danbot32162
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 11/10/07 through 11/12/07 during Veterans Day weekend. Stayed in Room 643. West window view was blocked by the equestrian/ events center - I recommend staying on the 9th floor or higher in a room facing West. Room was very clean. Beds were comfortable. Bathroom also very clean. At night security checks all who access the hotel elevators. Only minor problem was the reception of the flat screen TV - picture was grainy. Free shuttle brings you to Mandalay Bay. Many Condos & timeshares have shuttles to South Point as well. Easy access to the Freeway on the Northside of the property. Lots of gaming action - I like playing 1am when the crowds thin out. Loved the breakfast buffet. Coffee shop & food court not far away. Excellent for families with things for he kids to do. Hopefully I can stay here again next year during the Jerry Lewis Telethon. Overall it was a very relaxing and exciting trip

Reviews.Title: “Sumptuous rooms, great value, family-friendly”
Reviews.Author: Creekdipper
Reviews.Content: We were traveling through Las Vegas on a hiking trip to Zion, and wanted a place away from the chaos and expense of the Center Strip. South Point was ideal. The rooms are quiet, comfortable, spacious, well-lit and tastefully appointed. The coupon book helps with the cost of meals. There are plenty of restaurants, a big casino, bowling alley, cinema -- lots to do. And, thanks to an Internet special, all for only $55 a night. The location is great if you have a car. The place is giant and easy to find, and it's convenient to the airport, the Strip, the interstate, and Zappo's shoe outlet! One caution: if you use the hotel shuttle to the Strip, pay close attention to the dropoff site. South Point doesn't use the regular shuttle site at Mandalay Bay. Theirs is unmarked and hard to find. My only disappointments: no outdoor hot tub (the hot tub is in the spa, for which you pay a separate fee) and the cigarette smoke in the casino (though this comes with the territory -- all the casinos are smoky).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GrnZoom
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at South Point. I think we will always stay there when we travel to L.V. This is the off season so there weren't many people to deal with and tarffic in and around L.V. wasn't as bad as normal. We were the only ones checking in. Check in was as fast as it could be. No lines to any of the restaurants or buffet. Perfect... The room was as we expected.. great. Clean, comfortable and quiet The only complaint I have is they charge $11.00 for WiFi hook up for your laptop. This was a geocaching trip, (What is geocaching? [--]) It would have been great to be able to use the laptop to log the caches we found. We ate breakfast at the buffet. When you check in you get a coupon book. There is a 2 for one coupon for the buffet. Good place for breakfast.. omelets made to order and anything else you desire for breakfast. If you get a "Club" card, they give you 1000 point, which equals $3.00. This can be used for food ect. Get a card and save $3.00 on the breakfast buffet. Pig out and you won't eat until dinner. LOL Also, with the "Club" card you get on their mailing list for "deals". The deal we got was $70.00 for one night, next night free. This was probalby the best deal in L.V. As mentioned on other reviews, you need a car. south Point is about 5 miles south of the Strip. For those geocachers out there. This is a great location for caching. Henderson has 100's of caches. Lot's of quick grabs for the numbers. Nick and Sharon Grnzoom (Cacher name)

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: italrish37
Reviews.Content: Arrived 11/21 for the holiday weekend ...from check-in to check-out, could not have had a better experience. This is our second stay with our teenage son, but this trip we had booked 4 rooms for additional family members. ROOMS are very spacious with large bathrooms and flat screen tvs. We were in room 1038 and had a view of the pool below with construction to the right. Construction started again on Saturday after Thanksgiving, but we could hardly hear any noise from outside. We had our car, so traveling down the strip was not a problem. When we did not feel like battling the strip traffic, we traveled via the freeway. The on ramp is RIGHT next to the hotel. Getting back and forth to a particular part of town was not a problem. MOVIES/BOWLING: My son and his friend saw a movie and then moved on to bowling. Both areas are very nice and located right next to the elevators so the kids didn't have to cut through the casino. GAMBLING: I'm not a big gambler, but my husband enjoyed playing video roulette and doubled his money UNTIL the weekend. We ended up breaking even :) RESTAURANTS: We had friends try the Oyster bar and said it was very good. We ate at the CAFE 3 times late at night and the hamburgers were excellent! Most late night egg/bacon/sausage specials are $1.99... use your coupon book and it's FREE. OVERALL: Wonderful stay and we would highly recommend to others, especially those with children. Speaking of children, there must have been a soccer tournament after the holiday as LOTS of kids arrived on Friday dressed in their uniforms. The place was packed with kids of all ages, including teens. A+ experience and can't wait for our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Pluttan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good. Cheap, excellent, fresch rooms! Unfortunately it´s situated some kilometers from the strip but if you have a car it´s no problem. We enjoyed our stay at south point hotel after reading at tripadvisor that this was a great hotel. And it was, it was very good. Stay here if you have a car and less money!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a few downpoints”
Reviews.Author: Andyvegas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for a week long stay,so it felt like my little home !!! The rooms are big and nice,very clean. Bathrooms excellent. The downpoints are the following : Casino,big and soulless,it felt more like a wearehouse.They have great gambling value tho..I havent' seen $5 single deck blackjack in years !!! Spa : it totally sucked. The man spa is quite unpleasant,with no lights at all. The terapist who took care of me was totally unexperienced,well prepared on massaging back and shoulders but totally unprepared with legs and feet...too bad. And yes,the place is away from everything,so you must have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, saddle up”
Reviews.Author: Azvegas
Reviews.Content: Easy and convenient Las Vegas experience a short trip from the main action of the Strip. This place is only six miles from the LAS Rental Car Center Annex of McCarren Airport or the South end of Las Vegas Boulevard Strip--Mandalay Bay. Parking is easy, the casino/hotel is new and well cared for, I-15 Interstate access is super convenient for quick trips to the Strip. Everything for a good time is there, but a rental car frees up your Strip options. At least go check-out Mandalay Bay/Luxor which are interconnected by the Mandalay Place Hall, since South Point offers a shuttle service. Expect some 7am-4pm construction noise for the new Hotel Wing, not too bad though I advise bringing earplugs which are useful for the flight anyhow. In a casino/ hotel comparison, South Point reminds me of The Aladdin before its change-over the the Planet Hollywood markee. Other places definitely worth checking-out, the Wynn-wow!, the fabulous Red Rock Casino which is the grown-up version of The Hard Rock Hotel Casino and Mandalay Bay/The Hotel especially MIX which has an incredible view high-up over the Strip which is a ton better than Rio's Voodoo Lounge view in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific LV value off-strip”
Reviews.Author: Danhedonia
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas (former) local -- I am familiar with the multiple options in town. Plainly put, if you are looking for good value in a terrific hotel room off-Strip, the South Point is highly recommended. Location: 2-3 miles easy drive from the southern (preferable) end of the Strip. Easy airport access. Room quality: outstanding. Firm mattress, LCD or plasma TV in most rooms, floor to ceiling windows with good views. Good HVAC system. Property: you -can- gamble here, if you wish. Also has multiplex cinema, bowling alley, and equestrian center. Parking is simple. If rooms are under $100, and you are unable to find equal value on the Strip, I'd go for this in a flash. Whenever we had family visiting, we'd put them up here.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: maff
Reviews.Content: stayed here and was a brilliant hotel apart the pool was closed. casino was great,girls with drinks was excellant.used the cinema which was good,buffet was great and even won $110 dollards on a nickel machine

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, But Read the Review”
Reviews.Author: westcoastd
Reviews.Content: Well, I had booked this trip back in July on the South Point's own website, and much to my dismay when I arrived only to be told that I had cancelled my reservation. I advised the desk person (Takeda) that this was not possible, since I was standing in front of her trying to check in. She then asked me if I had stayed at the property in July, and I said that this was the first time staying at this location, to make a long story short she went into the back, and contacted the Manager (I did not see her personally) and came back out, and apologized for the for the problem, and would honor my booking with a 10% discount. I was booked into Suite 2542, and it was fabulous, and please see the pictures to prove it. I was there for 5 days, and the property was nice, and yes there is construction going on, and it was on my side of the building, and sometimes they start early around 7:00 a.m. I ate at the Garden Buffet, and there are some nice choices for food. I rented a car so! there was no issue with leaving, and generally getting around Las Vegas. which is a common complaint with this property. I will also mention a bit of a Security issue with going up to your room. I know that at most properties a Security person is posted just outside the elevator lobby, well this occurs only in the evening hours, and not all day. I guess it's a free for all to access the guest rooms during the daytime hours. I all in all enjoyed the lavishness of my room, and the property in general, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, need to have a car”
Reviews.Author: gabriel36
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent, brand new hotel with great buffet. The strip is about a 15 minutes drive north on Las Vegas boulevard. You must have a car if you'd like to enjoy what the strip offers. The hotel is well equipped, the prices are right, the room and bathroom was spacious. The only negative I can mention there was no wireless Internet access in the room, only wired; and there's a construction going on, so be prepared for noise and dust if you'd like to spend time at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms shame about building work and closed spa”
Reviews.Author: Adsandkev
Reviews.Content: Room was excellent and very clean although you could hear the noise of the air conditioning units outside. The big disappointment was the building work and that the spa area was closed, although they did give a discount on the treatment for this. Restaurant choice was good and staff fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: jackieK07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May for the second half of our honeymoon. What we paid for 4 nights here was the same as one night at the MGM Signature and our room here was larger. Check in was quick and easy. The rooms are spacious, elegant, and exceptionally clean. We had a rental car so we got around easily. The spa service was wonderful. We mostly at at the buffet in the am. Agree more mid-range dining options are needed. Found the casino to smell smokier than other area casinos. We had a great stay and this hotel is at the top of our list for our future Vegas visits.

Reviews.Title: “Loving South Point”
Reviews.Author: myinfo
Reviews.Content: Shuttle – South Point offers a free shuttle to strip. The shuttle runs around every 30 minutes depending on traffic and takes you to Mandalay Bay. The strip trolley also stops at the same location as the free shuttle and also takes you to Mandalay Bay; from there you can transfer to another trolley that takes you down the strip. If you take the free shuttle to Mandalay Bay, just cross the street and take the deuce down the strip. Hotel This hotel is only a few years old and is very nice. The ceiling is high and the decor consists of bright colors and bright lighting, not dark like a lot of casinos on the strip. The hotel is very easy to navigate with a reasonable layout. South Point also has a bingo hall, bowling alley, movie theater and equestrian center. Casino I am a penny slot junkie and there are tons of slots. I found them to be very loose compared to the strip. I didn’t win a ton of money since I am a low roller, but I won enough to play for 5 days without hitting the ATM machine. I might have just been lucky? Room I have stayed at MGM, Gold Coast, Bally’s and the Orleans in the past and feel the South Point rooms are the best compared to these hotels. If you go to the South Point website, the picture of their hotel room was exactly what the room looked like, but the furniture is nicer in person. The room is large and has a coffee maker, and if you want more coffee in the morning just ask a maid. The room had a full length mirror, desk with chair, dresser and large flat screen TV and a table with 2 leather chairs. The bathroom has ceramic tiled floor (at least they appeared to be), large marble sink (at least it appeared to be) and a separate room for the tub and toilet. You also have a phone in the bathroom which I never used but I guess a nice touch. The toiletries are Bath & Body products. I just loved the bathroom. Restaurants: Buffet was very good. I ate breakfast and lunch. Lunch cost $7.95 and the menu changes often. There is a deli which is very good but expensive and a coffee and ice cream shop. The Coronado Café's food is tasteless. I ate at the Cafe twice and both times the food was just average or below. They really need to add a food court and more restaurants. General Info I enjoyed my stay and plan to return in the future. Pros – Rooms, Loose Slot Machines, Cheap and tasty buffets, free shuttle to strip Cons – The shuttle should be on schedule instead of every 30 minutes, it seemed I always waited 20 to 30 minutes. I would have liked more restaurants and some type of fast food place because sometimes you don’t want to eat a big meal or spend a lot of money. Note: They are building another tower with 800 rooms and a few more restaurants. I will probably return and check out the new tower.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless!”
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the rooms are clean, very clean! Besides for the price paid, I did not expect it to be that spacious. Secondly, the bathrooms are spacious as well! conveniently designed! The casino is not so crowded and big but since I don't gamble, I really didn't mind. Finally, the location was not so good, provided you have a car, it takes about 15min to reach the strip, not that bad... But I strongly recomment people without a car not to stay at South Point, it is not really convenient to take and wait for a shuttle. Overall the hotel was very good, there is even a movie theater within. Staff are pleasant as well.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind noise, then go for it”
Reviews.Author: rosewillow
Reviews.Content: The room inself was quite nice, but there is construction noise 24 hours a day which made it miserable. The pool closed at 6p and wasn't heated. The casino is filled with cigarette smoke, and must be walked through to get to the rooms. I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: abelisama
Reviews.Content: ok people i just went to South Point for my 21st birthday with my boyfriend and family and it was the time of my life! i am not into the arty scene and wanted to stay off strip so we decided to get the south point 2 bedroom suite. It was beautiful! we were on the top floor with a great view. The room was so clean and lots of space. trust me people if you dont mind staying 10 min. off strip this is the place. the corinodo cafe is the best place to eat! good food nice people. we give it 2 thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: sbccc
Reviews.Content: This was a huge surprise. We booked a suite for a week. It was fantastic. We were on the top floor - floor to ceiling windows - very nice bathroom. I actually like this place better than the Venetian or the other casinos on the strip. The gaming is good. Whether I just got lucky or the slots are a little looser is anybody's guess but I walked away a winner. The crowd is what I would call "normal" folks. No idiots wearing diamonds and gowns hoping that you will be impressed and no real losers looking like they just lost their kid's lunch money. The food is pretty sad so don't plan to eat here other than the steakhouse which was good. The wireless internet service is unreliable - but they have a hardwired option that works. Staff were helpful and friendly. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Splendor and Elegances at the South Point in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: KJK0727
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4-night 5-day stay at the South Point Hotel, Casino and Spa. The facilities are about 2 years old, and they are still doing renovations and constructions, but other than that, the facilities are beautiful. The staff is friendly and accommodating; we dined in several of their restaurants and found them to have excellent service and food, and the servers were all very accommodating. The Bell Service was extremely helpful and friendly, very knowledgeable. The rooms are spotless, and the house cleaner service should be commended on how well they maintain the individual rooms. I cannot remember when I felt comfortable enough to walk around a hotel room bare foot. Also another note about the cleanliness of this hotel, one night after returning from an all day tour to the Grand Canyon, and nursing blisters on my feet from walking the strip prior to that trip, as I entered the lobby of the hotel, I had to remove my sneakers because my feet hurt so bad, so I walked from their front door, through their casino, through their entrance into the hotel portion, (which by the way in the evenings is manned by security and they check room keys), very secure feeling, unto the elevator to the 8th floor, down the hall to our room, and I could not believe the little, almost no dirt on my socks, that is how clean this hotel is. Very impressive! Only negative thing I could find is that due to their location you have to depend on a shuttle to get you to the strip, which eats a lot of your time, or you need to rent a car. They only have 1 shuttle to and from the Mandalay Bay, and our average wait ran between 20 to 40 minutes. Maybe adding another shuttle bus would help elevate that issue.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, quiet”
Reviews.Author: opieluvCA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a bowling tournament a friend was in. Clean room, very spacious and nicely decorated. Yes, it is quite a distance from the Strip locales, but the gambling was fun and someone in our group won over $1000 on video poker, so a good place to gamble too! Parking was good. The securty guards we a little zealous though. We called them the cell phone Nazis. Even in the deli and lounge they were on you about using your cell phone. Maybe they need to move the deli and lounge so it isn't on top of the sports book, which none of us cared about anyway. That sort of ticked me off. DINING: DO NOT eat at the cafe. YUCK. Awful food and everyone who tried it said so. However, DO eat at the buffet. We had breakfast there three times and for $6.95 ($11.95 on Sun) it is VERY good. Lots to choose from and good food to boot!

Reviews.Title: “OK but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Bay_Bloor
Reviews.Content: I spent Friday through Sunday October 19-21 at South Point and really wasn't too impressed with the hotel. Like most hotel far from the Vegas strip it had a fairly good pool, cimineas, bowling, arena, gift shop and fairly paying casino machines with many locals attending the hotel. From the outside it looks really great, however, due to construction (they are adding another tower) the noise around the pool was unbearable. The food within the hotel was excellent, we ate at the Oyster Bar ( the best oysters in Vegas); Don Vito (excellent quality at reasonale prices); the Buffet (great quantity of food at low prices) and all the All Night Cafe also fairly good. I took advantage of the 30% rebate for the spa since the romain pools were closed due to construction and it was fairly good. Overall, not a bad experience but if you're planning some quiet down time by the pool, this isn't the place for the next months.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Menagerie
Reviews.Content: Our friends stayed in a regular room and my husband and I stayed in the "Professional Suite". First of all, they claim the suite is 835 square feet. The majority of this space was taken up by the bathroom. The layout of this room is really awkward. The closet is out in the living room (not in the bedroom), and the living room is really small. In the bathroom there is a sign that reads "People need to throw away their needles so as not to infect or harm other guests". Okay, that freaked us out! Junkies?? The clientele at this hotel is not your regular "Vegas" crowd. Expect to see alot of older locals. Now to our huge issue with this hotel. On Saturday we woke up and were flipping through the channels on the TV and saw a completely hard core porn movie was on the TV. Okay, we thought, whatever. That evening we had the TV on and there was still porn on. (I'm not talking soft core - I mean the raunchy stuff!) When we checked out on Saturday, we disputed the bill because they charged us $110 for the porn! We NEVER ordered it! They said we ordered a movie at 4:04am, 4:05 am, 4:07 am, an all day "library" of porn and 2 more movies on Saturday night. Okay, our TV wan't even on at 4am. Next, why the hell would we order 3 movies within 5 minutes of each other as well as an all day channel? When we disputed this charge with Jeffrey, the manager, he was completely rude. He said we had to have ordered it. I swear to God on my life we DID NOT order it! I said why would anyone order movies back to back and he said "Well, I wouldn't but apparantly some people do". RUDE! We are still battling over this charge and have brought American Express into the dispute. So, I guess I would say to stay here if you're into watching expensive porn, hanging out with locals and getting treated rudely by the staff at South Point!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: Joseph_Lakshmi
Reviews.Content: Really good place to stay. Very close to the strip, but away from noise and busy-ness. Rooms are really clean and kept well. The reception was a bit not too courteous. Gave us a 2 Queen beds instead of a King. Well thats OK i guess. Food is really cheap and good. I would go back to the same place if I get to vist Vegas again. One more thing, they have shuttle buses every half hour, until 12:30 AM. Plan on going to Grand Canyon and rent a car. We had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Off Strip”
Reviews.Author: BAFeller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the South Point for five nights the first week of October. We were very happy with the large, clean room. We had a King Bed and it was very comfortable--the plazma TV was right in front of the bed and it was great watching the baseball playoff games. We used the swimming pool every day and the hot tub was especially nice when it cooled off later in the week. There is construction going on by the pool but it didn't disturb us. They are planning on closing the pool on November 1st through the winter until construction is completed. Ask for a room away from the construction area. We had a rental car so we were able to drive down to the strip whenever we wanted. We didn't use the shuttle service so can't comment on that. We used their coupon book for bowling which we really enjoyed; and also used a coupon for the buffet and for an ice cream sudae--they're huge and excellent!!! The South Point is a very good value for the price and would definitely stay here again. If you have any questions feel free to contact us.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas' Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: Bagman97
Reviews.Content: This is the 1st time I have stayed at the South Point and we will DEFINITELY be back. We have stayed at The Orleans when Michael Gaughan owned it and knew his latest creation (South Point) would be good but didnt think it would be this good. This hotel/casino is very clean and well maintained. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful and the atmosphere is awesome. Our room was a Non-Smoking King room (standard). Very roomy and extremely nice. 40 inch flat panel TV on the wall... Sofa... Table for 2... Large bathroom... No complaints here whatsoever. We ate at the Coronado Cafe and the Garden Buffet. Both dining experiences were very good. No complaints on the food. Matter of fact, the Prime Rib on the Buffet was to die for. We played BINGO and had a great time. Very professional and well carried out. As far as gaming, we played slots, 3-card poker, craps, and roulette. The Pit Bosses, dealers, and everyone involved in the table games was very friendly and helpful. The valet service is very fast... we didnt have to wait more than 3-4 minutes for our car, even at high peak times. All in all, this is a tremendous value for the money. If you want a good Las Vegas Hotel/Casino experience and dont want to pay an extravagant price, the South Point is the place for you. Way to go Michael Gaughan, you did it again... kudos to you and your staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Price”
Reviews.Author: jimmy_sportingstar
Reviews.Content: We found Las Vegas the hardest place to find a good hotel, but we found a very good and cheap one. This hotel is away from the strip but it has so many plus's The free stuttle bus that they offer to the strip is really good, we never waited more than 10 mins for it. The room that we stayed in was at the back of the Hotel on the 16th floor. We had a very nice view out of our window, looking at the pool and out to the open land. We never thought we would get that. They are also very big, with loads of free space. As I was only 20, it was a differnet for myself as I was not allowed to drink or gamle. But I will deff be returning next year when i'm 21 - for all the fun and games of Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Dok_K
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Saturday and Sunday night in October and was very impressed with the property. It is several miles south of the Strip, so do not stay here without a car. The driving is easy away from the Strip, and car rentals are cheap. There is plenty of parking in front of the casino, and in the parking ramp near the rooms. Check-in was quick and easy to find. I could tell getting off the elevator that I would like the place. The hallway to the room was wide, well lit, and very pretty. The room itself was large and nicely decorated. The plasma screen TV was a real treat, with lots of cable channels. There was a full size dresser and drawers in the nightstands, so there was more room to unpack than is typical in a LV hotel room. Bed was very comfortable with down pillows and comforter. Large in-room safe, coffee maker, and reading lights over the bed were nice features. I don't think there is much of a view in any direction, but definitely get up as high as possible to avoid a view of the parking ramp. Pool area was fine. It will be nicer when the palm trees grow up. Nice towels available on the way in, and they have a pavilion to purchase food and drinks poolside. Only complaint was the noise from a new tower they are adding to the hotel. Construction overlooks the pool and was quite annoying, but at least we didn't hear it from our room. Casino was brightly lit with wide aisles between the slots and tables. I never felt cramped in there, and there was a pretty good variety of slots. I found 9/6 JOB video poker but didn't spot any full pay Dueces. Plenty of $5 BJ tables. Cocktail service was weak. The servers were friendly and seemed to be working hard, but I never saw very many. I don't think they had enough working at one time to really cover the areas quickly. If you will have a car and want to be off the strip, then I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay - hope construction is finished soon”
Reviews.Author: CPT_Trips
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the end of a lengthy road trip to the National Parks. We are not gamblers so we were looking for relaxation. South Park gave us that. The room was terrific . . . a big flat panel TV and plenty of space . . . there are plenty of accurate descriptions in the other posts. Check in was quick and smooth . . . no hassle with leaving my car at the curb while we unloaded; we probably had more luggage than most as we were ending a long road trip and needed to repack for the flight home. Construction, did I mention that? First the ramp from I-15 south was closed necessitating a detour to get to the hotel . . . poor signage, but LV is a grid pattern! A new tower is under construction so the pool tranquility is regularly interupted by the [-] OSHA horns. The pool was a bit cool for our liking, but there was a big hot tub that was wonderful. We received a fun book on check in that had some good deals for us non-gamblers . . . free wine, free drink, BOGO buffet and BOGO sundae . . . and they gave me a second book just for the asking. We ate at the buffet one day for dinner and the other for lunch. Both menu selections were about the same and the quality was just fine . . . not gourmet, but properly cooked with quality ingredients and the price was right even without the BOGO! As long as I had a car, I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Southpoint...but”
Reviews.Author: mygarrett2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the SouthPoint....let me tell you first of all it is a ways off of the strip but here is some great advice that I wished we had. Take the Southpoint free shuttle to Mandalay bay, from there take the free Tram to Excalibur hotel, walk across the street to the shops with the M&M Store and purchase a 24 hour pass on the Deuce for $5. Had when known that it would have saved us few bucks. We found this out on our last day in Vegas. We used the Las Vegas Trolley to travel the first couple of days which was fine ( it comes directly to the hotel) but they make less frequent rounds than the Deuce and you have to buy a day and evening pass for $4.50 each and it stops running at 12:30. The Deuce runs for 24 hours. The hotel is fabulous and you can spend the whole day there if you like. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay. First class hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WaterfallsLover
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed in Las Vegas for the first time at South Point and were very very happy with our choice (thanks to the help of Trip Advisor). Everyone we spoke to told us to stay in town but we are so glad that we didn't. South Point has everything that Las Vegas represents under one roof. A great spa, great pool, slots (we actually won!), tables, restaurants, 16-movie cinema, bowling, arcade, super clean rooms and a friendly staff. Plus, it's only about 5 minutes into the city lights of Vegas. The room was the nicest I've ever stayed in. The beds were ultra comfortable, the lighting in the room was great, the size....it was huge, the bathroom vanity and sink are in a separate area from the toilet and bathtub so it was very easy to get ready to go out, and the TV was incredible. Now I want to buy an LCD TV. We had breakfast at the buffet and I'm not a big eater but this buffet was great. It had everything from an omelet station to fruit to pancakes to oriental rice! And at $6.00 for 2 people (with coupon), it's a terrific deal. We also had the Seafood Buffet (only served on Friday nights) and it was just about as good as the buffet that we had at the Bellagio except it was about half the price! Endless shrimp, crablegs, oysters, clams and every other style of food imaginable. We visited Vegas to primarily go to Zion National Park, Bryce Canyon and Grand Canyon North so we only stayed three nights but both agreed that we could have stayed at South Point for an entire week longer! South Point made my experience in Vegas a pleasureable one and would recommend this hotel/casino/resort to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience - Check cashing bad. Be aware.”
Reviews.Author: kooledd
Reviews.Content: Had a great time from Oct 1-4. Two couples. Everything positive was commented on by others before. Very clean, quiet and most important- BOTH OFFRAMPS OFF THE 15 FREEWAY ARE NOW OPEN IN EACH DIRECTION. You now get to the strip in about 5-10 minutes Tried to cash a check at the cashier- had to fill out a credit appli- cation and had to present a social security card. All this to cash a check for $100. Was told this was a new law in Las Vegas???? Since I didn't have my social security card with me, I was asked to fill out an IRS form that enabled them to obtain a copy of my latest IRS tax filing so they could see my social security number. Of course, they also got all my private and confidential financial info- TO CASH A CHECK!! Be aware, obviously all casinos are tied into this- bring cash, credit card advance or whatever, but don't cash a check unless you want Big Brother watching. There is a Bof A and Citibank a 5 minute drive away and I cashed my check there-no problem. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “so many PROBLEMS!!!! Inept staff!”
Reviews.Author: Hello_It's_Me_21
Reviews.Content: It began well and the first day and a half were nice. The spa was nice. The fitness center was nice. The beds were comfortable. Then it started… 11:30 at night, as we were getting ready to go back out again, as it is Vegas afterall, our door opens and someone comes in. Seems the hotel booked our room for someone else too. Cutting to the chase, 3.5 hours later, 2 clerks on the phone, 3 supervisors or managers in person, and the oh so generous offer of free breakfast (hardly makes up for the security issue here of someone else having our key!) and it is still not resolved. I find my debit card was billed for the room when it was supposed to go on someone else’s credit card. And I never authorized them to use my debit card (I gave a credit card at check-in). There is more but I’m just too livid right now but you get the idea. We were asked to write our experience (this was by the only manager we could find at 2am, and she was manager of the slots) and we both wrote 2 pages of our bad experiences. This is supposed to go to the real manager of the hotel. We’ll see. I’m skeptical. And to add the final insult, we finally agreed to free lunch at the restaurant and when I checked my slot club card later in the day, I saw they deducted my “free” lunch from my comp balance. Great.

Reviews.Title: “A different Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: Bellarina126
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on an impromptu trip to Vegas with a friend. The hotel is very new, but it is not convenient to the strip at all, especially if there is traffic. The rooms are very large, especially by Vegas standards. They are very comfortable though. The bathroom has a separate toilet and shower, which is nice if several people are trying to get ready at the same time. The beds are very comfortable, and there is a flat screen mounted on the wall. The rooms were very quiet -- no street noise. Our room looked into a concrete wall, but most people don't come to Vegas for the view from a hotel room. The biggest drawback was internet being $12/day, which is almost unheard of anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: tanbp
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a week long stay at the South Point and wanted to let people know that the reviews that are on here are correct. This is an excellent place to stay. My wife and I are going back to Vegas in a couple of years and were going to stay at the Belligio or the Wynn (no kid on that trip), but have decided we are going back to the South Point. The Pros: Big room, housekeeping was great, beds extremely comfortable (best sleep we have ever had in a hotel). Good coupon book they give you at check-in. Breakfast buffet for $5.95 (including drink) can't be beat. The food of course isn't top of the line, but it was good enough and for that price you can't even get breakfast at Hardee's. The $9.95 Porterhouse steak at the Coronodo Cafe was also very good. I guess the thing that impressed us the most was how quiet the hotel was even though it was pretty crowded. We didn't have any noise problems. The cons: Even though we really enjoyed the stay, there were a couple of cons. First was the locals bringing their kids on Friday/Sat night and basically using the Ice Cream shop as a baby sitter while they gambled. We saw a couple of boys running through the casino playing football. Security needs to stop that. The pool was very nice, but cold (like most in Vegas) but the hours were too short, 10 am to 6 pm. the only other thing we didn't like (and you can't help this at any large hotel in LV) was the long walk through the casino to the hotel. One heads up. If you want a bottle of milk or a soft drink with your breakfast at the deli (not the buffet), get it at the gift shop, it will save you a little money. Something else that was nice was the fact they check your room key before letting you into the hotel elevators after 8:00 or so at night. I would also like to commend the front desk staff (Larry was his name). Check in (at 3:00 in the afternoon) took maybe 2 minutes and we got the type room we requested (up high with a view and away from the construction). Although the in room checkout wasn't working, check out at the desk (Larry again) took about a minute. Our family (including a teenager) would highly recommend the South Point!

Reviews.Title: “watch out”
Reviews.Author: sipinka
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our second trip to Vegas because it seemed like a great value and had great reviews. It was only true until the houskeeper helped herself to 700 dollars cash we left under the lamp on the nightstand for about an hour while we went down for breakfast. I'm saying it was her because she cleaned our room while we were gone. i have to note that our safe was broken and that's why we didn't use it. the worst part about this is that even though we called security immediately, they attempted to investigate but never gave us any info and the hotel director didn't even bother to call us or try to solve this in any way. after we left the hotel, all we could get hold of was her voicemail-nobody ever returned our calls. So if you are gonna stay at this hotel, you better be very carefull and not bring anything valuable with or just go somewhere where they care about their customers. South Point is not that kind of hotel-unfortunatelly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place...”
Reviews.Author: SuzyMcDreamy
Reviews.Content: This place was HUGE and gorgeous. The rooms were very large--the beds AND PILLOWS were extremely comfortable--just like at home. The bathrooms were large--very modern with something like travertine tile on the shower walls--very large vanity big enough to put lots of toiletries, etc...And the room was sparkling clean. The staff was friendly. The food at the Coronado was delicious--they had a prime rib special with all the trimmings for $9.95--and it was delicious. THe buffet was very good--I had lunch there--only 7.95--can't beat it. THe salad bar alone was worth that! It is not on the strip, but the drive is not a very long one--and it is a straight shot to the strip, too. The hotel has complimentary shuttle to the Mandalay Bay and back. At $65 a night, this was an unbelievably good deal. I will definitely recommend this place and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tight Slots”
Reviews.Author: jesscat_7
Reviews.Content: Our stay was ok, however we played slots for many hours and could not win anything and it seemed neither was anyone else near us. With all the construction going on there they should try to loosen up some of those machines so their customers don't go elsewhere. The room was clean and spacious. The buffet was not great but the other eating places were ok. Would stay again but would not gamble there as much it was hard to win and you would have to play every day for a week just to get a free buffet with their comps.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel good for the price a few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: redheadedangel41
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the south Point during a recent convention in Las Vegas, and overall were very pleased. First the beds are very, very comfortable ( I believe they are Serta Perfect Sleepers). Our rooms one on the 22 floor and one on the 17 floor were very spacious and tastefully decorated with an equestrian theme. Check in was very easy and the front desk staff very friendly. I was especially impressed when they honored our request for a late check out at 1 pm. I don't gamble so I can't comment much on the casino except that it was roomy and well laid out. A big plus was that it was not shrouded in a cloud of cigarette smoke. The fitness center was state of the art and very nice to work out in, the pool area was also quite nice although a bit loud due to construction work going on. Dining was just OK We tried the buffet; nothing outstanding and also the Coronado Cafe which was typical vegas coffee shop fare, not terrible but adequate. It is quite a drive to the strip, and traffic can be very, very bad (it took me 45 minutes to get to the convention center) and the hotels shuttle is very limited. Two issues I had were that a used shower cap was left in our room hanging on the bathroom door and the wal to wall curtain in one room would not close properly due to broken hooks this let alot of unwanted light into our room early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “A big two thumbs up- greatv experience”
Reviews.Author: PDaddyBothwell
Reviews.Content: Having been a Vegas fan for the last 15 years and having experienced the sublime to the ridiculous in terms of standards of hotel accomodation I would have to give the South Point a "big two thumbs up". The rooms are spacious even by Vegas standards, we were in a King deluxe room which was very comfortable which contained a super king sized bed which was super comfortable, dining table for two, a two seater sofa and an extremely large HD plasma TV. The quality and standard of housekeeping was very high and we found housekeeping staff to be very efficient. I would urge anyone considering a Vegas trip to think about this hotel. The only small negative is that it is south on Las vegas Boulevard away from main strip hotels. If you want to see the strip take a taxi to the Mandalay Bay and get on the free monorail which operates between this hotel and the Luxor etc and get out and walk onto strip. Alternatively take the Vegas monorail which serves some areas on and off the strip. The volume of traffic on the strip can be prohibitive to driving the route, the best way to eperience the strip is on foot anyway.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprice away from the action!”
Reviews.Author: LOVEROFPV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Point Sept. 20th - 23rd. The location of this casino worked out great for us as we were in Vegas for a wedding in Henderson...staying 6 or so miles away from the main part of the strip helped us avoid all the traffic. We had rental cars so transportation wasn't an issue for us. *Check-in: was smooth and quick - recieved a room on the 8th floor facing the hills - front desk staff were friendly and helpful. *Rooms: Spacious and clean! We had a room with two queen size beds which were very comfortable, table with 2 chairs, dresser, closet with in room safe, iron and ironing board, 42" Plasma TV, internet (fees apply) clock radio with IPOD docking, coffee maker and bath & body works toiletries (my favorite). *Casino: lots of slots and tables - didn't win any money, but still had fun. Never had a problem finding room to play at a table or at a machine. We enjoyed the lay-out of the casino floor as it was always easy to find the others we were traveling with. Not a huge casino. *Location: The location might not be for everyone, if you want to be within walking distance to all the other major casinos, this is not the place for you. They do provide shuttle service to the Mandalay Bay and to the airport but the last shuttle that returns from Mandalay Bay is 12:30 am and if you don't make that, you will need to take a taxi and it will cost you $20.00 to $30.00 depending on where you are on the strip. They do provide plenty of parking if you have a rental car or they have quick valet service too. *Restaurants: Many dining options are available from snacks to full gourmet. We tried the Garden Buffet for breakfast and lunch - both were good. We also ate at the Coronado Cafe, also good. The Oyster bar was the best - it seemed to be everyones favorite - clam chowder soup and crap legs were the best. We often met at Seattle's Best coffee shop for our morning or late night coffee. They also have a deli and ice cream shop and several other fine dining restaurants like, Silverado Steakhouse, Don Vitos (Italian) and Michaels...I heard great things about these three but I never had time to try them. *Construction: Yes, they are building more rooms and more restaurants - making it a bigger and better place but the only time we heard the noise was when we sat by the pool (but the weather was so cold and cloudy, which was strange for Sept., we only sat out for about an hour) - once in our room, we never heard it. We also picked this casino because we had many people with us that were in the age group of 16 to 20 so we thought they would enjoy the 64 lane bowling center and the 16 screen theatre, however, we were so busy, they never got a chance to do either...but for those traveling with children, I am sure that this is a nice added touch. I would recommend this casino to anyone interested in staying away from the crowded area of the strip - however, I am not sure if I would recommend this casino for a first time visitor - we have been to Vegas many times (20+) so staying away from all the action was a nice change for us. We had a wonderful time and the wedding, which took place at Dragon Ridge Country Club was fantastic - nothing could have been better! Hope you enjoy your next trip to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: robby7fan
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at the South Point Casino. The room was super clean, and BIG. The king size bed was so comfortable i could have slept all day. The view from the 19th floor was awesome. I have been to Las Vegas many times, but have never been south of the airport. This hotel is super easy to find, easy parking and best of all NO TRAFFIC getting in or out of the parking garage. The staff in the buisness center were very helpful and professional. The breakfest buffet is very good, and at a bargin price. The bowling center is first class. I am very glad i stayed there, and will be my first choice the next time i visit Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rscott6942
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights here and the hotel is a fantastic place to stay. After reading about 100 of the reviews here I decided to place my reservation and when I go back to Vegas I will stay here. It is the little things that make the difference to me. If you are renting a car and aren't afraid to learn the local highways of which most of the hotels on the main strip have access points to there is no reason to stay on the cluttered strip. When I say it is the little things I mean like the room being immaculately clean. It was spotless from top to bottom and fantastic views of the sunrise over Vegas. When most hotels the shower is warm at best here it was as hot as you could stand. I know it is a little thing but those type of things add up. I'd put the floor of the casino similar to those in Atlantic City but not quite as cluttered. The low level limits were a welcome sight no matter what time it was. What some complained about in this hotel were its strong points to me. You didn't have the insanity of the strip itself, the congestion in trying to get anywhere. We went from South Point to Austin's steakhouse in about 15 minutes, try that from the middle of the strip! The gym had decent equipment in it, all Cybex machines which were nice to use. The only thing I could possibly say is a negative at all were the pool hours, they close the pool at 6pm, not quite sure why but I was busy golfing to really care. I hope this helps anyone who reads it, good traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: whitedo0926
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights and had a great time. The hotel staff is to be commended for a excellent job. We did not have one bad experience with any of the staff. Everyone is very friendly and helpfull. The Hotel is clean and the food is great. We are already planning our next trip in the spring. Thank-you South Point for a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: candyo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the South Point for our 25th aniversary. I have been to Vegas many times but this was the first time for my Husband. He loved it. The South Point was very nice. It is a little smaller than most of the casnios on the strip but that was perfect for his first visit. The food is excellent. The steak at the Silverado is the best I have ever had and so reasonable. $22 for filet. I won $200 on a penny machine and that was very exciting. I do suggest that you rent a car as the strip is quite a ways down from the South Point. We used the pool and found it very nice. There was construction going on as they are adding 800 rooms, 3bars and 2 new resturants but it did not bother us at all. We were on the 5th floor overlooking the pool and the contruction and my Husband found the crane and contruction progress somewhat entertaining to watch from our room. Nice rooms very large. Will be going back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: MikeWisconsin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the South Point on August 22nd thru the 25th. This is our 3rd stay this year at the South Point and again found it to be a great place. We have always had fast check in and very courtious staff. I do request different view rooms each time and always leave a tip. Rooms have always been very nice and are always clean and the beds comfortable.The casino is easy to get around in and has a great gift shop with cheap liquor and beer prices. We always rent a car so distance is not a problem. I can not say much about gambling for we are penny and nickle players and never win much no matter where we go. I do love blackjack and they have plenty of five dollar tables for me to enjoy. Well, that is enough from me but do not be afraid to try it out. I know you will enjoy. Mike and Sue

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: dowalker55
Reviews.Content: Our 4th or 5th trip to Vegas. My wife and I were there from 09/09 - 09/12. Arrived at about 11 AM Sunday morning. No line up at check in. Got our room right away. 18th floor facing East. View of the top of the casino :-) and the hills. Larger than normal room. Could have used a sofa or some soft chairs. Nice TV, nice bathroom. Very nice beds. No complaints about the room at all. Ate a lot of our meals in the 24 hour cafe. Most of the time it was great/fast service(Nick was Great). Some good food and Great deals. Prime rib for 10 bucks. And it was good and very tender. Midnight specials were aslo good and cheap. Tried the buffet once for lunch. Nothing to write home about. Normal buffet food. Large casino for off strip hotel I thought. But I will say that the slots seemed very tight. Poker room is ok. Not a room, just at the end of the casino. Played a couple of tournys there. Well run, and good drink service if needed. In the slot area, it was very hard to get a drink. We had a rental car, so the location did not matter to us. About a 5-10 minute drive from the strip(Shorter once you learn the back ways) Valet was always fast. Self parking is close and plenty of it. All in all a good stay, and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “K Hastings of Lansing IL Try the South Point”
Reviews.Author: khastings
Reviews.Content: Booked two nights at the South Point day after Labor day. Place is very impressive. very well kept. rooms are large .tastefully done and very comfortable. Casino well lit and colorful.Black Jack table was very generous to us. Pool area was very nice. Hot tub was large and excellent. Buffet was passable ,but have had much better. but they do offer two for one, so that made it taste a little better. Parking was easy, ride to strip was 5 minutes. had our own car ,so not a problem. All in all a very good decision to go there .Was a nice change from the crowded strip. Got a buy one get one night free deal on travelocity. Would highly recommend trying the South Point.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Wait Until After Construction!”
Reviews.Author: Kodaker
Reviews.Content: I stayed at South Point September 9th through the 12th. I usually stay on the strip, but the price was right and I wanted to try something new. For this trip, I planned only to sleep and do a little bit of gambling at the hotel since I rented a car and still wanted to spend my time at a few other places that I haven't seen. First, I was really on the fence about renting a car, but I was very happy that I did. I can't comment on the shuttle since I didn't use it, but having a car gave me the freedom to be on my own schedule and there was ample and easy parking within the hotel's parking garage. The on/off ramp to route 15 was literally a couple hundred feet from the parking garage making it extremely easy to travel towards the strip. No complaints with the hotel or room itself. The place is very large and well appointed. I stayed in room 451 which had a window view of a wall. If a view is important, please plan accordingly and ask for something better. My main reason for writing this review is to warn people about the construction. They do not work around your sleep and will work during various times during the night. The sounds of the circular saws and hammering are deafening and you will not be able to sleep. This hotel and property appears perfectly fine, safe and well equipted and a great place to stay if you want a reasonably priced room that is off-strip. My advice to all would be to wait until the major construction is over (whenever that is) and to do yourself a favor and rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “avoid!!! currently under construction all night!”
Reviews.Author: gocardinals
Reviews.Content: I had such a terrible experience there I had to write this (though I feel bad for some employees there who were very nice). (1) DO NOT be mislead by the price I stayed there for one night only and I did get a great deal (I thought). HOWEVER, you have to take into account that it costs about $25 one way to get to the Strip. So, add $50 to the price if you consider going to the Strip. (2) CURRENTLY UNDER CONSTRUCTION My room (booked though travelocity) was nice, but they were doing construction next to my room the entire night, starting from around 1am. When I complained, they offered me to check out which was ridiculous considering it was in the middle of desert at 2am. They then offered free breakfast, which was over when I went down. I wouldn't stay there until they are done with the construction work, which should continue for a while. Either way, I would never stay there again because of the way they handled the situation which was quite rude. Finally, for their rate plus $50, I would've stayed at other reasonably-priced hotels right outside the Strip. Even their complimentary shuttle initially refused to take me to the airport because someone forgot to put my name on the reservation list. Usually I really don't write bad reviews, but this place required me to write this to do some justice.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel will return(soon hopefully)”
Reviews.Author: nickwboy
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from south point hotel,this is my fourth visit to las vegas and by far the best thanks to the southpoint.i dont know where to start,the rooms were huge with 42"plasma tv-it was the best weeks sleep i have had in years the beds are so comfy.another good point is that safes have now been installed in all the rooms and their is no rental cost(bonus). when checking in make sure you get a coupon book, their is some excellent deals to be had when spending time in the hotel. the pool was lovely always plenty of sunloungers and chairs to be had and a endless supply of clean towels!!!!cocktails at the pool bar were lush and very cheap as are most things in the southpoint(half cost of most strip hotels). if you like steaks try the silverado steakhouse the food was a1 and very cheap,we had 3 course meal with a bottle of wine $90 for the two of us the steak was that nice we ate thier 3 times.buffet is great value for money and lots to choose from. slots in the casino seem quite tight compared to other casinos i have been but the surroundings make up for that. the only small downside i found was the distance from the strip 8 miles or so,we got taxis most days to and from the strip as we could never seem to work out when the free shuttle would turn up,its roughly $20 each way to the strip still not to bad and their is always taxis waiting out front of the hotel. the only small gripe about the hotel was the construction next to the pool they are building 800 new rooms and expanding the spar so it was noisy most days having said that when we return it will be complete and be even bigger and better. viva las vegas!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place in Town”
Reviews.Author: PAHealthy-Traveler
Reviews.Content: We love this place! We could live there year round. It has good restaurants, a pool, fitness room, bowling alley, movie theater, exposition center, and gambling of course. The rooms are very large, comfortable and clean, and you would think there was no one else on your floor because it is so quiet. The price is very reasonable and we love the location because it is away from the busy strip but very accessable to the interstate. They were just finishing an interchange that is right there by the hotel. It's not far from the airport and much closer than Valley Green or Red Rock. They built extra space that they can expand into as they grow. They will be doing this shortly, adding three new restaurants and more casino. They are also going to be adding 800 more rooms. I can't say enough good things about this place and have absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, bad location”
Reviews.Author: SusieQ916
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for those coming to Vegas with the family or who want to turn in early. With a movie theatre, bowling alley and nearby shopping, the South Point can keep kids of all ages entertained. If you're coming to Vegas to hang out at the strip, however, stay closer to the strip. Although the bus runs 24-hours and the hotel advertises a shuttle to the strip, all transportation to this part of town stops at midnight and the shuttle is unreliable at best. On a trip away from the kids in late July, we were constantly frustrated waiting for more than an hour for the shuttle that actually took you to Mandaly Bay -- which is where you have to then transfer for every mode of transport from bus to trolley to shuttle. I was advised by those who'd been to Vegas not to rent a car because parking is a nightmere (and so is traffic), but a cab ride from Mandalay Bay to the South Point is $30.

Reviews.Title: “South Point; Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: montagcynan
Reviews.Content: We travel to LV almost every August, but this time we decided to do something different. Instead of staying on the Strip or Downtown, we opted to try outlying casinos and picked SouthPoint due to the room rates and high opinions of other travelers. Pros: Cheap Extra-large comfortable rooms with in-room coffee makers, safes, and many other extras. Good return on slots and better-than-average cocktail services. Free shuttle to Mandalay Bay. Cons: Located much further down on LV BLVD than they advertise; no shuttle to Downtown; no freebies for joining SouthPoint Club Card if you already had a Coast Card....even though it is no longer a Coast resort. Our rooms were only $45-$50 @ night through SouthWest Airline special room rate that SouthPoint honored. Their website had them at $60-$70 (Weekdays only, of course) Overall...7 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Loved the South Point!”
Reviews.Author: chloenavasmommie
Reviews.Content: I am a very frequent, and picky, traveler. So I have no trouble saying that I would go back to South Point casino in a heartbeat! It was beautiful, clean, modern and had everything we needed to make our stay comfortable. We stayed on a Sunday night so the discounted weekly rate was an amazing deal for what we got. The rooms were immaculately clean, and were spacious & lovely with very comfy beds. Everything was very modern & cozy. The lobby/casino area was very pretty, and you could tell the ventilation was good cause it wasn't too smoky. The pool area is gorgeous! One huge pool and a great kids pool, plus a beautiful rock waterfall jacuzzi. I highly recommend this hotel to families who are looking for kid-friendly accommodations. I brought my 4yr old & 15mo old as I was in town for a family reunion, and I found check-in/check-out to be a breeze. I also got a crib sent to my room right away. The only downside (although for myself it didn't matter) is that it is about 5 miles from the strip. But for the price of this place you get something far more luxurious for less $ than anything on the strip! I highly recommend South Point!

Reviews.Title: “South Point's my new favorite”
Reviews.Author: Silygirl7
Reviews.Content: After reading the great reviews I was very excited to stay at South Point. After going eralier this year and staying on the strip, i was looking for a change of pace, a little more laid back experience. South Point was exactly that. We had a car, so being away from the strip was not a big deal for us, plus there is a shuttle to Mandalay Bay. We checked in really late (1 am) and there was no problem with the 2 rooms we had booked. We were checked in promptly and our rooms were only 2 doors apart on the 12th floor. The elevators are directly behind the check in desk through the casino, not a far walk at all. Good security at the elevators at night, you have to show your room key to a guard to access the elevators. Rooms are fantastic, huge tv, comfortable bed, clean large bathroom, and bath and body works products in the shower, which are replensihed daily. Housekeeping was friendly and our rooms were always changed by the time we got back in the afternoon. My favorite part of the stay was the access to the pool and exercise facitlites. There is no charge to use the gym, like some other strip hotels. Plenty of exercise equipment and each station has it's own TV. The pool was also fabolous, it was open from 8am to 10pm. There is one large pool, one small pool, and a circular jazuzzi with rock waterfalls. Plenty of towels and chairs, even in the middle of the day. Food and drinks are avaiable by the pool. The only drawback was that there is construction behind the pool, so it was a bit noisy during the day. But you could not hear the contruction from inside the hotel. Only ate breakfast there, but there are many good deals. When you check in you get a coupon book, which includes a 2 for 1 buffet. Breakfst buffet was great, it was more like a brunch. There was many things including chinese food, omlete station, fruit bar, and dessert bar. The Calypso cafe also offers tremendous breakfast specials before 9am. A full breakfast for $1.95, how can you beat that. Went to Fever one night to check out the free entertainment and it was pretty good. There was a cover band playing and plenty of room to sit and relax or go out and dance. Drinks in Fever are a bit overpriced, I would suggest bringing drinks from the casino in with you. Had a fantasitc stay all the hotel employees were friendly and we did not have one problem during out trip. The hotel is not loud and the casino is not overly smoky. I would highly reccommend a stay here in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: fireball067
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be clean, and the room was quite large. If you are travelling with kids this hotel has a lot of activities and a nice pool area.The restaurants were reasonably priced, best deal was the graveyard special, steak and eggs for $2.99. The only problem with this hotel is the distance from the strip. It is about a $16 dollar taxi ride. There is a free shuttle that will take you as far as Mandalay Bay, but it only runs until 11:00pm. Most of our money was spent on transportation.

Reviews.Title: “A Quality Property”
Reviews.Author: traveler2224
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter, and I stayed there August 8 & 9, 2007. I was suprised at the quality. It looks like a brand new hotel. Everything is so clean and new looking. Our room was quite large. There was a large plasma TV. The bath was large with granite counter top. It had a seperate shower area. The linens and beds seemed new and fresh. We ate breakfast at the restaurant buffet and was delighted at the large assortment of fresh foods - some international dishes. When we arrived, they gave me a discount book where I could buy one and get one free. The coupon book also contained a coupon for a steak breakfast for $1.99. I ate the steak breakfast and found it to be pleasing. I was seated in 3 minutes and someone took my order in 5 minutes and returned with my steak and eggs in about 5 minues. I hardly had time to finish the pot of fresh coffee that was put on my table. I had doubts about booking this hotel because someone said it was near a bad area. However, I found no such area. I also noted that one block from the hotel is i5. You can be at any place on the strip in 10 minutes. You never have to go down the boulevard. When we go back to vegas, we will spend our entir time here.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: phantom4536000
Reviews.Content: We arrived late an check in was pleasant. The rooms were very clean. Hotel is very clean. Everybody that I encountered was very pleasant. The casino smeel like cigarette smoke. The ventilation at the casino was not sufficiant. We did not use the shuttle to the strip but car parking was abundant. We had no problems. Our stay was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ndrisker
Reviews.Content: Double Reservations Because We Extended Our Stay This Was Corrected When We Arrived. The Restraunts We Very Nice And The Food Was Excellent. Dress Was Casual/Wear What You Want To Semi Casual Attire. Hotel Rooms Were Reasonalbly Priced. Located On The Far End Of The Strip However It Takes About 10 Minutes To Get To Bellagio And All Of The Other Madness/Casinos. Excellent Location. Beautiful Rooms Large Flat Screen Tv, King Beds, No Refrigerator For Beer Which Cost $3.75 A Bottle. If You Gamble Tips For Drinks. I Would Visit Again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place Off The Strip, But...”
Reviews.Author: DarthBane
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay at this hotel as it was very affordable, and it looked very nice on the website. Going in, the place is massive. It's about 10-15 mins off the strip from Mandalay Bay with nothing really around it except a nearby outlet mall. When I went to check in, there were 3 attendants, and 12 stations. Needless to say, there was a huge line, and a wait over 15 mins. No apology was given, which was disapointing. Going to my room, there were A LOT of kids running around and it was not a clear path to the elevators. Once up in the hallway, the place starts to shine a bit. Very nice decor and quiet. The room itself is very nice and big. 42" LCD on the wall, many lights and a huge VERY comfortable bed. If anyone's read my reviews before, you know that if everything else fails, if the bed is confortable, It's at least a decent stay. Well, bed was fantastic. The hotel has a lot of resturants, but only a few are worth the trip. Don Vitto's is the best of them, and a very nice intimate dinning expiereince. Michael's is a very high-end place, with great food. The Silverado Steakhouse is nice too. Everything else is not good. Service is slow, and food is VERY basic and bland. Pool is nice, but the hours change daily as they have a lot of events, so it's not even worth it. The Spa area however is the nicest part of this hotel. If you can afford the basic message, do it, as the expirence is really 1st class. Very comfortable and relaxing enviornment, and you have to expierence it to understand. I really enjoyed that. As you can see, this hotel is up and down. The good outweighed the bad, so I give it a 3 star rating, but barely. Because this hotel is up and down, makes it irritaiting. They're trying to be something they're not, and that's a strip hotel. They're trying to do WAYYYY too much. There's so much open space in the casino, that you feel that it's not even done. They throw slots in the hallway towards the room elevators. They seem out of place and cheesey. It's like a cross between downtown Vegas and the strip. What they need to do is stand on their own, and focus on the good things. The demographics are all over the place. Literally all walks of life stay there.
