That's fine, but it brings the place down a bit when you have nice dinning places, and kids running around the vast lobby. Too much ying and yang for me. If you want to stay off the strip, give this a try. They offer shuttles to Mandalay Bay, which is nice, but I'd recommend a car. But don't go in thinking you're staying in an off-strip full on resort like a Green Valley Ranch, or Red Rocks. They're try to be like that, but they also try to be like the strip. Then they try to be like an ecconomy hotel. My advice to South Point...Pick one of those styles, and stick to it. My advice to you, the traveler, if you don't expect much, you'll like it. But it's nothing that other hotels in Vegas aren't offering.

Reviews.Title: “Would Return”
Reviews.Author: metrocard
Reviews.Content: Our stay at South Point was a pleasant experience overall, and we would return. The hotel uses custom beds and linens (which are available for purchase), and while comfortable, they were not outstanding for my personal tastes. The room featured bathroom amenities from Bath & Body Works, and the room did offer a wall-mounted plasma television, although none of the channels offered (of the already limited number of selections) seemed to be broadcast in HD. Internet was available in-room for a fee typical of those seen in most business/conference type hotels. Make sure to ask for the fun book at check-in if you are interested in the dining and entertainment options at the property, and a preview of the coupons can be found by searching the internet. As for food, the buffet was standard fare but was neatly laid out and had enough room to move no matter how busy it became. The Italian restaurant, Don Vito's, was a decent value and presented a comfortable atmosphere. The free valet service was hit or miss depending on the times we needed the car, so in the future we would tip the attendant and ask them to leave the vehicle above ground for easy, quick access. Gaming was enjoyable, and with the property being so new, many of the newest slots were available with an adequate abundance of choices at levels from $.01 and up. "The Club" slot point program claims to offer something called "Bonus Credits" on the casino's website, although we played extensively over several days and never heard of this again, nor did we receive any such credits.

Reviews.Title: “South Point - You're The BEST”
Reviews.Author: Fastflys
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I stayed at the South Point between 17th and 31st July 2007. We had read the reviews on Trip Advisor prior to booking and on our arrival we were not disappointed. Check-in was easy and the staff courteous. We received a Fun Book each which contained some very useful coupons. We had a non-smoking room on the 22nd floor which was accessed by any one of six elevators. At night before gaining admission to the elevators we had to produce our room key to a security guard which was reassuring and wasn’t a problem. The hallways are long so if your legs aren’t what they used to be, request a room near to the elevators. Our room was nicely decorated, aired and clean. The beds were comfortable. Extra pillows were requested and supplied. In the room there was a writing table and chair, chest of drawers, round table and chairs, bedside cabinet, two telephones [cheap to use for local calls] and a clock radio. There was also a built in wardrobe containing a safe, iron and ironing board. Mounted on the wall opposite the beds was a remote controlled 42” flat screen TV with enough channels to keep you satisfied. After all who comes to Las Vegas to watch TV? The Air Con was integral, quiet and controlled by a digital thermostat. There were no opening windows but the view overlooking the pool area and mountains was nice. The bathroom comprised of two rooms, one with a bath/shower and toilet, the other with a hand basin, mirror, hair dryer and coffee maker. Towels, face cloths, complimentary toiletries and coffee were changed/replaced daily if required. We sampled room service on three occasions, [all between 1.00/4.00 a.m.] and the quality and quantity was above average. Compared to London hotels, the meals and drinks served were good value for money. Heads up: A service charge has already been applied so don’t feel pressured into adding extra dollars to the blank “tip line” when the bill is presented to you. Within the Hotel/Casino there is a 16 screen movie theatre. $7 before 6 p.m. $9 at other times. We saw four movies. There was cathedral seating with some degree of recline in all of the theatres we visited. There is also a 64 lane 10 pin bowling alley. Heads up: Retain your movie ticket stub and present it to the bowling alley sales staff and they will give you free shoe hire and a free game. It’s cheap anyway particularly after midnight when games and drinks cost $1 each. The swimming pool/Jacuzzi area is a great place to unwind but watch out for the sun, 112 degrees [July]. One hour and your good to go, fried sunny side up or over easy, it’s your choice. Dining: Garden Buffet, Coronado Café, Michaels, Don Vitos, Silverado Steak House and the Big Sur Oyster Bar. Various prices and all looked good but the smart money was on the Garden Buffet, Coronado Café and the Big Sur Oyster Bar. The Garden Buffet is GutBuster heaven. All you can eat Breakfast/Lunch/Dinner for $6.95/$11.95/$12.95. Sooo much to choose from. Bring it on!! Fun Book coupons for 2 for 1 Lunch and Dinner and a coupon for a complimentary bottle of wine of your choice. Monday’s were steak nights – Friday’s were seafood nights. Both were $13.95. The Coronado Café is good for a change. Fun Book coupons for free graveyard specials [steak & eggs, toast and jelly, drinks etc.]. If you like ice-cream, Kate’s Corner ice-cream parlour is the place to be. Large tubs [menu says three scoops – more like 6+] cost $4. Of course, there are Fun Book coupons for 2 for 1 so you can really chow down and get that brain freeze going! If coffee’s your thing, give the Seattle Best Coffee bar a whirl [next to Kate’s ice-cream parlour]. Naturally there’s a 10% off Fun Book coupon to give that cup of Joe an extra kick. As for the rest, well we never got round to them – too busy eating/drinking in other establishments along the Strip. Likewise with most of the entertainment. The South Point is a great base for your vacation and a stepping stone to days and nights of fun along the Strip and beyond. A hire car is essential [in my opinion]. The South Point had plenty of open air and multi story car parking spaces. I preferred the open air parking areas. Allowing for heavy weekend traffic I would say that it is a 10/15 minute straight drive to the south end of the strip [Mandalay Bay]. I didn’t find this a problem, indeed I was glad to drive “home” each night to the relative calm of the South Point. There is a shuttle bus service provided by the hotel but as we had hired a car I can’t comment on it’s usefulness. Plus Points: Newish Hotel/Casino [opened December 2005]. Friendly staff. Nice room, comfortable beds, quiet air con, free safe, free iron/ironing board, cheap local telephone calls. Hallways were quiet at night [no noisy neighbours]. Room service OK and cheap [$48 for three meals including drinks]. Casino was well lit, tables/slots spaced nicely apart, hostess complimentary drinks service was frequent and fast. Pleasant swimming pool/Jacuzzi and surroundings. Pool party every Thursday night. Spa and Fitness centre. Buffet/Restaurants/Bars/Coffee shop/Ice-cream parlour. 16 screen movie theatre/64 lane bowling alley. Games arcade. Equestrian centre [events only – no horse riding] Gift shop. Adequate car parking facilities. Minor Minus Points: Swimming pool water temperature, too cold. Hotel hallways air temperature at night, too cold. No fridge in room – Could hire for $15 per day [too expensive in my opinion]. No guest [coin operated] laundry. Best Las Vegas Tips: Treat gambling as another form of entertainment, set a limit and stick to it. Make use of Valet parking everywhere. Zero hassle for a $2 tip. Drive around the Red Rock Canyon scenic route – 17 miles west of the Strip. Drive to Mount Charleston - 35 miles northwest of the Strip – Pleasant views and 30 degrees cooler [July] than LV. Visit Hoover Dam [aim to arrive before 9.30 a.m.]. A new bridge is under construction causing long traffic queues for late risers. Take the tour. Take a lunchtime paddle steamer cruise on Lake Mead. See Hoover Dam from the waterside. Fly over the Grand Canyon [also Lake Mead and Hoover Dam] either by helicopter or twin engine plane. Take a helicopter flight over the Strip at night. Before booking attractions, check for discount coupons online. Attraction brochures/flyers containing discount coupons are available from almost anywhere along the strip and beyond. Buy designer clothes from the Premium Outlet Malls situated at the north and south ends of the Strip for the best discounts. Tipping: Some restaurants we visited incorporated a 12% service charge into the cost of their food. When presented with the bill, no separate charge for service was shown or mentioned. Always enquire if a service charge has been included before adding extra dollars to the blank “tip line” or leaving cash on the table. Unless you love extreme heat [100 degrees+] avoid June/July/August. Smoking: As a family of non-smokers we were concerned that smoking is permitted in some public areas in Las Vegas. Although we found no unpleasant odour in the South Point hotel hallways or the room that we were allocated, breathing in second hand smoke could be a problem in the South Point’s casino and surrounding areas. We found the odour at times to be mildly unpleasant but never overpowering. Whenever we encountered areas frequented by smokers we simply moved away. It is our opinion that Las Vegas would benefit by introducing a total smoking ban in all public places as the UK and other parts of the US have already done. Verdict: We thoroughly enjoyed our time at the South Point and provided standards remain the same, would most definitely stay there again. A good honest hotel/casino that we would seriously advise you to shortlist.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the Money!”
Reviews.Author: Hotti35
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the South Point in Las Vegas and I was pleasantly surprised by the size and cleanliness of the rooms. It is definitely worth the price we paid for the stay. The only thing negative I would say is that the shuttle service to the airport needs to be improved. The shuttle only comes every three hours and you must book a reservation to ride the shuttle four hours in advance. During our trip, we were not told that reservations must be booked in advance and the shuttle arrived one hour late. We were not taking to shuttle to the airport to catch a flight but it may have caused a problem for those who were trying to get to the airport at a designated time. Outside of the shuttle service, the stay was great and I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “price was right”
Reviews.Author: EatSantaBarbarian
Reviews.Content: The price was certainly right. We made this hotel the last stop on the return leg of a trip from Yellowstone National Park. After a week of camping, followed by driving, we were ready for a break. Our GPS needed an update as it took the long way to lead us to the South Point Hotel. We found the parking structure and made the long trek through the casino to registration. They had beads for my daughter at check-in that made the process more pleasant. They confirmed we wanted the rollaway bed I had requested and we were off across the casino again to find our room. The room was lovely. The bed was roomy and comfortable. The décor was modern and undamaged. We had a nice view of the pool area and the rollaway arrived promptly. The pool area was strangely empty. I sent my husband down to investigate before preparing our little one for the pool. He returned with bad news, the pool was closed because of weather. I looked at the sky and thought, “ what weather?” The sky was mildly cloudy. I called the pool to ask if there was hope that they would open during the day. Nobody answered. I called the front desk and they called the pool and then suggested I contact the pool. I mentioned I had tried that first without an answer. They admitted nobody had answered during their call either. This was an apparent dead end. I settled in for a shower to cool my frustration. While my husband played a ridiculous game of hide and seek in the hotel room, really not that many places to hide, I had a pleasant shower. The bath products smelled nice, lemon verbena and coconut. I found three products in the shower. I tried the shampoo and body wash first. In a fit of caution I checked the last product, lotion! I realized the lotion and the conditioner had been switched and made the soggy walk to the bathroom sink in the next room to exchange products. A couple of hours later the pool opened and we released the little one from the room. She was thrilled to follow the sun patterns down the hall to the elevator and finally the pool. As the pool had been closed they were not prepared to rent their floating mats at first. The managers graciously let us use the mat anyway to my daughter and my delight. The pool area was elaborate and clean. I would have enjoyed a drink if the poolside bar had been open, alas not. The hours for the pool were longer than I had seen at other Las Vegas hotels. I think this pool was open until 10pm. I noticed that the lifeguards were purely decorative. I spent some time watching a guard turn her chair from the main pool area and speak with an off-duty guard for 10+ minutes before the other, he, wandered off. I snapped a few pictured, as I was so amazed. Finally, she returned her lackadaisical eyes toward the pool but I had no confidence in the guarding policies at this pool facility. Prior to booking our room, I had investigated the horse facility options. There were no horse shows only a belly dancing conference. My daughter is a fan of horses so I was disappointed. However, once my daughter saw the belly dancers in costume, she couldn’t rest until she saw them dance. We had a pleasant dinner at the Italian Restaurant and used our coupon provided at check-in. I was surprised at how reasonable this sit-down dinner was. We followed the dinner with an evening watching the belly dancing competition. My daughter had a blast and I was happy that she was so happy. We awoke early enough to use the late-night coupons for breakfast – good until 9am. Our breakfast at another hotel restaurant was good if hurried at bit by our server’s frantic pace. After breakfast, we stopped by the gift shop for our free gift and my daughter received more beads, joy! We checked out via video checkout and we on our way home. This hotel was a great value even with the pool area issues. Finally, I should say that everyone we met was very child friendly to my surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed casino, housekeeping disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mefine
Reviews.Content: Usually we stay at Treasure Island but prices there were higher than my husband's employer was willing to pay. After reading positive reviews TripAdvisor and other online resources we decided to stay at South Point. When we arrived at South Point around 10:30 PM there were a few people in line at the registration desk and we had to wait about 10 minutes to register. That process went smoothly and we were given the king non-smoking with a safe that we requested. When we asked about the safe we were told that now all South Point rooms had safes as they had just finished installing the last of them that day (previously only suites had safes). We were given room 616. Upon arriving on the 6th floor if it hadn't been so late I would have turned around and left the hotel and stayed somewhere else. The hall was a mess with food wrappers, cups, ½ a pizza, and other trash littering the floor. It looked like the aftermath of a frat party. There were teenage boys LITERALLY hanging from the light fixtures in the hall. In the room next to ours they were having a wrestling tournament in the room with kids standing in line outside waiting to get in. When we opened the door to our room there was a maintenance cart as well as tool boxes in the room. The room was obviously not ready to be occupied. My husband called down to the front desk to get a room change. We were told there were no more king non smoking rooms and that they could put us in a queen room. My husband asked about an upgrade and was told that they had no larger rooms available. They told us that our new room would be on the 21st floor so we took our luggage up there and I sat in the chairs available outside of the elevator lobby while my husband went down to get the new keys. When my husband returned he said he had good news and bad news. The bad news was that we had to move the luggage to a new floor. The good news is that they had upgraded us to a one bedroom suite. Our suite was on the 5th floor. It was at the far end of the hall from the elevators. At the very end of the hall was a door that had two room numbers. You swiped your key card and the door opened into a small entrance way with a door on the right and left. This was the entrance to the suite. Having the extra room was very nice. We had a living area with a sofa, chair, two person dining table, and big screen TV and closet. In the closet were a very generously sized safe (large enough for a 15" laptop), iron and ironing board. In a separate alcove off of the living room there was an office with desk, fax/copier and lots of electrical outlets. The bedroom was a separate room with a door and had a triple sheeted king size bed, dresser, chair, and the second TV. The bathroom was very large and had a separate room for the toilet, a large shower, and large soaking tub. There were multiple sets of Body Works shower gel, soap, mouth wash, shampoo, conditioner, and body lotion. In fact they were very generous with this stuff and even when it wasn't used they would put a new set out so I ended up bringing home a whopping 2 pounds worth of amenities! Our room looked out over the pool. One complaint I had about the room, and it was something that would be a continuing theme through out our stay, was that housekeeping wasn't up to par. The night we checked in the sinks were not very clean. They didn't seem to vacuum outside our room very often and room service items were left in the hall for over 24 hours. Inside the room cleaning was spotty at best. They didn't seem to vacuum once in the 7 days we were there. Some days they didn't clean the bathroom counters and they didn't clean out the tub after it had been used. It was a little disappointing. I found the hotel overall to be nice. Almost everyone I dealt with was friendly and welcoming. I ate at the Coronado Cafe several times and while it seemed to take a long time for the food to come the wait staff was professional and friendly. I never ate at the Del Mar deli but the desserts there were huge and looked good. We did get ice cream several nights at Kate's Korner and found it to be very good. I really liked the fact that the pool was open until 10 PM in the evenings and that the doors to get to the pool were right next to the elevators to the hotel so it was easy to go from the room to the pool and avoid the casino. The casino was a very good experience for me. I thought the casino was generously spaced so that it was easy to maneuver around and in between tables and banks of slot machines. Drink service was very good every day I was there and I was offered a chance for a drink about every 15 minutes at a .25 Wheel of Fortune machine. In fact, I have to say that it was the best drink service I have ever seen. The casino was clean, too. Empty glasses and overflowing ashtrays were no where to be seen. Smoking was not an issue. The casino didn't really smell like smoke at all and, at least while I was playing, I was rarely bothered by anyone smoking next to me. The only downside was that the hotel was overrun with teenagers. There was a boy's basketball tournament in town and several teams must have been staying at the hotel. A lot of these kids were very tall and I am sure I saw some future NBA stars. Unfortunately it seemed like there was very little adult supervision and some of the boys seemed to be taking advantage of that. I will say that I never saw any kids in the casino. But, like boys that age seem programmed to do, they were wrestling with each other in the halls and elevators, slapping each other, running, spilling food all over, yelling, holding the elevator up, etc. I heard more than one guest comment on it. The kids were a problem at the pool as well. The pool area was fine. Certainly not as fancy as Mandalay Bay or The Mirage but it had a shallow area for tots, a secluded hot tub, and a rim around most of it so you could sit in the water. There were a lot of kids at the pool. Some were considerate and some weren't. One kid stepped on me and didn't care when we complained. The life guard was too busy flirting with a guest to pay attention to the kids. About 6 kids under 10 years old were running to the hot tub, jumping in, getting out, running to the pool, jumping in and splashing around and then repeating the process. This was not safe and was really getting annoying to both the people trying to use the hot tub and those in the pool area. Finally one gentleman got up from his lounge chair and talked sternly to the kids and they stopped until he left the pool area. I struggled with deciding to rate the hotel average or above average but decided that the good points outweighed the bad and gave it an above average rate. I would probably stay here again but maybe not during the summer when the kids are out of school.

Reviews.Title: “Best gaming; Clean, spacious, contemporary rooms; Good rates!”
Reviews.Author: PleaseTakeMe2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 days at South Point Casino recently for the third year in a row. As in previous years, we enjoyed ourselves immensely. We booked directly through the hotel and got better rates than we researched online with discount accomodations web sites. Rates for gaming is probably the lowest in Las Vegas--$1 min bets for roulette and $5 blackjack. We find the rooms at South Point to be very contemporary, spacious, and clean. We enjoyed the plasma tv. Internet access is available via ethernet cable for a small daily fee w/ a credit card. Housekeeping is efficient, but a little overzealous. Be sure to put out your Do Not Disturb sign if you don't plan to leave the room before 9 am. Our housekeeper was knocking and entering each morning at 9 am until we put the Don't Disburb card in the door card slot. The hotel provides Bath & Body Works products for its guest. Don't miss the Graveyard special at the Coronado Cafe nightly after midnight for less than $2 per person (with the hotel's coupon book, you get a two for one deal)---eggs, hashbrowns, sausage or bacon, toast or pancakes. The best deal for lunch is the Garden Buffet for $7.95 for two people with the hotel's coupon book --select American favorites (steak, roast, turkey, vegies), various seafood selections, Asian, Mexican, Salads, breads, fruits, and all the dessert you can eat and free beverage refills you can drink. We tried the Deli this time around----excellent buffalo wings--20 for $10 mild or spicy. Seattle's Best Coffee is delicious and Kate's Corner is the spot for ice cream. You'll need a car if you plan to dine outside the hotel. The hotel is on the most southern end of the strip. Plenty of fast food and shopping near the hotel, but not within walking distance. The hotel provides a Free shuttle service, but you will need to reserve a space early in the day to ensure a place on the van. We had initially reserved a spot on the shuttle from the airport to the hotel, but by the tme our plane arrived and we retrievied out luggage and reached the shuttle parking (11:15 pm) the last 11 pm shuttle had departed, and believe me, it departs promptly at 11 pm. If you plan to take the public transit from the airport, it's almost impossible to figure out and takes a lot of time and money. The Deuce double-decker bus runs along the northern end of the strip and then circles back to the bus terminal; it does not go any further than the outlet plaza on the southern end of the strip, which is quite a distance from South Point Casino. A taxi for $15-$20 is the best bet. We actually took the shuttle back the the airport on the second day of our stay and rented a car through the entirety of our stay for a great rate through Thrifty. Don't miss out on the outlet mall on the north end of the strip---Premium Outlets (Exit 41B off I-15N)--all designer outlet shops, including Hilfiger, Lacoste, Liz Claiborne, Perry Ellis, Polo, Brooks Brothers, KB Toys, etc---there is a food court in the outdoor plaza. Less busy during the week days; free parking, valet for a fee. Be sure you get your hotel coupon book at check-in to enjoy the discounts for food and drinks; don't worry if you missed out on your free souvenir--for the past three years its been seashell string necklaces or mardi gras bead necklaces---good to take home to younger kids just for fun. The hotel has a movie theater and bowling lanes. The pool is nice and free, but the fitness room is only available by appointment and for an hourly fee. We love the South Point and plan to visit again next year. If you like a quieter casino scene, (less people and smoke) this is the hotel for you. It's off the tourist path with all the same benefits.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience at South Point”
Reviews.Author: wildcatfans88
Reviews.Content: We visit Las Vegas frequently and stayed at South Point for the first time. We were attracted to the hotel in part because of their favorable room rates. Usually when we stay in Las Vegas, we spend little time in the room and roam around town. This trip we didn't leave the property for two days. The room was spacious, clean and featured an impressive flat screen tv and Bath and Body Works soaps. The room even smelled nice - which we don't always find even in higher end properties - and the bed was very comfortable. The restaurants were good, the bingo hall had a courteous and fun staff and our visit to the spa was outstanding. We were impressed that there is a movie theatre and bowling too. All the employees we encountered seemed to really enjoy their jobs, their employer and helping guests have an enjoyable time. But we're most impressed by the fact that when we left behind our new and fairly expensive digital camera with all of our vacation photos and a wallet with many credit cards in the room they were promptly turned into security by our housekeeper Doris. We were already half way home when we discovered our mistake. When we called the hotel, they quickly transferred us to security and we were able to make arrangements to have our items returned. We stayed at Paris and the MGM on recent visits, and while this property is a 5 to 10 minute drive from all the Strip action, we think it's well worth the value and look forward to staying at South Point again. Thanks South Point and thank you for your honesty Doris! You'll never know how much it means to us.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DavidHitchcock33
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay here. We stay here for several reasons. Overall value is the best you'll find in Vegas. Rooms are a good size, pools are nice, the hotel is not too big, the buffet is affordable, and its rates are the best. If you want a minfridge, tell the front desk its for medical purposes. It was complimentary. You'll read the other positive reviews so no need to repeat everything.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Luckylinn
Reviews.Content: Family of 5 stayed at Hotel. Booked because of high reviews on TripAdvisor and very happy we did. Our 4, 6, and 8 year old loved the pool, it was plenty for us. Extremely clean, great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: D-Will7
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at SouthPoint Las Vegas. The hotel is very comfertable and clean. Large rooms and pool and a lot of atractions for the childrens. Great expirience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice place!”
Reviews.Author: missrowe
Reviews.Content: South Point was recommended on a number of websites and was very good value so I thought I would go for it. Despite being a long way from the strip it is busy and popular and runs regular transport to the strip, both free of their own and the trolley stops there. My room was MASSIVE, quiet, clean, very well equiped and just what I wanted. The pool area is nice and the casino friendly and bright (which many aren't). Had a great stay and would def go back!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay South Of The Strip!”
Reviews.Author: travelstar57
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Vegas, we spent 3 nights at South Point. This place is very nice, spacious, clean and comfortable. The elevators were never crowded and ran swiftly. The pool was clean, and towels were available for free. We enjoyed the 42" plasma TV and comfortable beds. The room and bathroom are huge. July is a very busy time in Vegas, but this spot was a break from the maddening crowd. It is 5 miles from the strip, but they have shuttle service. We rented a car, and found that parking was easy. We used the garage once, it was more convenient for us to park in the front of the Hotel. We asked for extra coffee in our room, and the clerk was very kind. Everyone was friendly. We received a coupon book after registering. and enjoyed a bogof at the Garden Buffet. They had a large variety and good eating - drinks included!! Our only complaint was, we had to walk a long distance, and open two doors to get to our room. I did ask for a quiet room, but that was a bit overboard. They also have bowling and a theater. Check out your coupons for extra savings!! We will definitely return to South Point again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: lilrags
Reviews.Content: My first choice was the Mandalay Bay. I even booked a room there for $330-$360 per night, but then agonized over the costs and the anticipated crowds, nickel and dime charges...etc. But alas, I came to my senses with the help of reviews about the South Point. I drove to LV from SCAL and was first impressed that the hotel was just off the freeway exit...before the north bound freeway was about to back up. The valet drive up was well organized and manned. It had an upscale/grand appearance. My car and bags were quickly attended to (Thurs at about 2:00pm) There was one person in the registration line, and three counter persons. I did not wait more than 2 min. My 18th floor (smoking) room overlooked South East LV. At night, it was wonderful with all the lights from the residential homes with the mountains as a back drop. I would recommend everyone request a room on the east side. The west side faces the pool and freeway. I thought the room was gorgeous and so roomy. I had a king bed, sofa w/table plus another table with two chairs. The full length wall mirror and bathroom decor was especially nice. There were 2 sections of elevators one for the lower and one for the higher level floors, and each section had 8 banks. Never a wait for an elevator. The food at the Italian hotel restaurant was very good and the service/attention was even better. Wee bit of a irritation with the housekeeper who wanted to clean the room 10min after I checked in (huh) and then came back about 8am the next day (double huh) Someone should issue them a list of the days guest. I did not like being disturbed so early after my first night in Vegas! When I left for afternoon, I told the housekeeper working right next door that it was ok to clean the room. When I returned about 4 hours later, the room at 3:30 was untouched and this time the housekeeper was directly across the hall. She apologized profusely and immediately started cleaning my room, generously issuing me many extra favorites like shower gel and body lotion. Thin walls….its true. But none the less, I will return and will recommend this desert gem. Although I did not use the SPA I wanted to...Getting to the Strip was quick and easy from the freeway... Hotel has great covered parking and plenty of security. Oh by the way....I did not win any money in their casino, nor did I hear any bells, cheers, or screams from anyone else winning that week. My paranoia allowed me to suspect my losing was a conspiracy to get the money I thought I was saving. money. No regrets, South Point was indeed a good decision.

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Mei5
Reviews.Content: Great hotel off the strip. Good place to stay if you're going to rent a car in Vegas. Free valet parking. Clean, newer than some on the strip. Provided Bath and Body Works toiletries. Nice big wall mounted TV in a big room that even had a loveseat and coffee table. There's a big bowling alley. The pool is also very nice. There seems to be a wide selection of dining options. Just a great stay overall. Would definitely recommend and return.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: lizbru
Reviews.Content: I had been looking forward to coming to Las vegas for a number of years and we picked the right accommodation. We enjoyed being out of the strip. Shuttle buses could be a bit slow but we just learnt to time things. Was disappointed with the shuttle to the airport as we were never informed we needed to book and when we did find out it was to late. I am now working for a travel agency in NZ and I will be recommending this hotel for any clients traveling to vegas. Rooms were great and it was great having a bath in the bathroom. Will be back

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Off Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: americatravelfreak
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay in vegas even though it is about a 10 minute drive north to the lights, sounds and atmosphere of the stip. The hotel is fairly new, clean and extremley affordable. with great views of the surrounding mountains from nearly all floors, we were on the 17th. The quality and array of restaurants were really good from buffets to oyster bars and steakhouse. Casino was quite big with an array of Slots, Card tables and games and especially cheaper than other Vegas casinos. Entertainment and recreation was also excellent with a lovely swimming pool, 15 lane bowling alley (24 Hrs), numerous screen cinema and also stables and riding arena. Overall a really affordable luxury hotel, I will be returning. You may need a car to visit the attractions but there is a shuttle bus that runs from the hotel to the centre of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “good experience , bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: wandyshogun
Reviews.Content: hotel : huge spacious rooms , nice bathroom , quite , clean , comfort bad , big plasma screen (although there is nothing to watch= pretty useless) ,room service\house keeping was good - overall excellent experience casino : small , stink , dirty , too crowded , bad slots\tables ratio, sportbook was ok - go somewhere else if you want to play , theres much better casino on the strip location : very close to the strip , about 10 minutes from the mgm grand in the rush hours conclusion : great hotel , probably the best off-strip casino hotel , mediocre minus casino , great bang for the buck - recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for price and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: junybee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on first leg of trip to Zion, Bryce, Lake Powell, Grand Canyon and Sedona. Hotel is new (2 years) and gives out alot of coupons (Had 2 for 1 lunches and dinners) i.e., Lunch Buffet for for 4 people cost $21! Had coupons for free wine bottles, souvenirs etc. Very nice pool area, with sand V-ball court. Apparently on Thursday nights they have free concerts by the pool. About 15 minutes from strip, (straight down Las Vegas Blvd). Saw KA cirque du soleil show at MGM. AWESOME. best cirque I've seen (seen about 5 of them). Hotel Best bargain in town $60 per night including taxes, KA show - must see $180 per ticket, 8 rows back center. My second time, took the family and my 12 year old son said it was so amazing, he couldn't believe it and wanted to cry. (What???? couldn't believe he said that! it was that good! My husband balked at the price, but I said If I was willing to pay twice to see it, it must be worth it!!!!) I was right. Saved alot on food and hotel, so I splurged for KA!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful gem!”
Reviews.Author: Airedale2
Reviews.Content: I received an email from the hotel offering a free night with the purchase of one night. I booked three nights for a total of $125. We had a fantastic room on the 22nd floor. Great view of the city! The last time I was in Vegas, I stayed at the Wynn. The room size and layout was very similar at the South Point. Not as plush as the Wynn, but it measured up in every other way. The check in was very fast and friendly, and our bags were brought to our room within 5 minutes of checking in. We went to the pool every day at 8 am when it opened, and stayed for about 2 hours. It was really hot while we were there. My only complaint would be that the temperature of the pool was too cold. We ended up sitting in the jacuzzi for about 20 minutes, and then sitting in the kiddie pool. I know that sounds strange, but the kiddie pool had a nice "shelf" that you could lounge in about 8 inches of water and stay cool. There weren't to many kids around at that hour, and the ones that were there didn't mind sharing. The small pool was much warmer and more comfortable than the larger one. The other guests were very friendly, and we struck up conversations with several of them. The nice thing about the pool area was that we felt very comfortable there. The other guests looked like everyday folks, not the tan "hardbodies" you encounter at some of the other resorts. We didn't feel intimidated at all. The casino was big and contained a wide variety of games. We didn't do too well, and lost what we brought to gamble, but at least we had some play. All in all, it was a great experience, and we really enjoyed the location, which is south of the strip. I would definitely stay here again, and recommed it to singles, couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Management and lack of hospitality”
Reviews.Author: jimgbmx
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving, I was told that the two bed room that had been reserved several weeks in advance was no longer available and that we could only be offered a single king bed. When I asked to talk to a manager, it took approximately 20 min. for the manager to respond and when the manager did respond she was very very flat in conversation and not willing to help resolve the situation, walking away several times as if it didn't matter. I was told that the hotel had no roll out beds available and that I would be contacted if a two bed room or a roll out did become available. I was never contacted. My daughter ended up sleeping on the floor, she's 17. Due to being there for an event we were not able to re-book another hotel. I asked the manager if we would be offered a discount due to the hotels mistake. She said she would leave a note for the next manager. Upon check out she was present, when asked about the discounted rate, she denied making they statment and never wrote the note as stated Very rude and dishonest manager.

Reviews.Title: “great - unless you have a low tolerance for smoke”
Reviews.Author: oceanliner1
Reviews.Content: Based on the experience of others reviewing this hotel, I booked a stay here. The good - the rooms are wonderful for a great low price. The beds are comfortable, the 42" plasma tv is great, the bath accessories a nice touch and the view is great if you are above the parking garage wall. The bad - The ventilation is not great if you are a non-smoker. Even on floors with non-smoking rooms, there is a cigarette urn at the elevators and the smoke smell permeates the hallways. It is a nice respite from the crowds on the Strip and the Deuce bus now travels all the way to this part of Las Vegas Blvd from the Strip. So if you can tolerate a little cigarette odor, this is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Stay At The South Point!”
Reviews.Author: Schpoompie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the South Point from 05/05-05/10 of this year and really had a great experience with this hotel. On this trip were myself (35), my husband (35), our daughter (5) and my Mother (53). We all really enjoyed our stay here. I originally went looking online to make our reservations for this hotel. The least expensive rate I found happened to be through a "Good Buy" with Travelocity. But they wanted the entire payment upfront and I just was uncomfortable shelling out that money to a travel site upfront rather than the hotel itself. So I called the hotel reservations line and they were a terrific help! The gal I spoke to honored the rate I had found with Travelocity and we only had to provide the first night as deposit. Great customer service! I called back to this line a few other times to put in specific room requests and what not and always received friendly and efficient service! As you may have seen in other reviews it is best to request a room here above the 6th floor so as not to be facing a wall. We were on the 22nd floor and had a wonderful view of the pool and the mountains. If you are looking for a glimpse of the Strip you may want to request a room on the front side of the hotel. The check-in desk at this hotel is fairly non-descript and not immediately noticeable when you walk into the front door. If you aren't looking for it you may walk right by (we did just that!). As soon as you walk in make a right just past the bell desk and it's right there. Check-in was quick and easy - we did not have to re-state any of our requests and we were quickly on our way upstairs. We of course also received our coupon book at check-in. I recommend putting this straight away into whatever bag you're going to be carrying around so that you don't forget it in your room and then find yourself somewhere in the hotel where you may need to use it (which is just about everywhere). We loved our room - spacious, and with everything we needed. The beds here are the best I've slept in for as long as I can remember - just about perfect! The complimentary toiletries provided in the bathroom were from Bath & Body Works and were a good bit larger than you'd find in most hotel rooms. I think we also received mouthwash here, which was a nice perk. The shower head was quite nice as well, larger than normal and just real cozy. Sinks have granite tops and the bowl is very deep. Housekeeping provided good service all week, with the toiletries consistently replaced. One other thing we were impressed with - the coffee pot! They should all be so great :) This pot makes only one cup at a time - you put in a single pod, place your cup underneath, and out comes a piping hot cup o' joe. Quite convenient. I have seen many reviews on here containing some skepticism on the location of this hotel. I will concede that if you are relying on hotel or some other form of public transportation this location may be a little more inconvenient. However, if you are renting a vehicle (which I HIGHLY recommend when traveling to this great city), the location here is quite lovely and within a VERY reasonable distance to the strip. We never had any trouble whatsoever traveling to and from. Strip traffic can definitely be horrendous, and it always seems worse heading North (the direction you'll be traveling in from the hotel), but the traffic really does not get bad until you approach Tropicana. We really found that we enjoyed being able to escape the hectic traffic and crowds late in the evening when we were ready to settle in. We utilized Seattle's Best for coffee in the morning several times (my Mom give's it two thumbs up). The iced, blended caramel drink was quite yummy also. The buffett at this resort/casino was fair. Certainly much better can be had out here, but there is a 2for1 coupon in the coupon book and so it can be tried out for lunch quite inexpensively. The breakfast specials at the Cafe are a definite must! You cannot go wrong - just get there before 9am. The only bad thing - eating this much everyday cannot be good for us! :) We enjoyed the $1.25 special, which included eggs, meat, potato and toast. My husband also ordered the strip steak special for $2.95 a few times and was pleased with this as well. Tip: These specials are only good for those of us over the age of 21, and are not valid on weekends. In order to enjoy the greatest savings, skip the refreshments in favor of ice water, particularly juice. We found the casino here to be fairly small, and really any more smoky than any other casino. It seemed to be the most busy around very late evening (11:00ish or so). We had the best luck on the penny machines on the wall of the walkway heading back towards the rooms (right by Michaels). Our daughter decided to try out the Kidz-Place one day (coupon available). The staff were really friendly and the play area quite large. Kids can also be left money by their parents to be allowed to purchase snacks. Tips here: bring socks, or you will need to purchase them for play. Also, out of state residents will need to either have an immunization record copy with them or agree to mail or fax it in within 10 days of returning home. Anyway, our little one stayed for an hour - there weren't a whole lot of kids here during her time and she was a little bored. The lady at the front desk was great about recommending the best time to bring your children in when there would be several others for them to play with. We used the pool everyday, and had great service here as well. The pool staff were really friendly and there was never a long wait for beverages (I HIGHLY recommend the bomb pop in the collectible coconut bank!). You can get a coupon for this as well, the pool gal led us to that. The pool size is great, and the hot tub was just awesome. We loved the waterfall. Well, I could just go on and on. We really recommend a stay here. The value for the quality is just wonderful and we had no complaints. We found friendly service, even from the valet attendants, who, by the way, were ALWAYS swamped :) We always enjoyed coming back at the end of the day and actually found it a little hard to leave some mornings.

Reviews.Title: “We love going back to South Point”
Reviews.Author: jodi090801
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Southpoint when we go to Vegas, which is about once a month. They have a great movie theater, a bowling alley, poker room and blackjack for $5. The food at the restraunts are priced ok. Get a "fun book" when you are checking in, as you receive free popcorn, drinks and discounted food. It is farther off the strip, but close to the outlet mall and other shopping too. Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “What I faced”
Reviews.Author: Day2ntraveler
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hetel was a mixed bag. We had the best room with the best food and it was fun trying my hand at blackjack and the slots. The rub for me was while we were at dinner one evening someone with a key to our room came in and helped themselves to my cell phone. I reported only the cell phone being taken but later on we discovered that other items was taken also. We reported this to security with little more than a repprt was filed. They did a study on the locking system for the door but we never heard back from them. I called back to the hotel but was given a voice mailbox with no return phone call. Well, I am moving on with my life, I am getting a new cell phone, and I encourge you to not leave anything of any value in your room. It looks like someone has sticky hands with access to the door keys. Happy trails to you!

Reviews.Title: “Ashtray !!!”
Reviews.Author: daewoo07
Reviews.Content: If you are a chain smoker you will love this place. However, if you do not, be warned. I called prior to booking to ask about the issues with the smoke and were told it would not be a problem. This is the furthest thing from the truth. You have to go through the casino to get to everything. And it is a poor venting system. You could see the smoke in the air. Other places on the strip were no where close to that. I could not catch my breath and was sick from only walking in the door. Even the re route to avoid the casino via the employee access put me in a corridor with 20 employees smoking. I was upset because I called and asked specifically about the issue. The hotel manager did try to help but getting the room cancelled was an ordeal and she charged the full $$ for Sat because we could not find anywhere to go for the night. Expedia was also no help, I was hung up on and never was aloud to speak to a supervisor so beware with that also. I booked to be able to use the pool, movie theater, bowling alley, all was ruined and they didn't care at all your just a number to them.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for the Price”
Reviews.Author: GregPayer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Point on a Tahiti Village package (after reviewing TA's ratings for the places we were offered). I was amazed at the rating that this place gets on TA (4.5 is really unheard of with this many reviews) - but let me tell you it is the real deal. First and foremost, know this, the South Point is called the South Point because of its location. It is basically the southern most location on Las Vegas Blvd - EASILY 5+ miles SOUTH of Mandalay Bay and the airport. That being said - if you have a rental car - this is a great place to stay. The drive takes 7 - 10 mintues to the Strip and Valet is free everywhere so you can easily use your car for transportation. Additionally, Vegas is usually an affordable city to get rental cars in. As for the hotel - the place is amazing. The facility is 18 months old, but looks brand new. It is a large place with a big casino floor, 1300+ rooms, movie theatre, daycare, great pool, equestrian center, events center, and many dining options. My wife kept saying that you really never needed to leave South Point. The hotel is very clean, roomy, and nice. The staff are friendly and nice throughout all aspects of the property. Dining options are not great and the pricing is so-so. Daycare is affordable at $6 an hour (limit 5 hours). Overall, we really liked the South Point. We always rent a car - so the location was great for us (quieter and cleaner than the Strip) because we could still visit the Strip as we liked.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3 Star”
Reviews.Author: sandifeat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Point based on Trip Advisor ratings/reviews. This hotel is probably a solid 3 star hotel but has problems. Our experience with front desk personnel was less than pleasant; one older gentleman (S) was incredibly rude, pompous and arrogant. When we asked about an upgrade, he spoke as if we weren't entitled to such privilege. After encoutering his snobbish attitude, we decided to leave well enough alone and spend our money elsewhere. The hotel was overrun with children at all hours; obviously this hotel is a local hangout for teens. The pool was mediocre at best with no monitoring of patrons using profanity, smoking in the pool, as well as around the pool. The smoke-filled casino was smaller than most in Las Vegas and the hotel had little to offer other than a movie theatre and a bowling alley. The room was mostly quiet although slamming doors and children running up and down the hallways were disturbing. The room was OK but not sure about cleanliness because of constantly irritated allergies. After visiting other casinos on the strip with infinitely more to offer, cleaner casinos, better monitoring/security and definitely friendlier staff, we won't be returning to South Point.

Reviews.Title: “Loved South Point”
Reviews.Author: Paris2007
Reviews.Content: Loved South Point. First time staying at this hotel/casino (Usually stay on the strip). We were celebrating a 7/7 birthday and could not have picked a better place to stay. The hotel is still very new and clean. Hotel has a very "open" feel. You can find exit's easy without being "trapped in" like so many other casino/hotels do. Does not have that "cigarette" smell that so many casino's have. Very clean. Rooms are very large with nice decor and a large 42" flat screen plasma TV. Service is fast and friendly. Restaurants are plenty. Enjoyed the Coronodo Cafe for an open feel. We even went to the Century Theatre on-site to see a movie to "cool" down with the A/C in the early afternoon,lots of options at this great hotel. Takes about 8 minutes to get to Mandalay Bay and of course 45 minutes++ to get down the strip. My only complaint was the $15.00 charge to use the gym. And the beauty salon was very very high for a 35 minute wash/deep condition and blow dry. $140.00 before tip. Didn't even pay half that much at a 5-star hotel in London the prior year.All and all great choice for couples and families. Will be back again :-)

Reviews.Title: “Worth the trip from the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: Rozuki
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I spent 3 nights at South Point this past June....it was hot, hot, hot! 108 degrees every day..... The first night there was a cocktail party around the pool celebrating the hotel's oon to open Fever nightclub.....dancers, music, lights, band. Loads of people...yet it didn't feel crowded as it is a large pool area...lots of lounge chairs and tables! I can't comment on the shuttle as we rented a car ....took about 5 minutes to get to the Mandalay Bay intersection from the hotel. There is a large outlet center fairly close to the hotel on the way to the strip. Las Vegas Blvd is always choked with traffic between Mandalay Bay and the Fashion Mall...so you should get to know the other roads (Paradise, Koval, the I-15) to avoid this area...unless of course you feel like taking a slow drive and looking at the crowds and hotels. South Point has a gorgeous outdoor hot tub/spa...it snakes it's way around a center landscaped island and is raised up a level from the pool area and ringed with lounge chairs... one of the nicest I have seen and I have stayed at many hotels (2, 3, 4 and 5 star!!) The pool is large and was always staffed by 3 lifeguards....there was waitress service (the Friday afternoon we spent at the pool there was only one girl on duty ...but she managed to get us drinks fairly quickly!!) There is also a large shallow kiddie pool.... Our room on the 4th floor....was great....good size (desk with chair and large dresser...2 chairs with a small table by the window.... Two comfy queen beds with great bedding...Great 42 " wall mounted lcd tv. Good setup to the bathroom...Nice size tub...curved shower rod......plenty of towels, Bath and Body Works products, marble in the separate bathroom vanity area. We knew we would probably have a view of the "wall" that other reviewers have mentioned, since we requested a smoking room. However, it wasn't bad...the "wall" is another building in the complex...painted a soft yellow/ochre and situated about 25 feet away....if you stand at the window you could see the palm trees by the pool area and there was natural light coming in the window. Who stays in the room much anyway was our thinking....so no problem for us! I was also amazed at the speed of the elevators. Never waited more than a 20 second wait.... The casino is large and bright....we didn't notice a smoky smell...actually it smelled like coffee ...there was a Seattle Coffee shop opening onto the casino. The valet parking was always quick...and the employees pleasant. There is a beautiful massage spa and hair salon on the premises which we did not have time to use...maybe next time! Never made it to the bowling alley or the movie theater either! There were no equestrian events going on the weekend we were there....so we didn't get to see the "barn"..... We did not have time to eat at the hotel restaurants (peeked inside Michaels which looked like very plush Victorian decor). Would definitely return to South Point....great hotel at a great price...far enough away from the hustle and bustle...but not too far way!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweetgracie
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect. All the reviews I read were absolutely correct! The room was unbelieveably spacious. The bathroom was also roomy - granite countertops and a separate room for the shower and toilet. Housekeeping was great. I loved the Bath & Body soaps and shampoos. Check-in was a breeze. The hotel is six miles from "The Strip" but, with a car, the distance was not a problem. I just can't stress enough how wonderful this hotel was. It has so much- a brand new movie theatre, a bowling alley, lots of eating places, and of course, acres of slots! My only complaint would be that there is an $11.99 daily charge for WIFI. However, I would definitely stay here again when I return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “OH MY GOD!! What a hotel”
Reviews.Author: chilloutkoala
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous, not only does it have a casino, it has an amusement centre, cinemas, bowling alley and an equestrian centre. There is a free shuttle into the Strip, it only takes about 10 minutes or so. The rooms in this hotel are awesome. Extremely roomy. The restaurants dining is great. My boyfriend had a 24 ounce Steak (it was the size of the dinner plate), his response was MMMMMMM. The best steak he has ever had. I had Salmon and it was equallly as yummy.

Reviews.Title: “FUN for everyone”
Reviews.Author: r_villaneda
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at South Point when it first opened and it was called South Coast. I like the fact that this hotel/casino isn't as large as other more popular properties located in Las Vegas. We have stayed at Venetian, Monte Carlo, Luxor, MGM, Tuscany, Imperial Palace, Flamingo, and more. South Point is filled with families, young couples, people close to retirement age, and just about everyone else in between. The spa facitilites were impressive. Our package deal included the use of the spa (2 admissions) and fitness center. Great way to escape without ever leaving the hotel! The room is clean, newer looking, and comfortable. LOVED the Bath and Body Works shampoo, conditioner, lotion, shower gel, and mouth wash. Sure, Las Vegas is more entertaining without kids....but sometimes leaving them behind isn't possible. So, we went to the movie theater twice during our stay. The prices are fair (movies before 6pm) and it's a great way to keep everyone entertained. Bowling center is great, too! Keep your fun book (upon check in) and get deals on dessert (buy 1 sundae, get 1 free), buffet coupon, discount on child care ($5 per hour, instead of $6). We were at South Point on 6/29 and took advantage of the movie ticket stub/buffet special. Our ticket stub got us 50% off buffet price. The buffet is very good! Something for EVERYONE. Fresh salad, soup, Mexican, Asian, seafood, Italian, BBQ, desserts! And, the hotel isn't exactly in the center of the strip action. But, I saw many people taking advantage of the casino's transportation and/or the bus (stops right at the casino). We had our own car and it was easier for me to drive the kids around town than rely on a taxi. The Venetian is a beautiful property, but you don't get the same service and/or welcome feeling there as you do at South Point. And, to me that is worth a lot when planning a vacation. E-mail if you've got any questions.

Reviews.Title: “We really loved the South Point!”
Reviews.Author: Gslade
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 7 nights at the South Point and were seriously impressed- we had booked through Expedia and got a fantastic rate. The room was large with a great king size bed and plasma screen TV. Pros of the Room: 1. Comfortable bed and pillows 2. Great view across to the mountains from the windows 3. Great plasma screen TV 4. Cute coffeemaker 5. Bath and Body works products- good choice- shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, body lotion, soap and mouth wash 6. effective air conditioning- a must when it was 105 degrees in Vegas! 7. Very quiet- we never once heard our neighbours Cons of the Room: 1. Could do with a fridge for drinks etc, 2. No safe- we had to lock our money and passports up in one of our suitcases. However we did see and hear them installing safes in some of the rooms near ours so this must be on the cards for all rooms soon. Pros of the Hotel: 1. Pool open between 8am and 10pm which seemed very reasonable hours 2. Casino- although we didnt use it to gamble in- it was large and spacious and very different to many casinos in Vegas that are dark and dingy looking and cramped- it was easy to get to the room via the casino but without having to trawl around every one armed bandit 3. Bowling and cinema on site was a bonus and they offer a midnight to 8am $1.00 dollar a game for bowling 4. Buffet was OK- nothing spectacular but at $6.75 for breakfast and with a buy one get one free voucher in a coupon book they give you at check in I was impressed- lovely melon, cereals and omelettes to order. 5. Lovely ice-cream parlour and again free sundae with voucher 6. Easy parking- never had a problem getting a space and lifts were efficient 7. Staff seemed friendly all around especially in the buffet Cons of the Hotel: 1. There were at times lots of children but I think this was to do with some of the conventions that they hold there. Having said that they seemed well mannered and never really bothered us! 2. The video arcade was open at strange hours- I know we are adults and not kids but we actually liked the arcade! All in all we were impressed- the area is safe, it is quick enough to drive up to the strip and extra easy for car rental return at Mccarran airport. Note: i would not recommend this hotel if you don't have a car- its too far off and who wants to wait for a shuttle service- rent a car and explore Vegas- there is more to it than just the hotels on the Strip and you are missing out if you don't head out a bit further afield! We went to Mount Charleston and this was simply stunning- a Las Vegas must see!!

Reviews.Title: “What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: Pyxis1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the South Point for approximately $55/night. We also were given a coupon book that gave us a buy one/get one free buffet and also a free breakfast. The rooms are very spacious, with a nice bathroom, and very comfortable beds. Did not go bowling, or use the pool, but it looked very nice. It is a distance from the strip, but as we had a rental car, it was no big deal. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return.”
Reviews.Author: walker04
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4-night stay at the South Point Hotel. Have been booked there on previous occasions, but always got a better deal at the Orleans. I will not be changing my reservations anymore. We never stay on the strip when we go to Vegas, usually 3 to 4 times a year. This will be our new home away from home. We enjoyed everything about the hotel, casino, and restaurants. The rooms are very large; the bathroom was good sized, with the toilet and tub in separate area from sink and mirrors. Thought the room was clean, and even though it was smoking, didn’t feel the smell was that awful. Maids always in by noon, leaving enough towels for us. The soaps and shampoos were all Bath and Body works stuff, very nice. View was of the pool, 18th floor, not too far from elevator. Elevators are very quick, and never full. Our friends had the street view, and the strip if you pressed your nose up against the glass. Did notice a lot of children around. Didn’t really bother us, but did seem to be a lot of them. The pool was great. Never had to worry about getting lounge chairs 4 together right in front of the pool. Pool bar does not open until 11, and then waitresses will take your order. Buffet was good, had coupons, and cheap eats. The café had the midnight special that ran until 9 AM. $1.25 for big breakfast. Also had the Seattle’s Best Coffee 2 mornings, was pretty good. Used the deli one night for late night light supper, good, but sandwich was $10. Seemed a little expensive, but everything in Vegas is expensive. The Casino has great gambling. Played a little video poker, but mostly BJ. We are low rollers, so no huge wins. The staff here was great. Cocktail waitresses come to tables very quickly. Everyone was very friendly. Already booked for end of August. Can’t wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Free stay at South Point was great”
Reviews.Author: iamalexis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Point for free because we agreed to watch the Tahiti Village timeshare presentation. It was great! The hotel was a lot of fun. Our room was big and decorated nicely. I liked the decor in our hallway with the yellow wallpaper and cool ceiling lights. Housekeeping was great. I agree that the bed was too hard though! Others raved about the hotel sheets but I found them nothing special. At the hotel we played bingo, bowled and had a lovely dinner at the steakhouse. We didn't eat at the Triple Diamond AAA restaurant Michael's, but I would recommend that you at least peak in the door to check out the decor. Very nice! We did end up buying a timeshare btw! We got a good price so we figured we would try it out since we want to do the exchanges through Interval International. MSG me and I'll refer you to our rep there who wasn't pushy at all. We also got 6 free trips through Holiday Adventures.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Ski_pillow
Reviews.Content: The South Point Casino is a true gem off the strip. This is the second time I have stayed here. The property is still under two years old and continues to shine. Everything from past reviews rings true. The rooms are large, the plasma television is nice along with the coffee maker. Stayed here June 17th - 20th at a rate of 30 bucks a night. Hard to pass up. The buffets is just okay, nothing exceptional here but basic enough to satisfy someone who is hungry. The price reflects the choices. However the graveyard special at the diner is a great deal after midnight. $1.25 for eggs, bacon, hash browns and toast. They offer other items for the same price. Good eats after playing all night. The casino is large and airy although at times the smoke was too heavy when crowded with people. The slots were a bit tight for my action but there were plenty of table games at 5 bucks to choose from. For those who don't gamble the hotel offers bowling, a movie theater, decent pool and spa. The workout facility was nice too which was included in our rate. The biggest thing you need to know about this place is rent a car. Don't count on the shuttle. From what i was told from others the shuttle does not make frequent stops. However, if you get a good rate at the hotel you can supplement the cost and get a cheap car for your stay. All in all I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay . . .Great price”
Reviews.Author: Monks-in-Miami
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the South Point in June 2007 and was very pleasantly surprised. Family group of 7, including two children and two seniors. Two double queen rooms ($55 each per night) were very good size, and the bathrooms very well appointed and spacious. Housekeeping was very efficient. Kids loved the 42" plasma TV, arcade, bowling alley, and the pool. Quick efficient check-in; tv check-out. Food was pretty decent. Casino smoky as to be expected. Distance from main strip not a problem for us as we had a car; took 10 minutes approx. to get there. Hotel located in more residential type area, so shops, pharmacies, good restaurant options nearby. Very family-friendly in my opinion; there were lots of other families there. Good security monitors access to elevators to rooms at night. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with unbeatable price!”
Reviews.Author: dadolce107
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Point from June 17 to 21, everything is excellent! Our room is nice, big, clean and also quiet! We had a pleasant stay in here and will definately come back. I saw some reviews about the housekeeping performance, what I can say is the housekeeping people really did a good job in our room even we forgot to place the tipping in the first two days. My advice to those who is considering this hotel, do keep checking the price with expedia but book directly to the hotel. We did this and got an unbeatable price without paying un-necessary handling charges. South Point has a policy that if you find a lowest rate than theirs, they will offer same price to you. We saw expedia offering $4X something then we call to the hotel directly, we got the rate, it is amazing. Another advice, South Point is only suitable to those who is driving with their own car. It is really far from the Strip or down town LV, I'll say at least 6-8 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Casinoseniors
Reviews.Content: We are 2 seniors (65) who have just returned from 1 week at South Pointe. Husband at 2 day meeting which took us to that hotel. The hotel was clean and offered alot in the line of entertainment -- movie theaters, swimming pool, bowling alleys, arcade, casino. The food was delicious at the deli and buffet. Didn't try the other restaurants. Coupon book we received at check-in had good discounts. Casino had $5 blackjack tables (which on the strip are difficult to find.) All personel were friendly and helpful. Had great view from 24th floor; room was spacious and very clean. An inconvenience of staying at this hotel is that it is sooooo far from any other hotels and casinos. Transportation (bus, trolley, shuttle bus) is available, but takes awhile to get anywhere and usually you have to transfer. Free hotel shuttle to and from airport -- be sure to make a reservation in advance. Overall it was a very nice hotel, just so far from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Everything great, maybe except the location?”
Reviews.Author: fly2thesun
Reviews.Content: The only downside about this hotel might its off-strip location, if you want to see the strip. But except that, everything's good here. Rooms and food are good and affordable. Its casino is quite fun, with a good probability of winning ( by good, I mean, good enough to keep you in game for a long time with a small amount of money. The machines here don't suck up your money in a few minutes.. ) They even provide a welcome package with a lot of discounts and free gifts, including free wines at the buffet, discounts for buffet, and free game money to get you started.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience; I'll be repeating it soon.”
Reviews.Author: StevePR104
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Las Vegas for a convention, and tried to land an inexpensive hotel room that was at a certain comfort level. Priceline matched me with the South Point. It was one of the most pleasant experiences I've had at a Las Vegas hotel. The room was modern, spacious, clean, quiet and definitely upscale. The food at the buffet was adequate...but then again, so was the price and for what I paid, I won't be complaining. As others have noted, the hotel is located south of the Strip...about five minutes south of the Mandalay Bay. I did not take the shuttle, but drove my own car. It's simply not a problem. The traffic of the Strip and Vegas in general disappears by the time you make it this far south. There is a distinct country and western atmosphere here on the casino floor; if you're not into C&W, get over it. Your room will help you get away from it. I'm going back to Vegas for another convention later this year, and have voted with my wallet: I've made a point to stay at the South Point.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghTravelbug
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from Vegas today. We stayed at the South Point for two nights. I did not want to stay on the strip, but within a five minute drive of all the action. Our room was very impressive - large, granite countertops, plasma tv, and a very comfortable bed. At check in they give you a coupon book which we made good use of. They have a huge bowling alley and movie complex on the second floor. My children (both teenagers) enjoyed the place also. The is also a great choice of restaurants on site. I have nothing but great things to say about this hotel. Everyone was very friendly. I asked the security guard for directions, and he was extremely helpful (not in his job description to give directions, I'm sure). Anyway, for the price ($55.00) it is an unbeatable deal!

Reviews.Title: “One night success”
Reviews.Author: StephenWard
Reviews.Content: Very efficient with excellent value special deal directly from hotel website. Close (but not too close) to airport and city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: not-so-high-roller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the South Point. We chose it for the many amenities, including a shuttle to and from the strip and the airport, as well as the great rate we received on our room. The room was great, the bed was comfortable and the 42" plasma t.v. was a nice touch as well. If you are thinking of staying at the South Point and are attracted to it because of the shuttle, you would be better served staying elsewhere. Our third night in Las Vegas we had to wait for two shuttles before we could finally get on one(limited seating capacity), and our last night in Vegas we waited for 45 minutes on the last shuttle(other guests had been waiting for over an hour. Worried that there would not be a last shuttle, several of us called the hotel and spoke with the Assistant Front Office Supervisor who informed us that there was nothing that she or the hotel could or would do for us in the event that the shuttle didn't arrive, and that we were more than welcome to call a cab!

Reviews.Title: “Travelers Beware !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ilovevegas_7
Reviews.Content: We thought we were getting a good deal since the price was great and the hotel seemed nice, boy were we wrong! The property is alright, nothing to write home about, and very, very far from the actual strip. However, the staff is very rude from the security guards to management! Their housekeeping is filthy. We noticed a dead bug in the hallway and it stayed their until we left 4 nights later. You can expect to return to your room at the end of a long day to notice your room has not even been dusted. This is with us leaving a tip after the very first night! Our child was with us on this trip and when I stopped to get money from the ATM a security guard came up to us and told me, the obvious, that minors are not allowed on the casino floor. I told him we were staying at the hotel and just getting money he very rudely interrupted me and told me that children are not allowed anywhere on the casino floor. This while other families were walking on the casino floor! I didn't feel like arguing with the man and told him not to worry that we were on our way out, to which he responded "Don't tell me not to worry about my job." ??? A true ignoramus. So unless your children can float (lol). I hope this helps other innocent travelers. There are much nicer places to stay in Vegas and where you'll be able to truly enjoy your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Southerly Oasis”
Reviews.Author: EwoodParker
Reviews.Content: Although we had stayed in Las Vegas on an earlier trip this was our first experience of a "casino" hotel. Booked the South Point after reading Trip Advisor reviews and because of a great midweek Expedia rate of $53(£28). This was a one night layover after a flight from the UK and prior to setting out next day on a round trip to Wyoming. We were aware that the hotel was a long way south of the main Las Vegas Strip area. This may be a consideration for those having a longer visit and wanting to sample life north of the Mandalay Bay. However for us the hotel was a welcome oasis after a long flight and served our purposes admirably. Check in/check out were effortless and both completed rapidly. Our 20th floor Interstate 15 side room was superb. Fittings were of a high standard; in particular the bathroom with its separate shower/toilet area had been given exceptional finishes. In our experience noise from the Interstate was fairly minimal and corridor noise virtually non-existent. The hotel offers a wide range of dining/snack facilities although we can only comment specifically on the Grand Buffet. To anyone used to UK or European prices the latter offered exceptional value and a wide range of choices. A fairly discerning palate would be required to find fault. The various activities on site bowling alley, cinema, pool etc aside from the casino offerings should be suitable for most family visits. Staff we encountered were always polite and helpful. Overall I would recommend the South Point to any Las Vegas visitor.

Reviews.Title: “SOUTH POINT IS FANTASTIC !”
Reviews.Author: theOLDFRED
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the SOUTH POINT May 27 through june 2 . Wanted to book on-line but found better deals on travel sites than on south points site. I called them directly and they matched the better price. HOWABOUT $30.00 a night and I did not have to pay the web charge. (Of course the Sunday night was more $90.00 but all casinos charge more for weekends.) . We always rent a car in Vegas so the South Point was really good for us but it is 6 miles south of the Excalibur on the strip. If you don't have a car they run shuttles continously. . Parking::Easy Self parking either out front or in covered garage. Valet quite fast. Since the casino is so far off the "strip" proper it is not crowded at all. . The room:::Excellent, very new and clean, I particularly liked the way they did the bed covers. a comforterter sandwitched between two sheets which gets cleaned every day. I hate the old type covers which we always throw in the corner since they only get cleaned occasionally. Large room with PLASMA TV mounted on the wall, thin as a mirror. HOW COOL. . The Bathroom:::large with a separate room for the shower and toilet. Nice large sinks and they provide: Shampoo,Mouthwash,Body oil,Hair conditioner,bar soap and body wash. The coffee maker was NEAT makes one cup at a time actually brewed, not instant. Provided two cups of Regular Coffee, Two cups of Decaf, and Two cups Of Earl Grey Tea.(all at no charge) . Pool:: Very nice and clean, also have live band on Thursday night in band stand at the pool. BIG young crowd on That nite (Us oldsters did not partake of this particular venue) . Casino::Large and airy, not crowded as other Vegas casinos. Not very noisy and smokey. Table games are excellent and the dealers quite friendly. Tremendous amount of machines and since the casino is quite new they are also. All have TITO (ticket in ticket out) so you dont have to handle all that dirty money. If we did not have a convention at the Vegas Hilton we would have simply stayed in the South Point all visit. We really enjoyed the place. . The drive:: staying on the Strip and going to the Hilton on the other end of it took about 40 minutes with the traffic. The entrance to I-15 just opened behind the casino and using the interstate to Sahara Blvd. only took 15 minutes to the Hilton. .
