Airport rental return:: Vegas has moved ALL the rental car companies to one central place. NO rental booths are still in the terminal. You have to ride the rental car bus to this facility )10 min ride) All companies are there in one place. thats where you have to pick up your car and return it. Really quite good once you get used to it. The facility is SOUTH of the Airport and therefore Closer to the South Point than ANY OTHER CASINO ! . Food:: WE ate at the Buffet twice, Really good, Inexpensive $12.95 great food and I particularly liked the Chinese selection. (YES, I gained 5 pounds, gotta lose it before I go again !) They have a Chicago hot dog stand in the sports book with 75 cent hotdogs during the day, great lunch with SaurKraut and doesn't take much time away from the tables. . Extras:: Big horse arena which holds equestrian meets. Huge bowling alleys up stairs, REally large BINGO hall. and a Kids corral where you can leave your kids all day so long as they are Potty trained. I wouldnt want THAT job for any ammount. . Bottom Line::: We have visited VEGAS every year for the last 25 years. We usually try to stay in a different place each year. We like the South Point so well that we WILL be back there next year !! . Our choices( remember, we are 67 years old !) Number 1 is SOUTH POINT, We liked the ORLEANS untill my wife AND daughter got food poisioning in thier buffet and they simply DID NOT CARE or offer any assistance at all. WE do not like the HILTON, Too "upper crust" they think. raise all the table games to $15.00 or $25.00 minimum each night. Rooms just average. . hope this helped some...No spell checker on here.. OLDFRED .

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality with a bit of luxury on the side”
Reviews.Author: sulenka
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard double for 3 nights. The room was spacious, the sheets were exquisite, the bathroom was huge and immaculate. The new 42-inch flat screen TV was a nice luxury. We waited until the last day to try the $6.99 breakfast buffet and wished we had tried it earlier--great variety--everything from Spanish omelettes to British "bangers and mash". The house coffee was rich, and the buffet servers attentive to our table. The wide path through the casino allows folks with children to avoid it easily (in some of the hotels you must take a meandering path through every bank of slot machines to get from the hotel entrance to the guest rooms, but not here). The Cinemark theater inside the hotel was big and showy, with the trademark "best seats in the house". Self-parking was free, plentiful and easy to get in and out. And the rate couldn't be beat--our 3 nights averaged only $59 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great place at a great price”
Reviews.Author: DRBench
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a package from a major travel website. I was a little worried because it is off the strip and I never had heard of it. The hotel is about 3.2 miles from Mandalay Bay. The hotel is clean and new. The rooms are fairly large and we loved the 42 inch plasma screen for unwinding after our long days. The rooms are solid as I rarely heard a peep from any of my neighbors on the hall. Bathroom is set up nicely and has a nice tile shower. My wife complained about not having an exhaust fan though there is downdraft vent. The restaurants were fairly good. We had the dinner buffet the night we arrived and I can say it was one of the best "buffets" I've had in a while. The breakfast buffet was okay...nothing to write home about. The service of the front desk staff was so-so at best. At check in I asked for a bell-hop (carrying 4 suitcases) and the lady at the front desk told me to go around the corner instead of calling a bellhop for me. The casino was smokey in some areas but I think you're going to have that in any casino. The gambling was good with low minimums and EXTREMELY attractive (HOT) cocktail waitresses (better than any I've seen on the strip). I will definitely plan on staying at the South Point again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Elegance- Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: BargainGirl82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Point for one night on our way through Nevada and I did not want to leave. We had the best time. The hotel was super clean and beautiful. Our room was a lot bigger than I expected (which was great for our 18 month old to run around in). The bed was awesome and the toiletries were from Bath & Body Works (one of my favorite stores). They give you a great coupon booklet at check-in and we used the 2 for 1 breakfast buffet. We paid about $8 for the both of us to eat breakfast. It was great. We didnt get to use it, but they have a bowling alley and movie theater there which is great if you have kids. And the pool area was beautiful and our daughter LOVED the kiddie pool. I got a great deal on Hotels.com but I would have paid the rack rate for this hotel. If you dont mind being away from the strip, you definately should give this hotel a try. We like the strip, but we like value better and we dont mind driving the few miles to get to the strip. We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Like eveyone else said, "it's a hidden gem".”
Reviews.Author: outacali
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we attended a time share presentation at the Tahiti Village and we couldn't have been happier with our choice. The most important thing for me when staying at a hotel is to have quiet and this hotel didn't let me down. If there is ever a nuclear fallout I want the South Point to be my bunker because this place is built solid. The rooms were very quiet and amazingly enough didn't smell like smoke (big pet peeve). Also when we were in Vegas there was two days where the wind was howling so bad that the north strip was obscured by sand but in our hotel you wouldn't have known it unless you looked outside. It's that well built. We were on the 24th floor looking out over the pool. I did have three minor issues with the South Point. 1) Parking is so-so. You either park in the lot in front of the hotel where you leave your car in the hot sun or you park it in the garage where you are lucky to find a spot on the lower levels. Why do you want a lower level spot? Because from some reason there is no direct access to the hotel from the garage. You have walk down stairs or take an elevator down to the bottom floor just so you can enter through a side entrance so you can then go up to your room. It becomes a bit tedious after a while. 2. To get to your rooms you have to walk all the way through the casino regardless of where you park. And it's a long walk. I don't mind exercise but when you are lugging 4 bags and are too cheap to pay for a bellhop then the half mile walk becomes looonnngg. Even when not carrying bags it's a long walk. The biggest issue for me was having to walk through all the cigarette smoke. Even for someone like me who has minor asthma the smoke was enough to make my lungs tighten up on me. I got used to it by the end of day 2 though. 3. If you like firm noisy beds then this is your place. The beds are indeed firm, so firm that my wife and I woke up sore in the morning with neck aches...and we even brought our pillows from home. If you are traveling with a child and have to get a room with two beds be prepared to sleep like sardines. And if you have a wife like I do who can snore like a sailor when the mood strikes her you better have ear plugs. To top it off the sheets are partly made of sand paper. You think I'm joking. I'm not. It was like sleeping in burlap. After the first night I just slept on top of everything (thank goodness I'm a warm sleeper). Everytime I or my wife rolled over the sheets made a swoosh, swoosh sound, like someone too big wearing a too small pair of corduroy's. The rustling of bed sheets was so loud in our quiet room that I feared waking our daughter up in the next bed. All in all it was a pleasant experience. We ended up buying a humidifier from the local pharmacy because it was so dry in our bedrooms. It made a huge difference. So if you get a room on the 24th floor that has a humidifer in the closet you'll know where it came from. I suggest you rent a car when visiting as everything is much more spread out then you'd think. $25 a day from Budget was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value at the South Point”
Reviews.Author: Aimster77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Southpoint 5/31-6/3. The price was nice at around 60/night and the rooms were clean, well decorated, and fairly new w/ a big flat screen tv on the wall. The beds were comfy and the bathroom layout was great. The Sink area is separate from the shower/toilet area with doors in both areas, so you can get ready without disturbing the people in the room. This was awesome because I had to get up earlier than my roomate. The valet was always quick and you can just as easily park yourself in the parking structure or the lot out front as there is plenty or parking. The downsides to this property are that it's 5 miles down the strip from the Mandalay. Do not take LV Blvd in and out of there. Take I-15. The shuttle is a bit of a joke as there is no schedule to speak of. The driver was really nice and gave out his cell number for everyone to have so you could see where he was on the route for your pick-up. Also, we had trouble calling the front desk. We tried at least 5 seperate occasions, and always sat on hold for so long that we gave up. The coffee joint is not a Starbucks, and had slow service. All told, this is a very nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Room at Bargain Rate”
Reviews.Author: gjbCA
Reviews.Content: We walked in midweek and got a 14th floor room for $60. Really a deal considering how nice it was. But if you're looking for the real Vegas experience, you probably want to stay on the strip. The pool and casino areas aren't as elaborate as what you'll find on the strip, and there's more of a family atmosphere prevailing. But if a nice room at a low rate is your priority, I don't think you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “All Things are Better South”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth.schrader
Reviews.Content: We picked the South Coast (now South Point) hotel after staying at one of the other Coast hotels. I research my travel to a fare-the-well so I knew the hotel would have a few glitches since it had just opened when we visited. I will not say that customer service is at the top of the list at this particular hotel but I suspect people were new there and they will work on it. We checked in with two teenagers in one room and my husband and I in another. (The rooms at this hotel rank as gi-normous compared to most hotels.) Yes, you do have to have a car. Using the hotel shuttle to get to the Strip, if that is your thing, is not convenient. Bite the bullet and rent something. So give in to the fact that you are staying a bit out of town and enjoy the view of the mountains, etc. The rooms have 42' flat screen tv's and if you were wise enough to bring your portable DVD player, bingo you can hook right up. The beds were reasonable but someone with back problems might find them too soft. The pool at this place is beautiful but crowded. Lots of clean towels, a fair amount of drinks available. The bartenders inside are a bit more attentive and of course there is the ever present go-cup available for your margarita. There was a live band with a pool party while we were there. My husband is a former rock legend (well ok, of the garage band set) and he really enjoyed sitting outside watching the band. Free food and of course tickets to get in were free for the band. Speaking of food, our other Coast hotel experience gave us free breakfast every morning. A great value when feeding two children who act like they've never eaten before in their natural lives. So to the buffet it is. The buffet food is just that, some of it is OK, some of it is below par. (I wouldn't have TOUCHED those tacos, personally) but there's alot of fruit available and lots of no sugar stuff for people who can't indulge. We have visited Vegas enough with our kids that we feel a bit like locals. (We go to some of the out of the way holes in the wall to eat, where they treat us like friends. Most of the wait/serve staff in these areas are very pleasant folks which is great.) Back to the South Point (Coast)...we tried to get into the Mexican Restaurant only to endure hour long waits. B ut we were tired of the cafe food and finally got in. The food was good, the service painful to endure. The margaritas...typical watery style. Ick. The theatre in this hotel is very nice and we love to catch any afternoon movie when it's too hot to be wandering around Vegas. The bowling alley is also a great idea if you are there with kids. This is a good hotel and has the potential to be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: suhf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Vegas for the first time and I am so glad I changed my reservation from a hotel on the strip to the South Point Hotel. We received excellent service from beginning to end. The beds are comfortable, the hotel is very clean, and there are many choices of places to eat. The hotel staff is GREAT!! This hotel has so much to offer that you really don't have to leave it except to visit the strip. Although the hotel is located about eight miles off the strip, there is a shuttle service to take you back and forth. If you want to visit Vegas with the kids, this is the perfect hotel. It has a movie theater, very nice pool and kiddie pool, very large bowling alley, arcade and children's play area. We are planning to bring the kids back next year. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel especially for families and people who are visiting Vegas who are not there for the casinos and other Vegas entertainment. PS: I would like to thank the shuttle drivers and hotel staff for being so courteous and informative. We appreciate all you did to make our first visit so special.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great service”
Reviews.Author: SoCalCalendarGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the South Point as part of a group, so I was expecting to get the very bottom of the barrel in rooms. I was pleasantly surprised to get a spacious, well appointed room overlooking the pool. The beds and pillows were very comfy and the bathroom was also large with nice toiletries. I had planned to visit other casinos on my trip, but never did because I liked the casino here so much. You could get a seat at a $5 blackjack table on Saturday night! Next to impossible on the Strip. Check in was a breeze, and everyone I encountered on the staff was pleasant and helpful. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to TripAdvisor for this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SarahDaisy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reviewing all the Vegas Hotels on TripAdvisor, and I have to say a huge thank you to TripAdvisor and all the other reviewers for it! The room was fantastic - large, comfortable, clean and exactly what was needed. Casino was big enough with enough choice to satisfy most. Restaurants all good - even the Garden Buffet, the bread in the Italian was to die for! You need to book that one. We didn't get to try the steakhouse, but fully intend to on our next visit. Other good things - the quiet and relaxed atmosphere compared to other Vegas hotels. It was a relief to get "home" to SouthPoint after the madness of the strip. Staff - all really friendly and helpful without being in the least intrusive. Quiet (did I say that already?). Gift shop - excellent and open 24 hours with huge choice of wines and beers. Downsides: would have been nicer to have the pool open later. The distance from the strip meant a 20 Dollar taxi ride each way if you missed the shuttle times. The distance has been mentioned a lot already, but to be honest, the price of the room meant that adding a max of $40 a day for transport in and out of the strip was still miles cheaper than a room on the strip. We really really enjoyed our stay at SouthPoint and hope that it's as good next time, as I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: purr34ever
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a total of 3 nights. ( May 27 & 28) 2 at the begining and one ( May 31) at the end of our vacation. Our room was located on the 22 floor overlooking the pool. Bed was very comfortable, bathroom was great. Loved the Bath and Body works products. Best part of the bathroom was the vanity area was seperate from the shower/tub area. 2 rooms actually. You went through the vanity room to get into the shower/toilet. Room is very spacious and lots of room if you are travelling with kids. Large TV was nice even though we barely spent time in our room. Garden Buffet was not to my liking. Hubby said it was OK. Would I eat there again? Likely not. Food was BORING and everything tasted the same. MEXICAN. YUCK!! Yes I know the majority are mexcians. I just like my soup to be soup and not a salsa type soup. That is just an example. :-) If you are trying to save a few bucks, upon check in you will be given a coupon book with tons of useable coupons. We have an extra one if anyone wants it. Email me and I will send it out to you. We didn't make it to the pool area but I can tell you that most times it was very quiet. During peak times it still wasn't overly crowded. Plenty of chairs, towels and drinks to go around. :-) If you want to be close to the strip, this hotel is NOT for you. If you want a 5 star resort at a great price, stay here. Suggestion: This hotel is FAR from the strip. We ( I ) wanted to be away from the hustle and bustle of the busy vegas strip so hence the reason for choosing this Hotel. Our rental car came in handy.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem for those who don't want the bustle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Saskheat
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this fabulous property. In and of itself it is a true 4 Star even though its marketed as a 3 Star. The only thing holding it back from being a major destination is that its about 5 miles south of the strip so you either need to rent a car, or take the complamentary shuttle that goes to the south end of the strip (Mandalay Bay Hotel). The shuttle stops fairly early too 12 am seems to ring a bell. Don't let the cheap price fool you. This place is breath taking. The rooms are HUGE, with premium linnens. We had a cheap rate room off the inter net ($48 week day/ $99 week end) and our room even had a canopy over the bed. It had a huge picture window with a view of a wall, but the room otherwise was clsoe to twice the size of a customary room. The casino is great. Cheap early bird deals in the coffee shop $2.99 NY steak and eggs over the night until 10 am. There was a specialty coffee shop, a fine dining place, oyster bar and a buffet. There is an IHOP a mile and half up the road if youre into a traditional breakfast. This place had an awesome pool spa area. Which leads me to my only complaint. It had oddball hours. They posted a sign by the elevators daily indicating closing time. It really should be open till 10pm daily. Some nights it closed at 5pm others 7 pm. On thursday nights they sold tickets for a beach party at 10pm by the pool and brought in a band. The rest of the resort is very impressive. Mens and lady's salons of impressive appearance. Large health club. All the reular spa accoutriments, facials, full massage ect. Expect to pay top $$ for these. They even had a day time shoe shine stand in the casino. The gift shop had the cheapest liquor that I found anywhere in Vegas. Cheaper than even the supermarket thats about a mile down the road. There is a large movie theatre above the casio running all the newest movies. It was reasonable too. There was a full 16 lane bowling alley above the casino that had dirt cheap prices $2.90 a frame and cheap snacks for kids. There was also a day time baby sitting/ daycare for kids. $6/hr. Bingo hall as well. Heres the kicker...this place has a full indoor riding equestrian area attatched to the back of the building. WOW. I can't wait to return to Vegas. This is where I'll be staying. The cheap price and lavish appointments more than offset its remote location.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the Best Value in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lance074
Reviews.Content: In my previous visits to Las Vegas, I've only stayed at on-the-Strip hotels. But a promotion by Travelocity for the South Point caught my eye: $35 a night for the post-Memorial Day week. It had to be pre-paid with a one night penalty for cancelling, but I couldn't resist. For people driving to Las Vegas from the south, the hotel couldn't be easier to get to. It's several miles south of the airport (and hence, several miles south of the Strip) at the intersection of Las Vegas Blvd. and Silverado Ranch Blvd. Take the exit ramp, pull into the garage, and you're there. The area is under development and the I-15 / Silverado Ranch Blvd. interchange is still under construction (north bound on/off ramps only are in operation). My comments: Rooms: Clean, very large, with spacious bathrooms. My room on the 9th floor faced west overlooking the pool. I had previously read what others have said about "the wall" and asked when checking in for a room that didn't face "the wall". The person checking me in chuckled and said "you definitely don't want to face the wall!" Comfortable beds and, as nearly everyone mentions, 42" plasma televisions. Casino: In stark contrast to the low ceilings and dimly lit casinos of the Strip hotels, this casino is bright and (dare I say it) cheerful. The ceiling is high giving the room an open feel. While I often feel somewhat claustrophobic in some casinos, this one feels inviting. Some reviewers have called the casino"bland", but I found it refreshing. There is a lot of room to move about with the slot machines surrounding the gaming tables in the center. Gaming (slots): Their club program will pay you cash for the points you earn. I think I read somewhere (but I could be wrong) that you get 1 point for every dollar you put in. I ended up with almost 6000 points (I got $17 back). Since I only had about $500 to gamble with, that $500 stretched into $6000 "reinvested" into the slots. Most of the slots are either penny or variable denomination (penny, nickel, quarter, dollar). The penny slots are something of a misnomer since the machines typically come with 20-30 "lines" on which you can bet 1 to 10 "coins". So if you're on a penny slot with 30 lines active and 10 coins being played, you're really betting $3 per spin. I visited four Strip casinos during my visit, dropping $20 in similar machines at each location. I found $20 at the South Point lasted about twice as long when compared to the Strip hotels. Buffet: I ate at the dinner buffet twice and the breakfast buffet once. The dinner buffet is OK, but nothing to write home about. Other hotels have much better buffets albeit at much higher prices. The breakfast buffet is the best deal in Las Vegas. At $7 it has an astounding variety of breakfast foods, all attractively presented. And from what I tasted, all very good. Pool: It seems like a large pool area, but it's illogically laid out and thus feels much smaller. It's on the west side of the building so it gets noon and afternoon sun. Other activities: I didn't check out the bowling alley or theaters. Though they have 15 or so screens at the theaters, only 5-6 films were being shown (Spiderman 3 was on 4 screens, Shrek 3 was on 4 screens, and Pirates of the Caribbean 3 was on 4 screens, with other films on the remaining.) Entertainment. The Fever nightclub was still being remodeled so wasn't open. On Thursday, Fever had an outdoor party in the pool area. I didn't attend, but could see it from my room. And I could certainly hear it. It was so loud the windows literally rattled. Fortunately, it was over by 10 PM. Parking: It's a long, very long, walk from the parking garage to the hotel. Of course you have to walk through the casino to go from the parking garage to your room and vice versa. Service: I thought most of the staff were professional and courteous, but I found the ladies hawking beverages in the casino annoying, just shy of being downright rude. Gift Shop: One of the very few hotels of any kind that has food and beverage prices in their gift shop that are actually reasonable. I paid a breathtaking $2.95 for a small bottle of water at Paris Las Vegas compared to a large bottle (I think twice the size) for $1.99 at South Point. Wine, beer, and liquor were very reasonable (about the same as you'd pay in a grocery store). Transportation: The South Point is several miles from the Strip and a car is necessary if you're going to go there. There is a hotel-supplied shuttle service, but I didn't see many people taking advantage of it. Since the I-15 northbound ramp is in operation, it's a simple matter to leave the hotel and then get off on Tropicana or any other exit along the Strip and park in one of the hotel garages there. Getting back is a bit more problematic since the southbound exit ramps are still under construction, but I never found it to be difficult in the least. Bottom line: I found the South Point to be an excellent value for Las Vegas and it far exceeded my expectations. If being on the Strip is important to you, the South Point is not your hotel. But for the cost of a single night at a Strip hotel, you could probably stay at the South Point, rent a car, pay for your meals, and still have a few dollars left over. And you'd still have a good time!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with the South Point Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: OhioDiane
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Las Vegas on a Saturday evening and needed a hotel to stay one night before leaving for Zion Park in Utah. Originally I had booked a non gaming hotel close to the airport since we would only be there for one night, but after hearing so much about the South Point I decided to change our reservation. Well we were all really glad we stayed at the South Point. The hotel was very nice and the casinos were an added bonus to our 21 year old daughter. Our check in was quick and the clerks were very nice. Our room was clean and spacious. We had dinner at their Italian Restaurant, Don Vito's and the food and service were top notch. The location of the hotel was about a 10 minute drive from the rental car pick up location and about a 5 minute drive to access I-15 for our drive to Zion. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. The prices were very reasonable for food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive ans Spacious!!!”
Reviews.Author: asiadoll
Reviews.Content: I have nothing bad to say about this new hotel. We stayed at South Point during a weekday, and we were very impressed w/ the hotel. Checked in earlier than 3 p.m. and got a room that was available. (We asked for a smoking/King bed but was given a non-smoking/2 queen bed room but that's okay) The room (12 floor) was very spacious (even the bathroom) w/ a flat screen t.v., and did I mention everything is NEW- (exactly like the pictures at their web-site). The soaps and shampoo/conditioner was the coconut lime verbena from Bath and Body works!!! The store in the hotel offers a vast selection of affordable liquor products that "will match" other advertised prices outside. Although we did not try the buffet, the prices are very reasonable ($7 for breakfast). The gaming area is pretty big and for those who have kids (or the kids at heart), you can go bowling, watch a movie, or go to the pool. This is truely a one stop Las Vegas resort that is family friendly and doesn't break the bank. I understand that their is a complimentary shuttle to and from the Vegas strip-it is a bit far away from the action and bright lights but sometimes it's nice to take a break from the hustle and bustle of the Vegas lifestyle!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: bradleykim
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the South Point Casino - nice rooms and nice staff. They allowed us to check into the hotel at 12 noon (4 hours early) and gave us a late checkout of 2 pm - very nice. The South Point was easy to navigate inside: not the maze that other casinos can be. It was also well ventilated and well lit. We did not use the Bowling Alley or the Theater, but they looked nice. We plan on using their child care center the next time we visit - it looked like a lot of fun - lots of climbing equipment (like a McDonalds Playland) and a lot of room for running around. Children must be over 3 years old and have proof of vaccination. The cost was $4 hour and they were having a special of $1 off an hour for hotel guests. This is much cheaper than the $18 an hour we paid for an in-room babysitter (needed because our daughter is not 3 yet). The pool was not crowded, but the kiddie pool needed to be cleaned. Avoid the Carnation Cafe. The buffet was OK. Be careful as you drive to the hotel from the Strip. Right before the light on Las Vegas Boulevard we had a brick thrown into our windshield from the Desert Sky Apartment Complex (on the right). The police said ours was the 4th incident at that location that month! It made for a very bad ending to a nice stay. When the freeway onramp is complete I may be tempted by good prices and nice rooms to stay here again. I will not drive along Las Vegas Boulevard to get there, though, and recommend you be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The South Point (Again)”
Reviews.Author: tltfaas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at South Point for the second time May 17-21, 2007. I enjoyed my stay and I particularly love the variety of restaurants. However, if you stay at South Point you must have access to a car. It is several miles from the strip and public transportation is not reliable. This hotel features a multi-plex cinema, bowling, fun center for kids, etc. My only compliant this time around is that there is no security at the elevators during the day. You used to have to show your room key to get access to the hotel elevators. Without this security I felt a bit unsettled... my next door neighbors apparently invited every friend they had for a party at 1 am in the morning. Hotel security could have prevented this by ensuring that only hotel guests get access to the hotel. South Point suits my needs and I won't stay anywhere else in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Applejacker
Reviews.Content: I'll admit I was just there on short-term personal business, and looking for a good value. Found it at the South Point. The room, at mid-week value prices, was only $48 for a spacious room with two-room bathroom and large LCD TV. I did not try the restaurants though they looked appealing and reasonable for Las Vegas. A bountiful buffet was also offered. Additional dining options were plentiful within a few blocks away. It is about 5-6 miles south of the main strip but the I-15 access right out the back door was just reopening and made for great access to anything/anywhere you wanted. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Second time Stay”
Reviews.Author: quiet-pro
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights the same time last year so we knew exactly what to expect.This hotel is very good value and with the bowling alley and movie theatres is perfect for families.This time we knew to ask for a higher floor room that does not face "the wall" and the front desk clerk confirmed that we were reserved in one of those dreaded rooms but he would instantly chage us.The buffet in the cafe is good for the price but don't expect high quality.Smoke is pervasive and even though the vast majority do not want it these hotels continue to ignore the message.We went to eat out both nights to other restaurants that were completely non-smoking. With a rental car this is a good place to stay,especially being close to the new central rental car facility(which by the way worked very efficiently).

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip-well worth the drive”
Reviews.Author: Jettavroom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at South Point in April for a Vegas medical conference. I had reservation at another place but changed at the last minute because I was going alone. It was a great. The parking is easy and if you go to the 2nd level of the structure you can park right near the elevators. Parking was well lit and plentiful. Check in was easy and quick, the staff was very friendly. The little gift shop/store was open 24 hours and had soda, milk and water at normal prices, not Vegas $3 water. The alcohol was cheap as well. The room was about 500 square feet, bathroom was huge-the counter went from wall to wall. The room had a wonderful king bed, a sofa bed (I did not use it) a desk with internet ($10/24 hours) big flat screen TV, table and 2 chairs, dresser and 2 night stands. Plenty of lighting, big clean towels, shampoo & soap that is useable, very big closet w/iron & board. I ate at the buffet, typical but well stocked, hot and clean. You can get an entire bottle of wine for $6 which included a glass and they would even take it to your room. It has a movie theater, bowling alley, and an equestrian arena, and a small casino. I am not a big gambler so the casino was not a problem. I spent my $50 on the slots and I was done. There is a pool as well but I never saw it. The staff is not old and jaded (Fremont ST). They are not too young (MGM, TI) that they don’t understand that they are in the “service” industry. They joked and visited and gave a good personal touch. My price was $70 a night! The only down side is that it is about 15 miles south of the center of Vegas. I guess if you drink it could cause a problem. The view from the room is rather dull, but the lights are pretty at night. I don’t like dragging my luggage through a casino to get to my room but that is how 90% of the hotels in Vegas are, so no difference. I felt safe and the room was great. I will stay here again and tell everyone how nice it was.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Time At South Point”
Reviews.Author: GENE696
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Point May 13-18 and had a really fun time. The casino was alive 24/7 . The restaurants were top notch, including the buffet. The room was a whopping 500 sf. and very nicely furnished. Not to mention a 42 in wall mounted flat screen.Did I say the resort was nearly new! The pool area looked like out of the caribbean and very large and landscaped. This is a resort that is out of the main Strip area, however shuttles were available every 30 minutes. A full service resort and very friendly. We will go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for first timer, but good value and pleasant surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Sunbu
Reviews.Content: Two stays this year, cause it's close to son's apartment. He just moved here. Casino : Not the action or glitz you might find on the strip. It is all by itself, not walkable elsewhere. Like someone said, rent a car. The good: Good parking, sometimes close to the front door, bigger than average room with plasma tv, small coffee maker....In the casino, good drink service for players from nicely dressed servers, pretty good video poker (see [--]) $5 BJ (that means blackjack). Very cheap alcohol in the gift shop. Sports book has lower vig than strip on some wagers. The hotel has an arena connected, where we saw a rodeo, which was fun. Don Vitos restaurant is pretty good value for a white-tablecloth meal. Michaels restauarant (new here) is bloody expensive. No way you get out for less than $150pp (I looked at the menu). ... The fitness center is an extra $15. Better value if the front desk girl lets you have two for $15. Pool is ordinary but has good sun (no huge towers blocking the light). Negatives: No room safe or fridge. Very very inexpensive stay (except for gambling loss) booked on Travelocity, air and hotel combined.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, but far from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: NathanTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the South Point Casino hotel. I got room 2426, with view to the beautiful pool. The elevators are very fast. It's a big hotel, you walk a lot there. The room is very good, especially the bathroom. Great shower. It's far from the Strip. I had a car, but I would prefer next time to stay on the Strip..

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but book direct”
Reviews.Author: imdutch319
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - clean big rooms - but recommend you book directly with the hotel instead of online agencies. I booked 2 reservations through two diffent online companies to get best rate. Hotel never did find the second booking. Now they want me to pay for a night as a no show after I paid for the second room at the walk up rate with AAA discount. Staff and management was not accomodating even with booking document in hand. They need more customer care training and better booking procedures. It appears they have a manual / fax interface to outside online booking companies that is prone to error. You need a car if you stay but you can get to the strip fast now that Interstate 15 on ramp at hotel is open. Access ramps still under construction so had to navigate a little out of the way on return. No other casinos within walking distance. Buffet food is just ok. Cafe has $1.25 breakfasts at special hours. $2.99 steak and eggs. Service was a little slow even when not busy. Can't comment on other inhouse eateries. Short or no lines most times we ate which was nice. Pool closed at 7:00pm. Not what I would call family friendly. No opening hours were posted so you need to ask. Little shade. Very hot in PM as sun reflects off tower. Parking structure to park out of sun. Security patrolled. Security check at hotel elevators at night also. Join The Club players card but run up your points and asked to be comped for meals. I used points to pay for meals after dropping a bundel. Bbut since I used up the points they thought I hadn't played any and wouldn't comp my meals. Use your points on last day for meals or cash them out. 1000 points = $3. Big casino - not busy Mon - Wed so always had plenty of choices on machines and tables. $5 dollar table games. Inhouse travel agent can get discount show tickets for select shows. Discount book given at check in has some nice freebies or two for one deals - but skip waiting in line for the free gift - beads!

Reviews.Title: “Love it, Love it”
Reviews.Author: crislab4
Reviews.Content: Great place, I stayed at the south point during 5 days and I can say it is a great place off Las vegas Strip. You can rest in a great swimming pool, play some slots, or even go to the movies in a very clean, safe and nice looking place. The pool is fantastic, great place to go before take the tour to the strip and then come back to eat at the cafe coronado (serving great graveyards specials). If you like to gamble you would get a great comps and the players club is the ONE that gives you cash, nothing fake. Great job guys !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: erinlizabeth
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for a night in passing, but we loved this hotel! The rooms were large and luxurious. The beds were amazingly comfortable. We had a plasma flat screen TV. Even the bathroom amenities were above average (bath and body works!). It is all the luxury of the strip, but for half the price! It is far away from the strip, but that wasn't a problem for us. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Southpoint Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: JannieBoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here between May4-9/07. WoW!! Away from all the fuss of the strip-truly an enjoyable stay-staff,pool,housekeeping-all fantastic. If I had to find fault with something here, it would be the Garden Buffet, neither one of us found it special, but with sign-in book coupon it was only $12-really can't complain for that!! When and if we return....we will be staying at Southpoint Hotel and Casino!! Special thanks to Patricia Miranda for all her assistance during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed This Hotel/Casino”
Reviews.Author: Rannmann
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice hotel and casino and the rates were very reasonable. Read reviews of others before I booked, and I must agree with most of what I read. The room was definitely 4 stars (or better). My wife was very impressed with the Bath&Body soaps, shampoos, and lotions provided in the room. The t.v., what little we watched it, was great, and the bed felt awsome with a nice, firm matress. This place is about a year old, but our room looked brand new and still smelt new (we had a non-smoking room). We found the casino to be looser than the other casinos that we visited and had just as many games as the others did. My wife enjoyed the Spa Costa Del Sur and stated that she really enjoyed it and would definitely try it again if given the opportunity. The Garden Buffet was very nice the one time we ate there for breakfast, but we enjoyed the Coronado Cafe more often because it was open 24/7, the food was good, and the prices were very reasonable. The only two items which could be improved would be to reduce the amount of smoke in the casino (we are non-smokers) and to have the shuttle to and from the Mandalay Bay Resort be more on time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dcbush41
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in April and loved it! Great place! They've got a pool, kiddie pool, huge hot tub, provide beach towels, spa, hair salon, fitness center, movie theater, bowling alley, arcade, baby sitting for 3-9 yr olds, four or five different places to eat plus the casino. You wouldn't have to leave if you didn't want to. It is not close to the strip, but we actually liked that. We rented a car for $150 for the week and drove down to the strip on two different days just so we could say we did, but found we were happier just staying at South Point. Got a great rate online and found a discount code and ended up paying only $80 for Saturday night and $56 the other nights. Received a coupon booklet at check in good for the various eateries and movies etc. Staff was great and always quick and courteous. Didn't have to wait to check in or out and never saw anyone else waiting while we were there. Really a first class joint. Would recommend checking out Hoover Dam, short drive, go early and also going two hours north of Vegas to see Valley of Fire. Absolutely beautiful there and a good break from gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with South Point”
Reviews.Author: Champscme
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid-April, with wife and two kids. Rooms are very big and spacious, probably the largest hotel room I've seen in a long time. Beds were nice and comfortable. The bathroom is equally big and liked the fact that the shower and toilet were separate from the sink. The flat screen TV is nice, but it is not HD so it's not all that it is cracked up to be. All the staff we encountered were polite and pleasant. The pool area was spacious and the kids enjoyed (ages 2 and 11) it. The bowling alley on site was a plus, didn't see a movie but theater complex is big. We had a rental car so traveling to The Strip was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “A 4 star on the rising”
Reviews.Author: rayberinla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the South Point Casino Resort and Spa for 2 nights, April 25-27, 2007. What we read on Trip Advisor had our expectations high but we never expected it to be this high. The property on most sites comes in at 3 to 3.5 stars. It should be a 4 star resort. I think just a couple things are keeping it from reaching that level and they are minimal. Robes would be nice, a safe and toiletries such as Qtips and cotton balls would bring it to that level. Check in was rather fast even with just 2 people behind the counter and 7 people in line. The wait was no more than 5-6 minutes. When we made the reservations we were told the property was full and the only rooms available were the ADA queen rooms. We accepted, but were told all would be done to accommodate our request of a king bed. The request was granted with no problem and it was a 500 sq foot room on the 11th floor facing the pool. Of course with all Las Vegas hotels the rooms are a bit of a walk, but we had no problem parking in the covered garage as it had more than plenty of room, which was nice compared to other properties that take you around and around looking for spaces in the shade. When we got to the room the floor supervisor was just re checking the room to make sure that all lights, curtains, bath products, etc… were properly displayed and in working condition. We have stayed at some of the best properties in the world and have never seen or heard of this. WOW! That was our first impression that this was a properly run hotel/spa and nothing was over looked. There was a light out in the bathroom and the supervisor asked what time would be convenient to come back to change it as they did want to bother us. The staff was so professional and pleasant it really felt like a 5 star. The room itself had plenty of room and a beautiful LG wide screen mounted T.V. All the furnishings were Thomasville. High-end quality and service. The bath products were high-end Bath and Body Works products and Koehler sinks and shower heads. Wireless Internet service (for a fee of $10.99) was excellent and the simplest we have ever connected to. There were some top end restaurants in the hotel that we did not have time to go to but did have time to visit the Garden Buffet, which was of average quality, but what do you expect for $12.95 for dinner. The choices were plentiful and the lines were short and the food fresh. The property is a perfect place to stay if your one that does not need to be in the heart of the touristy strip. If you have a car, easy to get from strip and back, only 5 miles north to it. If no car, no problem. They provide a shuttle which works perfect. Make note that the south part of the strip is growing and becoming more populated at a very fast pace especially with the new and upcoming town center shopping mall just down the street from this property. I would not hesitate or even think twice about staying at this hotel. From the comfortable Sealy bed to the quietest rooms we have ever come across. You could hear a pin drop, that is how quiet. My only suggestion is a better quality of bath towel. If that is accomplished and the other suggestions are taken into consideration they would have no problem rating this property a 4 star property hands down. A perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynnstyr
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was very nice. The only drawback to this place is its location. Locate well south of the strip getting to and from the strip was a pain. I would highly recommend getting a rental car if you are staying here. The hotel has everything you need from a casino. It has about 6 reasturants, a 64 lane bowling alley, a 4 screen movie theater. Other live show entertainment is limited. The rooms were very spacious, had a nice flat screen TV and plenty of room. They do have some great food deals. The .75 cent hot dogs at the sports book were good. They have a great special at midnight you can get your choice of 3 grave yard specials. Full on breakfast for $1.25 or $2.25 for steak and eggs. They do have a free shuttle from the hotel to Madalay bay but we found it very inconvienient. Other than the location this hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with kids!!!”
Reviews.Author: KiwisinLA
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel - We are from New Zealand but live in Los Angeles. We always have a car when going to Vegas and dont find the 6 miles from the strip a problem, plus everywhere in Vegas is free parking! This place is so great for kids (and us) we have a 3 yr old and he just loves the kids pool, the spa (hot tub) which is a really nice temp, not to hot and has little waterfalls, not to mention the large heated pool also. And they are never crowded. We booked with expedia and got the room for $38 usd per night for 2 queen beds for all 3 of us. The buffet is great, food is nice and at $13 each (no charge for the little guy) its a steal, plus you recieve a coupon book that has a 2 for 1 deal for the buffet. B/fast is $7 each. There are a bunch of other restaurants, but when you have small kids its so much easier to do the buffet thing!! The Kids Tyme club is a $6 per hour per child and they must be potty trained, but again he loves it. Its a great cheap break for us non gamblers, with the movie theatres, bowling alley, spa etc - There's no need to go anywhere else..... Its fun tho to go for a drive at night to go see the free shows at Treasure Island, the light/water/fountain show at Bellagio, the indoor rain storm inside the Alladin mall and all the sights of the strip. The rooms are lovely, big, new, and clean. My husband loves the huge plasma tv's! They also have refridgerators on request. Check in is pretty quick compared to alot of the other places we have stayed in Vegas. So stay here if you have a car and have stayed already on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Everything about the South Point Hotel, Casino and Spa”
Reviews.Author: Beardielvr
Reviews.Content: The good: - Excellently trained staff who here helpful and friendly - Very quiet room with great mountain view - The most comfortable beds, ever - Great plasma TV on the wall - Quiet AC system - Reasonably priced breakfast and lunch buffet with lots yummy of choices and great service - Many yummy goodies at the deli - great for a sweet breakfast, filling lunch or snack - Seattles Best Coffee really was the best - Nice freeform pool with separate kiddy pool and separate hot tub pool - Lots of seating spread around the pool. Lots of big pool towels. - First class spa - beautiful facility - Wonderful massage - Excellent fitness center with lots of machines and TV's and no waiting - Good size casino. Lots of tables and slots with low limits/amounts. The bad: - Well, not really. At first I was put off by the additional charge to use the fitness center ($15 for 1 day; $36 for 3 days (I think); $50 for 5 days. When I used the gym, I realized the reason it was so nice is that the people in there were really dedicated to using the facilities. No kids running around. No people socializing. It left all the many machines there available for use. It is a beautiful facility and all the treadmills, and bikes have TV's, not to mention the numerous plasma TV's all around. The fitness center pass also let me use the spa facility - beautiful showers, soaking tub, hot tub, and steam room (but no sauna.) The ugly: Absolutely nothing! I highly recommend South Point, although I agree that a car is necessary. I have stayed at several hotels on the strip before, and I will be returning to South Point, hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD PRICE”
Reviews.Author: blurple80
Reviews.Content: When we got to the airport our flight had been cancelled due to weather. We called South Point, told them our situation, and they were pleasant enough not to charge us for that night of stay. We got into Vegas the next morning, very early and they were willing to let us check in early, at 10AM! The room was very nice, but we did face the wall. bad luck I guess. The restuarants they have inside the hotel were excellent and good priced. The buffet was awesome!! I would recommend the men to the barber shop down stairs by the elevators, my husband has never had such a good cut and shave.Thier staff was very friendly, even in the casino. It only took a few minutes to get to the main part of the Strip. I would definetly stay again. A++

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: successcoach
Reviews.Content: You will love it! We paid $81 dollars per night. It is worth 2 to 3 times that amount #1 Room are very large and clean! #2 It has a large 42" flat panel TV! #3 It feel like you are staying at the Hyatt, Bathroom had two seperate doors. Shower room and The sink room (very spacious) #4 Buffet is very reasonable. Dinner was around $12 and Lunch was around $8. We paid double that at the larger hotels. #5 Bowling alley, Game room....they have it all #6 Casino was large and clean. If you don't mind being off the main strip, this is the right choice! I like clean, safe hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cliveasmith
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights over Easter. Loved the room with the flat screen TV. Huge windows that give great views, we had the mountain side facing the I15 and the pool. Liked the pool area and enjoyed the large hot tub. There were cocktail waitress coming around often for if you got thirsty. As many people have said before this hotel is about 5 mins drive to Mandalay Bay but that does not bother us, it's like a mental break from the strip to go back to at bed time! Not the best place for a first trip to Las Vegas. We also always have a rental car so shuttles are not a problem for us, I might not be as keen on staying there if I had to rely on shuttles.

Reviews.Title: “Just awesome!”
Reviews.Author: TrickyRicky9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Wynn for 7 nights from April 6-13th, 2007 and it was just awesome! We had stayed at The Venetian and several other hotels the last 10 years and this was right up there as far as elegance. The room we were assigned had a view of The Strip and since there was an entire wall of windows, it was a spectacular view. The Wynn has buttons next to the bed that controls the drapes and sheers covering the windows so it was a neat feature. The bed was very comfortable, the room was very clean and was equipped with 2 flat, wall-mounted TV's (1 in the bathroom next to the tub and 1 in the living area) and even had HDTV channels. There is nothing cheap at this hotel so if you're looking for low limit gambling or cheap brekfasts, this isn't the place for you. This is an elegant hotel with upscale shopping and dramatic views from the restaurants of the waterfalls and man-made lake. Staff was very friendly and helpful...would stay here again for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Easter stay a pleasant suprise”
Reviews.Author: cpenorab
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent a marvelous Easter weekend at the South Point last week. We took advantage of their Easter special offer and were pleasantly suprised by this fantastic hotel. The rooms were large, clean , and the beds were firm. The 42" plasma tv was really a hit with the kids. The pool was standard but the hot tub was really great. The casino was large with plenty of $5.00 dollar tables and not as smokey or crowded as I have read on other reviews. We especially enjoyed the Del Mar Deli for lunch sandwichs, and the "graveyard special" can't be beat. Look for some great values in the coupon book they give you at check in.The new bowling alleys came in handy keeping the kids occupied while we went to see Barry Manilow. The hotel is 5 miles from south strip but if you rent a car there's no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Further South than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Matadoria
Reviews.Content: Brand spanking new property on South Las Vegas Boulevard, so I've no complaints regarding the room, amenities, or service. In fact, all of the above were top rate. However, for those not familiar with Vegas, it needs to be stated just how far South you are from the Strip. The South Point is approximately six miles south of Mandalay Bay. As a point of reference, the Strip runs four miles between Mandalay Bay and the Stratosphere. And it's about two miles from the Stratosphere to Fremont Street in the downtown area. So you're going south a distance the length of the Strip plus travel to the downtown area, only with much less to see and do, to get to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “off the strip, but still a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: werberzicke
Reviews.Content: if you don't want or need to spend the night on the strip, this hotel is right for you! new, nice, clean, unexpensive! we flew into vegas late at night and the way to the hotel was easy to find and drive. we had breakfast at the buffet, for what we got a coupon at the check in. the food was good and had lots of choices. because we left right after that, i can't say anything about the spa or other services. but i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Family-oriented and price-friendly”
Reviews.Author: fredorules
Reviews.Content: My 13-yr old son and I stayed here from 4/7-4/10 thru an internet deal (Sat nite $80, next 2 nites $56 each). The deal included a hotel coupon book and a $10 food credit. Naturally, you're not going to find a similar deal on the Strip. The tradeoff is that the Southpoint is apart from the Strip and a rental car is a must. However, with a rental car, you have the freedom of visiting other hotels and sights and you're not restricted by shuttle busses or paying for cabs. Our compact cost us $18 per day from Dollar and ferried us around quite nicely. Back to the Southpoint: rooms are as noted by recent reviewers. Ask for a room on a higher floor, though, if you want a view. We got put into a room on the second floor facing the casino wall, which extends about 5 stories. Although we didn't spend much time in the room, a view would have been nice. So be sure to ask at the desk for an upper floor room that doesn't face the casino wall. I second the great $.75 hot dog deal at the sportsbook. The stand does close at 5 pm though. And to PinkSoxUSA: the hotel has a bowling center and a 16-screen movie theater. Hel-lo! That's why families stay there!

Reviews.Title: “A Respite from all of the Glitz”
Reviews.Author: Shardiva
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at South Point on a whim. We have stayed at many different hotels on and off the Strip, so we figured we would try this new one out. South Point offers so much for the price. 1. Big rooms complete with a big flat screen TV. the beds were also very comfortable. 2. Good quality of consumer service - housekeeping was very receptive at 10:00pm to bring up an extra comforter. Also we had forgotten our room keys in the room and it was very quick to get new ones. 3.Not too busy like Strip hotels - It is nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of the craziness. This casino was quieter, brighter and less smoky than any we have ever stayed at. 4. The Spa and Barber Shop - This is the #1 reason I love this place. The Spa is comparable to any on the Strip. The services are extensive and not as expensive as other spas in the area. The fitness room has top of the line equipment and very large. The barber shop is run by a talented barber from upstate NY and he really knows his stuff. My husband has never looked better. I want to go back just for this. 5. The pool area is nice, but we didn't partake of this amenity. It did look like a great place to hang out. 6. We did not eat at the restaurants at the resort as we love to go on Strip for that (Side note: Eat at David Burke's in the Venetian - Phenomenal!!!). They look as though they cater to the business traveler and families. This is a place that hasn't figured out what it wants to be when it grows up. Does it want to be a distination Spa, resort and casino or does it want to be family casino? There were alot of families when we were there (i.e.: Spring break 4/4 to 4/8) and the South Point has alot to offer them (i.e.: movie theater, bowling alley, kids tyme area and rodeo arena). It will be interesting as Michael's restaurant comes in, what will the direction of this property will go. All in all, a great experience and we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “4Star Room for a 3 Star Price”
Reviews.Author: CaliGirl23
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you have a car in Las Vegas. It's a little far from The Strip, but the drive to the hotel is not too bad. Las Vegas Blvd, after you pass Mandalay Bay, is actually a very smooth drive. There is very little traffic usually, and the stop lights are few and far between. The hotel is approx 5 miles away Mandalay Bay. However, be warned that 5 miles is actually quite a ways away from the Strip. They were also doing construction on the freeway where the off-ramp is (or should be). We had to go down to the next exit (about 2 miles down) and backtrack to the hotel. But it was no biggie. It's also nice that the hotel was not crowded and good parking was readily available. The room was very spacious. I would say it's almost like a mini suite. It looks just like the pictures on their website. There was the bed (very nice and comfortable), a couch, a coffee table, a 42 inch (I think) plasma TV, a little desk, a nice sized dresser, a small round table and a couple of chairs in the room. There is also a coffee maker, iron, and ironing board. The bathroom is large. The toilet and bathtub/shower are in a separate room as the sink. The soap smelled really good (like Peach)! Overall, the room looked like it belonged in a 4 star hotel. The casino however, is probably a 3-3.5 star casino. There was no mini-bar or safe in the room. The pool is nice but nothing special. There was a main pool(unheated), a hot tub, and a smaller kiddy pool that is heated The hotel and casino is brand new so everything is nice. But I wouldn't say it was a luxury hotel and casino. The hotel and casino did smell more smokey than other casinos. But there are cheap tables if you want to gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the South Point”
Reviews.Author: Cindyph413
Reviews.Content: The South Point is off the strip, which is what we wanted. The room was very clean and big. The bathroom was great! We also loved the view from our room on the 24th floor. The only disappointment was that the pool opens late and closes early. I would have loved to sit in the beautiful jacuzzi later in the evening. Scott and Cindy

Reviews.Title: “Still New Off Strip Mediterranean-California themed Hotel/Casino”
Reviews.Author: GrandOhioTraveler
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at this relatively new hotel/casino 5-6 miles south of The Strip. Here are the pros: --coupon book for hotel service discounts provided --only $120/night on the weekend --rooms are still new, spacious, furniture clean, flat screen tv a plus --bathroom also spacious, sink separate from toilet and shower/bathtub --ordered room service twice, prompt service (30-40 minute wait only), decent food --did not use but noticed lots of families taking advantage of the pool --didn't think the casino was smoky at all, very well-lighted --surprised by the decent-sized Sports/racebook area --75 cent hotdogs by the sports/racebook area--one of the best food deals in Vegas the cons: --not recommended for Vegas visitors if you don't have a rental car --growing popularity will eventually cause wear and tear

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: Leilani07
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel for a week and definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a clean, spacious, affordable room to stay in while in vegas. Great for family. It's less smokey compare to any other hotels in las vegas that i have been too. The Buffet Dinner isn't that great and not worth the money even if it's cheap. I didn't try their breakfast nor lunch since dinner was bad. But Overal it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “New style for Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mi32ke
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say my wife and I head for Las Vegas about every 6 weeks for the last 15 years. We’ve stayed at most the major and some of the minor hotels in town. Our last trip was a spur of the moment thing and as usual the strip was sold out due to March madness even using our players card did no thing to help us finding a room. We had stopped as South Point the last time we were in town just to see what it was like. We checked on line and were able to book room for the weekend with no problem. Check-in was fast and the room was more then expected. They have some exceptional extras in the rooms, the 42" plasma TV , bedding and mattress was top notch. The casino staff was some of the best we’ve dealt with in recent years. The restaurants were all good and the service was excellent. The thing that impressed us the most was the spaciousness of the casino. You didn’t feel closed in between the machines and tables the isles were extra wide and the casino was very clean. Drink hostesses were always close by and fast, the dealers were friendly and always up-beat. The casino was bright and airy, not dark and dingy as most. I’ve never recommended a hotel in Las Vegas before but I defiantly do suggest you try this one.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: AsianVista
Reviews.Content: My family of four and my parents stayed at South Point for two days. We booked two rooms. Rooms are clean and spacious. Good customer services from the staff. Casino does smell more smoky than most. Our kids (ages 4 and 2) enjoyed bowling and hanging out at the pool. We're glad we stayed at this hotel because the kids were able to have fun and it's away from the strip. There's also an ice cream shop on the premises. Game room could be bigger. In the day, my folks took the free shuttle to the strip. In the evening, the kids hung out with them and then it was my husband and my turn to shuttle to the strip. The shuttle came every 20-30 minutes depending on the traffic on the strip. We were lucky enough to walk out to the pickup area and wait for only 5-10 minutes most of the time. Lots of parking and there's also a parking garage. Elevators are quick. Buffet is okay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiianwahines
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property 3/22/07-3/25/07 with my children and other family members. (seven of us in all) The hotel let us check in at 11 am and provided coupon books for each of our rooms. This hotel had nice big rooms that were very clean. There were two lights out in the bathroom but housekkeping replaced them when I left a note for the maid. Housekeeping gave us extra pillows and towels. I hooked up to the internet at $12.99 a day, but was worth it for my daughter. Rented a movie in the room too. Only problem was the adult channel was on #31 and so was the Disney channel. My sister didn't block the adult channels correctly and had to jump out of her chair quickly to turn off the tv! There was a great bowling alley with a good snack bar attached to it, a very small arcade that needs help, great theatres, a nice size pool that was open, kid club where you can check in/out your kids if you wanted to go to a show or whatever (I didn't use it). My kids liked the buffet and the variety at the 24 hr cafe. There were childrens' items on the main menu available. The $1.25 specials were really good. The casino area was large and smokey, great table games with low minimums, and one of the best BINGO games around. The outlet mall was two miles down the road on the wat to the strip. Our drive to Circus Circus took 15 minutes on the side road. All in all I would stay there again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay off the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: LadyNorma
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was the best deal and we wanted to be out of town, so that we could get on the road to LA the next day. Room was beautiful, spacious and clean and the linens and bedclothes were wonderful, as good as any 4 star hotel. Best of all, I won my money back, which I had lost in Laughlin!

Reviews.Title: “A great experience.”
Reviews.Author: roxydogo
Reviews.Content: My family has been to Las Vegas over 20 times with the usual places on the Strip to stay. We chose to stay here a few days of our vacation. The rooms are spacious, clean, and easily accommodated the 4 of us. They were willing to give us extra towels, pillows etc. No problem.. There were no areas of dissatisfaction noted. We have children and they were easily entertained. The kids wished for a larger game room though. All of the staff from the valet, bellman, housekeeping, restaurant staff and others were all excellent. Thanks for the great service which made a lasting impression. we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Shortfalls !!!”
Reviews.Author: Frequent
Reviews.Content: Went back to South Point (since it changed hands from South Coast) and noticed some downfalls. First, casino floor was real smoky. Got a room on the 2nd floor with a view of the wall next door. Room was clean, however some light bulbs did not work. Pillows were real cheap quality. Buffet Breakfast was not as good as before. Some items missing and others (fruits) were of canned variety. Front Desk Clerks were not smiling or seemed very concerned. Rates went up. Considering the rate and the fact the hotel is far from the main strip, I think I will be staying at other hotels from now on. Since the ownership change, things are not the same. Also, found ashtrays near slots full and empty glasses everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Tiburon
Reviews.Content: Our flight back to Chicago was cancelled and darn near everything on the strip was booked so we took a chance and had a friend Priceline a hotel off of the strip for us. We got the room for $70. Fortunately, the hotel provided a free shuttle from the airport making it very easy and convenient to get there. The pictures of the rooms are exactly what our room looked like. Very clean, spacious, plasma television, etc. We had just stayed 3 nights at the Monte Carlo and the room at the South Point was larger, cleaner, newer, nicer. I had no idea how large the place was - it has a spa, movie theatre, arcade, bowling alley, casino, and many restaurants. The restaurants all looked decent with a few nicer than others and offering a bit higher fare. We ate at an Italian place and the food was good, plentiful, and no casino noise to be had (which was amazing since it was just outside the door). I signed up for a players club card and received two free t-shirts, wine glasses, coupons for various things (free dessert at the Italian place - wonderful!). Everyone was extremely friendly. Having said all of the above, there is really only one thing you must know about the hotel - its location. It is not near the strip. This can be a benefit or drawback. I think the place is perfect for older people who do not want to go tromping around from one casino to the next and for families who are looking for something for everyone in the family to do while remaining in a centralized location. If you're going to Vegas for the first time, this probably isn't the place because you're going to want to see what everyone talks about - the great hotels, casinos, and shows that are on the strip. Last, if you do find yourself needing a last minute hotel and you've already exhausted the strip, this really does provide a great night away from the fray while still enjoying what Vegas has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Getaway for Horse Owners!”
Reviews.Author: TucsonWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay and especially great for horse owners and horse admirers! This is a great getaway from the hustle of the Strip- this is coming from a frequent Vegas traveler who loves to stay on the Strip. After my weekend stay at South Point, I will never ever stay on the Strip again. The rooms are new and spacious with beautiful horse decor, a huge plasma screen tv and I never heard noise from anyone in the halls or my neighbors. The greatest point for horse people is the quick walk to the arena to the horse show (when I was there, a million dollar cutting horse competition was going on). If you don't feel like walking to the the live action, you can watch the activity from your room on your plasma. The casino itself was great too (I did win a little) and the restaurants I ate at were as equally good. This is a kid friendly place with a movie theater, bowling alley and child care services. Nearby is the Silverton casino which was also a great atmosphere. Everything is very accessible with the South Point shuttle so if you are having Strip withdrawals or want to go to a show, it's a quick ride away. I am dying to go back to Vegas and stay at South Point!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the South Point”
Reviews.Author: TXVegaslover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the South Point for one night after returning from a four night stay in Laughlin. We payed $110 for the room which was quite reasonable considering how nice it was. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever spent the night on. The room was huge and beautifully decorated. It featured a 42" plazma TV and the bathroom had a separate area for the toilet and tub. The property was very self contained including a bowling alley and movie theatre. The casino was spacious and was less smoky than most casinos. The buffet was very good and very reasonably priced. The hotel had a nice mix of people of all ages. There were families, business men, seniors and college kids. The only real negative is the location - way south of Mandalay Bay. We always rent a car when visiting Vegas so it was not a problem for us. However, I would not recommend this location for a first time visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!!!!”
Reviews.Author: damons
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. The rooms are just as pictured on their site. Nice TV, soft bed, separate spaces in the bath room. The only complaint would be the valet. When we arrived, there was no bellman and the valet station was empty. We brought 4 suit cases and a set of golf clubs, and when the car was brought around, at check-out, the driver stood there and watched as my wife loaded the suit cases and clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloGringo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at South Point in February and will be returning in May. That alone should speak volumes since I will be attending a week long conference and I could have stayed anywhere because my company is picking up the tab. Enjoying what this hotel has to offer completely depends on what your expectations are for staying in Vegas. If you need to be on the traditional strip 24/7 to enjoy a Vegas trip then you might be disappointed only in that you are about 8 minutes removed from that location. If you like to get into the mix for a while and then want someplace to retreat to and regroup then this place is perfect. It is every bit the hotel and casino as you would find on the strip but without the hectic pace and crowds. Our tip in February was for a conference my wife was attending. We spent the weekend at South Point and then she stayed at the MGM and I crashed at the Imperial Palace. My wife insisted that we stay at the South Point on this trip and I had no arguement at all. This place is only 2 years old so everything is well kept and clean. The dealers and pit managers were hands down the most generous and friendliest of the dozen or so places I gambled in on the trip. You can tell these folks want and appreciate your business. I probably spent more time gambling at Harrahs and didn't get anything for the donations I made. South Point gave us breakfast and dinner comps for the time we spent on their tables - a small price for them given our time spent but it spoke volumes to me and earned my return trip business. After about a five hour stint on a table at Harrahs I asked for a breakfast comp and they laughed at me. The front desk and all the rest of staff were very friendly and helpful to us. I will be fair and give out one negative to the casino bar - $9.00 for a martini that I could have got for free by putting a nickel in the slot machine next to me is not a good business move, re-think your strategy there.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: junkrus
Reviews.Content: We tried this hotel because everything near the strip was too expensive due to Nascar and the reviews on this website. Our group loved this hotel for the following reasons. The rooms were large and clean with great plasma tvs. The casino is very nice and open, didn't feel caged in like some of the other casinos. And finally, the work out facility is awesome and the equipment is great (tv's at every machine). We can't comment on the food because we didn't eat there. A few issues other travelers might have: 1. Location- about a 15 minute drive south of Mandalay Bay, but we were fortunate to have a rent a car so it wasn't an issue for us. 2. The shower water was hard-so it took a while to get the soap off-but no big deal Other than that, it served its purpose for 4 guys golfing and gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value”
Reviews.Author: halifax01
Reviews.Content: I have been staying @ the Southpoint everytime I am in Vegas for Business... about 5-6 times per year... I have nothing but terrific things to say...the rooms are large, clean and modern.... the restaurant selection from the cafe to the seafood bar are top notch..... The proximity to the freeway is excellent! I wouldn't stay here w/out a car if you are looking for the Vegas experience.... From a business travellers point of view...The Southpoint can't be beat. I will be staying @ Southpoint the week of March 26th...looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Sanity away from the strip!”
Reviews.Author: DickG
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel a few miles from the strip and a great place lo lodge away from the glitz and the traffic! A friend and I stayed here for 3 nights and we were very impressed with the value for money. We had a HUGE room on the 15th floor with great views over Las Vegas. Food at the hotel was excellent and the choice was terrific. Who said they came back to the UK dying for a salad because they hadn't seen any? At south point the meals in the buffet meant fresh salad and fresh fruit available all day! The buffets were great and VERY good value at both breakfast and lunch time. One night we dined in the Silverado steakhouse and had superb service in a quality setting. We each had 2 courses, with bread and sparkling water (I had a melt in the mouth fillet steak and my friend had lamb chops) and the whole thing came to $68!!! We ate one night at the Oyster Bar (mainly seafood) and there are several themed areas for different styles of food. The rooms were cleaned regularly and the coupon book given to guests at reception on arrival was very useful and gave good discounts at the food outlets in the hotel and the spa. If you play the slots there are free drinks on offer served by delightful young ladies! Valet parking at the hotel was fast with polite, quality service. Express checkout via the TV in the room was useful as this was easy and quick and avoided any queues at reception (these were only half a dozen people at even busy times). Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and you felt very safe around the hotel. I would definitely stay here again, indeed, we even came back to the hotel a couple of times just to eat and pass a couple of hours of real fun! Brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyFamilyMen
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I've seen reviews good and bad but I can't see how people can complain about this place. The rooms are huge and clean. The hotel staff was friendly. I only ate at the Cafe but so I can't speak for the other restaurants but it was a good experience. I rented a car like I always do regardless of where I stay in Vegas. I caught a movie which was great. I'll be back on the 18th of March and can't wait to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lousy location”
Reviews.Author: OntarioCanuck
