Reviews.Content: I stayed for a convention that provided a shuttle service, and i have been to Vegas many times before so the location was not a big problem for me except for the cab fares from airport (I was later than last free shuttle), and to the strip for a show,but if you are visting to see vegas this hotel is far away from where you want to be. The hotel is VERY nice, great rooms, lots of choice for gambling, reasonable meals, etc but if I were visting I'd stay closer to the strip. There is a large movie complex and bowling alley but do you go to vegas to see a movie???

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 3hour_tourguide
Reviews.Content: We had made a reservation at this hotel back in October, when it was called South Coast. The reservation transferred over with no problems, and we were able to make some last minute changes as well. The front desk staff was very friendly. The hotel was much larger than we expected, and included several restaurants, a bowling alley, and a movie theater. We did not use the pool because of the time of year during our stay (December), but had a view of it from our room. The pool area appeared very spacious, with lots of lounge chairs and a bar. The room was a good size, had comfortable beds and lots of space. There was also a flat screen LCD TV on the wall. The bathroom was quite large and had a separate "room" for the tub & toilet, with a large countertop, mirror, and sink in the entry room. We did not spend a lot of time in the casino since we were in Vegas to shop, but the casino area seemed quite large. One of the main drawbacks to this hotel is the location. It is quite far from the main area of the strip, and you pretty much have to drive or take a cab from the hotel if you want to go anywhere. However, there seems to be a lot to do at the hotel (movies, bowling, gambling, etc.) so you could spend a lot of time at the hotel and still have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Too Local”
Reviews.Author: Lembeck2001
Reviews.Content: Rooms were big and clean. It was a nice room - I just didn't care for the casino or the people frequenting it while I was there. The buffet and Don Vitos were absolutely atrocious. The dueling pianos were fun. I normally stay on the strip but gave this place a try. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great LV hotel”
Reviews.Author: joanbosoxfn
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. We have stayed at lots of LV hotels and this one was one of the nicer. Room wise, it is every bit as nice as the Mandalay Bay, and half the price!! The plama TV on the wall is a plus, the rooms was spacious and very very nice linens, etc. Bathroom was large and clean. The staff is very cordial, helpful, and the food was pretty good. The Buffet is OK, the cafe was better. The only down side is that it is off the strip, but a nice break from the huge strip crowds. There is a casino, typical casino, but smaller, which was quite nice. The pool is not fancy, but still OK. Nice thick towels, a cool hot tub, then a large pool. Plenty good enough to catch that mid-winter sun!! We will definately stay there again! You do have to either take the shuttle or fight the traffic to get to the strip, but by the time you get back to your room, you'll be thankful to get away from the crowds!

Reviews.Title: “Very Quiet”
Reviews.Author: mkathy
Reviews.Content: Spent four days at the hotel and can't say enough about how great it was. We checked in early and they accomodated us with rooms immediately, The rooms were spacious, well-maintained and extremely quiet. We found the food at the Coronado Cafe good and very reasonably priced, especially breakfast. The casino didn't seem as smoky as some casinos, and wasn't overly crowded. If you go, request an even number room, those have tghe view of the pool area. Also we had booked through the hotel, but found a cheaper rate at Expedia and the hotel gladly matched the price. Since we always rent a car the drive was no problem. We plan on staying there on our next trip to Vegas. Kathy - Oklahoma

Reviews.Title: “Stay here and you won't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: dhartallen
Reviews.Content: You will not go wrong if you stay at this hotel. First of all, you can't beat the price. Secondly, you get alot for your money. What hotel do you know of that offers a bowling alley, movie theater, spa, gym, casino, 42inch plasma tv in a plush bedroom, arcade, babysitting services and good dining all at the same time. My husband and I had a blast. The next time I will take my daughters who is 19 and 16. The hotel is very family oriented. Trust me this is the hotel you would want to take your family to. If you have any additional questions, you can email me @ dhartallen@aol.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: tireman
Reviews.Content: Just a short drive from the strip. I stayed in room 1949 and could see the Mandelay Bay from my room. The rooms were very large with Thomasville furniture, 42 inch plazma tv, king bed, couch coffee table, floor to ceiling windows across the front of the room. Very nice marble/mix bathroom with hair dryer, coffee, tea, etc. large tub/shower, very clean. Bed was excellent with great sheets/pillows, walls had nice paintings. closet with extra pillow, suitcase bench, iron and ironing board. full length wall mirror in hall to check yourself before leaving the room. Very quiet room, stretch out on the couch and look out the window to see across LV and the hills. Hotel has, nice pool area, bowling alleys nice! and movie theatres nice! small casino area but plenty of places to eat. breakfast is dirt cheap! Steak and eggs $2.95, Buffets and formal eating also available with very reasonable prices. Hotel has FREE parking and plenty of it. A quiet hotel, lots of seniors come here for bingo. Free shuttle to the strip. This place is a bargain, stay here and take the shuttle. You'll save a bundle.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 4bzboys
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. We would even bring the kids next time. This hotel is kid friendly although I didn't see many. This hotel was better than we ever expected! The rooms were large and very clean. The bowling was fun. They also have a day care. We caught a movie, the theater was very nice and clean. I wan't impressed with the food. We ate once at the buffet and once at the Italian Rest. We worked out at the gym, although expensive, $15 a day for each person. I didn't want to come back home to my gym! This one has very nice equiplment!!!! The front desk staff weren't the nicest. Oh well. We will return for sure!

Reviews.Title: “We loved South Point”
Reviews.Author: gymnastmom
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the South Point hotel in Las Vegas. The rooms were very neat and tidy, the bathroom had a seperate shower and sink area that we loved. We ordered both room service and ate at the Garden Buffet. All meals were very good. After all, you can't beat a large buffet breakfast for $6.45. It was a steal! The kids bowled one night and had a blast. There is a coupon in the book that's given to you at check-in. The staff was very polite and helpful. I know there were some complaints of location on this hotel. This is actually one of the reasons we loved this place. It's located in the upcoming south strip and is about 4 miles from the hustle and bustle of the main strip. As long as you have a rental car, it's a breeze to get in and out. I'd valet park my car at any of the northern hotel locations, walk around the strip a bit, and would move on to the next hotel. All it costed was the price of a tip for the valet. We're not big gamblers, but it all depends what you're looking for. I only have one negative comment. In order to get to our rooms, we had to walk through the smoky casino. I wish there could be a back entrance where the elevators are so we didn't have to walk through the smoky casino. The rooms had no smoke odor whatsoever. If you're looking for a clean hotel for a great price, than try South Point. You can't beat the price compared to those expensive strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: darlin_me
Reviews.Content: My family and my mom from another state met here for new years 2007. Loved the spa (my husband and I had never been to one) It is great!! We also enjoyed the salon with a pedicure. As our kids 16, 18 & 19 enjoyed the movies and bowling. Also the shuttle to the strip (so mom and dad could sleep in!!) sitting in the outdoor hot tub in Jan. getting a tan!!(loved that) We got a smoking room for me and my hubby, and a non-smoking for the kids and G-ma. that worked well for me!!! Thank you, everyone at the South Point!!!!

Reviews.Title: “PROFILING AT THE GIFT SHOP ???? You decide...”
Reviews.Author: MoMo8-GA
Reviews.Content: Kids of all ages would probably love this place, as there are many things family-oriented, but not oversaturated with kids at every turn. Still had a romantic feel for couples. This was our first trip to Vegas and SouthPoint was a good choice for us as non-gamblers :-). Some may say we didn't get a real feel for Vegas, but the SP actual made us want to visit again and see all that Vegas has to offer. The rooms were beautiful and spacious, comfortable beds, large baths. Of course, my husband LOVED the big screen plasma TV... view in Rm 237 wasn't great, but not a big deal. There was some early morning construction noise, but not so loud that it woke us out of a sleep. ONLY one really bad experience and that was at the Gift Shop. We browsed around for 10 minutes with NO HELLO (but was mysteriously followed by a clerk pretending to put away merchandise) NO offer of assistance from a jewelry clerk who stood less than 2 feet away AND get this, no one came to RING UP OUR PURCHASES after standing at the cash register for 2 minutes! Can't say I was profiled, HOWEVER, when another woman walked in grabbed something and then stood behind us at the cashier... woman at the jewelry counter suddenly yelled over to take care of her. NEVER will I spend my money where I FEEL disrespected or discriminated against. I put the souvenirs down and disgustedly walked out of the store. My next letter is to the hotel as I am not one to complain about such ignorance... but VEGAS being an metropolitan city with visitors from all over the world... I couldn't believe the treatment I received. There were some glitches with the shutte times; but in looking at the other reviews I didn't find the Strip FAR away... The courtesy shuttle to airport was a nice plus, not all hotels do that from what I researched. The theatre was very nice with plush seating, cup holders and nice sound. The staff was very helpful and had a description of each movie at the front counter. I didn't do the bowling or the bingo, but definitely will go next time. FIRST TIMERS willing to TRY SP AGAIN... but bought my souvenirs SOMEPLACE ELSE!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: twostick
Reviews.Content: Big, clean rooms in a nice hotel. The location is way, way, way south of the strip. It;s very conveniant for me and the seminars I attend close by. Are you looking for excitement?- Go north to the strip. Are you looking for a nice hotel with good room service and pleasent resturants at a good value- stay here

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kamabuki
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for families. There is plenty for the kids to do - large bowling alley, 16 screen movie theater, video arcade, or you could bring along their XBox and park them in front of the 42" plasma TV in the room and order em up room service and they would be in gaming heaven. For the 21 and over crowd the casino is very nice - plenty of slots, table gaming and a sport book area . Nice pool area, spa, and barber shop. Only draw back is the distance from the main strip. 10 to 15 min's by riding in the complimentary shuttle van which does not include the wait for it to arrive. The best part of this hotel is the rooms. They are nicely appointed, very comfortable beds, huge bathrooms - with the toilet and tub/shower in a separate room, even has a phone next to the toilet. I guess for those really important phone calls that can't wait for mother nature. We will definitely stay here again - although next time with a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Very busy time of year but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Kaygee
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and I) stayed at the South Point (SP) from 26th December 2006 until 4th January 2007. We flew from London and landed in LAX at around 4pm, and after picking up our rental car, we headed off for LV. We have done this journey several times over the past couple of years, but we had never experienced anything like the amount of traffic trying to get out of LA. The journey was a nightmare and took almost 8 hours to get to the SP in LV. My recommendation to anyone thinking of doing this journey over the Christmas and New Year period would be – JUST DON'T DO IT!! We arrived at the SP at midnight and as expected we sailed through check in, and we were given a large room on the 12th floor (Room 1261). Our room was right at the end of a very long corridor, but in order to compensate it was larger than the normal King room (apparently). The rooms are larger than the average LV hotel room anyway, and everything in our room was lovely and clean, spotless white sheets and glistening bathroom. Even though it was after midnight and we were both completed shattered from the journey, we checked everything was in order with the room. The furniture was ample with lots of drawer space and lots of hanging space (but not many hangers for a couple of people staying for 9 nights). Unfortunately there wasn't a safe in the room, so we ended up putting our valuables in our suitcase and locking it in the wardrobe. The room also had a table and two chairs, as well as a sofa, allowing different places to sit within the room. The huge plasma TV was a bonus, and because the room was large it made easy viewing when we were sat on the sofa. The bathrooms were decorated in earthy coloured tiles, and the sink area was separate from the toilet and bath area, which is ideal when you are sharing the time to get ready on a morning. The products that were with the bathroom were OK, nothing special, and not worth using really. To my husband’s delight there was a coffee maker in the bathroom, but it only came with one regular and one decaffeinated coffee sachet and only one supply of milk and sugar… so it was only really OK for one drink, but they did get replenished on a daily basis (but really the best thing is to go to the Seattle’s Best Coffee shop). On the first day we ate at the Coronado Café and had a lovely breakfast, very nice surroundings, nice and bright and clean, only one downside was the speed of the service, it was a little slow, and we watched people who had arrived after us being served before us. We also ate evening meals here, we had something from the Chinese Menu, and it was delicious, and this time the service was spot on! Baja Miguel’s was open on the first few days we were in the hotel, but then it was closed and boarded over, it is being replaced with a new restaurant called Michael’s, I think it opens in the next few months. We can’t comment on the buffet as we didn’t eat there, but all in all the food outlets were very well received and the food was always well presented and tasted great. The hotel facilities are great; bowling, cinema, equestrian centre, exhibition centre, spa, barbers, pool (which was open all the time we were there, except on one very windy day) and of course the casino. The casino was always busy, and seemed to favour blackjack, craps and roulette. There were lots and lots of slot machines, and we seemed to leave about even, so I wouldn’t describe them as being tight. I played roulette a few times, and this worked well for me and the dealers were very friendly and polite. One negative about the casino was the lighting – it was so bright all of the time, and you couldn’t get away from the lights. Normally there is a subdued lighting regime in casinos, but not at the SP. If you are trying to hide a few skin complaints in the dark, then the SP casino is not for you. This is a shame really – if it had been a little darker I think there would have been a lot more ambience, however this was lacking due to the level of light in the room. Parking was never a problem; we always used valet parking and never had a problem with it – very fast and very friendly. There was a huge car park at the front of the hotel and a multi level car park at the north side. The views from our room were of the east of LV, and we could quite easily see Green Valley Ranch Resort, and over to the mountains towards Boulder City. We saw some great fireworks for New Year, but didn’t see anything of the Strip’s fireworks. Having stayed at the SP we would stay here again, and anyone who is staying here in the future should really consider hiring a car. We always hire a car when in LV, as you never know where you may decide to travel to (we travelled to Area 51 this time around) and having a car means having the freedom to make the journey to the strip. We didn’t have any problems when heading towards the centre of the strip, in fact the I15 was more congested than the strip! On average it took 10-15 minutes to get to Caesars Palace – not bad really. Overall the SP is a lovely hotel that offers lots of facilities, and is great for parties of all types - families, couples, younger groups. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family with the proviso that they hire a car and build in travel time to and from the Strip for any plans that are made at the major Strip hotels. Staying in a hotel that is a few miles away from the Strip isn’t a hindrance, it is an opportunity to make the most of an area that is up and coming, and quite a bit more serene than the bigger Strip Hotels. We enjoyed it and we hope that you do too!

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Resort. One of the Best in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: tahititreat
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas numerous times and this place is wonderful. It has to be the best value in Vegas period. The rooms are luxurious. The bed is one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on. The large screen tv was a huge bonus and the washroom was very large, upscale, and had a wonderful sprinkler head on the shower. I enjoyed some great food at the buffet. The breakfast buffet was $4.95. lunch $7.95, and dinner $11.95. For those prices it was a steal when you consider that you get for lunch barbaque ribs, turkey, chicken, all types of chinese and italian food as well as a large selection of deserts. In addition, they give you a coupon book at check-in, which includes a free buffet, free cocktails, as well as several other free things and discounts. One of the every day deals that they had at their main restaurant was $9.99 for a 16oz prime rib steak dinner. That included choice of potatoe, salad, soup, and mushrooms. Since I stayed here before, they emailed me a special rate that worked out to be $20 per night during my stay. I must say that I would find it extremely difficult to find such a deal elsewhere. I always rent a car so the location was no problem. Don't believe some of the other reviews that say it take a half hour to an hour to get to the strip. It never took me longer than 10 to 15 minutes. However, once you reach MGM the traffic becomes very heavy and it can take a long time to drive from the MGM north along the strip. Renting a car is the best way to go if you want to see all that Las Vegas and the surounding area has to offer. There are great side trips you can do like to the Valley of Fire, Red Rock Canyon, or the Hoover Dam to name a few. In addition, there is another great Casino Resort that just opened up in Sumerlin called the Red Rock Resort and Casino. It only took me a half an hour to get there using the freeway from the South Point. In general you can discover a lot more about Las Vegas by not getting glued to staying on the strip. If staying on the strip is not your major concern, there is no doubt that you will be very happy staying at the South Point Casino and Hotel. It is a new gem in Vegas and I can tell you I will be making it back here to stay over and over again. In fact, I was told that there are plans for billions of dollars in development in this area that will lead to the area being know as the south strip in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you love smoke”
Reviews.Author: flexibleflier
Reviews.Content: This is one of those brand-new, but character-free hotels. I'm not one who's into themes, but a little ambience would have been nice. The casino was the smokiest I've seen in Las Vegas. It lacks the sophisticated air circulation that's appreciated in many of the strip casinos. Our clothing reeked of smoke the entire week because of this place. Even though our room was non-smoking, the hallways had a smoky odor as well. As for the rooms, yes, they are enormous, and if you can get past the sandpaper-like sheets, the beds are pretty comfortable. We also liked the flat-screen TV and the extra large bathroom. However, we hated that the windows didn't open to combat the dry, stale air. The pool area is pretty bare and looks like an afterthought on the hotel's part. Think astroturf and a few baby palm trees. South Point apparently finds it necessary to blast (and I mean BLAST) top 40 music, so if you're hoping to read a book or enjoy a tranquil, poolside nap, this is not the place. However, the pool itself is large and seems popular with the kiddies. If you like to work out, be prepared to fork over a $15 per-day spa fee. You see, the exercise room is part of the spa, and they don't care if you only want to use the treadmill. I opted to take a power walk around the local neighborhood, and it was free. I would also avoid the buffet unless you don't mind having to get up from your table to find someone to take your drink order. The hotel's 24-hour restaurant is also very mediocre. When we wanted to dine on a budget, we opted for Subway up the street. We are going to stay at The Orleans next time we come to Vegas. It's comparably priced, closer to the strip, and a far less aggravating experience.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Frugal_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night only, after a 2-week journey visiting national parks in the Southwest. We chose it because it is close to the Las Vegas air port and got good reviews on Trip Advisor. We got a Travelocity "Good Buy" rate of $88/night, including taxes. Considering the luxury quality of the room and bath, it was a great bargain. The staff was friendly and the hotel offers all the services you would expect of a Las Vegas hotel/casino. Only drawback was having to haul our luggage the long walk from the entrance, through the casino, to reach the elevators to the hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dhenahan5
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. I received an e-mail about this new hotel that had a great rate. We were amazed with the entire hotel. Our room was suburb. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly, helpful and bent over backwards to make our stay wonderful. The food was very good and reasonably priced. The shuttle to the strip was convenient. The drivers pointed out the sights to us and gave us some good information about the area. The spa was not open at the time, but I can't wait to try it out when we go back in 2007. Don't hesitate to stay at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “A new favorite in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: UndercoverAngel
Reviews.Content: Simply put, this is a fabulous establishment. The rooms are incredible with flat screen TV, tasteful design, large bathrooms, and very comfortable beds. The maids and maintainance here do their job well, as the rooms are clean and in perfect working order. The Italian restaurant on site (Don Vito's, I think) has fantastic food and service. It has been a long time since I had service that was this attentive. My waiter offered to box my dessert (I had a coupon for free dessert) so I could enjoy it in my room later. He included a cloth napkin and a real (non-plastic) fork. The manager on duty made rounds to make sure the customers were happy and was very appreciative when I told her how happy I was with the establishment. I also ate at the Mexican restaurant which was excellent and very affordable. I needed to make a bet for a friend at the sports book and the teller was happy to help me and answer several questions, which was greatly appreciated since I know very little about that kind of gambling (payoffs, etc). This facility seems to have everything you could want, and more, including a state-of-the-art bowling center and arcade for kids and/or the young at heart. The only negative (for some people) is that the location is several miles from the Strip. If this doesn't bother you, I urge you to try South Point on your next Vegas trip.

Reviews.Title: “So good in so many ways.”
Reviews.Author: MOTiger
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas at least 30 times so the lure of the strip or downtown areas isn't nearly as strong as it use to be. Though I would still recommend either of the two for first-timers, I'm now looking for something different. For my past few trips I've stayed at the Orleans, but for my recent trip I decided to try their (then) sister property, South Point. The South Point had everything I was looking for, and more. The rooms were as nicer or nicer than 90% of hotels I've stayed at (possible exceptions would be Rio & Venetian). I also liked the not too big/not too small size of the property. Navigating was quite easy, and it usually took no more than 3-4 minutes from parking the car to being in the room. I had two meals in their coffee shop, both of which were very good. I also had one of the best meals ever at their steakhouse. The casino was well lit, ventilated, and very comfortable in size. And as for me, the liked the fact that it was about a ten minute drive from the strip. The crowds have gotten way too big for my taste; I enjoyed the feeling of driving away from the masses at the end of the day. For what I'm looking for in a property the South Point exceeded all expectations. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: thmules
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! Yes, it's a little ways from the action, but that was the best part. We did rent a car..... Had no prblems driving to the strip and parking (valet) at any of the hotels. The rooms were spotless! Beds were cozy and it was quite. Everyone was very nice and helpful. There was even the World championship Salsa Dancing going on, but you wodn't have known it. We gambled a little, mostly nickle slots......didn't win but didn't lose much either. We visited some of the hotels on the strip. WOULD NOT STAY AT ANY OF THEM!!! Too many people! At South Point it was really only the people that stayed there. My only complaint is that the casino was some what smoking (I am a non smoker), but the rooms didn't smell of smoke. We are already looking forward to staying there next year.........

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jhnfrnkl
Reviews.Content: We were on our way to Reno air races and only stayed one night. Loved the entire stay, great room good food at a fair price, a lot to do on site besides gamble. Will stay again in December.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: bs4u2c
Reviews.Content: My wife and three kids stayed on Friday night for $110 . The room and bathroom was large and nice. The food at the buffet was average, Friday night dinner was $13 per person no break for kids, my kids were 11, 9, 7 so it was $70 for us to eat., some what pricy, but that was standard for Vegas. The only two drawbacks to the casino was it was a long ways from the south end of the strip, about 4 miles maybe more , and also there was no "on or off ramp" from the Interstate near the casino , so if you don't get off at the right exit you will have to go a number of miles out of your way to get back to South Point. If you don't plan on leaving the casino during your stay , then this is a nice casino and hotel. Without kids my wife I perfer to stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: fosseman
Reviews.Content: Great overall experience, It is a hidden treasure about five miles south of the strip. The rooms are amazing. It reminded of the rooms at the Bellagio, except fpr the bathroom area which is much smaller. Very large room with Flat Screen TV's. Staff was warm and friendly. Had one problem wioth Valet pulled up my car and asked to valet to park it. Three hours later I get a call from Valet saying that my car is still outside WITH the motor running. They tried to blame me for this error. Even though that kind of treatment is unacceptable I did not let it hinder my time at the hotel. I just booked to return over Christmas. The movie theatre and bowling alley are onsite for when your are done with the casino. This hotel caters to the locals so it is not difficult to get a machine or a drink as is the case with other hotels. Recommended!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but far out location”
Reviews.Author: go2sun
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I needed a sun break and got a great deal off Expedia for this hotel-3 nights and airfare for $300 each so I can't complain too much! I picked this hotel for the price and it catered more to families. The hotel rooms are great-spacious, super comfortable beds,great bathrooms. etc. We spent one night having room service (Chinese food is available off the reasonable priced room service menu!) and watching a in room movie. Yes there is a large movie theater but nothing we wanted to see. We did not bowl but my 6 year old loved the arcade. She did not want to go to Kids Time but it looked great with one of those large slide/tunnel things in it. She swam in the pool but even though it was upper 70's the pool was ice cold and unheated. There is 2 large hot tubs or a very cold pool! Tip-there is no food service at the pool and the restaurants do not do "to go". The only place to get food by the pool is to order take out from the deli around the corner from the ice cream parlor. The Garden Buffet is basically Dennys-yuch. The buffet at the Mirage was wonderful but it was $40 for 2 compared to $6 so you do get what you pay for! There was quite a few things to do with a 6 year old in Vegas-all on the strip which is a 20-25 minute drive. We saw a great dolphin show at the Mirage and the white tigers, Flamingos/birds at the Flamingo (free), the Shark Reef at the Mandalay, fashion shows at the Fashion Show mall (free). and the lions at the MGM (free). The first day we spent $75 in cab fare between the hotel, strip and airport so that adds on to the bargain room rate! The second day we got the shuttle schedule and location figured out. The shuttle lets you off at a central location on the strip-right across from Ballys so you can walk or take the bus. Don't take the monorail! It is $9 for 2 people. I usually stay at the Alladin because of it's central location but it is under construction. I really did not like being off strip and away from everything-just not worth the bargain rates!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: psiguy
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay Oct23-26th. Nice rooms, great tv, great view. Food was good, and cheaper than on the strip. Midnight specials were wonderful. Why not that extra star? 3 reasons: 1-shuttle service could be loads better. Even catching a cab from the casino is frustrating. 2-The shower head is huge, and gives a nice rainfall effect, but I prefer something with a tad more pressure. 3-service is friendly, but in the restaurants a bit too casual (slow), altho I thought the food was wonderful. I had little reason to go to other restaurants. The casino is bright, clean, and I loved it. My last visit had been to the Imperial Palace, and South Point is light years nicer. One comment: the clientele is a bit younger than on the strip. Lots of barely 21 year olds, it seemed. Would I stay again? You bet I would, without hesitation. But get shuttle schedules. Many thanks to everybody at the South Point for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Line Dancing Lessons on the Lido Deck (Cowboy Hats and Boots Required)”
Reviews.Author: Atlantic112006
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying at the South Point because I needed a hotel room for one night between my return from the Grand Canyon and my flight out of Las Vegas. For $69/night, it was a great deal. However, while the South Point was extremely clean and the rooms were huge, I really did not enjoy my stay at this hotel. First off, the South Point is located miles away from the Strip, and the difference is like night and day. The South Point is surrounded by strip malls and completely lacks the atmosphere of the Strip. Navigating the crazy parking lot was a challenge, since nothing clearly points you to where you should go to check in/register. Also, the clientele at the South Point just was not my type of scene. The hotel has an equestrian center, and apparently there was a rodeo at the hotel during my stay. The place was filled with cowboys (if you weren't wearing cowboy hats and boots, you were definitely in the minority). Between that and the constant country music being piped in over the speakers, we definitely felt like fish out of water. However, between the movie theater and bowling alley there are plenty of things to do (which you could also do in your hometown). If you are travelling with children, or want to go to Las Vegas and forget that you are in Las Vegas, then go to the South Point. Otherwise, I would not recommend that you stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are okay, service is terrible.”
Reviews.Author: issohio
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here if you are a non-smoker. I spent 3 nights in this hotel in a room that had the stench of cigarettes. I booked a non-smoking room 4 weeks in advance and paid in full. When I checked in the person at the front desk told me the only room available was smoking and basically take it or leave it. When I checked with the desk the next morning, I was told the same thing. The staff at this hotel could care less whether you enjoy your stay. It is also too far away from the main part of the strip. The hotel is fairly new and the food choices are okay. But if you're traveling to Vegas to enjoy the strip, stay on the strip not 5 miles off the strip. During busy times it can take an hour to get to the main casinos from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the South Point (formerly South Coast)”
Reviews.Author: Travelling-Buckeye
Reviews.Content: The South Point is GREAT (formerly South Coast). This is a big, new, very nice property several miles south of the Las Vegas strip. It has many of the advantages of the Strip hotels (good casino, restaurants, great pool), but is inexpensive, clean and has friendly staff. My room (I had to book a $185/night suite because they were almost sold out) was bigger than my first apartment. Everything is new. Everything is clean. The casino doesn't smell like smoke. The seafood bar in the lobby serves really good food. You'll see a LOT of locals here, which usually means a place offers good value. Plus - the place is family friendly. They have a bowling alley, a movie theatre, kids club, and an attached equestrian arena. Prices were very good ($60/night rooms if it isn't near sell-out, fair prices in the restaurants). If you want to be in Las Vegas without the overwhelming sensory overload of the Las Vegas Strip area, want to bring your family and want a good value, I highly recommend the South Point. They know how to build and operate a great casino hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the South Coast”
Reviews.Author: cindy.a.h
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property, large rooms with luxurious bedding. Great pool area, good food, quieter, more relaxing atmosphere. Only drawback is the distance from the main strip, you need a car or taxi, although they do provide a shuttle, it's not too often. I attended a conference and the facilities were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Love It!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer4525
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! I live in Vegas but have stayed here a few times with a friend and would recommend to everyone. In my personal opinion the rooms here are much nicer than standard rooms I have seen at the Palms, Rio, Luxor, Excalibur, MGM and much cheaper (although it is a bit aways from the "strip"). The rooms are beautiful and spacious. We got a room with a king bed and a couch. There are big flat screen TV's in each room which is a nice touch. The pool area is very nice. There is a lot to do here besides gambling so it might be good for families. Please note if you want to go clubbing you will have to head up to the strip. This hotel is on the south end of Las Vegas Blvd...a few miles from the strip but it can take up to an hour in traffic. If traveling to the strip it is much faster to jump on the 15N and get off at Flamingo or Spring Mtn (depends which casino you want to go). I am a local and avoid driving down Las Vegas Blvd / center strip area at all causes.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emma1975
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Southcoast as rates on strip for the week we were in town were incredibly high. The purpose of our trip to the US was to attend a conference on the East Coast but decided to transit in Vegas for a few days beforehand. My husband and I have been to Vegas several times, but this time we had invited his bosses to come along with us. Firstly, I must admit it, the location is a bit of a problem. Spending a good half an hour to get into the heart of the Strip each day was a bit of a time waster, but we had a decent car and the traffic wasn't too bad so we shouldn't complain too much. However, now we have experienced an off strip hotel, we definately prefer being in the thick of things. Upon arrival to the hotel there were no bell boys to help us with our luggage (we had 8 cases between the 4 of use). This was very different to an on strip hotel - bell boys come running when you arrive at the Paris, Venetian etc. Even after waiting a few moments no one came. We checked in and that was a breeze - the front desk staff accomodated my request for a low, non-smoking floor and provided us with the necessary information about the hotel. There is security at the elevators 24/7 so that is always comforting to know that not just anyone can roam the floors. Our room was extremely comfortable and very clean. The bathrooms were great and the water pressure was pretty good! The plasma is a nice touch! The gym was great - I purchased a 3 day pass (worked out cheaper than paying each day). There is plenty of equipment, water, towels and complimentary fruit. The spa was a bit on the pricey side so I didn't have any treatments. When we joined the Coast Club we were greeted by a man who told us about the breakfast that starts at midnight and runs until 9am! Old school Las Vegas breakfast. $1.25 for pancakes, eggs, you name it, it's there. We had to do it, just for the experience, and it wasn't bad at all. We also ate breakfast at the buffet one morning which was pretty good also. We used the 2 for 1 voucher from the fun book we were given at check-in. Slots were extremely tight - for me anyway. I did watch a few people having some big wins throughout my stay so they weren't tight for everyone! All in all, our experience at the South Coast was pretty good, however I doubt that we will return as we definately like the heart of the strip better. I would recommend this hotel to families with young kids or to people who just want to eat and gamble. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the South Coast”
Reviews.Author: dellis31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the South Coast at the end of September. We loved it. The rooms were very comfortable. The beds were to die for and my husband loved the flat screen T.V. We didn't win much so not sure if our luck was down or the slots were tight. The pool was very nice. All-in-all, a very nice stay. We rented a car but only used it to drive to the Flamingo then parked and took either the bus or monorail. The shuttles seemed to run on a regular basis.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melnq8
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at this hotel/casino in September 2006. Loved the big room with incredibly comfortable bed, plasma screen TV, and spacious bathroom with plenty of thick towels, two sinks, lots of counter space and nice amenities. Also liked the reading lights above the bed. We chose this hotel based on reviews we read here and the fact that it isn't in a busy area on the strip. We'd just arrived from Singapore and were looking for a quieter than average Vegas hotel. That's exactly what we got - parking and check in were a breeze, we didn't have to walk 5 miles to get to our room, and the room was a pleasant surprise. Clean, comfortable and alot nicer than other Vegas hotels we've stayed at in the past. Only complaint - we could have used a safe in our room. We spent alot of time in the hotel's casino, which was uncrowded and well ventilated. We dined at the Mexican restaurant, the cafe and the steakhouse. All were good and inexpensive. Had a light dinner at the deli too, but suggest avoiding that one. Paid an internet weekday rate of $69 and $89. Would definitely stay here again - this is our new favorite hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort (now called the South Point)”
Reviews.Author: AnnapolisMD
Reviews.Content: Stayed October 21-25 for a convention at the Las Vegas Convention Center. We chose this hotel because of Travel Advisor recommendations and we did not wish to be either in a chain hotel or a Strip hotel. 7 miles south of the strip and McCarran airport. In the center of newly built up area of nice strip shopping centers and condos and the outlets. Right off 15 on the southern extension of Las Vegas Blvd (the Strip). We booked two rooms at reasonable prices ($65 less per day Tuesday and Wednesday and $35 less on Monday than the weekend rate. It was also $90 a day per room less than the convention hotel's quoted rate. We spent our savings at two Cirque du Soleils and two great restaurants (Craftsteak and Bouchon). This is a family style resort that just happens to have a casino area. Decor is very bright reds and yellows and a lot of wrought iron in public areas. Earth toned large rooms with two queen beds, 42 in. HD TV in wall, adequate closet and drawer space, adjustable A/C. One room had a view of the high rise parking garage but absolutely no noise; the other was pool view and occupants "felt the beat" (whether they wanted to or not) of the band playing on the pool deck for a convention. Could not hear neighbors or hallway noise.Toilet and shower in separate room from double vanity helped with privacy for two unrelated women sharing a room for the convention. .Positives: It was built in December 2005 and was the most pristine establishment I have ever seen. The finish workmanship, from painting to carpeting, was super (from someone in the trades). Good buffets at $6.49 or less before using two for one coupons; $9.99 T bone and prime rib that are thick and cooked to order. $1.25 breakfast but watch those $2 juices and cups of coffee as it does run up. Bingo hall, child care, bowling alley, saw a movie on one of their 12 movie screens with a remarkable selection of snacks (including Starbucks and free popcorn). Free drink tickets for those who drink alcohol and assorted discounts on all other amenities. We were surprised to see an indoor equestrian center that rivals any smaller university fieldhouse: immaculate, and we got to see the Clydesdales and take in a Paint horse (like Tonto's) western riding competition with the participants in their sequined body suits and some phenomenally well trained horses (and it was FREE!). Highlight of our non-gambling trip! Great pillows, great sheets, great pool with huge jacuzzi, separate children's area, sand volleyball court; Seattle's Best shop and an ice cream parlor, and security that checks room cards before allowing anyone into the hotel section. (And also opened wine bottles with cheap corkscrews for two of our party!). Oh, and the Spa and Kevin, a super massage therapist. All staff, from the waitress in the coffee shop to Jaime in the buffet to the movie's ticket person and concessions cashier, bell desk help and the bartender in the casino bar were nice and helpful at all times (we even had great cab drivers). You get disoriented in big, bright casinos and they directed us all over. And everyone had recommendations about sights that were solidly good. All the tours can pick up at the hotel and our group really enjoyed the Hoover Dam/Lake Mead cruise and Ethel M (local chocolates--this is the home of M and Ms) visit. Negatives: Not enough soap for two people; no concierge service for tickets for things not at South Coast (there is a travel agency that can book and not sure of service charge but there was only one staff member and a line). We did not care at all for the surly personnel on the free airport shuttle (one kicked us off the airport shuttle and strode toward the casino saying he was calling Security when we got in the van, even while holding up our room key cards--we had no idea we needed reservations to ride--figured it was the SC's misguided adherence to terrorist levels). The shuttle to the Strip was slightly better but not everyone is interested in 20 minutes of Christian commentary and a driver who never even turned to acknowledge us, not to mention be pleasant). $25 fare (with trip) each way to the most southerly sections of the Strip (lotsa traffic but all the strip hotels have parking and it would be a lot cheaper to drive one's own car but maybe not so to rent a car). Limited TV channels for those who neither watch sports nor gamble and something was wrong with the in room movie set up. Hair dryer blew up but was fixed promptly. The day before we left the hotel was bought back by its creator and all the slot functions were shut down from evening until midday. Overnight all signage was changed. The staff seemed to like the previous owner and was very relaxed. However, I am sure there were people who had come down to hit the slots (there were lots of local people there) and it would have been disappointing to them. There must be a reason why it wasn't announced in at least a posted sign. This hotel offers great value for not much money in a perfectly safe and family-oriented area. I surely hope it is successful. We were amazed at the friendliness of all the Nevada residents we met and would surely recommend this as a fine trip for those who don't even gamble (check out the Neon Museum and the Atom Bomb Testing museum). Annapolis, Maryland

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value, Too Far from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Sandi_r_k
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the South Coast a couple of weeks ago, and rooms were hard to come by in Vegas for under $300 a night (the UFC was in town, as well as two conventions). We booked on hotels.com, and got the Saturday for $149 and Sunday for $89. The room was nice - two Qn beds with nice linens, a plasma TV, a good sized bathroom. One nice touch was the clock radio that had an AUX connector to pipe your iPod through the radio speaker. Big disappointment with the room was that there was no in-room fridge. The in-room coffee maker had a "disposable" coffee filter tray, which I missed on Day One (I thought a part was missing from the coffee maker). Another nice touch: we got a coupon booklet upon checkin that contained free drink coupons, BOGO entree coupons, BOGO ice cream sundaes...we used a couple of drink coupons, but that was about it. It's obvious that they're marketing couples with kids, with the arcade, movie theater and bowling alley on site. We spent some time at the pool area (which had towels, a cafe, a jacuzzi, a wading pool, an outdoor shower, and a volleyball court). Unfortunately, they closed it early (at 6 pm!) for private parties on both Saturday and Sunday nights. Finally, the hotel itself was WAY further from the real Strip than the website leads you to believe. It took us nearly an hour from the hotel to the Paris on Saturday night, even though we set out for the Paris early - at 5:45 pm! Overall, if there's nothing else available, it's a decent enough place to stay - but if you're looking for easy access to the Strip, this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “A Winner!!”
Reviews.Author: lifeisgr8
Reviews.Content: True to the reviews, this was a great hotel; new, clean, nicely appointed rooms and a great casino! We had the lowest priced room available with a view of a blank wall but over the top of the wall you could see some mountains. The room was very clean and plenty big for two. Bathroom was nice with a seperate tub/toilet area with a it's own phone and a door, two sinks, plenty of towels and toiletries. Self park was a breeze and we rented a PT Cruiser from Dollar for $57 total for our stay. The hotel is farther south of the strip than I realized but it wasn't an issue. Hop on Interstate 15 to get to The Strip in no time. All the big hotels have free self parking. We ate at the cafe and the Italian restaurant in the hotel. Both were good but I would stick to breakfast or lunch for the cafe. Was suprised to find a huge movie theater in the hotel! We used our free popcorn coupon and saw a movie. The casino was great!! Lots of penny and nickel slots and low limit Roulette ( 5 x $1 bets) and Black Jack ($5)tables with friendly dealers. I left with $700 from the penny and nickel slots! Will surely stay here again. I am told that they are changing the name to South Point in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, but a long way from the action.”
Reviews.Author: downey
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 2 nights at South Coast (name is changing to South Point next week). All logo merchandise is 1/2 price till sold out. The rooms are very large and being new they are in great condition. The pool and especially the whirl pool are very nice. If you are looking for good accommodation way off the Strip then this is the place. They have a free shuttle but it takes 1/2 hour each way plus waiting in line, allow 45 min each way. Best deal from 12 midnight to 9:00 am - New York steak, eggs, hasbrowns and toast for $2.95.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the South Coast!”
Reviews.Author: NEPATraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the South Coast for the weekend of 10/6-10/8. We checked in early (1:00) with no problem. We had booked 3 rooms and we all on the same floor in close proximity as requested. Rooms were outstanding in both cleanliness and furnishings. My wife loved the linens and the comfort of the mattress. We were on a high floor and never had to wait for an elevator. We had an early check-out on Sunday and the bellman was there within 3-4 minutes. We ate at both the Buffet and the Coronado Cafe, both were fine. The pool area is very nice, the weather was warm enough to give it a try and we loved it. My wife and mother in law both won at the slots, one of the few places we did. We had a rental car so the strip was just a short drive, no problems there. The rooms and service were both outstanding, we will be returning!!

Reviews.Title: “South Coast is nice & relaxing...”
Reviews.Author: black_dobe
Reviews.Content: -South Coast Hotel-What a great room.Nice and clean hotel/casino. We will definitely stay here again. Fast check-in/out. We had a rental car and it was only 5-10 minutes S of the strip. Actually, we got off at the Silverton exit and shopped at the Bass Pro Shop. The coupon book saved us money on lots of stuff. Because they're changing their name soon, everything with their logo on it is 1/2 price in the gift shop, plus we ended up with money from our players card we could use there too. The pool looked great, we just couldn't fit it into our schedule.The casino was never full, the whole atmosphere is much more relaxed than on the strip. The buffet was ok, the Coranado cafe was reasonably priced with nice big servings. We went bowling and played 6 games, $13.00US which included 2 pair shoe rentals and 3 free games. I never did get the hang of sticking my fingers in the ball holes. I had to yell watch out once, when the ball started to slip out off my fingers in the middle of a throw! We'd never used the computerized score keeper before, and felt like idiots having to ask how to set it up so we could start playing! Oh well, now we know! They had all kinds of movie theatres there, but we didn't see anything we wanted to view. The buttered popcorn smell I'm sure was being pumped into the casino hallways! South Coast has an awesome equestrian centre, which was hosting a cutting horse competition. It was interesting to look out our hotel window and see pens filled with cattle just yards from the I-15! I can't say enough about the room. Nice and large, bright, great linen bedding..the bathroom was huge. Book it with confidence!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and great vibe!”
Reviews.Author: sonnysats
Reviews.Content: Great place. Still new so everything is clean and nice. The wall mounted TVs give you more room and look great. The only drawback is that it's further from the strip than we prefer, but it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “nice change from typical Vegas hotels”
Reviews.Author: Corgimom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the South Coast for three days recently during our conference held at the property. The hotel is very far south of the strip and the drive takes at least ten minutes or more to reach Mandalay Bay/MGM. They have a free shuttle to Barbary Coast and the airport but get to the shuttle stop early - it was always full (we did manage to get a seat each time). You need to make reservations for the airport shuttle by calling the front desk. The hotel isn't any particular "theme" and doesn't go to any great lengths on decor, so you can get lost in the sea of slot machines if you aren't careful. I wish they would have located the front desk of the hotel anywhere else except on the slot floor. We didn't have much of a wait during our check in, but it was 3pm on a Sunday. The room rate was very reasonable at $89.00. The hotel portion of the South Coast is great. There is a guard near the elevators checking room keys, and there are two elevator banks, one for lower floors and one for upper floors, so we never had to wait even one minute for an elevator. The rooms are a nice size and the beds/linens were great. The plasma screen TV is awesome, as is the huge picture window overlooking the mountains. The only thing I thought could be improved is the slightly cheap looking furniture (table.chairs/sofa), but it was typical motel stuff, not bad. The bathrooms and toiletry products were great. They have a shower head similar to the "heavenly shower by Westin". During our stay, the water pressure and temperature were fine. The South Coast has a wonderful pool and hottub area just off the elevator bank. The hot tub is warm and has plenty of jets - it is in a circle around an island, so you don't have to sit and stare at the folks across the tub from you - nice. The pool is very large but was too cold for an October afternoon. We didn't try the bowling alley or theater, but those are nice options if gambling is not your thing. We ate at Coronado Cafe and Don Vitos and both had good food with decent service. The Del Mar Deli had OK sandwiches, but they also had an awesome selection of desserts if you want a sweet treat. There is an ice cream parlor near the front door, next to the Coffee Bar (which closed at 9pm, a ridiculous thing for a casino). Most of the slots are new penny or nickel slots with a few dollars scattered here and there. Tons of video poker (we won a progressive Deuces Wild jackpot during our visit) and we played on the huge new Wheel of Fortune multi-player slot for hours without putting in more money. I saw many people playing on lots of credits, so I think the slots were pretty loose, although I didn't see any "big" winners. They have many $5 table games and a small poker room. The conference center was nicely appointed and the food was good. The management team seemed a bit disorganized, however, and we learned this hotel was recently sold and will soon be the South Pointe. They weren't really interested rebooking our small meeting again, even though the exhibit hall was completely empty Sunday - Wednesday, so I think the sales team here may be one of the reasons the hotel is considered to be "underperforming" by Vegas standards. This is a locals hotel and would be a good spot to retain smaller meetings, yet they are trying to sell it like the Venetian, Too bad, it was a good fit for us, but we probably won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: DonG20t
Reviews.Content: Decided to stayed at the South Coast casino for a little weekend getaway with the wife. I visit Vegas 6+ times a year and have stayed at most of the strip hotels from THE HOTEL to the Tropicana. We booked their SPA deal from their website and got a 2 for 1 massage ($100 total). The room was very nice and clean. 42" plasma in the room was a nice touch, small couch (not sleeper), round table w/2 chairs and spacious bathroom. Tub was small, so you can't bath, but big enough for a good shower. The casino area is a nice size and there were plenty of card tables as well as slots. The hotel has a good buffet (lunch = $8) and service was good. Pool was small, but great. It had a nice atmosphere and a separate area for the hot tub. There was a nice mix of adults and kids and did not feel like a LOCAL hang out like Hard Rock hotel. The SPA was good for the price we paid. If you do not get a treatment at the spa, they do charge ($15/day) if you would like to use the gym and spa. Hotel has a bowling alley and theather (which I did not see). Apparently the hotel will have a name change because all the South Coast logo items at the gift shop was 50% off. Overall, very nice hotel and would definitely stay again. People, just be warned that the hotel is a good distance from the strip so a car is definitely needed (not in walking distance). There is a shuttle, but from other reviewer it does not run that often or conveniently. Don S.

Reviews.Title: “good value in vegas”
Reviews.Author: dacarr
Reviews.Content: Got an incredible air/hotel/car deal from Expedia to allow us to stay at the South Coast in Oct. 06 for hundreds less than in the action of the strip, so it was worth driving to the strip when we wanted to. The South Coast is a few miles past Mandalay Bay, still on Las Vegas Blvd. It is a new resort,perfect for a family or couple.The rooms are larger than most on the strip,and come with a large flat screen t.v.,plush serta matresses & anchini linnens.They have a sitting area,large closet (w/iron & board) a bath with granite counter & seperate toilet/shower, hi-speed internet connection. The resort includes : a casino, a large pool & hot tubs, a spa, a large equestrian/events center,60 lane bowling alley,16 screen movie theater, onsite child care center, and several restaurants. I would advise upon arrival that you use the free valet parking. It has easy access to reservation/check in-then not too far to elevators to the rooms. After you have checked in, its not too bad to use the self parking the next time you park ,since you are not dragging your luggage thru the casino. We had good drink service at the tables and machines, and the machines even paid a little. The elevators are quick-never had to wait for one (even though we were on the 24th floor) Although this resort/casino does not have the "oh & awe" of seeing the lights of the strip out your window, it does have much easier access (dont have to fight strip traffic every time you leave resort in you car) and they have a free shuttle to the strip (to Barbary Coast) It appears that Boyd Gaming is selling this casino back to the original developer soon, and apparently will change the name to South Pointe, but will still be affiliated so you can continue to use your Coast Club card.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best Vegas experiences.”
Reviews.Author: giftedtobe
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a 1 bedroom suite at South Coast this past weekend. Check in took approximately 15 minutes. Though the casino was a little smoky, I didn't come home with my clothes smelly like I have in other hotels. The staff was cordial. The housekeeping staff on my floor was friendly and attentive. As for the room....I didn't want to leave after a 4 night stay. It was prettier than the website; I had decorations for a wedding reception and didn't need to use half of them. Clean room, sheets felt like heaven when I first laid on them. Gorgeous bathroom; we had all our guests come in to see it. My family stayed in the regular rooms and also had no complaints. We had to go up to the strip for our wedding ceremony; the hotel was crowded, the people were obnoxious and although the ceremony was beautiful, we couldn't wait to get back to Southcoast. We had a party of 14 for dinner at the Silverado steakhouse. Usually, when there is a larger party involved, something is bound to go awry. Not only was all the food served at the same time, it was also hot. No incorrect orders, and the taste and quality was exceptional for the price. Coronado cafe had good food and Baja Miguels is a must if you like Mexican food. I didn't gamble, but between 3 relatives, the take was over 1000 dollars. My relatives and I can't wait to go back ! I have a couple of suggestions; the suites have a refrigerator, but need a small microwave too. An on site wedding chapel would have been great; I saw at least four other brides during my stay. Very pleased overall.

Reviews.Title: “my wife wants to come back in dec, loves south coast”
Reviews.Author: tripper69
Reviews.Content: great stay recommend the mountain view ,

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot!”
Reviews.Author: JennJeff
Reviews.Content: I had never travelled to Las Vegas and I wanted to share what a wonderful experience we had at the South Coast. The room was very spacious and clean. The bed was extra comfy. We had a very nice view of the mountains. Plasma TV was awesome. The only complaint that I could possibly come up with was the water pressure was not very good. The staff was very friendly and courteous. The Garden Buffet and the Coronado Cafe both were very reasonably priced and the food was excellent. The slots were pretty tight I have to admit. I lost more than I care to mention... Overall, we had a wonderful vacation!! -J. Forrest, Richmond Va.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: TXGrayLady
Reviews.Content: It was nice to be off the main strip, the hotel was clean and most people friendly, but the interminable wait to check in dampened our experience from the first. The whole place seemed understaffed - there were waits for tables even though there were plenty of empty ones, we couldn't get the front desk to pick up the phone, and our room was not cleaned until just before we left for dinner. Nothing was replenished in our room except for towels - no coffee or soap, etc. The food at Baja Miguel's and the buffet were barely adequate, and the lunch at the Oyster Bar was inedible. At check out we noticed we had been charged for 3 days of Internet service though we had only been there two days. They did take the charge off, but it was an irritation after the poor service. We paid too much for our rooms for what we got, even in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: mwase54
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas 4 to 5 times per year and have always stayed at the Luxor (which is always our favorite), but this last time we decided to try a new place. We searched and found some great rates for a weekend at the Southcoast and booked it. We drove to Vegas from San Diego, and as we approached Vegas we saw the Southcoast! It is beautiful. The only problem was it seemed like miles from the Strip. Having never stayed off the strip before we were somewhat dissapointed. Check-in was quick, friendly, and we were just amazed at the room!!! It was HUGE, with comfy beds, huge flat screen TV, and probably the best bathroom set up I have ever seen. The soaps and toiletries were great and replenished every day! The room is reason enough to stay here, and the hotels strongest point The spa was great and very relaxing and uncrowded. They have individual tubs that shoot water on you from the ceiling! Very cool. The pool was nice, although very plain. We liked how close it was to the elevators. We spent most of the time on the strip at Wynn, Bellagio, Mirage, etc. The drive back to the "coast" wasn't too bad, but it felt a little wierd not being on the strip while in Vegas. That is the only drawback of the hotel- and the only reason we may not make this our favorite hotel in Vegas. Overall, great rooms, but too far from the strip. I would highly recommend it for those who don't mind a small drive!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: christogolfer
Reviews.Content: We just got back after spending 4 nights. We loved the hotel and would stay here again. Taxi fare to south strip (mandalay bay) ran about $17.00. We used the shuttle to Barbary Coast extensively and it was somewhat efficient. The buffet was average and the slots seemed a little tight. The room was VERY roomy and quite clean and nice. Elevators were SPEEDY. Hot tub area was beautiful. Roulette was $1.00 minimum bet and we had fun with that. We had no complaint at all with the hotel service. Drink service was decent, and the cocktail waitress were all very attractive.

Reviews.Title: “It's not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Knotachan
Reviews.Content: My husband, a racer in the International Indoor Champion RC car race being held at the hotel, our 15 year old and myself stayed for about a week. The hotel overall is nice and I was glad for the arcade, bowling alley, and theater to keep the 15 year old busy. However I did have 3 complaints about the facilities. 1. On the website and in the hotel room South Coast mentions having a 24 hour fitness center, well the true was the fitness center was only open from 6am to 8pm AND costed $15 per day or $39 for three days to use (funny how that fee is no where in print). This was not mentioned until after we had been there almost a week and have been in and out of the fitness center many times. 2. Vegas is suppose to be cheap when it comes to eating a good meal, however, the food at the Garden Buffet, Del-Mar, and Baja Miguel's was pricey and substandard. 3. The water pressure was not consistent and it sucked trying to take a shower with the water pressure changing ever 30 seconds or so. Also there was no hot water on our second day and everyone ended up taking cold showers (something about a broken pipe??). The only reason I would stay again would be if the next year's IIC is being held there, otherwise we will stay somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Not for handicapped guests”
Reviews.Author: shelsgram
Reviews.Content: The Southcoast is a wonderful new hotel; however, it is not set up for handicapped guests. We stayed there for 4 nights in August, 2006. I booked it after reading all of the positive reviews. It was very far from the main part of the strip but we knew that and had a rental car. Since this was the tail end of a two week vacation and family reunion out west, we were in and out of our car a lot with armloads of things. My husband has difficulty walking long distances. If we parked in the garage, we had to take the elevator down to the main level and then walk across the entire casino to get to the hotel elevators (carrying our things, no less). If we parked in front of the casino, we still had to walk across the entire casino to get to the hotel elevators. Everything else was fabulous at the Southcoast but we both agreed that we'd go back downtown next time where everything is convenient and close by.

Reviews.Title: “Child friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kremer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family members. Parents loved the" Kids Tyme "which is an excellent supervised Hourly Child Care Program in kid friendly surroundings, well away from the Casino area. The Hotel opened in Dec 05 and the rooms and corridors are spacious and nicely decorated. My only major concern was the smoke filled environment in the Casino on the Friday nite I was there. For a new Hotel the air quality for a non smoker was prohibitive and forced us out of the Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: masonman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at South Coast at the end of August, 2006. Brought our kids aged 7 and 5 and couldn't believe how nice the stay turned out. First of all, the geography as background. South Coast is 6 miles south of the McArren International Airport. It was interesting that when we got on the taxi after the millions of other people seeking cabs, we were probably the only ones heading "South". All the strip, downtown, East and West casinos are North of McArren. Felt an interesting tinge of concern mixed with anticipation, as all the glitter that used to represent Vegas to me faded in the opposite direction and the open road unwound in front of us. The only other major casino down in that area is the Silverton which has a huge Bass Pro Shop attached to it. Think about that, other cities are sprawling away from their nucleus, Vegas is sprawling into the nucleus. The opportunities to do more out in the "open space" is fantastic. Witness the Bass Pro Shop at Silverton or the Orleans Arena at Orleans and it makes unbelievable amounts of sense for more of the big money to build resorts a little further from the strip. Currently, Wynn, MGM, Las Vegas Sands, etc. are pumping billions into that magnificent four miles guaranteeing that the strip will always be the strip or at least for the foreseeable future. Given the land availability you wonder how much longer until that changes, the Barnes and Nobles, Best Buys, PF Changs and Walgreens of the world are learning to use the open land to their advantage all across the country and build out the burbs. Vegas, which is always unique is the only city where all the new investment dollars are piling into this little strip, even if they have to build highrises, witness the new million dollar condo high rises on the strip. The reasons I provide this tangential background are twofold- to provide a frame of reference for the incredible things that an off strip property is able to do because of cheaper real estate and more room to do it with and particularly because they have to be better to get you to stay that far away from the rest of the action. South Coast (soon to be re-christened South Pointe) goes the extra mile to please. The rooms are very large and all have flat panel 42 inch TVs, the beds are comfortable, the bathrooms are spacious with a separate door area to the commode for privacy. How much did we pay for some of the best standard rooms in Las Vegas? They could have easily gone for $150 a night at center strip properties, but our rooms were $42 a night on Monday and Tuesday, probably more on weekends, etc. Pulling up to the property you can appreciate its behemoth size and nice architectural design. Ample parking everywhere and regular shuttles to airport, LV strip and Gold Coast, etc. The swimming pool was awesome with a unique lazy river hot tub and palm trees. When we got there they were running a promotion and gave us a whole bunch of free tee shirts. The bowling alley has state of the art computer equipment and is a blast, the kids arcade was a huge highlight for our two little ones. They also have a large day care center which we never needed because we were having so much fun with the kids, but would have been nice to take advantage of in certain times. Buffet was stellar, great selection and half off coupons in the fun book. Plus kids were half off. The four of us ate ourselves absolutely silly for a total including tax and tips of $20. They also had nice bottles of wine for $6 a bottle. Funbooks are great and have discounts on the food, cocktails, gift shop, bowling, etc. The fried chicken , sweet and sour chicken, salads, pastas, seafood, and deserts were all good. Later we went to the strip and had a blast seeing Flamingo, Bellagio fountains and "all that jazz" but to be honest most of our best memories of this trip were created right at the good old South Coast. The shuttle was easy to catch and a nice rest spot between walks. The strip has a lot of great stuff but to be honest is getting too crowded and congested. With Kerkorian, Boyd and company building all these condos (and these men are legendary geniuses of this city so they will do well) but the point being the crowded and noise factors of the strip will eventually drive continued construction in the South, Boulder Strip etc. as more and more people like us who love Vegas but get to tired trying to navigate the strip, find out you can have all the fun of Vegas at one third the price, just a few short miles away from all that neon. The one place that is the worst on the strip is Caesars Palace which has mind numbing arrays of shopping,entertainment, and so on and is unbelievable but consistently takes at least three hours (no exaggeration) to get from one end to the other of the property. This is another fabulous feature of the South Coast. You walk in and check out is right there, then the Casino, Seattle's Best Coffee all the restaurants etc. so amazingly easy to navigate and the bowling, movie theaters, child care ,etc. is right up one easy escalator. The people working at the casino are basically friendly and one guy from San Diego working at the Casino bar was very friendly and smiled the whole time. This place really makes you feel at home. Stay there and you'll never want to go back to the strip to stay again. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Families with kids - Read this!”
Reviews.Author: ExRIGuy
Reviews.Content: I would advise that you stay in a non-casino hotel. This place is clean and new (but also industrial feeling - like the pool area especially - not cozy or warm at all). You have to walk for miles it seems through the huge casino to get to the hotel elevators. You cannot park close to the hotel portion, period! The parking is a major pain - long valet lines or long walks-take your pick. At any rate, they charge for everything, no fridge in the room etc. Again, with kids - if a nice pool is all that matters to you - then stay at a HI Express or something without a casino as they are all laid out the same. This place is a major hassle with young kids and the pool isn't that great. Bowling alley and playzone indoors is neat though, to be fair.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it at the South Coast!”
Reviews.Author: mesogirly
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the SouthCoast hotel and Casino for only 2 nights (Sept.8 and 9, 2006). We were celebrating his 30th birthday and neither of us had ever visited Las Vegas. I had a ton of friends that had and they gave us recommendations of places to stay. I chose the SouthCoast because of the appearance via the internet. I thought the things they offered was a good deal. I booked through hotels.com and I didn't get the low rates that I see listed now or the other reviews have boasted about. In any case it was still worth it to me. I see that in looking at the reviews you have to be extremely careful because most people seem to pick apart every little thing. I would be curious to see some of the homes if they judge the hotels so critically :-).... The overall appearance was very nice and we found the registration attendants to be kind enough and everyone we asked for direction or assistance seemed to be more than willing to assist. Well, other than one of the shuttle bus drivers but maybe he was tired. No excuse, but I wasn't there to make friends with him rather to get a ride to the strip. I enjoyed the food at Baja Miguels and the Garden buffet and YES-use the coupons. I especially enjoyed the free margarita at Baja Miguels and everything we ordered was tasty. The pool was nice enough and while we were there the weather was GREAT... The room was huge (the King size bed) and the bathroom made 2 of mine here at home. My boyfriend enjoyed the fact that you really didn't have to leave the hotel for anything because the gaming tables were there and he was able to join in a poker tournament onsite. I didn't think to ask to be upgraded and I didn't know about getting a fridge in the room for an extra cost but I do now. In terms of transportation I would say that more shuttles should be added and definitely more available times. We rode the shuttle twice (to and from the strip) and then once on the strip we jumped on the bus (the deuce). Once we were leaving we found out the trolley was right across the street and an all day pass was only $6.50 which is not bad. The trolley goes all the way up to the north side of the strip which isn't bad at all. We could have rented a car but I think that would have been a waste. We are in the process for booking another stay for longer and at the South Coast. It truly depends on what you expect in a hotel and the things you would like to do. If you want to be near the action then SouthCoast is not for you. Personally all of those people would drive me CRAZY! I can't wait to go back to enjoy the spa and the gym (by next year those things should be available for use) and oh yeah (the hallway on my floor was freezing. I ran to my room each time, but I wasn't home and you can't please everyone. I was ok with that. Enjoy if you decide to go!

Reviews.Title: “First time visitors fall in love with Vegas”
Reviews.Author: wolfman231
Reviews.Content: We booked a 5 night stay based on online reviews of the South Coast. I debated staying at a more expensive strip hotel...didn't want a bad experience just to save a few dollars. The hotel exceeded our expectations...the worst thing I can nitpick about is one bad cup of coffee at Seattle's Best coffee shop. Comfortable bed, plasma TV, clean, safe, great pool/hot tub (couldn't get my wife out), nice employees and guests, etc. A 10 minute chat with one of the security guards gave us an insider's view of the town (best buffets, shows, attractions.) Thanks Dave! The Jerry Lewis telethon for MD was televised from the hotel during our stay...but we weren't inconvenienced at all...it was cool to see some of Jerry's kids having as much fun at the pool as we were. Even convenient in-room checkout on the plasma TV... Definitely an excellent value...we'll be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, staff needs work”
Reviews.Author: mutigerbell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Aug 24-27. This place is new and very nice. Rooms are large with a flat screen tv that takes away the need for a large canibet to hold the tv. We were there for a convention and found it to be nice. The staff howeve need some traing, not many were friendly or helpful. We took the shuttle which was free downtown and with only one going to have to wait several times late at night to be picked up or pay $20 for a taxi back! We had one driver on Fri night that slammed the door in peoples faces saying the bus was full and they would have to wait at least an hour for his return.
