Upon closing door, he told everyone on the bus he loved telling people that-VERY RUDE. They need to add a couple shuttles to the route as you have to go to the strip for everything. Its several miles and expensive if you take a cab. The hotel is nice and clean however.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: TNDTJ
Reviews.Content: Had a thoroughly enjoyable stay at the South Coast. I doubt you will find something at a better price that is as nice as this. We were able to find less expensive rates on the Internet and when we mentioned it, the hotel matched the rate. The room was new, clean, and a really nice size. The bathroom was perfect although the water pressure could have been better. Loved the big screen TV (for as much as we watched TV). If you’re visiting Las Vegas for the first time, I might recommend staying on the strip if budget allows since there is nothing to do close to the hotel without driving or taking the shuttle. Buffet is very good for breakfast (we used the coupons they give at check in which made it a great bargain) but would not recommend for lunch or dinner. Don Vito’s was a great place for dinner (coupon also available for this restaurant) – very good food, nice wine list, great service. If you have a chance, go the lobby bar Wednesday – Saturday evening and catch the dueling pianos. They will sing almost whatever you request (and they can be really funny too). We had a blast and ended up there several evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Selected due to price and price only ...”
Reviews.Author: koolchas
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the South Coast for a few days in mid-August. Needing a well deserved short get-a-way from So-Cal, it was either stay a night a two (on the strip) or stay for three nights at the South Coast. Well, at under $50/night we booked at the South Coast - priced well below "better" hotels on the strip. On check in, I casually asked if we can be upgraded to a "suite." For $50, we were upgraded. I tried to negotiate that down but, they said due the low rate I got, it was $50. At first, I thought it was per night but, it was only $50 for all three nights ... still very cheap price wise. The hotel is nice and the best part; still new. We are not smokers and our child is never around smokers. So, the hotel did not have that smoke-filled aroma that dominates a lot of older hotels (we took the kid to the Nascar Cafe to eat on the strip and while eating everyone's eyes were turning red and burning due to cigarette smoke). The layout of the suite was kinda wierd to me. The flat screens were nice but, watching it in the seating area was not really comfortable as the screen is about 6ft from the couch (basically, it is to close because the area is narrow). The bedroom and bathroom are very nice. Just very clean and simple. But, you won't get the "Wow" factor by the decor as compared to the better hotels on the strip. The suite only had one bed so, we had to get a rollaway bed which was very small and NOT comfortable. The only way to get two beds is to have a standard room which in the end we may have been better off having vs upgrading. I did have issue with the A/C system. During our nights of sleep I was awakened by loud sounds coming from the A/C unit; it was very loud. Each time the A/C would kick on it would make loud sounds; something like someone was banging on something inside the air duct. The pool area did not impress me. The main pool is very shallow - i think the deepest part is 4'. The large hot tub is nice but, we noticed the water was comfortable on Sunday but, very hot on Monday since the waterfall part was not running. Also, it seemed like more people were in the hot tub than in the main pool so; I can only imagine how crowded it could be on a Saturday. We found "service" to be terrible at the pool. We were told "someone" was to walk around and take orders for drinks and food; we even got a menu from this area where you can get drinks (but, not food). Both days we were in the pool area not once did somebody come out and each time were in the pool area for 3 hours. Also, there is lots of construction going on so there was a lot of consistant loud banging and foot traffic from employees who I guess were setting up the gym/spa area; which was not open during out stay. The bowling alley did impress me. It was very large and not what I would expect. The only issue is that there are only a limited number of lanes at times because there is league bowling events. So, the bowling alley and even the cheap after midnight prices are open to everybody; meaning if you want to have fun bowling you don't have to stay there to do it. We were on the 23rd floor and one thing I did notice was that the same cigarette butt and wine glass was left in the hallway for two days. Also, on check in, the hallway was very hot. Even air blowing out the vents was hot. On the next days, the reverse happened, the air was freezing cold. They were also doing a test of the backup generators the morning of our checkout but, luckily that did not affect us since we drove in to Vegas and did not have to get up early to catch a taxi and/or plane at the airport. As everyone states do get the Fun Book. We used it to get a free drink, the two for one ice cream sundae, the free bowling games, and on check out we used it for the Breakfast Buffet which I actually thought was pretty decent with many options for the money; $18 for three adults and one child. The Coronado Cafe is good too. We had breakfast there one morning only. We tried the late night thing but, being tired we decided not to because even past midnight, there was a line of people waiting to be seated/get in! But, since the hotel is near the Las Vegas Outlets there are many outside choices to eat. There is even a Food 4 Less although if you want a fridge in your room it's $15/night. Personally, if we could spend $100-200+/night, I would have stayed somewhere else. The majority of our time was away from the hotel either on the strip or shopping. If staying somewhere else and had to the urge to bowl, I'd make a visit there to do it. Even at $100/night, if you get a room at the Luxor, Mandalay Bay, or MGM Grand, I think overall you'll be more satisfied vs. paying $50/night at The South Coast. If you have kids, Mandalay Bay or MGM just have better pools for them and the immediate area will have "more" for them to do.

Reviews.Title: “unorganized hotel”
Reviews.Author: enyioma
Reviews.Content: My best friend, her boyfriend and I check into the South Coast hotel on Thurs. Aug 23,2006. The appearance of the hotel was nice. The casino was spacious with not alot of cigarrette smoke. The room was nice with a beautiful bathroom. I was upset about the gym and the spa not being available for me to work out and relax. I had to go to a local gym a few miles from the hotel. I asked them the reason and they told me that it needed to get it's final approval which would be at the beginning of Sept. On Friday and Sunday the electricity and the water was cut off I could not use the bathroom for at least one hour which was an inconvience for me. They did this to test the back up generator which should have been done before the hotel open up. On Saturday, we order for room service. They made a mistake and went to the wrong room. We had two rooms. They were suppose to come to my friends room which was across from my room. They came to my room and I was not there. Room service knew that we had 2 rooms. They did not attempt to try the other room across. They said that they knock on my friend's door, but my friend's boyfriend was in the room all day waiting for the food and did not hear anyone knock on the door. They threw the food away. We asked them if they could bring us another breakfast and they said that it would take another 1 hour. We decided to go to I Hop, located 3 miles from the hotel. On Saturday the hotel had a concert which was located at the pool. Everyone had to leave the pool at 3:00pm so that they could prepare for the concert. That threw my whole day off. When they started the concert you were able to hear it from inside your room. It was hard for us to watch TV. We complain to the front desk and they told us that they did not have any rooms available. My friend suggested that it is probably best if we check out and they say if we decided to do that then we have 5 minutes to check out. If they are going to have concert they should invest in some sound proof windows. They should also invest in another area to have their concert because it is unfair to tell people to leave the pool to have a concert. I feel that if you spent your money for an hotel room all the amneties should be included and not excluded to benefit the hotel management. The flat screen TV were nice but they need to use the money to better organize the hotel. With this type of unorganization and customer service I don't think it is worth going to this hotel especially it being far from the strip. They food was okay. This hotel needs to get it together before letting people in.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely excellent”
Reviews.Author: niniemilo
Reviews.Content: Room spacious,very clean,furnished very well,with a 42" plasma tv,bath wonderful!!! Situated 4 or 5 miles off the strip,but if you have the car no problem.Cheap Beppe and Laura

Reviews.Title: “LOVED staying at the South Coast!”
Reviews.Author: HossLass
Reviews.Content: BIG thumbs up for the South Coast from me!! I travel to Las Vegas two to four times a year and for the most part always stay on the strip. This was a solo stay as I was working as a volunteer at an equesterian event at the horse arena for the weekend. I found my stay to be a really pleasant experience and I would stay here again in a heartbeat! Room: PERFECT size , not too small, not too big plenty of space for just me! I had two queen beds on the 24th floor with a great view of the mountains. Beds very comfortable, actual closet, great big plasma tv, excellent size vainity area with marble top and tile floor. The room was decorated in all horse themed paintings which was really fitting for me! Toilet and shower room was a little small but workable. Shower had a really nice huge water head and a curved curtain rod. Loved the soaps and shampoos (came in little "jars"), in fact housekeeping was very generous with extras when I requested. Extremely quiet floor, I didn't hear a thing outside in the hallway. Loved the color scheme and furniture. Food: Ate at the Coronordo Cafe twice, had the chinese food selection and that was decent, service a bit slow but friendly. Had a meal at the Mexican food place and it was very good, but the resturant is pretty small so a line forms quickly. Ate one dinner buffet, very average and not much better than say a Golden Corral paid around $14. Also ate one breakfast buffet, much better than dinner and paid around $7. Drink service at the buffets was pretty slow, I had to make myself noticed to get refills and get my plates cleaned away. One night I wanted room service but there was an hour wait for food and this was at 10 pm! Had several coffees at the Seattles Best and one ice cream at the ice cream stand which was ok. Casino: About a medium size, tons of video poker machines (I'd say at least half of the machines there wer VP). I play very little VP but did find some PENNY VP! Otherwise lots of newer slots, lots of pennies, nickles , quarters some dollars and a high limit area. Did not find the machines any looser than what I've experienced on the Strip unfortantuly!! No big wins here, just enough to keep me playing! Had the giant Wheel of Fortune Super Spin machine. Plenty of table games too. Cocktail service was about average to slow and drinks were really weak; don't order the margaritas! Casino was easy to get around and not very smoky at all; must have a good ventalation system. Clientele: My impression is that this is a locals casino with just enough tourist thrown in. LOTS of families, mostly middle class or working class folk, won't see the "beautiful people" here like at Belliago or Ceasars. There was a really nice laid back atmosphere to the place. There was a basketball camp going on the weekend I was there so that probably explained why the amount of kids in the hotel. Staff: Very friendly though not in much of a hurry a lot of times. Security was everywhere and your room key was checked all day and all night and these security guys took their job really seriously!! Good check in/out ; no problems with that. The shuttle buses ran on time, really on time! If the schedule said the bus left at 11 AM then yes the bus LEFT at 11 AM. Very effecient! I used both the airport and strip shuttle, which was a great service to have. Saved me $$ on cabs or car rental. I had very good housekeeping for the four days I was there. Suggestions: If you are used to staying on the Strip this casino/hotel is a bit south and is all by it's lonesome. NO other casinos within walking distance or resturants for that matter. However, all the properties around this area are being developed like gangbusters so it won't be by it's self too much longer. If you like to stay at one hotel, this is a nice one. If you like to casino hop, stay on the Strip. Arena: For horse people, the arena was really nice! It's totally climate controlled, in fact it was 110 degrees one day and inside the arena it was around 70! Arena is horse show size and seats about 4,500. Bathrooms easy to find and large but only two concession stands with average concession stand food and prices!! Very nice place for a horse show! I would return to this hotel and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JDFletcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night before our flight home. The room was lovely - it was large and had a 42" plasma television, and the sheets were lovely and white and crisp. There was a very nice pool which the kids made use of. The only criticisms I would have would be the check in procedure, which took ages as there were only two desk clerks on duty and a queue of approximately 50, and the lack of thought which had gone into the casino area - it was just a large room which had not had any thought put into it, unlike most of the other large hotels in Las Vegas. At the price though - you can't complain!

Reviews.Title: “A True Bargain and a Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lauraleigh9mm
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 1 night on Tripres for $53 including taxes mainly due to the reviews on this site. I can tell you it is a true gem! If you want to stay on the strip this is not the hotel for you. If you want an incredible room at a lovely hotel for an amazing price then this is it! We had a regular king room that was fairly large. The bed was wonderful and the plasma incredible. we plugged in the ipod to the TV and just relaxed after the road trip. The hotel let us check in at noon and we were given a room on the 14th floor overlooking the pool. The service was excellent everywhere with two exceptions- When we checked the line was long and we got a little grumpy. When we got to the desk we found out the key making computer was down so they were having to code the keys by hand. So that was forgiven. In the breakfast buffet, we got there around 9:55. It stops letting people in at 10:00. So when we were winding down from breakfast, all the servers were busy changing out the tables and such so our waitress was not to be found. we had to hijack a bus boy for our coffee refills. But with the funbook breakfast was $6.95 for the two of us. There were a lot of families there but I did not feel like kids were running all over the place. With the movie theaters and the bowling lanes I can see how this would be a great place to bring your children. The pool is nice but not terribly large but the poolside bar had great service and resonably drinks. All in all, the next time I book Vegas, It will be at the South Coast!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but too far from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Kufan_67455
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the South Coast from August 4 - 7. The facility was first class, as described by most of the other reviewers. The rooms were spacious, and nicely furnished. The plasma TV was nice, but we only watched it for about as long as it took to fall asleep each night. In my opinion, the money would have been better spent on other amenities. We play mostly video poker, and there were many machines available with 100% payback tables (if you know what you're looking for). The cocktail waitresses were always availabe when we needed a refill. The pool was very nice, with poolside bar service at very reasonable prices. However, we will probably not stay at the South Coast again. We like to spend time on the Strip, and the shuttle service did not meet our needs, so we spent over $200 in cab fares in three days. We could have rented a car, but then we would have had to deal with the hassle of fighting traffic and finding parking. If you like to go to Vegas and stay in one place, this is the place for you. If you like to spend at least part of your time on the Strip and/or downtown, you will probably be happier staying at one of the Strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for the $$$ on Las Vegas Blvd.”
Reviews.Author: Briannakristi
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this new Hotel and Casino for three nights. The hotel is located on Las Vegas Blvd. approximately 2 miles south from the MGM. The hotel is new; the rooms are 500 sq feet with Thomasville furniture, 42 inch flat screen TVs on the walls and great comfortable beds. The staff and service was truly excellent. The hotel has a large bowling center and large movie theater. The hotel pool was perfect, with a full lunch menu and complete bar service that were both moderately priced. The hotel has three restaurants; Mexican, Italian and Steak House, plus the buffet. All are truly excellent, but the best meal I ever had in my life was at the Silverado Steak House. If you are looking for a great place to stay near the strip, without the high strip prices and crowds, the South Coast is the place. According to my standards, this is a 5 star hotel. We cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the South Coast! We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: stellasmail
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the South Coast this week for 1 night as we could not check in to the Grandview across the street until Thursday. We flew in late Wednesday evening and went straight to the South Coast. I was impressed on how large the hotel and casino was. Yes, it is a drive from the strip but maybe 7-8 mins. We did have a rental so it worked for us. Checkin was easy however they need more folks at the desk as there was only 2 employees running the desk so I waited about 8-10 mins. It was 11:00 but this is Vegas! We were given room 1062 on the 10th floor and I was impressed to say the least. It was a suite and lovely!! For 59.00 internet rate off of their website you can not beat it. The room was clean and large. Soft bed, clean sheets, huge bathroom with walk in shower and a large tub not to mention the 2 flat screen tv's and a nice view. I called the next morning was given a late checkout since we got in so late which was super nice for us as we slept in a bit longer. We had a late dinner in the resturant and it was good. Now is it a 5 star resturant...no but it worked. We had lunch at the buffet the next afternoon and we both had lunch for 8.00 including drinks with the fun book coupon they give you when you check in. The buffet was good and for 8.00 I had no idea what to expect but I was pleasently suprised. After eating we went bowling at their in house bowling alley, it was huge! Maybe 26 or more lanes. They also have a 16 screen movie theater on site as well playing current movies. This place has it all with the exception of a spa however that is due to open at the end of summer. I will go back as this place was really nice and CHEAP!! If you can get over the fact that they are not on the strip then you should stay here.

Reviews.Title: “$$$ well spent at South Coast”
Reviews.Author: neonimc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights midweek at a great price. This hotel is very clean and has a relaxed charm to it. The rooms are big, beds are great, and the large wall-mounted TV is a nice touch. Bathrooms at the South Coast have a vanity area with a door to the seperate shower and toilet. We ate at Coronado Cafe which is open 24/7 and its has good food at reasonable prices. Getting to the main strip is easy just grab a Coast shuttle to take you right to the Barbary Coast, they leave about once an hour. Overall I'm am very pleased with this hotel and most likey will stay again on my next trip to Las Vegas. I definately recommend Coast Casinos to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Far away, but cheap and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: volvolover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Coast during a one night stay in Vegas. The hotel is new and beautiful. It was very clean and the bedding was wonderful. The casino is nice and the wait staff is easy to get the attention of for drinks. The lunch buffett was fine and we had no problems with the room. The hotel is located four miles from the main part of the strip. There are free shuttles but they do not come often enough. We waited for one that never came and had to take a taxi back. It was late at night, so I think this hotel would be better for families not wanting to party. I would stay there again though-the price and quality are great and with planning, good transport can be found.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Vegas_Girl
Reviews.Content: We'll definitely stay here again. I don't have much more to say about this place that hasn't been said already. Service was great, rooms are roomy, the TV's a nice touch. Great amenities loved the movie theatre especially after a couple hours at the pool. The pool is pretty basic and it gets crowded, so if you want a seat get there early. It is a few miles for the "action" but shuttles are provided or if you have your own car parking is easy. Some weird things (only in Vegas?)…There was some sort of concert/festival in the pool area and so the pool was closed that day (with no advance notice). Concertgoers had access to hotel elevators, we were accompanied on a couple of occasions by lost albeit VERY FRIENDLY drunks. That night we must have seen 20 cop cars on the strip (northbound?) between Mandalay & South Coast probably to catch drunk drivers, and parking was a nightmare because there was a lot of pedestrians and security milling around. I'd suggest checking out what events they have going on while your there so you know better what to expect. We had an interesting mix of crazy old school rock-n-rollers and laid back cowboys. Also, I wouldn't recommend their 24-hour cafe, the food is okay but reminded me a bit of cafeteria or school food (very bland). We didn't get a chance to eat at the oyster bar but it looked good and was always busy. Bowling was closed in the afternoon, eventhough I thought it was 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, But Remote”
Reviews.Author: ccpdpio
Reviews.Content: I'm a twice-a-year Vegas visitor since 2002, usually in June and December for 5 nights each. I'm a bargain hunter so on past trips I've stayed at Bally's (4 times), Excalibur, Monte Carlo, and Stratosphere. For this trip, June 25-30, I thought I might enjoy something away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip, especially since I planned to have rental car. I decided on the South Coast because it is new and also from the glowing reviews on Trip Advisor. Maybe I was expecting too much, but by the time it was time for me to leave I was ready to return to the Strip. Here are a few highlights: Location: yes, it is far from the Strip, a 15-20 minute drive to the Flamingo Road (Bellagio, Caesars, Bally's, Flamingo) intersection, longer if there's traffic, and when isn't there traffic? Check-in on Sunday afternoon was a bit slow - only 2 clerks on duty. But they were friendly and efficient. I've been spoiled by Bally's airport check-in so maybe I was just impatient. No problems with the reservation (booked online on the South Coast website for $69 a night). Room: as others have commented, my 14th floor room was very nice, as to be expected from a new property. Bed very comfy. Bathroom clean - nice touches included the curved shower curtain and a very nice shower head for great coverage. Also a comfortable mini-couch and table (for reading the Racing Form). Did not use the Internet access. Plasma TV was OK - the picture was not as crisp as other plasmas I've seen, but still nicer than the standard dinosaur-age TV's found in most hotel rooms. Fun book: disappointing. Others have commented favorably about the fun book, but I thought it was lacking. No match play coupons (boo!), and the 2-for-1 buffet deal was useless to me as a single traveler. Casino: smaller than most Strip properties (to be expeected) but the dealers and floor personnel were always friendly and helpful and it always felt like it was "fun" to gamble there. The atmosphere was lively but not overly raucous. Clientele seemed a bit more "working class" than most Strip properties. Race and sports book personnel were also very nice, as were the poker room staff. I played in 3 morning tournaments ($37 buy in) and although I didn't cash in any of them, had a great time playing. Food: the best thing I can say about the buffet is that it was cheap. And you get what you pay for. Quality and service were inconsistent. some food items were hot and fresh, others were cold and stale. Some servers were quick with coffee/drink refills, others disappeared for long periods. For convenience I ate the breakfast buffet every morning; I sure wish they had food court, just for a change of pace. I ate one meal in the cafe when I arrived too late for the dinner buffet. Had the chicken caesar salad and it was good (except for a couple of pieces of wilted romaine lattuce); service was also good. I did not try the specialty restaurants (Italian, Steakhouse, Mexican) but the prices at those seemed high (hey, I warned you I was bargain hunter). I did not try the bowling (I can bowl at home), the arcade (same), the pool (it was 110+ degrees every day, too hot to be outside for any reason), or visit the horse center (the only horses I am interested in carry jockeys on their backs). One complaint: when I tried to use a fun book coupon for a free drink at the casino bar, the bartender ignored me for what seemed forever, serving several others who sat down well after I did, before finally and grudgingly serving me a draft beer. I would have liked to have stayed for 3 or 4 more paid beers (and healthy tip) but Mr. Sourpuss's attitude chased me away. Overall, I'd say South Coast was a pleasant experience, but I am ready to return to the Strip next time.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: readbe4ugo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights at the end of June and another 2 nights 6-8 July. What a great hotel! We were so glad we chose it. Driving up to it, it's very impressive and eye-catching. All the staff are extremely helpful and polite and check-in (and out) was fast and efficient with almost no queue. I had requested a quiet room and was allocated room # 201. My only words are WOW! This room is massive, bigger than the others as it's at the end of the corridors, I "measured " it, it was approx 50x30 feet and beautifully and tastefully furnished . The beds are comfy with lovely linens and great pillows and the bathroom is extremely large and in two sections, there are loads of drawers and a large wardrobe - we had stuff for 2 adults and a teenager for 14 days and there was nothing lying around or suitcases on the floor!!! The only drawback to this room is that it faces into a brick wall at one side and the garage at the other but with a 42 inch plasma on the wall who is looking out of the window anyway? The windows go gold at night and its lovely when you turn on the downlighters. As we were on UK time for the first two days we ate in the middle of the night in the Colorado restaurant - they do a graveyard special of $3.99 for a steak with eggs, hash- browns and toast!! We also played bowling at 7am for $1 a game!! The breakfast buffet is amazing value and the food is fresh and hot with plenty of choices, the Sunday brunch is good too. We did not notice the casino being too smoky and we are non-smokers, the pool area is nice with plenty of beds although I think they need many more umbrellas!!All the public areas are extremely clean especially the restrooms. I would highly recommend this hotel especially for families - Its great!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms - Quite a bit off the strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the South Coast for the 4th of July weeekend. Overall we were pretty impressed by our room. However, it was quite a bit far from the strip and probably wouldn't stay again because of the distance. Room - Excellent The room was HUGE! By far the biggest room I've stayed in for $60/night. The room looked beautiful with a two-room bathroom, comfortable high bed, couch & table. Internet access = $10.99/24 hrs. Pool - Average/Above Average The pool was very clean and there were a lot of chairs available. Due to the shape of the pool, lap swimming was not possible. However, Casino - Average The dealers we're fantastic - very pleasant and eager to help. Low limit tables. Location - Poor My only problem with this casino is that it is too far off the strip. It was about a 10 minute drive to Mandalay Bay and 15-20 to Caesars. The distance from the strip would be a major reason why I probably wouldn't stay here again. We had a car, but we didn't really get that "on the strip" experience. Also, when we got tired it we couldn't just run up to the room for a while. There was a shuttle we could have taken, but the shuttle only came at specific times and stops down the strip make the ride longer. Since we didn't stay in the hotel much, I feel it would have been better to just stay at Impreial Palace and sacrafice luxary for convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New and Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Isabell1960
Reviews.Content: The South Coast is outside of Vegas, but only about 10 min. So if you have a rental, which we HIGHLY recommend!, it's fast to the strip. We stayed for two nights, my parents stayed for 6. We had comps from other hotels on the strip. But the South Coast is BRAND NEW! and smaller, more "homey". Great buffet! The rooms are HUGE! and the bathroom is HUGE! The toilet is in a separate room with the tub/shower, also has it's own phone! Huge closet, iron and iron board, hair dryer, and you get shampoo, cream rinse, ect. All the comforts of home! The beds are so comfy! Pillow top. Every room has a plasma TV! So cool! The pool was not open yet when we were there. And we kinda had a view of some mts. over a wall, but hey, who spends time in the room when in Vegas? We highly recommend this hotel. We will deffinately stay again! Check out my photo's of the outside, room and one of the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “You get more than what you payed for”
Reviews.Author: Tattooed_Everything
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I'm sick of reading reviews of this place saying "It's too smokey"...It's vegas. ALL of the casinos are smokey and as a matter of fact I noticed this one to be less smokey than the others. Now that I got that out of the way, the South Coast was a very nice place to stay for a very low price (4th of July weekend we payed $110 a night). The rooms, at around 500 square feet, are very nice and comfortable. The 42 inch plasma was very nice, as was the bathroom. The room was in good shape, clean, and the elevators were extremely fast. The coupon book at check in for 2 for 1 breakfast buffet, free drinks and players club points was a very nice touch. The staff were all very friendly. No problems whatsoever in that department. The casino was nice and new. Drinks were cheap and they comp'd you like crazy. The slot machines were a tiny bit tight, but not at all like people have been making them out to be. Low table limits were very nice also (my girlfriend loved the $1 minimum roulette). The place had a pulse but was not over crowded by any means. Crowd was a good mix of ethnicity and ages. The 64 lane bowling center was very nice. The arcade is kind of weak, not that I care because you can't drink or gamble in there, but I figure its worth mentioning if you plan on taking the kids. The pool was nice enough, nothing to write home about but new, nice, and served its purpose. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants except for the breakfast buffet. The price was right ($6.95 for two people with the coupon they give you at check in), but was not all that impressive. Stick to the Omlette bar, stay away from the sausage, and you should be alright. DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU LIKE THE HUSTLE AND CROWDS OF STRIP HOTELS!!! If you are flying in and not planning on renting a car but still want to see all the sights of "The Strip" in Vegas, don't stay here. I myself drove from L.A. so I had my car and did not mind making the 10 minute drive to the strip. If you drive to Vegas or are renting a car, then stay here. If you aren't going to rent a car but want to see the strip, try the stratosphere (not a huge fan of the stratosphere but it is about the same price and WAY closer to the strip, just nowhere as near nice as the South Coast. Overall I loved this place. Nice place to drink and gamble in a very nice and stylish atmosphere, sans the crowds of other strip hotels. Actually I really wouldn't even call this a strip hotel as Mandalay Bay is but a twinkle from the front doors of the South Coast.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jack_3B
Reviews.Content: This brand new hotel is located on Las Vegas Blvd, but it's quite a distance from the part normally referred to as the Strip. It can easily be more than half an hour with traffic, and there isn't much around it other than some malls. The casino looks like most lower-end casinos (tacky!) and attracts a decidedly un-stylish crowd, but the rooms are surprisingly tasteful and well-designed. Except, and this is a big exception, for the plastic mattress covers on the otherwise comfortable beds. We solved the problem by taking the duvet from one bed to use as a cover, while sleeping on top of the other, but this won't work if you don't have an extra bed. The staff is pleasant. We got a rate of $50 on Priceline, plus $12.50 in fees and taxes, so the price is definitely right. The Spa isn't open until fall, but there is a 24 Hour Fitness Center about 5 minutes away, which you can use for $15.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family spent one night at the South Coast and we were pleasantly surprised. The room was new and clean, decorated nicely, and had a flat screen TV! The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was lovely. We especially enjoyed the pool. It's a bit of a hike from the Strip, but the price is more reasonable than the hotels on the Strip. My only real complaint was that the casino was too smokey.

Reviews.Title: “had a great time only a few problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to the South Coast for my honeymoon. We had a great time! the room was huge and well kept and housekeeping love to give away their soaps and stuff! Teh breakfast buffet was brilliant and very cheap as they give you a coupon in the funbook for 2-1 (and you get a fun book when you check in and another one for joining players club so thats 3 total) We also ate at the steak house there and i ate the BEST steak of my life there mmmmm i have ben dreaming about it. the shuttle busses are great and one of the drivers its particuly nice and gives a tour and background talk about vegas which was nice. The trolley busses also stop there aswell if you want a very cheap way to get about to places like the outlet malls I diddnt meet a single member of staff who wasnt lovely except the manager!!!!! We were woken up 3 days in a row at aprok 6AM!! i complained the first day and the front desk man apologised and said it was emergency maintenance and comped my wireless internet (2 days worth). I figured well they cant help that and left it. The next day it happened again. i complained again he again comped my wireless and said it wouldnt happen again. The third day i was mad but the manager steped in and actualy stopped him doing anything other than comping my wireless as aparantly 6am isnt that early! and i have no grounds for complaint. but other than that it was a great time and i would go back! the only reason i wouldnt is i want to see other hotels (ill probably end up withing i was at south coast lol)

Reviews.Title: “great rooms”
Reviews.Author: gilbert
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here in February and had a wonderful time. The rooms are huge, new and terrific. Beds & pillows very comfortable and plasma TV was OK too. We ate breakfast every morning at the buffet and it was always good and reasonably priced. Got a free movie pass from the hotels website but passed on the bowling. Pool was not opened yet but it was COLD when we were there. Our only complaint was the hotel's location. They do have a shuttle that goes to the Strip but it was unreliable. One time we waited over an hour for it to come and the bus driver was miserable. Never won anything at the slots there. I would stay there again because it is new and clean, however it is a $20.00 taxi ride to get uptown.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: scullyaz
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a stay at the South Coast and had to write my first review because I loved this hotel. It was a great value for the money--the rooms were clean, quiet, great decor. The bath products were organic and cruelty-free. Shower was relaxing; beds were extremely comfortable. Ind termostat in each room and the flat screen tv--excellent!! The buffet is great--I'm a vegetarian and still had plenty to choose from. I go to Vegas once a year for business, and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Too Far From Strip”
Reviews.Author: TravelBee2100
Reviews.Content: The South Coast Hotel was cheap and the rooms were extremely clean. The hotel is extremely far from the strip, cap rides to range from 20-30 dollars each way. Nice hotel for families, senior citizens, not a whole lot going for younger generation since so far away from all the action. One Quirk-the room given to me was accessible for the Handicap and my shower had no ledge so all the water kept gushing out onto bathroom floor.....when asked if I could change rooms, I was told there were no others available and someone would call me the next day if one should become available.......needless to say the call never came. DON'T stay here if your looking for STRIP ACTION.....my room was an average of $60 a night through Expedia but with the daily cab fair to/from strip that average jumped to $120 a night. DO STAY here if you are a senior or family who is looking to be away from the busy strip. Overall Buffet was average and cheap. Staff was friendly, check-in/check-out speedy, elevators speedy, casino busy.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel! Nice and friendly hotel staff, except for the Rude Emma !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the South Coast Hotel in Las Vegas for a week on the third week of June 2006, our stay at the hotel was overall very good, the standard rooms were around 500 sq ft, quite spacious and clean, the food at the buffet were good. The pool was beautiful, there wasn't bugs flying around, a couple of reviews I've read here have mentioned about lots of bugs flying by the pool due to the houses next door, but when we were there, the pool area was very clean, the hotel must have done something to fix up the problem. Upon check in at the hotel, we received a coupon booklet, it has some good deals including two for one breakfast buffet or two for one lunch buffet. The hotel provides a free shuttle bus to and from the airport, and also to and from the strip. One of the reviews I've read here was written by a couple who had mentioned that they stayed at the South Coast and got a few looks by the staff and hotel guest because they are Asians, and they have noticed that most of the hotel guests were North American (Whites). It's very unfortunate that they had that experience. However, my husband and I are Asians, and we did not get any looks, actually during our week long stay at the hotel, we have noticed that the overall hotel guests were quite multi-cultural, it was a good mixture, and we are very glad about the multi cultural, we are from Toronto. The housekeeping staff were mostly very nice and polite, except for Emma - she is a very rude and terrible housekeeping staff, she has zero customer service, and personally I think she really needs to take a course in Anger Management. When I go to a new place, I have this habit of doing a general check-up on the room to make sure everything is clean and good, especially the bed, it has to be clean. So after we got into our room upon check in, I looked at the sheets and the pillow on the bed, I found several dark colored stains on the bed sheet, and a couple pieces of hair on the pillow, so my husband went to the hallway and asked a housekeeping staff to change the bedding for us. About ten minutes later, this housekeeping lady just rushed into our room, her name is Emma (according to her name tag), she did not even knock on the door, she just used her key card and came in, she did not even say hello or anything, the first sentence came out of her mouth was "What's the problem with the bed? Where are the stains?" So I showed her the stains and I also mentioned about the hair I found on the pillow, she said the pillows are all fresh and clean. Then she changed our bed sheets with an attitude. After that, I asked her to change our pillows for us, she said "Why, the pillows are fresh and clean?" Then I said to her "I found several pieces of long hair on the pillow, how do you explain this?" She replied "Who knows, maybe it's from the air in the room." She then left our room with a very angry face to get the new pillows, then I realized that one of our light bulbs was out, so I followed her and mentioned it to her, when I was talking to her, she was facing another housekeeping staff, when the other housekeeping staff said to our rude housekeeping staff (Emma) that "I think this lady is talking to you." Without even looking at me, all Emma said was "I know she's talking to me, and I heard what she said." So then I went back to my hotel room, a few minutes later, our rude housekeeping staff Emma came back to our room and put the pillows on the bed, she then used our room phone to call the main housekeeping phone number and told me that one of our light bulbs needs to be replaced. Then without a word to us, she left and slammed our door. I then realized that the small bottle of lotion in our bathroom was almost empty, usually it should be full. So again I went to find Emma, she was just a couple of doors down from our room, before I even opened my mouth, she said to me "I'm very busy, what do you want?" I said to her "Well, obviously I have another enquiry, otherwise I wouldn't be bothering you right now." Without even looking at me, she said "Call downstairs, I'm very busy, don't bother me!" I couldn't believe her attitude, her attitude went from worse to unbelievably worse! She just seemed to be a very angry person, she really needs to take a course in Anger Management! A couple of minutes later, we got a knock on the door, so I went and opened the door, this nice lady with a smile said to me "I'm just doing a room check. I asked her who I can call to make a complaint about the housekeeping staff." She told me that she is the Supervisor of the housekeeping department, she said I can call the housekeeping Director about the complaint, and she also asked me if there's anything she can help me with. So I told her everything that had happened re Rude Emma's unprofessional attitude, after Supervisor heard everything I said, she apologized, and she made notes to what I said, she told me that she will forward this to the housekeeping Director. After that experience, my husband and I went to the front desk and requested to a room change, we wanted a room with a nice view, and personally I didn't want to deal with Emma or even see Emma again during the rest of my stay at the hotel, so we got a room on the 22nd, we were originally on the 6th floor. Other than the rude experience we have had with Emma, all the other staff in the hotel were very nice and kind, including the housekeeping staff, the restaurant staff, the front desk staff, and the staff at the gift shop. I would give this review a 5, however, due to the experience with Emma, I'm giving this review a 4. My husband and I would definitely go back to the South Coast Hotel the next time we visit Vegas, and hopefully the next we go there, we won't have Emma as our housekeeping staff again for our room.

Reviews.Title: “South Coast Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: shanshanjan
Reviews.Content: My Sister and I originally booked at the South Coast for the cheap price. We were so suprised and excited when it turned out to be an awesome hotel! Check-in was a breeze...very friendly staff. We arrived early, so we could not check in right away but the bell desk was more than happy to store our luggage for us and got us on the VIP list for Rain at The Palms. When we got up to our room, we could hardly believe our eyes. It was beautiful! Sparkling clean, large, beautiful views, perfect! The beds were very comfy also. We loved the pool, it was cold but it felt great after laying out in the hot sun! Great service out there, as well. It was not packed, like some of the Strip pools, where you can't even turn your chair. We went to the Strip for a wedding and couldn't wait to get back to SC for the evening. Will be perfect when the night club opens up! We go to Vegas 2x a year and will stay here again for our next visit without question.

Reviews.Title: “A budget hotel in a mid-luxury setting”
Reviews.Author: justdefend
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the South Coast this past weekend and everyone had a great time. The hotel / casino is perfect for anyone on a budget. There are low-minimum tables ($5) for Blackjack, Pai Gow Poker, Craps, and $1 Roulette. In addition, weekend room rates can be had for less than $100 per night (in our case it was $87 / night). The hotel also has a great selection of activities for non-gamblers, including a bowling alley, movie theater, pool, and equestrian center. The bowling alley was a lot of fun and reasonably priced - $2.90 per game and $2.50 for shoes. The pool area is large and features cocktail service. The room was spacious and the 42-inch plasma was great for watching TV. The bathrooms were also large with a long bathroom counter seperate from the shower / bathroom. Also, the rooms were very quiet thanks to heavy, solid doors that kept hallway noise out. Hotel service was acceptable. Employees were friendly and the in-room maintenance to fix a clogged sink reported in five minutes. However, requests for late check-out and rollaway bed in a room with two Queen Beds were denied. The room had plenty of space for an additional bed near the wall and this has been a permittable request in most hotels with even smaller square footage. The Garden Buffet is a great deal and the South Coast Funbook offers a 2-for-1 coupon for Breakfast and Lunch buffets. At lunch and dinner the buffet offered peel-n-eat shrimp, mahi mahi, roasted turkey, beef brisket, Mongolian BBQ, and all of it was great. For visitors staying on Sunday morning, be sure to save the 2-for-1 coupon for Sunday Brunch. It's 11.95 but adds prime rib to the selection. We also tried the 24-hour Coronado Cafe but were disappointed. From fries, to burgers, to strawberry waffles, the food was underwhelming, wasn't that cheap, and the wait was long. Also, the heavily advertised Graveyard Special Steak and Eggs for $3.95 is only available Mon. - Thurs. South Coast is a great hotel with enough action to keep many from heading out to the Strip. Great room pricing, gambling, buffet, and non-gaming activites make it an attractive alternative to more expensive strip locations. Keep in mind that reasonable guest requests may be denied and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, customer service lacking”
Reviews.Author: randinc
Reviews.Content: A new and beautiful facility, the rooms are large and nicely furnished. Pillowtop mattress, LCD TV, granite and tile in the two room bath, sitting area in the bedroom. Couldn't ask for more. Valet parking was so disorganized that I only used it once, hiked from the parking lot thereafter. This wasn't a particularly busy time either. The steakhouse was very good, both food and service. The buffet food was fine, varied and tasty but service was lacking, take your order and disappear. Good luck getting a drink refil. Again not a busy time. I'm in Las Vegas 7-8 times a year on business and often stay at Coast properties and this isn't the norm for them, they are usually very customer oriented. Maybe it's growing pains but the South Coast has been open long enough to have these service issues worked out. Would I stay there again? Given the discounted price I had, yes, but I'll check the field carefully before booking my next stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The best!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kathy59714
Reviews.Content: Go to Vegas twice a year. Skip the strip!!! The South Coast is worth the drive!!! This place soars above the Strat! Move over Alladdin!! Skip the castles!!! Don"t clown around with the Circus Circus! The price is right. It is the cleanest hotel! The rooms are very nice. The plasma tv is great. The food is great. The staff is always there for you. The pool is great!!! No crowds!!! Don"t miss this one!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: DanGladwell
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I just got back from our trip to a friends wedding, and we stayed at the South Coast. Everything was extremelly clean and very nice, and there are tons of stuff to do there. Even though we don't have any kids, South Coast has an amazing bowling alley, arcade, and kid sitting service. The rooms were top notch, very big and set up very nicely. One of the best parts about the hotel was the service, we didn't meet one employee who didn't seem pleased to serve us or help. The Coronado Cafe is the 24 hour restaurant at South Coast, but don't be fooled, the food is a great deal and excellent quality. Highly suggested!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value! Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the South Coast for two nights June 15-17. The staff was friendly and the room was very nice. Truly enjoyed our stay. Great pricing at the restaurants in the hotel and the food was good too. Not fabulous but who can complain about eating a buffet for 2 utilizing the coupon book we received at check in for only $6!!? Also, the cocktails flowed freely when we were gambling. We tipped each time and the staff seemed most appreciative. Although the best bet seemed to be playing the video poker machines. My husband made $20 last over 2 hours while I lost $60 at the slots in less than 30 minutes. We hung out at the pool the remainder of the afternoon. Drinks were reasonable and not watered down as one might expect. We took the shuttle to the Barbary Coast that evening. A little tip... if you plan to utilize the shuttle going to the sister hotel Barbary Coast, make certain you are out and waiting 30 minutes before departure or you won't get on. These shuttles filled so fast! Also, make sure you check the airport shuttle times from the hotel so you book the best departure time out of Vegas. Our flight left at 11:10 and the morning shuttle times available were 6, 7 and 11 a.m. Overall though, we had a wonderful time and truly enjoyed our stay. It was nice to be off the strip. Much quieter and very relaxing. Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Not big on customer service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brand new and is tastefully done. Rooms are nice and normal sized. They kicked us out of the pool at 3 pm (I was looking for a hotel with pool for the kids when I was booking) after the kids just got in. There was some Rock pool party going on (no kids allowed). Needless to say we were diappointed. Couldn't voice my compaint, because the front desk is understaffed an no supervisor on duty. We went to the movies instead (hotel has multiplex and bowlin alley). Couldn't sleep, because of Rock concert outside out window (if you com from anwhere east and fight jet lag - don't take pool side room!) The breakfast buffet is very nice and so is the Oyster bar. The mexican is not good at all. Overall a little customer service would have gone a long way (ex. reduced movie tickets for our disappointed kids as we got kicked out of the pool ....).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely - Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: CNHeidelberg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at South Coast this week and it was a lovely experience. All the staff we encountered were very friendly. The gift shop has incredibly cheap liquor prices. The breakfast buffet is great, though dinner wasn't as good. The coupon book you get when you check in gets you buy-one-get-one-free at the breakfast buffet, and a free bottle of wine with two dinners at the dinner buffet. (You can drink it there or take it with you when you go.) We also ate at the Coronado Cafe, where the food was surprisingly good. The rooms are very quiet - the quietest hotel rooms that I've ever experienced, and it was at full capacity when we stayed. There was no non-smoking available, but the hotel is so new, the smoking room we stayed in had no bad smell. Unfortunately wireless access is $11/day, so we went off to Starbucks to get free wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with the South Coast”
Reviews.Author: LD16
Reviews.Content: Best deal in Vegas. Just returned form a 4 day visit. We absolutely loved the South Coast. It is a beautiful hotel. We didn't rent a car; took a cab to and from the airport (about $22 w/tip 1-way). Check in was a breeze. We booked through Travelocity (great price) and couldn't request a non-smoking room w/2 beds when we made the reservation, but the staff had no problem providing us with the room we wanted. We did have to leave a $100 deposit on our credit card for incidentals. Our room was beautiful. The sheets were a little scratchy. Would have preferred softer linens. The bathroom is gorgeous and we appreciated having the w/c and shower separate from the sink. We took the shuttle regularly to Barbary Coast and then on to the Orleans and Gold Coast. It was very convenient. We also used the Trolley and bought an all day pass for $5 to see the other hotels on the strip. We used a lot of the coupons in the funbook for our meals and entertainment. The food at the buffet was very good and we enjoyed the variety. It isn't gourmet but very satisfying. We did use the hot tub at the pool. It was wonderful after walking all day on the Strip. The pool area is very nice, except for the flies. Having the equestrian center near the pool is a problem. Something has got to be done when there are a lot of horses on site. The slots were not paying out but I had fun playing roulette. The dealers are great. Actually, I can't say enough about the staff. They were the friendliest people I've ever encountered at a hotel. I will definitely stay at the South Coast on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A lot of previous reviews are true. Very nice hotel. Fresh and Clean. Expensive construction. Buffet is good and cheap. Some BAD THINGS: 1. A lot of flys. There is like an equestrian center and there are a lot of flies outside. When we ate at the buffet, a fly kept flying around our food. 2. Felt that there were a lot of local people/American people. Not that many international tourists like the big well known hotels on the strip. We got a weird/mad look from some employees (waiters) and guests (we are asian). 3. Slots are tough. People have said this in previous reviews. We experienced the same thing. We stopped playing here and went to the Stardust. Our money lasted longer there. Would stay here

Reviews.Title: “We loved South Coast!”
Reviews.Author: mmlm01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay at South Coast 6/6 through 6/10 after getting an unbelievable deal. All the staff we encountered was friendly and helpful. Our king non-smoking room was large and comfortable. The bedding was above average and the entire room just sparkled. I am a clean freak and have never stayed in a hotel room as clean as this one. The bathroom was also large and well laid out. I did not care for the bath products, but I’m quite fussy about that sort of thing so I wasn’t really expecting much and brought my own supplies. The pool area was well kept and not very crowded Monday through Thursday. The equestrian center was a real treat – we got to watch 2 days of barrel racing free of charge. We ate at the café, the buffet and Big Sur and all met or exceeded our expectations. The restaurant prices were reasonable (especially for Vegas). My most pleasant discovery here was the gift shop where you can purchased all manner of snacks and beverages (including beer, wine and spirits) for less than I pay in my convenience and liquor stores here at home. The onsite movie theater and bowling alley are a nice touch as well. Seattle’s Best runs the lobby coffee shop and I never waited in line for more then 2 minutes for my a.m. coffee. Unlike many guests, we did not rent a car during our stay. This was not a problem as we either took the free shuttle or the $2 trolley when we wanted to venture to the Strip (we basically got on whatever showed up first). Be warned that valet parking seemed to be a mess on the day we left, but the property is new so this could just be growing pains. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay at South Coast.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! The rooms are larger than normal. If you get one with a king bed you also have a nice sitting area with a couch, chair and table. The plasma screen tv was a treat and the bathroom nicely furnished. The only things in the room that could be improved in the mattress cover on the bed, which is like sleeping on a heating pad, and the towels. With a nice room like this, there should be big, fluffy towels, not the same ones you find in a budget motel. Our solution to the mattress cover was to use these towels as a barrier. It worked fine until the maid took them while stripping the bed. We stayed at the South Coast for 6 days on business and ate at every restaurant. All were very good. The only pricey restaurant in the place is the Steak House. The best bet, though is the hot dogs in the sports betting area for 75 cents! The casino was clean and the air very smoke free for Vegas. The slots did seem a little tight but the table games were wonderful. If you are tired of the noise and nonsense of the main strip, the South Coast is a must. It is a long ways from all the action, but for some of us a welcome oasis in this crazy town.

Reviews.Title: “South Coast is well worth the drive!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the South Coast Hotel and Casino from May 13 thru the 17th of 2006. The hotel itself was about 6 miles off the strip (we rented a car) Even with the high gas prices ($3.15 a gallon) the week we were there it was well worth it. We parked for free in the 10 hotels/casinos we visited. The hotel itself was only about 6 months old and it was beautiful with golden mirrored glass. Our room was very spacious and clean, the bathroom was as well. The bed was covered with down bedding and extra pillows...so comfortable we wanted to take it home with us! The 42in. flat screen was awesome. We purchased some MGD from the store in the hotel at $4.99 for a six pack! The staff were so very nice they even brought up a bottle opener for the beer. My boyfriend spent some time researching deals on where to eat while we were in Vegas. Suprisingly,the some of the deals were right in our hotel. The South Coast has a great breakfast/lunch buffet. Upon checking-in they give you a coupon booklet that has 2for1 coupons for this great buffet. The buffet had 8ft long separate sections of Seafood, BBQ,Chinese,Italian, Mexican,and Desserts !! They also have a cafe that is open 24 hours. The breakfast special in there was awesome! Steak,eggs,potatoes and toast for $4.99 unfortunately we didn't find out about that until our last day. The slots were a little tight,but the Poker Room was okay says my boyfriend. The pool was large with alot of seating. They also had a large bowling alley and gameroom for kids. My boyfriend goes to Vegas at least once a year and he has stayed at most of the higher-end hotels,I convinced him we didn't have to spend alot of money on a room. We took a gamble and it paid off! We have recommended this hotel to friends and plan to stay there again before the year is out. Overall a great value a wonderful staff at the South Coast Hotel&Casino!

Reviews.Title: “NIce and roomy....Needs a little work...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel off the main strip. Rooms were clean, roomy and the room service was great! Great security also. Only a few things to complain about...pit bosses and casino staff a little new. We gambled about 8 hrs straight and had to bring the attention to several pit bosses before gettting comp'd. Tables had a low minimums which was great! Still no spa and no nightclub. I think once this hotel gets things in order (since it is still relatively new) It will be a major competition for the downtown area. Very close to the strip and I would defintely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the South Coast”
Reviews.Author: LivingonTulsaTime
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the South Coast on the Friday of Memorial weekend(5-26-06). We stayed here since it was relatively cheap for that Friday, and we've stayed at other Coast properties in Vegas. We checked in about 6pm, and there wasn't any wait at the front desk. I also liked the fact that they have a seating area right near the front desk. I sat with the bags, while my boyfriend checked us in. It's a nice little touch, especially if you'd have to wait or you're worn out from traveling. They also provide you with a coupon book for your stay at the South Coast, as well as, other Coast properties. I enjoy the coupons, since you can still get a few things for free(very rare these days in Vegas.) The rooms are very nice. Very clean, plasma tvs, and all the normal amenities of the average Vegas hotels. Our floor/room seemed extremely new, still had that "new" smell. I especially liked the bathrooms. There are separate doors between the room and bathroom, and also between the sink areas and shower, etc. It's nice that one person could be getting ready, while another is showering, and still have privacy. There is also a one-cup coffee maker. I wasn't bothered by the small amount of coffee, since I can easily head downstairs for an extra cup . The casino was very clean. It was also relatively wide open, but that may be since the hotel is fairly new. It was nice to be able to walk anywhere and play anything you wanted. Since we only stayed one night here, we only had the chance to try the buffet. It was a typical buffet. Nothing fantastic, but not bad either(considering the price). Like other Coast properties, South Coast also has a bowling alley and a movie theater. Something to give you a break from gambling, or for the kids to enjoy. I believe the spa still isn't open yet, and I didn't get the chance to hit the pool. From the room, the pool appeared to be nice. I can't really say anything bad about the South Coast. I guess the only thing is its distance from the rest of the strip. It's far south on LasVegas Blvd., past the outlet mall. I actually like staying away from the strip, since I grow extremely tired of the crowds. This hotel also has an equastrian arena, so you do smell hay in the parking area/outside areas. I guess if that bothers you, you wouldn't want to stay here. Otherwise, I would highly recommend South Coast. Yes, it's not the Wynn, but it's also not going to break your piggy bank.....good deal for your money. I'll definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “OK Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: lovetowinbingo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the SouthCoast with my husband in April 06 and if you are familiar with Coast Hotels, it was just that, a coast hotel. Nothing fancy, the rooms were actually kind of bland and cold, not cozy and inviting. We at at the cafe from their chinese menu, that has very good reviews and the food was good. If you're going for the gambling, the machines didn't pay at all for us, but we only stayed one night. The rooms were very clean and the place overall was nice, the staff was very nice and check in and out was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quiet hotel away from the busy crazy strip”
Reviews.Author: Gourmand
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised to find a beautiful hotel/casino five miles from the strip. South Coast is very new and so very clean and sparkling. We used the valet service at least 10 times in 3 days and always, ALWAYS had quick efficient service. So, not sure what the negative reviewer had encountered. Our bellman both times was extremely quick. Our room service, while the food was not still hot, was 15 minutes quicker than predicted. When we left notes for the housekeepers they left those items for us. We ordered up a refrigerator and it was delivered within 10 minutes. So, the service is very good in our opinion. The casino can be smoky at night, just like all the other casinos in town. The rooms are clean and so new. Bright yellow. Gorgeous plasma screen TV that made me want my own. Lovely marble bathroom. Showers were great - still no understanding of what the negative review was about - the shower head was one of those larger ones that rinse off more of your body at once. But what I need most from a room is QUIET. And this room is very very quiet. You can barely hear anyone else around you - and those times were rare. We had very comfortable sleep on the beautiful expensive linens and puffy pillows. We stayed during the busy Memorial Day weekend and had a wonderful time. You need to know it does take a while to get to the active part of the strip. So, you need to learn how to use the I15 freeway and utilize the backroads Noval and Frank Sinatra Way to get around quicker. We quickly learned from a map in the room that we used constantly. The price is very good at this hotel because it is off the beaten path. On the one hand, it is south of the major strip by 5 miles, so when you arrive exhausted after hours of driving, it is the first exit long before the strip. Ahhh. Nice and quiet. Then when you depart, you jump on the freeway and you are out of Vegas without dealing with the traffic of the strip. We really appreciated this. There is an IHOP across the street and a bit north, as well as a Starbucks. For an average of $110 a night we would definitely stay again. (The lights outside did not affect us at all if we pulled the curtains shut - then the room was pitch black.) The slots were fun and it is nice to have roulette only $1.00. The pool area is gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay with Kids”
Reviews.Author: 8Clap
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at South Coast during the Memorial Day weekend. Chose this hotel due to reasonable rates and available activities for my 2 young kids. My first impression was that it's a big property and all by itself. It's a new hotel/casino so everything is clean and nice. They have a very large drive thru area to drop off or valet. However it was very sparsely attended but we did drive in at a ridiculous hour as there was some construction on the way from LA. There was plenty of parking out front of the main entrance so we didn't bother valeting. Check-in was easy (one good thing about early a.m. arrival). Room was average size and clean. large bathroom. Good temp control. Pool was nice and is very similar to Orleans with a main pool and a kiddie/wading pool but I liked this one better as I remember the Orleans kiddie pool was kinda tainted yellow and you know what that means... While the sun was out, it was kinda chilly there due to the breeze that kept flowing thru. I think since this hotel is all by itself, there isn't much protection from the wind as you might get along the strip with all those hotels bunched together. Kids had a great time swimming. Wish they had a slide or lazy river. Used the on site movie theater but didn't use the bowling alley with 60+lanes. We checked out the kids tyme area where they charge $6per hr per kid. We were hesitant on leaving our kids there but after touring the center and speaking to the staff, my wife let the kids play there, albeit with her sitting in the waiting area to keep an eye on things. Kids had a great time there too. There's a rock climbing wall, a very expansive human habittrail (like chuck e. cheese) with slides, a small movie theater (big tv w/ dvd library), craft center and snack bar where you can leave $ for the kids to buy things or preselect a snack for them. Best part was the staff to kid ratio...there were only 10 kids there and 4-5 staff at the time. They were the 'grandmotherly' type and assured us that no adults are allowed in the play area without an escort so it's safe. Food was just OK at the lunch buffet. Dinner at Miguel's was very good but service was very poor. We had a waitress that must've walked by our table 5 times when we were trying to get our bill. When we finally did leave to pay, another couple near our table had the same experience. Breakfast at the cafe was excellent. 24 hr steak special was very good especially since it was comped. I'm not a big $ player but they didn't have a problem comping me for the cafe for 4 of us so that was nice. We enjoyed our stay as it's a nice place to stay with kids. However, it is a ways from the strip or any other major casino/hotel. The only other negative related to that is there isn't a freeway exit close. Nearest exit is 2 miles before and after. Be nice if they had one that funneled right into the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: harrahs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the South Coast for one night before the journey home, the place is great from the service to the rooms, arrived on a sunday May 21. Very Busy some kinda event going on, line to check in was long but moved extremely fast, got an excellent room on the 23rd floor overlooking the entire valley, yeah, nothing special but the mountains are pretty. room itself was great so clean and functional, love the showers, stayed here in January and still is great the 42'' plasma TV is a plus. beds are comfy and the place is so clean from the corridors to the rooms. yeah there are real brigh lights illumitaing the tower at night but if you shut your drapes it wont bother you. food at the buffet is good to, a con however the service in the buffet gets a B. otherwise good. Casino is perfect but the slots are tight beware, anyhow stay at the south coast, its clean and has everthing you need.

HotelInfo.Name: South Point Hotel, Casino and Spa
HotelInfo.Address: 9777 Las Vegas Blvd South, Las Vegas, NV 89183
